Tailo: Hi-tse-kia kā lín kóng, ' Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè ē kiù lán thuat-lī A-siul ông ê tshiú. ' Tse kám m̄-sī ín-iú lín, hō͘ lín iau koh tshuì-ta lâi sí?
English: Does not Hezekiah persuade you, to give you over to die by famine and by thirst, saying, Yahweh our God will deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Thê-man lâng E-lī-huat, Siú-ua lâng Bil-tat, Ná-má lâng Tso-huah, tsiàu Siōng-tè só͘ bīng-līng in ê khì kiâⁿ; Siōng-tè mā tsiap-la̍p Io-buh.
English: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did what Yahweh commanded them, and Yahweh accepted Job.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, lín m̄-thang thîng-kha, tio̍h jiok lín ê tuì-ti̍k, phah in ê āu-tuī, m̄-thang iông-ín in ji̍p in ê siâⁿ, in-uī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè í-king kā in kau tī lín ê tshiú.
English: but don't stay; pursue after your enemies, and strike the hindmost of them; don't allow them to enter into their cities: for Yahweh your God has delivered them into your hand.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h huann-hí khuài-lo̍k ê siann, hō͘ Lí só͘ at-tn̄g ê kut thang huann-hí.
English: Let me hear joy and gladness, That the bones which you have broken may rejoice.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú kíng-suán Iâ-kop kui I ka-kī, kíng-suán I-su-la-el tsò I ka-kī ti̍k-pia̍t ê suán-bîn.
English: For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself; Israel for his own possession.

Tailo: Lín kah lín ê ka-kuàn, ta̍k só͘-tsāi lóng thang tsia̍h; tse sī lín ê kang-tsînn, sī pò-tap lín tī huē-bō͘ lāi só͘ tsò ê kang.
English: You shall eat it in every place, you and your households: for it is your reward in return for your service in the tent of meeting.

Tailo: In-uī gī lâng pua̍h-tó tshit pái ē koh peh khí-.lâi; pháiⁿ lâng siū tsai-lān tsiū tó-huāi.
English: For a righteous man falls seven times, and rises up again; But the wicked are overthrown by calamity.

Tailo: E-hu-laim ē kóng: Guá kah ngó͘-siōng iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân? Guá ū kā i ìn, koh kā i khuàⁿ-kò͘. Guá tshin-tshiūnn tsheⁿ-tshuì ê siông tshiū, lí ê kué-tsí tuì guá lâi tit-tio̍h.
English: Ephraim, what have I to do any more with idols? I answer, and will take care of him. I am like a green fir tree; From me your fruit is found.

Tailo: Taⁿ in tsai Lí hō͘ guá ê ta̍k hāng lóng sī tuì Lí lâi ê.
English: Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you,

Tailo: Ê-no͘k seⁿ I-la̍t, I-la̍t seⁿ Me-hu-ia-el, Me-hu-ia-el seⁿ Má-thó͘-sat-lī, Má-thó͘-sat-lī seⁿ Le-mi̍k.
English: To Enoch was born Irad. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.

Tailo: Guān I-su-la-el kóng: I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.!
English: Let Israel now say That his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: I-é-sái hō͘ i hiah-ê tshit-ê kiáⁿ, lóng tuì Sa-mu-el ê bīn-tsîng king-kuè. Sa-mu-el kā I-é-sái kóng, Siōng-tsú mā bô kíng tsiah-ê.
English: Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. Samuel said to Jesse, Yahweh has not chosen these.

Tailo: Tī Siōng-tsú hō͘ lâng thang tuà ê tē-tsiūⁿ khuài-lo̍k, mā kah sè-kan lâng tsò-hué huann-hí.
English: Rejoicing in his whole world. My delight was with the sons of men.

Tailo: Lí mā tshú Guá só͘ hō͘ lí ê kim-gîn kah suí ê pó-khì, uī-tio̍h lí ka-kī tsò tsa-po͘ lâng ê siōng kah i kiânn kan-îm;
English: You also took your beautiful jewels of my gold and of my silver, which I had given you, and made for yourself images of men, and played the prostitute with them;

Tailo: Hiah-ê síng-tiúⁿ ê siàu-liân lâng tsò thâu tshut-.khì. Bian-ha-tat tshe lâng khì thàm-tsa, in tńg-lâi huê-hok kóng, Ū lâng tuì Sa-má-lī-a tshut-.lâi.
English: The young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben Hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out from Samaria.

Tailo: Guá sī Páu-lô, uī-tio̍h Ki-tok I-é-su lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò siû-huān. Guá kah lán ê hiann-tī Tî-mó͘-theh siá phue hō͘ guán só͘ thiàⁿ ê tâng-kang Hui-lé-móng,
English: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng ìn Iô-tah lâng kóng, Tsiàu tsi-tso̍k, tsit-ê ông guán ū tsa̍p hūn, guán tuì Ta-bi̍t pí lín khah ū kuan-hē. Lín án-tsuáⁿ khuànn-khin guán, tshuā guán ê ông tńg-.lâi, ná-bô tāi-sing kah guán tsham-siông? Tsóng-.sī, Iô-tah lâng ê uē pí I-su-la-el lâng ê uē khah ngē.
English: The men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more right in David than you: why then did you despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king? The words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.

Tailo: In lóng siū Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá, tsiàu Sìng Sîn siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê un-sù, khui tshuì kóng bô kāng ê gí-giân.
English: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.

Tailo: E-hú tsīn-la̍t khui kiong, siā tio̍h Io-lâm ê pn̄g-sî-kut tiong, tsìnn tuì i ê sim thàng-kuè-.khì, i tsiū lik lo̍h-khì tshia lāi.
English: Jehu drew his bow with his full strength, and struck Joram between his arms; and the arrow went out at his heart, and he sunk down in his chariot.

Tailo: Guá ê kong-gī kīn lah; Guá ê kiù-un huat-tshut. Guá ê tshiú beh phuàⁿ-tuàn lia̍t pang; tó-sū lóng beh thìng-hāu Guá, koh beh uá-khò Guá ê tshiú.
English: My righteousness is near, my salvation is gone forth, and my arms shall judge the peoples; the islands shall wait for me, and on my arm shall they trust.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê kuì-tso̍k pún-kok ê jîn-bîn uàn-hūn i, tsiū tshe tsi̍t-ê sù-tsiá tuè-āu khì tsàu, kóng, ' Guán bô ài tsit-ê lâng tsò guán ê ông. '
English: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, We don't want this man to reign over us.'

Tailo: guá nā in-uī tsâi-bu̍t hong-sīng, in-uī guá ê tshiú thàn tsin tsē tsînn lâi huann-hí;
English: If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, And because my hand had gotten much;

Tailo: Tsò sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ, tsóng-kiōng gû-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah, iûⁿ-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á tsa̍p-jī tsiah kah tsò-hué hiàn ê sò͘-tsè tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsa̍p-jī tsiah;
English: all the oxen for the burnt offering twelve bulls, the rams twelve, the male lambs a year old twelve, and their meal offering; and the male goats for a sin offering twelve;

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia ông ê jîn-sîn tsiū khì kìnn I-sá-iah.
English: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kiò ta tē tsò tē, kiò tsū-tsi̍p ê tsuí tsò hái; Siōng-tè khuànn án-ne sī hó.
English: God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters he called Seas. God saw that it was good.

Tailo: In-uī pò-siû ê ji̍t tī Guá ê sim-lāi, Guá kiù-sio̍k Guá ê tsú-bîn ê nî í-king kàu.
English: For the day of vengeance was in my heart, and the year of my redeemed is come.

Tailo: Án-ne, lí sī īng jia̍t-jia̍t ê hué-thuàⁿ thia̍p tī i ê thâu-khak tíng hō͘ i tsai kiàn-siàu; Siōng-tsú mā ē kā lí pò-siúⁿ.
English: For you will heap coals of fire on his head, And Yahweh will reward you.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî bat i ê miâ ê, lín lóng tio̍h uī i pi-siong, kóng: Hit-ê ióng ê thuî, suí ê kuái-á, ná ē áu-tn̄g kàu án-ne?
English: All you who are round about him, bemoan him, and all you who know his name; say, How is the strong staff broken, the beautiful rod!

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh kā guá kóng, Lí tio̍h kā in kóng, bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Lín tio̍h lim, lâi tsuì, lâi thò͘, lâi pua̍h-tó, bô koh khí-.lâi, in-uī Guá hō͘ to-kiàm lîm-kàu lín tiong-kan.
English: You shall tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Drink you, and be drunken, and spew, and fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.

Tailo: Guá ài i-tī I-su-la-el ê sî, E-hu-laim ê tsuē-kò kah Sa-má-lī-a ê tsuē-ok tsiū lō͘-hiān. In-uī in tsò tāi-tsì hi-ké, lāi-bīn ū tsha̍t ji̍p-.lâi, guā-bīn ū kui tīn ê tshiúⁿ-kiap.
English: When I would heal Israel, Then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, Also the wickedness of Samaria; For they commit falsehood, And the thief enters in, And the gang of robbers ravages outside.

Tailo: Nā ū bī-sìn-tsiá tshiánn lín tsia̍h pn̄g, lín nā khì, pâi tī lín bīn-tsîng ê mi̍h lóng thang tsia̍h. M̄-bián uī-tio̍h liông-sim ê iân-kò͘ lâi mn̄g-tang mn̄g-sai.
English: But if one of those who don't believe invites you to a meal, and you are inclined to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no questions for the sake of conscience.

Tailo: Khui in ê ba̍k-tsiu, hō͘ in lī-khui o͘-àm, uat- tńg-lâi kui-ǹg kng-bîng; lī-khui Sa-tán ê kuân-sè, lâi kui-ǹg Siōng-tè, tuì sìn guá lâi tit-tio̍h sià tsuē, koh sîng-siū tsò Siōng-tè suán-bîn ê tē-uī. '
English: to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.'

Tailo: In lâi-kàu Kai-sa-lī-a, tsiū kā hit-tiuⁿ phue kau hō͘ tsóng-tok, mā kā Páu-lô kau hō͘ i.
English: When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, bô siáⁿ-mi̍h ē-tàng kah Lí pí-phīng-.tit! To̍k-to̍k Lí tsò tuā, Lí ê miâ tuā koh ū lîng-li̍k.
English: There is none like you, Yahweh; you are great, and your name is great in might.

Tailo: Hō͘ in tsiàu-sî sím-phuàⁿ jîn-bîn, tuā sū tio̍h hō͘ in kàu lí tsia, sió-sū in thang ka-kī sím-phuàⁿ. Án-ne, lí tsiū ē khah kiám khin tāng-tàⁿ, in mā thang kah lí tsò-hué tam-tng.
English: Let them judge the people at all times. It shall be that every great matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they shall judge themselves. So shall it be easier for you, and they shall share the load with you.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsò uân-tsuân ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lín ê Thiⁿ-pē.
English: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê sî, Lí m̄-tsún in tshim-huān Am-móng lâng, Mô͘-ap lâng kah Se-il suaⁿ lâng, guán tsiū lī-khui in, bô kā in siau-bia̍t.
English: Now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and Mount Seir, whom you would not let Israel invade, when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned aside from them, and didn't destroy them;

Tailo: E-tsu-le-el, Iok-tiān, Tsa-nó͘-uah,
English: and Jezreel, and Jokdeam, and Zanoah,

Tailo: Tī tsia só͘-ū ê sìn-tô͘, ti̍k-pia̍t sī Lô-má hông-kiong lāi ê sìn-tô͘, lóng beh kā lín tshíng-an.
English: All the saints greet you, especially those who are of Caesar's household.

Tailo: Lí kiânn tsiah-ê it-tshè khó-ò͘ⁿ kah îm-luān ê tāi-tsì, lóng bô siūⁿ-tio̍h lí sè-hàn tshiah-sin lō͘-thé, kō tī lí hueh tiong ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: In all your abominations and your prostitution you have not remembered the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, and was weltering in your blood.

Tailo: He-lo̍t tsò seⁿ-ji̍t ê sî, He-ló-tiah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tī lâi-pin bīn-tsîng thiàu-bú, hō͘ He-lo̍t tsin huann-hí.
English: But when Herod's birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced among them and pleased Herod.

Tailo: Tī só͘ niû ê tiong-kan, lí tio̍h niû, tn̂g nn̄g-bān gō͘-tshing, khuah tsi̍t-bān. Hit tiong-kan ū sìng-só͘, to̍h-sī tsì-sìng ê.
English: Of this measure shall you measure a length of twenty-five thousand, and a breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be the sanctuary, which is most holy.

Tailo: Guá beh in-uī Lí lâi huann-hí khuài-lo̍k; Tsì-kuân-.ê ah, guá beh o-ló Lí ê miâ.
English: I will be glad and rejoice in you. I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.

Tailo: Lâng ē-tàng jím-siū jio̍k-thé ê pēⁿ-thiànn; sim-sîn siū-siong, siáⁿ lâng jím-siū ē-tiâu?
English: A man's spirit will sustain him in sickness, But a crushed spirit, who can bear?

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, bīn tsiū sit-sik, iu-thâu kat-bīn lī-khui I-é-su, in-uī i ū tsin tsē tsâi-sán.
English: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

Tailo: Su-kot hiah-ê siú-líng ìn kóng, Se-bah kah Tsal-mú-nah ê tshiú í-king tī lí ê tshiú tiong, guán kám tsiah tio̍h īng piáⁿ hō͘ lí ê kun-tuī?
English: The princes of Succoth said, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in your hand, that we should give bread to your army?

Tailo: Lín tī sè-kan it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí, tī Siōng-tsú — lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, tio̍h tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê:
English: These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess it, all the days that you live on the earth.

Tailo: In tio̍h o-ló Lí tuā koh thang kiaⁿ-uì ê miâ; I sī tsì-sìng!
English: Let them praise your great and awesome name. He is Holy!

Tailo: In koh mn̄g Pa-lo-sih kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kā guán kóng, lí īng siáⁿ khuán lâi siá i só͘ thuân it-tshè ê uē?
English: They asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How did you write all these words at his mouth?

Tailo: Guá ê lông-kun, lâi, lán lâi-khì suaⁿ-tiûⁿ, lán lâi-khì tsng-thâu hioh mê.
English: Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field. Let us lodge in the villages.

Tailo: Luán-jio̍k ê, lín bô kò͘ hō͘ i ióng; phuà-pēⁿ ê, lín bô kā i i-tī; siū-siong ê, lín bô kā i pau; siū kuáⁿ-tio̍k ê, lín bô kā i tshuā tò tńg-.lâi; sit-lo̍h ê, lín bô khì tshuē i; to̍k-to̍k īng kiông-pō kah giâm-giâm ê kuán-hat.
English: You haven't strengthened the diseased, neither have you healed that which was sick, neither have you bound up that which was broken, neither have you brought back that which was driven away, neither have you sought that which was lost; but with force and with rigor have you ruled over them.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Lín tsiàu I-su-la-el tsa̍p-jī tsi-tso̍k, pun tsit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p, i ê tē-kài tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn ē-té: Iô-sé-huh ē tit-tio̍h nn̄g hūn.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: This shall be the border, by which you shall divide the land for inheritance according to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Tshun lí ê tshiú khì lia̍h i ê bué. Mô͘-se tsiū tshun tshiú khì lia̍h, tsuâ tī i ê tshiú tiong koh piàn-tsò kuái-á.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Put forth your hand, and take it by the tail. He put forth his hand, and laid hold of it, and it became a rod in his hand.

Tailo: Ba-siah thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū thîng kang, bô koh khí La̍h-má siâⁿ.
English: It happened, when Baasha heard of it, that he left off building Ramah, and let his work cease.

Tailo: Án-ne, tì-huī ê lâng tī tó-uī? King-ha̍k kàu-su tī tó-uī? Tsit sè-kan hò͘ⁿ piān lūn ê lâng tī tó-uī? Siōng-tè kám m̄-sī í-king hō͘ sè-kan ê tì-huī piàn-tsò gû-gōng?
English: Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the lawyer of this world? Hasn't God made foolish the wisdom of this world?

Tailo: Lî-á khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá khiā tī lō͘-.ni̍h, tshiú-.ni̍h pue̍h to; lî-á tsiū tuì lō͘-.ni̍h siám ji̍p-khì hn̂g lāi; Pa-lân tsiū phah lî-á beh hō͘ i kui guân-lō͘.
English: The donkey saw the angel of Yahweh standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and the donkey turned aside out of the way, and went into the field: and Balaam struck the donkey, to turn her into the way.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ ê āu-bīn, to̍h-sī sai-bīn mā tsò la̍k tè pán.
English: For the far part of the tent westward he made six boards.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tī sím-phuàⁿ ê sî, Tu-lô kah Si-tòng tio̍h siū ê hîng-hua̍t pí lín iáu khah hó jím-siū.
English: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.

Tailo: Lí ê tsi̍t luí ba̍k-tsiu nā ín-khí lí huān tsuē, tio̍h kā i ó͘ hiat-ka̍k; lîng-khó kiám tsi̍t luí ba̍k-tsiu phuà-siùⁿ lâi ji̍p-khì Siōng-tè kok-tō͘, pí nn̄g luí ba̍k-tsiu hó-hó lo̍h tē-ga̍k khah hó.
English: If your eye causes you to stumble, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into the Kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

Tailo: I mā phah-tó in ê phû-tô tshiū kah bû-hua-kó tshiū, huí-huāi in kíng lāi ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: He struck their vines and also their fig trees, And shattered the trees of their country.

Tailo: Sí-bông, lí ê sìng-lī tī tó-uī? Sí-bông, lí ê to̍k-tshì tī tó-uī? (tsù, HSA 13:14)
English: Death, where is your sting? Hades, where is your victory?

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng tsi̍t hāng, guá ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h nn̄g hāng, to̍h-sī kuân-lîng sio̍k tī Siōng-tè,
English: God has spoken once, Twice I have heard this, That power belongs to God.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, lí ê tshuì tsiū khui, lí tsiū kah tit-tio̍h thuat-lī ê lâng kóng-uē, bô koh é-káu. Lí ē án-ne tsò in ê tiāu-thâu, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: In that day shall your mouth be opened to him who is escaped, and you shall speak, and be no more mute: so shall you be a sign to them; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê só͘-ū ê Iô-tah lâng tuì in hō͘ lâng kuáⁿ-khì ê ta̍k só͘-tsāi tò tńg-.lâi, lâi-kàu Iô-tah tē ê Mi-su-peh, khì kìⁿ Ge-tá-lia̍h, koh tsik-tsū tsin tsē tsiú kah jua̍h-thinn ê kué-tsí.
English: then all the Jews returned out of all places where they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, to Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits very much.

Tailo: Guá tsai ka-kī ê kuè-sit; guá ê tsuē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: For I know my transgressions. My sin is constantly before me.

Tailo: Lín nā kian-siú guá thuân hō͘ lín ê hok-im tō-lí, lín ê sìn-gióng koh m̄-sī khang-khang, lín tsiū ē khò tsit-ê hok-im lâi tit-kiù.
English: by which also you are saved, if you hold firmly the word which I preached to youunless you believed in vain.

Tailo: Siū kat-lé liáu-āu tsiah tsiap-siū ho͘-tiàu ê lâng, m̄-bián am-khàm kat-lé ê kì-hō; siū ho͘-tiàu ê sî iáu-buē siū kat-lé ê lâng, mā m̄-bián khì siū kat-lé.
English: Was anyone called having been circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Has anyone been called in uncircumcision? Let him not be circumcised.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-pē lóng bô kā lâng sím-phuàⁿ, I kā sím-phuàⁿ ê kuân-pìng lóng kau-tài Kiáⁿ.
English: For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son,

Tailo: Io-ná-than ê kiáⁿ, Pe-liat, Tsa-tsah. Tsiah-ê lóng sī E-la-mel ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

Tailo: Han-nah ê sim-lāi iu-khó͘, tuì Siōng-tsú kî-tó, suah lâi tuā thî-khàu.
English: She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to Yahweh, and wept sore.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, guá ê gû-gōng Lí pún-lâi to̍h tsai; guá bô tuì Lí ún-muâ guá ê tsuē-kò.
English: God, you know my foolishness. My sins aren't hidden from you.

Tailo: M̄-thang khuànn guá phuê-hu lio̍h-á o͘, he sī in-uī ji̍t-thâu pha̍k guá; guán lāu-bú ê kiáⁿ bat tuì guá siū-khì, in hō͘ guá kò͘-siú in ê phû-tô hn̂g; guá ka-kī ê phû-tô hn̂g suah bô huat-tō͘ kò͘-siú.
English: Don't stare at me because I am dark, Because the sun has scorched me. My mother's sons were angry with me. They made me keeper of the vineyards. I haven't kept my own vineyard.

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit nî, tē tio̍h siú tuā ê an-hioh, to̍h-sī kā Siōng-tsú siú ê an-hioh, m̄-thang tsìng-tsoh lí ê tshân-hn̂g, mā m̄-thang siu-tsíng phû-tô hn̂g.
English: but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a Sabbath to Yahweh. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.

Tailo: Lū-biān lâng kah Ga̍t lâng kā hit-ê tuâⁿ kiò-tsò tsìng-kì, in-uī kóng, tsit-ê tuâⁿ tī lán tiong-kan tsìng-bîng Siōng-tsú sī Siōng-tè.
English: The children of Reuben and the children of Gad called the altar Ed: For, said they, it is a witness between us that Yahweh is God.

Tailo: Án-ne tsiah ē hō͘ lí ê lîng-hûn tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, tī lí ê ām-kún tsiâⁿ-tsò suí ê táⁿ-pān.
English: So they will be life to your soul, And grace for your neck.

Tailo: I sī kà-sī lán iâⁿ-kuè tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsáu-siù, hō͘ lán ū tì-huī iâⁿ-kuè khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu.
English: Who teaches us more than the animals of the earth, And makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?'

Tailo: mā kā in ê sîn-bîng kah só͘ tsù ê ngó͘-siōng, í-ki̍p gîn kim ê pó-khì tshiúⁿ-lia̍h kàu Ai-gi̍p. Kuí-nā nî kú, i lóng bô koh khì kong-kik pak-hong ê ông.
English: Also their gods, with their molten images, and with their goodly vessels of silver and of gold, shall he carry captive into Egypt; and he shall refrain some years from the king of the north.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, Ta-ni-el ji̍p-khì kìnn A-lio̍k, to̍h-sī ông só͘ phài lâi tsâu-bia̍t Ba-bú-lông hiah-ê tì-huī ê lâng ê. I khì kā i kóng, M̄-thang tsâu-bia̍t Ba-bú-lông hiah-ê tì-huī ê lâng, tshuā guá khì-kàu ông ê bīn-tsîng, guá beh kā bāng tuì ông kái-bîng.
English: Therefore Daniel went in to Arioch, whom the king had appointed to destroy the wise men of Babylon; he went and said thus to him: Don't destroy the wise men of Babylon; bring me in before the king, and I will show to the king the interpretation.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ka-kī tuā-tuā kín-sīn, thiàⁿ Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: Take good heed therefore to yourselves, that you love Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Hó-gia̍h lâng siūⁿ kóng tsâi-bu̍t sī i kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, ná tshin-tshiūnn ū kuân tshiûⁿ thang khò.
English: The rich man's wealth is his strong city, Like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.

Tailo: Kàu hioh mê ê só͘-tsāi, in tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tháu-khui i ê pò͘-tē, beh the̍h hō͘ lî tsia̍h, tsiah khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê gîn iû-guân tī-.leh, hē tī pò͘-tē kháu.
English: As one of them opened his sack to give his donkey food in the lodging place, he saw his money. Behold, it was in the mouth of his sack.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí m̄-thang tuā siū-khì, mā m̄-thang íng-uán ē kì-tit guán ê tsuē-kò. Kiû Lí àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn guán, guán lóng sī Lí ê tsú-bîn.
English: Don't be furious, Yahweh, neither remember iniquity forever: see, look, we beg you, we are all your people.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá beh hō͘ Guá it-tshè ê un-huī king-kuè lí ê bīn-tsîng, mā suan-pò͘ Guá ê sìng-miâ — I-é-ho-bah tī lí ê bīn-tsîng. Guá beh si un tī Guá só͘ si un ê, Guá beh liân-bín tī Guá só͘ liân-bín ê.
English: He said, I will make all my goodness pass before you, and will proclaim the name of Yahweh before you. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.

Tailo: Guá tsit-má teh kóng ê m̄-sī Tsú ê ì-sù, sī guá tsò tsi̍t-ê gōng lâng teh khua-kháu.
English: That which I speak, I don't speak according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this confidence of boasting.

Tailo: Me-si-le-miah ê kiáⁿ kah hiann-tī lóng sī ióng-sū, kiōng tsa̍p-peh lâng.
English: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, valiant men, eighteen.

Tailo: Siōng-tè hi-sing Ki-tok tsò sio̍k-tsuē ê tsè-phín, īng I ê hueh hō͘ sìn I ê lâng ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián; Siōng-tè khuan-iông lâng, bô tui-kiù lâng kuè-khì só͘ huān ê tsuē.
English: whom God set forth to be an atoning sacrifice , through faith in his blood, for a demonstration of his righteousness through the passing over of prior sins, in God's forbearance;

Tailo: Mô͘-kuí tsiū tshuā I-é-su khì-kàu sìng-siâⁿ, hō͘ I khiā tī sìng-tiān tshù tíng siōng kuân ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple,

Tailo: Guá beh tshe i kong-kik siâ-ok ê pang-kok, huan-hù i kong-kik guá só͘ siū-khì ê jîn-bîn, khì tshiúⁿ i só͘ tshiúⁿ ê, khì lia̍h i só͘ lia̍h ê, koh tshin-tshiūnn ke-lō͘ ê thô͘-muê kā in thún-ta̍h.
English: I will send him against a profane nation, and against the people who anger me will I give him a charge to take the spoil and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

Tailo: Ê-no͘k seⁿ Me-thu-se-la̍h liáu-āu, koh kah Siōng-tsú tsò-hué kiânn saⁿ pah nî, kî-tiong ū koh seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: Enoch walked with God after he became the father of Methuselah three hundred years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-sá-iah kóng,
English: Then the word of Yahweh came to Isaiah, saying,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè koh ē tshe tuā-tsiah phang pue kàu in tiong-kan, it-ti̍t kàu in só͘ tshun lo̍h-lâi teh siám-bih-.ê tī lí ê bīn-tsîng siau-bia̍t.
English: Moreover Yahweh your God will send the hornet among them, until those who are left, and hide themselves, perish from before you.

Tailo: I tio̍h kā sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê gû-káng-á só͘-ū ê iû lóng the̍h khí-.lâi, khàm pak-lāi ê iû kah pak-lāi só͘-ū ê iû,
English: He shall take all the fat of the bull of the sin offering off of it; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards,

Tailo: Taⁿ guá beh khí-.lâi, tī siâⁿ lāi sì-kè kiânn, tī ke-lō͘, tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, guá beh tshuē guá sim só͘ ài ê; guá tshuē i mā tshuē bē-tio̍h.
English: I will get up now, and go about the city; In the streets and in the squares I will seek him whom my soul loves. I sought him, but I didn't find him.

Tailo: Lām-sám kiàn-tsìng ê lâng bē bián-tit siū hîng-hua̍t; kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê lâng ē tú-tio̍h bia̍t-bông.
English: A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who utters lies shall perish.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Guá tsit khuán ê gû-gōng kah bû-ti, tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng ná tshin-tshiūnn tsing-seⁿ.
English: I was so senseless and ignorant. I was a brute beast before you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê siàu-liân lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Iû-tu-kó͘, tsē tī thang-á-mn̂g. Páu-lô kè-sio̍k káng-lūn tsin kú, hit-ê siàu-liân lâng suah khùn lo̍h-bîn, tuì saⁿ-tsàn lâu pua̍h lo̍h-.khì. Tāi-ke kā i hû khí-.lâi ê sî, i í-king sí à.
English: A certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window, weighed down with deep sleep. As Paul spoke still longer, being weighed down by his sleep, he fell down from the third story, and was taken up dead.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Tu-lô, lí khuàⁿ, Guá kah lí tsò tuì-ti̍k, Guá mā beh hō͘ tsin tsē kok khí-lâi kā lí kong-kik, tshin-tshiūnn hái hō͘ i ê íng giâ khí-.lâi.
English: therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to come up.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū tshe lâng khì-kàu Sī-lô, tuì hia kng tsē tī ki-lō͘-ping ê tiong-kan bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī lâi. E-lī nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ — Ho-hu-nî kah Hui-ne-hah kah Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī tī hia.
English: So the people sent to Shiloh; and they brought from there the ark of the covenant of Yahweh of Armies, who sits above the cherubim: and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.

Tailo: Tse sī tsá-tsîng Siōng-tsú kā E-hú kóng ê uē, kóng, Lí ê kiáⁿ-sun ē tsē I-su-la-el ê kok-uī kàu sì tāi. Tsit-ê uē án-ne ìng-giām.
English: This was the word of Yahweh which he spoke to Jehu, saying, Your sons to the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel. So it came to pass.

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, ông lim tsiú lim kah tsin sóng-khuài, tsiū bīng-līng Me-hu-mān, Bi-tsu-tha, Ha-bó͘-ná, Bik-thah, A-bak-thah, Tse-ta̍t, Kal-ka-su, to̍h-sī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kin-tuè tī A-ha-sui-ló͘ ông bīn-tsîng hit tshit-ê thài-kàm,
English: On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine, he commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcass, the seven chamberlains who ministered in the presence of Ahasuerus the king,

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn ua̍h-tauh-á pia̍k tsi̍t ē tsiū lâi-kàu tsuân sè-kài lâng só͘ tuà ê ta̍k só͘-tsāi.
English: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.

Tailo: Me-ke-lat lâng He-huel, Pe-lóng lâng A-hi-iah,
English: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

Tailo: Tsiah-ê thiⁿ-sài lī-khui in beh tsiūⁿ thinn ê sî, kò͘ iûⁿ ê lâng tsò-hué kóng, Taⁿ lán lâi-khì Bia̍t-lé-hèm siâⁿ, khuànn Tsú pò lán tsai só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì.
English: It happened, when the angels went away from them into the sky, that the shepherds said one to another, Let's go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè hō͘ ta̍k tsióng ê tshiū tuì tē-.ni̍h huat khí-.lâi, hó khuànn mā hó tsia̍h. Τī hn̂g ê tiong-kan, koh ū ua̍h-miā ê tshiū kah hun-pia̍t siān-ok ê tshiū.
English: Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

Tailo: In ê kiáⁿ tsiām-tsiām puî-phauh, tī suaⁿ-iá tióng-tuā; in tshut-.khì, tsiū bô koh tò tńg-.lâi.
English: Their young ones become strong. They grow up in the open field. They go forth, and don't return again.

Tailo: Tsit khuán lâng ē tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú sù-hok, koh tuì kiù i ê Siōng-tè tit-tio̍h gī.
English: He shall receive a blessing from Yahweh, Righteousness from the God of his salvation.

Tailo: Lāu-ing teh pue, thí-khui i ê si̍t, ǹg lâm khì, kám sī khò lí ê tì-huī?
English: Is it by your wisdom that the hawk soars, And stretches her wings toward the south?

Tailo: Iáu ū tsè-si É-lī-a-kim, Ma-a-se-iah, Mi-niah-mín, Mi-ka-iah, E-lio-e-nái, Tsa-kha-lī-a, Han-nán-niah, in lóng gia̍h kó͘-tshue.
English: and the priests, Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Micaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah, with trumpets;

Tailo: Ē thiaⁿ ê hīⁿ-khang kah ē khuànn ê ba̍k-tsiu, tsit nn̄g hāng lóng sī Siōng-tsú só͘ tsō.
English: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Yahweh has made even both of them.

Tailo: Thiⁿ tsi̍t ē kng, Iô-tá-iah lâng ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah king-ha̍k kàu-su tsū-tsi̍p khui-huē, kuat-tīng kā I-é-su ah-khì in ê gī-huē.
English: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people was gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,

Tailo: In-uī in só͘-ū ê tsâi-liāu í-king kàu-gia̍h thang tsò it-tshè só͘ tio̍h tsò ê kang, suah ū tshun.
English: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim tsē-uī ê sî, jī-tsa̍p gō͘ huè, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ông, kiōng tsa̍p-it nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Tse-bi-tah, sī Lu-mah lâng Pe-tá-iah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Zebidah the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

Tailo: tsí ū hn̂g tiong-ng hit-tsâng tshiū ê kué-tsí, Siōng-tè bat kóng, ' Lín m̄-thang tsia̍h, mā m̄-thang bong, khióng-kiaⁿ lín tsia̍h-liáu ē sí. '
English: but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God has said, You shall not eat of it, neither shall you touch it, lest you die.'

Tailo: Kó͘-tsá lâng in-uī ū tsit-ê sìn-sim, tsiah tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê tsiap-la̍p.
English: For by this, the elders obtained testimony.

Tailo: Lí kiâⁿ lō͘ ê sî tsiū ē ín-tshuā lí, lí khùn ê sî tsiū ē pó-siú lí, lí khùn-tshéⁿ tsiū kah lí tâm-lūn.
English: When you walk, it will lead you. When you sleep, it will watch over you. When you awake, it will talk with you.

Tailo: Guá kóng, tú-tú tī guá tiong-liân ê ji̍t, guá tio̍h ji̍p im-kan ê mn̂g, bē tit thang hióng-siū guá iáu tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê nî-ji̍t.
English: I said, In the middle of my life I go into the gates of Sheol. I am deprived of the residue of my years.

Tailo: （Peh kiā-á ê si. ）Lí khuàⁿ, Tsiah-ê àm-sî tuà tī Siōng-tsú tshù lāi ê lô͘-po̍k, lín lóng tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú!
English: Look! Praise Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh, Who stand by night in Yahweh's house!

Tailo: Tû Gi-bóng ê Hi-bī lâng í-guā, bô kah tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ kah I-su-la-el lâng kóng-hô, in lóng tuì kau-tsiàn lâi tsing-ho̍k i.
English: There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, save the Hivites the inhabitants of Gibeon: they took all in battle.

Tailo: Lí mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê kha-puâⁿ kah kha-tsíng-thâu-á, tsi̍t-puàⁿ sī sio-huî ê thô͘, tsi̍t-puàⁿ sī thih, hit-ê kok mā ē hun-khui. Tsóng-.sī, lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h thih kah nuā-thô͘ sio-tsham, tsit-ê kok mā ē ū tshin-tshiūnn thih ê la̍t.
English: Whereas you saw the feet and toes, part of potters' clay, and part of iron, it shall be a divided kingdom; but there shall be in it of the strength of the iron, because you saw the iron mixed with miry clay.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tiong-kan tsin tsē lâng su-hā teh gī-lūn I-é-su ê tāi-tsì, ū lâng kóng, I sī hó lâng. Mā ū lâng kóng, M̄-sī, I sī teh siàn-tōng kûn-tsiòng.
English: There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said, He is a good man. Others said, Not so, but he leads the multitude astray.

Tailo: Tshun guá ka-kī tī hia. Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tuā ī-siōng, sing-khu lóng bô khuì-la̍t, jî-tshiánn guá bīn-māu ê suí-sik piàn bái, tì-kàu lóng bô la̍t.
English: So I was left alone, and saw this great vision, and there remained no strength in me; for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption, and I retained no strength.

Tailo: Tsò kiáⁿ-jî ê, tio̍h sūn-ho̍k pē-bú, tse sī lí-só͘-tong-jiân ê.
English: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.

Tailo: Kang-hô ē piàn tshàu, Ai-gi̍p ê hô tsuí ē kiám-tsió, koh ta-ta-.khì; lô͘-uí kah lô͘-tik lóng ē ta-.khì.
English: The rivers will become foul. The streams of Egypt will be diminished and dried up. The reeds and flags will wither away.

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p-gō͘ sī E-le-mo͘t, i kah i ê kiáⁿ kah i ê hiann-tī, kiōng tsa̍p-jī lâng.
English: for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve:

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán koh tshe-phài tsi̍t-ê hiann-tī kah in tsò-hué khì, tsit-ê hiann-tī king-kuè guán tsin tsē khó-giām, guán tsai i jia̍t-sim pang-tsān lâng. Taⁿ i hui-siông sìn-jīm lín, tsiū koh khah khat-bōng khì pang-tsān lín.
English: We have sent with them our brother, whom we have many times proved earnest in many things, but now much more earnest, by reason of the great confidence which he has in you.

Tailo: I siūⁿ kóng ka-kī ê hiann-tī ē liáu-kái tse sī Siōng-tè īng i ê tshiú lâi kiù in; m̄-koh, in bô liáu-kái.
English: He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn't understand.

Tailo: Tē-gō͘-tsa̍p nî beh tsò lín ê hí-nî, m̄-thang tsìng-tsoh; tē ka-kī huat ê m̄-thang siu-kuah; bô siu-tsíng ê phû-tô tshiū mā m̄-thang bán phû-tô.
English: That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee to you. In it you shall not sow, neither reap that which grows of itself, nor gather from the undressed vines.

Tailo: Kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi tsin ài lí tī tsit ji̍t to̍h tsai kuan-hē pîng-an ê tāi-tsì; tsóng-.sī, hiān-tshú-sî lí ê ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ bē-tshut.
English: saying, If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Kám sī Ai-gi̍p bô bōng-tē, lí tsiah tshuā guán tshut-lâi sí tī khòng-iá? Lí ná ē án-ne khuán-thāi guán, tshuā guán tshut Ai-gi̍p?
English: They said to Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, have you taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why have you treated us this way, to bring us forth out of Egypt?

Tailo: Ū kuí-nā-ê bûn-tô͘ hō͘-siong kóng, I kā lán kóng, ' Koh bô guā kú, lín tsiū bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, koh-tsài bô guā kú, lín tsiū ē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá. ', koh kóng, ' In-uī guá teh beh tńg-khì Thiⁿ-pē hia. ' Tsiah-ê uē sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù?
English: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, What is this that he says to us, A little while, and you won't see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;' and, Because I go to the Father?'

Tailo: Hit sî, lín lóng lâi kìnn guá, kóng, ' Lán tio̍h tshe lâng tāi-sing khì, kā lán thàm-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē, kā lán huê-hok, khuànn lán sī tio̍h tuì siáⁿ-mi̍h lō͘ kiâⁿ-.khì, tuì siáⁿ-mi̍h siâⁿ ji̍p-.khì. '
English: You came near to me everyone of you, and said, Let us send men before us, that they may search the land for us, and bring us word again of the way by which we must go up, and the cities to which we shall come.

Tailo: In tiong-kan nā ū lâng bô sìn-si̍t, in ê bô sìn-si̍t kám ē hō͘ Siōng-tè ê ē piàn-tsò bô sìn-si̍t?
English: For what if some were without faith? Will their lack of faith nullify the faithfulness of God?

Tailo: Lí tsi̍t-sì-lâng ē tit-tio̍h an-ún, ū hong-sīng ê kiù-un, tì-huī kah tì-sik; kìng-uì Siōng-tsú ē tsiâⁿ-tsò lí ê pó-puè.
English: There will be stability in your times, abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge. The fear of Yahweh is your treasure.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lín khuànn, Guá beh tshe tsuâ kah to̍k-tsuâ kàu lín tiong-kan, lín bô huat-tit kā in kuáⁿ-tsáu ê ē kā lín kā. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: For, behold, I will send serpents, adders, among you, which will not be charmed; and they shall bite you, says Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī I hō͘ pik-tshiat him-bō͘ ê sim tit-tio̍h ti tsiok, hō͘ iau-gō ê sim tit-tio̍h hó-mi̍h tsia̍h kàu pá.
English: For he satisfies the longing soul. He fills the hungry soul with good.

Tailo: Má-ná-se hō͘ Iô-tah lâng huān tsuē, kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, i tsit-ê tsuē í-guā, koh lâu tsin tsē bô tsuē ê lâng ê hueh, muá Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tuì tsit kik kàu hit kik.
English: Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, until he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; besides his sin with which he made Judah to sin, in doing that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.

Tailo: tsiah bián guá ê tuì-ti̍k kóng, Guá iâⁿ-kuè i ; tsiah bián guá ê siû-ti̍k tī guá pua̍h-tó ê sî huann-hí.
English: Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him; Lest my adversaries rejoice when I fall.

Tailo: Mal-tha ìn kóng, Tsú ah, guá sìn Lí sī Ki-tok, Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ, sī teh beh lâi sè-kan ê hit uī.
English: She said to him, Yes, Lord. I have come to believe that you are the Christ, God's Son, he who comes into the world.

Tailo: Lia̍t ông, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ! Tsiah-ê siú-líng tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang! Guá ǹg Siōng-tsú, guá beh gîm-si; guá beh tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè.
English: Hear, you kings; give ear, you princes; I, even I, will sing to Yahweh; I will sing praise to Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè uī-tio̍h hit-ê lâng kah i ê bó͘, īng phuê tsò saⁿ-khò͘ hō͘ in tshīng.
English: Yahweh God made coats of skins for Adam and for his wife, and clothed them.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am kah i ê tsó͘-sian I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông tâng khùn liáu-āu, i ê kiáⁿ Tse-ka-lí-ah suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel; and Zechariah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Guá án-ne tsáu, m̄-sī bô bo̍k-phiau teh tsáu; guá phah-kûn, mā m̄-sī teh phah khong-khì.
English: I therefore run like that, as not uncertainly. I fight like that, as not beating the air,

Tailo: Iá-gû kám khíng ho̍k-sāi lí? Á-sī hioh tī lí ê tsô piⁿ?
English: Will the wild ox be content to serve you? Or will he stay by your feeding trough?

Tailo: Só͘ kau-tài lí tsò lí ê Siōng-tè tiān lāi ê lō͘-īng ê khì-kū, lí tio̍h kau tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng.
English: The vessels that are given you for the service of the house of your God, deliver you before the God of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Kol-né-lioh kā guán kóng i ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê thiⁿ-sài khiā tī i ê tshù-.ni̍h, tuì i kóng, ' Tio̍h tshe lâng khì Io̍p-pe, tshiánn hit-ê kiò-tsò Piat-tò͘ ê Sí-mòng lâi,
English: He told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying to him, Send to Joppa, and get Simon, whose surname is Peter,

Tailo: Ê-nó͘-suh tsia̍h kàu káu pah khòng gō͘ huè tsiah sí.
English: All the days of Enosh were nine hundred five years, then he died.

Tailo: I án-ne kóng m̄-sī tshut tī ka-kī ê ì-sù, sī in-uī hit nî i tsò tuā-tsè-si, i teh ī-giân I-é-su ē uī-tio̍h tsit-ê bîn-tso̍k lâi sí;
English: Now he didn't say this of himself, but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,

Tailo: Siōng-tè kám m̄-sī teh kàm-tshat guá ê lō͘, tiám-sǹg guá ê kha-pō͘?
English: Doesn't he see my ways, And number all my steps?

Tailo: Siat-sú tsiah-ê gō͘-tsa̍p-ê hó lâng khiàm gō͘-ê, Lí kám ē in-uī khiàm gō͘-ê, lâi tsâu-bia̍t tsuân siânn? Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá tī hia nā tú-tio̍h ū sì-tsa̍p-gō͘-ê, mā bô beh tsâu-bia̍t.
English: What if there will lack five of the fifty righteous? Will you destroy all the city for lack of five? He said, I will not destroy it, if I find forty-five there.

Tailo: Ū lâng pò A-siul ông, kóng, Lí só͘ tshian-suá an-tì tī Sa-má-lī-a hiah-ê siâⁿ ê lia̍t pang lâng, m̄-tsai hit só͘-tsāi ê Siōng-tsú ê kui-lē, só͘-í, I hō͘ sai ji̍p-lâi in tiong-kan, kā in kā-sí. In-uī in m̄-tsai hit só͘-tsāi ê Siōng-tè ê kui-lē.
English: Therefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, The nations which you have carried away, and placed in the cities of Samaria, don't know the law of the god of the land: therefore he has sent lions among them, and behold, they kill them, because they don't know the law of the god of the land.

Tailo: guá nā tshin-tshiūⁿ A-tám jia-khàm guá ê kuè-sit, kā guá ê tsuē-gia̍t khǹg tī guá ê hing tsîng;
English: If like Adam I have covered my transgressions, By hiding my iniquity in my heart,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú bat kah in li̍p-iok, kā in huan-hù kóng, M̄-thang kìng-uì pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, m̄-thang kuī-pài, m̄-thang kā i ho̍k-sāi, m̄-thang tuì i tsè-hiàn.
English: with whom Yahweh had made a covenant, and charged them, saying, You shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them:

Tailo: Sàu-lô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, koh tsai Siōng-tsú kah Ta-bi̍t tông-tsāi, jî-tshiánn Sàu-lô ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mi-kal mā thiàⁿ i.
English: Saul saw and knew that Yahweh was with David; and Michal, Saul's daughter, loved him.

Tailo: I kā ū pe̍h bûn ê tshiū-ki tshah tī iûⁿ lim tsuí ê tsuí-kau kah tsuí-tsô, hō͘ i kah iûⁿ sio tuì-siòng; iûⁿ lâi lim tsuí ê sî, kang-bó͘ kau-ha̍p.
English: He set the rods which he had peeled opposite the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink. They conceived when they came to drink.

Tailo: Guá beh kā lín tsū-tsi̍p, īng Guá tuā siū-khì ê hué pûn lín, lín tsiū ē tī hit tiong-kan iûⁿ-huà.
English: Yes, I will gather you, and blow on you with the fire of my wrath, and you shall be melted in the midst of it.

Tailo: Guán ū tshâ-tshut tsit-ê lâng ná tshin-tshiūnn un-i̍k, tī tsuân sè-kài ê Iô-tá-iah lâng tiong-kan ín khí jiáu-luān. I sī Na-tsa-lia̍t tóng ê thâu-ba̍k,
English: For we have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.

Tailo: In tsiū tuì Ai-gi̍p kā U-lī-a lia̍h tńg-.lâi, sàng kàu E-hō͘-iá-kim ông hia; ông īng to kā i thâi, kā i ê sin-si hiat tī pîng-siông lâng ê bōng. ）
English: and they fetched forth Uriah out of Egypt, and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword, and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.

Tailo: In-uī lán sī Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ ê kok-bîn, mā teh ǹg-bāng Kiù-sè-Tsú, to̍h-sī Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok tuì hia lâi.
English: For our citizenship is in heaven, from where we also wait for a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ;

Tailo: Guá ê sim-lāi tio̍h-kip, só͘-í, guá ê sim-su pik guá tio̍h ìn.
English: Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, Even by reason of my haste that is in me.

Tailo: E-li-iah kā i kóng, Bián-kiaⁿ! Tsò lí khì! Tsiàu lí só͘ kóng ê lâi kiâⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, tāi-sing kā guá tsò tsi̍t tè sè tè ê piáⁿ, tuà-lâi hō͘ guá, jiân-āu tsiah uī lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ khì piak.
English: Elijah said to her, Don't be afraid; go and do as you have said; but make me of it a little cake first, and bring it forth to me, and afterward make for you and for your son.

Tailo: In-uī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē ê tsí-ì to̍h-sī, só͘-ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Kiáⁿ lâi sìn I ê lâng, lóng ū íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā, guá tī bua̍t-ji̍t mā ē hō͘ i koh-ua̍h.
English: This is the will of the one who sent me, that everyone who sees the Son, and believes in him, should have eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

Tailo: La̍h-ban kóng, Hó, guá guān-ì tsiàu lí ê uē kiânn.
English: Laban said, Behold, I desire it to be according to your word.

Tailo: Ta-ni-el tuì i kóng, Kiû lí tshì lí tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k tsa̍p kang, hō͘ guán tsia̍h tshài lim tsuí,
English: Prove your servants, I beg you, ten days; and let them give us pulse to eat, and water to drink.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah A-lông tuì I-su-la-el jîn-bîn kóng, Kàu ê-hng lín ē tsai, tshuā lín tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê sī Siōng-tsú.
English: Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, At evening, then you shall know that Yahweh has brought you out from the land of Egypt;

Tailo: Taⁿ guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, tshiáⁿ lí thiaⁿ guá ê uē, tsún guá só͘ kiû, m̄-thang hō͘ guá tò tńg-khì su-kì Io-ná-than ê tshù, bián-tit guá sí tī hia.
English: Now please hear, my lord the king: please let my supplication be presented before you, that you not cause me to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.

Tailo: Thuân-tō-tsiá kóng: Khang-hi ê khang-hi, khang-hi ê khang-hi, huân-sū lóng sī khang-hi.
English: Vanity of vanities, says the Preacher; Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.

Tailo: In tsi̍t-ē lâi, tē tín-tāng, thiⁿ iô-tāng, ji̍t-gue̍h o͘-àm, tsheⁿ-sîn bô kng.
English: The earth quakes before them. The heavens tremble. The sun and the moon are darkened, And the stars withdraw their shining.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê sun Me-hui-bo-siat mā lo̍h-khì gîng-tsiap ông, tuì ông tshut-khì ê ji̍t kàu ông pîng-an tńg-.lâi ê ji̍t, i lóng bô siu-tsíng kha, mā bô siu-tsíng tshuì-tshiu, mā bô sé saⁿ.
English: Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king; and he had neither dressed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came home in peace.

Tailo: Guá beh kiâⁿ tī lín tiong-kan, Guá beh tsò lín ê Siōng-tè, lín beh tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn.
English: I will walk among you, and will be your God, and you will be my people.

Tailo: Tuì guân-khí-thâu, tsit-ê tō tsiū kah Siōng-tè tông-tsāi.
English: The same was in the beginning with God.

Tailo: Guá ê tâng-kang Má-khó, A-lí-su-ta̍t-khó͘, Tê-má kah Lū-ka, mā beh kā lí tshíng-an.
English: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

Tailo: Koh khí-tsō I ê sìng-só͘, kuân kah tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ, koh tshin-tshiūnn I kiàn-li̍p íng-uán tsûn-tsāi ê tē;
English: He built his sanctuary like the heights, Like the earth which he has established forever.

Tailo: kā i kóng: ' Tio̍h tuà tsiah-ê khì-kū khì hē tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tiān, mā tio̍h tī i ê guân uī khí Siōng-tè ê tiān. '
English: and he said to him, Take these vessels, go, put them in the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be built in its place.

Tailo: In nn̄g tsí-muē tsiū tshe lâng khì tshuē I-é-su, kóng, Tsú ah, Lí só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng teh phuà-pēⁿ.
English: The sisters therefore sent to him, saying, Lord, behold, he for whom you have great affection is sick.

Tailo: King-kuè la̍k-tsa̍p-jī-ê tshit-ji̍t kî liáu-āu, siū buah-iû ê ē tú-tio̍h siū tsián-tû, ta̍k hāng mā lóng ē bô liáu-liáu; ē ū tsi̍t-ê kun-ông ê jîn-bîn kàu, lâi kā siâⁿ kah sìng-só͘ huí-bia̍t, i ê kiat-kio̍k ē tshin-tshiūⁿ īng tuā-tsuí lâi im-bia̍t. Kàu lō͘-bué ē ū kau-tsiàn, pha-hng ê tāi-tsì í-king tiāⁿ-tio̍h.
English: After the sixty-two weeks the Anointed One shall be cut off, and shall have nothing: and the people of the prince who shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary; and the end of it shall be with a flood, and even to the end shall be war; desolations are determined.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú bô khuài siū-khì, ū tuā lîng-li̍k, tsua̍t-tuì bô lia̍h ū tsuē ê tsò bô tsuē. Siōng-tsú ê lō͘ tī kńg-lê-á hong kah kông hong ê tiong-kan, hûn sī I ê kha-ē ê thô͘-sua hún.
English: Yahweh is slow to anger, and great in power, and will by no means leave the guilty unpunished. Yahweh has his way in the whirlwind and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; īng si-hiân ê ga̍k-khì; īng tē-peh tiāu. ) Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang tī siū-khì tiong tsik-pī guá, mā m̄-thang tī Lí tuā siū-khì tiong khián-tsik guá.
English: Yahweh, don't rebuke me in your anger, Neither discipline me in your wrath.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī tī suaⁿ-tē, tī pîng-guân, tī A-la̍h-bah, tī suaⁿ-kha, tī khòng-iá, tī lâm-hong ê tē sī Hiat lâng, A-mô͘-lī lâng, Ka-nân lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, Hi-bī lâng, I-é-bú-suh lâng tsiah-ê ông kì tī ē-té:
English: in the hill country, and in the lowland, and in the Arabah, and in the slopes, and in the wilderness, and in the South; the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè tuì tsuâ kóng, Lí í-king tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì, lí tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! Hit-ê tsiù-tsó͘ pí it-tshè ê tsing-seⁿ kah suaⁿ-iá it-tshè ê tsáu-siù ê khah tāng. Lí tio̍h īng pak-tó͘ kiâⁿ lō͘, it-sing tsia̍h thô͘-sua hún.
English: Yahweh God said to the serpent, Because you have done this, cursed are you above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. On your belly shall you go, and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.

Tailo: Í-sak kiò Iâ-kop lâi, kā i tsiok-hok, mā huan-hù i kóng, Lí m̄-thang tshuā Ka-nân ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tsò bó͘.
English: Isaac called Jacob, blessed him, and commanded him, You shall not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

Tailo: Kiû Lí īng tsin-lí kā in sìng-huà; Lí ê uē to̍h-sī tsin-lí.
English: Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.

Tailo: He-mán tso̍k ê Ia-tsi-el kah Si-mí, E-to-tòng tso̍k ê Si-má-iah kah U-tsi-el, lóng khí-.lâi;
English: and of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá ê sim-pak uī-tio̍h Mô͘-ap tshin-tshiūnn khîm tshut siaⁿ thó͘-khuì, guá ê sim-tn̂g uī-tio̍h Kel-ha-la-siat mā sī án-ne.
English: Therefore my heart sounds like a harp for Moab, and my inward parts for Kir Heres.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h kā in kóng, ' Lín tio̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê hué-tsè, to̍h-sī bô khuat-tiám bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, ta̍k ji̍t nn̄g tsiah, tsò kú-tn̂g hiàn ê sio-tsè.
English: You shall tell them, This is the offering made by fire which you shall offer to Yahweh: male lambs a year old without blemish, two day by day, for a continual burnt offering.

Tailo: Tī i tshing-khì ê ji̍t muá, bô-lūn sī uī tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ á-.sī tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, i tio̍h īng bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á tsò sio-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ á-.sī tsi̍t tsiah pan-kah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tuà kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu kau-tài tsè-si.
English: When the days of her purification are completed, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring to the priest at the door of the Tent of Meeting, a year old lamb for a burnt offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a sin offering:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Jiám-tio̍h thái-ko tsìng ê saⁿ-khò͘, bô-lūn sī iûⁿ-mn̂g ê á-.sī tē-pò͘ ê,
English: The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether it is a woolen garment, or a linen garment;

Tailo: In ê sim-lāi tô͘-bô͘ siâ-ok, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsū-tsi̍p ài beh kau-tsiàn.
English: Those who devise mischief in their hearts. They continually gather themselves together for war.

Tailo: Ti̍t kàu Siōng-tsú hō͘ lín ê hiann-tī kah lín sio-siâng lóng tit-tio̍h pîng-an, ti̍t-kàu in mā tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tē, hit sî lín tsiah thang tńg-khì lín só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tē, kā i sîng-tsiap lâi tsò sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se só͘ hō͘ lín tī Iol-tàn hô tsit pîng ǹg ji̍t tshut ê só͘-tsāi.
English: until Yahweh has given your brothers rest, as he has given you, and they also have possessed the land which Yahweh your God gives them: then you shall return to the land of your possession, and possess it, which Moses the servant of Yahweh gave you beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise.

Tailo: Guá ē pàng-lī Guá ê sán-gia̍p só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, kā in kau tī tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú, in ē tsiâⁿ-tsò in só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k só͘ lia̍h só͘ tshiúⁿ ê tuì-siōng,
English: I will cast off the remnant of my inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am siám-phiah Só͘-lô-móng ông ê bīn, tsáu-khì Ai-gi̍p, tuà tī hia. Ia-lô-ba-am iáu tī Ai-gi̍p ê sî, thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: It happened, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was yet in Egypt, where he had fled from the presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam lived in Egypt,

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè;
English: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

Tailo: Tê-mē-tu-lí-oh kah hiah-ê uá i ê sai-hū nā beh khòng-kò in, ū khui-tîng ê ji̍t-kî, mā ū tsóng-tok, tāi-ke thang tuà hia sio-kò.
English: If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another.

Tailo: Páu-lô kóng, Iô-há-neh kiânn hué-kái ê sé-lé, i kiò I-su-la-el lâng tio̍h sìn tuè i āu-bīn lâi ê hit uī, to̍h-sī tio̍h sìn I-é-su.
English: Paul said, John indeed baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying to the people that they should believe in the one who would come after him, that is, in Jesus.

Tailo: In tuì i kóng, Tshiánn tsē, tha̍k hō͘ guán thiaⁿ. Pa-lo-sih tsiū tha̍k hō͘ in thiaⁿ.
English: They said to him, Sit down now, and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.

Tailo: I tuì i hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kóng, Hit-ê lâng tī tó-uī? Lín ná ē kā i pàng tī hia? Tio̍h tshiánn i lâi tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: He said to his daughters, Where is he? Why is it that you have left the man? Call him, that he may eat bread.

Tailo: Hak-git ê kiáⁿ A-to-nî-iah, khì kìⁿ Só͘-lô-móng ê lāu-bú Bat-se-ba, i mn̄g i kóng, Lí lâi kám sī pîng-an ê? I ìn kóng, Sī.
English: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. She said, Come you peaceably? He said, Peaceably.

Tailo: In suah tio̍h tuà tī suaⁿ-kok ê tshim kheⁿ, tī tē-hia̍t kah tsio̍h-tōng ê lāi-bīn.
English: So that they dwell in frightful valleys, And in holes of the earth and of the rocks.

Tailo: Guá kám-siā Siōng-tè ê sî, kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē pí lín tāi-ke khah tsē.
English: I thank my God, I speak with other languages more than you all.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn, bâi-tsòng tī i ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ. I ê kiáⁿ Lô-bo-àm suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē īng bē i-tit ê to̍k liàp-á phah lí, tī lí ê kha-thâu-u kah kha-thuí, tuì lí ê kha-tsiúⁿ kàu thâu-khak tíng.
English: Yahweh will strike you in the knees, and in the legs, with a sore boil, of which you can not be healed, from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.

Tailo: Lín ing-kai ū thiaⁿ-kuè Ki-tok ê tāi-tsì, koh ū ha̍k-si̍p I ê kà-sī; I-é-su pún-sin to̍h-sī tsin-lí.
English: if indeed you heard him, and were taught in him, even as truth is in Jesus:

Tailo: In ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê só͘ tsò kah I tī tshim-ian só͘ kiâⁿ ê kî-sū.
English: These see Yahweh's works, And his wonders in the deep.

Tailo: Lán ū tsun-tiōng sè-kan ê pē-bú kā lán kuán-kà, hô-hòng sio̍k-lîng Thiⁿ-pē ê kuán-kà, lán kám m̄-sī koh khah tio̍h sūn-ho̍k lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā?
English: Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to chasten us, and we paid them respect. Shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits, and live?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú hó khuán-thāi bān-bîn; I ê liân-bín tì-ìm I só͘ tsō ê it-tshè.
English: Yahweh is good to all. His tender mercies are over all his works.

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p-peh sī Ha-na-nih, i kah i ê kiáⁿ kah i ê hiann-tī, kiōng tsa̍p-jī lâng.
English: for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve:

Tailo: Kí hit uī tshòng-tsō thiⁿ kah thinn-tíng ê mi̍h, tē kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê mi̍h, hái kah hái-.ni̍h ê mi̍h ê hit uī íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tè, lâi tsiù-tsuā kóng, Bē koh iân-tshiân lò͘!
English: and swore by him who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and the things that are in it, the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that there will no longer be delay,

Tailo: I tsi̍t-ē tshut siaⁿ, khong-tiong tsiū ū tsin tsē tsuí kik-tōng; I hō͘ hûn-bū tuì tē-ki̍k tshìng khí-.lâi. I uī-tio̍h lo̍h hō͘, tshòng-tsō sih-nà, I hō͘ hong tuì I ê kim-khò͘ tshut-.lâi.
English: when he utters his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens, and he causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; he makes lightning for the rain, and brings forth the wind out of his treasuries.

Tailo: Ji̍t-lo̍h ê sî, i tsiū tshing-khì, jiân-āu tsiū thang tsia̍h sìng-mi̍h, in-uī tse sī i ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: When the sun is down, he shall be clean; and afterward he shall eat of the holy things, because it is his bread.

Tailo: Guá beh in-uī i kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun kah i ê jîn-sîn ê tsuē-kò, kā in hîng-hua̍t. Guá beh hō͘ Guá só͘ kóng it-tshè ê tsai-hō lîm-kàu in, í-ki̍p Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn kah Iô-tah lâng; tsóng-.sī, in m̄-thiaⁿ.
English: I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring on them, and on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them, but they didn't listen.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì in kóng, Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng, ' Lín ta̍k lâng tio̍h tshah to tī tuā-thuí-.ni̍h, tī iâⁿ tiong óng-lâi, tuì tsit-ê mn̂g kàu hit-ê mn̂g, ta̍k lâng thâi-sí i ê hiann-tī kah i ê tâng-phuāⁿ, í-ki̍p i ê tshù-piⁿ. '
English: He said to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Every man put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and every man kill his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.

Tailo: mā bô koh in-uī ngó͘-siōng kah khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h, í-ki̍p it-tshè ê tsuē-kò, kā pún-sin uè lah-sap. Guá beh kiù in thuat-tshut in só͘-ū tuà ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī in huān tsuē hia; Guá beh kā in tshing-khì; án-ne, in ē tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn; Guá beh tsò in ê Siōng-tè.
English: neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will save them out of all their dwelling places, in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God.

Tailo: Lâng-lâng tuì tshù-piⁿ kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t; īng phô͘-tháⁿ ê tshuì-tûn kah nn̄g khuán ê sim lâi kóng-uē.
English: Everyone lies to his neighbor. They speak with flattering lips, and with a double heart.

Tailo: Thinn ê thiāu tín-tāng, in-uī I ê tsik-pī lâi tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì.
English: The pillars of heaven tremble And are astonished at his rebuke.

Tailo: I-su-la-el tsuân huē-tsiòng tuì Mô͘-se ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.khì.
English: All the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.

Tailo: Sàu-lô khuàⁿ-tio̍h Hui-lī-sū ê kun-ping, tsiū tsin kiaⁿ, sim-kuann pho̍k-pho̍k-tshíng kàu-ki̍k.
English: When Saul saw the army of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart trembled greatly.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, uī-tio̍h mài tik-tsuē hiah-ê lâng, lí khì ô͘-.ni̍h tiò-hî, kā tiò tio̍h ê thâu-tsi̍t bué hî ê tshuì peh-khui, lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê gîn-á. The̍h khì hō͘ in, thè guá kah lí la̍p sìng-tiān-suè.
English: But, lest we cause them to stumble, go to the sea, and cast a hook, and take up the first fish that comes up. When you have opened its mouth, you will find a stater coin. Take that, and give it to them for me and you.

Tailo: Án-ne, bô lâng ē-tàng uá-khò lu̍t-huat lâi kah Siōng-tè kiàn-li̍p hô-hó ê kuan-hē, in-uī king-tián ū kóng, Tuì sìn lâi kah Siōng-tè ū hô-hó kuan-hē ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā. (tsù, HPK 2:4)
English: Now that no man is justified by the law before God is evident, for, The righteous will live by faith.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí ìn guá! In-uī Lí ê tsû-ài sī hó; kiû Lí tsiàu Lí hong-sīng ê tsû-pi ua̍t kuè-lâi khuànn guá!
English: Answer me, Yahweh, for your loving kindness is good. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, turn to me.

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ só͘-ū hó-hàn ê lâng ē lim-tsia̍h lâi kìng-pài; kiàn-nā teh beh sí, teh beh kui thó͘ ê lâng lóng ē kuī-pài tī I ê bīn-tsîng.
English: All the rich ones of the earth shall eat and worship. All those who go down to the dust shall bow before him, Even he who can't keep his soul alive.

Tailo: I tsiū mn̄g hit só͘-tsāi ê lâng kóng, Hit-ê E-ná-ìm lō͘ piⁿ ê tshiong-ki tī tó-uī? In kóng, Tsia bô tshiong-ki.
English: Then he asked the men of her place, saying, Where is the prostitute, that was at Enaim by the road? They said, There has been no prostitute here.

Tailo: Hô ê siang pîng ū ua̍h-miā-tshiū, muí nî kiat tsa̍p-jī pái ê kué-tsí, muí kò-gue̍h kiat tsi̍t pái, tshiū-hio̍h ē-tàng tsò i-tī lia̍t kok ê lō͘-īng.
English: in the middle of its street. On this side of the river and on that was the tree of life, bearing twelve kinds of fruits, yielding its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

Tailo: Guān tshòng-tsō thiⁿ-tē ê Siōng-tsú, ē siúⁿ-sù hok-khì hō͘ lín!
English: Blessed are you by Yahweh, Who made heaven and earth.

Tailo: Guán lóng sī tsi̍t-ê lâng ê kiáⁿ, guán sī láu-si̍t lâng, lí ê lô͘-po̍k m̄-sī tsing-thàm.
English: We are all one man's sons; we are honest men. Your servants are not spies.

Tailo: Tsû-ài ê lâng, Lí īng tsû-ài tuì-thāi i; uân-tsuân ê lâng, Lí īng uân-tsuân tuì-thāi i.
English: With the merciful you will show yourself merciful. With the perfect man, you will show yourself perfect.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá àm-sî kì-liām Lí ê miâ, tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: I have remembered your name, Yahweh, in the night, And I obey your law.

Tailo: Lín ná tshin-tshiūnn sè-kan ê iâm. Iâm nā sit-bī, beh án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ i koh ū kiâm-bī? Nā sit-khì kiâm-bī tsiū bô lō͘-īng ā, tsí ū hiat khì guā-bīn hō͘ lâng thún-ta̍h.
English: You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.

Tailo: Kuân-pìng bô lī-khui Iô-tah, tī-lí tsiá bô lī-khui i nn̄g ki kha ê tiong-kan, ti̍t-kàu Si-lô（ Tsù,Si-lômā thang i̍k-tsò I ê thóng-tī-tsiá Á-sī Tsìn-kòng ê mi̍h ） lâi-lîm; lia̍t pang lóng ē kui i.
English: The scepter will not depart from Judah, Nor the ruler's staff from between his feet, Until he comes to whom it belongs. To him will the obedience of the peoples be.

Tailo: Ū tō͘-tsûn kuè-.khì, tsài ông ê ka-kuàn, tshut-tsāi ông īng. Ông kuè Iol-tàn hô ê sî, Ge-la̍h ê kiáⁿ Si-mí tsiū phak tī ông ê bīn-tsîng,
English: A ferry boat went to bring over the king's household, and to do what he thought good. Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, when he was come over the Jordan.

Tailo: Bat tsò-tsha̍t ê m̄-thang koh thau-the̍h, tio̍h lô-khó͘ tsò-kang lâi tit-tio̍h tsìng-tong ê siu-ji̍p, tsiah ē-tàng pang-tsān khiàm-khueh ê lâng.
English: Let him who stole steal no more; but rather let him labor, working with his hands the thing that is good, that he may have something to give to him who has need.

Tailo: Kú-si̍t mā seⁿ Nim-lo͘t, i tsiâⁿ-tsò sè-tsiūⁿ ing-hiông ê thâu tsi̍t-ê.
English: Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín lâi guá tsia pang-tsān guá, lán thang lâi-khì phah Gi-bóng, in-uī i kah Io-siú-ah í-ki̍p I-su-la-el li̍p hô-iok.
English: Come up to me, and help me, and let us strike Gibeon; for it has made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsit saⁿ-ê lâng tsiū thîng-tsí kóng-uē, bô koh ìn Io-buh, in-uī i ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī.
English: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

Tailo: Lí bat ji̍p-khì bô siū kat-lé ê lâng ê tshù kah in tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: saying, You went in to uncircumcised men, and ate with them!

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú sī uí-tāi-.ê Siōng-tè, sī iâⁿ-kuè só͘-ū sîn-bîng ê tuā kun-ông.
English: For Yahweh is a great God, A great King above all gods.

Tailo: Koh ū lâng kóng, Tse m̄-sī hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin ê lâng só͘ kóng ê uē, kám kóng kuí ē khui tsheⁿ-mê lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu?
English: Others said, These are not the sayings of one possessed by a demon. It isn't possible for a demon to open the eyes of the blind, is it?

Tailo: Guá tio̍h sí tī tsit-ê tē, guá bē-tàng kuè Iol-tàn hô; tsóng-.sī, lín ē-tàng kuè-khì tit-tio̍h hit-ê hó ê tē.
English: but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but you shall go over, and possess that good land.

Tailo: Guá ê lāu-bú, guá ū tsai-hō à! In-uī lí seⁿ guá tsò tsi̍t-ê kah tsuân tē sio-tseⁿ kè-kàu ê lâng. Guá pîng-sî bô īng gîn tsioh lâng lâi the̍h lī-sik, lâng mā bô īng gîn tsioh guá lâi the̍h lī-sik, tsóng-.sī, lâng lóng kā guá tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Woe is me, my mother, that you have borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have not lent, neither have men lent to me; yet everyone of them does curse me.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h sio-tsè ê lō͘-īng ê sì tè toh, sī tsio̍h-thâu phah ê, tn̂g tiú puàⁿ, khuah tiú puàⁿ, kuân tsi̍t tiú; thâi sio-tsè kah tsiah-ê tsè só͘ īng ê khì-kū lóng hē tī hit tíng-bīn.
English: There were four tables for the burnt offering, of hewn stone, a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half broad, and one cubit high; whereupon they laid the instruments with which they killed the burnt offering and the sacrifice.

Tailo: Ū tuì E-hu-laim lâi ê, i ê kin-pún tī A-má-li̍k; Biān-iá-mín tsham tī lí ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan kin-tuè lí, ū siat lu̍t-huat ê, tuì Ma-kil lo̍h-.lâi; ū gia̍h kuái tiám-sǹg jîn-bîn ê sò͘-gia̍h ê, tuì Tse-bú-lông lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Out of Ephraim came down they whose root is in Amalek; After you, Benjamin, among your peoples; Out of Machir came down governors, Out of Zebulun those who handle the marshal's staff.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsa-po͘ lâng tio̍h īng pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè, to̍h-sī tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, khan kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè.
English: He shall bring his trespass offering to Yahweh, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, even a ram for a trespass offering.

Tailo: Lu̍t-huat ê iau-kiû sī, M̄-thang kan-îm, m̄-thang thâi lâng, m̄-thang thau-the̍h, m̄-thang tham-sim. （ Tsù, CAG 20:13-15,17; SBK 5:17-19,21) Tsiah-ê kah kî-tha ê iau-kiû lóng pau-hâm tī Tio̍h thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn thiàⁿ ka-kī （ Tsù, LBK 19:18) tsit kù uē lāi-té.
English: For the commandments, You shall not commit adultery, You shall not murder, You shall not steal, You shall not give false testimony, You shall not covet, and whatever other commandments there are, are all summed up in this saying, namely, You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Siōng-tsú, in-uī I só͘ kiâⁿ ê tsin hián-hik; guān tsit-ê tāi-tsì piàn thuân tī thiⁿ-ē.
English: Sing to Yahweh, for he has done excellent things! Let this be known in all the earth!

Tailo: Kí-khí guá tī hong ê tíng-bīn, hō͘ guá khiâ hong; koh tī tsin thàu ê hong tiong kā guá siau-bia̍t.
English: You lift me up to the wind, and drive me with it. You dissolve me in the storm.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, I-é-lí-miah koh the̍h tsi̍t pún, kau hō͘ Nê-lé-iù ê kiáⁿ — su-kì Pa-lo-sih, i tsiū kā I-é-lí-miah só͘ thuân ê uē siá tī hit lāi-bīn, to̍h-sī Iô-tah ông E-hō͘-iá-kim só͘ sio-khì hit pún só͘-ū ê uē, līng-guā koh thiⁿ tsin tsē luī-sū ê uē.
English: Then took Jeremiah another scroll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and there were added besides to them many like words.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê kiáⁿ Sia-lúm, Sia-lúm ê kiáⁿ Mip-sám, Mip-sám ê kiáⁿ Mi-si-má.
English: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ū si̍t ê thâng, īng sì-kha kiânn ê, lín lóng tio̍h lia̍h-tsò sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: All flying insects that walk on all fours are an abomination to you.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā I-su-la-el tiong, tuì jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng, ē tshut-khì kau-tsiàn ê, lí kah A-lông tio̍h tsiàu in ê kun-tuī lâi tiám-sǹg.
English: from twenty years old and upward, all who are able to go out to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall number them by their divisions.

Tailo: Koh tsō hiah-ê tsō kah tsō tíng ê phûn,
English: He made also the bases, and the basins made he on the bases;

Tailo: Pò͘-pênn ê tiùⁿ só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tn̂g, tsit pîng tsi̍t tiú, hit pîng tsi̍t tiú, tio̍h suê tī huē-bō͘ ê siang pîng lâi kā i jia-.leh.
English: The cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the other side, of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tent on this side and on that side, to cover it.

Tailo: In thâi tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, tsiū tshuā gín-á kàu E-lī ê bīn-tsîng.
English: They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k kui lí tsi̍t-ê lâng; m̄-thang kah pa̍t lâng tsò-hué īng.
English: Let them be for yourself alone, Not for strangers with you.

Tailo: In khuàⁿ-tio̍h Hit lia̍p tsheⁿ, hui-siông huann-hí.
English: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.

Tailo: Má-ná-se kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, bâi-tsòng tī i ka-kī kiong lāi ê hn̂g, to̍h-sī U-tsà ê hn̂g. I ê kiáⁿ Am-móng suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Suà-tsiap i ê sī kuán-lí Biat-tsul tē ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ, A-tsu-buk ê kiáⁿ Nî-hí-miah siu-lí, ti̍t-kàu Ta-bi̍t hûn-bōng ê tuì-bīn, koh kàu khui hó ê tî, í-ki̍p ióng-sū ê tshù.
English: After him repaired Nehemiah the son of Azbuk, the ruler of half the district of Beth Zur, to the place over against the tombs of David, and to the pool that was made, and to the house of the mighty men.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h īng kìng-uì Ki-tok ê sim lâi hō͘-siōng sūn-ho̍k.
English: subjecting yourselves one to another in the fear of Christ.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú pó-tsuân in só͘-ū ê kut, tsi̍t ki mā bô phah-tn̄g.
English: He protects all of his bones. Not one of them is broken.

Tailo: koh īng Siōng-tè ê lîng tshiong-muá i, hō͘ i ū tì-huī, ū tshong-bîng, ū tì-sik, ē tsò ta̍k tsióng ê kang,
English: He has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship;

Tailo: Tē-sì sī I-sé-lī, i kah i ê kiáⁿ kah i ê hiann-tī, kiōng tsa̍p-jī lâng.
English: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve:

Tailo: Lín tsiū tò tńg-.lâi, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu; tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú m̄-thiaⁿ lín ê siann, mā m̄ àⁿ hīⁿ-khang ǹg lín.
English: You returned and wept before Yahweh; but Yahweh didn't listen to your voice, nor gave ear to you.

Tailo: Āu-tiān ê lāi-bīn tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú, kuân jī-tsa̍p tiú, lóng īng sûn-kim lâi an, mā īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ khàm tuâⁿ.
English: Within the oracle was a space of twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in the height of it; and he overlaid it with pure gold: and he covered the altar with cedar.

Tailo: Tio̍h kam-sim lo̍k-ì tsīn lô͘-po̍k ê pún-hūn, tshin-tshiūnn teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú, m̄-sī teh ho̍k-sāi lâng.
English: with good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men;

Tailo: Lín ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h kau-tsiàn kah jiáu-luān ê tāi-tsì, hit sî lín m̄-bián tio̍h-kiaⁿ, in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì it-tīng ē tāi-sing huat-sing, tsóng-.sī, bua̍t-ji̍t bē suî-sî kàu.
English: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don't be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won't come immediately.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kài tio̍h lo̍h-khì kàu Iol-tàn hô, thàng-kàu Iâm-hái uî-tsí. Tsit sì-kho͘-uî ê kài lāi beh tsò lín ê tē.
English: and the border shall go down to the Jordan, and the goings out of it shall be at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to the borders of it round about.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t ē ū ua̍h-tsuí tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm tshut-.lâi, tsi̍t-puàⁿ lâu-khì tang-hái, tsi̍t-puàⁿ lâu-khì se-hái; kuâⁿ-thiⁿ, jua̍h-thinn lóng sī án-ne.
English: It will happen in that day, that living waters will go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea; in summer and in winter will it be.

Tailo: In tsit-má uî-khùn guán ê kha-pō͘; in tsù-ba̍k beh kā guán siak-tó tī tē-.ni̍h.
English: They have now surrounded us in our steps. They set their eyes to cast us down to the earth.

Tailo: I-é-su khui in ê sim-khiàu, hō͘ in ē-tàng liáu-kái king-tián.
English: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ióng-sū ê sò͘-gia̍h kì tī ē-té: Hak-mo-nih lâng Ia-sio-be-am, i sī tsiah-ê tsiòng ê siú-líng, i bat tsò tsi̍t-ē gia̍h tshiuⁿ thâi-sí saⁿ pah lâng.
English: This is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tó-sū beh thìng-hāu Guá; Tal-si-sih ê tsûn-tsiah beh tsò thâu, kā lí ê tsìng kiáⁿ liân in ê kim-gîn, tuì hn̄g-hn̄g tsò tsi̍t-ē tuà-.lâi; tse lóng sī uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê miâ, koh uī-tio̍h I-su-la-el ê sìng ê, in-uī I í-king îng-kng lí.
English: Surely the islands shall wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, to bring your sons from far, their silver and their gold with them, for the name of Yahweh your God, and for the Holy One of Israel, because he has glorified you.

Tailo: I bô tī tsia, I í-king koh-ua̍h ā. Lín tio̍h ē kì-tit I iáu tī Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê sî kā lín kóng ê uē,
English: He isn't here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee,

Tailo: I-é-su kóng, Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ ê ò-pì í-king hō͘ lín tsai, m̄-koh, tuì it-puaⁿ lâng tio̍h īng phì-jū, in-uī ū kì-tsài, In khuànn mā khuànn bē tshing-tshó, thiaⁿ mā thiaⁿ bē bîng-pi̍k. (tsù, ISI 6:9)
English: He said, To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables; that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.'

Tailo: In-uī Guá ê lô͘-po̍k Iâ-kop, Guá só͘ kíng ê I-su-la-el ê iân-kò͘, Guá tsiū kiò lí ê miâ tiàu lí; lí suî-jiân m̄-bat Guá, Guá ū tshing lí ê miâ.
English: For Jacob my servant's sake, and Israel my chosen, I have called you by your name: I have surnamed you, though you have not known me.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê kiânn huí-bia̍t ê suaⁿ, lí khuàⁿ, Guá kah lí tsò tuì-ti̍k, lí huí-bia̍t tsuân tē. Guá beh tshun Guá ê tshiú tī lí ê tíng-bīn, tuì suaⁿ-giâm kā lí tshia lo̍h-.khì, hō͘ lí tsiâⁿ-tsò sio-huí ê suaⁿ.
English: Behold, I am against you, destroying mountain, says Yahweh, which destroys all the earth; and I will stretch out my hand on you, and roll you down from the rocks, and will make you a burnt mountain.

Tailo: Lán bô-lūn tuì Siōng-tè kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h, lóng ē tit-tio̍h, in-uī lán ū tsun-siú I ê bīng-līng, tī I ê bīn-tsîng, tsò I só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì.
English: and whatever we ask, we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do the things that are pleasing in his sight.

Tailo: Tuì kó͘-tsá í-lâi, lí guá í-tsîng hiah-ê sian-ti, tuì tsin tsē só͘-tsāi kah tuā kok ī-giân kau-tsiàn, tsai-hō, un-i̍k.
English: The prophets who have been before me and before you of old prophesied against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsí-put-kò sī khò kuí-ông Be̍h-tse-bul teh kuáⁿ kuí.
English: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.

Tailo: Àm-sî, tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê kiáⁿ sí-.khì, in-uī i khùn ê sî teh-tio̍h i.
English: This woman's child died in the night, because she lay on it.

Tailo: ū gō͘-bān káu-tshing saⁿ-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Simeon, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.

Tailo: Tuā tsuí huàn-lām tī tē-tsiūⁿ sì-tsa̍p kang; tsuí tiòng ná kuân, hō͘ tuā tsûn tshìng phû, tsûn tsiū lī tē.
English: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ark, and it was lifted up above the earth.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Lē-bī lâng tshing-khì ka-kī, tû-khì tsuē, sé in ê saⁿ-khò͘; A-lông kā in hiàn tsò iô-tsè tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, A-lông koh uī in sio̍k-tsuē lâi hō͘ in tshing-khì.
English: The Levites purified themselves from sin, and they washed their clothes; and Aaron offered them for a wave offering before Yahweh; and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them.

Tailo: Lí ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tó tī hái tiong, á-.sī tshin-tshiūnn khùn tī tsûn-uî-tíng ê lâng.
English: Yes, you will be as he who lies down in the midst of the sea, Or as he who lies on top of the rigging:

Tailo: Hái-iûⁿ sio̍k tī I, sī I tshòng-tsō ê; ta tē mā sī I ê tshiú tsō-sîng ê.
English: The sea is his, and he made it. His hands formed the dry land.

Tailo: khì-sak in tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī tshuā in tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê, khì tuè pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, to̍h-sī sì-kho͘-uî hiah-ê jîn-bîn ê sîn-bîng, kā in kuī-pài, lâi jiá Siōng-tsú ê tuā siū-khì.
English: and they forsook Yahweh, the God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the peoples who were round about them, and bowed themselves down to them: and they provoked Yahweh to anger.

Tailo: Guá beh tshuā in lo̍h-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn teh tshuā iûⁿ-á, tshin-tshiūnn tshuā kang ê mî-iûⁿ kah kang ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ, khì-kàu siū thâi ê tē.
English: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with male goats.

Tailo: In khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê siâⁿ teh hué sio ê ian, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, Ū tó tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tsit-ê tuā siâⁿ?
English: and cried out as they looked at the smoke of her burning, saying, What is like the great city?'

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng siū lîng-jio̍k lâi kiàn-siàu! Guān hiah-ê kè-bô͘ hām-hāi guá ê lâng ua̍t tò tńg-khì lâi làu-khuì!
English: Let those who seek after my soul be disappointed and brought to dishonor. Let those who plot my ruin be turned back and confounded.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Ū to-kiàm ē lîm-kàu Kal-tí-ah lâng kah tuà tī Ba-bú-lông ê jîn-bîn, kah in ê kuì-tso̍k, kah in ê tsheⁿ-siōng-ka.
English: A sword is on the Chaldeans, says Yahweh, and on the inhabitants of Babylon, and on her princes, and on her wise men.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h sio-thiànn, in-uī Siōng-tè tāi-sing thiàⁿ lán.
English: We love Him, because he first loved us.

Tailo: In bô koh ta̍k lâng kà-sī in ê tshù-piⁿ kah in ta̍k lâng ê hiann-tī, kóng, ' Lín tio̍h bat Siōng-tsú', in-uī in tuì tuā kàu sè lóng ē bat Guá. In-uī Guá beh sià-bián in ê tsuē-kò, bô koh ē kì-tit in ê tsuē. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: and they shall teach no more every man his neighbor, and every man his brother, saying, Know Yahweh; for they shall all know me, from the least of them to the greatest of them, says Yahweh: for I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin will I remember no more.

Tailo: Keh ji̍t, Pa-si-hul khui tshâ-kê, tháu-pàng I-é-lí-miah. I-é-lí-miah tsiū tuì i kóng, Siōng-tsú m̄-sī kiò lí ê miâ tsò Pa-si-hul, to̍h-sī kiò lí Ma-gol-mi-sa-bí（ Tsù, Hi-bú-lâi bûn ê im-tha̍k, ì-sù sī Sì-kho͘-uî tit lâng kiaⁿ . ）
English: It happened on the next day, that Pashhur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah to him, Yahweh has not called your name Pashhur, but Magormissabib.

Tailo: Lí ū tit-tio̍h bi̍t bô? Tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h tsiū hó; khióng-kiaⁿ lí tsia̍h kuè-thâu suah thò͘ tshut-.lâi.
English: Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, Lest you eat too much, and vomit it.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h tuì Ai-gi̍p ông Huâ-láu kah i ê kûn-tsiòng kóng: Lí hiah tuā-bué, sī tshin-tshiūnn siáⁿ lâng?
English: Son of man, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his multitude: Whom are you like in your greatness?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Jîn-tsú, lí ê jîn-bîn tī tshù-piⁿ, tī tshù mn̂g-kháu teh tâm-lūn lí. Hiann-tī tuì hiann-tī tsò-hué kóng, ' Lâi! Lâi thiaⁿ, thiaⁿ khuànn Siōng-tsú ê uē sī teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h. '
