English: As for you, son of man, the children of your people talk of you by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak one to another, everyone to his brother, saying, Please come and hear what is the word that comes forth from Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng lâi tsò thang buah ê sìng-iû, to̍h-sī tsiàu tsò phang-bī ê tsè-huat lâi tiâu-hô, sī beh tsò thang buah ê sìng-iû.
English: You shall make it a holy anointing oil, a perfume compounded after the art of the perfumer: it shall be a holy anointing oil.

Tailo: Hit sî, I-su-la-el lâng tsat iâⁿ tī Gil-gal. Hit-gue̍h tsa̍p-sì ê-hng, tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê pîng-guân siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: The children of Israel encamped in Gilgal; and they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month at even in the plains of Jericho.

Tailo: Guá buē siū khó͘ í-tsîng ū kiânn bê-lō͘, tsóng-.sī, guá taⁿ tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-lē.
English: Before I was afflicted, I went astray; But now I observe your word.

Tailo: I-é-su tńg-khì tshù-.ni̍h. Tsìng lâng koh tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi, I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ suah bē kò͘-tit tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng, ji̍t, gue̍h kah tsheⁿ lóng ē hián-tshut tiāu-thâu; tī tē-tsiūⁿ, bān-bîn ē in-uī hái-íng huā-huā háu lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ put-an.
English: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;

Tailo: Tē-jī nî tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it, huē-bō͘ tsiū khiā khí-.lâi.
English: It happened in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tent was raised up.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tsá-tsîng iông-ín bān-pang kiânn in ka-kī ê lō͘.
English: who in the generations gone by allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways.

Tailo: Kìng-ài ê Thê-o-hui-lô tāi-jîn, ū tsin tsē lâng í-king kā guán tiong-kan só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì tsíng-lí kì-lio̍k lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,

Tailo: Tsè-si giām hit-ê tshng ê tsìng-thâu, lí khuàⁿ, khuán-sit nā bô tshim-ji̍p-khì phuê-hu lāi, hit tiong-kan mā bô o͘ ê mn̂g, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h kā huān-tio̍h tshng ê tsìng-thâu ê lâng kuaiⁿ-kìm tshit ji̍t.
English: If the priest examines the plague of itching, and behold, its appearance isn't deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, then the priest shall isolate him the person infected with itching seven days.

Tailo: In gâu khui kiong, ē īng tò tshiú, tsiàⁿ tshiú hiat tsio̍h-thâu kah siā tsìnn, lóng sī Biān-iá-mín lâng Sàu-lô ê kâng tso̍k.
English: They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow: they were of Saul's brothers of Benjamin.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h suan-pò͘ kóng, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: In-uī in hō͘ lí pha-hng, tī sì-kho͘-uî kā lí thun-kā, beh hō͘ lí kui tī só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê guā-pang lâng tsò sán-gia̍p, mā hō͘ kāu-uē ê lâng kā lí gī-lūn, hō͘ tsìng lâng kā lí huí-pòng.
English: therefore prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because, even because they have made you desolate, and swallowed you up on every side, that you might be a possession to the residue of the nations, and you are taken up in the lips of talkers, and the evil report of the people;

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm khì Sī-khiàm, in-uī I-su-la-el jîn-bîn lâi-kàu Sī-khiàm, beh kā i siat-li̍p tsò ông.
English: Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel were come to Shechem to make him king.

Tailo: Iā-tsíng ê kah ak-tsuí ê lóng bô tiōng-iàu, hō͘ i tuā tsâng ê Siōng-tè tsiah tiōng-iàu.
English: So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase.

Tailo: Kiû Lí tuì thiⁿ àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn, tuì Lí sìng-kiat îng-kng ê só͘-tsāi khuànn. Lí ê jia̍t-sim kah Lí tuā kuân-lîng-.ê só͘ tsò tī tó-uī? Lí thiàⁿ-thàng ê sim-tn̂g kah liân-bín tuì guá thîng-tsí.
English: Look down from heaven, and see from the habitation of your holiness and of your glory: where are your zeal and your mighty acts? the yearning of your heart and your compassion is restrained toward me.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t phah-sí hit-ê Hui-lī-sū lâng liáu-āu tò tńg-.lâi, in tńg-.lâi ê sî, hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì I-su-la-el ta̍k-ê siâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tshiùⁿ kua, thiàu-bú, īng lin-long-kó͘, īng huann-hí, īng tsàu ga̍k ê khì-kū, lâi gîng-tsiap Sàu-lô ông.
English: It happened as they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tambourines, with joy, and with instruments of music.

Tailo: Kî-tha ê jîn-bîn kau i ê sió-tī A-bi-sai, hō͘ i pâi tīn lâi tí-ti̍k Am-móng lâng.
English: The rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and he put them in array against the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Hō͘ lín thang tī guá ê kok-tō͘ kah guá tsò-hué tsē-toh lim-tsia̍h, koh tsē tuà pó-tsō lâi sím-phuàⁿ I-su-la-el tsa̍p-jī-ê tsi-tso̍k.
English: that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

Tailo: In-uī tsuân-pō͘ lu̍t-huat lóng pau-hâm tī Thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī tsit tiâu kài-bīng lāi-bīn.
English: For the whole law is fulfilled in one word, in this: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

Tailo: Tsiàn-tshia ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iô-sa-huat, tsiū kóng, Tse it-tīng sī I-su-la-el ông! Tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin beh kah i kau-tsiàn, Iô-sa-huat tsiū huah-hiu.
English: It happened, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, Surely it is the king of Israel; and they turned aside to fight against him: and Jehoshaphat cried out.

Tailo: Mā beh kah hiah-ê kah lín tsò-hué ê it-tshè ua̍h-mi̍h, to̍h-sī kah lín tī-.leh ê pue-tsiáu, tsing-seⁿ, í-ki̍p it-tshè ê tsáu-siù; kiàn-nā tuì tuā tsûn tshut-lâi tē-tsiūⁿ ê it-tshè tsáu-siù li̍p-iok.
English: and with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the livestock, and every animal of the earth with you, of all that go out of the ark, even every animal of the earth.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Guá ū kā lín kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī beh hō͘ lín kàu-sî thang ē kì-tit, guá bat kā lín kóng. Guá bô tī khí-thâu to̍h kā lín kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī in-uī guá iáu kah lín tsò-hué.
English: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn't tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kiat-bué ê uē, pâi-lia̍t tī ē-té. I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ Ta-bi̍t kóng, tit-tio̍h sing kuân ê lâng sī Iâ-kop ê Siōng-tè só͘ buah iû ê. Tī I-su-la-el gâu tsò kua ê kóng:
English: Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse says, The man who was raised on high says, The anointed of the God of Jacob, The sweet psalmist of Israel:

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, jîn-bîn tshut-khì kàu tshân-.ni̍h, ū lâng kā A-mí-me-li̍k kóng;
English: It happened on the next day, that the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ná ē tī Ai-gi̍p ê lō͘, kám sī beh lim Si-hool ê tsuí? Lí án-tsuáⁿ tī A-siul ê lō͘, kám sī beh lim tuā hô ê tsuí?
English: Now what have you to do in the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Shihor? or what have you to do in the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?

Tailo: M̄-thang kóng pháiⁿ uē, tian-tò tio̍h kóng ē tsō-tsiū lâng ê hó uē, hō͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng tit-tio̍h lī-ik.
English: Let no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth, but such as is good for building up as the need may be, that it may give grace to those who hear.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū peh-tsa̍p-ê lâng tuì Sī-khiàm, tuì Sī-lô, tuì Sa-má-lī-a lâi, thì tshuì-tshiu, thiah-li̍h saⁿ, ka-kī kuah sing-khu, tshiú the̍h lé-mi̍h kah jú-hiuⁿ, beh kā i tuà kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: that there came men from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even eighty men, having their beards shaved and their clothes torn, and having cut themselves, with meal offerings and frankincense in their hand, to bring them to the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê siann tī tsuí-bīn teh hiáng; îng-kng ê Siōng-tè khí luî tuā-tân, Siōng-tsú kàng-lîm tī hái-iûⁿ ê tíng-bīn.
English: Yahweh's voice is on the waters. The God of glory thunders, even Yahweh on many waters.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī E-sáu ê kiáⁿ-sun, koh tsiah-ê sī in ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ. E-sáu to̍h-sī E-tóm.
English: These are the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and these are their chiefs.

Tailo: ( CAG 34：11-16) Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tshuā lí ji̍p-khì lí só͘ beh khì tit-tio̍h ê tē, tuì lí ê bīn-tsîng kuáⁿ-tshut tsin tsē pang-kok, to̍h-sī Hiat lâng, Gi-ga-sih lâng, A-mô͘-lī lâng, Ka-nân lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, Hi-bī lâng, I-é-bú-suh lâng, tsóng-kiōng tshit kok, lóng pí lí khah tuā koh khah bíng.
English: When Yahweh your God shall bring you into the land where you go to possess it, and shall cast out many nations before you, the Hittite, and the Girgashite, and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, seven nations greater and mightier than you;

Tailo: Lín thang īng tsit-ê tī lín tiong-kan tsò tsìng-kì. Ji̍t-āu lín ê kiáⁿ-sun nā mn̄g lín kóng, ' Tsiah-ê tsio̍h-thâu, tuì lín lâi kóng ū siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-gī? '
English: that this may be a sign among you, that when your children ask in time to come, saying, What do you mean by these stones?

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng siat lô-bāng beh hāi guá, tsóng-.sī, guá bô phian-lī Lí ê kà-sī.
English: The wicked have laid a snare for me, Yet I haven't gone astray from your precepts.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm kā So͘-tóm ông kóng, Guá ū kí thiⁿ-tē ê Tsú — tsì-kuân Siōng-tè Siōng-tsú lâi tsiù-tsuā,
English: Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,

Tailo: Tuā tsuí liáu-āu, nó͘-ah koh-tsài ua̍h saⁿ-pah gō͘-tsa̍p nî.
English: Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ū án-ne kā i kóng, ' Lí ê kiáⁿ-sun ē tshut-guā khì tī guā-kok, tsò lâng ê lô͘-lē siū pháiⁿ khuán-thāi sì-pah nî. ' (tsù, CSK 15:13)
English: God spoke in this way: that his seed would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kik-tōng Hui-lī-sū lâng kah uá-kīn Kú-si̍t ê A-la-puh lâng ê sim, lâi kong-kik Io-lâm.
English: Yahweh stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians who are beside the Ethiopians:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: M̄-thang tsun-thàn pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, to̍h-sī lín sì-kho͘-uî jîn-bîn ê hiah-ê sîn-bîng.
English: You shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples who are round about you;

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê E-hu-laim tiong ê ióng-sū miâ kiò-tsò Tsik-lī, thâi ông ê kiáⁿ Ma-a-se-iah kah kuán-lí ông-kiong ê A-tsu-li-kam, í-ki̍p tsáiⁿ-siòng El-ká-nah.
English: Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king's son, and Azrikam the ruler of the house, and Elkanah who was next to the king.

Tailo: In-uī hit-ê put-huat ê sîn-pì sè-li̍k í-king khai-sí teh ūn-tsok, to̍k-to̍k tio̍h tán kàu tsó͘-tòng ê sè-li̍k thiat-lī liáu-āu tsiah ē huat-sing.
English: For the mystery of lawlessness already works. Only there is one who restrains now, until he is taken out of the way.

Tailo: Guá beh kā guá ê sîn-lîng hē tī lín ê lāi-bīn, lín tsiū ē ua̍h khí-.lâi. Guá kā lín an-tì tī lín ê pún só͘-tsāi, lín tsiū ē tsai Guá — Siōng-tsú ū án-ne kóng, mā ū án-ne lâi tsiânn. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê. '
English: I will put my Spirit in you, and you shall live, and I will place you in your own land: and you shall know that I, Yahweh, have spoken it and performed it, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang tsò gōng lâng, tio̍h bîng-pi̍k siáⁿ-mi̍h sī Tsú ê tsí-ì.
English: Therefore don't be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

Tailo: Tī siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā hō͘ bān-mi̍h ê Siōng-tè kah tuì Pún-tiu Pí-lia̍p-to tsò bí-hó kiàn-tsìng ê Ki-tok I-é-su bīn-tsîng, guá huan-hù lí,
English: I charge you before God, who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate testified the good confession,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, i ê hueh nā tuà-ji̍p huē-bō͘ tī sìng-só͘ sio̍k-tsuē, lóng m̄-thang the̍h-lâi tsia̍h, tio̍h īng hué sio-tiāu.
English: No sin offering, of which any of the blood is brought into the Tent of Meeting to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be eaten: it shall be burned with fire.

Tailo: Tsí-ū īng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê sim lâi thìng-hāu sím-phuàⁿ, í-ki̍p hit-ê teh beh thun-bia̍t kah Siōng-tè tsò tuì-ti̍k ê lâng ê lia̍t-hué.
English: but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries.

Tailo: Guán kah I tī sìng-suaⁿ ê sî, ū tshin-sin thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê siann tuì thinn-tíng huat tshut-.lâi.
English: This voice we heard come out of heaven when we were with him in the holy mountain.

Tailo: Kàu enn-á tshut-sì tē-peh ji̍t, in lâi beh kā enn-á kiânn kat-lé, koh tsiàu i ê lāu-pē ê miâ kā i hō-tsò Tsa-kha-lī-a.
English: It happened on the eighth day, that they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of the father.

Tailo: In kóng, Guān I kuáⁿ-kín kiânn, kuáⁿ-kín uân-sîng I ê só͘ tsò, thang hō͘ guán khuàⁿ-.tio̍h. Guān I-su-la-el ê sìng ê só͘ kè-uē ê pik uá-.lâi, thang hō͘ guán tsai.
English: Who say, Let him make speed, let him hasten his work, that we may see it; And let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw near and come, That we may know it!

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng, Guá kah lín mā kah hiah-ê kah lín tông-tsāi ê ta̍k tsióng ua̍h-mi̍h só͘ li̍p íng sè-tāi ê iok, sī ū kì-hō ê.
English: God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng, siáⁿ lâng khó-liân lí? Siáⁿ lâng uī lí pi-siong? Siáⁿ lâng ua̍t tńg-sin lâi kā lí tshíng-an?
English: For who will have pity on you, Jerusalem? or who will bemoan you? or who will turn aside to ask of your welfare?

Tailo: Guán só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, sì-kho͘-uî ê guā-pang lâng lóng tio̍h-kiaⁿ, ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò sī sit-pāi, in-uī khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê kang-sū tsò-tsiâⁿ, sī tshut tī lán ê Siōng-tè.
English: It happened, when all our enemies heard of it, that all the nations that were about us feared, and were much cast down in their own eyes; for they perceived that this work was worked of our God.

Tailo: Hit bué tuā bué liông tsiū hō͘ lâng hiat tshut-.lâi; i to̍h-sī hit bué lāu- tsuâ, kiò-tsò Mô͘-kuí, mā kiò-tsò Sa-tán, tsuân sè-kài lóng siū i bê-hi̍k. I hông hiat lo̍h-lâi tē-tsiūⁿ, i ê sù-tsiá mā kah i tsò-hué hông hiat lo̍h-.lâi.
English: The great dragon was thrown down, the old serpent, he who is called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world. He was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kā Mô͘-se kóng, Lí tio̍h lī-khui guá-.khì, lí tio̍h ka-kī kín-sīn, m̄-thang koh-tsài lâi kìnn guá ê bīn, in-uī lí koh-tsài kìnn guá ê bīn hit ji̍t, lí ē sí.
English: Pharaoh said to him, Get away from me! Be careful to see my face no more; for in the day you see my face you shall die!

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, o͘-àm jia-khàm tsuân tē, tuā o͘-àm jia-khàm lia̍t kok; tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú beh hián-hiān tsiò lí, I ê îng-kng beh tshut-hiān tī lí ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: For, behold, darkness shall cover the earth, and gross darkness the peoples; but Yahweh will arise on you, and his glory shall be seen on you.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kah tuè i ê lâng khì Ke-i-lah kah Hui-lī-sū lâng kau-tsiàn, tshiúⁿ in ê tsing-seⁿ, kā in thâi-sí tsin tsē lâng. Án-ne, Ta-bi̍t tsín-kiù tuà tī Ke-i-lah ê jîn-bîn.
English: David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their livestock, and killed them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.

Tailo: In ê sin-si ē tó tī tuā siâⁿ ê ke-lō͘; lâng kā tsit-ê siâⁿ-tshī pí-phīng tsò So͘-tóm kah Ai-gi̍p, in ê Tsú mā tī hia hō͘ lâng tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: Their dead bodies will be in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also their Lord was crucified.

Tailo: Go-mel ê kiáⁿ, A-si-ke-nah, Lī-huat, To-kal-mah.
English: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

Tailo: Nā tsiàu i khuànn, tshng í-king thîng-tsí, hit tiong-kan nā huat o͘ ê mn̂g, tshng kì-jiân hó, hit-ê lâng sī tshing-khì, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò tshing-khì.
English: But if in his eyes the itch is arrested, and black hair has grown in it; the itch is healed, he is clean. The priest shall pronounce him clean.

Tailo: In koh tuā-siaⁿ huah, Kā I tìng si̍p-jī-kè!
English: They cried out again, Crucify him!

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê si. )M̄-thang in-uī tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng lâi sim-lāi put-pîng, mā m̄-thang uàn-tò͘ hîng-uî put-gī ê lâng.
English: Don't fret because of evil-doers, Neither be envious against those who work unrighteousness.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín í-king kái-piàn, kiânn Guá só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò tsìng-ti̍t ê tāi-tsì; ta̍k lâng tuì tshù-piⁿ suan-pò͘ tháu-pàng, koh tī īng Guá ê miâ lâi tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng li̍p-iok.
English: You were now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbor; and you had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:

Tailo: Tio̍h kah huann-hí ê lâng tsò-hué huann-hí kah pi-siong ê lâng tsò-hué pi-siong.
English: Rejoice with those who rejoice. Weep with those who weep.

Tailo: ' Lí tio̍h kā I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn kóng, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā Guá ê sìng-só͘ uè lah-sap, to̍h-sī lín ê sè-li̍k só͘ khua-kháu, lín ê ba̍k-tsiu só͘ ì-ài, lín ê sim só͘ thiàⁿ-sioh ê; jî-tshiánn lín só͘ lâu tī hia ê kiáⁿ-jî ē tó tī to hā.
English: Speak to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the desire of your eyes, and that which your soul pities; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind shall fall by the sword.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ka-kī kín-sīn, mā tio̍h tsiàu-kò͘ Sìng Sîn kau-tài lín tsò kàm-tok ê iûⁿ-kûn, lâi bo̍k-ióng Siōng-tè ê kàu-huē, to̍h-sī I īng ka-kī ê hueh só͘ sio̍k-huê ê.
English: Take heed, therefore, to yourselves, and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the assembly of the Lord and God which he purchased with his own blood.

Tailo: Lâng nā kā lô͘-po̍k tuì sè-hàn to̍h khuán-thāi kuè-thâu; tsit-ê lô͘-po̍k kàu lō͘-bué ē piàn-tsò i ê kiáⁿ lâi tit tsâi-sán.
English: He who pampers his servant from youth Will have him become a son in the end.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ tsiàu án-ne tsò, hō͘ kûn-tsiòng lóng tsē lo̍h-.khì.
English: They did so, and made them all sit down.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng beh kā in siong-hāi, in ē tuì tshuì thò͘ hué tshut-.lâi, kā tuì-ti̍k sio-bia̍t; nā ū lâng ài beh hāi in, it-tīng tshin-tshiūnn ē án-ne siū sat-hāi.
English: If anyone desires to harm them, fire proceeds out of their mouth and devours their enemies. If anyone desires to harm them, he must be killed in this way.

Tailo: In kiám-tshái ē thiaⁿ, kiám-tshái m̄-thiaⁿ, ( in-uī in sī puē-gi̍k ê ke ), in ē tsai tī in tiong-kan it-tīng bat ū sian-ti.
English: They, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear, (for they are a rebellious house), yet shall know that there has been a prophet among them.

Tailo: lóng sio kiat-liân, liân tsò tsi̍t-ê, bē-tàng hun-khui.
English: They are joined one to another; They stick together, so that they can't be pulled apart.

Tailo: In-uī guá bē-hiáu kā lâng phô͘-tháⁿ; guá nā ū án-ne tsò, tshòng-tsō guá ê Siōng-tè ē tsin kín kā guá tû-bia̍t.
English: For I don't know how to give flattering titles; Or else my Maker would soon take me away.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông — E-hō͘-iá-kim tsē-uī tē-saⁿ nî, Ba-bú-lông ông — Nep-kat-ne-tsal lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, uî siâⁿ lâi kong-kik.
English: In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Jerusalem, and besieged it.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, hiah-ê sì-suàⁿ ê lâng khì ta̍k só͘-tsāi thuân hok-im.
English: Therefore those who were scattered abroad went around preaching the word.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ guá ê sim kui-ǹg Lí ê kà-sī, bô àm put-gī ê tsîⁿ-tsâi.
English: Turn my heart toward your statutes, Not toward selfish gain.

Tailo: In-uī lín kóng: Pà-ông ê tshù tī tó-uī? Pháiⁿ lâng pîng-sî tuà ê tshù tī tó-uī?
English: For you say, Where is the house of the prince? Where is the tent in which the wicked lived?'

Tailo: Ông uī-tio̍h Ap-nel tshiùnn ai-ko: Ap-nel ná ē tshin-tshiūnn gōng lâng ê sí?
English: The king lamented for Abner, and said, Should Abner die as a fool dies?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī in ê bīn-tsîng, tuì tshiûⁿ-piah iah khang, tuì hit khang tuà mi̍h-kiāⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Dig you through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lâng nā tsun-siú Siōng-tè ê tō-lí, i tuì Siōng-tè ê thiàⁿ tsiū uân-tsuân si̍t-tsāi; án-ne, lán tsiū ē-tàng khak-sìn lán ū tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì teh sing-ua̍h.
English: But whoever keeps his word, God's love has most assuredly been perfected in him. This is how we know that we are in him:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá tuì i kóng, Lí ná ē saⁿ pái phah lí ê lî-á? Lí khuàⁿ, guá tshut-lâi tí-ti̍k lí, in-uī lí tī guá ê bīn-tsîng só͘ kiâⁿ ê sī puē-gi̍k.
English: The angel of Yahweh said to him, Why have you struck your donkey these three times? behold, I am come forth for an adversary, because your way is perverse before me:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá koh tsìn-tsîng khì, khiā tī e̍h-e̍h ê só͘-tsāi, siang pîng bô lō͘ thang uat.
English: The angel of Yahweh went further, and stood in a narrow place, where was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm kā Ló-toh kóng, Lí guá m̄-thang uan-ke, lí ê bo̍k-tsiá kah guá ê bo̍k-tsiá mā m̄-thang uan-ke, in-uī lán sī kut-jio̍k tsì-tshin.
English: Abram said to Lot, Please, let there be no strife between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; for we are relatives.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, I-é-su tuì be̍h-hn̂g king-kuè. I ê bûn-tô͘ ná kiâⁿ ná tiah be̍h-suī.
English: It happened that he was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè nā bô kā tsū-jiân seⁿ tshut-.lâi ê tshiū-ki lâu lo̍h-.lâi, khó-lîng mā bô it-tīng ē kā lín lâu lo̍h-.lâi.
English: for if God didn't spare the natural branches, neither will he spare you.

Tailo: Tuì-ti̍k sí ê tsin tsē, in-uī tsit-ê kau-tsiàn sī tuì Siōng-tè. In tsiū tuà tī tuì-ti̍k ê tē, ti̍t-kàu in siū lia̍h ê sî.
English: For there fell many slain, because the war was of God. They lived in their place until the captivity.

Tailo: In ê kiáⁿ-jî huâi-liām in tī kuân suaⁿ tíng, tsheⁿ-tshuì tshiū piⁿ ê tuâⁿ kah ngó͘-siōng.
English: while their children remember their altars and their Asherim by the green trees on the high hills.

Tailo: Tsit king tiān suî-jiân tsin kuân, tsiong-lâi king-kuè ê lâng ē tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, kóng, ' Siōng-tsú ná ē án-ne khuán-thāi tsit-ê tē, tsit king tiān? '
English: This house, which is so high, everyone who passes by it shall be astonished, and shall say, Why has Yahweh done thus to this land, and to this house?

Tailo: Tsa-po͘ lâng bô ing-kai tà thâu-kin, in-uī i sī Siōng-tè ê hîng-siōng kah îng-kng; m̄-koh, tsa-bó͘ lâng sī tsa-po͘ lâng ê îng-kng.
English: For a man indeed ought not to have his head covered, because he is the image and glory of God, but the woman is the glory of the man.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lim tsit-kháu tséⁿ-tsuí ê lâng lóng ē koh tshuì-ta,
English: Jesus answered her, Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again,

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng tsiū tuì Iol-tàn hô hit tiâu lō͘ khì jiok in, lâi-kàu lō͘-thâu; jiok in ê lâng tsi̍t-ē tshut-.khì, siâⁿ mn̂g tsiū kuainn khí-.lâi.
English: The men pursued after them the way to the Jordan to the fords: and as soon as those who pursued after them were gone out, they shut the gate.

Tailo: Khiā tī piⁿ-á ê lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kóng, I teh kiò E-li-iah.
English: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said, This man is calling Elijah.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá beh tû-khì E-hu-laim ê tsiàn-tshia kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsiàn-bé, kau-tsiàn ê kiong mā beh tû-.khì. I beh tuì lia̍t kok thuân hô-pîng; i ê kuân-pìng ē tuì tsit-ê hái kàu hit-ê hái, tuì tuā hô kàu tē-ki̍k.
English: I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, And the horse from Jerusalem; And the battle bow will be cut off; And he will speak peace to the nations: And his dominion will be from sea to sea, And from the River to the ends of the earth.

Tailo: Ba-nî ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong-kan, ū Me-siu-lám, Mal-luk, A-ta-iah, Ia-siup, Sia-al kah E-li-mo͘t.
English: Of the sons of Bani: Meshullam, Malluch, and Adaiah, Jashub, and Sheal, Jeremoth.

Tailo: Lín í-tsîng só͘ tuà ê Ai-gi̍p tē, hit uī ê lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê lín m̄-thang tsun-thàn in lâi kiâⁿ, Guá beh tshuā lín kàu Ka-nân tē, hit uī ê lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lín mā m̄-thang tsun-thàn in lâi kiâⁿ, mā m̄-thang tsiàu in ê kui-lē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: You shall not do as they do in the land of Egypt, where you lived: and you shall not do as they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you; neither shall you walk in their statutes.

Tailo: Saⁿ ji̍t āu tsiah tī sìng-tiān lāi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su tsē tī hiah-ê kàu-su tiong-kan, mā teh thiaⁿ, mā teh mn̄g.
English: It happened after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both listening to them, and asking them questions.

Tailo: Tī Io̍p-pe ū tsi̍t-ê lú sìn-tô͘, miâ kiò-tsò Ta-bí-thah, Hi-la̍h uē kiò-tsò Tol-ka, to̍h-sī lo̍k-á ê ì-sù. I tsò tsin tsē hó tāi-tsì, koh tsín-tsè sàn-tshiah lâng.
English: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which when translated, means Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and acts of mercy which she did.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tuè Om-lī ê jîn-bîn iâⁿ-kuè tuè Ke-na̍t ê kiáⁿ Thê-pí-nî ê lâng. Thê-pí-nî sí liáu-āu, Om-lī tsiū tsò ông.
English: But the people who followed Omri prevailed against the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.

Tailo: Hit sî, I-é-su iáu-buē ji̍p-khì tsng-thâu, iáu tī Mal-tha gîng-tsiap I ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha met him.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì hit-ê lâng kah i ê ke pìⁿ-bīn, kā i kah só͘-ū tuè i kiânn siâ-îm ê, to̍h-sī kah Mô͘-lo̍k kiânn siâ-îm ê, lóng kā i tuì jîn-bîn tiong-kan tsián-tû.
English: then I will set my face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all who play the prostitute after him, to play the prostitute with Molech, from among their people.

Tailo: Guān Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè kah lán tông-tsāi, tshin-tshiūnn I kah lán ê tsó͘-sian tông-tsāi. Guān I bô lī-khui lán, bô pàng-sak lán,
English: Yahweh our God be with us, as he was with our fathers: let him not leave us, nor forsake us;

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lí tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú! Si-óng, lí tio̍h o-ló lí ê Siōng-tè!
English: Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!

Tailo: Tû-khì gîn ê tse-tái, gîn-tshiūⁿ tsiah ē-tàng tsò-tshut khì-kū;
English: Take away the dross from the silver, And material comes out for the refiner;

Tailo: Bān-bîn tī I ê bīn-tsîng tshin-tshiūnn bô mi̍h, hō͘ I khuànn hui-siông bô, to̍h-sī khang-khang.
English: All the nations are like nothing before him. They are regarded by him as less than nothing, and vanity.

Tailo: Tē tī an-hioh-nî só͘ tshut ê beh hō͘ lín tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h, i ê tshut-sán lóng beh hō͘ lí kah lí ê lô͘-po̍k, lí ê lú-pī, lí ê tshiàⁿ-kang, í-ki̍p kià-kha tī lí hia ê tshut-guā lâng,
English: The Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you; for yourself, for your servant, for your maid, for your hired servant, and for your stranger, who lives as a foreigner with you.

Tailo: Koh kā Siōng-tsú tiān lāi ê pó-bu̍t kah ông-kiong ê pó-bu̍t, lóng tuì hia the̍h-.khì, koh kā I-su-la-el ông Só͘-lô-móng só͘ tsō Siōng-tsú tiān lāi ê kim-khì lóng phah-phuà, tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ kóng ê uē;
English: He carried out there all the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king's house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold, which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of Yahweh, as Yahweh had said.

Tailo: Ia-be-si ê kiáⁿ Sia-lúm puē-puān i, tī jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng kā i phah, kā i thâi, tshuàn i ê uī.
English: Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and struck him before the people, and killed him, and reigned in his place.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò tuâⁿ, tn̂g gō͘ tiú, khuah gō͘ tiú, tsit-ê tuâⁿ sī sì-kak-hîng ê, kuân saⁿ tiú.
English: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and its height shall be three cubits.

Tailo: I kiânn tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Guá kóng: I ē kui-uá guá, tsóng-.sī, i bô, i kan-tsà ê sió-muē — Iô-tah mā ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: I said after she had done all these things, She will return to me; but she didn't return: and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.

Tailo: Pài ngó͘-siōng, kiânn siâ-su̍t, kiat uan-siû, sio-tseⁿ, uàn-hūn, siū-khì, kiat-tóng, hun-phài, tsū-su,
English: idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousies, outbursts of anger, rivalries, divisions, heresies,

Tailo: Tī pak pîng, tsiàu in ê kun-tuī sī Tàn ê iâⁿ ê tuā kî, A-mí-siá-tái ê kiáⁿ A-hí-e-tsel tsò Tàn ê lâng ê siú-líng.
English: On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan according to their divisions: and the prince of the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

Tailo: Io-ap phak tī thô͘-kha lâi pài, kā ông tsiok-siā, Io-ap kóng, Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, ông kì-jiân kiânn lí ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ kiû ê, kin-á-ji̍t lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsai-iáⁿ guá ū tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián.
English: Joab fell to the ground on his face, and did obeisance, and blessed the king: and Joab said, Today your servant knows that I have found favor in your sight, my lord, king, in that the king has performed the request of his servant.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: I-é-su bô-lūn ji̍p-khì siáⁿ-mi̍h tsng-thâu, siâⁿ-tshī, hiong-tshuan, lâng tsiū kā pēnn-lâng khǹg tuà ke-lō͘, kiû I-é-su tsì-tsió hō͘ in bong I ê saⁿ-á-ki ê tshiu. Só͘-ū bong-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: Wherever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and begged him that they might touch just the fringe of his garment; and as many as touched him were made well.

Tailo: I tshuā I ê tsú-bîn huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí tshut-.lâi, tshuā I kíng-suán ê tsú-bîn tshiùnn huann-hí ê kua tshut-.lâi.
English: He brought forth his people with joy, His chosen with singing.

Tailo: Kui mê thǹg-pak-theh bô tshīng saⁿ tó-.leh; hân-líng bô kah phuē.
English: They lie all night naked without clothing, And have no covering in the cold.

Tailo: Tng in jua̍h-.lâng ê sî, Guá beh uī in pān tsiú-toh, hō͘ i tsiú-tsuì, hō͘ i khuài-lo̍k, hō͘ i kú-tn̂g teh khùn, íng-uán bô tsing-sîn. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē hō͘ lí tē-tsiūⁿ ê hō͘ piàn-tsò thô͘-hún, piàn-tsò sua, i ē tuì thiⁿ lo̍h tī lí, it-ti̍t kàu lí bia̍t-bông.
English: Yahweh will make the rain of your land powder and dust: from the sky shall it come down on you, until you are destroyed.

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê si-kua, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Guān Siōng-tè khí-.lâi, hō͘ I ê tuì-ti̍k sì-suàⁿ; hō͘ uàn-hūn I ê lâng tuì I ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu.
English: Let God arise! Let his enemies be scattered! Let them who hate him also flee before him.

Tailo: Sī tshut sió-be̍h, tuā-be̍h, phû-tô tshiū, bû-hua-kó tshiū kah sia̍h-liû tshiū ê tē, mā sī tshut kaⁿ-ná tshiū kah bi̍t ê tē.
English: a land of wheat and barley, and vines and fig trees and pomegranates; a land of olive trees and honey;

Tailo: I tuì Thiⁿ-pē Siōng-tè tit-tio̍h tsun-kuì kah îng-kng ê sî, hit uī tsì-tsun koh îng-kng ê Siōng-tè ū tshut siaⁿ tuì I kóng, Tsit-ê sī guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê Kiáⁿ, I sī guá tsin-tsiàⁿ kah-ì ê.
English: For he received from God the Father honor and glory, when the voice came to him from the Majestic Glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Tailo: Tī i ù-uè ê sî-kan, kiàn-nā i só͘ tó ê mi̍h lóng sī bô tshing-khì, kiàn-nā i só͘ tsē ê mi̍h mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Everything that she lies on in her impurity shall be unclean. Everything also that she sits on shall be unclean.

Tailo: Kā pân lāi ê iû thîn tī i ê thâu-khak, kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Guá īng iû kā lí buah, hō͘ lí tsò I-su-la-el ê ông. ' Lí tsiū tio̍h khui mn̂g tô-tsáu, m̄-thang iân-tshiân.
English: Then take the vial of oil, and pour it on his head, and say, Thus says Yahweh, I have anointed you king over Israel. Then open the door, and flee, and don't wait.

Tailo: Si-miān kā in tsiok-hok, koh tuì I-é-su ê lāu-bú Mâ-lí-ah kóng, Tsit-ê enn-á siū siat-li̍p, sī beh hō͘ I-su-la-el tiong tsin tsē lâng pua̍h-tó, tsin tsē lâng peh khí-.lâi, mā tsò siū kong-kik ê kì-hō;
English: and Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi tsiū-kīn Guá; tio̍h thiaⁿ, lín ê sim-sîn tsiū ē ua̍h. Guá beh kah lín li̍p íng-uán ê iok, to̍h-sī Guá ìng-ín beh hō͘ Ta-bi̍t kian-kò͘ ê un-huī.
English: Turn your ear, and come to me; hear, and your soul shall live: and I will make an everlasting covenant with you, even the sure mercies of David.

Tailo: Lí tsò I-su-la-el lâng ê jîn-kháu tiâu-tsa, tsiàu in tiong-kan ū tsu-keh ê ting-kì, lí teh sǹg ê sî, in ta̍k lâng tio̍h uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā īng sio̍k-huê ê kè-tsînn hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, bián-tit lí teh sǹg ê sî, tī in tiong-kan ū tsai-hō.
English: When you take a census of the children of Israel, according to those who are numbered among them, then each man shall give a ransom for his soul to Yahweh, when you number them; that there be no plague among them when you number them.

Tailo: Sí ê hô͘-sîn ē hō͘ tsò phang-liāu ê iû huat-tshut tshàu-bī; án-ne, tsi̍t-tiám-á ê gû-gōng mā ē pāi-huāi tuā tì-huī kah tsun-kuì.
English: Dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to send forth an evil odor; so does a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor.

Tailo: Ga̍t tsiah-ê kiáⁿ, tsiàu ka-tso̍k; sio̍k Sé-hun ê, ū Sé-hun tso̍k; sio̍k Hak-gī ê, ū Hak-gī tso̍k; sio̍k Siu-nî ê, ū Siu-nî tso̍k;
English: The sons of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites;

Tailo: Hô-hòng tsiah-ê lâng bô thau-the̍h biō lāi ê mi̍h, mā bô huí-pòng lán ê lú-sîn, lín kìng-jiân thua in lâi tsia.
English: For you have brought these men here, who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess.

Tailo: Hit tong-sî, guá ê tsú m̄-bián uī-tio̍h lâu bô tsuē ê lâng ê hueh, sin ka-kī ê uan, tì-sú ū siáⁿ-mi̍h iu-būn á-.sī sim-lāi ka-kī tsik-pī. Siōng-tsú sù-hok hō͘ guá ê tsú ê sî, kiû lí kì-liām lí ê lú-pī.
English: that this shall be no grief to you, nor offense of heart to my lord, either that you have shed blood without cause, or that my lord has avenged himself. When Yahweh shall have dealt well with my lord, then remember your handmaid.

Tailo: Án-ne, guán tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ bīn-tuì sí-bông, lín khiok in-uī án-ne tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā.
English: So then death works in us, but life in you.

Tailo: Guá ê sim nā siūⁿ-khí tsiah-ê, tī guá ê pak lāi tsiū ut-būn.
English: My soul still remembers them, and is bowed down within me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, in-uī Lí ê sím-phuàⁿ, Si-óng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū huann-hí; Iô-tah ê siâⁿ mā lóng khuài-lo̍k.
English: Zion heard and was glad. The daughters of Judah rejoiced, Because of your judgments, Yahweh.

Tailo: In tuì tshâ-thâu kóng, ' Lí sī guá ê pē'; tuì tsio̍h-thâu kóng, ' Lí sī seⁿ guá ê'. In īng kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ ǹg Guá, bô īng bīn ǹg Guá; kàu tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê sî tsiah kóng, ' Khí-.lâi, lâi kiù guán! '
English: who tell a stock, You are my father; and to a stone, You have brought me forth: for they have turned their back to me, and not their face; but in the time of their trouble they will say, Arise, and save us.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kah i ê bó͘ E-bah tâng-pâng, E-bah tsiū huâi-īn seⁿ Kai-ín, kóng, Guá tuì Siōng-tsú ê pó-siú tit-tio̍h kiáⁿ.
English: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, I have gotten a man with Yahweh's help.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h kā si-un-só͘ an-tì tī tsì-sìng-só͘ lāi ê huat-kuī tíng-bīn.
English: You shall put the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.

Tailo: Ba̍k-thâu kuân, sim kiau-ngō͘, í-ki̍p pháiⁿ lâng tsū-ko lóng sī tsuē.
English: A high look, and a proud heart, The lamp of the wicked, is sin.

Tailo: Tse-ka-lí-ah kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, lóng kì tī I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k.
English: Now the rest of the acts of Zechariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

Tailo: Mā tsò iù-tē pò͘ ê bō-á kah iù-tē pò͘ suí-suí pau thâu-khak ê kin, īng kuè-pháng ê iù-tē pò͘ tsò khò͘.
English: and the turban of fine linen, and the linen headbands of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twined linen,

Tailo: In-uī I-é-su kóng tsiah-ê uē, Iô-tá-iah lâng koh khí hun-lia̍t.
English: Therefore a division arose again among the Jews because of these words.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i tsiū tsiú-kuáⁿ. Kàu-taⁿ í-king peh-tsa̍p-sì huè, lóng bô lī-khui sìng-tiān, mê-ji̍t kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tè.
English: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn't depart from the temple, worshipping with fastings and petitions night and day.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú tuì I-su-la-el lâng tuā siū-khì, kuáⁿ in lī-khui I ê bīn-tsîng, to̍k-to̍k tshun Iô-tah tsi̍t tsi-tso̍k niā-niā.
English: Therefore Yahweh was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.

Tailo: Lí ê sim-lāi m̄-thang luân-bō͘ i ê suí-sik, mā m̄-thang hō͘ i ê ba̍k-tsiu ín-iú khì.
English: Don't lust after her beauty in your heart, Neither let her captivate you with her eyelids.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsú-lâng ē lâi kā lí kóng, ' Tshiánn niū uī hō͘ tsit-ê lâng', lí ē kám-kak kiàn-siàu, suah tio̍h khì tsē tī siōng bué ê uī.
English: and he who invited both of you would come and tell you, Make room for this person.' Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.

Tailo: Līng-guā tī Má-ná-se kiáⁿ-sun ê sán-gia̍p tiong, ū hun-pia̍t ê siâⁿ; hiah-ê siâⁿ kah i ê tsng-thâu, lóng pun hō͘ E-hu-laim lâng.
English: together with the cities which were set apart for the children of Ephraim in the midst of the inheritance of the children of Manasseh, all the cities with their villages.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ū ua̍h-miā ê bah, to̍h-sī ū kâⁿ hueh ê, lín m̄-thang tsia̍h.
English: But flesh with the life of it, the blood of it, you shall not eat.

Tailo: Ta̍k tè pán tio̍h ū nn̄g-ê sún sio-tuì pâi, huē-bō͘ só͘-ū ê pán lóng tio̍h tsiàu án-ne tsò.
English: There shall be two tenons in each board, joined to one another: thus shall you make for all the boards of the tent.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h kā i giām, lí khuàⁿ, phuê-hu nā ū só͘-tsāi tsíng kah pe̍h-pe̍h, tì-sú i ê mn̂g piàn-pe̍h, tī tsíng ê só͘-tsāi khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiah-bah,
English: and the priest shall examine him. Behold, if there is a white rising in the skin, and it has turned the hair white, and there is raw flesh in the rising,

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī Lē-bī ê ta̍k tso̍k; ū Lip-nî tso̍k, He-bú-lông tso̍k, Má-lī tso̍k, Mu-sih tso̍k, Khó-la̍h tso̍k. Ko-hat seⁿ Àm-lâm.
English: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. Kohath became the father of Amram.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tshīng ù-uè ê saⁿ, khiā tī sù-tsiá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and was standing before the angel.

Tailo: No-gah, Ne-hi̍k, Ia-hui-iah,
English: and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

Tailo: tio̍h tshut-huat ua̍t-tńg kàu A-mô͘-lī lâng ê suaⁿ-tē kah kīn-uá hia ê ta̍k só͘-tsāi, tī A-la̍h-bah, tī suaⁿ-tē, tī pîng-guân, tī lâm-hong, iân hái it-tài, Ka-nân lâng ê tē kah Le-ba-nòng, koh kàu tuā hô, to̍h-sī Iu-hu-la-té tuā hô.
English: turn, and take your journey, and go to the hill country of the Amorites, and to all the places near there, in the Arabah, in the hill country, and in the lowland, and in the South, and by the seashore, the land of the Canaanites, and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khuànn Si-óng, lán siú sìng-tseh ê siâⁿ; lí ê ba̍k-tsiu ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò an-tsīng ê tshù-the̍h, tsò bô î-suá ê pò͘-pênn; i ê khit íng bô pue̍h-tshut, i ê soh lóng bô tn̄g.
English: Look at Zion, the city of our appointed festivals. Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet habitation, A tent that won't be removed. Its stakes will never be plucked up, Nor will any of its cords be broken.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, kàu ji̍t-āu, Guá beh hō͘ Ê-lám siū lia̍h ê lâng tò tńg-.lâi. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: But it shall happen in the latter days, that I will bring back the captivity of Elam, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Tse tī lín it-tshè tuà ê só͘-tsāi beh tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi ê lu̍t-lē.
English: These things shall be for a statute and ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Tailo: （Peh kiā-á ê si. ）Guá tī guî-kip ê sî kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú, I tsiū ìn-tap guá.
English: In my distress, I cried to Yahweh. He answered me.

Tailo: Iûⁿ-ko the̍h-tio̍h hit kńg tsheh ê sî, hit sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h kah jī-tsa̍p sì ê tiúⁿ-ló, lóng phak tī iûⁿ-ko ê bīn-tsîng, ta̍k-ê ū the̍h khîm kah té hiuⁿ muá-muá ê kim lô͘; hiah-ê hiuⁿ to̍h-sī Siōng-tè tsú-bîn ê kî-tó.
English: Now when he had taken the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each one having a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.

Tailo: I siā-tshut I ê tsìnn, hō͘ tuì-ti̍k sì-suàⁿ; huat-tshut tsin tsē sih-nà hō͘ in hūn-luān.
English: He sent out his arrows, and scattered them; Yes, great lightning bolts, and routed them.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng tsù-ba̍k kā i khuànn, tiām-tiām bô kóng-uē, ài beh tsai Siōng-tsú ū siúⁿ-sù i sūn-sī ê lō͘ á-bô.
English: The man looked steadfastly at her, remaining silent, to know whether Yahweh had made his journey prosperous or not.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn tsit-má tsin tsē, lín kìng-jiân beh kiò in mài tsò-kang.
English: Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land are now many, and you make them rest from their burdens.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh tshe piàⁿ tsiú ê khì i hia, kā i piàⁿ tshut-.lâi, piàⁿ khang i ê khì-kū, phah-phuà i ê tsiú-àng.
English: Therefore, behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that I will send to him those who pour off, and they shall pour him off; and they shall empty his vessels, and break their bottles in pieces.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lú-pī ê kiáⁿ, Guá mā beh hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t kok, in-uī i mā sī lí seⁿ ê.
English: I will also make a nation of the son of the handmaid, because he is your seed.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá kā in tû-khì it-tshè guā-pang lâng ê khuán-sit, koh siat-li̍p tsè-si kah Lē-bī lâng ê pan, kok tsīn in ê tsit,
English: Thus cleansed I them from all foreigners, and appointed charges for the priests and for the Levites, everyone in his work;

Tailo: Siat tsi̍t-pah khòng gō͘ huè, seⁿ Ê-nó͘-suh.
English: Seth lived one hundred five years, and became the father of Enosh.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm tsiū tshun tshiú gia̍h to, beh thâi i ê kiáⁿ.
English: Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to kill his son.

Tailo: Tsóng-kóng tsi̍t kù, hō͘ ka-kī ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kiat-hun sī hó, bô hō͘ i tshut-kè koh khah hó.
English: So then both he who gives his own virgin in marriage does well, and he who doesn't give her in marriage does better.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Jîn-tsú mā sī An-hioh-ji̍t ê Tsú.
English: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kā I-é-su kóng, Tsìng lâng sui-jiân ē pàng-sak Lí, m̄-koh, guá bē án-ne tsò.
English: But Peter said to him, Although all will be offended, yet I will not.

Tailo: Lí kóng, guá ê tō-lí sûn-tsuân, guá tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tshing-khì.
English: For you say, My doctrine is pure, I am clean in your eyes.'

Tailo: Lí ē tuì lí ê pún só͘-tsāi, tuì pak-hong ê ki̍k-thâu lâi kah tsin tsē kok ê jîn-bîn tsò-hué lâi, lóng sī khiâ bé, tsò tuā-tīn, tsin tsē ê kun-tuī.
English: You shall come from your place out of the uttermost parts of the north, you, and many peoples with you, all of them riding on horses, a great company and a mighty army;

Tailo: Tsú suah piàn-tsò tshin-tshiūnn tuì-ti̍k, thun-bia̍t I-su-la-el, I thun-bia̍t i só͘-ū ê kiong-tiān, I huí-huāi i hiah-ê siâⁿ-pó; tī Iô-tah tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê tiong-kan, ke-thinn tsin tsē pi-siong kah pi-ai.
English: The Lord is become as an enemy, he has swallowed up Israel; He has swallowed up all her palaces, he has destroyed his strongholds; He has multiplied in the daughter of Judah mourning and lamentation.

Tailo: Kuè-khì in-uī lín puē-gi̍k Siōng-tè, lîng-sìng í-king sí-.khì.
English: You were made alive when you were dead in transgressions and sins,

Tailo: Iâ-kop thiaⁿ-kóng Ai-gi̍p ū niû-si̍t, tsiū tshe lán ê tsó͘-sian khì hia. Tse sī thâu tsi̍t pái.
English: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē tē-jī pái lîm-kàu guá kóng, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá ìn kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê tiánn teh kún, i ê bīn tuì pak pîng ǹg kuè-.lâi.
English: The word of Yahweh came to me the second time, saying, What see you? I said, I see a boiling caldron; and the face of it is from the north.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to mn̄g in kóng, Lín ài guá pàng Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông hō͘ lín, sī-.bô?
English: Pilate answered them, saying, Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?

Tailo: Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-gō͘ ji̍t.
English: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Guán hō͘ hong-íng sàu-kah tsin lī-hāi, keh tńg kang, tāi-ke tsiū khai-sí kā huè-bu̍t hiat-lo̍h hái.
English: As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard.

Tailo: In mā bē-tàng tuì lí the̍h-tshut tsit-má teh kā guá khòng-kò ê tsìng-kì.
English: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.

Tailo: Tē-bīn tsiū án-ne piàn-uāⁿ tshin-tshiūnn khàm ìn ê thô͘, bān-mi̍h hián-hiān tshin-tshiūnn saⁿ-khò͘ ê tshái-sik.
English: It is changed as clay under the seal, And stands forth as a garment.

Tailo: Kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah kā guá pau-uî, khióng-pò͘ kā guá im-ba̍t.
English: Fearfulness and trembling have come on me. Horror has overwhelmed me.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā kuân-tuā ê i kā i khuànn-khin; i tī só͘-ū kiau-ngō͘-ê tso̍k-luī tsò ông.
English: He sees everything that is high: He is king over all the sons of pride.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ Tî-mó͘-theh, guá tsiàu í-tsîng hit-ê kuan-hē lí ê ī-giân, kā tsit-ê kài-bīng kau-thok lí, hō͘ lí thang tsun-tsiàu tsiah-ê uē, lâi hó-hó phah-iâⁿ hit tiûⁿ tsing-tsiàn.
English: This charge I commit to you, my child Timothy, according to the prophecies which led the way to you, that by them you may wage the good warfare;

Tailo: Hi-lâm tsiū īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ kah siông tshiū ê tshâ, tsiàu i it-tshè só͘ ài ê hō͘ Só͘-lô-móng.
English: So Hiram gave Solomon timber of cedar and timber of fir according to all his desire.

Tailo: I ē khiā-.leh, uá-khò Siōng-tsú ê kuân-lîng kah i ê Siōng-tè ui-giâm ê miâ, lâi tshī i ê iûⁿ-kûn. In ē an-jiân sing-ua̍h; i ē tsò tuā, kàu tē ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: He shall stand, and shall shepherd in the strength of Yahweh, In the majesty of the name of Yahweh his God: And they will live, for then he will be great to the ends of the earth.

Tailo: ' M̄-thang lām-sám tshing Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê miâ, in-uī lām-sám tshing I ê miâ ê lâng, Siōng-tsú it-tīng bô lia̍h i tsò bô tsuē.
English: You shall not take the name of Yahweh your God in vain: for Yahweh will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.

Tailo: Guān thiàⁿ lán ê Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok kah lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōng-tè, īng I ê un-tián siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán íng-uán ê an-uì kah bí-hó ê ǹg-bāng,
English: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace,

Tailo: thǹg-khì i siū lia̍h ê sî só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, tuà tī lí ê tshù lāi ai-khàu pē-bú tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t, jiân-āu lí thang kah i tâng-pâng, lí tsò i ê tiōng-hu, i tsò lí ê bó͘.
English: and she shall put the clothing of her captivity from off her, and shall remain in your house, and bewail her father and her mother a full month: and after that you shall go in to her, and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.

Tailo: Lí nā tì-ì thiaⁿ Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê uē, siú I it-tshè ê kài-bīng lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn, to̍h-sī guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ē hō͘ lí puâⁿ-kuè thian-hā bān-kok.
English: It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to the voice of Yahweh your God, to observe to do all his commandments which I command you this day, that Yahweh your God will set you on high above all the nations of the earth:

Tailo: Sio̍k Má-ná-se ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê,
English: Of the children of Manasseh, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h uē thang tuì Lí kóng-kàu Lí ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsun-kuì? In-uī Lí tsin liáu-kái Lí ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: What can David say yet more to you concerning the honor which is done to your servant? for you know your servant.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tuā-siaⁿ jióng, thǹg guā-saⁿ, ǹg khong-tiong iā thô͘-sua hún ê sî,
English: As they cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air,

Tailo: Sâm-sóng lo̍h-khì Tim-nah, tī Tim-nah khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á, to̍h-sī Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Samson went down to Timnah, and saw a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh kong-kik Le-ba-nòng só͘-ū kuân-tuā ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū kah Ba-siáng só͘-ū ê siōng tshiū;
English: For all the cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up, For all the oaks of Bashan,

Tailo: kah tē-tsiūⁿ lia̍t ông ê bô͘-sū tông-tsāi, in bat uī ka-kī tī pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi khí-tsō;
English: With kings and counselors of the earth, Who built up waste places for themselves;

Tailo: Āu-lâi, guá koh khuànn, lí khuàⁿ, koh ū tsi̍t tsiah siù, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn pà, kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ ū sì-ê si̍t tshin-tshiūnn tsiáu; tsit tsiah siù ū sì-ê thâu-khak, koh ū kuân-pìng hō͘ i.
English: After this I saw, and behold, another, like a leopard, which had on its back four wings of a bird; the animal had also four heads; and dominion was given to it.

Tailo: Tsiàu lâng-miâ ê sò͘-gia̍h, tuì muá-gue̍h í-siōng, kiàn-nā thâu-tsiūⁿ seⁿ ê tsa-po͘ ting king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsóng-kiōng ū nn̄g-bān nn̄g-tshing nn̄g-pah tshit-tsa̍p-saⁿ miâ.
English: All the firstborn males according to the number of names, from a month old and upward, of those who were numbered of them, were twenty-two thousand two hundred seventy-three.

Tailo: Pa-lân tuì Ba-al kóng, Guá kám bô tuì lí só͘ tshe lâi-kàu guá hia ê sù-tsiá kóng:
English: Balaam said to Balak, Didn't I also tell your messengers who you sent to me, saying,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lí bat kà-sī tsin tsē lâng, luán-jio̍k ê tshiú lí mā hō͘ i giám-ngē.
English: Behold, you have instructed many, You have strengthened the weak hands.

Tailo: Tíng-bīn I-é-su ū kóng kuè, Tsè-sū kah lé-mi̍h, sio-tsè kah sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, Lí lóng bô ài, mā bô kah-ì. Suî-jiân tsiah-ê lóng sī tsiàu lu̍t-huat lâi hiàn ê, I iáu-koh án-ne kóng.
English: Previously saying, Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn't desire, neither had pleasure in them (those which are offered according to the law),

Tailo: I-é-su tsik-pī siâ-sîn, siâ-sîn tuì gín-á ê sing-khu tshut-.khì; gín-á ê pēⁿ tsiū suî-sî hó-.khì.
English: Jesus rebuked him, the demon went out of him, and the boy was cured from that hour.

Tailo: I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ Ta-bi̍t ê kî-tó kàu tsia kiat-sok.
English: This ends the prayers by David, the son of Jesse. BOOK III

Tailo: Tuì hia tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Sat-lia̍t ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: From there they traveled, and encamped in the valley of Zered.

Tailo: Lí gîng-tsiap hit-ê huann-hí kiâⁿ gī kah kì-liām Lí ê tō-lō͘ ê lâng; Lí khuànn, Lí bat siū-khì, guán bat huān tsuē; tshin-tshiūnn án-ne í-king tsin kú, guán kám iáu ē tit-tio̍h kiù?
English: You meet him who rejoices and works righteousness, those who remember you in your ways: behold, you were angry, and we sinned: in them have we been of long time; and shall we be saved?

Tailo: I tuì in kóng, Lín nā ū ì-sù beh hō͘ guá bâi-tsòng guá ê sí-lâng, hō͘ guá bô koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, tsiū tshiánn thiaⁿ guá kóng, thè guá kiû Tso-hal ê kiáⁿ E-hu-lóng,
English: He talked with them, saying, If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng koh ua̍t tńg-sin, Biān-iá-mín lâng tsiū tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, in-uī khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsai-hō kàu à.
English: The men of Israel turned, and the men of Benjamin were dismayed; for they saw that evil had come on them.

Tailo: M̄-koh, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, sin-lông ē hō͘ lâng tuì in tiong-kan lia̍h-.khì, tī hiah-ê ji̍t in tsiū ē kìm-tsia̍h.
English: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast in those days.

Tailo: Tì-huī iâⁿ-kuè kau-tsiàn ê kun-khì; tsóng-.sī, tsi̍t-ê ū tsuē ê lâng ē pāi-huāi tsin tsē hó sū.
English: Wisdom is better than weapons of war; but one sinner destroys much good.

Tailo: Lâng kám ē bih tī ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi, hō͘ Guá khuànn bē-tio̍h i? Siōng-tsú koh kóng, Guá kám bô tshiong-muá tī thiⁿ-tē?
English: Can any hide himself in secret places so that I shall not see him? says Yahweh. Don't I fill heaven and earth? says Yahweh.

Tailo: King-tián pa̍t-ê só͘-tsāi koh kóng, Tsú tsai ū tì-huī ê lâng ê sim-su bô lō͘-īng. (tsù, SPh 94:11)
English: And again, The Lord knows the reasoning of the wise, that it is worthless.

Tailo: Tse thang pí-phīng hit-ê kuì-khì ê iû tó tī thâu-khak tíng, lâu kàu tshuì-tshiu, to̍h-sī A-lông ê tshuì-tshiu, koh lâu kàu i ê saⁿ-á-ki.
English: It is like the precious oil on the head, That ran down on the beard, Even Aaron's beard; That came down on the edge of his robes;

Tailo: Kuan-hē to̍k-sin ê būn-tê, guá bô siū Tsú ê bīng-līng, tsóng-.sī, guá í-king tit-tio̍h Tsú ê liân-bín, lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò tsīn-tiong ê lô͘-po̍k, guá tsiū thê-tshut ka-kī ê ì-kiàn.
English: Now concerning virgins, I have no commandment from the Lord, but I give my judgment as one who has obtained mercy from the Lord to be trustworthy.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tsiàu tsiah-ê siâⁿ-ip tshian-suá Ai-gi̍p ê jîn-bîn, tuì Ai-gi̍p tsit pîng kàu tī hit pîng.
English: As for the people, he moved them to the cities from one end of the border of Egypt even to the other end of it.

Tailo: Hit sî, lí tio̍h kín-sīn, bián-tit lí bē kì-tit Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī tshuā lí tuì Ai-gi̍p tē — tsò lô͘-lē ê ke, tshut-.lâi ê.
English: then beware lest you forget Yahweh, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

Tailo: Tsit saⁿ-ê sī Nó͘-ah ê kiáⁿ, tuì in tshut ê kiáⁿ-sun phiàn-muá tsuân tē.
English: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these, the whole earth was populated.

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, Lóng bô gī lâng, liân tsi̍t-ê to bô!
English: As it is written, There is no one righteous. No, not one.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h thinn-tíng sìng-tiān ê mn̂g phah-khui-khui, lāi-bīn ū Siōng-tè lîm-tsāi ê huē-bō͘.
English: After these things I looked, and the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened.

Tailo: Si-phih ê kiáⁿ Tsi-tsah, Si-phih sī A-lông ê kiáⁿ, A-lông sī Ia-ta-iah ê kiáⁿ, Ia-ta-iah sī Sim-lī ê kiáⁿ, Sim-lī sī Si-má-iah ê kiáⁿ.
English: and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah

Tailo: Taⁿ tī tsit só͘-tsāi ê ki-hng í-king nn̄g nî, iáu ū gō͘ nî, bô thang tsìng-tsoh, bô thang siu-sîng.
English: For these two years the famine has been in the land, and there are yet five years, in which there will be neither plowing nor harvest.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tī khòng-iá ê sî, tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng tī An-hioh-ji̍t khioh tshâ.
English: While the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.

Tailo: In ē kàu Si-óng kuân ê só͘-tsāi tshiùⁿ kua, koh ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hô tsuí teh lâu, kàu Siōng-tsú un-tián ê tē, tit-tio̍h ngó͘-kok, tsiú, iû, iûⁿ-kûn kah sè tsiah ê gû-kûn. In ê sim ē tshin-tshiūⁿ kuàn-ak ê hn̂g, lóng bô koh iu-khó͘.
English: They shall come and sing in the height of Zion, and shall flow to the goodness of Yahweh, to the grain, and to the new wine, and to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul shall be as a watered garden; and they shall not sorrow any more at all.

Tailo: （ Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Pháiⁿ lâng ū guân tsuē tī sim tiong teh tsok-kuài, i gán-tiong bô kiann Siōng-tè.
English: An oracle is within my heart about the disobedience of the wicked: There is no fear of God before his eyes.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ tsin tsē lâng pua̍h-tó; tāi-ke tó sio-tha̍h, in tsiū kóng, khí-.lâi! Lán tò- tńg lâi-khì pún tso̍k, kàu lán ê pún só͘-tsāi, lâi siám-phiah ap-tsè lán ê to-kiàm.
English: He made many to stumble, yes, they fell one on another: and they said, Arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our birth, from the oppressing sword.

Tailo: In tio̍h án-ne sé tshiú sé kha, bián-tit sí-bông, tse sī tsò in tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē, to̍h-sī tsò i kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they not die: and it shall be a statute forever to them, even to him and to his descendants throughout their generations.

Tailo: In-uī Lí ê sím-phuàⁿ tsìng-khak, Si-óng suaⁿ tio̍h huann-hí, Iô-tah ê siâⁿ-tshī tio̍h khuài-lo̍k.
English: Let Mount Zion be glad! Let the daughters of Judah rejoice, Because of your judgments.

Tailo: Ná-than kóng, Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, lí kám ū kóng, ' A-to-nî-iah beh suà-tsiap guá tsò ông, beh tsē guá ê uī? '
English: Nathan said, My lord, king, have you said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne?

Tailo: Lū-biān, lí sī guá ê tuā-kiáⁿ, guá ê kuân-sè, guá ê khuì-la̍t ê khí-thâu, ū ui-giâm ê ti̍k-sik, ū kuân-lîng ê ti̍k-sik.
English: Reuben, you are my firstborn, my might, and the beginning of my strength; Excelling in dignity, and excelling in power.

Tailo: A-lông tuì in kóng, Lín ê bó͘, lín ê kiáⁿ-jî ê hīnn-á só͘ kuà ê kim-khuân, kā i pak khí-.lâi, the̍h-lâi hō͘ guá.
English: Aaron said to them, Take off the golden rings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them to me.

Tailo: Sái ba̍k-bué lâi huē-ì, īng kha pí ì-sù, īng tsíng-thâu-á tsí-sī.
English: Who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet, Who motions with his fingers;

Tailo: Lí in-uī Lí ê tuì-ti̍k ê iân-kò͘, tuì enn-á kah tsia̍h ling-.ê ê tshuì kiàn-li̍p lîng-li̍k, beh hō͘ tuì-ti̍k kah pò-uan ê tiām-tiām.
English: From the lips of babes and infants you have established strength, Because of your adversaries, that you might silence the enemy and the avenger.

Tailo: Pi-tsiān ê lâng ē khut-lo̍h, tsun-kuì ê lâng ē kàng kē, ba̍k-thâu kuân ê lâng mā ē kàng kē.
English: So man is brought low, Mankind is humbled, And the eyes of the arrogant ones are humbled;

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng siū hì-lāng, piⁿ-phah, mā ū lâng siū khún-pa̍k kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ.
English: Others were tried by mocking and scourging, yes, moreover by bonds and imprisonment.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông ìn kóng, Guá ê tsú, guá ê ông, tsiàu lí ê uē, guá kah guá só͘-ū ê lóng sī lí ê.
English: The king of Israel answered, It is according to your saying, my lord, O king; I am yours, and all that I have.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kiâⁿ uá khì iâⁿ-pâng, khuàⁿ-tio̍h gû-á, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng teh thiàu-bú, tsiū tuā siū-khì, tuì i ê tshiú hiat hit nn̄g tè tsio̍h-pi, tī suaⁿ-kha at-tn̄g.
English: It happened, as soon as he came near to the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing: and Moses' anger grew hot, and he threw the tablets out of his hands, and broke them beneath the mountain.

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p-la̍k sī Ha-na-niah, i kah i ê kiáⁿ kah i ê hiann-tī, kiōng tsa̍p-jī lâng.
English: for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve:

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tú-tio̍h in ê ē thun-tsia̍h in. In tsiah-ê tuì-ti̍k kóng, ' Guán bô tsuē, in-uī in tik-tsuē Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī kong-gī tuà ê só͘-tsāi, mā sī in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ ǹg-bāng ê Siōng-tsú. '
English: All who found them have devoured them; and their adversaries said, We are not guilty, because they have sinned against Yahweh, the habitation of righteousness, even Yahweh, the hope of their fathers.

Tailo: A-hap tsiū tsiūⁿ-khì lim-tsia̍h. E-li-iah tńg-khì Kal-mel suaⁿ tíng, khut-sin tī tē-.ni̍h, bīn phak tī nn̄g-ê kha-thâu-u ê tiong-kan,
English: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he bowed himself down on the earth, and put his face between his knees.

Tailo: tī Ka-nân tē ê Sī-lô kā in kóng, Tsîng Siōng-tsú thok Mô͘-se hō͘ guán ū siâⁿ thang tuà, ū kau-iá thang tsò tshī tsing-seⁿ ê lō͘-īng.
English: and they spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, Yahweh commanded Moses to give us cities to dwell in, with the suburbs of it for our livestock.

Tailo: Huān-nā tsia̍h hiah-ê tsè-mi̍h ê lâng, it-tīng tio̍h tam-tng i ê tsuē-kò, in-uī i siat-to̍k Siōng-tsú ê sìng-mi̍h, hit-ê lâng it-tīng tio̍h tuì i ê jîn-bîn tiong hông tsián-tû.
English: but everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the holy thing of Yahweh, and that soul shall be cut off from his people.

Tailo: E-thu-ló kóng, Siōng-tsú sī ing-kai o-ló ê, I kiù lín thuat-lī Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tshiú, mā thuat-lī Huâ-láu ê tshiú, kiù tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tshut Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tshiú-hā.
English: Jethro said, Blessed be Yahweh, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh; who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.

Tailo: Guá ē kì-tit kó͘-tsá ê ji̍t-tsí, guá siàu-liām Lí it-tshè ê tsok-uî, tiām-tiām su-sióng Lí tshiú ê só͘ tsò.
English: I remember the days of old. I meditate on all your doings. I contemplate the work of your hands.

Tailo: Tsè-sū Guá ê sing-lé, i ê hueh m̄-thang tsham ū kàⁿ ê mi̍h lâi hiàn, mā m̄-thang kā Guá tseh-kî sing-lé ê iû lâu kàu keh kang tsá-khí.
English: You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread, neither shall the fat of my feast remain all night until the morning.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá kám bô in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lâi pān in? Guá ê sim kám bô beh tuì tsit khuán jîn-bîn lâi pò-siû?
English: Shall I not visit for these things? says Yahweh; and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

Tailo: Tī Be-tsik tiám-sǹg hiah-ê lâng, I-su-la-el lâng ū saⁿ-tsa̍p bān, Iô-tah lâng ū saⁿ bān.
English: He numbered them in Bezek; and the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.

Tailo: Gia̍h i ê kun-khì ê khuàⁿ-tio̍h Sàu-lô í-king sí, i mā tshi̍h lo̍h-khì tī to-.ni̍h kah i tsò-hué sí.
English: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword, and died with him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh koh īng kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì khuán-thāi tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, hit-ê tāi-tsì to̍h-sī kî-biāu koh kî-ī ê. In tì-huī lâng ê tì-huī ē siau-bia̍t, in tshong-bîng lâng ê tshong-bîng ē khàm ba̍t.
English: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, even a marvelous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden.

Tailo: Lí nā bô tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ tsit pún tsheh só͘ kì lu̍t-huat it-tshè ê uē, bô kìng-uì ū îng-kng thang kiaⁿ-uì ê miâ, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè,
English: If you will not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and fearful name, YAHWEH YOUR GOD;

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng kah só͘-ū sio̍k in ê, lóng ua̍h-ua̍h lo̍h im-kan; tē tsiū koh ha̍p-uá tī in ê tíng-bīn, in tsiū tuì huē tiong bia̍t-bông.
English: So they, and all that appertained to them, went down alive into Sheol: and the earth closed on them, and they perished from among the assembly.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē tshian-suá lí kah lí só͘ siat-li̍p lâi kā lí kuán-hat ê ông, lâi-kàu lí kah lí ê tsó͘-sian só͘ m̄-bat ê kok, tī hia lí ē ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, sī tshâ-ê kah tsio̍h ê.
English: Yahweh will bring you, and your king whom you shall set over you, to a nation that you have not known, you nor your fathers; and there shall you serve other gods, wood and stone.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t, I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ tsiūⁿ tsûn ê sî kā in kóng, Lán lâi-khì ô͘ ê hit pîng huāⁿ. In tsiū khui tsûn.
English: Now it happened on one of those days, that he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them, Let's go over to the other side of the lake. So they launched out.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī Tsú ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi, I tsiū ē kā lín ko-sing.
English: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.

Tailo: Jiân-āu kā tsia̍h-mi̍h pâi tī i ê bīn-tsîng, beh hō͘ i tsia̍h. Tsóng-.sī, i kóng, Guá bô beh tsia̍h, tio̍h thìng-hāu guá kóng bîng guá ê sù-bīng. La̍h-ban kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kóng.
English: Food was set before him to eat, but he said, I will not eat until I have told my message. He said, Speak on.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ ê āu-bīn, to̍h-sī sai-bīn, tio̍h tsò la̍k tè pán.
English: For the far part of the tent westward you shall make six boards.

Tailo: Tio̍h tsio-tsi̍p siā tsìnn ê ping, to̍h-sī só͘-ū ē khui kiong ê, lâi kong-kik Ba-bú-lông. Tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî tsat iâⁿ, lâi kā i phah, m̄-thang hō͘ i tsáu kah tsi̍t-ê, tsiàu i só͘ tsò ê lâi kā i pò-ìng; i án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi lâng, tio̍h tsiàu án-ne lâi kā i khuán-thāi, in-uī i kiau-ngō͘ puē-gi̍k Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê sìng ê.
English: Call together the archers against Babylon, all those who bend the bow; encamp against her round about; let none of it escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she has done, do to her; for she has been proud against Yahweh, against the Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê pēnn-lâng, miâ kiò-tsò La̍h-tsa-lō͘, i tuà tī Bē-tha-niah, to̍h-sī Mâ-lí-ah kah i ê á-tsé Mal-tha ê tsng-thâu.
English: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha.

Tailo: Guá ê sè-kiáⁿ, guá siá tsiah-ê hō͘ lín, sī beh hō͘ lín bô huān tsuē; nā ū lâng huān tsuē, tī Thiⁿ-pē ê bīn-tsîng, lán ū gī lâng I-é-su Ki-tok uī lán piān-hō͘.
English: My little children, I write these things to you so that you may not sin. If anyone sins, we have a Counselor with the Father, Jesus Christ, the righteous.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tuā kuân-lîng to̍h-sī hō͘ Ki-tok tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, koh hō͘ Ki-tok tī thinn-tíng tsē tī I ê tsiànn pîng.
English: which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places,

Tailo: Guá sim-lāi siūⁿ, tse sī uī-tio̍h sè-kan lâng ê iân-kò͘, Siōng-tè ē kā in tshì-giām, hō͘ in tsai ka-kī sī khîm-siù.
English: I said in my heart, As for the sons of men, God tests them, so that they may see that they themselves are like animals.

Tailo: Tsè-si tó tī to hā, tsiú-kuáⁿ ê lâng mā bô thî-khàu.
English: Their priests fell by the sword, And their widows couldn't weep.

Tailo: I kóng, Guá ū tsi̍t kiāⁿ sió-khuá tāi-tsì kiû lí, tshiáⁿ lí mài kā guá the-sî. Ông kā i kóng, Guá ê lāu-bú, tsò lí kóng, guá bô beh kā lí the-sî.
English: Then she said, I ask one small petition of you; don't deny me. The king said to her, Ask on, my mother; for I will not deny you.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng só͘-ū ê í-king tsá to̍h ū hō i ê miâ, tsai i sī lâng, mā bē-tàng kah hit-ê pí i khah ū la̍t ê lâi sio-tseⁿ.
English: Whatever has been, its name was given long ago; and it is known what man is; neither can he contend with him who is mightier than he.

Tailo: Ji̍t àm beh kuainn siâⁿ mn̂g ê sî, hiah-ê lâng tshut-.khì, in khì tó-uī guá m̄-tsai. Lín kuáⁿ-kín khì jiok, tsiū ē jiok-.tio̍h.
English: and it happened about the time of the shutting of the gate, when it was dark, that the men went out; where the men went I don't know: pursue after them quickly; for you will overtake them.

Tailo: Sè-kài tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng pāi-huāi, sè-kài tshiong-muá kiông-pō.
English: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng kám m̄-sī hit-ê tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm pik-hāi só͘-ū kiû-kiò tsit-ê miâ ê lâng? I koh lâi tsia beh lia̍h sìn-tô͘, thua in khì kau hō͘ tsè-si-tiúⁿ.
English: All who heard him were amazed, and said, Isn't this he who in Jerusalem made havoc of those who called on this name? And he had come here intending to bring them bound before the chief priests!

Tailo: Tsiū-sī hit uī īng khuì-la̍t hâ guá ê io, hō͘ guá ê lō͘ uân-tsuân ê Siōng-tè.
English: The God who arms me with strength, and makes my way perfect?

Tailo: Bô lâng īng kong-gī lâi pín-bîng, bô lâng tsiàu sîng-si̍t lâi piān-hō͘; lóng sī uá-khò hi-ké, kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t. In só͘ huâi-īn ê sī tsân-hāi, só͘ seⁿ ê sī tsuē-gia̍t.
English: None sues in righteousness, and none pleads in truth: they trust in vanity, and speak lies; they conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity.

Tailo: Suaⁿ-thâu in-uī I tín-tāng, suaⁿ-niá mā lóng siau-iûⁿ, tāi-tē tī I ê bīn-tsîng phòng khí-.lâi, sè-kài kah tiàm tī hit tiong-kan ê mā sī án-ne.
English: The mountains quake before him, and the hills melt away. The earth trembles at his presence, yes, the world, and all who dwell in it.

Tailo: Hok-kok kah i ê kau-iá, Le-hap kah i ê kau-iá;
English: and Hukok with its suburbs, and Rehob with its suburbs;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ū uī lán tsò tuā tāi-tsì, lán tsiū huann-hí.
English: Yahweh has done great things for us, And we are glad.

Tailo: Mô͘-se ê lu̍t-huat kì-tsài, gû teh lún ngó͘-kok ê sî, m̄-thang kā i kuà gû-tshuì-lom. (tsù, SBK 25:4) Siōng-tè kám m̄-sī teh kuan-sim gû?
English: For it is written in the law of Moses, You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the grain. Is it for the oxen that God cares,

Tailo: Tē-sì ji̍t tio̍h hiàn gû-káng-á tsa̍p tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng nn̄g tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á tsa̍p-sì tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: On the fourth day ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

Tailo: Io-si-iah tsē-uī ê sî peh huè, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ông kiōng saⁿ-tsa̍p it nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò E-ti-tah, sī Phel-siah -ka lâng A-ta-iah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign; and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah of Bozkath.

Tailo: Guán tuì Tho͘-lo-a tsē tsûn, it-ti̍t khì-kàu Sa-mô͘-thá-keh, keh tńg kang lâi-kàu Nî-a-pho-lī.
English: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis;

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng sí-.khì ê ū tsi̍t-bān peh-tshing, tsiah-ê lóng sī ióng-sū, kî-tha ê lâng ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu khì khòng-iá, kàu Lim-móng ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: There fell of Benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were men of valor.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn tī guā-bīn ê pâng ê piⁿ-á, ǹg hit-ê pâng ê thâu-tsîng ê guā-īⁿ, tn̂g gō͘-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The wall that was outside by the side of the chambers, toward the outer court before the chambers, the length of it was fifty cubits.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hō͘ in tsò sìng, hō͘ in tsiâⁿ-tsò tsì-sìng, kiàn-nā bong-tio̍h i ê lóng hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: You shall sanctify them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them shall be holy.

Tailo: In Ku-lé-té lâng ê tsi̍t-ê sian-ti bat án-ne kóng, Ku-lé-té lâng put-sî kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t, tshin-tshiūnn hiong-ok ê iá-siù, tham-tsia̍h koh pîn-tuāⁿ.
English: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.

Tailo: In ē kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; thàng-thiàⁿ ê kan-khó͘ ē kā in khîⁿ-tiâu; in pak-tó͘ kiáu-ká tshin-tshiūnn beh seⁿ kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng. Tāi-ke tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-khì lâi sio tuì khuànn, bīn ná tshin-tshiūnn hué-iām.
English: They will be dismayed. Pangs and sorrows will sieze them. They will be in pain like a woman in labor. They will look in amazement one at another. Their faces will be faces of flame.

Tailo: Lán īng bé-kā-kiuⁿ tàu tī bé ê tshuì, hō͘ in sūn-ho̍k, tsiū ē-tàng khòng-tsè kui-tsiah bé.
English: Indeed, we put bits into the horses' mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body.

Tailo: Ū ê ka-la̍uh tī hó ê thó͘-tē, tsiū huat-gê tuā tsâng khí-.lâi, kiat-si̍t. Ū ê kiat si̍t saⁿ-tsa̍p puē, ū ê la̍k-tsa̍p puē, ū ê tsi̍t-pah puē.
English: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some brought forth thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.

Tailo: Guá tuì tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan kā lín tshuā tshut-.lâi, tuì lín sì-suàⁿ khì ê lia̍t kok tiong kā lín tsū-tsi̍p. Hit sî, Guá beh tsiap-la̍p lín tshin-tshiūnn phang-hiuⁿ; Guá beh tī lín tit-tio̍h hián-bîng tsiânn-tsò sìng, hō͘ guā-pang lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: As a sweet savor will I accept you, when I bring you out from the peoples, and gather you out of the countries in which you have been scattered; and I will be sanctified in you in the sight of the nations.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng kóng, Lâi! Lán tio̍h kui-uá Siōng-tsú! I kā lán thiah-li̍h, mā ē kā lán i hó; I phah lán, mā ē kā lán ê siong pau khí-.lâi.
English: Come, and let us return to Yahweh; For he has torn us to pieces, And he will heal us; He has injured us, And he will bind up our wounds.

Tailo: M̄-thang hō͘ tsuē kā lín tsi-phuè, in-uī lín m̄-sī ua̍h tī lu̍t-huat ē-bīn, sī ua̍h tī un-tián ē bīn.
English: For sin will not have dominion over you. For you are not under law, but under grace.

Tailo: Tuā tsiah sai thiah-li̍h mi̍h, hō͘ sè tsiah sai tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h, uī-tio̍h bó ê sai kā-sí ua̍h-mi̍h, kā só͘ thiah-li̍h ê tún-muá i ê hia̍t, kā só͘ kā-tio̍h ê, tsik muá i ê tōng.
English: The lion tore in pieces enough for his cubs, and strangled for his lionesses, and filled his caves with the kill, and his dens with prey.

Tailo: Tse it-tshè lóng sī uī-tio̍h lín, beh hō͘ koh khah tsē lâng tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê un-tián, thang hiàn koh khah tsē ê kám-siā lâi îng-kng Siōng-tè.
English: For all things are for your sakes, that the grace, being multiplied through the many, may cause the thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h i ê ji̍t-tsí, āu-lâi ê lâng ē kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng ê lâng ê kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Those who come after shall be astonished at his day, As those who went before were frightened.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá beh tī bān-bîn ê tiong-kan kám-siā Lí, tī lia̍t pang ê tiong-kan tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Lí!
English: I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations. I will sing praises to you among the peoples.

Tailo: Kíng lāi pi-ai, tāi-ke līng-guā tuà. Ta-bi̍t tso̍k ê ke līng-guā tuà, in ê tsa-bó͘ lâng līng-guā tuà; Ná-than tso̍k ê ke līng-guā tuà, in ê tsa-bó͘ lâng līng-guā tuà.
English: The land will mourn, every family apart; the family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; the family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart;

Tailo: Io-ná-than kah Ta-bi̍t nn̄g lâng kiat iok, in-uī i thiàⁿ Ta-bi̍t tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.

Tailo: Tshìn-thuî bô sio-kāng sī Siōng-tsú só͘ thó-ià, ké ê thian-phîng mā sī m̄-hó.
English: Yahweh detests differing weights, And dishonest scales are not pleasing.

Tailo: A-to-nî-be-tsik tô-tsáu, in kā i jiok, lia̍h-tio̍h i, tsám-tn̄g i ê tshiú kah kha ê tuā-thâu-bú.
English: But Adoni-Bezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Ê-lú-sa-lèm kah Iô-tah ê ue lóng ē tsò sìng kui bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú. Kiàn-nā hiàn tsè ê lóng ē īng tsiah-ê ue, tsú bah tī hit lāi-bīn. Tng hit ji̍t, tī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê tiān lāi, bô koh ū Ka-nân lâng.
English: Yes, every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holy to Yahweh of Armies; and all those who sacrifice will come and take of them, and cook in them. In that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: kā hit-ê siâⁿ ê tiúⁿ-ló kóng, ' Guán tsit-ê kiáⁿ bân-phuê koh ngó͘-gi̍k, m̄-thiaⁿ guán ê uē, lām-sám khai-tsîⁿ, tham-tsia̍h koh hò͘ⁿ-tsiú. '
English: and they shall tell the elders of his city, This our son is stubborn and rebellious, he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton, and a drunkard.

Tailo: M̄-koh, kóng-kàu I-su-la-el lâng, I-sá-iah kóng, guá kui ji̍t tshun khui siang tshiú teh thìng-hāu m̄ sūn-ho̍k koh puē-gi̍k ê tsú-bîn. （ Tsù, ISI 65:2)
English: But as to Israel he says, All day long I stretched out my hands to a disobedient and contrary people.

Tailo: kah uá-kīn ê Ha-mat, í-ki̍p Tu-lô, Si-tòng, in-uī in ū tuā tì-huī.
English: And Hamath, also, which borders on it; Tyre and Sidon, because they are very wise.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ I-é-su Ki-tok ê hok-im sī án-ne khai-sí.
English: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

Tailo: Lia̍t-pang án-tsuáⁿ teh tsō siaⁿ-sè? Jîn-bîn án-tsuáⁿ teh kè-bô͘ khang-khang ê tāi-tsì?
English: Why do the nations rage, And the peoples plot a vain thing?

Tailo: Tsú kóng, Tsiah-ê ji̍t liáu-āu, guá kah in só͘ beh li̍p ê iok sī án-ne, guá beh kā guá ê lu̍t-huat khǹg tī in ê sim, khik tī in ê thâu-náu.
English: This is the covenant that I will make with them: After those days,' says the Lord, I will put my laws on their heart, I will also write them on their mind;' then he says,

Tailo: Bia̍t-lé-hèm lâng kah Ne-to-huat lâng, kiōng tsi̍t-pah peh-tsa̍p peh lâng.
English: The men of Bethlehem and Netophah, one hundred eighty-eight.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, i mā beh kik-tōng tsin tsē kok ê jîn-bîn; lia̍t ông beh tuì i lâi am in ê tshuì. In-uī só͘ m̄-bat tuì in kóng ê, in ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h; m̄-bat thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê, in ē bîng-pi̍k.
English: so shall he sprinkle many nations; kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they understand.

Tailo: Tng Phel-siah ông Ko-le-si guân nî, in-uī beh ìng-giām Siōng-tsú thok I-é-lí-miah só͘ kóng ê uē, Siōng-tsú tsiū kik-tōng Phel-siah ông Ko-le-si ê sim, hō͘ i suan-pò͘ tī tsuân kok, koh siá bīng-līng, kóng,
English: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
