Tailo: Tsi̍t-kuá bat hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin á-.sī phuà-pēⁿ hō͘ I-é-su i hó ê hū-jîn-lâng mā kah in tsò-hué, kî-tiong ū Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâ-lí-ah. I-é-su bat tuì tsit-ê Mâ-lí-ah sin tsiūⁿ kuáⁿ-tshut tshit-ê kuí.
English: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

Tailo: Kuè tsin kú, Iô-tah ê bó͘ Siú-ua ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ sí. Iô-tah siū an-uì liáu-āu, tsiū kah i ê pîng-iú A-tu-lâm lâng Hi-la̍h tsiūⁿ-khì Tim-nah, kàu kā i tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g ê lâng hia.
English: After many days, Shua's daughter, the wife of Judah, died. Judah was comforted, and went up to his sheepshearers to Timnah, he and his friend Hirah, the Adullamite.

Tailo: I tsiū kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Lí sī Io-ap á m̄-sī? I ìn kóng, Guá sī à. Tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Kiû lí thiaⁿ lú-pī ê uē. Ìn kóng, Guá teh thiaⁿ.
English: He came near to her; and the woman said, Are you Joab? He answered, I am. Then she said to him, Hear the words of your handmaid. He answered, I do hear.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k tī lí tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k tiong ê tsi̍t-ê, Siōng-tsú só͘ kíng-suán ê só͘-tsāi, lín tī hia tio̍h hiàn lí ê sio-tsè, koh tī hia kiânn guá it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng lí ê.
English: but in the place which Yahweh shall choose in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I command you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng tán teh khuàⁿ I-é-su tī An-hioh-ji̍t ū beh i-tī tsit-ê lâng á-bô; ì-sù sī ài beh kā I kò.
English: They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.

Tailo: M̄-thang lia̍h lí ê lú-pī tsò pháiⁿ tik-hīng ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, in-uī guá kàu taⁿ lóng sī tuì guá ê tuā iu-būn kah siū kik-khuì lâi kóng.
English: Don't count your handmaid for a wicked woman; for out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation have I spoken hitherto.

Tailo: Tī guá huān-lān ê ji̍t, guá tsáu-tshuē Tsú; tī àm-sî, guá gia̍h-khí tshiú, bô thîng kî-tó; guá ê sim m̄-khíng siū an-uì.
English: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord. My hand was stretched out in the night, and didn't get tired. My soul refused to be comforted.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Ta-bi̍t ông kóng, Siōng-tsú in-uī Siōng-tsú ê kuī, sù-hok tī O-biat-e-tóm ê ke kah kiàn-nā sio̍k tī i ê. Ta-bi̍t tsiū khì, huann-hí kng Siōng-tsú ê kuī tuì O-biat-e-tóm ê tshù, lâi-kàu Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ.
English: It was told king David, saying, Yahweh has blessed the house of Obed-Edom, and all that pertains to him, because of the ark of God. David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-Edom into the city of David with joy.

Tailo: Guá kā i khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h kut ê tíng-bīn ū kin, mā ū bah, koh ū phuê pau tī i ê tíng-bīn, tsóng-.sī, lāi-bīn bô ua̍h-khì.
English: I saw, and, behold, there were sinews on them, and flesh came up, and skin covered them above; but there was no breath in them.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Lí kiâⁿ-khui, khiā tī piⁿ-á. I tsiū kiâⁿ-khui, tī hia khiā-.leh.
English: The king said, Turn aside, and stand here. He turned aside, and stood still.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t uī tsiáng-kuân-.ê beh tuì Iâ-kop tshut, i beh tsâu-bia̍t siâⁿ tiong só͘ lâu lo̍h-.lâi ê.
English: Out of Jacob shall one have dominion, Shall destroy the remnant from the city.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h in ê bīn ê hîng-siōng, to̍h-sī guá tsá-tsîng tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê bīn; in ê khuán-sit, in ê sing-khu, lóng sī án-ne, lóng ta̍k-ê ti̍t-ti̍t kiâⁿ-.khì.
English: As for the likeness of their faces, they were the faces which I saw by the river Chebar, their appearances and themselves; they went every one straight forward.

Tailo: Tiān-hō͘ kā tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k lia̍h khí-.lâi, tsi̍t-ê phah, tsi̍t-ê thâi, tsi̍t-ê īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm.
English: The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Kiàn-nā uá-khò lâng, īng jio̍k-thé tsò i ê tshiú, i ê sim lī-khui Siōng-tsú ê, hit khuán lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Thus says Yahweh: Cursed is the man who trusts in man, and makes flesh his arm, and whose heart departs from Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tè só͘ kiâⁿ tī guá ê sîn-jiah, kî-sū, guá huann-hí suan-pò͘:
English: It has seemed good to me to show the signs and wonders that the Most High God has worked toward me.

Tailo: Guán beh tsâu-bia̍t tsit-ê só͘-tsāi, in-uī tsit-ê siâⁿ huān tsuē ê siann tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tsin tuā, Siōng-tsú tshe guán lâi beh kā tsit-ê siâⁿ tsâu-bia̍t.
English: for we will destroy this place, because the outcry against them has grown great before Yahweh that Yahweh has sent us to destroy it.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tī thinn-tíng, tī tē-tsiūⁿ, tī hái tiong, tī só͘-ū ê tshim-ian, lóng tsiàu I ka-kī ê tsí-ì lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Whatever Yahweh pleased, that he has done, In heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps;

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia, tsit-ê hō͘ lí tsò tiāu-thâu, kin-nî lín ē tsia̍h ka-kī huat-tshut ê mi̍h, mê-nî ē tsia̍h tuì hit-ê só͘ tshut-sán ê, kàu tē-saⁿ nî, lín tio̍h tsìng-tsoh siu-kuah, tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g, lâi tsia̍h i ê kué-tsí.
English: This shall be the sign to you: You shall eat this year that which grows of itself, and in the second year that which springs of the same; and in the third year sow you, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of it.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kám-kak kî-kuài, sim-lāi tú-teh siūⁿ tsit-ê ī-siōng sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù ê sî, Kol-né-lioh só͘ tshe lâi ê lâng í-king tshuē-tio̍h Sí-mòng ê tshù, lâi khiā tī mn̂g-kháu,
English: Now while Peter was very perplexed in himself what the vision which he had seen might mean, behold, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made inquiry for Simon's house, stood before the gate,

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ bān-tso̍k tiong, kiàn-nā bô tsiūⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm kìng-pài tuā ê ông — bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê, tī in hia ē bô lo̍h hō͘.
English: It will be, that whoever of all the families of the earth doesn't go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, Yahweh of Armies, on them there will be no rain.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí ná ē tshing-ho͘ guá sī hó à? Siōng-tè í-guā bô tsi̍t-ê sī hó.
English: Jesus asked him, Why do you call me good? No one is good, except oneGod.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Tsì-kuân-.ê tio̍h siū kìng-uì, I sī tuā kun-ông, kuán-lí tsuân tē.
English: For Yahweh Most High is awesome. He is a great King over all the earth.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì í-tsîng, kuán-lí guán Siōng-tè tiān lāi ê pâng-king ê tsè-si E-lí-a-sip kah To-bi-iah kiat-bîng,
English: Now before this, Eliashib the priest, who was appointed over the chambers of the house of our God, being allied to Tobiah,

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to tuì hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah kui tīn ê lâng kóng, Guá khuànn tsit-ê lâng bô tsuē.
English: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes, I find no basis for a charge against this man.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kàu kau-tsiàn ê ji̍t, tuè Sàu-lô kah Io-ná-than ê lâng bô kah tsi̍t-ê lâng tshiú-.ni̍h ū kiàm ū tshiuⁿ ê, kan-taⁿ Sàu-lô kah i ê kiáⁿ Io-ná-than ū.
English: So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people who were with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsai, hō͘ tsi̍t-ê sit-bê ê lâng tò tńg-.lâi ê lâng, ē kiù hit-ê tsuē-jîn ê lîng-hûn thuat-lī sí-bông, koh hō͘ tsin tsē tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián.
English: let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death, and will cover a multitude of sins.

Tailo: In tuì Ka-té-si tshut-huat, I-su-la-el ê tsuân huē-tsiòng lâi-kàu Hol suaⁿ.
English: They traveled from Kadesh: and the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Hil-kí-iah kah ông só͘ thok ê lâng, lóng khì kìⁿ lú-sian-ti Hol-tah. I sī Hap-su-la̍h ê sun, Tô-khó-hap ê kiáⁿ, kuán-lí lé-ho̍k hit-ê Sia-lúm ê bó͘. I tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tē-jī khu; in kā tsit-ê ì-sù tuì i kóng.
English: So Hilkiah, and they whom the king had commanded, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she lived in Jerusalem in the second quarter;) and they spoke to her to that effect.

Tailo: Ê-bel saⁿ-tsa̍p-sì huè ê sî seⁿ Hua-li̍k.
English: Eber lived thirty-four years, and became the father of Peleg.

Tailo: Lí tuì thiⁿ-.ni̍h suan-pò͘ sím-phuàⁿ, tē tsiū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, lóng tiām-tiām;
English: You pronounced judgment from heaven. The earth feared, and was silent,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín kuè Iol-tàn hô, tit-tio̍h tuà tī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín sîng-tsiap ê tē, koh hō͘ lín thuat-lī sì-kho͘-uî só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k, tit-tio̍h an-hioh, lâi an-ún tuà lo̍h-.khì.
English: But when you go over the Jordan, and dwell in the land which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, and he gives you rest from all your enemies round about, so that you dwell in safety;

Tailo: Só͘-í, Thiⁿ-pē thiàⁿ guá, in-uī guá pàng-sak ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā, thang koh tit-tio̍h sìng-miā.
English: Therefore the Father loves me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè tī I ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê bīn-tsîng, kuáⁿ-tshut A-mô͘-lī lâng, kám kóng lí mā beh tit-tio̍h in ê tē?
English: So now Yahweh, the God of Israel, has dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and should you possess them?

Tailo: Hun-pia̍t i ê tē tsò sìng ê, nā it-tīng beh sio̍k-huê, i tsiū tio̍h tī lí só͘ kó͘ ê kè-tsînn í-guā, ke-thinn gō͘-hūn tsi-it, tē tsiū tiāⁿ-tio̍h kui i.
English: If he who dedicated the field will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of your valuation to it, and it shall remain his.

Tailo: Koh īng E-hu-laim suaⁿ-tē ê Sī-khiàm, to̍h-sī thâi-sí-lâng ê tô-siám ê siâⁿ kah in ê kau-iá, í-ki̍p Ge-tsel kah i ê kau-iá,
English: They gave them Shechem with its suburbs in the hill country of Ephraim, the city of refuge for the manslayer, and Gezer with its suburbs,

Tailo: Ba-siah kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, bâi-tsòng tī Til-tsah. I ê kiáⁿ E-la̍h suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah; and Elah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: tī Ná-hu-tha-lím tsi-tso̍k ê tē, ū Ga-lí-la-iah ê Ke-té-sih kah i ê kau-iá, Ham-móng kah i ê kau-iá, Ki-lia̍t-tháim kah i ê kau-iá.
English: and out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its suburbs, and Hammon with its suburbs, and Kiriathaim with its suburbs.

Tailo: tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Lô͘-po̍k só͘ kuán ê ping, í-king tiám-sǹg tsóng-gia̍h, guán tiong-kan bô kiám-tsió kah tsi̍t-ê lâng.
English: and they said to Moses, Your servants have taken the sum of the men of war who are under our charge, and there lacks not one man of us.

Tailo: Tse sī Kel-sióng kiáⁿ-sun tsiah-ê ke king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, sī só͘-ū tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê, to̍h-sī Mô͘-se kah A-lông tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng lâi tiám-sǹg ê.
English: These are those who were numbered of the families of the sons of Gershon, all who served in the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the commandment of Yahweh.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshân-.ni̍h ū tsi̍t kháu tséⁿ, ū saⁿ tīn iûⁿ tó tī tséⁿ piⁿ, in-uī lâng lóng sī īng hit kháu tséⁿ ê tsuí hō͘ iûⁿ-kûn lim tsuí; tséⁿ-tshuì īng tuā tsio̍h khàm-.leh.
English: He looked, and behold, a well in the field, and, behold, three flocks of sheep lying there by it. For out of that well they watered the flocks. The stone on the well's mouth was large.

Tailo: I tsiū kā guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, tsiah-ê kut to̍h-sī I-su-la-el ê tsuân ke; lí khuàⁿ, in kóng, ' Guán ê kut lóng ko͘-tâ, guán ê ǹg-bāng lóng sit-lo̍h; guán tsuân-pō͘ siū tsâu-bia̍t. '
English: Then he said to me, Son of man, these bones are the whole house of Israel: behold, they say, Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost; we are clean cut off.

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang tī lim-tsia̍h, siú tseh-kî, tshe-it á-.sī An-hioh-ji̍t ê būn-tê hō͘ lâng phue-phîng.
English: Let no man therefore judge you in eating, or in drinking, or with respect to a feast day or a new moon or a Sabbath day,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú siū-khì Só͘-lô-móng, in-uī i ê sim lī-khui Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, to̍h-sī bat nn̄g pái tuì i tshut-hiān ê.
English: Yahweh was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned away from Yahweh, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-tsuáⁿ kah guá ê tsú — guá ê ông tông-tsāi, guān I mā tsiàu án-ne kah Só͘-lô-móng tông-tsāi, koh hō͘ i ê kok-uī pí guá ê tsú — Ta-bi̍t ông ê kok-uī koh khah tuā.
English: As Yahweh has been with my lord the king, even so be he with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.

Tailo: Siōng-tè só͘ tshe-khián ê hit uī kóng Siōng-tè ê uē, in-uī Siōng-tè bô hān-liōng siúⁿ-sù Sìng Sîn hō͘ I.
English: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, tsai-hō ē lîm-kàu lí, lí m̄-tsai i tuì tó-uī lâi; tsai-hāi kàu tī lí, lí mā bē-tàng kā i tû-.khì; lí só͘ m̄-tsai ê huí-bia̍t mā ē hut-jiân lîm-kàu lí.
English: Therefore shall evil come on you; you shall not know the dawning of it: and mischief shall fall on you; you shall not be able to put it away: and desolation shall come on you suddenly, which you don't know.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì guá ê hiann-tī suan-iông Lí ê miâ; guá beh tī tsū-huē tiong o-ló Lí.
English: I will declare your name to my brothers. In the midst of the assembly, I will praise you.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn ū tsi̍t hāng tsai-hō hō͘ lâng ū tāng-tàⁿ,
English: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is heavy on men:

Tailo: Ba-bú-lông ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h in ê hong-siaⁿ, tshiú tsiū nńg lo̍h-.khì; thòng-khó͘ kā i khîⁿ-tiâu, thàng-thiàⁿ tshin-tshiūnn beh seⁿ kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng.
English: The king of Babylon has heard the news of them, and his hands wax feeble: anguish has taken hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.

Tailo: M̄-thang jia-khàm in ê tsuē-kò, m̄-thang hō͘ in ê tsuē-ok tuì Lí ê bīn-tsîng tshat-siau, in-uī in tī khí-tsō ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng, kik-tōng Lí ê siū-khì.
English: and don't cover their iniquity, and don't let their sin be blotted out from before you; for they have provoked you to anger before the builders.

Tailo: Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k, ē pâi tīn ê, nn̄g-bān peh-tshing la̍k-pah lâng.
English: Of the Danites who could set the battle in array, twenty-eight thousand six hundred.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī tshòng-tsō tuā kng-thé ê Siōng-tè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who made the great lights; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Lí ná ē teh sím-mn̄g guá? Lí khì mn̄g thiaⁿ-kuè guá kóng-uē ê lâng, khuànn guá án-tsuáⁿ tuì in kóng, in lóng tsai-iáⁿ guá só͘ kóng ê.
English: Why do you ask me? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them. Behold, these know the things which I said.

Tailo: In-uī sè-kan lâng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê, khîm-siù mā ē tú-.tio̍h, só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê lóng sī sio-siâng; tsit-ê án-ne sí, hit-ê mā sī án-ne sí. In lóng sio-siâng tshuán-khuì, lâng bē khah iâⁿ khîm-siù; in-uī lóng sī khang-hi.
English: For that which happens to the sons of men happens to animals. Even one thing happens to them. As the one dies, so the other dies. Yes, they have all one breath; and man has no advantage over the animals: for all is vanity.

Tailo: Ping-á kā I-é-su tìng tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng liáu-āu tsiū tsò khau-á lâi pun I ê saⁿ.
English: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots,

Tailo: Siat-sú in tik-tsuē Lí, tì-sú thiⁿ kuaiⁿ-ba̍t, bô lo̍h hō͘; Lí kā in hîng-hua̍t ê sî, in nā ǹg tsit só͘-tsāi kî-tó, jīn Lí ê miâ, lī-khui in ê tsuē,
English: When the sky is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against you; if they pray toward this place, and confess your name, and turn from their sin, when you do afflict them:

Tailo: guán ê tsó͘-sian lo̍h-khì Ai-gi̍p, guán tuà tī Ai-gi̍p tsin kú; Ai-gi̍p lâng pháiⁿ khuán-thāi guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian.
English: how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians dealt ill with us, and our fathers:

Tailo: Lâng nā bô kah guá kiat-liân, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tshiū-ki hō͘ lâng hiat khì guā-bīn, suah ta-.khì, lâng ē kā in khioh tsò-tui, hiat-lo̍h hué khì sio.
English: If a man doesn't remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Guá kan-taⁿ tsò tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì, lín tsiū lóng kám-kak kî-kuài.
English: Jesus answered them, I did one work, and you all marvel because of it.

Tailo: Lâng nā hian khui tséⁿ á-.sī ku̍t tséⁿ bô khàm kuà, ū gû á-.sī lî pua̍h lo̍h-khì hit lāi-bīn,
English: If a man opens a pit, or if a man digs a pit and doesn't cover it, and a bull or a donkey falls into it,

Tailo: Nā tú-tio̍h lí ê tuì-ti̍k ê gû á-.sī lî bê-lō͘, it-tīng tio̍h khan tńg-lâi kau i.
English: If you meet your enemy's ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely bring it back to him again.

Tailo: Kuah ê kuah bô kui pé, hâ ê hâ bô kui lám.
English: With which the reaper doesn't fill his hand, Nor he who binds sheaves, his bosom.

Tailo: Lí nā m̄-khíng hō͘ Guá ê jîn-bîn lī-khui, lí khuàⁿ, bîn-á-tsài Guá beh hō͘ tsháu-me̍h ji̍p-khì lí ê kíng lāi,
English: Or else, if you refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your country,

Tailo: Ko-iû kah phang-liāu hō͘ lâng ê sim huann-hí; pîng-iú tiong-si̍t ê khó͘-khǹg, i ê tinn mā sī án-ne.
English: Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart; So does earnest counsel from a man's friend.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsiàu hí-nî āu ê nî-hān, tuì tshù-piⁿ bé, i mā tio̍h tsiàu siu-sîng ê nî-hān bē hō͘ lín.
English: According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall buy from your neighbor. According to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you.

Tailo: Hit-ê hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin ê lâng, tsiū uá khì kong-kik hiah-ê kiâⁿ kang-ô͘ ê lâng, kā in tsè-ho̍k, hō͘ in tio̍h-siong, koh thǹg-pak-theh tuì hit king tshù tô-tsáu.
English: The man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overpowered them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

Tailo: Kiû guá ê tsú m̄-thang tì-ì tsit-ê bô hē-lo̍h ê lâng Na-bal, in-uī i ê miâ án-tsuáⁿ, i ê lâng khuán mā sī án-ne. I ê miâ kiò-tsò Na-bal, i tsò lâng kó-jiân gû-gōng. Tsóng-.sī, guá ê tsú só͘ tshe lâi ê siàu-liân lâng, lí ê lú-pī mā bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Please don't let my lord regard this worthless fellow, even Nabal; for as his name is, so is he; Nabal is his name, and folly is with him: but I your handmaid didn't see the young men of my lord, whom you did send.

Tailo: M̄-koh, bô-lūn ji̍p-khì siáⁿ-mi̍h siâⁿ, lâng nā m̄ tsiap-la̍p lín, lín tio̍h tshut-khì in ê tuā ke-lō͘, kóng,
English: But into whatever city you enter, and they don't receive you, go out into the streets of it and say,

Tailo: Lâi sîng-siū hit-ê uī-tio̍h lán pó-tsûn tī thinn-tíng, bē pāi-huāi, bē lah-sap, koh bē sue-thè ê hok-khì.
English: to an incorruptible and undefiled inheritance that doesn't fade away, reserved in heaven for you,

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê suán-tshiú lóng ū tsiap-siū giâm-keh ê hùn-liān, bo̍k-tik sī beh tit-tio̍h ē pāi-huāi ê îng-kuan; m̄-koh, lán sī beh tit-tio̍h bē pāi-huāi ê îng-kuan.
English: Every man who strives in the games exercises self-control in all things. Now they do it to receive a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible.

Tailo: Guān Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí thinn-tíng ê kam-lō͘, sè-tsiūⁿ ê puî tē, ngó͘-kok kah sin ê tsiú tsin tsē.
English: God give you of the dew of the sky, of the fatness of the earth, and plenty of grain and new wine.

Tailo: I bô īng tshuì-tsi̍h bû-luā lâng, bô pháiⁿ khuán-thāi pîng-iú, bô sì-kè tsō iâu-giân lâi huí-pòng tshù-piⁿ.
English: He who doesn't slander with his tongue, Nor does evil to his friend, Nor casts slurs against his fellow man;

Tailo: I-é-su kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, the̍h piáⁿ pun hō͘ in, hî mā sī án-ne pun hō͘ in.
English: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

Tailo: In lóng tsò tsi̍t-ē phak lo̍h-.khì, khut-lo̍h-.khì, bē-tàng kò͘ in ê tāng-tàⁿ, in pún-sin mā hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì.
English: They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden, but themselves are gone into captivity.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Uī-tio̍h Tu-lô huān tsuē kàu tē-saⁿ pái, mā kàu tē-sì pái, Guá bô beh bián-tû tuì i ê hîng-hua̍t; in-uī in kā kui tso̍k ê jîn-bîn kau hō͘ E-tóm, mā bē kì-tit hiann-tī ê bîng-iok.
English: Thus says Yahweh: For three transgressions of Tyre, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; Because they delivered up the whole community to Edom, And didn't remember the brotherly covenant;

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tsiū tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng ê khuán-thāi in, bé tsiū kuah-tn̄g in ê thuí ê tuā kin, tshia tsiū īng hué sio.
English: Joshua did to them as Yahweh bade him: he hamstrung their horses, and burnt their chariots with fire.

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng ê tsè-si, ta̍k ji̍t khiā-teh ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tè, tsi̍t pái koh tsi̍t pái hiàn siâng-khuán ê tsè, mā íng-uán bē-tàng tû-khì jîn-luī ê tsuē.
English: Every priest indeed stands day by day ministering and often offering the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins,

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng tsiū tsiàu án-ne kiânn, tsiàu in ê lâng-gia̍h tuì thiàu-bú ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tiong-kan só͘ lia̍h ê lâi tshuā in tsò bó͘, tsiū tò tńg-khì in pún-tē, koh khí siâⁿ lâi tuà tī hia.
English: The children of Benjamin did so, and took them wives, according to their number, of those who danced, whom they carried off: and they went and returned to their inheritance, and built the cities, and lived in them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú sī ing-kai siū o-ló ê, in-uī I ū thiaⁿ guá khún-kiû ê siann.
English: Blessed be Yahweh, Because he has heard the voice of my petitions.

Tailo: Īng ha̍p-gî ê uē ìn-tap, ná tshin-tshiūnn īng tshuì kā lâng tsim.
English: An honest answer Is like a kiss on the lips.

Tailo: Pa̍t ê Ne-bó ê lâng gō͘-tsa̍p jī-ê.
English: The men of the other Nebo, fifty-two.

Tailo: Ê-no͘k, Me-thu-se-la̍h, Le-mi̍k,
English: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

Tailo: I tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tó lo̍h-khì lò͘! Tuā Ba-bú-lông tó lo̍h-khì à! Taⁿ tsit-ê siâⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò kuí teh tuà ê só͘-tsāi, it-tshè ù-uè siâ-sîn ê kaⁿ-lô, í-ki̍p só͘ ū bô tshing-khì koh khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tsiáu-luī ê tsiáu-siū.
English: He cried with a mighty voice, saying, Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great, and she has become a habitation of demons, a prison of every unclean spirit, and a prison of every unclean and hateful bird!

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ka-kī phuàⁿ-tuàn, tsa-bó͘ lâng bô tà thâu-kin lâi tuì Siōng-tè kî-tó, kám ū sik-ha̍p?
English: Judge for yourselves. Is it appropriate that a woman pray to God unveiled?

Tailo: Iô-há-neh thuân hok-im hō͘ bîn-tsiòng ê sî, lóng īng tsin tsē hong-huat lâi khó͘-khǹg.
English: Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people,

Tailo: Muí tsi̍t-ê tuā-tsè-si ê siat-li̍p, lóng sī uī-tio̍h hiàn lé-mi̍h kah tsè-sū, só͘-í, tsit-ê tuā-tsè-si mā it-tīng tio̍h ū siáⁿ-mi̍h thang hiàn.
English: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this high priest also have something to offer.

Tailo: In bô kā tuà tī Ge-tsel ê Ka-nân lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì; tsóng-.sī, Ka-nân lâng tuà tī E-hu-laim lâng ê tiong-kan, tsò khó͘-kang ê lô͘-po̍k, kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: They didn't drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer: but the Canaanites dwell in the midst of Ephraim to this day, and are become servants to do forced labor.

Tailo: Lí ê huè-bu̍t tuì hái bīn tsiūⁿ lio̍k, tsiū hō͘ tsin tsē jîn-bîn tshiong-tsiok; lí īng tsin tsē tsîⁿ-tsâi, huè-bu̍t, hō͘ tē-tsiūⁿ ê kun-ông hó-gia̍h.
English: When your wares went forth out of the seas, you filled many peoples; you did enrich the kings of the earth with the multitude of your riches and of your merchandise.

Tailo: I tuì thiⁿ hō͘ lí thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê siann, uī-tio̍h beh kà-sī lí, koh tī tē-bīn tsiūⁿ hō͘ lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê tuā-hué, koh hō͘ lí thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê uē tuì hué tiong tshut-.lâi.
English: Out of heaven he made you to hear his voice, that he might instruct you: and on earth he made you to see his great fire; and you heard his words out of the midst of the fire.

Tailo: Lí nā tiām-tiām-á tsín-tsè lâng, tī àm-tiong teh kàm-tshat lâng ê Thiⁿ-pē ē kā lí pò-siúⁿ.
English: so that your merciful deeds may be in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

Tailo: Guá kám sī tuì kin-á-ji̍t tsiah thè i mn̄g Siōng-tsú? Guá tsua̍t-tuì bô hit khuán ì-sù, tshiánn ông m̄-thang kā siáⁿ-mi̍h kui tī lô͘-po̍k kah guá ê lāu-pē tsuân ke, in-uī tsiah-ê só͘-ū ê tāi-tsì, bô-lūn tuā-sè, lí ê lô͘-po̍k lóng m̄-tsai.
English: Have I today begun to inquire of God for him? be it far from me: don't let the king impute anything to his servant, nor to all the house of my father; for your servant knows nothing of all this, less or more.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tè it-tīng khì-tsua̍t in, in-uī in m̄ tsun-thàn I; in mā it-tīng ē phiau-liû tī lia̍t kok tiong.
English: My God will cast them away, because they did not listen to him; And they will be wanderers among the nations.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h nā tuì iûⁿ-kûn tiong lâi tsò sio-tsè, á-.sī mî-iûⁿ, á-.sī suaⁿ-iûⁿ, tio̍h īng bô khuat-tiám ê kang ê lâi hiàn.
English: If his offering is from the flock, from the sheep, or from the goats, for a burnt offering, he shall offer a male without blemish.

Tailo: Ka-nân seⁿ tuā-kiáⁿ Si-tòng kah Hiat,
English: Canaan became the father of Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ông ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ E-ho-sí-ba, kā A-ha-tsiah ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si, tuì hiah-ê teh beh siū thâi ê ông-tsú tiong-kan thau phō tshut-.lâi, kā i kah i ê ling-bú khǹg tī khùn-pâng-.ni̍h. Iok-si-pa sī Io-lâm ông ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, A-ha-tsiah ê tsí-muē, tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah ê bó͘. I tuì A-tha-lí-iah kā i khàm ba̍t, hō͘ i bô thâi-sí Io-a-si.
English: But Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him away from among the king's sons who were slain, and put him and his nurse in the bedchamber. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of king Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest (for she was the sister of Ahaziah), hid him from Athaliah, so that she didn't kill him.

Tailo: In ê enn-á ē tī in ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng hō͘ lâng siak-sí, in ê tshù ē hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, in ê bó͘ ē hō͘ lâng lîng-jio̍k.
English: Their infants also will be dashed in pieces before their eyes. Their houses will be ransacked, and their wives raped.

Tailo: Bú-bān lâng ê lâng, Siōng-tsú kā i bú-bān; Siōng-tsú si un hō͘ khiam-pi ê lâng.
English: Surely he mocks the mockers, But he gives grace to the humble.

Tailo: Kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín khì tuì-bīn ê tsng-thâu, suî-sî ē tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah lî-á pa̍k-.leh, koh ū tsi̍t tsiah lî-á-kiáⁿ tsò-hué tī hia. Lín kā in tháu-khui, khan-lâi guá tsia.
English: saying to them, Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them, and bring them to me.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī phah-sí Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tuā-kiáⁿ ê Siōng-tè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who struck down the Egyptian firstborn; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Tē-tshit ê sī Hat-ko-tsuh, tē-peh ê sī A-bi-iah,
English: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,

Tailo: Ná-hu-tha-lím ê kiáⁿ: Ia-ha-tsi-el, Gu-nî, E-tsel, Sia-lúm. Tse sī Bil-ha̍h ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.

Tailo: Lín ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiàn-tsing kah tsiàn-tsing ê hong-siaⁿ, tio̍h kín-sīn m̄-bián kiaⁿ. Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì it-tīng ē huat-sing, tsóng-.sī, bua̍t-ji̍t iáu-buē kàu.
English: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you aren't troubled, for all this must happen, but the end is not yet.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng, lí suî-jiân kiânn kan-îm, tsóng-.sī, Iô-tah m̄-thang huān tsuē, m̄-thang khì Gil-gal, mā m̄-thang tsiūⁿ-kàu Bia̍t-a-biân, mā m̄-thang kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: Though you, Israel, play the prostitute, Yet don't let Judah offend; And don't come to Gilgal, Neither go up to Beth Aven, Nor swear, As Yahweh lives.'

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kuāⁿ-lâu muá-bīn tsiah ē-tàng tit-tio̍h tsia̍h pá, it-ti̍t kàu lí kui thó͘, in-uī lí sī tuì thô͘ the̍h tshut-.lâi ê, lí pún sī thô͘-sua hún, mā ē kui tī thô͘-hún.
English: By the sweat of your face will you eat bread until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken. For you are dust, and to dust you shall return.

Tailo: Tshiú pîn-tuāⁿ ê lâng ē tú-tio̍h sàn-tshiah; tshiú kut-la̍t ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h hó-gia̍h.
English: He becomes poor who works with a lazy hand, But the hand of the diligent brings wealth.

Tailo: In tham lâng ê tshân-hn̂g, tsiū kā i tshiúⁿ-.lâi, tham lâng ê tshù-the̍h, tsiū kā i tsiàm khí-.lâi; in ap-tsè lâng kah i ê ke, to̍h-sī lâng kah i ê sán-gia̍p.
English: They covet fields, and seize them; And houses, and take them away: And they oppress a man and his house, Even a man and his heritage.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan kiàn-nā bat lí ê lâng, lóng ē uī-tio̍h lí lâi tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì. Lí hō͘ lâng thang kiaⁿ, íng-uán bô thang koh tsûn-tsāi.
English: All those who know you among the peoples shall be astonished at you: you are become a terror, and you shall nevermore have any being.

Tailo: siat-li̍p kun-tiúⁿ lâi kuán-lí jîn-bîn, kā in tsū-tsi̍p kàu i hia, tī siâⁿ mn̂g khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, īng uē kā in an-uì kóng,
English: He set captains of war over the people, and gathered them together to him in the broad place at the gate of the city, and spoke comfortably to them, saying,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê tuā ji̍t kīn à, hit-ê ji̍t sī kīn koh tsin kín, Siōng-tsú ê ji̍t ê siann, tī hia ióng-sū tuā kan-khó͘, tuā-siaⁿ huah.
English: The great day of Yahweh is near. It is near, and hurries greatly, the voice of the day of Yahweh. The mighty man cries there bitterly.

Tailo: Tī iâⁿ tiong ê jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tsim-lī puē-puān, koh thâi-sí ông, só͘-í, I-su-la-el jîn-bîn hit ji̍t tsiū tī iâⁿ tiong siat-li̍p kun-tiúⁿ Om-lī tsò I-su-la-el ông.
English: The people who were encamped heard say, Zimri has conspired, and has also struck the king: therefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.

Tailo: Gōng lâng ê lô-lo̍k tì-sú hō͘ in ià-siān, in-uī liân ji̍p siâⁿ ê lō͘ i mā m̄-tsai.
English: The labor of fools wearies every one of them; for he doesn't know how to go to the city.

Tailo: In ē tshin-tshiūⁿ ióng-sū tī tsiàn-tīn, kā tuì-ti̍k ta̍h tī ke-lō͘ ê thô͘-muê tiong. In beh kau-tsiàn, in-uī Siōng-tsú kah in tông-tsāi; kiàn-nā khiâ bé ê tú-tio̍h in lóng ē kiàn-siàu.
English: They shall be as mighty men, Treading down muddy streets in the battle; And they shall fight, because Yahweh is with them; And the riders on horses will be confounded.

Tailo: Tsia̍h-ê lâng, hū-jîn-lâng kah gín-á bô sǹg, tsóng-kiōng sì-tshing lâng.
English: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì hia king-kuè, lí khuàⁿ, i sí-.khì à; guá tshuē mā lóng tshuē bē-tio̍h.
English: But he passed away, and behold, he was not. Yes, I sought him, but he could not be found.

Tailo: I-su-la-el só͘ ǹg-bāng ê Siōng-tsú ah, kiàn-nā khì-sak Lí ê, lóng ē kiàn-siàu. Kiàn-nā lī-khui Lí ê, in ê miâ ē kì tī thô͘-kha, in-uī in khì-sak Siōng-tsú ua̍h-tsuí ê guân-thâu.
English: Yahweh, the hope of Israel, all who forsake you shall be disappointed. Those who depart from me shall be written in the earth, because they have forsaken Yahweh, the spring of living waters.

Tailo: Thuat-lī to-kiàm, beh tuì Ai-gi̍p tē tńg-lâi Iô-tah tē ê, in ê lâng-gia̍h tsin tsió; hiah-ê só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê Iô-tah lâng khì Ai-gi̍p tē, siūⁿ beh tī hia kià-kha ê, beh tsai siáⁿ lâng ê uē ē tit-tio̍h ìng-giām ê, sī Guá ê á-.sī in ê?
English: Those who escape the sword shall return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah, few in number; and all the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, shall know whose word shall stand, mine, or theirs.

Tailo: Hō͘ guá khì liáu-āu, bô koh tò tńg-.lâi, to̍h-sī khì o͘-àm kah sí-ìm ê tē ê tsìn-tsîng, thang lio̍h-á tit-tio̍h an-uì.
English: Before I go where I shall not return from, To the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;

Tailo: In ê hiann-tī, tī It-sa-kal hiah-ê ke lóng sī tuā ióng-sū, tsiàu in ê sè-hē lâi sǹg, kiōng peh-bān tshit-tshing lâng.
English: Their brothers among all the families of Issachar, mighty men of valor, reckoned in all by genealogy, were eighty-seven thousand.

Tailo: Iô-tah koh khì phah hiah-ê tuà tī He-bú-lông ê Ka-nân lâng, thâi-sí Sī-su, A-hi-mān kah That-mái. He-bú-lông í-tsîng ê miâ kiò-tsò Ki-lia̍t-a-ba.
English: Judah went against the Canaanites who lived in Hebron (now the name of Hebron before was Kiriath Arba); and they struck Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú hō͘-hué I tsō lâng tī sè-kan, sim-lāi iu-būn.
English: Yahweh was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì I-su-la-el tsuân huē-tsiòng kóng, Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù ê uē, sī án-ne kóng:
English: Moses spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which Yahweh commanded, saying,

Tailo: Tsò tsú-lâng ê mā tio̍h án-ne khuán-thāi lô͘-po̍k, m̄-thang kā in tuā-siaⁿ khióng-hat. Lín tio̍h tsai, in kah lín lóng sio̍k kāng tsi̍t-uī thinn-tíng ê Tsú. Tsú īng kāng-khuán ê thài-tō͘ tuì-thāi muí tsi̍t-ê lâng.
English: You masters, do the same things to them, and give up threatening, knowing that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven, and there is no partiality with him.

Tailo: Lí saⁿ ji̍t tsîng phah-m̄-kiàn hiah-ê lî-bó, lí m̄-bián khuà-ì, í-king tshuē-.tio̍h à. I-su-la-el jîn-bîn só͘ him-bō͘ ê ē kui siáⁿ lâng? Kám m̄-sī ē kui lí kah lí ê lāu-pē ê ke?
English: As for your donkeys who were lost three days ago, don't set your mind on them; for they are found. For whom is all that is desirable in Israel? Is it not for you, and for all your father's house?

Tailo: Sa-má-lī-a tio̍h tam-tng i ê tsuē, in-uī i puē-gi̍k i ê Siōng-tè. I ē tó tī to hā, in ê enn-á ē hō͘ lâng siak-sí, in ū sin-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ē hō͘ lâng phuà-pak.
English: Samaria will bear her guilt; For she has rebelled against her God. They will fall by the sword. Their infants will be dashed in pieces, And their pregnant women will be ripped open.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, bûn-tô͘ tiong-kan ū tsin tsē lâng lī-khui, bô koh tuè I-é-su kiânn.
English: At this, many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tsi̍t-ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h Páu-lô kóng tsit kù uē, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ kóng, Tsit khuán lâng tio̍h tuì tē-tsiūⁿ siau-bia̍t, m̄-thang hō͘ i ua̍h lo̍h-.khì.
English: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said, Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn't fit to live!

Tailo: Sàu-lô the-sî kóng, Guá m̄-tsia̍h. Tsóng-.sī, i ê lô͘-po̍k kah tsa-bó͘ lâng hó-tshuì khǹg i, i tsiah thiaⁿ in ê tshuì tuì tē-.ni̍h khí-.lâi, tsē tī tshn̂g-.ni̍h.
English: But he refused, and said, I will not eat. But his servants, together with the woman, constrained him; and he listened to their voice. So he arose from the earth, and sat on the bed.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá tsiū khiā tī phû-tô hn̂g ê e̍h-lō͘, tsit pîng ū tshiûⁿ, hit pîng mā ū tshiûⁿ.
English: Then the angel of Yahweh stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side.

Tailo: Tē-tshit ji̍t sī E-hu-laim kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, A-mi-hut ê kiáⁿ E-lí-sia-mah.
English: On the seventh day Elishama the son of Ammihud, prince of the children of Ephraim

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí sī thòng-khó͘, to̍h-sī uī kiông-pō ê lâng só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê nî-sò͘.
English: The wicked man travails with pain all his days, Even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng se̍h I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tshit ji̍t, in-uī ū sìn-sim, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tsiū tó lo̍h-.khì.
English: By faith, the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been encircled for seven days.

Tailo: Siū buah iû ê ông kóng, Guá beh thuân-ta̍t sìng-tsí, Siōng-tsú bat kā guá kóng, ' Lí sī guá ê kiáⁿ, guá kin-á-ji̍t seⁿ lí.
English: I will tell of the decree. Yahweh said to me, You are my son. Today I have become your father.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tuì i ê hiann-tī ê tiong-kan kíng gō͘ lâng, tshuā in khì kìⁿ Huâ-láu.
English: From among his brothers he took five men, and presented them to Pharaoh.

Tailo: In tsua̍t-tuì bē tit-tio̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tuì in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín ê tē. Só͘-ū khuànn-khin Guá ê lâng lóng bē-tàng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: surely they shall not see the land which I swore to their fathers, neither shall any of those who despised me see it:

Tailo: In tsiū kā i kóng, Lí sī siáⁿ lâng? Tshiáⁿ lí kā guán kóng, thang hō͘ guán huê-hok tshe-phài guán lâi ê lâng. Lí ka-kī kóng lí sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: They said therefore to him, Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?

Tailo: I mā khui in ê hīⁿ-khang lâi siū kà-sī, huan-hù in ua̍t tò tńg-.lâi, lī-khui tsuē-ok.
English: He also opens their ears to instruction, And commands that they return from iniquity.

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê kóng Ho͘h, lí tshám àê lâng, in-uī kiàn-siàu lâi ua̍t tò tńg-.khì.
English: Let them be turned because of their shame Who say, Aha! Aha!

Tailo: Hit ji̍t ê kau-tsiàn tsin hiông, Ap-nel kah I-su-la-el lâng tī Ta-bi̍t ê ping ê bīn-tsîng khah su.
English: The battle was very severe that day: and Abner was beaten, and the men of Israel, before the servants of David.

Tailo: Bô lō͘-īng ê bo̍k-tsiá, khì-sak iûⁿ-kûn ê ū tsai-hō ah! To ē lîm-kàu i ê tshiú kah i ê tsiànn ba̍k. I ê tshiú ē tsuân-pō͘ ko͘-tâ-.khì, i ê tsiànn ba̍k ē o͘-o͘ àm-àm.
English: Woe to the worthless shepherd who leaves the flock! The sword will be on his arm, and on his right eye. His arm will be completely withered, and his right eye will be totally blinded!

Tailo: Lín tsò tiōng-hu ê mā tio̍h kah ka-kī ê hū-jîn-lâng tuà tsò-hué, thé-thiap in jio̍k-thé siōng khah nńg-tsiáⁿ; tio̍h kā in tsun-tiōng, in-uī in mā pêⁿ-pêⁿ kah lín tsò-hué sîng-tsiap Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù ua̍h-miā ê un-tián. Án-ne, lín ê kî-tó tsiah bē tú-tio̍h tsó͘-gāi.
English: You husbands, in like manner, live with your wives according to knowledge, giving honor to the woman, as to the weaker vessel, as being also joint heirs of the grace of life; that your prayers may not be hindered.

Tailo: In-uī in uī ka-kī kah in ê kiáⁿ, tshuā hiah-ê lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, tì-sú sìng ê kiáⁿ-sun kah hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn tsham-tshap; jî-tshiánn siú-líng kah in ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ tsò in ê tsuē-khue.
English: For they have taken of their daughters for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy seed have mixed themselves with the peoples of the lands: yes, the hand of the princes and rulers has been chief in this trespass.

Tailo: Koh tuì Iô-tah hiah-ê siâⁿ tshuā hiah-ê tsè-si tshut-.khì, kā tsè-si sio hiuⁿ ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ uè lah-sap, tuì Ge-bah kàu Bel-sí-bah, mā thiah-huí hiah-ê mn̂g ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī kuán-siâⁿ ê Io-siú-ah ê mn̂g tsîng, to̍h-sī lâng ji̍p siâⁿ mn̂g ê tò pîng.
English: He brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba; and he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man's left hand at the gate of the city.

Tailo: U-lī-a tuì Ta-bi̍t kóng, Iok-kuī kah I-su-la-el í-ki̍p Iô-tah lóng tuà tī tsháu-liâu-á, guá ê tsú Io-ap kah guá ê tsú ê lô͘-po̍k, lóng tsat iâⁿ tī tshân-iá, guá kám thang tò tńg-khì guá ê tshù lim-tsia̍h kah guá ê bó͘ tsò-hué khùn? Guá kí lí ê ua̍h-miā kah lí lîng-hûn ê ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, guá tsua̍t-tuì bô beh tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì!
English: Uriah said to David, The ark, and Israel, and Judah, abide in booths; and my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open field; shall I then go into my house, to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife? as you live, and as your soul lives, I will not do this thing.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê lō͘ tshin-tshiūnn o͘-àm, in kha that-tio̍h mā m̄-tsai siáⁿ-mi̍h guân-in.
English: The way of the wicked is like darkness. They don't know what they stumble over.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ A-li-el khùn-lân, i ē ū pi-siong ai-khàu, tsóng-.sī, guá ē kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī A-li-el.
English: then I will distress Ariel, and there will be mourning and lamentation. She shall be to me as an altar hearth .

Tailo: In-uī guá hiám-hiám pua̍h-tó, guá ê iu-būn tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: For I am ready to fall. My pain is continually before me.

Tailo: Lán tsai Ki-tok í-king tuì sí koh-ua̍h, I bē koh sí, sí bô koh kā I kuán-hat.
English: knowing that Christ, being raised from the dead, dies no more. Death no more has dominion over him!

Tailo: Ki-lō͘-ping lóng tsiūⁿ-.khì; tse sī guá tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ só͘ bat khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê ua̍h-mi̍h.
English: The cherubim mounted up: this is the living creature that I saw by the river Chebar.

Tailo: I-é-su tńg-khì kàu I sîng-tióng ê kò͘-hiong Na-tsa-lia̍t. Tī An-hioh-ji̍t, I tsiàu pîng-siông ê si̍p-kuàn ji̍p-khì huē-tn̂g, khiā khí-lâi teh beh tha̍k king-tián ê tsheh.
English: He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. He entered, as was his custom, into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.

Tailo: I-é-su khuàⁿ-tio̍h hiah tuā-tīn ê lâng, to̍h peh tsiūⁿ suaⁿ. I tsē lo̍h-.khì, bûn-tô͘ tsiū uá-.lâi.
English: Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.

Tailo: Siú-líng koh tuì in kóng, Tio̍h iông-ín in ua̍h lo̍h-.khì. In tsiū án-ne kā huē-tsiòng tsò phuà tshâ kah tshiūⁿ tsuí ê kang-lâng, tsiàu siú-líng só͘ kā in kóng ê uē.
English: The princes said to them, Let them live: so they became wood cutters and drawers of water to all the congregation, as the princes had spoken to them.

Tailo: Sàu-lô koh khah kiaⁿ Ta-bi̍t, Sàu-lô tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsò Ta-bi̍t ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: Saul was yet the more afraid of David; and Saul was David's enemy continually.

Tailo: I-é-su tī sìng-tiān kà-sī lâng, tī hōng-hiàn-siuⁿ ê piⁿ-á kóng tsiah-ê uē, mā bô lâng kā I lia̍h, in-uī I ê sî iáu-buē kàu.
English: Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as he taught in the temple. Yet no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tsīn-la̍t tshiùⁿ kua, īng khîm, sik, lô, kó͘ kah kó͘-tshue, tsàu ga̍k thiàu-bú.
English: David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with tambourines, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.

Tailo: Nn̄g-ê ông tsò-hué tsō tsûn beh khì Tal-si-sih, tsiū tī E-tsióng-ge-bel tsō tsûn.
English: and he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish; and they made the ships in Ezion Geber.

Tailo: Tiōng-hu iáu ua̍h-.leh ê sî, hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tio̍h siū sok-pa̍k; tiōng-hu nā sí-.khì, i thang tsū-iû kè i só͘ ì-ài ê lâng, to̍k-to̍k tio̍h kè hō͘ sìn Tsú ê lâng tsiah thang.
English: A wife is bound by law for as long as her husband lives; but if the husband is dead, she is free to be married to whoever she desires, only in the Lord.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng huâi-īn beh seⁿ ê sî, tsiū kiáu-ká, tī thòng-khó͘ ê sî, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah. Siōng-tsú ah, guán tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng mā sī án-ne.
English: Like as a woman with child, who draws near the time of her delivery, is in pain and cries out in her pangs; so we have been before you, Yahweh.

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p lâng tsiū tok-tsik I-su-la-el lâng tsò khó͘-kang,
English: The Egyptians ruthlessly made the children of Israel serve,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Mô͘-se kah A-lông siū-tiàu tò tńg-lâi kìnn Huâ-láu, Huâ-láu kā in kóng, Lín khì ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè; to̍k-to̍k hiah-ê siūⁿ beh khì ê, tàu-té sī siáⁿ-mi̍h khuán lâng?
English: Moses and Aaron were brought again to Pharaoh, and he said to them, Go, serve Yahweh your God; but who are those who will go?

Tailo: Lí ê kám-siā sī hó, m̄-koh, bô hō͘ lâng tit-tio̍h tsō-tsiū.
English: For you most assuredly give thanks well, but the other person is not built up.

Tailo: I tio̍h khan gû-káng-á kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī gû-káng-á ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng thâi hit tsiah gû-káng-á.
English: He shall bring the bull to the door of the Tent of Meeting before Yahweh; and he shall lay his hand on the head of the bull, and kill the bull before Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuì siâⁿ mn̂g king-kuè, tsún-pī jîn-bîn ê lō͘; thūn kuân-tuā lō͘, tû-khì tsio̍h-thâu, uī-tio̍h lia̍t kok khiā tuā kî.
English: Go through, go through the gates; prepare you the way of the people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a banner for the peoples.

Tailo: Tē iáu tsûn-tsāi ê sî, tsai-tsìng kah siu-sîng, kuâⁿ kah jua̍h, kuâⁿ-thiⁿ kah jua̍h-thinn, ji̍t kah mê, lóng bô-hioh.
English: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá tī khòng-iá ê tō͘-kháu thìng-hāu tuì lí hia ū siau-sit lâi, pò guá tsai-iáⁿ si̍t-tsîng.
English: Behold, I will stay at the fords of the wilderness, until word comes from you to inform me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh kah I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn í-ki̍p Iô-tah ke li̍p sin ê iok,
English: Behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah:

Tailo: Siōng-tè huat-tshut luî ê siann tsin kî-biāu; I kiânn tuā sū hō͘ lán bē tshik-to̍k tit.
English: God thunders marvelously with his voice. He does great things, which we can't comprehend.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông Ta-bi̍t ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng ê Tsim-giân.
English: The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:

Tailo: Khuànn-khin Guá ê miâ ê tsè-si, bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú tuì lín kóng: Kiáⁿ tsun-kìng i ê lāu-pē, lô͘-po̍k tsun-kìng i ê tsú-lâng; Guá nā tsò pē, Guá tī tó-uī tit-tio̍h tsun-kìng? Guá nā tsò tsú-lâng, Guá tī tó-uī tit-tio̍h kìng-uì? Lín tsiū kóng, ' Guán tī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì khuànn-khin Lí ê miâ? '
English: A son honors his father, and a servant his master. If I am a father, then where is my honor? And if I am a master, where is the respect due me? Says Yahweh of Armies to you, priests, who despise my name. You say, How have we despised your name?'

Tailo: Ū thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu ê, i ê saⁿ-khò͘ tio̍h thiah-li̍h, i ê thâu-mn̂g tio̍h phah-suàⁿ, am i ê tshuì ê tíng-tûn, tuā-siaⁿ huah, ' Bô tshing-khì, bô tshing-khì. '
English: The leper in whom the plague is shall wear torn clothes, and the hair of his head shall hang loose. He shall cover his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean! Unclean!'

Tailo: Bô lâng khuàⁿ-kò͘ lí, kā lí tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, mā bô lâng liân-bín lí; lí tshut-sì ê ji̍t hō͘ lâng hiat tī tshân-iá, sī in-uī lí hō͘ lâng thó-ià.
English: No eye pitied you, to do any of these things to you, to have compassion on you; but you were cast out in the open field, for that your person was abhorred, in the day that you were born.

Tailo: In lóng sio-siâng tó tī thô͘-.ni̍h, hō͘ thâng khàm ba̍t.
English: They lie down alike in the dust, The worm covers them.

Tailo: Tse-bú-lông kiáⁿ-sun ê tsi-tso̍k, ū siú-líng Phàⁿ-la̍p ê kiáⁿ I-lī-sat-huan.
English: Of the tribe of the children of Zebulun a prince, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tsiū tsiàu Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng, tuì Pa-lân ê khòng-iá tshe in khì, in lóng sī I-su-la-el lâng ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ.
English: Moses sent them from the wilderness of Paran according to the commandment of Yahweh: all of them men who were heads of the children of Israel.

Tailo: I-é-su ê miâ-siaⁿ suî-sî thuân kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê ta̍k só͘-tsāi.
English: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k lín kìng-uì Guá ê miâ ê lâng, ē ū kong-gī ê ji̍t khí-lâi tsiò lín, i ê kng-suàⁿ（ tsù, guân-bûn sīsi̍t） ū i-tī ê kong-hāu, lín ē tshut-lâi tiô-thiàu, tshin-tshiūnn gû-tiâu lāi puî ê gû-á.
English: But to you who fear my name shall the sun of righteousness arise with healing in its wings. You will go out, and leap like calves of the stall.

Tailo: Só͘-í, nā tsia̍h-mi̍h ē hō͘ guá ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ê sìn-gióng siū tsó͘-gāi, guá tsua̍t-tuì m̄-tsia̍h tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, tsiah bián hō͘ in tī sìn-gióng siōng pua̍h-tó.
English: Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will eat no meat forevermore, that I don't cause my brother to stumble.

Tailo: E-sáu ê kiáⁿ só͘ seⁿ, tsò tso̍k-tiúⁿ ê, kì tī ē-té : E-sáu ê tuā-kiáⁿ E-lī-huat ê kiáⁿ, ū Thê-man tso̍k-tiúⁿ, O͘-mal tso̍k-tiúⁿ, Tse-pho tso̍k-tiúⁿ, Ke-ná-juh tso̍k-tiúⁿ,
English: These are the chiefs of the sons of Esau: the sons of Eliphaz the firstborn of Esau: chief Teman, chief Omar, chief Zepho, chief Kenaz,

Tailo: Bîn-á-tsá-khí, lín tio̍h tsiàu lín ê tsi-tso̍k kiâⁿ uá-.lâi; Siōng-tsú só͘ tshú ê tsi-tso̍k, tio̍h tsiàu tsong-tso̍k kiâⁿ uá-.lâi; Siōng-tsú só͘ tshú ê tsong-tso̍k, tio̍h tsiàu ka-kuàn kiâⁿ uá-.lâi; Siōng-tsú só͘ tshú ê ka-kuàn, tio̍h tsiàu jîn-ting, tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê kiâⁿ uá-.lâi.
English: In the morning therefore you shall be brought near by your tribes: and it shall be, that the tribe which Yahweh takes shall come near by families; and the family which Yahweh shall take shall come near by households; and the household which Yahweh shall take shall come near man by man.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ kā I kóng, Lí khuànn, kui tīn lâng teh kā Lí e-kheh, ná ē mn̄g kóng, siáⁿ lâng ū bong guá?
English: His disciples said to him, You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, Who touched me?'

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tuì I-su-la-el lâng kóng, Siōng-tsú — lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ê tē, lín iân-tshiân m̄-khì tshú, beh kàu tang-sî?
English: Joshua said to the children of Israel, How long are you slack to go in to possess the land, which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you?

Tailo: Tuì siā-un-tsè ê tiong-kan, tio̍h kā hué-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, īng khàm pak-lāi ê iû kah pak-lāi só͘-ū ê iû,
English: He shall offer of the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to Yahweh; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards,

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tiong nā ū lâng tshò-gō͘ huān tsuē, kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng m̄-thang kiânn ê tsi̍t hāng sū, tì-sú ū tsuē,
English: If anyone of the common people sins unwittingly, in doing any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done, and is guilty;

Tailo: Bô Mô͘-se lu̍t-huat ê guā-pang lâng nā tsiàu pún-sìng tsun-hîng lu̍t-huat ê kui-tīng, in pún-sin to̍h-sī ka-kī ê lu̍t-huat.
English: (for when Gentiles who don't have the law do by nature the things of the law, these, not having the law, are a law to themselves,

Tailo: In mā kuáⁿ-tshut tsin-tsē kuí, īng iû buah tsin tsē pēnn-lâng, kā in i hó.
English: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

Tailo: Guān in tshin-tshiūnn tshù tíng ê tsháu, iáu-buē tuā tsâng to̍h ta-.khì;
English: Let them be as the grass on the housetops, Which withers before it grows up;

Tailo: Lí ê tshù-piⁿ an-jiân tuà tī lí ê hū-kīn, lí m̄-thang siat-kè lâi hāi i.
English: Don't devise evil against your neighbor, Seeing he dwells securely by you.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ guá ê lâng, guá mā thiàⁿ i; khún-tshiat tsáu-tshuē guá ê lâng, ē tshuē-.tio̍h.
English: I love those who love me. Those who seek me diligently will find me.

Tailo: Hit-ê hū-jîn-lâng khiā tī I-é-su ê āu-bīn teh thî-khàu, ū ba̍k-sái tih-tâm I-é-su ê kha. I tsiū īng ka-kī ê thâu-mn̂g lâi tshit, koh tsia̍p-tsia̍p tsim I-é-su ê kha, īng phang-iû lâi buah kha.
English: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

Tailo: Só͘-ū tuà tī Lu̍h-tah kah Sat-lûn ê lâng lóng ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne, tsiū lâi kui Tsú.
English: All who lived at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia kî-tha ê tāi-tsì kah i ê hó só͘ kiâⁿ, lóng kì tī A-mô͘-su ê kiáⁿ I-sá-iah sian-ti bi̍k-sī ê tsheh kah Iô-tah I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k.
English: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and his good deeds, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz, in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

Tailo: I tuà i só͘ khioh ê ji̍p siâⁿ, hō͘ i ê ta-ke khuànn, mā kā i tsia̍h pá só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê the̍h tshut-lâi hō͘ ta-ke tsia̍h.
English: She took it up, and went into the city; and her mother-in-law saw what she had gleaned: and she brought forth and gave to her that which she had left after she was sufficed.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h īng ní âng ê iûⁿ-káng phuê, tsò pò͘-pênn ê kuà, koh īng hái-káu phuê tī tíng-bīn tsò kuà.
English: You shall make a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.

Tailo: In ìn Io-siú-ah kóng, In-uī ū lâng khak-si̍t pò lí ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè bat bīng-līng I ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se, kā tsit-ê tsuân tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín, mā tī lín ê thâu-tsîng tsâu-bia̍t tuà tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn, só͘-í, guán in-uī lín ê iân-kò͘, khióng-kiaⁿ bô miā, tsiah tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: They answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told your servants, how that Yahweh your God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you; therefore we were sore afraid for our lives because of you, and have done this thing.

Tailo: Ga̍t tsiū lâi kìnn Ta-bi̍t, kā i kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí tio̍h ka-kī kíng,
English: So Gad came to David, and said to him, Thus says Yahweh, Take which you will:

Tailo: In thâi-sí kuáⁿ-hū kah tshut-guā lâng, koh hāi-sí ko͘-jî.
English: They kill the widow and the alien, And murder the fatherless.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsuí miâ kiò-tsò Me-lí-bah ê tsuí, sī in-uī I-su-la-el lâng kah Siōng-tsú kè-kàu, Siōng-tsú tsiū tuì in hián-bîng ka-kī tsò sìng.
English: These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with Yahweh, and he was sanctified in them.

Tailo: Bat Lí ê miâ ê lâng ē uá-khò Lí; in-uī Siōng-tsú Lí m̄-bat khì-sak tsáu-tshuē Lí ê lâng.
English: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, For you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

Tailo: In-uī Lí bat tsò guá tô-siám ê só͘-tsāi, tsò guá kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ-pó lâi hō͘ guá thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k.
English: For you have been a refuge for me, A strong tower from the enemy.

Tailo: Bô-lūn siáⁿ lâng uî-puē lí ê bīng-līng, m̄-thiaⁿ lí ê uē, tsiàu lí it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng ê, tsiū beh hō͘ i sí. Tsóng-.sī, lí tio̍h ióng-kám tsòng-táⁿ!
English: Whoever he be who shall rebel against your commandment, and shall not listen to your words in all that you command him, he shall be put to death: only be strong and of good courage.

Tailo: I ē tī só͘ uá-khò ê pò͘-pênn siū pue̍h tshut-.lâi, ah-kàu thang kiaⁿ ê ông hia.
English: He shall be rooted out of his tent where he trusts. He shall be brought to the king of terrors.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t koh huan-hù I-su-la-el ê tsìng siú-líng lâi pang-tsān i ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng, kóng,
English: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,

Tailo: Tsè-si tsiū hō͘ tsa-bó͘ lâng īng tsiù-tsó͘ lâi tsiù-tsuā, tsè-si tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, ' Siōng-tsú hō͘ lí ê tuā-thuí nuā, pak-tó͘ tiùⁿ ê sî, guān Siōng-tsú hō͘ lí tī lí ê jîn-bîn tiong tsiâⁿ-tsò tsiù-tsó͘, tsiâⁿ-tsò tsiù-tsuā ê uē-pèⁿ;
English: then the priest shall cause the woman to swear with the oath of cursing, and the priest shall tell the woman, Yahweh make you a curse and an oath among your people, when Yahweh allows your thigh to fall away, and your body to swell;

Tailo: Guá bat īng guá ê tshuì kiû-kiò I; īng guá ê tsi̍h o-ló I, tsun I tsò kuân.
English: I cried to him with my mouth. He was extolled with my tongue.

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng hiah-ê tuā-tsè-si, ta̍k nî tio̍h īng gû kah iûⁿ ê hueh ji̍p-khì tsì-sìng-só͘; Ki-tok m̄-bián tsi̍t pái koh tsi̍t pái hiàn ka-kī pún-sin.
English: nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest enters into the holy place year by year with blood not his own,

Tailo: Kiânn tsit khuán tāi-tsì ê lâng, guān Siōng-tsú tuì Iâ-kop ê pò͘-pênn tiong, tû-khì i só͘-ū ê lâng, á-.sī kiò-tshéⁿ lâng ê（ Tsù, tsí tsè-si ）, á-.sī ìn-tap lâng ê（ Tsù, tsí king-ha̍k kàu-su ）, í-ki̍p hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê.
English: Yahweh will cut off, to the man who does this, him who wakes and him who answers, out of the tents of Jacob, and him who offers an offering to Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah kā in kiânn kat-lé ê iân-kò͘, sī in-uī tuì Ai-gi̍p tshut-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, kiàn-nā ē kau-tsiàn ê tsa-po͘ ting, tshut Ai-gi̍p í-āu tī lō͘-.ni̍h sí tī khòng-iá.
English: This is the cause why Joshua did circumcise: all the people who came forth out of Egypt, who were males, even all the men of war, died in the wilderness by the way, after they came forth out of Egypt.

Tailo: I ē tuà tī kuân ê só͘-tsāi; kian-kò͘ ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ ē tsò i ê siâⁿ-pó; ē ū bí-niûⁿ kiong-kip i, i ê tsuí it-tīng bē tsua̍t-tn̄g.
English: He will dwell on high. His place of defense will be the fortress of rocks. His bread will be supplied. His waters will be sure.

Tailo: I koh tuì guá kóng, ' Lí ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng ē khí Guá ê tiān kah Guá ê īⁿ, in-uī Guá kíng i tsò Guá ê kiáⁿ, Guá mā beh tsò i ê pē.
English: He said to me, Solomon your son, he shall build my house and my courts; for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tuì jîn-bîn kóng, Lín bē-tàng ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú, in-uī I sī sìng ê Siōng-tè, tsua̍t-tuì bô iông-ín īng pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng kah I phit-phuè, bô beh sià-bián lín ê kuè-sit, lín ê tsuē-ok.
English: Joshua said to the people, You can't serve Yahweh; for he is a holy God; he is a jealous God; he will not forgive your disobedience nor your sins.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông khuànn phue liáu-āu, tsiū thiah-li̍h i ê saⁿ, kóng, Guá kám sī Siōng-tsú, ē-tàng hō͘ lâng sí, hō͘ lâng ua̍h? Tsit-ê lâng kìng-jiân tshe lâng lâi guá tsia kah guá i hó i ê thái-ko. Tshiánn lín tsim-tsiok siūⁿ, khuànn tsit-ê lâng án-tsuáⁿ tshuē phāng beh lâi kong-kik guá.
English: It happened, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he tore his clothes, and said, Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man does send to me to recover a man of his leprosy? but consider, I pray you, and see how he seeks a quarrel against me.

Tailo: I ê uē, lí m̄-thang ke-thinn; khióng-kiaⁿ I ē kā lí tsik-pī, lí tsiū hián-bîng sī teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: Don't you add to his words, Lest he reprove you, and you be found a liar.

Tailo: A-ta̍t gue̍h tsa̍p-saⁿ kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tsa̍p-sì an-hioh, īng tsit ji̍t siat iàn-si̍k tsò huann-hí ê ji̍t.
English: This was done on the thirteenth day of the month Adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same they rested, and made it a day of feasting and gladness.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, tsóng-kóng tsi̍t kù, hiah-ê tsin-si̍t ê, khó-kìng ê, kong-gī ê, tshing-kiat ê, thang thiàⁿ ê, hó miâ-siaⁿ ê, hó tik-hīng ê, thang o-ló ê, lín lóng tio̍h sî-sî khik-khik tì-ì tī sim-lāi.
English: Finally, brothers, whatever things are true, whatever things are honorable, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report; if there is any virtue, and if there is any praise, think about these things.

Tailo: Tshiū-nâ tshun bô kuí tsâng tshiū-á, gín-á mā ē-hiáu kì i ê sò͘-gia̍h.
English: The remnant of the trees of his forest shall be few, so that a child could write their number.

Tailo: koh tuì Biat-gil-gal, mā tuì Ge-bah kah A-tsu-má-biat ê tshân lâi, in-uī tshiùⁿ kua ê lâng tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm sì-kho͘-uî uī ka-kī kiàn-li̍p tsng-thâu.
English: also from Beth Gilgal, and out of the fields of Geba and Azmaveth: for the singers had built them villages round about Jerusalem.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat tsō Tal-si-sih ê tsûn-tsiah, beh khì O͘-huil ūn kim lâi; tsóng-.sī, bô-.khì, in-uī tsûn tī E-tsióng-ge-bel phah-phuà.
English: Jehoshaphat made ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold: but they didn't go; for the ships were broken at Ezion Geber.

Tailo: Guá kóng, Ai-ah, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, Lí tsin-tsiàⁿ sī tuā-tuā khi-phiàn tsiah-ê jîn-bîn kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm, kā in kóng, ' Lín ē tit-tio̍h pîng-an', kî-si̍t to-kiàm hāi-tio̍h in ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Then said I, Ah, Lord Yahweh! surely you have greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, You shall have peace; whereas the sword reaches to the life.

Tailo: Thuî-á i sǹg-tsò tiū-tsháu; lâng bú-lāng tshiuⁿ, i tsiū thí-tshiò.
English: Clubs are counted as stubble. He laughs at the rushing of the javelin.

Tailo: Mo-tsah seⁿ Bi-ne-ah, Bi-ne-ah seⁿ Le-hua-iah, Le-hua-iah ê kiáⁿ sī Ê-lī-a-tsal, Ê-lī-a-tsal ê kiáⁿ sī Ak-sil.
English: and Moza became the father of Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ tuì hia king-kuè Ga-lí-la-iah síng, I-é-su bô ài lâng tsai I tī tó-uī.
English: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn't want anyone to know it.

Tailo: Tī Iol-tàn hô guā, Pik-pí-jíⁿ tuì-bīn ê suaⁿ-kok tiong, tī He-si-bóng tuà A-mô͘-lī ông Si-hông ê tē, to̍h-sī Mô͘-se kah I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p liáu-āu só͘ phah-pāi ê.
English: beyond the Jordan, in the valley over against Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel struck, when they came forth out of Egypt.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín kî-tó ê sî tio̍h án-ne kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ah, guān Lí ê miâ sìng, Lí ê kok lîm-kàu.
English: He said to them, When you pray, say, Our Father in heaven, May your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on Earth, as it is in heaven.

Tailo: Lia̍t kok tuā siū-khì, Lí mā tuā siū-khì. Sí-lâng siū sím-phuàⁿ ê sî-kî kàu à. Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, to̍h-sī hiah-ê sian-ti kah tsìng sìn-tô͘ í-ki̍p kìng-uì Lí ê miâ ê, bô-lūn tuā-sè, Lí pò-siúⁿ in ê sî-kî kàu à. Hiah-ê pāi-huāi tāi-tē ê lâng siū Lí huí-bia̍t ê sî-kî kàu à.
English: The nations were angry, and your wrath came, as did the time for the dead to be judged, and to give your bondservants the prophets, their reward, as well as to the saints, and those who fear your name, to the small and the great; and to destroy those who destroy the earth.

Tailo: In mā khì-sak I ê lu̍t-lē, í-ki̍p I kah in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ li̍p ê iok kah tuì in só͘ kiàn-tsìng ê kiàn-tsìng, khì tsun-thàn hi-ké, lâi ka-kī tsò hi-ké, o̍h sì-kho͘-uî ê guā-pang lâng, hiah-ê lâng to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú bat bīng-līng in m̄-thang o̍h in ê só͘ kiâⁿ ê.
English: They rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified to them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and went after the nations that were round about them, concerning whom Yahweh had charged those who they should not do like them.

Tailo: Tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì kiânn ê sī Siōng-tsú, kè-uē lâi kiàn-li̍p ê mā sī I, I-é-ho-bah sī I ê miâ.
English: Thus says Yahweh who does it, Yahweh who forms it to establish it; Yahweh is his name:

Tailo: A-sel ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ miâ kiò-tsò Se-la̍h.
English: The name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.

Tailo: I-é-su khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ìn-liáu tsin sik-tòng, tsiū kā i kóng, Lí lī Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ bô hn̄g à. Tuì hit sî khí, bô lâng káⁿ koh mn̄g I-é-su siáⁿ-mi̍h būn-tê.
English: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, You are not far from the Kingdom of God. No one dared ask him any question after that.

Tailo: Guá tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá ê thê-ô͘-tsiáu; mā tshin-tshiūnn pha-hng só͘-tsāi ê àm-kong-tsiáu.
English: I am like a pelican of the wilderness. I have become as an owl of the waste places.

Tailo: In king-kuè lâu ba̍k-sái ê suaⁿ-kok, hō͘ i piàn-tsò tsuí-tsuâⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, koh ū tshiu-thinn ê hō͘ hō͘ i tshiong-muá hok-khì.
English: Passing through the valley of Weeping, they make it a place of springs. Yes, the autumn rain covers it with blessings.

Tailo: Tng Ba-bú-lông ông Bel-sia-tsal guân nî, Ta-ni-el tī tshn̂g-.ni̍h bāng-kìnn, sim-lāi ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng, i tsiū kā hit-ê bāng siá lo̍h-.lâi, koh kóng-khí kî-tiong ê tāi-ì.
English: In the first year of Belshazzar king of Babylon Daniel had a dream and visions of his head on his bed: then he wrote the dream and told the sum of the matters.

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū kì-tsài, guá beh siau-bia̍t tì-huī ê lâng ê tì-huī, Mā beh khì-sak tshong-bîng ê lâng ê tshong-bîng. (tsù, ISI 29:14)
English: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, I will bring the discernment of the discerning to nothing.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, ū lâng kā A-bu-la-hàm kóng, Mil-kah kā lí ê sió-tī Na-khool seⁿ kiáⁿ,
English: It happened after these things, that it was told Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she also has borne children to your brother Nahor:

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín sī lâi-kàu Si-óng suaⁿ, íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tè ê siâⁿ, thinn-tíng ê Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tī hia ū tshing-tshing bān-bān ê thiⁿ-sài.
English: But you have come to Mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to innumerable multitudes of angels,

Tailo: Koh ū hiah-.kú, tò tńg-lâi beh tshuā i, uat tuì lō͘ piⁿ beh khuànn sí-.khì ê sai, khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū tsi̍t siū phang kah bi̍t tī sai ê sin-si lāi-té,
English: After a while he returned to take her; and he turned aside to see the carcass of the lion: and behold, there was a swarm of bees in the body of the lion, and honey.

Tailo: Lí ê kiong lóng lō͘-tshut, tuì tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê lóng sī tsin-si̍t ê uē. [Sè-la̍h] Lí īng kang-hô kā tāi-tē hun-khui.
English: You uncovered your bow. You called for your sworn arrows. Selah. You split the earth with rivers.

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ Su-ke-uah ê tshit-ê kiáⁿ, mā teh tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì.
English: There were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, who did this.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng mn̄g Iô-há-neh kóng, Án-ne, guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò khah hó?
English: The multitudes asked him, What then must we do?

Tailo: In beh suan-iông Lí ki̍k tuā ê un-tián, mā beh tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Lí ê kong-gī.
English: They will utter the memory of your great goodness, And will sing of your righteousness.

Tailo: I tshe lâng piàn kiâⁿ Má-ná-se, Má-ná-se lâng mā tsū-tsi̍p lâi tuè i. I koh tshe lâng khì kìⁿ A-sel lâng, Tse-bú-lông lâng kah Ná-hu-tha-lím lâng, in mā lóng khí-lâi kah in liân-ha̍p.
English: He sent messengers throughout all Manasseh; and they also were gathered together after him: and he sent messengers to Asher, and to Zebulun, and to Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.

Tailo: I ē kóng, ' Guá kā lín kóng, guá m̄-tsai lín tuì tó-uī lâi, lín tsiah-ê tsò put-gī tāi-tsì ê lâng lóng tio̍h lī-khui guá. '
English: He will say, I tell you, I don't know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.'

Tailo: I tuì tîn-ai kí-khí sàn-tshiah lâng, tuì pùn-sò-tui thê-pua̍t khiàm-khueh ê lâng,
English: He raises up the poor out of the dust. Lifts up the needy from the ash heap;

Tailo: Uàn-hūn lâng ê, i tshuì kóng phô͘-tháⁿ ê uē, tsóng-.sī, sim-lāi khǹg kuí-tsà.
English: A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, But he harbors evil in his heart.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ sì-bīn ê hong tuì thiⁿ ê sì-bīn tshue-.lâi, lîm-kàu Ê-lám lâng, kā in kuáⁿ-suàⁿ khì tī sì-hng. Ê-lám siū kuáⁿ-suàⁿ ê lâng bô tsi̍t kok bô kàu.
English: On Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of the sky, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation where the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh khuàⁿ-tio̍h Biān-iá-mín kah in tsò-hué lâi, tsiū tuì kuán-ke ê kóng, Tshuā tsiah-ê lâng khì tshù lāi, thâi tsing-seⁿ, tsún-pī iàn-si̍k, in-uī tiong-tàu guá beh kah tsiah-ê lâng tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the steward of his house, Bring the men into the house, and butcher an animal, and make ready; for the men will dine with me at noon.

Tailo: Guá sī tsun-tsiàu guá tuì Thiⁿ-pē hia khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi kóng; lín sī tuì lín ê pē hia thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi tsò.
English: I say the things which I have seen with my Father; and you also do the things which you have seen with your father.

Tailo: Īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò kǹg, īng kim pau khí-.lâi.
English: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.

Tailo: kî-si̍t guá bô iông-ín guá ê tshuì huān tsuē, tsiù-tsó͘ kiû hō͘ in sí;
English: (Yes, I have not allowed my mouth to sin By asking his life with a curse);

Tailo: Tī Ai-gi̍p tsuân tē, kiàn-nā tī tshân-.ni̍h ê, bô-lūn lâng á-.sī tsing-seⁿ, lóng hō͘ pha̍uh phah, pha̍uh mā phah tshân-.ni̍h só͘-ū ê tshài-se, koh phah-tn̄g tshân-.ni̍h só͘-ū ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: The hail struck throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and animal; and the hail struck every herb of the field, and broke every tree of the field.

Tailo: In-uī guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn seⁿ kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê siann, tshin-tshiūnn seⁿ tuā-kiáⁿ ê kan-khó͘, to̍h-sī Si-óng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê siann, i tshuán tuā khuì, thí-khui tshiú, kóng, Guá ū tsai-hō à, in-uī guá ê sîn-hûn uī-tio̍h thâi lâng ê lâi hūn-.khì.
English: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, the anguish as of her who brings forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, who gasps for breath, who spreads her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul faints before the murderers.

Tailo: E-sáu ê kiáⁿ, E-lī-huat, Liû-el, E-ú-sih, ngá-lân, Khó-la̍h.
English: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.

Tailo: Tsú I-é-su kā in kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, tsiū siū tsiap tsiūⁿ thiⁿ, tsē tī Siōng-tè ê tsiànn pîng.
English: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong i ê bah ê lâng ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng, i ê hueh nā hiù tī siáⁿ-mi̍h saⁿ-khò͘ ê tíng-bīn, só͘ hiù-tio̍h hit niá, lí tio̍h tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi sé.
English: Whatever shall touch its flesh shall be holy. When there is any of its blood sprinkled on a garment, you shall wash that on which it was sprinkled in a holy place.

Tailo: I tuì tíng-bīn tshun tshiú khiú guá, tuì tuā-tsuí tiong khan guá khí-.lâi.
English: He sent from on high, he took me; He drew me out of many waters;

Tailo: I koh thê-khí kua, kóng: Ai-ah, Siōng-tè kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì ê sî, siáⁿ lâng ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h?
English: He took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God does this?

Tailo: Tī Tse-ti-kiah ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, thâi-sí Tse-ti-kiah hiah-ê kiáⁿ, koh iah Tse-ti-kiah nn̄g luí ba̍k-tsiu, īng thih-liān kā i liān khí-.lâi, kā i ah-kàu Ba-bú-lông.
English: They killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon.

Tailo: I-é-su thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê pēⁿ bē tì-kàu sí, tse sī uī-tio̍h beh hián-bîng Siōng-tè ê îng-kng, hō͘ Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ tuì tsit-ê tāi-tsì tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: But when Jesus heard it, he said, This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that God's Son may be glorified by it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá ê khîm piàn-tsò pi-ai ê im, guá ê siau piàn-tsò thî-khàu ê siann.
English: Therefore is my harp turned to mourning, And my pipe into the voice of those who weep.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tuì Mô͘-se ai-kiû, Mô͘-se tsiū kî-kiû Siōng-tsú, hit-ê hué tsiū sit.
English: The people cried to Moses; and Moses prayed to Yahweh, and the fire abated.

Tailo: I koh tuì guá kóng, Lí tio̍h tuì tsiah-ê kut-thâu suan-pò͘, lâi kā in kóng: Lín ko͘-tâ ê kut, tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōng-tsú ê uē.
English: Again he said to me, Prophesy over these bones, and tell them, you dry bones, hear the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ná ē ua̍h-.leh, tsia̍h tn̂g huè-siū, sè-li̍k kiông-sīng?
English: Why do the wicked live, Become old, yes, and grow mighty in power?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú kóng, E-hu-laim, Guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi lí? Iô-tah, Guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi lí? In-uī lí ê siān-liông tshin-tshiūnn tsá-khí sî ê hûn-bū, koh tshin-tshiūnn tsin kín ta ê lō͘-tsuí.
English: Ephraim, what shall I do to you? Judah, what shall I do to you? For your love is like a morning cloud, And like the dew that disappears early.

Tailo: I ê tsiàⁿ tshiú ū tn̂g huè-siū, i ê tò tshiú ū hó-gia̍h kah tsun-kuì.
English: Length of days is in her right hand. In her left hand are riches and honor.

Tailo: Tse sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lâng bîng-pi̍k, Siōng-tè beh siúⁿ-sù hong-sīng ê îng-iāu, hō͘ hiah-ê tit-tio̍h liân-bín ê lâng, to̍h-sī Siōng-tè só͘ ī-tīng, beh lâi niá-siū I ê îng-kng ê hiah-ê lâng.
English: and that he might make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy, which he prepared beforehand for glory,

Tailo: Tī ông-kiong lāi ê thài-kàm — Kú-si̍t lâng E-bia̍t-me-li̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h in kā I-é-lí-miah luī-lo̍h tséⁿ （ hit sî, ông tsē tī Biān-iá-mín mn̂g-kháu ）.
English: Now when Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, who was in the king's house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon (the king then sitting in the gate of Benjamin),

Tailo: Koh ē tsiūⁿ-khì lí kah lí ê jîn-bîn, í-ki̍p lí tsìng jîn-sîn ê sing-khu. '
English: and the frogs shall come up both on you, and on your people, and on all your servants.'

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Khí-.lâi, giâ lí ê pho͘-á khí-lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Jesus said to him, Arise, take up your mat, and walk.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Tng hit ji̍t, lí ē kiû-kiò Guá kóng: Guá ê tiōng-hu bô koh kiû-kiò guá kóng: Guá ê Tsú ah;
English: It will be in that day, says Yahweh, That you will call me my husband,' And no longer call me my master.'

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tuì ki-lō͘-ping hia tsiūⁿ-.khì, thîng tī tiān ê hō͘-tīng ê tíng-bīn; tiān ū hûn muá-muá, hit-ê īⁿ mā hō͘ Siōng-tsú îng-kng ê tshàn-lān tshiong-muá.
English: The glory of Yahweh mounted up from the cherub, and stood over the threshold of the house; and the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was full of the brightness of Yahweh's glory.

Tailo: In-uī guá beh tuì in ê tshuì tû-khì tsiah-ê Ba-al ê miâ, bô koh īng tsit-ê miâ kì-liām i.
English: For I will take away the names of the Baals out of her mouth, And they will no longer be mentioned by name.

Tailo: Tuì I ê phīⁿ-khang ū ian tshìng tshut-.khì, tuì I ê tshuì ū tshut sio-bia̍t ê hué, thuàⁿ tsiū án-ne to̍h khí-.lâi.
English: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, Fire out of his mouth devoured: Coals were kindled by it.

Tailo: I-su-la-el kun-tuī tsiah-ê siū lia̍h ê ē tit-tio̍h sio̍k Ka-nân lâng ê tē, it-ti̍t kàu Tsa-le-phat; tuà tī Se-hual-la̍h siū lia̍h ê Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng ē tit-tio̍h lâm-hong ê siâⁿ.
English: The captives of this army of the children of Israel, who are among the Canaanites, will possess even to Zarephath; and the captives of Jerusalem, who are in Sepharad, will possess the cities of the Negev.

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn luân-bō͘ Siōng-tsú ê tiān-īⁿ kàu beh hūn-.khì; guá ê sim-tn̂g, guá ê jio̍k-thé, ǹg ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú kiû-kiò.
English: My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of Yahweh. My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, M̄-bat thiaⁿ-kuè I ê sìn-sit ê lâng ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I; m̄-bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê lâng ē bîng-pi̍k I. (tsù, ISI 52:15)
English: But, as it is written, They will see, to whom no news of him came. They who haven't heard will understand.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē ê un-sù m̄-sī beh hō͘ sìn-tô͘, sī beh hō͘ bô sìn ê lâng tsò kì-hō; thuân hok-im ê un-sù m̄-sī beh hō͘ bô sìn ê lâng, sī beh hō͘ sìn-tô͘ tsò kì-hō.
English: Therefore other languages are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to the unbelieving; but prophesying is for a sign, not to the unbelieving, but to those who believe.

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t tsí Biān-iá-mín lâng Kú-si̍t ê uē, ǹg Siōng-tsú tshiùⁿ kua; tiāu īng Si-ga-ióng）（ Tsù, tan-sò͘ hîng, Ha-bá-kok su 3:1 ê Si-gi-io-nah sī ho̍k-sò͘ hîng ） Siōng-tsú — guá ê Siōng-tè ah, guá uá-khò Lí; kiû Lí kiù guá thuat-lī só͘-ū jiok guá ê lâng, kiù guá tshut-.lâi.
English: Yahweh, my God, I take refuge in you. Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,

Tailo: Kng toh ji̍p-.khì, pâi-siat tíng-bīn ê mi̍h. Kng ting-tâi ji̍p-.khì, tiám i ê ting.
English: You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the lampstand, and light the lamps of it.

Tailo: Ná ē in-uī guán lāu-pē bô kiáⁿ, tsiū kā i ê miâ tuì i ê tso̍k tiong tû-.khì? Tshiánn tī guán lāu-pē ê hiann-tī tiong pun sán-gia̍p hō͘ guán.
English: Why should the name of our father be taken away from among his family, because he had no son? Give to us a possession among the brothers of our father.

Tailo: Ū uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng-tio̍h só͘-ū tuà tī Ai-gi̍p tē ê Iô-tah lâng, to̍h-sī tuà tī Mik-tol, Ta̍k-pe-neh, Nó͘-hu, Pa-thó-loh ê kíng lāi ê Iô-tah lâng, kóng,
English: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews who lived in the land of Egypt, who lived at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Memphis, and in the country of Pathros, saying,

Tailo: I ē tī lia̍t pang tiong lâi sím-phuàⁿ, I ē hō͘ sin-si phiàn-muá ta̍k só͘-tsāi; I ē tī tsin tsē kok phah-phuà tuì-ti̍k ê thâu-khak.
English: He will judge among the nations. He will heap up dead bodies. He will crush the ruler of the whole earth.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Puē-gi̍k ê kiáⁿ-jî, lín tio̍h tò tńg-.lâi! In-uī Guá tsò lín ê tiōng-hu, jî-tshiánn Guá beh kā lín tuì tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ tshú tsi̍t-ê lâng, tuì tsi̍t tso̍k tshú nn̄g-ê lâng, tshuā kàu Si-óng.
English: Return, backsliding children, says Yahweh; for I am a husband to you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:

Tailo: Taⁿ lí khuàⁿ, Tsú beh kā lí hîng-hua̍t, lí ē tsheⁿ-mê, tsiām-sî bē khuànn-kìnn ji̍t-kng. I ê ba̍k-tsiu suî-sî hō͘ o͘-bū tah-teh, lóng khuàⁿ bô, sì-kè kiû lâng kā i khan.
English: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a season! Immediately a mist and darkness fell on him. He went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

Tailo: Ba-nî ê kiáⁿ-sun, la̍k-pah sì-tsa̍p jī lâng.
English: The children of Bani, six hundred forty-two.

Tailo: In lâi beh thiaⁿ I-é-su káng tō-lí, mā beh hō͘ I i-pēⁿ. Hiah-ê hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin kiáu-jiáu ê lâng mā lóng tit-tio̍h i-tī.
English: as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed.

Tailo: Hò͘ⁿ piān ê lâng kám thang kah Tsuân-lîng-.ê piān-lūn? Piān-pok Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k taⁿ tio̍h ìn I.
English: Shall he who argues contend with the Almighty? He who argues with God, let him answer it.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng koh kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, Siōng-tsú tsiū kā in kau tī Mí-tiân ê tshiú tiong, king-kuè tshit nî.
English: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: and Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

Tailo: Tuì hái ê kíng-kài to̍h-sī Ha-tsal-e-nán kīn tī Ta-má-su-ko ê kíng-kài, koh tī pak pîng ǹg pak sī Ha-mat ê kíng-kài. Tse sī pak pîng ê kài.
English: The border from the sea, shall be Hazar Enon at the border of Damascus; and on the north northward is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ông it-tshè lim ê khì-kū lóng sī kim ê, Le-ba-nòng tshiū-nâ ê tshù só͘-ū ê khì-kū mā sī sûn-kim ê. Só͘-lô-móng ê nî-kan, lâng khuànn gîn tsò bô siáⁿ-mi̍h kè-ta̍t.
English: All king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: silver was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.

Tailo: I-é-su tī Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ teh tsē ê sî, bûn-tô͘ su-hā lâi mn̄g I kóng, Tshiánn kā guán kóng, tang-sî ē huat-sing tsiah-ê tāi-tsì? Lí ê tsài-lîm kah sè-kài ê bua̍t-ji̍t ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tiāu-thâu?
