English: As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age?

Tailo: Ta-ke khuàⁿ-tio̍h i kuat-ì beh kah i khì, tsiū bô koh tuì i kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: When she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, she left off speaking to her.

Tailo: bô-lūn tsa-po͘ lâng, tsa-bó͘ lâng, gín-á kah ông ê hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, í-ki̍p sī-uē-tiúⁿ Ne-bu-tsa-la-tàn só͘ lâu lâi kau-tài Sia-huánn ê sun — A-hi-kam ê kiáⁿ Ge-tá-lia̍h ê kûn-tsiòng, kah I-é-lí-miah sian-ti, í-ki̍p Nê-lé-iù ê kiáⁿ Pa-lo-sih, lóng lia̍h khì-kàu Ai-gi̍p tē, khì-kàu Ta̍k-pe-neh.
English: the men, and the women, and the children, and the king's daughters, and every person who Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan; and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah;

Tailo: Tsuân-siânn tsiū khí jiáu-luān. Tsìng lâng lia̍h-tio̍h Páu-lô ê tâng-phuāⁿ — Ma-ke-tó-niah lâng Gâ-io̍h kah A-lí-su-ta̍t-khó͘, kui tīn lâng tsò tsi̍t-ē kheh ji̍p-khì hì-hn̂g.
English: The whole city was filled with confusion, and they rushed with one accord into the theater, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel.

Tailo: Uî ê thiāu jī-tsa̍p ki, tâng tsò ê khū jī-tsa̍p-ê, thiāu ê kau kah huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ sī īng gîn tsò ê.
English: their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kā in kóng, Guān lín pîng-an! Tshin-tshiūnn Thiⁿ-pē ū tshe-phài guá, guá mā beh tshe-phài lín.
English: Jesus therefore said to them again, Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.

Tailo: I ē huê-ho̍k lí ê tsing-ing, hōng-ióng lí ê nî lāu, in-uī seⁿ i ê, to̍h-sī lí hit-ê thiàⁿ lí ê sim-pū; tuì lí lâi kóng, pí tshit-ê kiáⁿ iáu khah hó ê!
English: He shall be to you a restorer of life, and sustain you in your old age, for your daughter-in-law, who loves you, who is better to you than seven sons, has borne him.

Tailo: I só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê kun-tuī, tsóng-kiōng ū saⁿ-bān nn̄g-tshing nn̄g-pah miâ.
English: His division, and those who were numbered of them, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.

Tailo: Kal-mel lâng He-tsu-lō͘, Al-bah lâng Pha-lâi,
English: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,

Tailo: I nā uī-tio̍h kám-siā lâi hiàn, tsiū tio̍h īng tiâu-hô iû ê bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ kah buah iû bô-kàⁿ ê po̍h piáⁿ, í-ki̍p tshiau hō͘ i tsiâu ê mī-hún, īng iû tiâu-hô tsò ê piáⁿ kah kám-siā ê tsè tsò-hué lâi hiàn.
English: If he offers it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mixed with oil.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá tio̍h kā si̍t-tsîng kā lín kóng; guá khì sī tuì lín ū lī-ik; guá nā bô-.khì, hit uī Pó-huī-su tsiū bē lâi lín tsia; guá nā khì, tsiū ē tshe I lâi lín tsia.
English: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don't go away, the Counselor won't come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng kā tuà tī Ai siânn ê jîn-bîn tsuân-pō͘ thâi-sí, tī tshân-.ni̍h á-.sī tī khòng-iá jiok-.tio̍h ê só͘-tsāi, in lóng tó tī to hā, kàu bia̍t-bông. I-su-la-el jîn-bîn tsiū tò tńg-lâi Ai siânn, īng to thâi siâⁿ lāi ê lâng.
English: It happened, when Israel had made an end of killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they pursued them, and they were all fallen by the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all Israel returned to Ai, and struck it with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: Ka-nân seⁿ tuā-kiáⁿ Si-tòng kah Hiat,
English: Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tuà tī Si̍t-tîm, jîn-bîn tsiū kah Mô͘-ap ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á kiânn kan-îm.
English: Israel abode in Shittim; and the people began to play the prostitute with the daughters of Moab:

Tailo: E-lī-huat ê kiáⁿ, Thê-man, O͘-mal, Tse-pho, Ga-tàm, Ke-ná-juh, Tim-ná kah A-má-li̍k.
English: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng tshú tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it ê sî, A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong ê tsè-si tio̍h ū tsi̍t-ê kah Lē-bī lâng tông-tsāi. Lē-bī lâng mā tio̍h kā tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it tuà lâi-kàu guán Siōng-tè ê tiān, lâi-kàu pâng-king, siu ji̍p-khì khò͘-pâng.
English: The priest the son of Aaron shall be with the Levites, when the Levites take tithes: and the Levites shall bring up the tithe of the tithes to the house of our God, to the chambers, into the treasure house.

Tailo: I-é-su āu-lâi koh kóng, Lí khuànn, guá lâi sī beh tsiàu Lí ê tsí-ì lâi si̍t-hiān. Án-ne, Siōng-tè sī beh huì-tû í-tsîng ê hiàn tsè, beh īng Ki-tok ê hi-sing lâi tāi-thè.
English: then he has said, Behold, I have come to do your will. He takes away the first, that he may establish the second,

Tailo: Sàu-lô í-king kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mi-kal, to̍h-sī Ta-bi̍t ê bó͘, hō͘ Ka-lîm lâng La-i-si ê kiáⁿ Phàⁿ-thê tsò bó͘.
English: Now Saul had given Michal his daughter, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish, who was of Gallim.

Tailo: Ông mn̄g in kóng, Lâi tú-tio̍h lín, kā lín kóng tsiah-ê uē ê, i ê hîng-tsōng siáⁿ khuán?
English: He said to them, What manner of man was he who came up to meet you, and told you these words?

Tailo: A-khà-tsuh ông sí hit nî, ū tsit-ê bi̍k-sī:
English: This burden was in the year that king Ahaz died.

Tailo: Kuan-hē hit-ê ji̍t kah hit-ê sî, bô lâng tsai, tī thinn-tíng ê thiⁿ-sài mā m̄-tsai, Kiáⁿ mā m̄-tsai, kan-taⁿ Thiⁿ-pē tsai.
English: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

Tailo: Guá mā beh lâu khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah ê jîn-bîn tī lí ê tiong-kan, in ē uá-khò Siōng-tsú ê miâ.
English: But I will leave in the midst of you an afflicted and poor people, and they will take refuge in the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh kā i ê hiann-tī kóng, Guá sī Iô-sé-huh, guá ê lāu-pē iáu tī-.leh bô? I ê hiann-tī bē-tàng ìn, in-uī tī i ê bīn-tsîng lóng tsin kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Joseph said to his brothers, I am Joseph! Does my father still live? His brothers couldn't answer him; for they were terrified at his presence.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h khuànn, I nā tuì kau-kài ê lō͘ tsiūⁿ-khì kàu Bia̍t-si-mé-si, kàng tsit-ê tuā tsai-hō hō͘ lán ê si̍t-tsāi to̍h-sī I; nā bô, tsiū thang tsai phah lán ê m̄-sī I ê tshiú, sī lán ngó͘-jiân tú-.tio̍h ê.
English: Behold; if it goes up by the way of its own border to Beth Shemesh, then he has done us this great evil: but if not, then we shall know that it is not his hand that struck us; it was a chance that happened to us.

Tailo: I tsiū tuì ông kóng, Guá tī pún-kok só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê tāi-tsì kah lí ê tì-huī, lóng sī tsin-si̍t!
English: She said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in my own land of your acts, and of your wisdom.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tsú ah, guá tsua̍t-tuì m̄-thang án-ne tsò, tsiah-ê lâng bô kò͘ sèⁿ-miā, guá kám káⁿ lim in ê hueh? In-uī in bô kò͘ sèⁿ-miā khì tshiūⁿ tsuí lâi, só͘-í, i m̄-lim. Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì sī tsit saⁿ-ê ióng-sū tsò ê.
English: and said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this: shall I drink the blood of these men who have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men.

Tailo: Tī hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, ū sin-īn kah hō͘ enn-á tsia̍h ling ê hū-jîn-lâng tsin put-hīng, in-uī ū tuā tsai-lān teh beh lîm-kàu tsit-ê só͘-tsāi. Siōng-tè ê tuā siū-khì mā teh beh lîm-kàu tsiah-ê jîn-bîn.
English: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h hit tshit tsiah iûⁿ-á, ta̍k tsiah tio̍h hiàn tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat.
English: a tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs:

Tailo: Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se tuì Ka-té-si Bal-né-ah tshe guá lâi thau-khuàⁿ tsit-ê tē, hit sî guá tú-á sì-tsa̍p huè, guá tsīn guá ê sim kā i huê-hok.
English: Forty years old was I when Moses the servant of Yahweh sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land; and I brought him word again as it was in my heart.

Tailo: Páu-lô tī hia tuà kuí ji̍t liáu-āu koh tshut-huat, king-kuè Ga-la̍h-tia kah Hu-lú-gia̍h ê tē-khu, kian-kò͘ tsìng bûn-tô͘ ê sìn-sim.
English: Having spent some time there, he departed, and went through the region of Galatia, and Phrygia, in order, establishing all the disciples.

Tailo: Gín-á tuā-hàn, ū tsi̍t ji̍t tshut-khì kàu i ê lāu-pē, kàu siu-kuah ê lâng hia.
English: When the child was grown, it fell on a day, that he went out to his father to the reapers.

Tailo: Kha ē kā i thún-ta̍h, to̍h-sī sàn-tshiah lâng ê kha, khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ê kha-pō͘.
English: The foot shall tread it down; Even the feet of the poor, And the steps of the needy.

Tailo: Ha-tit, Tse-bó-ím, Ne-bal-lat,
English: Hadid, Zeboim, Neballat,

Tailo: Nā bē, ná ē phah-thè guá ê tsú tsiah-ê siōng sè-hàn ê lô͘-po̍k tiong ê tsi̍t-ê kun-tiúⁿ? Kìng-jiân koh uá-khò Ai-gi̍p, ài tit-tio̍h tsiàn-tshia kah bé-ping?
English: How then can you turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants, and put your trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

Tailo: Koh tī khòng-iá khí tsiú-keⁿ lâu, koh tī kē ê tē kah pîng-guân khui tsin tsē kó͘-tséⁿ, in-uī i ū tsin tsē tsing-seⁿ; tī suaⁿ-tē kah hó ê tshân, i koh ū tsoh-sit lâng kah liāu-lí phû-tô hn̂g ê, in-uī i huann-hí tsìng-tsoh ê tāi-tsì.
English: He built towers in the wilderness, and hewed out many cisterns, for he had much livestock; in the lowland also, and in the plain: and he had farmers and vineyard keepers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields; for he loved farming.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè pí lán ê sim khah tuā, mā ta̍k hāng lóng tsai.
English: because if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.

Tailo: I koh pàng tsi̍t tsiah hún-tsiáu tshut-.khì, beh khuànn tsuí tuì tē-tsiūⁿ thè-khì á-buē.
English: He sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground,

Tailo: Ké sian-ti sī sio̍k sè-kan, kóng sè-kan-sū, só͘-í, sè-kan lâng tsiah thiaⁿ in ê uē.
English: They are of the world. Therefore they speak of the world, and the world hears them.

Tailo: I kóng, Τhang tsiàu lín ê uē lâi kiâⁿ. Tsiū án-ne, i tshe in tshut-.khì, in tsiū khì. Jiân-āu, i īng tsu-âng sik ê soh-á pa̍k tī thang-á.
English: She said, According to your words, so be it. She sent them away, and they departed: and she bound the scarlet line in the window.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, sim tsun-thàn khó-ò͘ⁿ thang thó-ià-.ê ê sim hit khuán lâng, Guá beh tsiàu in só͘ kiâⁿ ê pò-ìng tī in ê thâu-khak tíng. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: But as for them whose heart walks after the heart of their detestable things and their abominations, I will bring their way on their own heads, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī I khuàⁿ-kò͘ lú-pī ê pi-bî. Tuì taⁿ í-āu, bān-sè-tāi ê lâng lóng ē kóng guá ū hok-khì.
English: For he has looked at the humble state of his handmaid. For behold, from now on, all generations will call me blessed.

Tailo: Tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tuà tsiah-ê siâⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê, lí nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h kóng,
English: If you shall hear tell concerning one of your cities, which Yahweh your God gives you to dwell there, saying,

Tailo: Guá ê tshiú kiàn-li̍p tē ê tē-ki; Guá ê tsiàⁿ tshiú thián-khui tsiah-ê thiⁿ; Guá tsi̍t-ē kiò, in tsiū lóng khiā khí-.lâi.
English: Yes, my hand has laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand has spread out the heavens: when I call to them, they stand up together.

Tailo: I mā tio̍h īng tsit-ê sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ piⁿ, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê hueh tio̍h piàⁿ tī tuâⁿ-kha hō͘ i lâu, tse sī sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kiò ta tē tsò tē, kiò tsū-tsi̍p ê tsuí tsò hái; Siōng-tè khuànn án-ne sī hó.
English: God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters he called Seas. God saw that it was good.

Tailo: Guá ka-kī ua̍t tńg-lâi khuànn tì-huī, tian-kông kah gû-gōng; tī kun-ông hō͘-puè ê lâng iáu ē-tàng tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū-sī tsá-tsîng í-king tsò-kuè ê tāi-tsì niā-niā.
English: I turned myself to consider wisdom, madness, and folly: for what can the king's successor do? Just that which has been done long ago.

Tailo: Lí tsiū ē kóng, Hāi ah! Guá ná ē uàn-hūn kà-sī, sim-lāi biáu-sī tsik-pī;
English: And say, How I have hated instruction, And my heart despised reproof;

Tailo: Im-mel ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong, ū Ha-na-nih kah Tse-ba-tiah.
English: Of the sons of Immer: Hanani and Zebadiah.

Tailo: Tshit ji̍t liáu-āu, guán tshut-huat kè-sio̍k guán ê lō͘-thîng. Tsìng lâng tshuā bó͘-kiáⁿ sàng guán kàu siâⁿ guā, tāi-ke lóng kuī lo̍h-.khì, tī hái piⁿ kî-tó.
English: When it happened that we had accomplished the days, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed.

Tailo: Guá tāi-khài ē kah lín tuà tsi̍t-tsām-á, kiám-tshái ē kah lín tsò-hué kuè kuâⁿ-thiⁿ. Án-ne, bô-lūn suà lo̍h-khì guá beh khì tó-uī, lóng thang hō͘ lín sàng guá tshut-huat.
English: But with you it may be that I will stay, or even winter, that you may send me on my journey wherever I go.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kiò Io-siú-ah lâi, tī I-su-la-el jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng tuì i kóng, Lí tio̍h ióng-kám tsòng-táⁿ, in-uī lí beh kah tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tsò-hué khì, ji̍p-khì Siōng-tsú tuì in tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā beh hō͘ in ê tē, lí mā ē hō͘ in tit-tio̍h i lâi tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: Moses called to Joshua, and said to him in the sight of all Israel, Be strong and of good courage: for you shall go with this people into the land which Yahweh has sworn to their fathers to give them; and you shall cause them to inherit it.

Tailo: Ki-tok uī lán hi-sing sèⁿ-miā, lán tsiū tuì án-ne tsai-iáⁿ siáⁿ-mi̍h sī thiàⁿ-sim. Lán mā ing-kai uī-tio̍h hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē hi-sing sèⁿ-miā.
English: By this we know love, because he laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

Tailo: Lí kuáⁿ in lī-khui khì, sī tsiàu só͘ ha̍p-gî ê teh kah in sio-tseⁿ; khí tang-hong ê ji̍t, Lí tsiū īng tuā hong kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.

Tailo: Lí ē sí tī lí só͘ khì ê suaⁿ lāi, tshin-tshiūnn lí ê a-hiaⁿ A-lông sí tī Hol suaⁿ.
English: and die on the mountain where you go up, and be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor, and was gathered to his people:

Tailo: I kā Lô-bo-àm seⁿ kuí-nā-ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī E-ú-sih, Si-ma-liah, Tsa-ham.
English: and she bore him sons: Jeush, and Shemariah, and Zaham.

Tailo: Bô tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī khiam-pi, tshin-tshiūnn i ê lāu-pē Má-ná-se ê ka-kī khiam-pi. Tsit-ê Am-móng ná lâi ná huān tsuē.
English: He didn't humble himself before Yahweh, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but this same Amon trespassed more and more.

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ hiah-ê sing-lí lâng, mā uī-tio̍h i pi-siong thî-khàu, in-uī bô lâng koh bé in ê huè,
English: The merchants of the earth weep and mourn over her, for no one buys their merchandise any more;

Tailo: Hit sî,. Guá īng tsuí kā lí sé, kā lí sing-khu ê hueh sé tshing-khì, koh īng iû kā lí buah.
English: Then washed I you with water; yes, I thoroughly washed away your blood from you, and I anointed you with oil.

Tailo: Kiû Lí siàu-liām Lí só͘ li̍p ê iok, in-uī tē-tsiūⁿ o͘-àm ê só͘-tsāi lóng sī pō-tô͘ ê tsâu-hia̍t.
English: Honor your covenant, For haunts of violence fill the dark places of the earth.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Guá kám bô kā lí kóng, tsit-ê lâng só͘ beh ī-giân guá ê, bô kóng hó uē, tsí ū tsai-hō niā-niā?
English: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, Didn't I tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?

Tailo: I ê pak-tó͘ ē tshin-tshiūnn lāi ê tshù-hiā phè; i tshin-tshiūnn thih-pê thua kuè thô͘.
English: His undersides are like sharp potsherds, Leaving a trail in the mud like a threshing sledge.

Tailo: I hō͘ guá ê khuì-la̍t tī puàⁿ-lō͘ sue-lám, hō͘ guá ê ji̍t-tsí kiám-tsió.
English: He weakened my strength along the course. He shortened my days.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Iô-tah ê siú-líng tshin-tshiūnn tshian-suá tē-kài ê lâng, Guá beh kā Guá ê siū-khì piàⁿ tī in ê sin tsiūⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn teh piàⁿ tsuí án-ne.
English: The princes of Judah are like those who remove a landmark. I will pour out my wrath on them like water.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h kā lín ê sim kiânn kat-lé, m̄-thang ngē lín ê ām-kún.
English: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiff-necked.

Tailo: O͘-pe̍h-kóng ê lâng sì-kè khí hun-tsing, o̍h-uē ê lâng hō͘ tshin-bi̍t ê pîng-iú pìⁿ líng-tām.
English: A perverse man stirs up strife. A whisperer separates close friends.

Tailo: M̄-thang suî-piān kā lâng kiânn huāⁿ-tshiú-lé, mā m̄-thang tsham-ú pa̍t lâng ê huān tsuē; tio̍h kò͘-siú ka-kī ê sûn-kiat.
English: Lay hands hastily on no one, neither be a participant in other men's sins. Keep yourself pure.

Tailo: lí nā tńg-khì siâⁿ lāi, kā Αp-sa-lôm kóng, ' Ông, guá beh tsò lí ê lô͘-po̍k; guá í-tsîng tsò lí ê pē ê lô͘-po̍k, taⁿ guá mā beh án-ne tsò lí ê lô͘-po̍k. ' Lí tsiū thang uī guá phò-huāi A-hi-to-huel ê kè-bô͘.
English: but if you return to the city, and tell Absalom, I will be your servant, O king; as I have been your father's servant in time past, so will I now be your servant; then will you defeat for me the counsel of Ahithophel.

Tailo: Ū kuí-nā-ê king-ha̍k kàu-su ìn kóng, Lāu-su ah, Lí kóng liáu tsin hó.
English: Some of the scribes answered, Teacher, you speak well.

Tailo: Lián ê khuán tshin-tshiūnn tshia-lián ê khuán; i ê ti̍k-sim, i ê guā-khuân, i ê tsí （ Tsù, tshia-lián huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ ê bué-liu ）, i ê lāi-khuân, lóng sī tsù ê.
English: The work of the wheels was like the work of a chariot wheel: their axles, and their rims, and their spokes, and their naves, were all molten.

Tailo: Αp-sa-lôm tsiū tô-tsáu. Siú-bōng ê siàu-liân lâng gia̍h thâu khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsin tsē jîn-bîn tuì i ê āu-bīn, tuì suaⁿ piⁿ ê lō͘ lâi.
English: But Absalom fled. The young man who kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold, many people were coming by way of the hillside behind him.

Tailo: ū tshit-bān sì-tshing la̍k-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Judah, were sixty-four thousand six hundred.

Tailo: In-uī lí tio̍h khak-si̍t tsai, lí nā tshut-.khì, kiâⁿ-kuè Kit-lông khe, hit ji̍t lí tio̍h sí, lí ê hueh beh kui lí ka-kī ê thâu-khak.
English: For on the day you go out, and pass over the brook Kidron, know you for certain that you shall surely die: your blood shall be on your own head.

Tailo: In ē in-uī bē-tàng lī-ik in ê jîn-bîn lâi kiàn-siàu; hit-ê jîn-bîn m̄-sī tsiâⁿ-tsò pang-tsān, mā m̄-sī tsiâⁿ-tsò lī-ik, to̍k-to̍k sī tsiâⁿ-tsò kiàn-siàu kah lîng-jio̍k.
English: They shall all be ashamed because of a people that can't profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.

Tailo: Í-sak tuì in kóng, Lín kì-jiân uàn-hūn guá, kiò guá lī-khui lín, taⁿ sī án-tsuáⁿ ē lâi guá tsia?
English: Isaac said to them, Why have you come to me, since you hate me, and have sent me away from you?

Tailo: In tsiàu-sî sím-phuàⁿ jîn-bîn, ū oh-tit kái-kuat ê àn-kiāⁿ tsiū khì Mô͘-se hia, nā-sī ta̍k hāng sió-sū, in tsiū ka-kī sím-phuàⁿ.
English: They judged the people at all times. They brought the hard causes to Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.

Tailo: Tio̍h lī-khui pháiⁿ lâi tsò hó sū, tsuan-sim tui-kiû hô-pîng.
English: Let him turn away from evil, and do good. Let him seek peace, and pursue it.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sioh ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng, ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā; tī tsit sè-kan bô tham-luân ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng it-tīng ē pó-siú sèⁿ-miā lâi tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: He who loves his life will lose it. He who hates his life in this world will keep it to eternal life.

Tailo: Tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê lâng lóng tsai tsit-hāng tāi-tsì, só͘-í, tsiàu in ê uē kā hit tè tē kiò-tsò A-kik-tāi-má, to̍h-sī ' hueh-hn̂g' ê ì-sù.
English: It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called Akeldama,' that is, The field of blood.'

Tailo: I-é-su kā i tsik-pī kóng, Tiām-khì! Tuì tsit-ê lâng tshut-.khì! kuí tī tsìng lâng bīn-tsîng hō͘ hit-ê lâng tó lo̍h-khì tsiū tshut-.khì, lóng bô kā i siong-hāi-tio̍h.
English: Jesus rebuked him, saying, Be silent, and come out of him! When the demon had thrown him down in their midst, he came out of him, having done him no harm.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng hiah-ê jîn-sîn thâi-sí i ê lāu-pē Iô-tah ông, taⁿ kok-kuân tsi̍t-ē kian-kò͘, tsiū kā in thâi-sí.
English: It happened, as soon as the kingdom was established in his hand, that he killed his servants who had slain the king his father:

Tailo: Pó͘-kuà tio̍h sù-hong, áu siang-tîng, tn̂g tsi̍t lia̍h, khuah tsi̍t lia̍h.
English: It shall be square and folded double; a span shall be its length of it, and a span its breadth.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khì hiah-ê tī pún-kok siū lia̍h ê jîn-bîn hia; in kiám-tshái ē thiaⁿ, kiám-tshái m̄-thiaⁿ; lí tio̍h tuì in kóng uē, kā in kóng: Tse sī Tsú — Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng ê.
English: Go, get you to them of the captivity, to the children of your people, and speak to them, and tell them, Thus says the Lord Yahweh; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.

Tailo: Tsit-ê phì-jū ê ì-sù sī án-ne, tsíng-tsí to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê tō-lí.
English: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

Tailo: Tsìng suaⁿ uî tiâu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, Siōng-tsú mā án-ne uî tiâu I ê tsú-bîn, tuì tsit sî kàu íng-uán.
English: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, So Yahweh surrounds his people from this time forth and forevermore.

Tailo: Pó-siú lí ê sī Siōng-tsú; Siōng-tsú tī lí ê tsiànn pîng tsò lí ê ìm-ńg pó-hō͘ lí.
English: Yahweh is your keeper. Yahweh is your shade on your right hand.

Tailo: Bô sìn Tsú ê tsa-po͘ lâng in-uī tshuā sìn Tsú ê lâng tsò bó͘, ē tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê tsiap-la̍p. Kāng-khuán án-ne, bô sìn Tsú ê tsa-bó͘ lâng in-uī kè sìn Tsú ê ang, ē tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê tsiap-la̍p. Nā m̄-sī án-ne, lín ê kiáⁿ-jî tsiū bô sio̍k Siōng-tè, kî-si̍t in sī kui-sio̍k Siōng-tè ê.
English: For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but now are they holy.

Tailo: I ê lô͘-po̍k I-su-la-el ê kiáⁿ-sun, I só͘ kíng Iâ-kop ê kiáⁿ-sun,
English: Remember his marvelous works that he has done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ua̍h ê tōng-bu̍t lóng tsò lín ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, tsiah-ê it-tshè guá lóng beh tsò lín ê tsia̍h-mi̍h. Tsiah-ê it-tshè Guá lóng beh hō͘ lín, tshin-tshiūnn Guá hō͘ lín tshài-se kāng-khuán.
English: Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As the green herb, I have given everything to you.

Tailo: I tsi̍t ē tshuē-.tio̍h, tsiū kiò pîng-iú kah tshù-piⁿ lâi, kā in kóng, ' Lâi kah guá tàu huann-hí, in-uī guá phah-m̄-kiàn ê gîn-á í-king tshuē-.tio̍h. '
English: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.'

Tailo: Lín tī hn̄g ê lâng tio̍h thiaⁿ Guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lín tī kīn ê lâng tio̍h tsai Guá ê tuā kuân-lîng.
English: Hear, you who are far off, what I have done; And, you who are near, acknowledge my might.

Tailo: Tì-huī hō͘ tì-huī ê lâng ū lîng-li̍k, iâⁿ-kuè siâⁿ lāi tsa̍p-ê tsiáng-kuân-tsiá.
English: Wisdom is a strength to the wise man more than ten rulers who are in a city.

Tailo: Pàng tsi̍t tsiah o͘-a tshut-.khì. O͘-a pue-lâi pue khì, it-ti̍t kàu tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsuí ta-.khì.
English: and he sent forth a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.

Tailo: In tī Iô-tah kà-sī lâng, ū tuà Siōng-tsú lu̍t-huat ê tsheh, piàn kiâⁿ Iô-tah ta̍k-ê siâⁿ, kà-sī hiah-ê jîn-bîn.
English: They taught in Judah, having the book of the law of Yahweh with them; and they went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught among the people.

Tailo: Lín beh īng siáⁿ lâng kah Guá sio-pí, kah Guá pîng-tíng, thang kah Guá pí-phīng, hō͘ guán sio-kāng?
English: To whom will you liken me, and make me equal, and compare me, that we may be like?

Tailo: Taⁿ I-su-la-el lâng tuā-siaⁿ âu-kiò ê siann hō͘ Guá thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, Guá mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ai-gi̍p lâng kā in khó͘-to̍k ê kan-khó͘.
English: Now, behold, the cry of the children of Israel has come to me. Moreover I have seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū lâng khí-lâi kā lí jiok, siàu-siūⁿ lí ê sèⁿ-miā, tsóng-.sī, guá ê tsú ê sèⁿ-miā ē tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè hia, pau tī ua̍h-miā ê pau lāi; lí ê tuì-ti̍k ê sèⁿ-miā, Siōng-tsú ē kā i hìⁿ tshut-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn tuì hìⁿ soh ê tiong-kan hìⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Though men be risen up to pursue you, and to seek your soul, yet the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life with Yahweh your God; and the souls of your enemies, them shall he sling out, as from the hollow of a sling.

Tailo: Ta̍k hāng tsia̍h ê lâng m̄-thang khuànn-khin bô ta̍k hāng tsia̍h ê lâng, bô ta̍k hāng tsia̍h ê lâng mā m̄-thang phue-phuàⁿ ta̍k hāng tsia̍h ê lâng, in-uī Siōng-tè í-king ū tsiap-la̍p i.
English: Don't let him who eats despise him who doesn't eat. Don't let him who doesn't eat judge him who eats, for God has received him.

Tailo: Nó͘-ah koh thìng-hāu tshit ji̍t, tsiah koh-tsài pàng hún-tsiáu tshut tuā tsûn.
English: He stayed yet another seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark.

Tailo: Guān guá ê suan-phuàⁿ tuì Lí ê bīn-tsîng huat-tshut, guān Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu kàm-tshat tsìng-ti̍t.
English: Let my sentence come forth from your presence; Let your eyes look on equity.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng mā kā Siōng-tsú tiān tsîng īⁿ tiong hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, tī hia hiàn sio-tsè kah siā-un-tsè ê iû, in-uī Só͘-lô-móng só͘ bat tsō ê tâng-tuâⁿ bô kàu-gia̍h iông-ín hiah-ê sio-tsè, sò͘-tsè kah iû-lâ.
English: Moreover Solomon made the middle of the court holy that was before the house of Yahweh; for there he offered the burnt offerings, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the brazen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat.

Tailo: Lín ná ē khai-huì tsînn, bé hit-ê bē tsia̍h-.tit ê mi̍h? Ná ē lô-khó͘, tī hit-ê bē hō͘ lâng pá-tsiok ê? Lín tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ Guá ê uē, tsiū ē tsia̍h hit-ê hó mi̍h, tit-tio̍h hióng-siū iû-jī, hō͘ sim huann-hí.
English: Why do you spend money for that which is not bread? and your labor for that which doesn't satisfy? listen diligently to me, and eat you that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in fatness.

Tailo: Beh kā lín pun tē tsò sán-gia̍p ê lâng ê miâ-jī kì tī ē-té: Sī tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal kah Nùn ê kiáⁿ Io-siú-ah.
English: These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.

Tailo: Guá tsá to̍h káng-kiù Lí ê kà-sī, Lí khak-li̍p hiah-ê kà-sī kàu íng-uán.
English: Of old I have known from your testimonies, That you have founded them forever. RESH

Tailo: M̄-koh hit-ê kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t-ê Í-lū-má( Hi-la̍h uē ê ì-sù to̍h-sī Kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t ê lâng ) huán-tuì in nn̄g lâng, ài beh tsó͘-tòng tsóng-tok tsiap-siū tsit-ê sìn-gióng.
English: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng í-guā, kíng-tshut I-su-la-el lâng gia̍h to ê kiōng sì-tsa̍p bān, lóng sī tsiàn-sū.
English: The men of Israel, besides Benjamin, were numbered four hundred thousand men who drew sword: all these were men of war.

Tailo: Lín guā-pang lâng kuè-khì bô sūn-ho̍k Siōng-tè, m̄-koh, tsit-má khiok in-uī I-su-la-el lâng bô sūn-ho̍k, lín tsiah tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê liân-bín.
English: For as you in time past were disobedient to God, but now have obtained mercy by their disobedience,

Tailo: U-tsi-iah ông khí thái-ko kàu i sí ê ji̍t, in-uī i thái-ko tuà tī līng-guā ê tshù, kah Siōng-tsú ê tiān keh-lī. I ê kiáⁿ Iô-thàm kuán-lí ông-ka, tī-lí jîn-bîn.
English: Uzziah the king was a leper to the day of his death, and lived in a separate house, being a leper; for he was cut off from the house of Yahweh: and Jotham his son was over the king's house, judging the people of the land.

Tailo: Lí mā m̄-thang ji̍p-khì iàn-lo̍k ê ke kah in tsē-.leh lim-tsia̍h.
English: You shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and to drink.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsiah-ê lia̍t kok mā kìng-uì Siōng-tè, mā ho̍k-sāi in ê ngó͘-siōng. In ê kiáⁿ, in ê sun, mā lóng sī án-ne, in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kàu kin-á-ji̍t in mā tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: So these nations feared Yahweh, and served their engraved images; their children likewise, and their children's children, as did their fathers, so do they to this day.

Tailo: Tī siâⁿ mn̂g piⁿ, tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, tī siâⁿ tshut-ji̍p ê só͘-tsāi, tuā-siaⁿ huah,
English: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, At the entry doors, she cries aloud:

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí in-uī Lí ê miâ hó khuán-thāi; in-uī Lí ê tsû-ài tsin hó, kiû Lí kā guá khan-kiù!
English: But deal with me, Yahweh the Lord, for your name's sake, Because your loving kindness is good, deliver me;

Tailo: In in-uī khiàm-khueh kah iau-gō, sing-khu siau-sán; tī hong-huì líng-tsīng ê o͘-àm tiong khè ta-thô͘.
English: They are gaunt from lack and famine. They gnaw the dry ground, in the gloom of waste and desolation.

Tailo: I-é-su koh lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Ka-ná, to̍h-sī I kā tsuí piàn-tsò tsiú ê só͘-tsāi, tī hia ū tsi̍t-ê Ka-peh-ná-um kuaⁿ-uân ê kiáⁿ phuà-pēⁿ.
English: Jesus came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water into wine. There was a certain nobleman whose son was sick at Capernaum.

Tailo: I nā bô tuì tē-it-ê bó͘ tsīn tsit sann hāng gī-bū, i tsiū thang tsū-iû lī-khui-.khì, bián īng tsînn lâi sio̍k.
English: If he doesn't do these three things for her, she may go free without paying any money.

Tailo: Lín kì-jiân kah Ki-tok tâng-tsê sí, í-king thuat-lī tsi-phuè ú-tiū ê siâ-lîng, lín ná ē iáu-koh tshin-tshiūnn sio̍k tsit sè-kan ê lâng teh sing-ua̍h? Lín ná ē iáu-koh teh siú tsiah-ê kui-lē?
English: If you died with Christ from the elements of the world, why, as though living in the world, do you subject yourselves to ordinances,

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá tī khòng-iá tuì in gia̍h-khí Guá ê tshiú, kóng beh kā in hun-suànn tī lia̍t kok, hō͘ in sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang.
English: Moreover I swore to them in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the nations, and disperse them through the countries;

Tailo: Iô-tah lâi-kàu-uī, suî-sî kiâⁿ uá khì I-é-su hia, kiò tsi̍t-siaⁿ Lāu-su , tsiū ti̍t-ti̍t kā I tsim.
English: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, Rabbi! Rabbi! and kissed him.

Tailo: I ê to̍k-hāi ē tò tńg-khì kàu i ê thâu-khak; i ê kiông-pō ē lo̍h tī ka-kī ê thâu-khak tíng.
English: The trouble he causes shall return to his own head. His violence shall come down on the crown of his own head.

Tailo: Iô-tah mā bô tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú — in ê Siōng-tè ê kài-bīng, to̍h-sī tsun-thàn I-su-la-el só͘ li̍p ê kui-lē.
English: Also Judah didn't keep the commandments of Yahweh their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.

Tailo: Kah i kóng-uē ê thiⁿ-sài lī-khui liáu-āu, Kol-né-lioh tsiū kiò nn̄g-ê lô͘-po̍k kah tsi̍t-ê pîng-siông sū-hāu i koh sī kìng-khiân ê ping lâi,
English: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those who waited on him continually.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng ê, lóng king-kuè tiám-sǹg, tsiàu só͘ tiám-sǹg tsa-po͘ lâng ê gia̍h-sò͘, kiōng saⁿ-bān peh-tshing.
English: The Levites were numbered from thirty years old and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty-eight thousand.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Sìng Sîn bîng-bîng kóng, Tī āu-lâi ê sî-kî ē ū lâng khì-sak sìn-gióng, ì-ài hiah-ê bê-hi̍k lâng ê siâ-lîng kah kuí-sîn ê kà-sī.
English: But the Spirit says expressly that in later times some will fall away from the faith, paying attention to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons,

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Īng Ai-gi̍p siù-hue ê iù-tē pò͘ tsò lí ê phâng, tsò lí ê kî; īng E-lí-siah tó-sū nâ-sik, tsí-sik ê pò͘ tsò lí ê liâng-pêⁿ.
English: Of fine linen with embroidered work from Egypt was your sail, that it might be to you for a banner; blue and purple from the islands of Elishah was your awning.

Tailo: Taⁿ tio̍h īng nn̄g tsiah gû-káng-á hō͘ guán, Ba-al ê sian-ti thang uī ka-kī kíng tsi̍t tsiah gû-á, tshiat-tsò kui tè, hē tī tshâ tíng, ē-bīn m̄-thang lok hué; guá liāu-lí hit tsiah gû-á, hē tī tshâ tíng, ē-bīn mā bô lok hué.
English: Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā in phah, tuì hông-hun-àm kàu keh tńg kang ê-hng, tsí ū sì-pah-ê khiâ lo̍k-tô ê siàu-liân lâng tsáu-.khì, í-guā bô kah tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu lī-khui.
English: David struck them from the twilight even to the evening of the next day: and there not a man of them escaped, except four hundred young men, who rode on camels and fled.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn. I ê kiáⁿ Má-ná-se suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Hezekiah slept with his fathers; and Manasseh his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: I bô khó-liân i ê kiáⁿ, ná tshin-tshiūnn m̄-sī i ê kiánn; i ê lô-khó͘ khang-khang, i mā bô tshau-huân.
English: She deals harshly with her young ones, as if they were not hers. Though her labor is in vain, she is without fear,

Tailo: Tshiánn thè guá kā Ki-tok I-é-su ê tâng-kang — Pu-lí-su-ki-lah kah A-ku-lah tshíng-an.
English: Greet Prisca and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,

Tailo: Tuì guá tshuā I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p ê ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, Guá m̄-bat tiàm tī tshù-.ni̍h, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī pò͘-pênn kah huē-bō͘ kiânn.
English: for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but hawe moved around in a tent and in a tabernacle.

Tailo: Guá taⁿ khiā tī tsuí-tséⁿ piⁿ, tuì tsi̍t-ê tshut-lâi tshiūⁿ tsuí ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á kóng, ' Tshiáⁿ lí kā lí pân-.ni̍h ê tsuí tām-po̍h-á hō͘ guá lim;
English: behold, I am standing by this spring of water. Let it happen, that the maiden who comes forth to draw, to whom I will say, Give me, I pray you, a little water from your pitcher to drink,

Tailo: Íng-ua̍h ê Thiⁿ-pē tshe-phài guá, guá uī Thiⁿ-pē lâi ua̍h; tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, tsia̍h guá ê bah ê lâng ē in-uī guá lâi ua̍h.
English: As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father; so he who feeds on me, he will also live because of me.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín tiong-kan tsò tuā ê lâng tio̍h tsò lín ê tshe-īng.
English: But he who is greatest among you will be your servant.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p tē í-āu, tē-jī nî, jī-gue̍h tshe-it, Siōng-tsú tī Si-nái ê khòng-iá tī huē-bō͘ tiong huan-hù Mô͘-se, kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k lí siū hiat-ka̍k, bē-tàng ji̍p-khì lí ê bōng, tshin-tshiūnn thang thó-ià ê ki; lí īng siū thâi ê lâng tsò saⁿ, to̍h-sī siū to tsha̍k-sí kah tuī lo̍h-khì kheⁿ tiong tsio̍h-thâu ê; lí koh tshin-tshiūnn siū thún-ta̍h ê sin-si.
English: But you are cast away from your tomb like an abominable branch, clothed with the slain, who are thrust through with the sword, who go down to the stones of the pit; like a dead body trodden under foot.

Tailo: Lín ê tsuē-gia̍t hō͘ tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tian-tò lī-khui lín; lín ê tsuē-ok hō͘ lín bē-tàng tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withheld good from you.

Tailo: Sí-bah lú-ông khuàⁿ-tio̍h Só͘-lô-móng ê tì-huī kah i só͘ khí ê tshù,
English: When the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Kàu hit ji̍t, ū ì-sù ē hing-khí tī lí ê sim, lí ē tô͘-bô͘ pháiⁿ ê kè-bô͘,
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: It shall happen in that day, that things shall come into your mind, and you shall devise an evil device:

Tailo: Tng i teh sio hiuⁿ ê sî, huē-tsiòng kui tuā-tīn tī guā-bīn teh kî-tó.
English: The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.

Tailo: Iâ-kop tuì Pa-tàn-a-lâm tńg-.lâi ê sî, pîng-an lâi-kàu Ka-nân tē ê Sī-khiàm siâⁿ, tī siâⁿ ê thâu-tsîng tah pò͘-pêⁿ.
English: Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan Aram; and encamped before the city.

Tailo: Guá suî-jiân sī kong-gī, mā m̄-káⁿ ìn I, to̍k-to̍k tuì sím-phuàⁿ guá ê kiû in.
English: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer. I would make supplication to my judge.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú bat tshut bīng-līng, kóng-tio̍h A-siul lâng, I kóng, Sio̍k lí ê lâng it-tīng bô koh thuân tsíng; Guá beh tuì lí ê sîn-bîng ê biō lāi tû-bia̍t tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng kah tsù-tsō ê siōng; Guá beh kā lí tsún-pī hûn-bōng, in-uī lí sī pi-tsiān.
English: Yahweh has commanded concerning you: No more descendants will bear your name. Out of the house of your gods, will I cut off the engraved image and the molten image. I will make your grave, for you are vile.

Tailo: Guán in-uī guán ê pháiⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ kah guán ê tāng tsuē, í-king tú-tio̍h tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, guán ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kā guán hîng-hua̍t pí guán ê tsuē só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê khah khin, koh kā guán lâu lo̍h-lâi tsiah-ê thuat-lī ê lâng.
English: After all that is come on us for our evil deeds, and for our great guilt, seeing that you our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and have given us such a remnant,

Tailo: Hit nn̄g lâng lâi kìnn I-é-su tsiū kóng, Kiânn sé-lé Iô-há-neh tshe guán lâi tshiáⁿ-mn̄g Lí, ' Lí kám sī teh beh lâi ê hit uī? Á-sī guán tio̍h koh thìng-hāu pa̍t lâng? '
English: When the men had come to him, they said, John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?'

Tailo: lí khuàⁿ, só͘-í Guá tshun-tshut Guá ê tshiú kong-kik lí, kā lí kau hō͘ lia̍t kok hō͘ in tshiúⁿ-.khì. Guá beh tuì lia̍t pang tiong kā lí tsián-tû, hō͘ lí tī bān-kok tiong pāi-bông. Guá beh kā lí tû-bia̍t, lí tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: therefore, behold, I have stretched out my hand on you, and will deliver you for a spoil to the nations; and I will cut you off from the peoples, and I will cause you to perish out of the countries: I will destroy you; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit sî, Mô͘-se tì-ì tshuē tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, lí khuàⁿ, í-king sio-.khì, tsiū tuì A-lông só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê kiáⁿ Ê-lī-a-tsal kah I-tha-mal siū-khì, kóng,
English: Moses diligently inquired about the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burned: and he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying,

Tailo: Ông só͘ kah-ì ê lú-tsú thang kā i siat-li̍p tsò ông-hō͘, lâi tāi-thè Ua-si-thih. Ông lia̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsò hó, tsiū án-ne khì kiâⁿ.
English: and let the maiden who pleases the king be queen instead of Vashti. The thing pleased the king; and he did so.

Tailo: Só͘ tsik-tsū ê bí-niûⁿ, thang tsò Ai-gi̍p tē tsiong-lâi tshit nî ki-hng ê lō͘-īng, bián-tit tsit-ê tē hō͘ ki-hng só͘ bia̍t.
English: The food will be for a store to the land against the seven years of famine, which will be in the land of Egypt; that the land not perish through the famine.

Tailo: Kuan-hē só͘-ū ê saⁿ-khò͘, á-.sī phuê tsò ê, á-.sī suaⁿ-iûⁿ mn̂g tsit ê, á-.sī tshâ tsò ê mi̍h, lóng tio̍h kā i tshing-khì.
English: As to every garment, and all that is made of skin, and all work of goats' hair, and all things made of wood, you shall purify yourselves.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-tē tsiàu Lí ê tīng-lē kàu taⁿ iáu tsûn-tsāi, in-uī bān-mi̍h lóng sī Lí ê tshe-īng.
English: Your laws remain to this day, For all things serve you.

Tailo: In bô kè-sio̍k kah tsò thâu ê Ki-tok kiat-liân. Tsuân sing-khu tio̍h tuì tsit-ê thâu tit-tio̍h îng-ióng, tsiah-ê tsat kah kin tio̍h kiat-liân khí-.lâi, tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì lâi tióng-sîng.
English: and not holding firmly to the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments, grows with God's growth.

Tailo: in kí Siōng-tsú ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, sī beh kóng I tshuā I-su-la-el ê kiáⁿ-sun tuì pak-hong ê tē, mā tuì kiàn-nā I só͘ kuáⁿ in kàu ê tē lâi, jî-tshiánn Guá beh tshuā in tńg-lâi in ê tē, to̍h-sī Guá tsîng só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tsó͘-sian ê.
English: but, As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the countries where he had driven them. I will bring them again into their land that I gave to their fathers.

Tailo: Toh-á ê sì-kho͘-uî, kok tsò tsi̍t pa-tsiúⁿ khuah ê huâiⁿ-niû, huâiⁿ-niû tíng ê sì-kho͘-uî siuⁿ khí-hîng kim piⁿ.
English: You shall make a rim of a handbreadth around it. You shall make a golden molding on its rim around it.

Tailo: Guá tshe lâng tiàu hiah-ê thâu-lâng, to̍h-sī E-lí-e-tsel, A-li-el, Si-má-iah, El-ná-than, Ia-lip, El-ná-than, Ná-than, Tsa-kha-lī-a, Me-siu-lám, koh tiàu kàu-uân Io-iá-lip kah El-ná-than.
English: Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, who were teachers.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsiū kah tuè i ê la̍k pah lâng kàu Pí-so ê khe, lâu-.leh ê lâng hioh tī hia.
English: So David went, he and the six hundred men who were with him, and came to the brook Besor, where those who were left behind stayed.

Tailo: Guá tiām-tiām bô tshut siaⁿ, liân hó uē mā bô kóng-tshut tshuì. Guá ê iu-būn tsiū ke-thinn.
English: I was mute with silence. I held my peace, even from good. My sorrow was stirred.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng tsiū kā iù-tē pò͘ pàng-teh, thǹg-pak-theh lâi tô-tsáu.
English: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

Tailo: I-é-su tam tshò͘ liáu-āu, tsiū kóng, Taⁿ it-tshè lóng uân-sîng ā. Án-ne kóng suah, thâu tsiū tàm lo̍h-.khì, khuì tn̄g.
English: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished. He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h īng gîn tuì in bé bí-niûⁿ lâi tsia̍h, mā tio̍h īng gîn tuì in bé tsuí lâi lim.
English: You shall purchase food of them for money, that you may eat; and you shall also buy water of them for money, that you may drink.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá bat tuì I-su-la-el lâng ê tiong-kan kíng-suán lín ê hiann-tī Lē-bī lâng, lâi siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kah kui Siōng-tsú, lâi liāu-lí huē-bō͘ ê kang.
English: I, behold, I have taken your brothers the Levites from among the children of Israel: to you they are a gift, given to Yahweh, to do the service of the tent of meeting.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, ' Lí kám m̄-bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá tī guân-khí-thâu só͘ tsò ê, tī kó͘-tsá só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê? Taⁿ Guá beh kā i uân-sîng, to̍h-sī beh hō͘ lí huí-huāi kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, hō͘ in piàn-tsò huè-hi.
English: Have you not heard how I have done it long ago, and formed it in ancient times? Now I have brought it to pass, that it should be yours to destroy fortified cities, turning them into ruinous heaps.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Guá lóng sī kong-khai tuì sè-kan kóng-uē, guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī huē-tn̂g kah Iô-tá-iah lâng tsū-tsi̍p ê sìng-tiān kà-sī lâng, guá m̄-bat tī pì-bi̍t ê só͘-tsāi kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: Jesus answered him, I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where the Jews always meet. I said nothing in secret.

Tailo: Saⁿ lâng tiong-kan, i pí hit nn̄g-ê khah kia̍t-tshut, tsiū tsò in ê thâu, tsóng-.sī, bē pí-tit khí-thâu ê saⁿ lâng.
English: Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, and was made their captain: however he didn't attain to the first three.

Tailo: Put-kuán sī tshut-guā lâng á-.sī pún-tē-lâng, tio̍h tsun-siú sio-siâng ê lu̍t-huat, in-uī Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: You shall have one kind of law, for the foreigner as well as the native-born: for I am Yahweh your God.'

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā in kóng, Siōng-tsú kóng, ' Guá kí Guá ê ua̍h-miā lâi kóng: Lín hō͘ Guá thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê uē, Guá ē tsiàu án-ne kā lín khuán-thāi.
English: Tell them, As I live, says Yahweh, surely as you have spoken in my ears, so will I do to you:

Tailo: Guá ū kíng sìn-si̍t ê lō͘, kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē hē tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: I have chosen the way of truth. I have set my heart on your law.

Tailo: In-uī tsi̍t-tò͘ ē kik-khí lâng ê tuā siū-khì; pò-siû ê sî it-tīng bô khuan-iông.
English: For jealousy arouses the fury of the husband. He won't spare in the day of vengeance.

Tailo: Nó͘-ah tsiū kah i ê kiáⁿ, i ê bó͘, i ê sim-pū, lóng ji̍p-khì tuā tsûn, siám-phiah tuā-tsuí.
English: Noah went into the ark with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives, because of the waters of the flood.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Má-ná-se ê kiáⁿ-sun bē-tàng kā hiah-ê siâⁿ ê jîn-bîn kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, Ka-nân lâng tsiū kuat-ì beh tuà tī hit-ê tē.
English: Yet the children of Manasseh couldn't drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.

Tailo: Tuà tī Gi-lia̍t-ia-be-si ê jîn-bîn, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Hui-lī-sū lâng tuì Sàu-lô só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: When the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard concerning him that which the Philistines had done to Saul,

Tailo: Ji̍t liâng-líng ê sî, Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè kiâⁿ-iû tī hn̂g lāi, in thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê siann, hit-ê lâng kah i ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū bih tī hn̂g lāi ê tshiū tiong, lâi siám-phiah Siōng-tsú ê bīn.
English: They heard the voice of Yahweh God walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.

Tailo: Si-tòng kah tuà tī Al-bua̍t ê jîn-bîn tsò lí ê kò tsiúⁿ ê; lí tiong-kan ê gâu lâng tsò lí ê huāⁿ tuā ê.
English: The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers: your wise men, Tyre, were in you, they were your pilots.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tiám-tshéⁿ Guá, lí Guá thang tsò-hué piān-lūn; lí thang pâi-lia̍t lí ê tsîng-lí, thang tit-tio̍h tshing-tsò gī.
English: Put me in remembrance; let us plead together: set you forth your cause, that you may be justified.

Tailo: Kā só͘-ū ê hē tī A-lông ê tshiú kah i ê kiáⁿ ê tshiú, tsò iô-tsè tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng iô.
English: He put all these in Aaron's hands and in his sons' hands, and waved them for a wave offering before Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá uàn-hūn guá it-tshè ê lô-lo̍k, to̍h-sī guá tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn só͘ lô-lo̍k ê; in-uī guá tio̍h lâu hō͘ guá í-āu ê lâng.
English: I hated all my labor in which I labored under the sun, seeing that I must leave it to the man who comes after me.

Tailo: Taⁿ tsiah-ê lóng sī Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, Lí ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī Lí īng Lí ê tuā khuì-la̍t kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú só͘ kiù-sio̍k ê.
English: Now these are your servants and your people, whom you have redeemed by your great power, and by your strong hand.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng nā huê-thâu lī-khui só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tsuē-ok, tsip-siú Guá só͘-ū ê lu̍t-lē, kiânn tsìng-ti̍t kah ha̍p-lí ê tāi-tsì, i it-tīng ē ua̍h, bē sí.
English: But if the wicked turn from all his sins that he has committed, and keep all my statutes, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall surely live, he shall not die.

Tailo: Hit sî, Nep-kat-ne-tsal muá-sim siū-khì, tuì Sia-to-la̍k, Me-siak kah A-bia̍t-ne-go͘ pìⁿ-bīn, bīng-līng lâng khí pí pîng-siông tshit puē khah jia̍t ê hué-lô͘;
English: Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury, and the form of his visage was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego: therefore he spoke, and commanded that they should heat the furnace seven times more than it was usually heated.

Tailo: Tsiū huan-hù Biān-iá-mín lâng kóng, Lín tio̍h khì bih tī phû-tô hn̂g tiong,
English: They commanded the children of Benjamin, saying, Go and lie in wait in the vineyards,

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t kiò thiⁿ kiò tē tuì lín tsò kiàn-tsìng, guá īng seⁿ-sí, tsiok-hok kah tsiù-tsó͘ pâi-lia̍t tī lí ê bīn-tsîng; só͘-í, lí tio̍h kíng-suán ua̍h-miā, hō͘ lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun lóng ē ua̍h-.leh,
English: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that I have set before you life and death, the blessing and the curse: therefore choose life, that you may live, you and your seed;

Tailo: to̍h-sī tī siū-khì tiong liân-liân phah tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, tī siū-khì tiong kuán-hat lia̍t kok koh kiânn pik-hāi bô lâng thang tsó͘-tsí.
English: who struck the peoples in wrath with a continual stroke, who ruled the nations in anger, with a persecution that none restrained.

Tailo: Tng i ê ji̍t, Iô-tah ē tit-tio̍h kiù, I-su-la-el ē an-jiân tuà tī hia. I ê miâ beh kiò-tsò ' Siōng-tsú — lán ê gī. '
English: In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely; and this is his name by which he shall be called: Yahweh our righteousness.

Tailo: Hit-ê kuán-ke tsiū kiò tsú-lâng ê tsè-bū-jîn tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê lâi. I kā thâu tsi̍t-ê kóng, ' Lí khiàm guá ê tsú-lâng guā tsē? '
English: Calling each one of his lord's debtors to him, he said to the first, How much do you owe to my lord?'

Tailo: E-hú tuì hia khì, tú-tio̍h Le-kap ê kiáⁿ Io-Ná-tap lâi tsiap i, E-hú kā i tshíng-an, tuì i kóng, Lí ê sim tsìng-ti̍t ǹg guá, tshin-tshiūnn guá ê sim ǹg lí ê sim á-bô? Io-Ná-tap ìn kóng, Sī. E-hú kóng, Nā-sī án-ne, tshun lí ê tshiú hō͘ guá. I tsiū tshun tshiú hō͘ i, i tsiū khan i tsiūⁿ tshia.
English: When he was departed there, he lighted on Jehonadab the son of Rechab coming to meet him; and he greeted him, and said to him, Is your heart right, as my heart is with your heart? Jehonadab answered, It is. If it be, give me your hand. He gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tsiàu i ê tsó͘-sian só͘ kiâⁿ ê, bô lī-khui Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê tsuē, to̍h-sī hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē ê.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, as his fathers had done: he didn't depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tsiū mn̄g i kóng, Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu án-tsuáⁿ piàn ē khuànn-kìnn?
English: They therefore were asking him, How were your eyes opened?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kìng-uì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, ho̍k-sāi I, kah I kiat-liân, kí I ê miâ lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: You shall fear Yahweh your God; him shall you serve; and to him shall you cleave, and by his name shall you swear.

Tailo: Tsit nn̄g-uī sù-tô͘ tsiū tiàm hia tsin kú, uá-khò Tsú hó-tánn suan-káng hok-im. Tsú siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ū lîng-li̍k kiânn sîn-jiah kî-sū, lâi kiàn-tsìng in só͘ thuân un-tián ê tō-lí.
English: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord, who testified to the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn lâng gia̍h-khí pó͘-thâu, lâi tshò tshiū-nâ ê tshiū.
English: They behaved like men wielding axes, Cutting through a thicket of trees.

Tailo: A-hà-tsuh seⁿ Ia-a-lah, ngá-la̍h seⁿ A-le-met, A-tsu-ma-bet kah Tsim-lī, Tsim-lī seⁿ Mo-tsah.
English: Ahaz became the father of Jarah; and Jarah became the father of Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza;

Tailo: Ná ē án-ne? In-uī in bô tuì sìn, sī tuì uá-khò in ê hîng-uî. In ê kiat-kio̍k sī khì that-tio̍h hit tè hō͘ lâng pua̍h-tó ê tsio̍h-thâu.
English: Why? Because they didn't seek it by faith, but as it were by works of the law. They stumbled over the stumbling stone;

Tailo: Iá-uán ê kiáⁿ E-lí-siah, Tha-sì, Kit-thê, Lô-tan.
English: The sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.

Tailo: Kah I-é-su tâng-tsê hō͘ lâng tìng si̍p-jī-kè ê hit nn̄g-ê thó͘-huí mā sī án-ne kā I bú-jio̍k.
English: The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng: Lín tio̍h tsai, Guá án-ne kiânn m̄-sī uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘. I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h uī ka-kī ê só͘ kiâⁿ lâi làu-khuì, kiàn-siàu.
English: Nor for your sake do I this, says the Lord Yahweh, be it known to you: be ashamed and confounded for your ways, house of Israel.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Lí só͘-ū ê kà-sī guá lóng lia̍h-tsò sī tsìng-ti̍t; jî-tshiánn guá uàn-hūn it-tshè ê siâ-lō͘.
English: Therefore I consider all of your precepts to be right. I hate every false way. PEY

Tailo: Tio̍h thâi-sí tsuân-pō͘ ê lāu lâng, siàu-liân lâng, tsāi-sik-lí, enn-á kah tsa-bó͘ lâng, mā tio̍h tuì Guá ê sìng-só͘ thâi khí, tsóng-.sī, kiàn-nā ū kì-hō ê, m̄-thang kīn-uá i. Tsiū án-ne, in tsiū tuì tiān tsîng ê tiúⁿ-ló thâi khí.
English: kill utterly the old man, the young man and the virgin, and little children and women; but don't come near any man on whom is the mark: and begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the old men that were before the house.

Tailo: In-uī lâng tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn lô-lo̍k lô-sim, ū tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: For what has a man of all his labor, and of the striving of his heart, in which he labors under the sun?

Tailo: Guān Lí ê tsû-pi lîm-kàu guá, hō͘ guá ū ua̍h-miā, in-uī Lí ê lu̍t-huat sī guá só͘ ì-ài.
English: Let your tender mercies come to me, that I may live; For your law is my delight.

Tailo: Lín ná ē hō͘ guán tshut Ai-gi̍p, tshuā guán kàu tsit-ê pháiⁿ só͘-tsāi? Bô só͘-tsāi thang iā tsíng, mā bô bû-hua-kó, bô phû-tô, bô sia̍h-liû, koh bô tsuí thang lim.
English: Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè, to̍h-sī I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, tsí ū I kiânn kî-ī ê tāi-tsì, lán ing-kai o-ló I!
English: Praise be to Yahweh God, the God of Israel, Who alone does marvelous deeds.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông Io-a-si kā i ê tsó͘-sian Iô-tah ông Iô-sa-huat, Io-lâm, A-ha-tsiah só͘ hiàn tsò sìng ê mi̍h, kah i pún-sin só͘ hiàn tsò sìng ê mi̍h, í-ki̍p Siōng-tsú ê tiān kah ông-kiong kim-khò͘ só͘-ū ê kim, lóng sàng hō͘ A-lâm ông Ha-tsa-el, i tsiū bô khí-lâi Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: Jehoash king of Judah took all the holy things that Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah, his fathers, kings of Judah, had dedicated, and his own holy things, and all the gold that was found in the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and of the king's house, and sent it to Hazael king of Syria: and he went away from Jerusalem.

Tailo: Sa-tán nā ka-kī khí hun-tsing, i ê kok ná khiā ē tiâu? Lín kóng guá khò Be̍h-tse-bul kuáⁿ kuí,
English: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h kā hit nn̄g tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng an-tì tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: He shall take the two goats, and set them before Yahweh at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú kóng, Lia̍t kok, in-uī án-ne lín tio̍h thiaⁿ! Huē-tsiòng, lín tio̍h tsai in tiong-kan ū siáⁿ-mi̍h sū.
English: Therefore hear, you nations, and know, congregation, what is among them.

Tailo: Iô-el ê kiáⁿ Si-má-iah, Si-má-iah ê kiáⁿ Go͘-k, Go͘-k ê kiáⁿ Si-mí,
English: The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

Tailo: Ū ê ka-la̍uh tī tsio̍h-thâu-á tē, thô͘-bah tshián ê só͘-tsāi, in-uī thô͘-bah bô tshim, tsin kín tsiū huat-gê.
English: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

Tailo: I-su-la-el jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h ông só͘ phuàⁿ-tuàn ê àn, tsiū lóng kìng-uì i, in-uī in ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê sim-lāi ū Siōng-tsú ê tì-huī lâi teh phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: All Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do justice.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh tuì guá kóng, Tī Iô-tah lâng kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng ê tiong-kan ū kè-bô͘ tsō-huán ê tāi-tsì.
English: Yahweh said to me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Tailo: to̍h-sī hō͘ Lē-bī kiáⁿ-sun tiong, Ko-hat tsong-tso̍k tiong, A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun, in-uī hō͘ in tāi-sing liam-khau,
English: and they were for the children of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites, who were of the children of Levi; for theirs was the first lot.

Tailo: só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, Guá beh tsiàu lí ê siū-khì, tsiò lí uī-tio̍h uàn-hūn kiânn tī in ê uàn-tò͘ lâi khuán-thāi lí. Tī sím-phuàⁿ lí ê sî, Guá tsiū beh hián-bîng ka-kī tī in tiong-kan.
English: therefore, as I live, says the Lord Yahweh, I will do according to your anger, and according to your envy which you have shown out of your hatred against them; and I will make myself known among them, when I shall judge you.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī sàng hō͘ tuà tī Be-thel ê, tuà tī lâm-hong ê La̍h-mot ê, tuà tī Ia-thel ê,
English: To those who were in Bethel, and to those who were in Ramoth of the South, and to those who were in Jattir,

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tsū-tsi̍p Ai-gi̍p tē tshit-ê hó-nî-tang só͘-ū ê bí-niûⁿ, kā bí-niûⁿ tsik-tsū tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ; sì-kho͘-uî tshân-tē ê bí-niûⁿ, lóng tsik-tsū tī i ê pún-siâⁿ.
English: He gathered up all the food of the seven years which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which was round about every city, he laid up in the same.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì tī lia̍t pang tiong suan-pò͘, tio̍h tsún-pī kau-tsiàn, kik-tōng ióng-sū, hō͘ só͘-ū ê tsiàn-sū hiòng tsîng māi-tsìn.
English: Proclaim this among the nations: Prepare for war! Stir up the mighty men. Let all the warriors draw near. Let them come up.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng kah guá piān-lūn? Ū, guá tsiū tiām-tiām lâi tn̄g-khuì.
English: Who is he who will contend with me? For then would I hold my peace and give up the spirit.

Tailo: Tè-ông tuì guá lâi tsē uī; kun-ông tuì guá tiāⁿ-tio̍h kong-pêⁿ ê lu̍t-huat.
English: By me kings reign, And princes decree justice.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsò tsè-si ho̍k lāi-bīn ê guā-phàu, kui niá sī nâ-sik ê.
English: You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.

Tailo: In lóng kàu tsi̍t-ê só͘-tsāi; lóng tshut tī thô͘-sua hún, mā lóng kui tī thô͘-sua hún.
English: All go to one place. All are from the dust, and all turn to dust again.

Tailo: Ông thiàⁿ Ê-su-tel iâⁿ-kuè kî-tha tsìng lú-tsú, i tī ông ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián kah thióng-ài, iâⁿ-kuè kî-tha tsìng tsāi-sik-lí. Ông tsiū kā ông-hō͘ ê bián-liû tì tī i ê thâu-khak, siat-li̍p i tsò ông-hō͘, lâi tāi-thè Ua-si-thih.
English: The king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained favor and kindness in his sight more than all the virgins; so that he set the royal crown on her head, and made her queen instead of Vashti.

Tailo: Koh īng liam-khau hō͘ Ko-hat kî-tha ê kiáⁿ-sun tsa̍p-ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī E-hu-laim ê tsi-tso̍k, tī Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k, koh tī Má-ná-se puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ê tē.
English: To the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, out of the family of the tribe, out of the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.

Tailo: Tsit khuán lâng mā tio̍h sing hō͘ in tsiap-siū khó-giām, nā bô thang hiâm tsiah thang hō͘ in tsò tsip-sū.
English: Let them also first be tested; then let them serve as deacons, if they are blameless.

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t khuàⁿ-tiōng lí ê sèⁿ-miā, guān Siōng-tsú mā án-ne khuàⁿ-tiōng guá ê sèⁿ-miā, koh kiù guá thuat-lī só͘-ū ê huān-lān.
English: Behold, as your life was much set by this day in my eyes, so let my life be much set by in the eyes of Yahweh, and let him deliver me out of all oppression.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsit-ê Ta-ni-el, tng Ta-lió-suh tsē-uī ê sî kah Phel-siah lâng Ko-le-si tsē-uī ê sî, lóng tit-tio̍h hing-thong.
English: So this Daniel prospered in the reign of Darius, and in the reign of Cyrus the Persian.

Tailo: Lí ê tshuì-phué tī phè lāi, tshin-tshiūnn peh khui ê sia̍h-liû.
English: Your temples are like a piece of a pomegranate behind your veil.

Tailo: Tio̍h tsun-siú tsit-ê bīng-līng, bô khuat-tiám, bô thang hiâm, it-ti̍t kàu lán ê Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok tsài-lîm.
English: that you keep the commandment without spot, blameless, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ;

Tailo: Guá kiû-kiò ê sî, guá ê tuì-ti̍k lóng ē ua̍t tńg-sin thè-.khì. Siōng-tè uī guá, tse sī guá só͘ tsai.
English: Then my enemies shall turn back in the day that I call. I know this, that God is for me.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia huan-hù tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān lāi tio̍h tsún-pī tshik-tshng, in tsiū án-ne tsún-pī.
English: Then Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of Yahweh; and they prepared them.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tī Siōng-tsú ê tuâⁿ tsîng, kha-thâu-u kuī-.leh, tshun tshiú ǹg thiⁿ, í-king tuì Siōng-tsú kî-tó khún-kiû liáu-āu, tsiū khí-.lâi.
English: It was so, that when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication to Yahweh, he arose from before the altar of Yahweh, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread forth toward heaven.

Tailo: Io-ha-nân seⁿ A-tsa-lí-ah, (tsit-ê A-tsa-lí-ah tī Só͘-lô-móng tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm só͘ khí ê tiān tam-tng tsè-si ê tsit )
English: and Johanan became the father of Azariah, (he it is who executed the priest's office in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem),

Tailo: I koh kau-tài in kóng, M̄-thang tuà lō͘-huì, m̄-thang tuà kuái-á, m̄-thang tuà hîng-lí tē, m̄-thang tuà kan-niûⁿ, m̄-thang tuà tsîⁿ-gîn, mā m̄-thang tuà nn̄g niá saⁿ.
English: He said to them, Take nothing for your journeyneither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats apiece.

Tailo: Ia-kim, Tsik-lī, Tsap-tí,
English: and Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,

Tailo: Hiah-ê kah A-to-nî-iah tī-.leh ê lâng-kheh lóng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ khí-.lâi, ta̍k lâng kiânn in ê lō͘ sì-suàⁿ-.khì.
English: All the guests of Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn Lí ū tshe-phài guá ji̍p sè-kan, guá mā ū tshe-phài in ji̍p sè-kan.
English: As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.

Tailo: Nā lī-khui, tsiū tio̍h siú to̍k-sin, nā bô, tio̍h koh kah in ang hô-hó; tsa-po͘ lâng mā m̄-thang pàng-sak in bó͘.
English: (but if she departs, let her remain unmarried, or else be reconciled to her husband), and that the husband not leave his wife.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê tshuì seⁿ-tshut tì-huī; o͘-pe̍h-kóng ê tsi̍h ē hông kuah-tn̄g.
English: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, But the perverse tongue will be cut off.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī Tse-lông ê kiáⁿ E-lí-ap ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.

Tailo: Guá ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tè hō͘ sè-kan lâng ê lô-lo̍k, I hō͘ in tī hit tiong-kan lâi liān-si̍p.
English: I have seen the burden which God has given to the sons of men to be afflicted with.

Tailo: Thuat-lī siâ-sîn ê hit-ê lâng kiû beh tuè I-é-su khì, m̄-koh, I-é-su kiò i tńg-.khì, kóng,
English: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

Tailo: Koh tio̍h hiàn siā-un-tsè, mā tī hia tsia̍h, tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng huann-hí.
English: and you shall sacrifice peace offerings, and shall eat there; and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê sî, in kah Ha-gal lâng kau-tsiàn, Ha-gal lâng sí tī in ê tshiú-hā, in tsiū tī Gi-lia̍t tang pîng ê tsuân tē tuà tī in ê pò͘-pênn.
English: In the days of Saul, they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they lived in their tents throughout all the land east of Gilead.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Lí só͘ tsò ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h sū? Tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Tsuâ ín-iú guá, guá tsiū tsia̍h.
English: Yahweh God said to the woman, What is this you have done? The woman said, The serpent deceived me, and I ate.

Tailo: Lâng siàu-liân ê sî phāinn i ê ka-tann, tse sī hó.
English: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī tshuā I ê tsú-bîn kiânn tī khòng-iá ê Siōng-tè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who led his people through the wilderness; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Io-siú-ah kóng, Suá tuā tè tsio̍h kàu tōng kháu, phài lâng tiàm hia kā in kò͘-siú,
English: Joshua said, Roll great stones to the mouth of the cave, and set men by it to keep them:

Tailo: Tse sī tsuân tē-it hūn ê sìng-tē, tio̍h kui tī tsè-si, to̍h-sī tsò sìng-só͘ ê tshe-īng, kīn-uá lâi ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú ê, tsit-ê tē thang tsò in khí tshù ê só͘-tsāi kah sìng-só͘ ê sìng-tē.
English: It is a holy portion of the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to minister to Yahweh; and it shall be a place for their houses, and a holy place for the sanctuary.

Tailo: In-uī i sí ê sî, bô kah tsi̍t hāng tuà ē khì; i ê îng-huâ hù-kuì bē-tàng tuè i khì.
English: For when he dies he shall carry nothing away. His glory shall not descend after him.

Tailo: He-ló-tiah tsiū uàn-hūn Iô-há-neh, ài beh kā i thâi, m̄-koh bô huat-tō͘ si̍t-hiān.
English: Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him, but she couldn't,

Tailo: Iûⁿ tī tshiū-ki ê tuì-bīn kau-ha̍p, tsiū seⁿ ū bûn ê, ū tiám ê, ū pan ê.
English: The flocks conceived before the rods, and the flocks brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted.

Tailo: In tsìng be̍h, siu-sîng tshì-phè; lô-khó͘ mā lóng bô lī-ik. In-uī Siōng-tsú ê tuā siū-khì, in ē uī-tio̍h in ê lông-sán-bu̍t lâi kiàn-siàu.
English: They have sown wheat, and have reaped thorns; they have put themselves to pain, and profit nothing: and you shall be ashamed of your fruits, because of the fierce anger of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tī tshân-.ni̍h siu-kuah ngó͘-kok, nā bē kì-tit tsi̍t-sok tī tshân-.ni̍h, m̄-thang koh uat-khì the̍h, tio̍h lâu hō͘ tshut-guā lâng kah ko͘-jî, kuáⁿ-hū, án-ne Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ē tī lí ê tshiú só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, kā lí sù-hok.
English: When you reap your harvest in your field, and have forgot a sheaf in the field, you shall not go again to get it: it shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow; that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê lâng kiàn-siàu, kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, siū lia̍h; lí khuàⁿ, in pàng-sak Siōng-tsú ê uē, in ê sim-lāi kám iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tì-huī?
English: The wise men are disappointed, they are dismayed and taken: behold, they have rejected the word of Yahweh; and what manner of wisdom is in them?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá koh tuì i kóng, Lí taⁿ huâi-īn, beh seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, tio̍h kā i hō-miâ I-si-ma-el, in-uī Siōng-tsú ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê khó͘-tsîng.
English: The angel of Yahweh said to her, Behold, you are with child, and will bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael, because Yahweh has heard your affliction.

Tailo: In tsiū kā i pak sing-khu ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ, the̍h i ê thâu-khak kah kun-tsong, tshe lâng khì Hui-lī-sū tē ê sì-kho͘-uî, pò siau-sit hō͘ in ê ngó͘-siōng kah in ê jîn-bîn.
English: They stripped him, and took his head, and his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the news to their idols, and to the people.

Tailo: Kòng tsin tsē ē liáu-āu, kā in kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ, huan-hù kò͘-kaⁿ ê lâng giâm-bi̍t kò͘-siú.
English: When they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, charging the jailer to keep them safely,

Tailo: I mā kā lán khàm ìn tsò kì-hō, koh siúⁿ-sù Sìng Sîn tī lán ê sim-lāi tsò tam-pó.
English: who also sealed us, and gave us the down payment of the Spirit in our hearts.

Tailo: Tse sī guá tsá-tsîng tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-su-la-el Siōng-tè ē-bīn ê ua̍h-mi̍h, guá tsai in sī ki-lō͘-ping.
English: This is the living creature that I saw under the God of Israel by the river Chebar; and I knew that they were cherubim.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê kng si̍t-tsāi ē hua, i ê hué-iām ē bô kng.
English: Yes, the light of the wicked shall be put out, The spark of his fire shall not shine.

Tailo: Í-tsîng lín ê ì-sù sī pháiⁿ, tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tè ê ì-sù sī hó; I beh pó-tsuân tsin tsē lâng ê sèⁿ-miā, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t.
English: As for you, you meant evil against me, but God meant it for good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save many people alive.

Tailo: I ê tshù-piⁿ kah pîng-sî bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h i í-tsîng tsò khit-tsia̍h ê lâng kóng, Tsit-ê kám m̄-sī put-sî tsē teh tsò khit-tsia̍h hit-ê lâng?
English: The neighbors therefore, and those who saw that he was blind before, said, Isn't this he who sat and begged?

Tailo: M̄-koh, Piat-tò͘ khí-.lâi, tsáu-khì bōng-.ni̍h, àⁿ lo̍h-khì khuànn lāi-bīn, tsí ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h iù-tē pò͘. I tsiū tńg-.khì, tuì só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì kám-kak tsin kî-kuài.
English: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.

Tailo: mā uī-tio̍h gû-káng, iûⁿ-káng kah iûⁿ-á, suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè, i ê kuàn-tiān, lóng tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu hit-ê lē.
English: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i beh ua̍t tńg-sin ǹg ka-kī kok lāi ê hiám-iàu só͘-tsāi, tsóng-.sī, i ē kha that-tio̍h lâi pua̍h-tó, kàu bué bô koh hông khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Then he shall turn his face toward the fortresses of his own land; but he shall stumble and fall, and shall not be found.

Tailo: I koh kā in ê tsing-seⁿ kau hō͘ pha̍uh, kā in kui kûn ê tsing-seⁿ kau hō͘ sih-nà.
English: He gave over their livestock also to the hail, And their flocks to hot thunderbolts.

Tailo: Guān tsè-tsú īng kè-tì kā i tsing-ho̍k it-tshè só͘-ū ê! Guān tsheⁿ-hūn lâng tshiúⁿ i thua-buâ só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsâi-sán!
English: Let the creditor seize all that he has. Let strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.

Tailo: M̄-thang siūⁿ kóng guá ē tī Thiⁿ-pē ê bīn-tsîng khòng-kò lín; teh khòng-kò lín ê sī lín só͘ gióng-bōng ê Mô͘-se.
English: Don't think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, even Moses, on whom you have set your hope.

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan só͘-ū ê tsa-po͘ ê, lóng tio̍h siū kat-lé; tse to̍h-sī Guá kah lí í-ki̍p lí ê kiáⁿ-sun só͘ li̍p ê iok, sī lín só͘ tio̍h tsun-siú ê.
English: This is my covenant, which you shall keep, between me and you and your seed after you. Every male among you shall be circumcised.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tshun tshiú ji̍p-khì tē-á lāi, the̍h tsi̍t tè tsio̍h-thâu-á tshut-.lâi, īng soh hìⁿ-.khì, siā tio̍h Hui-lī-sū lâng ê thâu-hia̍h, tsio̍h-thâu-á tîm ji̍p-khì thâu-hia̍h, i tsiū tó lo̍h-.khì, bīn phak tī thô͘-kha.
English: David put his hand in his bag, and took there a stone, and slang it, and struck the Philistine in his forehead; and the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.

Tailo: Kàu tē-sì ji̍t, tī lán Siōng-tè ê tiān, tshìn hiah-ê kim-gîn kah khì-kū, kau tī tsè-si U-lī-a ê kiáⁿ Me-le-mo͘t ê tshiú. Kah i tsò-hué lâi ê ū Hui-ne-hah ê kiáⁿ Ê-lī-a-tsal, koh kah in tsò-hué lâi ê, ū Lē-bī lâng E-siu-ah ê kiáⁿ Io-tsa-bat kah Bin-nuí ê kiáⁿ No-a-tiah.
English: On the fourth day the silver and the gold and the vessels were weighed in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, the Levite;

Tailo: Hō͘-siong sio-sî liáu-āu, guán tsiūⁿ tsûn, in tńg-khì in tau.
English: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.

Tailo: Tû-khì hiah-ê tuì sì-kho͘-uî ê guā-pang tiong lâi tshuē guán ê lâng í-guā, ū Iô-tah lâng kah kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p lâng, tī guá ê toh tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: Moreover there were at my table, of the Jews and the rulers, one hundred fifty men, besides those who came to us from among the nations that were round about us.

Tailo: Tuâⁿ sī tshâ tsò ê, kuân saⁿ tiú, tn̂g nn̄g tiú. I ê kak, i ê tsō kah i ê sì-piⁿ lóng sī tshâ tsò ê. I tuì guá kóng, Tse sī Siōng-tsú bīn-tsîng ê toh.
English: The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and the length of it two cubits; and the corners of it, and the length of it, and the walls of it, were of wood: and he said to me, This is the table that is before Yahweh.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ tóng tshin-tshiūnn káu-luī teh pau-uî guá; in thiah-li̍h guá ê tshiú, guá ê kha.
English: For dogs have surrounded me. A company of evil-doers have enclosed me. They pierced my hands and my feet.

Tailo: El-ká-nah kah i ê tsuân ke lóng tsiūⁿ-.khì, tsiū īng ta̍k nî ê tsè-sū kah i só͘ hē ê guān hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to Yahweh the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōng-tè ê Sìng Sîn lîm-kàu tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah ê kiáⁿ Tsa-kha-lī-a; i tsiū khiā tī jîn-bîn ê tíng-bīn, tuì in kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Lín ná ē huān-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê kài-bīng, tì-sú bē-tàng hing-thong? In-uī lín khì-sak Siōng-tsú, Siōng-tsú mā khì-sak lín. '
English: The Spirit of God came on Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest; and he stood above the people, and said to them, Thus says God, Why disobey you the commandments of Yahweh, so that you can't prosper? because you have forsaken Yahweh, he has also forsaken you.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè kóng, Lâng tuaⁿ-sin ka-kī tuà m̄-hó, Guá beh kā i tsō tsi̍t-ê pang-tsān ê, lâi kah i phit-phuè.
English: Yahweh God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a helper suitable for him.

Tailo: I ê lāu-pē nā bô hiann-tī, tsiū tio̍h kā i ê sán-gia̍p hō͘ i ê tso̍k tiong tsì-tshin ê, i tsiū tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p. Tse beh tsò I-su-la-el lâng tn̄g tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē; sī tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘-se ê.
English: If his father have no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his kinsman who is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it: and it shall be to the children of Israel a statute and ordinance, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Siōng-tè tshut-tsāi in hòng-tshiòng tsîng-io̍k khì tsò it-puaⁿ lâng kám-kak kiàn-siàu ê tāi-tsì, tsa-bó͘ lâng kah tsa-bó͘ lâng īng huán tsū-jiân ê sìng-kuan-hē, lâi tāi-thè kah tsa-po͘ lâng ê tsū-jiân sìng-kuan-hē.
English: For this reason, God gave them up to vile passions. For their women changed the natural function into that which is against nature.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng ê tsuân huē-tsiòng lóng tsū-tsi̍p tī Sī-lô, tah huē-bō͘ tī hia, in-uī in í-king tsing-ho̍k hi̍t tē-hng.
English: The whole congregation of the children of Israel assembled themselves together at Shiloh, and set up the tent of meeting there: and the land was subdued before them.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Guá, Guá í-king kóng, Guá mā kíng-tiàu i, tshuā i lâi, i ê lō͘ ē hing-thong.
English: I, even I, have spoken; yes, I have called him; I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsiàu Lē-bī lâng ê tsong-tso̍k kah ke-kháu, kā in tiám-sǹg. Kiàn-nā muá-gue̍h í-siōng ê tsa-po͘ gín-á, lí lóng tio̍h tiám-sǹg.
English: Number the children of Levi by their fathers' houses, by their families: every male from a month old and upward shall you number.

Tailo: Guá — Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hō͘ kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ tuì sì-kho͘-uî lîm-kàu tī lín, lín ē siū kuáⁿ-tshut, ta̍k lâng ti̍t-ti̍t tsáu-.khì, tsáu bô lō͘ ê bô lâng thang siu-liû.
English: Behold, I will bring a fear on you, says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, from all who are round about you; and you shall be driven out every man right forth, and there shall be none to gather together the fugitives.

Tailo: Bil-ha̍h, E-tsém, To͘-lat,
English: and at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kuáⁿ-kín tsàu khì khiā tī hit-ê Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tíng-bīn, kā i ê to pue̍h tshut siù, īng hit ki to kā i thâi-sí, tsám i ê thâu-khak. Hui-lī-sū kûn-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê ióng-sū í-king sí, tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tsàu.
English: Then David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath of it, and killed him, and cut off his head therewith. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.

Tailo: Guá tsin kiaⁿ, só͘-í, kā lí hit tsi̍t-tshìn gîn-pè tâi tī thô͘-kha. Taⁿ lí ê gîn-pè hîng lí. '
English: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours.'

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ ê kun-ông, tuā-kuaⁿ, kun-tiúⁿ, hó-gia̍h lâng, ū sè-li̍k ê, í-ki̍p só͘-ū tsò lô͘-po̍k ê kah tsū-iû ê, lóng khì bih tiàm suaⁿ-tōng kah suaⁿ-giâm.
English: The kings of the earth, the princes, the commanding officers, the rich, the strong, and every slave and free person, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê iàn-lo̍k, an-jiân teh tsē ê lâng, taⁿ tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê uē. Lí sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng: Tsí-ū guá, guá í-guā bô pa̍t-ê. Guá it-tīng bē tì-sú tsiú-kuáⁿ, mā bē tú-tio̍h kiáⁿ sí-sit ê tāi-tsì.
English: Now therefore hear this, you who are given to pleasures, who sit securely, who say in your heart, I am, and there is none else besides me; I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall I know the loss of children:

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ lia̍h tuā-tsè-si Se-la-iah kah tē-jī kip ê tsè-si Tse-huan-iah kah saⁿ-ê kò͘-mn̂g ê,
English: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold:

Tailo: Koh thâi-sí tsi̍t-ê Ai-gi̍p ê tuā-hàn lâng, ū gō͘ tiú ê kuân, Ai-gi̍p lâng tshiú-.ni̍h ū tshiuⁿ, tuā tshin-tshiūnn pò͘-ki ê niû; Be-ná-iah gia̍h kuái lo̍h-khì kah i tsih-tsiap, tshiúⁿ Ai-gi̍p lâng tshiú lāi ê tshiuⁿ, tsiah īng i ê tshiuⁿ kā i thâi-sí.
English: He killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian's hand was a spear like a weaver's beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and killed him with his own spear.

Tailo: Lí ê hiann-tī piàn sàn-tshiah lâi tuà tī lí hia, lí tio̍h kā i pó͘-tsō͘, hō͘ i kah lí tsò-hué tuà, tshin-tshiūnn tshut-guā lâng kah kià-kha ê.
English: If your brother has become poor, and his hand can't support him among you; then you shall uphold him. As a stranger and a sojourner he shall live with you.

Tailo: In-uī ū lâng tshut-sì to̍h bô sik-ha̍p kiat-hun, mā ū jîn-uî ê iân-kò͘, mā ū uī-tio̍h thian-kok ê iân-kò͘. Ē-tàng tsiap-siū ê lâng tsiah hó án-ne tsò.
English: For there are eunuchs who were born that way from their mother's womb, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men; and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven's sake. He who is able to receive it, let him receive it.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, pháiⁿ lâng tiuⁿ king, an in ê tsìnn tī king-hiân, beh thau-thau-á siā hiah-ê sim tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng.
English: For, behold, the wicked bend their bows. They set their arrows on the strings, That they may shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tī uá-kīn E-tóm pian-kài ê Hol suaⁿ, huan-hù Mô͘-se kah A-lông kóng:
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying,

Tailo: In-uī in m̄ tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú — in ê Siōng-tè ê uē, uî-puē I ê iok, kiàn-nā Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se só͘ bīng-līng ê, in m̄-thiaⁿ koh m̄ tsun-siú.
