English: because they didn't obey the voice of Yahweh their God, but transgressed his covenant, even all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded, and would not hear it, nor do it.

Tailo: I tī tsiah-ê sū ê tsi̍t hāng ū tsuē, tsiū tio̍h sîng-jīn i só͘ huān ê tsuē.
English: It shall be, when he is guilty of one of these, he shall confess that in which he has sinned:

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Guá sī ua̍h-miā ê piáⁿ. Lâi guá tsia ê lâng tsua̍t-tuì bē iau, sìn guá ê lâng íng-uán bē tshuì-ta.
English: Jesus said to them, I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū siong-sìn, in thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú tsiàu-kò͘ I-su-la-el lâng, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê kan-khó͘, tsiū ànn thâu kìng-pài.
English: The people believed, and when they heard that Yahweh had visited the children of Israel, and that he had seen their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshiped.

Tailo: Lán ê Tsú koh sù guá hong-sīng ê un-tián, hō͘ guá tit-tio̍h kah Ki-tok I-é-su kiat-liân tsiah ū ê sìn-gióng kah thiàⁿ-sim.
English: The grace of our Lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

Tailo: Siā tsìnn ê lâng tuì tshiûⁿ tíng siā lí ê lô͘-po̍k, ông ê lô͘-po̍k sí kuí-nā-ê lâng, lí ê lô͘-po̍k Hiat lâng U-lī-a mā sí.
English: The shooters shot at your servants from off the wall; and some of the king's servants are dead, and your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.

Tailo: M̄-thang kìng-pài pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, in-uī Siōng-tsú ê miâ kiò-tsò to̍k-tsun, I sī to̍k-tsun ê Siōng-tè.
English: for you shall worship no other god: for Yahweh, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.

Tailo: Lín tsit-má teh iau ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōng-tè ē hō͘ lín tsia̍h kah pá. Lín tsit-má teh thî-khàu ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōng-tè ē hō͘ lín tshiò.
English: Blessed are you who hunger now, For you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, For you will laugh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh kóng, Lín tio̍h tsia̍h bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ tshit ji̍t, thâu tsi̍t ji̍t tio̍h tuì lín ta̍k king tshù kā kàⁿ tû-.khì, in-uī tuì thâu tsi̍t ji̍t kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, só͘-ū tsia̍h ū kàⁿ ê, ē tuì I-su-la-el tiong tû-.khì.
English: Seven days shall you eat unleavened bread; even the first day you shall put away yeast out of your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá kā lín kóng, lóng m̄-thang tsiù-tsuā. M̄-thang kí thiⁿ lâi tsiù-tsuā, in-uī thiⁿ sī Siōng-tè ê pó-tsō;
English: but I tell you, don't swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsin tio̍h-kip, in-uī tsìng lâng kóng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā Ta-bi̍t tìm-sí. Lâng-lâng uī-tio̍h in ê kiáⁿ-jî tsin huân-ló, tsóng-.sī, Ta-bi̍t uá-khò Siōng-tsú — i ê Siōng-tè, ka-kī kian-kò͘.
English: David was greatly distressed; for the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David strengthened himself in Yahweh his God.

Tailo: Tsiù-tsó͘ lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú ê, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Anyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí ê tshiú só͘ tshòng-tsō ê thiⁿ kah Lí só͘ pâi-lia̍t ê gue̍h-niû, tsheⁿ-sîn.
English: When I consider your heavens, the work of your fingers, The moon and the stars, which you have ordained;

Tailo: Sâm-sóng ê bó͘ tī i ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu, kóng, Lí sī uàn-hūn guá, m̄-sī thiàⁿ guá, in-uī lí tshut bī-tshai hō͘ guá pún-kok ê lâng, mā bô kā guá kóng bîng. Sâm-sóng ìn i kóng, Guá liân lāu-pē lāu-bú to bô kā in kóng, kám thang kā lí kóng?
English: Samson's wife wept before him, and said, You do but hate me, and don't love me: you have put forth a riddle to the children of my people, and haven't told it me. He said to her, Behold, I haven't told it my father nor my mother, and shall I tell you?

Tailo: Lâng siat-to̍k Siōng-tsú ê miâ, tio̍h hō͘ i sí; tsuân huē-tsiòng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí. Put-kuán sī tshut-guā lâng á-.sī pún-tē-lâng, i siat-to̍k Siōng-tsú ê miâ ê sî, tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: He who blasphemes the name of Yahweh, he shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall certainly stone him: the foreigner as well as the native-born, when he blasphemes the Name, shall be put to death.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-jī lâng to̍h-sī, Sí-mòng, I-é-su kā i hō-tsò Piat-tò͘.
English: Simon, to whom he gave the name Peter;

Tailo: Ông kóng, A-hi-mé-li̍k, lí kah lí ê lāu-pē tsuân ke lóng it-tīng tio̍h sí.
English: The king said, You shall surely die, Ahimelech, you, and all your father's house.

Tailo: Ki-song ê sî, guá m̄-bat tsia̍h hiah-ê sìng-mi̍h; bô tshing-khì ê sî, guá mā m̄-bat the̍h khí-lâi tsia̍h, mā bô īng lâi tsò tuì sí-lâng ê tsè-mi̍h. Guá tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú — guá ê Siōng-tè ê uē, lóng sī tsiàu Lí it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng guá ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: I have not eaten of it in my mourning, neither have I put away of it, being unclean, nor given of it for the dead: I have listened to the voice of Yahweh my God; I have done according to all that you have commanded me.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm siū Siōng-tè khó-giām ê sî, in-uī ū sìn-sim, tsiah kā i ê kiáⁿ Í-sak hiàn tsò tsè-mi̍h; to̍h-sī kóng sîng-siū ìng-ín ê A-bu-la-hàm, iáu-koh guān-ì kā i ê to̍k-seⁿ kiáⁿ tsò tsè-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tè.
English: By faith, Abraham, being tested, offered up Isaac. Yes, he who had gladly received the promises was offering up his one and only son;

Tailo: Tsiàu tsìng-ti̍t lâi kiâⁿ ê lâng kìng-uì Siōng-tsú; to̍k-to̍k tsò tāi-tsì hîng-gi̍k ê lâng biáu-sī Siōng-tsú.
English: He who walks in his uprightness fears Yahweh, But he who is perverse in his ways despises him.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Guá tsū-tsi̍p I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, tuì só͘ sì-suàⁿ khì ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan tuì in hián-bîng Guá tsò sìng tī lia̍t kok lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng; hit sî, in ē tuà tī pún só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Iâ-kop ê tē.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: When I shall have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and shall be sanctified in them in the sight of the nations, then shall they dwell in their own land which I gave to my servant Jacob.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: tsiū guān tshì-á seⁿ-tshut lâi thè sió-be̍h, pháiⁿ-tsháu seⁿ-tshut lâi thè tuā-be̍h. Io-buh ê uē kóng suah à.
English: Let briars grow instead of wheat, And stinkweed instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.

Tailo: Tsi̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guá ê tsú, guá kah tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò-hué tuà tsi̍t king tshù, guá tī tshù lāi seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ.
English: The one woman said, Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.

Tailo: Ông pak ka-kī ê tshiú-tsí lâi hō͘ Mol-té-kái, to̍h-sī tuì Ha-mán the̍h tò tńg-.lâi ê. Ê-su-tel koh siat-li̍p Mol-té-kái lâi kuán-lí Ha-mán ê ka-sán.
English: The king took off his ring, which he had taken from Haman, and gave it to Mordecai. Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.

Tailo: koh kàu Tu-lô kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ kah Hi-bī lâng í-ki̍p Ka-nân lâng só͘-ū ê siâⁿ, koh tshut-khì kàu Iô-tah lâm-hong ê Bel-sí-bah.
English: and came to the stronghold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites; and they went out to the south of Judah, at Beersheba.

Tailo: Hit sî, I-é-su tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng lâi-kàu Iol-tàn hô tshuē Iô-há-neh, beh hō͘ i sé-lé.
English: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

Tailo: Tē-peh ji̍t, ông tshe jîn-bîn suàⁿ-.khì; in tsiū kā ông tsiok-hok; in-uī Siōng-tsú tuì I ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t kah I ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el só͘ si-tshut it-tshè ê un-huī, in tsiū huann-hí, sim-lāi khuài-lo̍k, ta̍k-ê tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn.
English: On the eighth day he sent the people away; and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that Yahweh had shown to David his servant, and to Israel his people.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Só͘-lô-móng kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, A-to-nî-iah kiaⁿ Só͘-lô-móng ông, in-uī i khîⁿ-tiâu tsè-tuâⁿ ê kak, kóng, ' Guān Só͘-lô-móng ông kin-á-ji̍t tuì guá tsiù-tsuā, it-tīng bô īng to thâi-sí i ê lô͘-po̍k. '
English: It was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah fears king Solomon; for, behold, he has laid hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear to me first that he will not kill his servant with the sword.

Tailo: Lâng nā tī Siōng-tsú ê sìng-mi̍h huān tsuē tì-sú ū kuè-sit, tsiū tio̍h īng pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè lâi hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, tsiàu lí só͘ kó͘ si-khel ê gîn, to̍h-sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tuì iûⁿ-kûn tiong tshú bô khuat-tiám ê mî-iûⁿ-káng, lâi tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè.
English: If anyone commits a trespass, and sins unwittingly, in the holy things of Yahweh; then he shall bring his trespass offering to Yahweh, a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation in silver by shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.

Tailo: Bô lâng thè lí piān-hō͘, hō͘ lí ê siong-hûn tit-tio̍h pau-tsat; lí bô i-tī ê hó-io̍h.
English: There is none to plead your cause, that you may be bound up: you have no healing medicines.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tuì Lâm-sik tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Su-kot.
English: The children of Israel traveled from Rameses, and encamped in Succoth.

Tailo: Nep-kat-ne-tsal só͘ lia̍h ê jîn-sò͘, kì tī ē-té: Tī tē-tshit nî lia̍h Iô-tah lâng saⁿ-tshing khòng jī-tsa̍p saⁿ lâng.
English: This is the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand twenty-three Jews;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Nó͘-ah kóng, Lí kah lí tsuân ke lóng tio̍h ji̍p tuā tsûn, in-uī tī tsit sè-tāi ê tiong-kan, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng sī gī lâng.
English: Yahweh said to Noah, Come with all of your household into the ark, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.

Tailo: In-uī tī kong-khai ê piān-lūn tiong, i tshut-la̍t piān-tó Iô-tá-iah lâng, kin-kì king-tián lâi tsìng-bîng I-é-su sī Ki-tok.
English: for he powerfully refuted the Jews, publicly showing by the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.

Tailo: Ha-la̍h ê kiáⁿ-sun tsi̍t-pah tsa̍p-jī lâng.
English: The children of Hariph, one hundred twelve.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, jîn-bîn m̄-khíng thiaⁿ Sa-mu-el ê uē, kóng, M̄-lah, guán it-tīng beh tsi̍t-ê ông lâi kā guán tī-lí,
English: But the people refused to listen to the voice of Samuel; and they said, No: but we will have a king over us,

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, guán tshut-huat lâi-kàu Kai-sa-lī-a, tī hia tuà tī thuân hok-im ê Hui-li̍p-pò͘ ê tshù; i sī Ê-lú-sa-lèm hit tshit-ê tsip-sū tsi-it.
English: On the next day, we, who were Paul's companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.

Tailo: In-uī kiông-pō ê lâng í-king siau-sit, bú-bān ê lâng í-king bia̍t-bông; só͘-ū tshuē ki-huē tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng mā lóng siū tsián-tû.
English: For the ruthless is brought to nothing, and the scoffer ceases, and all those who are alert to do evil are cut off

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông tshe lâng kàu Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ kóng-tio̍h thê-hông ê só͘-tsāi. Tsiū án-ne, bô siū siong-hāi, m̄-nā tsi̍t pái nn̄g pái.
English: The king of Israel sent to the place which the man of God told him and warned him of; and he saved himself there, not once nor twice.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā Ná-than kóng, Guá ū tik-tsuē Siōng-tsú. Ná-than kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, Siōng-tsú í-king tû-khì lí ê tsuē, lí bē tì-kàu sí.
English: David said to Nathan, I have sinned against Yahweh. Nathan said to David, Yahweh also has put away your sin. You will not die.

Tailo: I kóng, Siōng-tsú tuì Si-nái lâi, uī-tio̍h in tuì Se-il khí-.lâi; tuì Pa-lân ê suaⁿ tsiò-tshut kng, tuì bān-bān sìng ê hia lâi, tuì I ê tsiàⁿ tshiú uī-tio̍h in huat-tshut lia̍t-hué ê lu̍t-huat.
English: He said, Yahweh came from Sinai, Rose from Seir to them; He shined forth from Mount Paran, He came from the ten thousands of holy ones: At his right hand was a fiery law for them.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Kā bāng pha lo̍h-khì tsûn ê tsiànn pîng, tsiū ē pha-tio̍h hî. In pha bāng lo̍h-.khì, in-uī pha-tio̍h tsin tsē hî, hî-bāng suah thua bē khí-.lâi.
English: He said to them, Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some. They cast it therefore, and now they weren't able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-it-.gue̍h tē-tsa̍p-it-ê pan-tiúⁿ sī E-hu-laim tso̍k, Pi-la-tòng ê kiáⁿ Be-ná-iah, i ê pan lāi ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his division were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, I-su-la-el lâng, lí nā khíng tò tńg-.lâi, tsiū tò tńg-lâi guá tsia; nā tuì Guá ê bīn-tsîng tû-khì lí khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, mā bô tshìn-tshái kiânn.
English: If you will return, Israel, says Yahweh, if you will return to me, and if you will put away your abominations out of my sight; then you shall not be removed;

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, kā Su-san siâⁿ siū thâi ê jîn-sò͘ thîng-pò tī ông ê bīn-tsîng.
English: On that day the number of those who were slain in Shushan the palace was brought before the king.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, ' Guá ē kàng tsai-hō hō͘ lí, beh kā lí tsuân-pō͘ tû-bia̍t. Kiàn-nā sio̍k A-hap ê tsa-po͘ ting, bô-lūn siū khu-sok ê á-.sī tsū-iû ê, lóng tī I-su-la-el tiong kā i tsián-tû.
English: Behold, I will bring evil on you, and will utterly sweep you away and will cut off from Ahab every boy, and him who is shut up and him who is left at large in Israel:

Tailo: I hi-sing ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā lâi sio̍k-huê tsìng lâng, tsit-ê tāi-tsì tī Siōng-tè tsí-tīng ê ji̍t-tsí ē tit-tio̍h tsìng-si̍t.
English: who gave himself as a ransom for all; the testimony in its own times;

Tailo: Guá koh kā Gi-lia̍t hō͘ Ma-kil.
English: I gave Gilead to Machir.

Tailo: Tsai-eh ē jiok pháiⁿ lâng; m̄-koh, gī lâng ē tit-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ.
English: Misfortune pursues sinners, But prosperity rewards the righteous.

Tailo: Nā-sī tē-tsiūⁿ it-tshè ê tsáu-siù kah khong-tiong it-tshè ê tsiáu, í-ki̍p tē-tsiūⁿ it-tshè ē tín-tāng ū ua̍h-miā ê mi̍h, Guá kā it-tshè ê tsheⁿ-tsháu hō͘ in tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food. And it was so.

Tailo: Sio̍k Si-hua-ti-ah ê kiáⁿ-sun, ū Mî-khá-el ê kiáⁿ Tse-ba-tiah kah i tsò-hué lâi ê, ū tsa-po͘ ting peh-tsa̍p lâng.
English: Of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael; and with him eighty males.

Tailo: In-uī tsiàn-tīn suàⁿ tsin khui, piàn-piàn tī hit só͘-tsāi, tshiū-nâ só͘ thun-bia̍t ê, pí hō͘ to só͘ thun-bia̍t ê khah tsē.
English: For the battle was there spread over the surface of all the country; and the forest devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.

Tailo: Gâu liân-bín lâng ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōng-tè ē kā in liân-bín!
English: Blessed are the merciful, For they shall obtain mercy.

Tailo: Sio̍k It-sa-kal ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê,
English: Of the children of Issachar, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;

Tailo: Sa-mu-el kā I-é-sái kóng, Lí ê kiáⁿ kám lóng tī tsia? I-é-sái ìn kóng, Iáu ū tsi̍t-ê suah-bué ê, taⁿ teh tshī iûⁿ. Sa-mu-el kā I-é-sái kóng, Lí tio̍h tshe lâng khì tshuā i lâi, in-uī i iáu-buē lâi, lán bô beh tsē-toh.
English: Samuel said to Jesse, Are here all your children? He said, There remains yet the youngest, and behold, he is keeping the sheep. Samuel said to Jesse, Send and get him; for we will not sit down until he come here.

Tailo: Kî-tó ê sî, lín só͘ kiû ê, nā ū sìn-sim tsiū ē tit-tio̍h.
English: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.

Tailo: Tû-pâng-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h bāng kái liáu hó, tsiū kā Iô-sé-huh kóng, Guá mā tī guá ê bāng tiong khuànn-kìnn, tī guá ê thâu-khak tíng ū saⁿ-khing piak ê piáⁿ,
English: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, I also was in my dream, and behold, three baskets of white bread were on my head.

Tailo: In-uī tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng ē siū tsâu-bia̍t; tsí ū thìng-hāu Siōng-tsú ê lâng ē-tàng sîng-tsiap thó͘-tē.
English: For evildoers shall be cut off, But those who wait for Yahweh shall inherit the land.

Tailo: Siâⁿ-mn̂g, gia̍h-khí lín ê thâu! Íng-uán ê mn̂g, lín mā tio̍h gia̍h-khí! Îng-kng ê ông beh ji̍p-.lâi!
English: Lift up your heads, you gates; Yes, lift them up, you everlasting doors: The King of glory will come in.

Tailo: Lí in-uī uá-khò ka-kī ê só͘ tsò kah ka-kī ê tsâi-pó, mā ē siū lia̍h. Ke-mô͘-sih kah sio̍k i ê tsè-si, kuì-tso̍k, mā lóng ē tsò tsi̍t-ē siū tshian-suá.
English: For, because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures, you also shall be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, his priests and his princes together.

Tailo: Iâ-kop hiah-ê kiáⁿ uī-tio̍h in sió-muē siū uè lah-sap, tsiū lâi-kàu siū thâi ê lâng hia, tshiúⁿ-kiap in ê siâⁿ.
English: Jacob's sons came on the dead, and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ guá kiânn Lí kài-bīng ê lō͘, in-uī tsit-ê lō͘ sī guá só͘ ì-ài ê.
English: Direct me in the path of your commandments, For I delight in them.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ìn kóng, Guá kám m̄-sī Biān-iá-mín lâng, I-su-la-el tsi-tso̍k tiong ki̍k sió-khuá ê? Biān-iá-mín tsi-tso̍k tsiah-ê ke ê tiong-kan, guá ê ke kám m̄-sī ki̍k bî-sè? Lí ná ē tuì guá kóng tsit khuán uē?
English: Saul answered, Am I not a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? why then speak you to me after this manner?

Tailo: In kóng, Mô͘-se ín-tsún lâng siá lî-hun-su lâi lî i ê bó͘.
English: They said, Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá beh hō͘ hiah-ê ap-tsè lí ê tsia̍h ka-kī ê bah, in mā beh lim ka-kī ê hueh lim kàu tsuì, tshin-tshiūnn lim tiⁿ-tsiú án-ne. Kiàn-nā ū hia̍t-khì ê, lóng ē tsai Guá — Siōng-tsú sī lí ê Kiù-tsú, sī kiù-sio̍k lí ê Tsú, sī Iâ-kop ê tuā kuân-lîng-.ê.
English: I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I, Yahweh, am your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tshú tshâ-liāu, lâi khí tsit-ê tiān, Guá tsiū ē in-uī án-ne lâi huann-hí, koh tit-tio̍h îng-kng. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Go up to the mountain, bring wood, and build the house. I will take pleasure in it, and I will be glorified, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè kā Si-hông kah i ê jîn-bîn, kau tī I-su-la-el lâng ê tshiú tiong, in tsiū kā in phah. Tsiū án-ne, I-su-la-el tit-tio̍h tuà hit só͘-tsāi ê A-mô͘-lī lâng ê tsuân tē.
English: Yahweh, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they struck them: so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country.

Tailo: La̍h-ban thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, kah i ê guā-sun í-ki̍p i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsim-tshuì, kā in tsiok-hok, tsiū tshut-huat tńg-khì ka-kī ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Early in the morning, Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them. Laban departed and returned to his place.

Tailo: Hit-ê siàu-liân lâng tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì, lóng bô iân-tshiân, in-uī i ài Iâ-kop ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, jî-tshiánn i tī in lāu-pē ê ke siōng tsun-kuì.
English: The young man didn't wait to do this thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter, and he was honored above all the house of his father.

Tailo: Ha-gal tsiū kā hit uī tuì i kóng-uē ê Siōng-tsú tshing-tsò Khuàⁿ ē-tio̍h ta̍k hāng sū ê Siōng-tè , in-uī i kóng, Guá kìng-jiân tī tsia mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit uī khuàⁿ-kò͘ guá ê Siōng-tè?
English: She called the name of Yahweh who spoke to her, You are a God who sees, for she said, Have I even stayed alive after seeing him?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá kah Siōng-tsú só͘ hō͘ guá ê kiáⁿ tī tsia. Guán lóng sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī tiàm tī Si-óng suaⁿ ê, tshe-phài tī I-su-la-el tiong-kan lâi tsò tiāu-thâu kah kì-hō ê.
English: Behold, I and the children whom Yahweh has given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from Yahweh of Armies, who dwells in Mount Zion.

Tailo: Tng guá ê a-tsik ê kiáⁿ Ha-ná-mel kah tshiam-miâ tī khè-bīn tsiah-ê tsìng-jîn, í-ki̍p tsē tī khu-liû-só͘ īⁿ lāi só͘-ū Iô-tah lâng ê bīn-tsîng, kā bé-bē ê kè-tsînn kau hō͘ Ma-a-se-iah ê sun — Nê-lé-iù ê kiáⁿ Pa-lo-sih.
English: and I delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle's son, and in the presence of the witnesses who subscribed the deed of the purchase, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the guard.

Tailo: Lâng nā kóng-uē kong-kik Jîn-tsú ê, iáu ē tit-tio̍h sià-bián; nā-sī siat-to̍k Sìng Sîn ê, tsiū bē-tàng sià-bián.
English: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but those who blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

Tailo: Khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu, lóng tī ki tíng tsò siū; tshân-iá ê tsáu-siù lóng tī ki-ē seⁿ kiáⁿ; tsin tsē tuā kok lóng tiàm tī i ê ìm-ē.
English: All the birds of the sky made their nests in its boughs; and under its branches did all the animals of the field bring forth their young; and under its shadow lived all great nations.

Tailo: In gîm-si liáu-āu tsiū tshut-.lâi, khì Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ.
English: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá — Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Kóng-tio̍h thok Guá ê miâ lâi thuân-pò͘ ê hiah-ê sian-ti, Guá pīng bô tshe in, in iáu-koh kóng tsit-ê tē bē tú-tio̍h to-kiàm, ki-hng, kî-si̍t hiah-ê sian-ti ē tuì to-kiàm, ki-hng lâi bia̍t-bông.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name, and I didn't send them, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land: By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.

Tailo: Só͘-í, I kā bíng-lia̍t ê siū-khì kah tsing-tsiàn ê hiong-bíng piàⁿ tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ. Tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî tshin-tshiūnn hué to̍h, i iáu m̄-tsai, hué sio-.tio̍h i, i mā bô khuà-ì.
English: Therefore he poured on him the fierceness of his anger, and the strength of battle; and it set him on fire round about, yet he didn't know; and it burned him, yet he didn't lay it to heart.

Tailo: In-uī tuì Guá tshuā lín tsó͘-sian tshut Ai-gi̍p hit tsi̍t ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, Guá pik-tshiat kā in kíng-kài, to̍h-sī tsá-tsá khí-lâi kā in kíng-kài, kóng, ' Lín tio̍h tsun-thàn Guá ê uē. '
English: For I earnestly protested to your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even to this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h to-kiàm lîm-kàu hit só͘-tsāi, nā pûn sàu-kak kíng-kài tsìng lâng,
English: if, when he sees the sword come on the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;

Tailo: Kiû Lí kuan-sim guá ê kan-lân kah lô-khó͘, sià-bián guá it-tshè ê tsuē.
English: Consider my affliction and my travail. Forgive all my sins.

Tailo: Nā-sī lí, lí tio̍h khiā tī Guá tsia, Guá beh kā lí só͘ tio̍h kà-sī in ê it-tshè kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, huat-tō͘, kā lí kóng, hō͘ in tī Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē án-ne lâi kiâⁿ. '
English: But as for you, stand you here by me, and I will speak to you all the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which you shall teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess it.

Tailo: I-é-su tsi̍t ē tsiūⁿ huāⁿ to̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tuā-tīn ê lâng, tsiū liân-bín in, in-uī in tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ bô bo̍k-tsiá. I tsiū kà-sī in tsin tsē hāng tāi-tsì.
English: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.

Tailo: Gî-tióng kah tuè i ê tsi̍t pah lâng, tī saⁿ keⁿ thâu, lâi-kàu iâⁿ piⁿ. Hit sî, tsiú-keⁿ ê tú-á uāⁿ pan, in tsiū pûn sàu-kak, kòng-phuà tshiú-.ni̍h ê àng.
English: So Gideon, and the hundred men who were with him, came to the outermost part of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch, when they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and broke in pieces the pitchers that were in their hands.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, ē uī-tio̍h Ta-bi̍t ê ke kah tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn khui tsi̍t-ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, sé-tû tsuē-ok kah lah-sap.
English: In that day there will be a spring opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.

Tailo: I īng kong-gī tsò khue-kah lâi tshīng, īng tsín-kiù tsò thâu-khue lâi tì, īng pò-siû tsò saⁿ-khò͘ lâi tshīng, īng jia̍t-sim tsò guā-phàu lâi mua.
English: He put on righteousness as a breastplate, and a helmet of salvation on his head; and he put on garments of vengeance for clothing, and was clad with zeal as a mantle.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah in ê tsng-thâu, to̍h-sī Tse-bú-lông lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: This is the inheritance of the children of Zebulun according to their families, these cities with their villages.

Tailo: In tio̍h ta̍k tsá-khí án-ne tsún-pī iûⁿ-ko, sò͘-tsè kah iû, tsò tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè.
English: Thus shall they prepare the lamb, and the meal offering, and the oil, morning by morning, for a continual burnt offering.

Tailo: Guá bē-tàng an-jiân, bē-tàng pîng-tsīng, bē-tàng an-hioh, tsóng-.sī, ū huān-lān lâi.
English: I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; But trouble comes.

Tailo: Ê-bel seⁿ nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Hua-li̍k, in-uī tī i hit sî tē-tsiūⁿ tsiū hun-kài; Hua-li̍k ê sió-tī miâ kiò-tsò Iok-tan.
English: To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother's name was Joktan.

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê tsō ê khuán-sit sī án-ne, sì pîng lóng ū keh-tó͘, i ê keh-tó͘ tī sì-ê kak ê só͘-tsāi sio-tsiap.
English: The work of the bases was on this manner: they had panels; and there were panels between the ledges;

Tailo: Tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè ah, Lí bat īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú tshuā Lí ê tsú-bîn tshut Ai-gi̍p tē, hō͘ Lí ū miâ-siaⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t. Guán ū huān tsuē, guán ū kiâⁿ pháiⁿ.
English: Now, Lord our God, who has brought your people forth out of the land of Egypt with a mighty hand, and have gotten you renown, as at this day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly.

Tailo: Tsú suî-jiân hō͘ lâng iu-būn, iáu-koh ē tsiàu I pah-puaⁿ ê tsû-ài huat-tshut liân-bín.
English: For though he cause grief, yet he will have compassion according to the multitude of his loving kindnesses.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín khì kā I ê bûn-tô͘ kóng, ' I-é-su tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h ā, I ē pí lín khah tāi-sing khì-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng, tī hia lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I. ' Taⁿ guá í-king kā lín kóng à.
English: Go quickly and tell his disciples, He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.' Behold, I have told you.

Tailo: Be-thu-el, Hol-mah, Tsik-lak,
English: and at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

Tailo: Iok-siang-seⁿ Sí-bah kah Tí-tàn. Tí-tàn ê kiáⁿ-sun sī A-su-lī tso̍k, Le-to-sih tso̍k kah Le-u-mih tso̍k.
English: Jokshan became the father of Sheba, and Dedan. The sons of Dedan were Asshurim, Letushim, and Leummim.

Tailo: Kín-kín kuè-khì tshin-tshiūnn khuài-tsûn, koh tshin-tshiūnn ing kuáⁿ-kín pue lo̍h-khì la̍k mi̍h.
English: They have passed away as the swift ships, As the eagle that swoops on the prey.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng kah Ai-gi̍p ông Huâ-láu kiat-tshin, tshuā Huâ-láu ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, tshuā i ji̍p Ta-bi̍t siâⁿ, thìng-hāu i khí ka-kī ê tshù kah Siōng-tsú ê tiān, í-ki̍p Ê-lú-sa-lèm sì-kho͘-uî ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ uân-kang.
English: Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of Yahweh, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.

Tailo: tī tîn-ai huán-pún kui thó͘, lîng-hûn kui tī hō͘ i lâi ê Siōng-tè hia tsìn-tsîng, tio̍h kì-liām tshòng-tsō lí ê Tsú.
English: And the dust returns to the earth as it was, And the spirit returns to God who gave it.

Tailo: Lâng huān-tio̍h thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu, mā bô la̍t thang tsún-pī tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lé-mi̍h, hit-ê kui-lē sī án-ne.
English: This is the law for him in whom is the plague of leprosy, who is not able to afford the sacrifice for his cleansing.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tī hit tē-hng kiâⁿ thàu-thàu, kûn-tsiòng thiaⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, tsiū īng pho͘-á kng pēⁿ-lâng khì hia.
English: and ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick, on their mats, to where they heard he was.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: E-hu-laim kám sī Guá thiàⁿ ê kiáⁿ? Kám sī thang huann-hí ê gín-á? Guá kiàn-nā kā i tsik-pī, iáu-koh tshim-tshim siàu-liām i; só͘-í, Guá ê sim-tn̂g uī-tio̍h i bē pîng-an, Guá it-tīng beh liân-bín i.
English: Is Ephraim my dear son? is he a darling child? for as often as I speak against him, I do earnestly remember him still: therefore my heart yearns for him; I will surely have mercy on him, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Tàn ê lâng tuì Tso-lah kah E-si-ta-ol, tshe pún tso̍k tsìng lâng tiong gō͘-ê ióng-sū, khì thau-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē lâi tshâ-khó, kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín khì tshâ-khó hit-ê tē. In lâi-kàu E-hu-laim suaⁿ, ji̍p-khì Mi-ka ê tshù, tsiū hioh tī hia.
English: The children of Dan sent of their family five men from their whole number, men of valor, from Zorah, and from Eshtaol, to spy out the land, and to search it; and they said to them, Go, search the land. They came to the hill country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, and lodged there.

Tailo: Tī i hiat-lāu só͘-ū ê ji̍t, kiàn-nā i só͘ tó ê tshn̂g, i tio̍h khuànn tshin-tshiūnn king-kî ê tshn̂g sio-siâng, kiàn-nā i só͘ tsē ê mi̍h mā it-tīng bô tshing-khì kah i king-kî ê sî bô tshing-khì sio-siâng.
English: Every bed whereon she lies all the days of her discharge shall be to her as the bed of her period: and everything whereon she sits shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her period.

Tailo: Hit sî, in-uī hit ki kak teh kóng tuā-uē ê siann, guá tsiū kā i khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit tsiah siù siū thâi, i ê sing-khu siū huí-huāi, hông hiat tī hué-.ni̍h sio.
English: I saw at that time because of the voice of the great words which the horn spoke; I saw even until the animal was slain, and its body destroyed, and it was given to be burned with fire.

Tailo: Má-thài kah Tho-má-suh, Al-hua-ioh ê kiáⁿ Iâ-kop kah kiò-tsò Se-lô-tí ê Sí-mòng,
English: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;

Tailo: Be-tsái ê kiáⁿ-sun saⁿ-pah jī-tsa̍p sì lâng.
English: The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty-four.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng khí-lâi kuainn mn̂g liáu-āu, lín tsiah khiā tī guā-bīn phah mn̂g, kóng, ' Tsú-lâng, tshiánn kā guán khui mn̂g. ' I ē ìn lín kóng, ' Guá m̄-bat lín sī tuì tó-uī lâi ê lâng. '
English: When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us!' then he will answer and tell you, I don't know you or where you come from.'

Tailo: La̍h-ban tsiū ji̍p-khì Iâ-kop ê pò͘-pênn, Le-ah ê pò͘-pênn kah nn̄g-ê lú-pī ê pò͘-pênn, lóng tshiau bô, tsiū tuì Le-ah ê pò͘-pênn tshut-.lâi, ji̍p-khì La̍h-khel ê pò͘-pênn.
English: Laban went into Jacob's tent, into Leah's tent, and into the tent of the two female servants; but he didn't find them. He went out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē lâng koh lâi kìnn I-é-su, kóng, Iô-há-neh lóng bô kiâⁿ sîn-jiah, to̍k-to̍k i só͘ kóng kuan-hē tsit-ê lâng ê tāi-tsì lóng sī tsin-si̍t.
English: Many came to him. They said, John indeed did no sign, but everything that John said about this man is true.

Tailo: Hit-ê hué kàng lo̍h-.lâi, koh ū Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tī tiān-.ni̍h ê sî, I-su-la-el jîn-bîn khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tī pho͘ tsio̍h ê só͘-tsāi, phak lo̍h tē kìng-pài, kám-siā Siōng-tsú, kóng, In-uī I sī hó, I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tī-.leh!
English: All the children of Israel looked on, when the fire came down, and the glory of Yahweh was on the house; and they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground on the pavement, and worshiped, and gave thanks to Yahweh, saying, For he is good; for his loving kindness endures for ever.

Tailo: I ē uī Guá ê miâ khí tiān. I beh tsò Guá ê kiáⁿ, Guá beh tsò i ê pē. Guá ē tī I-su-la-el kian-kò͘ i ê kok-uī, ti̍t-kàu íng-uán. '
English: he shall build a house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.

Tailo: Ji̍t kah gue̍h, lín tio̍h o-ló I! Huat-kng ê tsheⁿ-sîn, lín lóng tio̍h o-ló I!
English: Praise him, sun and moon! Praise him, all you shining stars!

Tailo: Kî-tha ê lô͘-po̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì, hui-siông hùn-khài, kā só͘-ū ê tāi-tsì khì tuì tsú-lâng kóng.
English: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were exceedingly sorry, and came and told to their lord all that was done.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā I-su-la-el lâng kóng: Tsit-ê tshit gue̍h tsa̍p-gō͘ sī Tuà-pêⁿ-tseh, tio̍h kā Siōng-tsú siú tshit ji̍t.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and say, On the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the feast of tents for seven days to Yahweh.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā hō͘ lâng lâu hueh ê, lâng mā beh hō͘ i lâu hueh, in-uī Siōng-tè tsō lâng, sī tshin-tshiūnn I ka-kī ê siōng.
English: Whoever sheds man's blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.

Tailo: Tio̍h hun-pia̍t tshing-khì ê kah bô tshing-khì ê, ē tsia̍h-tit ê ua̍h-mi̍h kah bē tsia̍h-tit ê ua̍h-mi̍h.
English: to make a distinction between the unclean and the clean, and between the living thing that may be eaten and the living thing that may not be eaten.'

Tailo: （Peh kiā-á ê si, Só͘-lô-móng só͘ tsò. ）Tshù-the̍h nā m̄-sī Siōng-tsú khí-tsō, khí-tsō ê lâng lô-khó͘ tsiū bô tshái-kang; siâⁿ-tî nā m̄-sī Siōng-tsú kò͘-siú, kò͘-siú ê lâng tsiū pe̍h-pe̍h kíng-síng.
English: Unless Yahweh builds the house, They labor in vain who build it. Unless Yahweh watches over the city, The watchman guards it in vain.

Tailo: I-é-su lâi-lîm í-tsîng, Iô-há-neh tāi-sing tuì I-su-la-el lâng thuân-tō, kiò in tio̍h hué-kái lâi niá siū sé-lé.
English: before his coming, when John had first preached the baptism of repentance to Israel.

Tailo: E-siu-ah, Ba-nî, Kat-mi-el, Si-ba-niah, Bun-nî, Se-le-biah, Ba-nî kah Ke-ná-nî, lóng khiā tī Lē-bī lâng ê tâi tíng, tuā-siaⁿ kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú — in ê Siōng-tè.
English: Then stood up on the stairs of the Levites, Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani, and cried with a loud voice to Yahweh their God.

Tailo: Lín mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tiong-kan thang thó-ià ê mi̍h kah in hiah-ê tshâ, tsio̍h, kim, gîn ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: and you have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them);

Tailo: Kā sé-tn̄g ê phûn hē tī huē-bō͘ kah tuâⁿ ê tiong-kan, phûn lāi té tsuí, thang sé-tn̄g.
English: He set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water therein, with which to wash.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín tsiah-ê sī tī lâng ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī kiò-tsò gī ê lâng, m̄-koh, Siōng-tè tsai lín ê sim-su, in-uī lâng khuàⁿ-tsò tsun-kuì ê, tuì Siōng-tè khuàⁿ khí-lâi sī thó-ià ê.
English: He said to them, You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h lim ka-kī tsuí-tî lāi ê tsuí, lim ka-kī tséⁿ lāi só͘ tshut ê tsuí.
English: Drink water out of your own cistern, Running water out of your own well.

Tailo: An-tì tī tsè-si ho̍k ê phi-kian, uī I-su-la-el lâng tsò kì-liām tsio̍h, tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘-se ê.
English: He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: In tsia̍h tsá-tǹg liáu-āu, I-é-su kā Sí-mòng Piat-tò͘ kóng, Iô-há-neh ê kiáⁿ Sí-mòng, lí pí thiàⁿ tsiah-ê ū khah thiàⁿ Guá bô? Piat-tò͘ ìn kóng, Tsú ah, ū, Lí tsai guá ū thiàⁿ Lí. I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí tio̍h iúⁿ-tshī Guá ê iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ.
English: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these? He said to him, Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you. He said to him, Feed my lambs.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah sian-ti, lūn-khí lia̍t kok ê tāi-tsì.
English: The word of Yahweh which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lâng nā uàn-hūn i ê tshù-piⁿ, bih khí-lâi kā i phah, kā i siong-hāi kàu sí, tsiū ē-tàng tsáu kàu hiah-ê siâⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê.
English: But if any man hate his neighbor, and lie in wait for him, and rise up against him, and strike him mortally so that he dies, and he flee into one of these cities;

Tailo: A-sel ê kiáⁿ sī Im-nah, I-si-bah, E-sú-bí, Bê-lô-ia, koh ū in ê tsí-muē Se-la̍h.
English: The sons of Asher: Imnah, and Ishvah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng tio̍h tsiàu Tsú siúⁿ-sù ê un-sù, tsiàu Siōng-tè kíng-tiàu ta̍k lâng ê bo̍k-tik lâi sing-ua̍h. Tse sī guá kàu-tō kok kàu-huē ê tsún-tsik.
English: Only, as the Lord has distributed to each man, as God has called each, so let him walk. So I command in all the assemblies.

Tailo: Guá mā beh ke-thinn lâng kah tsing-seⁿ tī lín ê tíng-bīn; in ē seⁿ-thuàⁿ tsin tsē. Guá beh hō͘ lín tsiàu kū ū lâng tuà, koh beh kā lín hó khuán-thāi, iâⁿ-kuè khí-thâu ê sî; lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: and I will multiply on you man and animal; and they shall increase and be fruitful; and I will cause you to be inhabited after your former estate, and will do better to you than at your beginnings: and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: In it-tīng ē ū sán-gia̍p, Guá sī in ê sán-gia̍p. M̄-thang tī I-su-la-el tiong hō͘ in ki-gia̍p, Guá sī in ê ki-gia̍p.
English: They shall have an inheritance: I am their inheritance; and you shall give them no possession in Israel; I am their possession.

Tailo: in tio̍h lia̍h hit-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kàu i ê lāu-pē ê tshù ê mn̂g-kháu, i pún-siâⁿ ê lâng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí, in-uī i tī I-su-la-el tiong kiânn kiàn-siàu ê tāi-tsì, tī i ê lāu-pē ê ke kiânn kan-îm. Án-ne tsiū ē-tàng tuì lín tiong-kan tû-khì hit-ê pháiⁿ.
English: then they shall bring out the young lady to the door of her father's house, and the men of her city shall stone her to death with stones, because she has done folly in Israel, to play the prostitute in her father's house: so shall you put away the evil from the midst of you.

Tailo: In kóng, Guán ē. I-é-su kā in kóng, Guá só͘ lim ê pue, lín beh lim, guá só͘ siū ê sé-lé, lín beh siū.
English: They said to him, We are able. Jesus said to them, You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;

Tailo: In kóng, lán tio̍h tshuah-tn̄g in ê khún-pa̍k, hiat-ka̍k in ê soh.
English: Let's break their bonds apart, And cast away their cords from us.

Tailo: Lâng nā īng kuí-tsà ê kè-bô͘ thâi i ê tshù-piⁿ, to̍h-sī kóng lâi tī Guá ê tuâⁿ tsîng, mā tio̍h lia̍h-khì kā i thâi-sí.
English: If a man schemes and comes presumptuously on his neighbor to kill him, you shall take him from my altar, that he may die.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, tsìng kuì-tso̍k lâi tshuē I-é-lí-miah, mn̄g i; i tsiū tsiàu ông só͘ huan-hù it-tshè ê uē lâi ìn in. In tsiū suah, bô koh kah i kóng-uē, in-uī sū-tsîng bô lō͘-tshut.
English: Then came all the princes to Jeremiah, and asked him; and he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they left off speaking with him; for the matter was not perceived.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín tsìng lâng tshiánn lín koh lâi, in-uī lín tiong-kan guá tshuē bô tsi̍t-ê tì-huī ê lâng.
English: But as for you all, come on now again; I shall not find a wise man among you.

Tailo: Hit mê, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu Ná-than kóng,
English: It happened the same night, that the word of Yahweh came to Nathan, saying,

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm siūⁿ kóng, Siōng-tè ē-tàng hō͘ Í-sak tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, só͘-í mā ē īng-tit kóng, Í-sak sī sí-liáu koh tò tńg-.lâi.
English: accounting that God is able to raise up even from the dead. Figuratively speaking, he also did receive him back from the dead.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū lâng īng pho͘-á kng piàn-suī-.ê lâi, ài beh kng ji̍p-khì hē tī I-é-su ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.

Tailo: Na-khool ê sè-î miâ kiò-tsò Lú-mah, i seⁿ Te-bah, Ga-hâm, Ta-ha-sih kah Má-kah.
English: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

Tailo: Tī thâu tsi̍t pái koh-ua̍h ū hūn ê lâng tsin ū hok-khì, in sī sìng-kiat ê lâng. Tē-jī pái ê sí-bông bô kuân kā in kuán-hat, in ē tsò Siōng-tè kah Ki-tok ê tsè-si, mā ē kah Ki-tok tsò-hué thóng-tī tsi̍t tshing nî .
English: Blessed and holy is he who has part in the first resurrection. Over these, the second death has no power, but they will be priests of God and of Christ, and will reign with him one thousand years.

Tailo: Guá tī kíng lāi ta̍k-ê siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, īng puà-ki kā in puà; Guá tsua̍t in ê hō͘-sû, Guá bia̍t Guá ê tsú-bîn, in iû-guân bô ua̍t tńg-lâi lī-khui in ê lō͘.
English: I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land; I have bereaved them of children, I have destroyed my people; they didn't return from their ways.

Tailo: Guān Lí hō͘ guá tsún-tǹg, tshin-tsū kā guá tsò pó, ū siáⁿ lâng khíng kah guá tah tshiú li̍p-iok?
English: Now give a pledge, be collateral for me with yourself. Who is there who will strike hands with me?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá lâi kìnn Siōng-tè sī tsò guá ê lī-ik; guá īng tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú tsò guá siám-phiah ê só͘-tsāi, thang hō͘ guá kóng-khí Lí it-tshè ê tsok-uî.
English: But it is good for me to come close to God. I have made the Lord Yahweh my refuge, That I may tell of all your works.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, kā iûⁿ-kûn kau hō͘ tsi̍t-ê kò͘-siú ê lâng, tsiàu I-é-sái só͘ bīng-līng i ê, tuà tsia̍h-mi̍h khì-kàu pâi-lia̍t tshia ê só͘-tsāi. Kun-ping tú-á tshut-khì kàu tsiàn-tiûⁿ, huah beh kau-tsiàn.
English: David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the place of the wagons, as the army which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle.

Tailo: In só͘ tiau-khik in ê sîn-bîng ê siōng, lín tio̍h īng hué kā i sio; lí m̄-thang tham i sin tsiūⁿ ê kim-gîn, mā m̄-thang kā i the̍h-lâi piàn-tsò ka-kī ê, khióng-kiaⁿ lí ē uī-tio̍h tsit-ê lâi hām-lo̍h lô-bāng, in-uī tse sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ thó-ià ê.
English: The engraved images of their gods shall you burn with fire: you shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it to you, lest you be snared therein; for it is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Lí in-uī hò͘ⁿ-sik put ti-tsiok, koh kah A-siul lâng kiânn kan-îm; kah in kiânn kan-îm liáu-āu, iû-guân bô buán-ì.
English: You have played the prostitute also with the Assyrians, because you were insatiable; yes, you have played the prostitute with them, and yet you weren't satisfied.

Tailo: Hit sî, i ê tsìng hiann-tī, tsí-muē kah í-tsîng sio-bat ê lâng lóng lâi kìnn i, tī i ê tshù tsò-hué tsia̍h, uī-tio̍h Siōng-tè só͘ kàng-lo̍h tī i só͘-ū ê tsai-hō, lóng pi-siong lâi kā i an-uì; ta̍k lâng sàng i tsi̍t tè gîn, ta̍k lâng sàng i tsi̍t-ê kim-khuân.
English: Then came there to him all his brothers, and all his sisters, and all those who had been of his acquaintance before, and ate bread with him in his house. They comforted him, and consoled him concerning all the evil that Yahweh had brought on him. Everyone also gave him a piece of money, and everyone a ring of gold.

Tailo: Sio-mel ê kiáⁿ sī A-hi, No-gah, Iâ-hō͘-pa, A-lâm.
English: The sons of Shemer: Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

Tailo: In sim-lāi mā bô kóng: Taⁿ lán tio̍h kìng-uì Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè, I tsiàu-sî siúⁿ-sù hō͘-tsuí, to̍h-sī tshun-hō͘ tshiu-lîm, I mā ū tīng tsiah-ê siu-sîng ê sî-kî, lâu-.leh hō͘ lán.
English: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear Yahweh our God, who gives rain, both the former and the latter, in its season; who preserves to us the appointed weeks of the harvest.

Tailo: I tiàu hiah-ê tsè-si kah Lē-bī lâng lâi, tsū-tsi̍p tī tang pîng khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi,
English: He brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the broad place on the east,

Tailo: Lí ê sim nā siūⁿ kóng, ' Siōng-tsú só͘ bô kóng ê uē, guán beh ná ē tsai? '
English: If you say in your heart, How shall we know the word which Yahweh has not spoken?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Tse sī lí só͘ ing-kai tú-.tio̍h ê, sī Guá niû hō͘ lí ê hūn-gia̍h, in-uī lí bē kì-tit Guá, khì uá-khò hi-ké.
English: This is your lot, the portion measured to you from me, says Yahweh; because you have forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.

Tailo: Án-ne, lán bô koh-tsài sī gín-á, bē koh hō͘ ta̍k tsióng kàu-gī ê hong iô-tāng phiau-liû, tiòng-tio̍h lâng ê kuí-kè kah muâ-phiàn, tì-sú hō͘ lâng ín-iú khì.
English: that we may no longer be children, tossed back and forth and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, in craftiness, after the wiles of error;

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: In-uī lí tsûn-sim ka-kī lia̍h-tsò sī Siōng-tè,
English: therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because you have set your heart as the heart of God,

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, tsiū gī-lūn hun-hun, kóng, Tse sī án-tsuáⁿ? Kám sī sin ê kà-sī? I īng kuân-lîng bīng-līng siâ-sîn, liân siâ-sîn to khut-ho̍k.
English: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ pi-ai sue-thè; Le-ba-nòng kiàn-siàu ta-.khì; Sia-lông tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá; Ba-siáng kah Kal-mel ê tshiū-ba̍k lak kah kng-kng.
English: The land mourns and languishes. Lebanon is confounded and withers away. Sharon is like a desert, and Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.

Tailo: Tī hia kè-sio̍k thuân hok-im.
English: There they preached the Good News.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, A-sel, Má-ná-se, Tse-bú-lông ê tiong-kan, mā ū lâng ka-kī khiam-pi, lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: Nevertheless certain men of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tî-mó͘-theh, lí tio̍h tshî-siú Siōng-tè kau-thok lí ê tsit-tsik, tio̍h siám-phiah hiah-ê ū-miâ bô-si̍t ê ké tì-sik ê tsing-lūn.
English: Timothy, guard that which is committed to you, turning away from the empty chatter and oppositions of the knowledge which is falsely so called;

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông kóng, Tshám ah, Siōng-tsú tsū-tsi̍p tsit saⁿ-ê ông, beh kā in kau tī Mô͘-ap lâng ê tshiú.
English: The king of Israel said, Alas! for Yahweh has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.

Tailo: Lí mā ē siang tshiú mo͘h thâu-khak, tuì hia tshut-.lâi; in-uī Siōng-tsú í-king khì-tsua̍t lí só͘ uá-khò ê, lí mā bē tuì in tit-tio̍h hing-thong.
English: From there also shall you go forth, with your hands on your head: for Yahweh has rejected those in whom you trust, and you shall not prosper with them.

Tailo: koh hō͘ lí tī îng-kng, miâ-siaⁿ, tsun-kuì, puâⁿ-kuè I só͘ tshòng-tsō bān-kok ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ lí kui tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, tsò sìng-kiat ê tsú-bîn, tsiàu I só͘ kóng ê.
English: and to make you high above all nations that he has made, in praise, and in name, and in honor; and that you may be a holy people to Yahweh your God, as he has spoken.

Tailo: Guá beh kā lí hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t kok, kā lí sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang. Guá beh tû-khì lí tiong-kan ê ù-uè.
English: I will scatter you among the nations, and disperse you through the countries; and I will consume your filthiness out of you.

Tailo: in kah pah-siù kok tsiàu i ê luī, it-tshè ê tsing-seⁿ kok tsiàu i ê luī, it-tshè tī tē-tsiūⁿ sô ê thâng-thuā kok tsiàu i ê luī, it-tshè ū si̍t ê kok tsiàu i ê luī, it-tshè ê pue-tsiáu kok tsiàu i ê luī, lóng tsìn-ji̍p tuā tsûn.
English: they, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.

Tailo: I-é-su lī-khui hit só͘-tsāi, lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘-piⁿ, tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tsē tuà hia.
English: Jesus departed there, and came near to the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iô-sé-huh tsa̍p-ê a-hiaⁿ lóng lo̍h-khì Ai-gi̍p, khì tia̍h bí-niûⁿ.
English: Joseph's ten brothers went down to buy grain from Egypt.

Tailo: A-si-ke-lông ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne lâi kiaⁿ; Ga-jah khuàⁿ-tio̍h mā ē tsin kan-khó͘; Ik-lóng mā ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h in-uī sit-bōng lâi kiàn-siàu. Ga-jah it-tīng bô koh ū kun-ông, A-si-ke-lông bô koh ū lâng tuà.
English: Ashkelon will see it, and fear; Gaza also, and will writhe in agony; As will Ekron, for her expectation will be disappointed; And the king will perish from Gaza, And Ashkelon will not be inhabited.

Tailo: Lín tuì guá só͘ ha̍k-si̍p, só͘ niá-siū, só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê, lóng tio̍h kè-sio̍k lâi si̍t-hîng. Án-ne, siúⁿ-sù pîng-an ê Siōng-tè tsiū ē kah lín tông-tsāi.
English: The things which you learned, received, heard, and saw in me: do these things, and the God of peace will be with you.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tô-tsáu, suî lâng kò͘ sèⁿ-miā, tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá ê tō͘-siông.
English: Flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.

Tailo: Am-móng tso̍k ê ông Ba-li-su ū tshe Ne-thá-niah ê kiáⁿ I-si-ma-el, lâi beh tshú lí ê sèⁿ-miā, lí kám tsai? Tsóng-.sī, A-hi-kam ê kiáⁿ Ge-tá-lia̍h m̄-sìn in ê uē.
English: and said to him, Do you know that Baalis the king of the children of Ammon has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to take your life? But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam didn't believe them.

Tailo: Tē-káu nî tsa̍p-gue̍h tshe-tsa̍p, Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Again, in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Iô-sé sī Ê-lī-e-tsel ê kiáⁿ, Ê-lī-e-tsel sī Iô-lîm ê kiáⁿ, Iô-lîm sī Má-that ê kiáⁿ, Má-that sī Lē-bī ê kiáⁿ,
English: the son of Josa, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Tsit kuí ji̍t, I-é-su ji̍t-sî tī sìng-tiān kà-sī lâng, àm-sî tsiū tshut-khì hit-ê Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ kuè-mê.
English: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.

Tailo: in lâu bô tsuē ê lâng ê hueh, to̍h-sī in ê kiáⁿ-jî ê hueh, kā in tsò tsè-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Ka-nân ê ngó͘-siōng, hit-ê tē tsiū hō͘ hueh uè lah-sap.
English: They shed innocent blood, Even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan. The land was polluted with blood.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, I-su-la-el tsiah-ê kun-ông, lín taⁿ kàu-gia̍h à; tio̍h tû-khì kiông-pō kah tshiúⁿ-kiap ê tāi-tsì, píng-kong kiâⁿ-gī, bô koh pà-tsiàm jîn-bîn ê sán-gia̍p. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Let it suffice you, princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute justice and righteousness; dispossessing my people, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín siat-li̍p A-mí-me-li̍k tsò ông, nā tsiàu sîng-si̍t kong-gī lâi kiâⁿ, koh hó khuán-thāi Ia-lu-ba-al kah i ê ke, tsiàu i ê tshiú só͘ lô-khó͘ ê lâi kā i pò-tap.
English: Now therefore, if you have dealt truly and righteously, in that you have made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done to him according to the deserving of his hands

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá ài lín bîng-pi̍k, Ki-tok sī só͘-ū tsa-po͘ lâng ê thâu, tsa-po͘ lâng sī tsa-bó͘ lâng ê thâu, Siōng-tè sī Ki-tok ê thâu.
English: But I would have you know that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is the man, and the head of Christ is God.

Tailo: Guá beh īng kau kā lí ê gê-tsô kau tiâu-.leh, koh hō͘ lí kang-hô tiong ê hî kha̍h-tiâu tī lí ê lân; Guá beh kā lí kah só͘ kha̍h-tiâu tī lí ê lân ê hî, tuì kang-hô tiong thua tshut-.lâi.
English: I will put hooks in your jaws, and I will make the fish of your rivers stick to your scales; and I will bring you up out of the midst of your rivers, with all the fish of your rivers which stick to your scales.

Tailo: Khí-.lâi! Mā hō͘ gín-á khí-.lâi, īng lí ê tshiú kā i khan-.leh, Guá beh hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā kok.
English: Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation.

Tailo: Hit sî, lín kin-tuè tsit sè-kan ê pháiⁿ hong-sio̍k teh sing-ua̍h, koh sūn-ho̍k thian-kài ê tsiáng-kuân-tsiá, to̍h-sī tsit-má teh kuán-hat hiah-ê puē-gi̍k Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k ê hit-ê siâ-sîn.
English: in which you once walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the powers of the air, the spirit who now works in the children of disobedience;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè ah, taⁿ Lí só͘ kóng-khí Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kah Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê ke, guān Lí íng-uán kā i kian-kò͘, tsiàu Lí só͘ kóng ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Now, Yahweh God, the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, confirm you it forever, and do as you have spoken.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h khì khiā tī sìng-tiān, kā tsit-ê sù ua̍h-miā ê sìn-sit lóng tuì tsìng lâng suan-káng.
English: Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

Tailo: Án-ne, lâng só͘ liāu-sióng buē kàu ê Siōng-tè ê pîng-an, ē thong-kuè Ki-tok I-é-su lâi pó-siú lín ê sim-su ì-liām.
English: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus.

Tailo: I kiù guá thuat-lī ióng-bíng ê tuì-ti̍k, kah hiah-ê uàn-hūn guá ê lâng, in-uī in pí guá khah ū la̍t.
English: He delivered me from my strong enemy, From those who hated me; for they were too mighty for me.

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p nî tsa̍p-gue̍h tsa̍p-jī, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Tsia ū tsi̍t-ê gín-á, i ū gō͘ tè tuā-be̍h piáⁿ kah nn̄g bué hî, tsóng-.sī, kā tsiah-ê hō͘ hiah tsē lâng tsia̍h, ná ū kàu?
English: There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what are these among so many?

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ-jî nā ke-thinn tsin tsē, sī beh hō͘ to thâi-sí; i ê kiáⁿ-sun bô thang tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h.
English: If his children are multiplied, it is for the sword. His offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

Tailo: Lín í-king tuì sūn-ho̍k tsin-lí lâi kiat-tsīng ka-kī, koh kah kî-tha ê sìn-tô͘ ū sûn tsin ê tshiú-tsiok-tsi-tsîng, lín tio̍h tuì sim-té jia̍t-tshiat sio-thiànn.
English: Seeing you have purified your souls in your obedience to the truth through the Spirit in sincere brotherly affection, love one another from the heart fervently:

Tailo: Koh ū tshia kah khiâ bé ê, hit-tīn lâng put-tsí tsē.
English: There went up with him both chariots and horsemen. It was a very great company.

Tailo: Sàu-lô sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Guá kā tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ hō͘ Ta-bi̍t tsò lô-bāng lâi kā i bāng-.leh, thang tsioh Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tshiú hāi i. Sàu-lô tsiū kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, Taⁿ tsit-ê tē-jī pái lí thang tsò guá ê kiáⁿ-sài.
English: Saul said, I will give her to him, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Therefore Saul said to David, You shall this day be my son-in-law a second time.

Tailo: Kiû Lí si tuā-un hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, hō͘ guá ē-tàng ua̍h-.leh lâi tsun-thàn Lí ê uē.
English: Do good to your servant. I will live and I will obey your word.

Tailo: Guá beh án-ne khuán-thāi tsit-ê só͘-tsāi kah tuà tī kî-tiong ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ ná tshin-tshiūnn To-hu-teh.
English: Thus will I do to this place, says Yahweh, and to the inhabitants of it, even making this city as Topheth:

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng kî-tha ê tsong-tso̍k, to̍h-sī Me-la-lih ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, liam-khau só͘ tit-tio̍h tsiah-ê siâⁿ, kiōng tsa̍p-jī tsō siâⁿ.
English: All these were the cities of the children of Merari according to their families, even the rest of the families of the Levites; and their lot was twelve cities.

Tailo: Kā i ê thâu-khak khǹg tuà puâⁿ-.ni̍h, kau hō͘ hit-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á, i tsiū phâng khì hō͘ i ê lāu-bú.
English: His head was brought on a platter, and given to the young lady: and she brought it to her mother.

Tailo: Lia̍t ông lóng ē phak lo̍h-lâi kā i pài; bān-kok lóng ē kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: Yes, all kings shall fall down before him. All nations shall serve him.

Tailo: Tì-huī tī ke-lō͘ tuā-siaⁿ teh kiò, tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi tshut i ê siann.
English: Wisdom calls aloud in the street. She utters her voice in the public squares.

Tailo: I tsiū kā in kóng, Lín ná ē kiânn tsiah-ê tāi-tsì? Guá tuì tsiah-ê tsìng lâng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín ê pháiⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: He said to them, Why do you such things? for I hear of your evil dealings from all this people.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, In it-tshè ê pháiⁿ tāi lóng tī Gil-gal, Guá tī hia uàn-hūn in. In-uī in só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ, Guá beh tuì Guá ê ke kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, bô koh kā in thiàⁿ-sioh; in ê siú-líng lóng sī puē-gi̍k ê.
English: All their wickedness is in Gilgal; For there I hated them. Because of the wickedness of their deeds I will drive them out of my house! I will love them no more. All their princes are rebels.

Tailo: Mô͘-se sì-tsa̍p huè ê sî, siūⁿ beh khì khuànn ka-kī ê hiann-tī — I-su-la-el ê tông-pau.
English: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers , the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lín só͘-ū niá siū sé-lé lâi kah Ki-tok kiat-liân ê lâng, lóng ji̍p tī Ki-tok, ū I ê ua̍h-miā.
English: For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.

Tailo: in ê lo̍k-tô ū sì-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p gō͘ tsiah, lî ū la̍k-tshing tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p tsiah.
English: their camels, four hundred thirty-five; their donkeys, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín m̄-bián kiaⁿ, guá ē iúⁿ-tshī lín kah lín ê kiáⁿ-jî. Tsiū án-ne, Iô-sé-huh īng tshin-ài ê ē kā in an-uì.
English: Now therefore don't be afraid. I will nourish you and your little ones. He comforted them, and spoke kindly to them.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng, Thiⁿ-ē tsiah-ê tsuí tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p kàu tsi̍t-ê só͘-tsāi, ta tē tio̍h tshut-hiān. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: God said, Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear, and it was so.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kā i kóng, ' Tsin hó, hó ê lô͘-po̍k, lí kì-jiân tī sió-khuá ê tāi-tsì tsīn-tiong, taⁿ hō͘ lí kuán tsa̍p-ê siâⁿ. '
English: He said to him, Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.'

Tailo: Guá ê hiann-tī kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò kuè-lō͘ lâng; guá ê tông-pau kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò guā-kok lâng.
English: I have become a stranger to my brothers, An alien to my mother's children.

Tailo: In uî-khùn Biān-iá-mín lâng, jiok in, tī in hioh-kha ê só͘-tsāi kā in thún-ta̍h, it-ti̍t kàu Gi-be-at ê tuì-bīn, ǹg ji̍t tshut ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They enclosed the Benjamites round about, and chased them, and trod them down at their resting place, as far as over against Gibeah toward the sunrise.

Tailo: Guān thiⁿ huann-hí, tē khuài-lo̍k! Guān hái kah kî-tiong ê ua̍h-mi̍h lóng tshut tuā-siaⁿ!
English: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice. Let the sea roar, and it's fullness!

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Moreover the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang sit-khì lín ê ióng-khì, in-uī tsit-ê ióng-khì ē hō͘ lín tuā pò-siúⁿ.
English: Therefore don't throw away your boldness, which has a great reward.

Tailo: hit-ê tsìng-thâu nā-sī tsheⁿ á-.sī âng ê sik, tī saⁿ-khò͘, tī phuê, tī king, tī huī, á-.sī tī phuê tsò ê mi̍h, lóng sī thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu, tio̍h hō͘ tsè-si giām.
English: if the plague is greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in anything made of skin; it is the plague of leprosy, and shall be shown to the priest.

Tailo: Kā nn̄g tâi tshia kah sì tsiah gû kau Kel-sióng ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiàu in só͘ tsò ê kang.
English: He gave two wagons and four oxen to the sons of Gershon, according to their service:

Tailo: Tsí-ū khòng-iá ê tsáu-siù tó tī hia, hm̄-hm̄ háu ê siù-luī muá tshù-king; tô-tsiáu tiàm tī hia, iá suaⁿ-iûⁿ tī hia thiàu-bú.
English: But wild animals of the desert will lie there, and their houses will be full of jackals. Ostriches will dwell there, and wild goats will frolic there.

Tailo: Nā ū sio-kò ê tāi-tsì, in tio̍h khiā-teh phuàⁿ-tuàn, tio̍h tsiàu Guá ê phuàⁿ-tuàn lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn. Tī Guá it-tshè ê tseh-kî, tio̍h siú Guá tsiah-ê huat-tō͘ lu̍t-lē, mā tio̍h siú Guá tsiah-ê An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng.
English: In a controversy they shall stand to judge; according to my ordinances shall they judge it: and they shall keep my laws and my statutes in all my appointed feasts; and they shall make my Sabbaths holy.

Tailo: Lín in-uī tsiah-ê iáu-koh bô siū tsik-tok lâi kui-ǹg Guá, tsò tāi-tsì huán-tuì Guá,
English: If by these things you won't be reformed to me, but will walk contrary to me;

Tailo: bâi-tsòng tī i ka-kī ê bōng, to̍h-sī i tī Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ uī ka-kī só͘ tsha̍k ê, hē tī bîn-tshn̂g tíng, i ê bîn-tshn̂g ū phang-hiuⁿ muá-muá, to̍h-sī tsiàu tiâu-hô hiuⁿ ê hong-huat só͘ tsō ê. Jîn-bîn uī-tio̍h i kiânn tsin tsē sio-tsè ê lé-sò͘.
English: They buried him in his own tombs, which he had hewn out for himself in the city of David, and laid him in the bed which was filled with sweet odors and various kinds of spices prepared by the perfumers' art: and they made a very great burning for him.

Tailo: Huān-nā ho̍k-sāi tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng, īng hi-ké ê sîn-bîng tsū-khua ê lâng lóng ē kiàn-siàu. Lín tsiah-ê sîn-bîng lóng tio̍h kìng-pài Siōng-tsú.
English: Let all them be shamed who serve engraved images, Who boast in their idols. Worship him, all you gods!

Tailo: Guá mā beh hō͘ pak-hong ê kun-tuī lī-khui lín hn̄g-hn̄g, kā i kuáⁿ kàu khòng-uāⁿ, pha-hng ê tē, i ê tsîng-tuī kàu tang-hái, āu-tuī kàu se-hái; in-uī i kiânn tuā tāi-tsì, i ê pháiⁿ-bī tshìng khí-.lâi, tshàu-bī huat khí-.lâi.
English: But I will remove the northern army far away from you, And will drive it into a barren and desolate land, Its front into the eastern sea, And its back into the western sea; And its stench will come up, And its bad smell will rise. Surely he has done great things.

Tailo: I-é-su khiā khí-.lâi, kā i kóng, Tsa-bó͘ lâng, in hiah-ê lâng khì tī tó-uī? Bô lâng kā lí tīng tsuē, sī-.bô?
English: Jesus, standing up, saw her and said, Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?

Tailo: Siám-phiah kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê siann ê lâng ē pua̍h-lo̍h hām-kheⁿ; tuì hām-kheⁿ khí-.lâi ê lâng ē hō͘ ua̍h-tauh tauh-.tio̍h; in-uī thinn-tíng ê thang-á lóng khui, tē ê kin-ki mā tín-tāng.
English: It will happen that he who flees from the noise of the fear will fall into the pit; and he who comes up out of the midst of the pit will be taken in the snare; for the windows on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth tremble.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kā in kóng, Lín tio̍h hué-kái, ta̍k lâng lóng tio̍h hōng I-é-su Ki-tok ê miâ niá siū sé-lé, hō͘ lín ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián, lín tsiū ē-tàng niá-siū Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù ê Sìng Sîn.
English: Peter said to them, Repent, and be baptized, everyone of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Ióng-tsòng ê lâng bô su-iàu i-sing, m̄-koh, phuà-pēⁿ ê lâng tsiū su-iàu.
English: Jesus answered them, Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng tńg-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tshéⁿ-tshéⁿ, hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k tsin ū hok-khì. Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, tsú-lâng ē ka-kī hâ uî-su-kûn, tshiánn in tsē-toh, lâi kā in sū-hāu.
English: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most assuredly I tell you, that he will dress himself, and make them recline, and will come and serve them.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: I-su-la-el tso̍k tiong ê guā-pang lâng, to̍h-sī sim bô siū kat-lé, sing-khu bô siū kat-lé ê guā-pang lâng, lóng m̄-thang ji̍p-lâi Guá ê sìng-só͘.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh, No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any foreigners who are among the children of Israel.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, Lí ê tō-lō͘ sîn-sìng; ū siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-bîng tshin-tshiūnn Lí hiah uí-tāi?
English: Your way, God, is in the sanctuary. What god is great like God?

Tailo: In-uī i sī Siōng-tè ê tshe-īng, beh hō͘ lí tit-tio̍h lī-ik. M̄-koh, lí nā tsò pháiⁿ, to̍h ē kiaⁿ i. I tuà kiàm m̄-sī bô bo̍k-tik, i sī Siōng-tè ê tshe-īng, sī sin-uan tsiá, beh hō͘ pháiⁿ lâng tú-tio̍h hîng-hua̍t.
English: for he is a servant of God to you for good. But if you do that which is evil, be afraid, for he doesn't bear the sword in vain; for he is a minister of God, an avenger for wrath to him who does evil.

Tailo: In ū tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng ê thâu-mn̂g, koh ū tshin-tshiūnn sai ê gê.
English: They had hair like women's hair, and their teeth were like those of lions.

Tailo: Sio̍k E-to-tòng ê ū E-to-tòng ê kiáⁿ Ge-tá-lia̍h, Tse-lī, E-siu-ah, Ha-sia-biah, Mat-ta-thí-iah, Si-mí, kiōng la̍k lâng, lóng kui in lāu-pē E-to-tòng tsí-hui, tuâⁿ khîm, tshiùⁿ kua lâi kám-siā o-ló Siōng-tsú.
English: Of Jeduthun; the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsè-si kā i giām, lí khuàⁿ, tsìng-thâu nā bô thuàⁿ tī saⁿ-.ni̍h, tī king, tī huī, á-.sī phuê tsò ê mi̍h,
English: If the priest examines it, and behold, the plague hasn't spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in anything of skin;

Tailo: Kiông-pō hing-khí, tsiâⁿ-tsò hîng-hua̍t pháiⁿ ê kuái-á. In sí-.khì, in ê kûn-tsiòng mā sí-.khì, in ê tsâi-pó mā bô-.khì, in tiong-kan bô lâng tit-tio̍h tsun-kuì.
English: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness; none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of their wealth: neither shall there be eminency among them.

Tailo: In-uī I-su-la-el tiong it-tshè thâu-tsiūⁿ seⁿ ê, á-.sī lâng, á-.sī tsing-seⁿ, lóng sī Guá ê. Guá tī Ai-gi̍p tē phah-sí it-tshè thâu-tsiūⁿ seⁿ ê hit ji̍t, í-king kā in hun-pia̍t tsò sìng kui tī Guá.
English: For all the firstborn among the children of Israel are mine, both man and animal. On the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for myself.

Tailo: Be-tsa-lel īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò kuī, tn̂g nn̄g tiú puàⁿ, khuah tiú puàⁿ, kuân tiú puàⁿ.
English: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, and its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, guá beh tuâⁿ sik o-ló Lí, o-ló Lí ê sìn-si̍t! I-su-la-el ê sìng ê ah, guá beh tuâⁿ khîm o-ló Lí!
English: I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God. I sing praises to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Ha-mán huann-hí, sim-lāi khuài-lo̍k, tsiū tshut-.lâi; tsóng-.sī, Ha-mán khuàⁿ-tio̍h Mol-té-kái tī ông-kiong ê mn̂g-kháu bô khí-.lâi, mā bô uī-tio̍h i lâi tín-tāng, tsiū muá-sim siū-khì Mol-té-kái.
English: Then went Haman forth that day joyful and glad of heart: but when Haman saw Mordecai in the king's gate, that he didn't stand up nor move for him, he was filled with wrath against Mordecai.

Tailo: Tī tang, sai, lâm, pak, sì-hng lóng ū kò͘-mn̂g ê.
English: On the four sides were the porters, toward the east, west, north, and south.

Tailo: Suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê hue-tsháu, kin-á-ji̍t teh ua̍h, bîn-á-tsài tsiū hō͘ lâng hiat lo̍h-khì hué-lô͘, Siōng-tè to án-ne teh kā i táⁿ-pān, lí siūⁿ, I kám bē koh khah kā lín táⁿ-pān? Lín ná ē hiah-ni̍h bô sìn-sim?
English: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won't he much more clothe you, you of little faith?

Tailo: Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, uī-tio̍h Lí ê iân-kò͘, guán kui ji̍t bīn-tuì sí-bông ê ui-hia̍p. Guán hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò teh beh hō͘ lâng thâi ê iûⁿ. (tsù, SPh 44:22)
English: Even as it is written, For your sake we are killed all day long. We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.

Tailo: Tio̍h lī-khui hi-ké ê tāi-tsì hn̄g-hn̄g, m̄-thang thâi bô tsuē kah gī ê lâng, in-uī Guá it-tīng bô kā pháiⁿ lâng sǹg-tsò sī gī lâng.
English: Keep far from a false charge, and don't kill the innocent and righteous: for I will not justify the wicked.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá ái lín tsai, guá só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì tian-tò hō͘ hok-im koh khah tsìn-tián.
English: Now I desire to have you know, brothers, that the things which happened to me have turned out rather to the progress of the Good News;

Tailo: In puî koh bô jiâu-bûn, tsò pháiⁿ kuè-thâu, bô uī-tio̍h lâng sin-uan! Tsiū-sī bô uī-tio̍h ko͘-jî sin-uan, hō͘ i hing-thong, mā bô uī-tio̍h sàn-tshiah lâng phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: They are grew fat, they shine: yes, they overpass in deeds of wickedness; they don't plead the cause, the cause of the fatherless, that they may prosper; and the right of the needy they don't judge.

Tailo: Tsit-ê bûn-tô͘ to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tsò kiàn-tsìng, koh kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì siá lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, lán tsai i ê kiàn-tsìng sī tsin-si̍t.
English: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

Tailo: Hit mê, ông bē-khùn-.tit, kiò lâng the̍h li̍k-sú ê tsheh lâi, in tsiū tī ông ê bīn-tsîng tha̍k tsheh.
English: On that night the king couldn't sleep; and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles, and they were read before the king.

Tailo: Lín suî-jiân í-king tsai tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, guá iáu-koh beh kā lín thê-tshéⁿ, Siōng-tè tsi̍t pái to̍h kā I-su-la-el tsú-bîn tuì Ai-gi̍p ê só͘-tsāi kiù tshut-.lâi, āu-lâi koh kā hiah-ê m̄-sìn ê lâng huí-bia̍t.
English: Now I desire to remind you, though you already know this, that the Lord, having saved a people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed those who didn't believe.

Tailo: Kel-sióng lâng ê siâⁿ tsiàu i ê tsong-tso̍k, kiōng tsa̍p-saⁿ tsō siâⁿ kah i ê kau-iá.
English: All the cities of the Gershonites according to their families were thirteen cities with their suburbs.

Tailo: Tsiàu Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng, kā i só͘ kiû ê siâⁿ hō͘ i, to̍h-sī E-hu-laim suaⁿ-tē ê Tîng-ná-se-la̍h, i tsiū khí hit-ê siâⁿ, tuà tī hit tiong-kan.
English: according to the commandment of Yahweh they gave him the city which he asked, even Timnathserah in the hill country of Ephraim; and he built the city, and lived therein.

Tailo: Kuan-hē só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī hiah-ê m̄-sī sio̍k I-su-la-el ê A-mô͘-lī lâng, Hiat lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, Hi-bī lâng kah I-é-bú-suh lâng,
English: As for all the people who were left of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of the children of Israel;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Līng-guā tsi̍t-ê huān-lâng kā hit-ê tsik-pī, kóng, Lí kah I kāng-khuán teh siū-hîng, lí kám m̄-kiaⁿ Siōng-tè?
English: But the other answered, and rebuking him said, Don't you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?

Tailo: Si-óng ê lō͘-kìng pi-siong, in-uī bô lâng beh hù i ê tseh-kî; i ê siâⁿ mn̂g lóng líng-tsīng, i ê tsè-si teh thó͘-khuì; i ê tsāi-sik-lí kan-lân, i pún-sin mā iu-khó͘.
English: The ways of Zion do mourn, because none come to the solemn assembly; All her gates are desolate, her priests do sigh: Her virgins are afflicted, and she herself is in bitterness.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, tsìng jîn-bîn ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tsè-si kah Lē-bī lâng, lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi-kàu king-ha̍k kàu-su E-tsu-la̍h hia, ài beh tì-ì thiaⁿ lu̍t-huat ê uē.
English: On the second day were gathered together the heads of fathers' houses of all the people, the priests, and the Levites, to Ezra the scribe, even to give attention to the words of the law.

Tailo: In-uī guá mā sī hō͘ lâng kuán ê lâng, mā ū ping hō͘ guá kuán. Guá kā tsit-ê kóng, ' Khì! ', i tsiū khì; kā hit-ê kóng, ' Lâi! ', i tsiū lâi; kā guá ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Án-ne tsò! ' I tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: For I am also a man under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, Go,' and he goes; and tell another, Come,' and he comes; and tell my servant, Do this,' and he does it.

Tailo: Tī i ê tsiàⁿ tshiú, ū tsiam-pok khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsìnn; siat iûⁿ thâu thuî, khui tshuì huah thâi, tuā-siaⁿ huah, siat iûⁿ thâu thuî lâi kong-kik siâⁿ mn̂g, khí thô͘-tui lâi tsō tâi.
English: In his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to build forts.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā Io-siú-ah kóng, M̄-bián uī-tio̍h in lâi kiaⁿ, in-uī bîn-á-tsài tsha-put-to tsit sî, Guá ē kā thâi-sí ê kûn-tsiòng kau tī I-su-la-el lâng ê bīn-tsîng. Lí tio̍h kuah-tn̄g in ê bé-thuí ê tuā kin, īng hué sio in ê tshia.
English: Yahweh said to Joshua, Don't be afraid because of them; for tomorrow at this time will I deliver them up all slain before Israel: you shall hamstring their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.

Tailo: Kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê kiò Ku-lé-o-pah ê ìn I-é-su kóng, Tsit kuí ji̍t tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì, sī án-tsuáⁿ kan-taⁿ Lí m̄-tsai?
English: One of them, named Cleopas, answered him, Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn't know the things which have happened there in these days?

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ê Sìng Sîn lîm-kàu guá; in-uī Siōng-tsú īng iû buah guá, hō͘ guá thuân hok-im hō͘ sàn-tshiah ê lâng, tshe guá i hó siong-sim ê lâng, suan-iông siū lia̍h ê tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, siū kuaiⁿ ê tshut kaⁿ-lô;
English: The Spirit of the Lord Yahweh is on me; because Yahweh has anointed me to preach good news to the humble; he has sent me to bind up the broken-hearted, to proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to those who are bound;

Tailo: Mi-ka-iah kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-su-la-el tsìng lâng sì-suàⁿ tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tshin-tshiūnn bô bo̍k-tsiá ê iûⁿ. Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Tsiah-ê bô tsú-lâng, in ta̍k-ê thang pîng-an tńg-khì in ê ke. '
English: He said, I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and Yahweh said, These have no master; let them return every man to his house in peace.

Tailo: Kiâⁿ-gī píng-kong, pí hiàn tsè koh khah tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú tsiap-la̍p.
English: To do righteousness and justice Is more acceptable to Yahweh than sacrifice.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá ê uē kám m̄-sī tshin-tshiūnn hué, koh tshin-tshiūnn ē phah-phuà tsio̍h-puâⁿ ê tuā thuî?
English: Isn't my word like fire? says Yahweh; and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tshuā Lē-bī lâng kàu huē-bō͘ tsîng, tsū-tsi̍p I-su-la-el tso̍k ê tsuân huē-tsiòng.
English: You shall present the Levites before the Tent of Meeting. You shall assemble the whole congregation of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Ū uē tuì Siōng-tsú lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng, lín tio̍h siū kà-sī. Bián-tit Guá ê sim kah lí so͘-uán, bián-tit Guá hō͘ lí pha-hng, tsiâⁿ-tsò bô lâng tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Be instructed, Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from you; lest I make you a desolation, a land not inhabited.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tsuâⁿ-tsuí sī tuì kah in tâng kiâⁿ ê hit tè tsio̍h-puâⁿ lâu tshut; hit tè tsio̍h-puâⁿ to̍h-sī Ki-tok.
English: and all drank the same spiritual drink. For they drank of a spiritual rock that followed them, and the rock was Christ.

Tailo: Sò͘-tsè só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tio̍h kui hō͘ A-lông kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun, tse sī hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê hué-tsè tiong tsò tsì-sìng ê.
English: That which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'. It is a thing most holy of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire.

Tailo: Sí-mòng Piat-tò͘ ìn kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ū íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê uē, guán tio̍h koh khì tuè siáⁿ lâng?
English: Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.

Tailo: Tuì hiah-ê í-tsîng huān tsuē ê kah kî-tha só͘-ū ê lâng, guá tī tē-jī pái khì lín hia ê sî ū kā lín kíng-kò kuè. Tsit-má guá bô tī lín hia, beh koh tsi̍t pái kā lín kíng-kò, āu-pái guá koh khì lín hia ê sî, to̍h bô beh kā lín khuan-iông.
English: I have said beforehand, and I do say beforehand, as when I was present the second time, so now, being absent, I write to those who have sinned before now, and to all the rest, that, if I come again, I will not spare;

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê kî-tó. ）Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá kî-tó, in-uī guá khùn-khó͘ sàn-tshiah.
English: Hear, Yahweh, and answer me, For I am poor and needy.

Tailo: Guán ai-kiû Siōng-tsú ê sî, I thiaⁿ guán ê siann, tshe-khián sù-tsiá tshuā guán tshut Ai-gi̍p, taⁿ guán tī lí ki̍k piⁿ-á ê siâⁿ Ka-té-si.
English: and when we cried to Yahweh, he heard our voice, and sent an angel, and brought us forth out of Egypt: and behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of your border.

Tailo: In-uī Lí m̄-sī huann-hí tsuē-ok ê Siōng-tsú; pháiⁿ tāi Lí bô beh iông-ín.
English: For you are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness. Evil can't live with you.

Tailo: （Peh kiā-á ê si. ）Kiàn-nā kìng-uì Siōng-tè, kiânn tī I ê lō͘ ê lâng tsin ū hok-khì!
English: Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh, Who walks in his ways.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kóng, Guá só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h m̄-sī thâi-iâⁿ tik-sìng ê siann, mā m̄-sī thâi-su tuā-siaⁿ huah-hiu ê siann, sī teh tshiùⁿ kua ê siann.
English: He said, It isn't the voice of those who shout for victory, neither is it the voice of those who cry for being overcome; but the noise of those who sing that I hear.

Tailo: In bô koh gióng-bōng ka-kī ê tshiú só͘ khí ê tsè-tuâⁿ, bô koh kuan-khuàⁿ ka-kī ê tsíng-thâu-á só͘ tsō ê tshâ-thiāu á-.sī ji̍t-thâu ê siōng.
English: They will not look to the altars, the work of their hands; neither shall they respect that which their fingers have made, either the Asherim, or the incense altars.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā lín ê kha-tsiúⁿ só͘ ta̍h ê tē, Guá lóng siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín, tsiàu Guá tuì Mô͘-se só͘ kóng ê.
English: Every place that the sole of your foot shall tread on, to you have I given it, as I spoke to Moses.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-tsa̍p, jîn-bîn tuì Iol-tàn hô khí-.lâi, tsiū tsat iâⁿ tī Gil-gal, tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tang pîng ê kíng-kài.
English: The people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped in Gilgal, on the east border of Jericho.

Tailo: In gia̍h thâu khuànn thiⁿ, ànn-lo̍h khuànn tē, bô siūⁿ kóng tsuân-pō͘ lóng sī kan-khó͘ kah thòng-khó͘ ê o͘-àm, koh hông kuáⁿ ji̍p-khì tī o͘-o͘ àm-àm ê lāi-bīn.
English: and look to the earth, and see distress, darkness, and the gloom of anguish. They will will be driven into thick darkness.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ê tsāi-sik-lí, Guá beh koh kā lí kiàn-li̍p, lí tsiū ē tit-tio̍h kiàn-li̍p; lí beh koh īng lin-long-kó͘ tsò táⁿ-pān, kah khuài-lo̍k ê lâng tsò-tīn thiàu-bú tshut-.khì.
English: Again will I build you, and you shall be built, O virgin of Israel: again shall you be adorned with your tambourines, and shall go forth in the dances of those who make merry.
