Tailo: Lí tio̍h khì guá ê lāu-pē ê ke, guá ê pún tso̍k hia, kā guá ê kiáⁿ tshuā tsi̍t-ê bó͘. '
English: but you shall go to my father's house, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son.'

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū tshing-bān lâng lâi kā guá uî-kong, guá mā bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: I will not be afraid of tens of thousands of people Who have set themselves against me on every side.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, tsiàu guán ê hīⁿ-khang só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê, bô tsi̍t-ê tshin-tshiūnn Lí, Lí í-guā bô pa̍t-ê tsin-sîn.
English: Yahweh, there is none like you, neither is there any God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat kóng, I ū Siōng-tsú ê uē. I-su-la-el ông kah Iô-sa-huat kah E-tóm ông tsiū lo̍h-khì kìnn i.
English: Jehoshaphat said, The word of Yahweh is with him. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.

Tailo: Guá tshâ-tshut i hō͘ lâng kò sī uī-tio̍h in ê lu̍t-huat piān-lūn, pīng bô huān-tio̍h kai sí á-.sī tio̍h kā i kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê tsuē.
English: I found him to be accused about questions of their law, but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Si-hông m̄ siong-sìn I-su-la-el, m̄ hō͘ in king-kuè i ê kíng-kài, Si-hông tsiū tsū-tsi̍p i ê jîn-bîn, tī Ia-hat tsat iâⁿ kah I-su-la-el lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: But Sihon didn't trust Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.

Tailo: Lí ê bo̍k-tsiá ē hō͘ hong tshue-.khì, lí só͘ tshin-ài ê ē hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì; hit sî, lí it-tīng ē in-uī lí it-tshè ê pháiⁿ lâi làu-khuì kiàn-siàu.
English: The wind shall feed all your shepherds, and your lovers shall go into captivity: surely then shall you be ashamed and confounded for all your wickedness.

Tailo: Ông koh phài Lē-bī lâng tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān the̍h pua̍t, sik, khîm, tsiàu Ta-bi̍t kah ông ê sian-kiàn Ga̍t, í-ki̍p Ná-than sian-ti só͘ bīng-līng ê, in-uī Siōng-tsú ū kau-thok I hiah-ê sian-ti, bīng-līng in án-ne tsò.
English: He set the Levites in the house of Yahweh with cymbals, with psalteries, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, and of Gad the king's seer, and Nathan the prophet; for the commandment was of Yahweh by his prophets.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsóng-tok ê ping-á ah I-é-su ji̍p-khì tsóng-tok-hú, tiàu-tsi̍p tsuân-iâⁿ ê ping kā I uî khí-.lâi.
English: Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.

Tailo: Án-ne, Ta-bi̍t kah I-su-la-el tsuân ke kng Siōng-tsú ê kuī lâi, tshut huann-hí ê siann, pûn sàu-kak.
English: So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of Yahweh with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet.

Tailo: I phah-thè I ê tuì-ti̍k, hō͘ in íng-uán siū lîng-jio̍k;
English: He struck his adversaries backward. He put them to a perpetual reproach.

Tailo: Lí ke-thinn lí ê sing-lí lâng, pí thinn-tíng ê tsheⁿ khah tsē; tō͘-kâu sún-hāi liáu tsiū pue-.khì.
English: You have increased your merchants more than the stars of the skies. The grasshopper strips, and flees away.

Tailo: Tsit-ê siàu-liân lâng, to̍h-sī siàu-liân ê sian-ti, khì Gi-lia̍t ê La̍h-mot.
English: So the young man, even the young man the prophet, went to Ramoth Gilead.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Mô͘-ap ê pîng-guân, tī Iol-tàn hô guā, I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê tuì-bīn.
English: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tshe lâng khì thàm-khuàⁿ Guá só͘ sù hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng ê Ka-nân tē, tio̍h tuì in tsó͘-sian ta̍k tsi-tso̍k tiong-kan kok tshe tsi̍t-ê lâng, lóng sī tī in tiong-kan tsò siú-líng ê.
English: Send you men, that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel: of every tribe of their fathers shall you send a man, everyone a prince among them.

Tailo: Lín ē-tàng īng ē-bīn ê hong-huat, lâi hun-pia̍t hit-ê lîng sī m̄-sī Siōng-tè ê Sìng Sîn, kong-khai sîng-jīn I-é-su Ki-tok tō tsiânn jio̍k-thé lîm-kàu tsit sè-kan ê hit-ê lîng, to̍h-sī tuì Siōng-tè lâi ê Sìng Sîn.
English: By this you know the Spirit of God: every spirit who confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,

Tailo: Mā m̄-thang uī ka-kī tshāi tiau-khik ê thiāu, tse sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ uàn-hūn ê.
English: Neither shall you set yourself up a pillar; which Yahweh your God hates.

Tailo: Lín í-tsîng suî-jiân tshin-tshiūnn thinn-tíng ê tsheⁿ hiah tsē, tsóng-.sī, in-uī lí bô tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê uē, só͘-í, lí só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê sò͘-gia̍h tsiū ē piàn tsió.
English: You shall be left few in number, whereas you were as the stars of the sky for multitude; because you didn't listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Guá ê sió-muē, guá ê sin-niû, lí tua̍t-khì guá ê sim; īng lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsi̍t-ē khuànn, īng lí ê ām-kún ê tsi̍t tiâu kim liān-á, lí tua̍t-khì guá ê sim!
English: You have ravished my heart, my sister, my bride. You have ravished my heart with one of your eyes, With one chain of your neck.

Tailo: Lín ē tuì kiù-un ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ huann-hí lâi tshiūⁿ tsuí.
English: Therefore with joy you will draw water out of the wells of salvation.

Tailo: I tshuā guá, hō͘ guá kiânn tī o͘-àm, bô kiâⁿ tī kng-bîng tiong.
English: He has led me and caused me to walk in darkness, and not in light.

Tailo: Tsò ang-î ê, tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: You shall not allow a sorceress to live.

Tailo: Guān Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok ê un-tián, Siōng-tè ê thiàⁿ-thàng, Sìng Sîn ê siong-thong kah lín tāi-ke tông-tsāi.
English: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen.

Tailo: I-si-ma-el tī uá-kīn Ge-tá-lia̍h hia thâi tsiah-ê lâng, kā in ê sin-si hiat tī kó͘-tséⁿ-.ni̍h; tsit-kháu tséⁿ sī tsá-tsîng A-sah ông in-uī kiaⁿ I-su-la-el ông Ba-siah ê iân-kò͘ só͘ khui ê. Ne-thá-niah ê kiáⁿ I-si-ma-el kā só͘ thâi ê sin-si thūn-muá kó͘-tséⁿ.
English: Now the pit in which Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had killed, by the side of Gedaliah (the same was who which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel), Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with those who were killed.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kiò lâng thî-khàu, ai-siong, thì thâu-mn̂g, hâ muâ-pò͘.
English: In that day, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, called to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to dressing in sackcloth:

Tailo: Guán bô ài lâng huí-pòng guán ê ho̍k-sāi kang-tsok, guán lóng bô tsò tsó͘-gāi lâng ê tāi-tsì.
English: We give no occasion of stumbling in anything, that our service may not be blamed,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, I it-tīng tio̍h tāi-sing siū tsin tsē ê kan-khó͘, mā hō͘ tsit sè-tāi ê lâng khì-sak.
English: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

Tailo: Án-ne, lu̍t-huat ū siáⁿ lō͘-īng? Lu̍t-huat sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lâng tsai siáⁿ-mi̍h sī kuè-sit, iû thiⁿ-sài thong-kuè tsi̍t-ê tiong-kan-jîn só͘ siat-li̍p ê, it-ti̍t kàu hit uī tit-tio̍h ìng-ín ê Kiáⁿ-sun lâi-lîm ê sî tsiū kiat-sok.
English: What then is the law? It was added because of transgressions, until the seed should come to whom the promise has been made. It was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.

Tailo: Tsit-ê uē kó-jiân ìng-giām tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ, in-uī jîn-bîn tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu kā i thún-ta̍h, i tsiū sí-.khì.
English: it happened even so to him; for the people trod on him in the gate, and he died.

Tailo: Guán in-uī thiaⁿ-tio̍h tshoh-mē lâi làu-khuì, muá-bīn kiàn-siàu, in-uī ī-pang lâng ji̍p-khì Siōng-tsú ê tiān hiah-ê sìng ê só͘-tsāi.
English: We are confounded, because we have heard reproach; confusion has covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of Yahweh's house.

Tailo: Le-ah kā Iâ-kop só͘ seⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Tí-nah, tshut-khì beh kìnn hit só͘-tsāi ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á.
English: Dinah, the daughter of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

Tailo: Bô-oh-tsuh kā Lù-thuh kóng, Guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ, m̄-thang khì pa̍t khu hn̂g khioh be̍h-sap, mā m̄-thang lī-khui tsia, tio̍h án-ne kah guá tsiah-ê lú-pī tsò-tīn.
English: Then said Boaz to Ruth, Don't you hear, my daughter? Don't go to glean in another field, neither pass from hence, but abide here fast by my maidens.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí i-tī guá, guá tsiū tit-tio̍h i hó; tsín-kiù guá, guá tsiū tit-tio̍h kiù; in-uī Lí sī guá só͘ o-ló ê.
English: Heal me, O Yahweh, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved: for you are my praise.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, lâng ē kí Siōng-tsú ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, bô beh kóng I sī tshuā I-su-la-el ê kiáⁿ-sun tuì Ai-gi̍p tē tshut-.lâi ê.
English: Therefore, behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that they shall no more say, As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm khí-.lâi, tuì hit só͘-tsāi ê lâng, to̍h-sī Hiat tso̍k, àⁿ-io.
English: Abraham rose up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.

Tailo: Bik-bai ê kiáⁿ-sun, nn̄g-tshing khòng gō͘-tsa̍p la̍k lâng.
English: The children of Bigvai, two thousand fifty-six.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè tuì guá án-ne kóng, Lí tuì Guá ê tshiú tsiap tsit pue siū-khì ê tsiú, hō͘ hiah-ê Guá só͘ tshe lí khì ê lia̍t kok lim.
English: For thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, to me: take this cup of the wine of wrath at my hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send you, to drink it.

Tailo: Kah guá tsò-hué khì ê Tî-to, suî-jiân sī Hi-la̍h lâng, mā bô hō͘ lâng bián-kióng i tsiap siū kat-lé.
English: But not even Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.

Tailo: Lí kám ē pí guán ê tsó͘-sian A-bu-la-hàm khah uí-tāi? I í-king sí, tsìng sian-ti mā sí; Lí siūⁿ kóng Lí sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Are you greater than our father, Abraham, who died? The prophets died. Who do you make yourself out to be?

Tailo: Am-móng lâng tsìn-kòng U-tsi-iah, i ê miâ-siaⁿ thuân kàu Ai-gi̍p ê kau-kài, in-uī i hui-siông kiông-sīng.
English: The Ammonites gave tribute to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt; for he grew exceeding strong.

Tailo: Lí nā tì-ì tsáu-tshuē Siōng-tè, koh tuì Tsuân-lîng-.ê kiû un;
English: If you want to seek God diligently, Make your supplication to the Almighty.

Tailo: guá tsi̍t ē lī-khui lí, Siōng-tsú ê Sìng Sîn ē tshuā lí kàu guá só͘ m̄-tsai ê só͘-tsāi. Guá khì kā A-hap kóng, i mā tshuē lí bē-tio̍h, tsiū ē kā guá thâi-sí. Tsóng-.sī, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tuì siàu-liân to̍h sī kìng-uì Siōng-tsú ê.
English: It will happen, as soon as I am gone from you, that the Spirit of Yahweh will carry you I don't know where; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he can't find you, he will kill me: but I your servant fear Yahweh from my youth.

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t, guá beh kā lí ê iûⁿ-kûn sûn tsi̍t piàn, kā mî-iûⁿ tiong kiàn-nā ū tiám ê, ū pan ê kah o͘-sik ê, í-ki̍p suaⁿ-iûⁿ tiong kiàn-nā ū pan ê kah ū tiám ê lóng puah tshut-.lâi, kàu-sî tsit khuán ê iûⁿ tsiū hō͘ guá lâi tòng-tsò guá ê kang-tsînn.
English: I will pass through all your flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted one, and every black one among the sheep, and the spotted and speckled among the goats. This will be my hire.

Tailo: A-ki-si kā i ê jîn-sîn kóng, Lín khuànn, tsit-ê lâng sī tian-kông, ná ē tuà i lâi guá tsia?
English: Then said Achish to his servants, Look, you see the man is mad; why then have you brought him to me?

Tailo: Nā seⁿ-thuàⁿ tī phuê-hu, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò bô tshing-khì, sī huān-tio̍h tsìng-thâu.
English: If it spreads in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a plague.

Tailo: Lí ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap in ê tē, pīng m̄-sī in-uī lí ê gī-hîng, mā m̄-sī in-uī lí ê sim tsìng-ti̍t, to̍h-sī in-uī tsiah-ê kok ê pháiⁿ, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tsiah tuì lí ê bīn-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, koh in-uī Siōng-tsú beh kian-kò͘ I tuì lí ê tsó͘-sian A-bu-la-hàm, Í-sak, Iâ-kop só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê uē.
English: Not for your righteousness, or for the uprightness of your heart, do you go in to possess their land; but for the wickedness of these nations Yahweh your God does drive them out from before you, and that he may establish the word which Yahweh swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.

Tailo: Tsiàn-tshia ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h m̄-sī I-su-la-el ông, tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin bô koh jiok i.
English: It happened, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.

Tailo: Siâng tsit ji̍t, kiàn-nā bô khik-khó͘ i ê sim ê, ē hông tuì jîn-bîn tiong tsián-tû.
English: For whoever it is who shall not deny himself in that same day; shall be cut off from his people.

Tailo: Hit sî, Tsú ē īng tuì hô guā tshiàⁿ-.lâi ê thì thâu to, to̍h-sī A-siul ông lâi thì in ê thâu kah kha ê mn̂g, mā beh tsuân-pō͘ khun in ê tshuì-tshiu.
English: In that day the Lord will shave with a razor that is hired in the parts beyond the River, even with the king of Assyria, the head and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.

Tailo: Siâ-sîn tsiū pik-tshiat kiû I-é-su m̄-thang kuáⁿ in lī-khui hit-ê tē-khu.
English: He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

Tailo: kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, Lí pí guá khah kong-gī, in-uī lí īng hó pò guá, tsóng-.sī, guá īng pháiⁿ pò lí.
English: He said to David, You are more righteous than I; for you have rendered to me good, whereas I have rendered to you evil.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huat-tshut siū-khì lâi jiok in, tuì Siōng-tsú ê thian-hā lâi kā in tsâu-bia̍t.
English: You will pursue them in anger, and destroy them from under the heavens of Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Kàu hit ji̍t, Guá beh tsū-tsi̍p pái-kha-.ê, tsio-tsi̍p siū kuáⁿ-tshut ê kah Guá só͘ bat hō͘ i siū khó͘ ê.
English: In that day, says Yahweh, I will assemble that which is lame, And I will gather that which is driven away, And that which I have afflicted;

Tailo: I ìn kóng, Kā i liân-bín hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī. I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí khì, tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: He said, He who showed mercy on him. Then Jesus said to him, Go and do likewise.

Tailo: Pîn-tuāⁿ lâng ê sim him-bō͘ mā tit bē-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h; in-khîn ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h sim-muá ì-tsiok.
English: The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing, But the desire of the diligent shall be fully satisfied.

Tailo: Ông án-ne kóng: Kā tsit-ê lâng kuainn tī kaⁿ-.ni̍h, īng khó͘ ê piáⁿ kah khó͘ ê tsuí hō͘ i tsia̍h, thìng-hāu guá pîng-an tńg-.lâi.
English: and say, Thus says the king, Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I come in peace.

Tailo: Sò͘-tsè kah tiān-tsiú lóng bô thang kàu tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān; ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú ê tsè-si lóng pi-ai.
English: The meal offering and the drink offering are cut off from Yahweh's house. The priests, Yahweh's ministers, mourn.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā sian-ti, á-.sī tsè-si, á-.sī jîn-bîn kóng ' Siōng-tsú tāng-tàⁿ ê bi̍k-sī ê ', hit khuán lâng, Guá beh kā i kah i ê ke hîng-hua̍t.
English: As for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, who shall say, The burden of Yahweh, I will even punish that man and his house.

Tailo: Bô-oh-tsuh lim-tsia̍h liáu-āu, sim huann-hí, tsiū khì tó tī be̍h-tui ê piⁿ-á. I tsiū liam-kha ji̍p-.khì, hian-khui i ê kha só͘ kah ê, jiân-āu tó tī hia.
English: When Boaz had eaten and drunk, and his heart was merry, he went to lie down at the end of the heap of grain: and she came softly, and uncovered his feet, and laid her down.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h buán-tsiok ka-kī ê jio̍k-thé lâi iā tsíng ê lâng, i ê siu-sîng to̍h-sī jio̍k-thé ê pāi-huāi; uī-tio̍h hō͘ Sìng Sîn huann-hí lâi iā tsíng ê lâng, tsiū ē tuì Sìng Sîn lâi siu-sîng íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: For he who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption. But he who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.

Tailo: Tsit ji̍t tuì hit ji̍t kóng-uē, tsit mê tuì hit mê thuân-tshut tì-sik.
English: Day after day they pour forth speech, And night after night they display knowledge.

Tailo: Hiat lâng ìn A-bu-la-hàm, kóng,
English: The children of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him,

Tailo: I īng kha-liâu tshiú-khàu khàu guá ê kha-tshiú, tì-ì khuànn guá só͘-ū ê lō͘.
English: He puts my feet in the stocks, He marks all my paths.'

Tailo: Tē-la̍k ji̍t sī Ga̍t kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, Tiu-el ê kiáⁿ E-lí-a-sa̍h.
English: On the sixth day, Eliasaph the son of Deuel, prince of the children of Gad

Tailo: Gōng ê ū gia̍h ting, bô līng-guā tuà iû.
English: Those who were foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú to̍k-to̍k huaⁿ-hí lí ê tsó͘-sian, thiàⁿ in, tī bān-bîn tiong kíng-suán in ê kiáⁿ-sun, to̍h-sī lín tsiah-ê, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t to̍h-sī.
English: Only Yahweh had a delight in your fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all peoples, as at this day.

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê si. ）Guá ê sim-sîn ah, lí tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú; huān-nā tī guá lāi-bīn ê mā lóng o-ló I ê sìng-miâ.
English: Praise Yahweh, my soul! All that is within me, praise his holy name!

Tailo: Lâng nā tuì Siōng-tsú hē guān á-.sī tsiù-tsuā, īng tsi̍t-ê iok ka-kī iok-sok, tsiū m̄-thang thun-tsia̍h i ê uē, tio̍h tsiàu i ê tshuì só͘ kóng-tshut ê, tsuân-pō͘ si̍t-hîng.
English: When a man vows a vow to Yahweh, or swears an oath to bind his soul with a bond, he shall not break his word; he shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.

Tailo: hit-ê kài koh tuì suaⁿ tíng kàu Nî-hut-to-a ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, thàng-kàu E-hu-lóng suaⁿ hiah-ê siâⁿ; hit-ê kài koh kàu Ba-la̍h, ( Ba-la̍h to̍h-sī Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm );
English: and the border extended from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of Mount Ephron; and the border extended to Baalah (the same is Kiriath Jearim);

Tailo: í-ki̍p hiuⁿ-tuâⁿ, sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ kah i só͘-ū ê khì-kū, í-ki̍p sé-tn̄g ê phûn kah i ê tsō.
English: the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels, the basin and its base,

Tailo: Koh tio̍h īng tshing-khì ê jú-hiuⁿ hē tī ta̍k tsuā, kā piáⁿ tsò kì-hō, to̍h-sī tsò hué-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: You shall put pure frankincense on each row, that it may be to the bread for a memorial, even an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn á-.sī tī I-su-la-el tiong kià-kha ê tshut-guā lâng, kiàn-nā kah Guá keh-tn̄g, tsiap-la̍p i ê ngó͘-siōng tī i ê sim-lāi, koh hē ē tì-sú huān tsuē ê tsó͘-gāi tī i ka-kī ê bīn-tsîng, koh lâi kìnn sian-ti, siūⁿ beh uī ka-kī ê tāi-tsì lâi mn̄g Guá ê, Guá — Siōng-tsú beh tshin-sin kā i ìn-tap.
English: For everyone of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who sojourn in Israel, who separates himself from me, and takes his idols into his heart, and puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face, and comes to the prophet to inquire for himself of me; I Yahweh will answer him by myself:

Tailo: In lia̍h-tio̍h ông, kā i lia̍h kàu Ha-mat tē ê Lip-la̍h — Ba-bú-lông ông hia; Ba-bú-lông ông tsiū kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: Then they took the king, and carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he gave judgment on him.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, I-é-su kuè-khì Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘, to̍h-sī Tî-bé-lī-a ô͘ ê hit pîng.
English: After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Taⁿ tsit-ê sī guá kut lāi ê kut, bah lāi ê bah; guá beh kā i kiò-tsò tsa-bó͘ lâng, in-uī i sī tuì tsa-po͘ lâng the̍h tshut-.lâi ê.
English: The man said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

Tailo: In tsuan-sim niá-siū sù-tô͘ ê kà-sī, tsham-ú sìn-tô͘ thuân-khè sing-ua̍h, niá-siū Sìng-tshan, kî-tó.
English: They continued steadfastly in the apostles' teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.

Tailo: Lín kám bô án-ne kóng, ' Koh sì gue̍h-ji̍t tsiū ū thang siu-sîng ā'? Guá kā lín kóng, lín khuànn sì-bīn ê tshân-hn̂g, ngó͘-kok í-king si̍k, thang siu-sîng ā.
English: Don't you say, There are yet four months until the harvest?' Behold, I tell you, lift up your eyes, and look at the fields, that they are white for harvest already.

Tailo: Koh khùn tsi̍t-sî-á, koh bîn tsi̍t-sî-á, koh theⁿ tsi̍t-sî-á;
English: A little sleep, a little slumber, A little folding of the hands to sleep:

Tailo: Tsiah-ê kiáⁿ bīn-phuê kāu, sim ngē. Guá tshe lí khì in hia, lí tio̍h tuì in kóng: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng.
English: The children are impudent and stiff-hearted: I am sending you to them; and you shall tell them, Thus says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t tiâu miâ kiò-tsò Pi-sióng, to̍h-sī se̍h-lâu tī Ha-bí-la̍h tsuân tē ê, tī hia ū tshut kim.
English: The name of the first is Pishon: this is the one which flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, ông só͘-ū ê tì-huī lâng lóng ji̍p-.lâi; tsóng-.sī, in bē-hiáu tha̍k hit-ê bûn-jī, mā bē-hiáu kái-bîng hō͘ ông tsai.
English: Then came in all the king's wise men; but they could not read the writing, nor make known to the king the interpretation.

Tailo: Lí kám sī thâu tsi̍t-ê tshut-sì ê lâng? Á-sī pí tsiah-ê suaⁿ khah tāi-sing siū tsō?
English: Are you the first man who was born? Or were you brought forth before the hills?

Tailo: Lín sī tsū-iû ê lâng, m̄-thang īng tsū-iû lâi jia-khàm siâ-ok, tio̍h tsò Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: as free, and not using your freedom for a cloak of wickedness, but as bondservants of God.

Tailo: Guá tsai-iáⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kuè pi-tsiān ê sing-ua̍h, mā tsai-iáⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kuè hù-jū ê sing-ua̍h. Bô-lūn sī pá á-.sī iau, sī hù-jū á-.sī khiàm-khueh, guá ê pì-kuat to̍h-sī ta̍k hāng ti tsiok.
English: I know how to be humbled, and I know also how to abound. In everything and in all things I have learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in need.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t lia̍h i ê bé-ping tsi̍t-tshing tshit-pah kah pō͘-ping nn̄g bān, Ta-bi̍t kā tsiàn-tshia ê bé kuah-tn̄g i ê kha-kin, tsí ū lâu tsi̍t pah tâi tshia ê bé.
English: David took from him one thousand seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for one hundred chariots.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū huân-ló, kî-si̍t tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ū hí-lo̍k; suî-jiân sàn-tshiah, kî-si̍t hō͘ tsin tsē lâng hó-gia̍h; kah-ná bô puàⁿ-hāng, kî-si̍t ta̍k hāng lóng ū.
English: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.

Tailo: Nó͘-ah gō͘ pah huè ê sî, seⁿ Sé-mh, Hâm, Iá-hia̍t.
English: Noah was five hundred years old, and Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Tailo: Tō í-king tī sè-kan, sè-kan thong-kuè tō lâi tshòng-tsō, m̄-koh, sè-kan m̄-bat tsit-ê tō.
English: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn't recognize him.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm kóng, Guá beh tsiù-tsuā.
English: Abraham said, I will swear.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, I-su-la-el lâng tī ing-kai hiàn ê mi̍h ū huān tsuē; in-uī Iô-tah ê tsi-tso̍k tiong, Tsa-la̍h ê kan-á-sun, Tsap-tí ê sun, Kal-mih ê kiáⁿ A-kan the̍h ing-kai hiàn ê mi̍h; Siōng-tsú tsiū siū-khì I-su-la-el lâng.
English: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the devoted thing; for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the devoted thing: and the anger of Yahweh was kindled against the children of Israel.

Tailo: Guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ thè lín kám-siā guá ê Siōng-tè, in-uī Siōng-tè ê un-tián ū thong-kuè I-é-su Ki-tok siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín.
English: I always thank my God concerning you, for the grace of God which was given you in Christ Jesus;

Tailo: Siōng-tè ū tsín-kiù gī lâng Ló-toh, in-uī i tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ uī-tio̍h siâ-ok îm-luān ê lâng lâi tshim-tshim iu-būn.
English: and delivered righteous Lot, who was very distressed by the lustful life of the wicked

Tailo: Tio̍h tsò phûn, lâi siu i ê hué-hu, koh tsò i ê thuh-á, i ê puânn, i ê tshe, i ê hué-tiáⁿ, i só͘-ū ê khì-kū lóng tio̍h īng tâng tsò.
English: You shall make its pots to take away its ashes, its shovels, its basins, its flesh hooks, and its fire pans: all its vessels you shall make of brass.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng hō͘ sìn guá ê lâng tiong-kan bî-sè ê tsi̍t-ê lâng huān tsuē, i lîng-khó hō͘ lâng īng tuā tsio̍h-bō pa̍k tuà ām-kún, kā i thiām lo̍h-khì tshim hái.
English: but whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him that a huge millstone should be hung around his neck, and that he should be sunk in the depths of the sea.

Tailo: Tê-mē-tu-lí-oh kā hiah-ê sai-hū kah só͘-ū ê tông-gia̍p tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi, kā in kóng, Kok-uī, lín tsai lán sī uá-khò tsit-ê tshiú-gē teh thàn tsîⁿ.
English: whom he gathered together, with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, you know that by this business we have our wealth.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kì-jiân tshing Ki-tok tsò Tsú, Ki-tok ná ē tsò Ta-bi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun?
English: David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?

Tailo: Lán nā kóng ka-kī bô tsuē, sī teh khi-phiàn ka-kī, lán ê sim-lāi tsiū bô tsin-lí.
English: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng nā tsai tsha̍t-á tang-sî ē lâi, i tsiū ē tiuⁿ-tî, it-tīng bē hō͘ tsha̍t-á ji̍p-lâi i ê tshù, tse sī lín tsai-iáⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into.

Tailo: A-tsa-lí-ah seⁿ Se-la-iah, Se-la-iah seⁿ Io-tsa-tak;
English: and Azariah became the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak;

Tailo: Só͘-í, tshiáⁿ lí phài uē-ping khì kò͘-siú hit-ê bōng kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, án-ne tsiah bē hō͘ I ê bûn-tô͘ lâi thau-the̍h I ê sin-si, jiân-āu kā tsìng lâng kóng, ' I tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h. ' Nā án-ne, tsit-ê āu-lâi ê khi-phiàn ē pí khí-thâu ê koh khah giâm-tiōng.
English: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, He is risen from the dead;' and the last deception will be worse than the first.

Tailo: Guān hit-ê kui tī Io-ap ê thâu-khak kah i ê lāu-pē tsuân ke, koh guān Io-ap ê ke huān-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng ê, thái-ko ê á-.sī uà khò kuái-á ê, hō͘ to thâi-sí ê, bô thang tsia̍h ê, íng-uán bô tn̄g.
English: let it fall on the head of Joab, and on all his father's house; and let there not fail from the house of Joab one who has an issue, or who is a leper, or who leans on a staff, or who falls by the sword, or who lacks bread.

Tailo: Tse sī uī-tio̍h I-su-la-el lâng kā in tī tshân-iá só͘ hiàn ê tsè, tuà kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kau hō͘ tsè-si, hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò siā-un ê tsè.
English: This is to the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they sacrifice in the open field, that they may bring them to Yahweh, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to the priest, and sacrifice them for sacrifices of peace offerings to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guán ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ, in-uī guán hō͘ lâng khuànn-khin, kiû Lí hō͘ in ê huí-pòng kui tī in ê thâu-khak, hō͘ in tī siū lia̍h ê tē tú-tio̍h tshiúⁿ-kiap.
English: Hear, our God; for we are despised: and turn back their reproach on their own head, and give them up for a spoil in a land of captivity;

Tailo: Siōng-tè īng I ê kuân-lîng pó-tsuân kiông-bíng ê lâng; suî-jiân i ê ua̍h-miā tsua̍t-bāng, iáu-koh ē koh khí-.lâi.
English: Yet God preserves the mighty by his power. He rises up who has no assurance of life.

Tailo: Lí ē seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî, bô thang tsò lí ê, in-uī in ē hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì.
English: You shall father sons and daughters, but they shall not be yours; for they shall go into captivity.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, lán tsai lán sī sio̍k tsin-lí ê lâng. Lán nā siū liông-sim tsik-pī, tī Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng lán ē-tàng an-ún tsū-tsāi.
English: And by this we know that we are of the truth, and persuade our hearts before him,

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì A-lông kah i ê kiáⁿ Ê-lī-a-tsal, I-tha-mal kóng, M̄-thang phah-suàⁿ thâu-mn̂g, mā m̄-thang thiah-li̍h saⁿ, bián-tit lín sí-bông, koh bián-tit Siōng-tsú tuì huē-tsiòng siū-khì; tsóng-.sī, lín ê hiann-tī I-su-la-el tsuân ke uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú só͘ huat-tshut ê hué lâi ai-khàu.
English: Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons, Don't let the hair of your heads go loose, neither tear your clothes; that you don't die, and that he not be angry with all the congregation: but let your brothers, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which Yahweh has kindled.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín khì tuā lō͘-kháu, kā só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tshiánn lâi hù hun-iàn. '
English: Go therefore to the intersections of the highways, and as many as you may find, invite to the marriage feast.'

Tailo: I īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò huâiⁿ-kông, uī-tio̍h huē-bō͘ tsit pîng ê pán tsò gō͘ ki,
English: He made bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tent,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù I-su-la-el lâng, kā in kóng, Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Kàu Guá pān lí ê ji̍t, lí ê sim kám iáu ē jím-siū? Lí ê tshiú kám iáu ē ū la̍t? Siōng-tsú kóng tsit-ê uē, tsiū beh tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with you? I, Yahweh, have spoken it, and will do it.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm tsiām-tsiām suá khì lâm pîng ê tē.
English: Abram traveled, going on still toward the South.

Tailo: Jiân-āu I-é-su tńg-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h in teh khùn, tsiū kā Piat-tò͘ kóng, Sí-mòng, lí teh khùn ò͘? Lí kám bē-tàng tshéⁿ-tshéⁿ kíng-síng tsi̍t-sî-á kú?
English: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn't you watch one hour?

Tailo: I í-tsîng tuì lí lóng bô lō͘-īng, taⁿ tuì lí kah guá lóng ū lō͘-īng.
English: who once was useless to you, but now is useful to you and to me.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê sù-tô͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h Sa-má-lī-a í-king tsiap-la̍p Siōng-tè ê tō-lí, tsiū tshe Piat-tò͘ kah Iô-há-neh khì in hia.
English: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them,

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h kā tsit-ê tiān tsí-sī I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, hō͘ in in-uī ka-kī ê tsuē-kò lâi kiàn-siàu; in mā tio̍h niû tiān ê kui-bô͘.
English: You, son of man, show the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities; and let them measure the pattern.

Tailo: In tsiū tī huē-bō͘ ê thâu-tsîng tng tshiùⁿ kua ê kang, it-ti̍t kàu Só͘-lô-móng tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm khí-tsō Siōng-tsú ê tiān, in tsiū tsiàu pan-lia̍t tng-tsit.
English: They ministered with song before the tent of the tent of meeting, until Solomon had built the house of Yahweh in Jerusalem: and they waited on their office according to their order.

Tailo: M̄-thang īng sîn-sìng ê mi̍h hiat hō͘ káu tsia̍h, khióng-kiaⁿ káu uē ua̍t kuè-lâi kā lín; mā m̄-thang īng lín ê tsin-tsu hiat tī ti ê bīn-tsîng, ti ē īng kha lâi thún-ta̍h.
English: Don't give that which is holy to the dogs, neither throw your pearls before the pigs, lest perhaps they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.

Tailo: Hit sî, Ta-bi̍t kóng, Tû-khì Lē-bī lâng í-guā, bô lâng thang kng Siōng-tè ê iok-kuī, in-uī Siōng-tsú kíng in lâi kng Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī, koh ho̍k-sāi I ti̍t-kàu íng-uán.
English: Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them has Yahweh chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister to him forever.

Tailo: I sǹg tsheⁿ-sîn ê sò͘-bo̍k, suî lia̍p kā i hō-miâ.
English: He counts the number of the stars. He calls them all by their names.

Tailo: Tuā siaⁿ huah, I-é-su, lāu-su, liân-bín guán!
English: They lifted up their voices, saying, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!

Tailo: A-ha-tsiah ê lāu-bú A-tha-lí-iah khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê kiáⁿ í-king sí, tsiū khí-lâi kā Iô-tah ê ông-tshin tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t.
English: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the seed royal of the house of Judah.

Tailo: Lí kám ē hō͘ i tiô-thiàu tshin-tshiūnn tsháu-me̍h? I tián-ui phǹg-phǹg háu tsin thang kiaⁿ.
English: Have you made him to leap as a locust? The glory of his snorting is awesome.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè kā hit-ê lâng hē tī E-tiân hn̂g, lâi tsìng-tsoh kah kò͘-siú.
English: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsa-po͘ lâng tsiū bô tsuē, tsa-bó͘ lâng tio̍h tam-tng ka-kī ê tsuē.
English: The man shall be free from iniquity, and that woman shall bear her iniquity.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia tuì Siōng-tsú kî-tó kóng,
English: Hezekiah prayed to Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: In-uī kok-tō͘ sī sio̍k tī Siōng-tsú; I sī bān-kok ê Tsú-tsáiⁿ.
English: For the kingdom is Yahweh's. He is the ruler over the nations.

Tailo: I ê tsè-si uai-khiok Guá ê lu̍t-huat, siat-to̍k Guá ê sìng-só͘, bô hun-pia̍t sìng ê kah tsho͘-sio̍k ê, mā bô hō͘ lâng hun-pia̍t tshing-khì ê kah bô tshing-khì ê, koh am ba̍k-tsiu m̄-khuàⁿ Guá tsiah-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, Guá mā tī in tiong-kan siū siat-to̍k.
English: Her priests have done violence to my law, and have profaned my holy things: they have made no distinction between the holy and the common, neither have they caused men to discern between the unclean and the clean, and have hid their eyes from my Sabbaths, and I am profaned among them.

Tailo: Lán nā kóng lán kah Siōng-tè ū thuân-khè ê kuan-hē, m̄-koh, iáu kè-sio̍k tī o͘-àm tiong sing-ua̍h, án-ne sī teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t, bô tsiàu tsin-lí teh kiâⁿ.
English: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the darkness, we lie, and don't tell the truth.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tio̍h tsò hó sū, m̄-thang siūⁿ siān.
English: But you, brothers, don't be weary in doing well.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tshut-guā tī Ai-gi̍p, tsóng-kiōng sì-pah saⁿ tsa̍p nî.
English: Now the time that the children of Israel lived in Egypt was four hundred thirty years.

Tailo: Uī tsheⁿ-hūn lâng tam-pó, tio̍h the̍h hit lâng ê saⁿ lâi tí-ah; thè guā-lâng tsò pó-tsìng, tio̍h ka-kī tam-tng tsik-jīm.
English: Take the garment of one who puts up collateral for a stranger; And hold him in pledge for a wayward woman.

Tailo: Tsiàu lu̍t-huat lâi kóng, ta̍k hāng mi̍h tsha-put-to lóng sī īng hueh hō͘ i tshing-khì, nā bô lâu hueh, tsiū bô sià tsuē.
English: According to the law, nearly everything is cleansed with blood, and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission.

Tailo: Lī-khui bîng-lí ê lō͘ ê lâng, ē tuà tī im-hûn ê tiong-kan.
English: The man who wanders out of the way of understanding Shall rest in the assembly of the dead.

Tailo: Guān in ê iàn-si̍k tī in ê bīn-tsîng piàn-tsò lô-bāng, tī in pîng-an ê sî piàn-tsò hām-tséⁿ.
English: Let their table before them become a snare. May it become a retribution and a trap.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, Tsú ē tû-khì in suí ê kha-khuân, thâu-mn̂g bāng, gue̍h-tsiam,
English: In that day the Lord will take away the beauty of their anklets, the headbands, the crescent necklaces,

Tailo: Tse-bú-lông mā bô kā Ki-lûn kah Na-ha-lal ê jîn-bîn kuáⁿ tshut-.khì. Ka-nân lâng tsiū iû-guân tuà tī in tiong-kan, lâi tsò khó͘-kang.
English: Zebulun didn't drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Nahalol; but the Canaanites lived among them, and became subject to forced labor.

Tailo: Ê-no͘k la̍k-tsa̍p-gō͘ huè, seⁿ Me-thu-se-la̍h.
English: Enoch lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Methuselah.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Tshin-tshiūnn bo̍k-tsiá tuì sai ê tshuì, tshiúⁿ-tshut nn̄g ki kha á-.sī puàⁿ tè hīnn-á, án-ne, tuà tī Sa-má-lī-a ê I-su-la-el lâng, theⁿ tī bîn-tshn̂g kak á-.sī tshu siù-hue thán ê bîn-tshn̂g ê, in ê tit-tio̍h kiù mā tsí-put-kò sī án-ne.
English: Thus says Yahweh: As the shepherd rescues out of the mouth of the lion two legs, Or a piece of an ear, So shall the children of Israel be rescued who sit in Samaria on the corner of a couch, And on the silken cushions of a bed.

Tailo: I-é-su khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê lâng teh iu-būn tsiū kóng, Hó-gia̍h lâng beh ji̍p-khì Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ tsin khùn-lān!
English: Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said, How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

Tailo: In-uī I-su-la-el bē kì-tit tshòng-tsō in ê Tsú, khí king-biō; Iô-tah ke khí kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, Guá beh kàng hué tī i ê siâⁿ, sio in ê iâⁿ-pâng.
English: For Israel has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; And Judah has multiplied fortified cities; But I will send a fire on his cities, And it will devour its fortresses.

Tailo: Lū-biān lâng Si-siak ê kiáⁿ A-tē-ná（ i sī Lū-biān tsi-tso̍k tiong ê tsi̍t-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tshuā saⁿ-tsa̍p lâng ）,
English: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,

Tailo: In tńg-lâi kā i huê-hok, E-hú tsiū kóng, Tse to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú thok I ê lô͘-po̍k Thi-si-bih lâng E-li-iah só͘ kóng ê uē, kóng, ' Tī E-tsu-le-el ê hn̂g, káu ē tsia̍h I-é-tse-bel ê bah,
English: Therefore they came back, and told him. He said, This is the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by his servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying, In the portion of Jezreel shall the dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel;

Tailo: Tsiàu Siōng-tè thong-kuè kó͘-tsá sìng sian-ti ê tshuì só͘ suan-pò͘ ê, I it-tīng tio̍h tiàm tī thinn-tíng, it-ti̍t kàu bān-mi̍h uāⁿ sin ê sî-kî.
English: whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.

Tailo: In mā bô kóng: Hit-ê tshuā lán tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê Siōng-tsú tī tó-uī? I sī tshuā lán king-kuè khòng-iá, sua-bô͘ kah tshim kheⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, khòng-uāⁿ, sí-ìm ê tē, bô lâng king-kuè, bô lâng tuà ê kíng-kài.
English: Neither said they, Where is Yahweh who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought and of the shadow of death, through a land that none passed through, and where no man lived?

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng lîm-kàu guán, guán bô bē kì-tit Lí, mā bô ké-iáⁿ siú Lí ê iok.
English: All this has come on us, Yet have we not forgotten you, Neither have we been false to your covenant.

Tailo: I huí-huāi guá ê phû-tô tshiū, pak guá ê bû-hua-kó tshiū, hō͘ i kng liu-liu lâi kā i khì-sak, i ê ki piàn pe̍h-sik.
English: He has laid my vine waste, And stripped my fig tree. He has stripped its bark, and thrown it away. Its branches are made white.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, í-king ū hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-lâi sio sí í-tsîng nn̄g-ê pâi-tiúⁿ kah in ta̍k-ê gō͘-tsa̍p lâng; taⁿ kiû lí khuàⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā tsò pó-puè!
English: Behold, fire came down from the sky, and consumed the two former captains of fifty with their fifties; but now let my life be precious in your sight.

Tailo: Hit tong-sî, guá bô tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm; in-uī Ba-bú-lông ông Al-ta-siá-su-ta saⁿ-tsa̍p jī nî, guá uat-khì ông hia. Kuè kuí-nā ji̍t, guá tuì ông tshíng-kà.
English: But in all this time I was not at Jerusalem; for in the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon I went to the king: and after certain days asked I leave of the king,

Tailo: In-uī tse sī tuā pháiⁿ, sī sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ ing-kai pān ê tsuē;
English: For that would be a heinous crime; Yes, it would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges:

Tailo: Lín nā sio-thiànn, tsìng lâng ē tsiū án-ne lâi tsai lín sī guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng ē siū-tio̍h íng-uán ê hîng-hua̍t; m̄-koh, gī lâng ē tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.

Tailo: Kah án-ne kāng-khuán, lín tiong-kan bô-lūn siáⁿ lâng, nā bô pàng-sak ka-kī ê it-tshè, tsiū bē-tàng tsò guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: So therefore whoever of you who doesn't renounce all that he has, he can't be my disciple.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì i kóng, M̄-thang kā i tsó͘-tòng, in-uī bô huán-tuì lín ê to̍h-sī uī lín ê.
English: Jesus said to him, Don't forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k sio̍k-lîng ê lâng ē-tàng phuàⁿ-tuàn bān-hāng sū, i ka-kī pún-sin ê tāi-tsì mā bô lâng ē-tàng kā i phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: But he who is spiritual discerns all things, and he himself is judged by no one.

Tailo: Siōng-tè koh kā i kóng, Lí ê miâ sī Iâ-kop, taⁿ í-āu lí ê miâ bô koh kiò Iâ-kop, beh kiò-tsò I-su-la-el. I tsiū kiò i ê miâ I-su-la-el.
English: God said to him, Your name is Jacob. Your name shall not be Jacob any more, but your name will be Israel. He named him Israel.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē Iô-tá-iah lâng in-uī La̍h-tsa-lō͘ sí-.khì, lâi an-uì Mal-tha kah Mâ-lí-ah.
English: Many of the Jews had joined the women around Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother.

Tailo: Tse sī tuì thiⁿ kàng-lo̍h ê piáⁿ, m̄-sī tshin-tshiūnn lín tsó͘-sian só͘ tsia̍h ê má-ná, in tsia̍h-liáu mā sī sí-.khì; tsia̍h guá tsit-ê piáⁿ ê lâng ē íng-uán ua̍h-.leh.
English: This is the bread which came down out of heavennot as our fathers ate the manna, and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.

Tailo: Lí tī tsin tsē kiàn-tsìng-jîn ê bīn-tsîng tuì guá só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h kau-thok hō͘ hiah-ê tiong-sìn koh ē kham-tit kà-sī pa̍t lâng ê lâng.
English: The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ji̍p-khì tuā tsûn ê, lóng sī ū kang ū bó ê jio̍k-thé, tú tsiàu Siōng-tè só͘ bīng-līng ê. Siōng-tsú tsiū kā in kuainn tī tuā tsûn lāi.
English: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; and Yahweh shut him in.

Tailo: Kel-sióng lâng tsiah-ê ke ê kang-tîng, só͘ tio̍h pān-lí, só͘ tio̍h kng ê, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê:
English: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens:

Tailo: Ta̍k khuán ê jio̍k-thé mā lóng bô kāng-khuán; jîn-luī ê jio̍k-thé tsi̍t-khuán, siù-luī ê jio̍k-thé tsi̍t-khuán, tsiáu-luī ê jio̍k-thé tsi̍t-khuán, hî-luī ê jio̍k-thé koh tsi̍t-khuán.
English: All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds.

Tailo: In ê tsòng-liân í-king sue-thè, in tshiú ê khuì-la̍t kah guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuan-hē?
English: Of what use is the strength of their hands to me, Men in whom ripe age has perished?

Tailo: Mô͘-se tú-á kóng suah tsiah-ê uē, in ē-bīn ê tē tsiū li̍h-.khui.
English: It happened, as he made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground split apart that was under them;

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsù-ì A-pit-gue̍h, lâi siú Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, in-uī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tī A-pit-gue̍h àm-sî tshuā lí tshut Ai-gi̍p.
English: Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to Yahweh your God; for in the month of Abib Yahweh your God brought you forth out of Egypt by night.

Tailo: I tuì hia tshut-.lâi, khì A-siul; tī hia khí-tsō Ni-ne-beh, Lí-hô-pik-i-ní, Ka-la̍h,
English: Out of that land he went forth into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,

Tailo: A-mô͘-lī lâng ê ông, to̍h-sī tuà tī He-si-bóng ê Si-hông, i só͘ kuán ê tē sī tuì Al-nông suaⁿ-kok piⁿ ê A-ló-el kah suaⁿ-kok tiong ê siâⁿ, í-ki̍p Gi-lia̍t ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ, it-ti̍t kàu Am-móng lâng ê kíng-kài, to̍h-sī Iá-bo̍k hô.
English: Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and ruled from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and half Gilead, even to the river Jabbok, the border of the children of Ammon;

Tailo: Αp-sa-lôm tsáu kàu Ge-siul, tī hia tuà sann nî.
English: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.

Tailo: Guá nā īng n̂g-kim tsò ǹg-bāng, tuì sûn-kim kóng: Lí sī guá ê uá-khò;
English: If I have made gold my hope, And have said to the fine gold, You are my confidence;'

Tailo: Sio̍k tsè-si ê ū Io-iá-lip ê kiáⁿ Ia-ta-iah kah Iá-kin.
English: Of the priests: Jedaiah the son of Joiarib, Jachin,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá beh hō͘ lâng tú-tio̍h kan-khó͘, hō͘ in tshin-tshiūnn tsheⁿ-mê-.ê teh kiâⁿ lō͘, in-uī in tik-tsuē Siōng-tsú. In ê hueh ē hông piàⁿ-tshut tshin-tshiūnn tîn-ai, in ê bah ē hông hiat-ka̍k tshin-tshiūnn pùn-sò.
English: I will bring distress on men, that they will walk like blind men, because they have sinned against Yahweh, and their blood will be poured out like dust, and their flesh like dung.

Tailo: Tuà kàu A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê hia, i tsiū tuì iù ê mī-hún tiong tshú tsi̍t pé tshut-.lâi kah tām-po̍h-á iû, í-ki̍p só͘-ū ê jú-hiuⁿ, tsè-si tsiū kā i sio tī tuâⁿ tíng tsò kì-liām, sī hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: He shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests; and he shall take his handful of its fine flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Uē kóng iáu-buē suah, Li-bé-kah king-kah-thâu phāinn tsuí-pân tshut-.lâi. I sī Be-thu-el seⁿ ê, Be-thu-el sī A-bu-la-hàm ê sió-tī Na-khool ê bó͘ Mil-kah ê kiáⁿ.
English: It happened, before he had finished speaking, that behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher on her shoulder.

Tailo: Só͘ tshe ê lâng lâi-kàu Sàu-lô ê Gi-be-at, kā tsiah-ê uē kóng hō͘ jîn-bîn thiaⁿ, jîn-bîn tsiū lóng khui siaⁿ háu.
English: Then came the messengers to Gibeah of Saul, and spoke these words in the ears of the people: and all the people lifted up their voice, and wept.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, tuà tī I-su-la-el hong-huì ê tē ê lâng teh kóng, ' A-bu-la-hàm to̍k-to̍k tsi̍t-ê lâng, ū tit-tio̍h tsit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p; lán lâng-gia̍h tsin tsē, tsit-ê tē sī hō͘ lán tsò sán-gia̍p ê. '
English: Son of man, they who inhabit those waste places in the land of Israel speak, saying, Abraham was one, and he inherited the land: but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Siōng-tè tiān lāi kim-gîn ê khì-kū, to̍h-sī Nep-kat-ne-tsal tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tiān lāi the̍h tshut-.lâi, tuà-lâi Ba-bú-lông ê tio̍h koh hîng i, tuà kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tiān, kok tsiàu guân uī hē tī Siōng-tè ê tiān.
English: Also let the gold and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought to Babylon, be restored, and brought again to the temple which is at Jerusalem, everyone to its place; and you shall put them in the house of God.

Tailo: Tsit tsa̍p-ê lâng lóng sī Ha-me-tá-tha ê sun, Iô-tah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k Ha-mán ê kiáⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, bô tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: the ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Jew's enemy, killed they; but they didn't lay their hand on the spoil.

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn ē tuà tī pîng-an ê the̍h, an-ún ê tshù, tshing-tsīng hioh-khùn ê só͘-tsāi.
English: My people will abide in a peaceful habitation, In safe dwellings, And in quiet resting places.

Tailo: Guá tsiū tuì guá ê a-tsik ê kiáⁿ Ha-ná-mel bé A-ná-thot hit khu tshân, tshìn hit-ê kè-tsînn hō͘ i, kiōng tsa̍p-tshit si-khel.
English: I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel my uncle's son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.

Tailo: Bíng lâng tshiúⁿ-khì ê, kám ē-tàng tshiúⁿ tò tńg-.lâi? Kiông ê lâng só͘ tshiúⁿ-lia̍h ê, kám ē-tàng kiù i?
English: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captives be delivered?

Tailo: I tsiū uī ka-kī tuì I-su-la-el tiong kíng saⁿ tshing lâng, nn̄g tshing lâng kin-tuè Sàu-lô tī Mik-mah kah Be-thel suaⁿ, tsi̍t tshing kin-tuè Io-ná-than tī Biān-iá-mín ê Gi-be-at; kî-tha ê lâng, i tshe in tńg-khì ta̍k lâng ê pò͘-pênn.
English: Saul chose him three thousand men of Israel, of which two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in the Mount of Bethel, and one thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.

Tailo: Lín í-king tuì tsuē tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò gī ê lô͘-lē.
English: Being made free from sin, you became bondservants of righteousness.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ i ū tuā hok-khì kàu tī íng-uán, koh hō͘ i tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng huann-hí khuài-lo̍k.
English: For you make him most blessed forever. You make him glad with joy in your presence.

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī i ê sian-ti ê tsuē-ok, i ê tsè-si ê kuè-sit; in tī siâⁿ lāi lâu lâng ê hueh.
English: It is because of the sins of her prophets, and the iniquities of her priests, That have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her.

Tailo: in-uī in sī tuì I-su-la-el tiong uân-tsuân kui guá ê, guá kíng-suán in lâi sio̍k tī guá, lâi thè it-tshè thâu-the ê, to̍h-sī I-su-la-el lâng ê thâu-tsiūⁿ ê.
English: For they are wholly given to me from among the children of Israel; instead of all who open the womb, even the firstborn of all the children of Israel, I have taken them to me.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, ū lâng tī A-só-to͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Hui-li̍p-pò͘, i iân-lō͘ tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ-tshī thuân hok-im, it-ti̍t kàu Kai-sa-lī-a.
English: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

Tailo: （ A-sah ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; īng Gat ê tiāu. ）Siōng-tè sī lán ê khuì-la̍t, lín tio̍h tuā-siaⁿ o-ló I, tio̍h tshut huann-hí ê siann, o-ló Iâ-kop ê Siōng-tè!
English: Sing aloud to God, our strength! Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob!

Tailo: Ki-tok kì-jiân tī jio̍k-thé siū khó͘, lín mā tio̍h īng tsit khuán ê sim-tsì lâi tsong-pī ka-kī; in-uī jio̍k-thé siū khó͘ to̍h-sī kah tsuē-ok tuān-tsua̍t kuan-hē.
English: Forasmuch then as Christ suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same mind; for he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin;

Tailo: Lín kin-á-ji̍t khí-lâi kong-kik guá lāu-pē ê ke, tī tsi̍t tè tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng thâi-sí i ê kiáⁿ tshit tsa̍p lâng, koh siat-li̍p i ê lú-pī ê kiáⁿ A-mí-me-li̍k tsò Sī-khiàm lâng ê ông, in-uī i sī lín ê hiann-tī.
English: and you are risen up against my father's house this day, and have slain his sons, seventy persons, on one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his female servant, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother);

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Nā-sī tuì gō͘ huè kàu jī-tsa̍p huè, tsa-po͘ ê lí tio̍h kā i kó͘ ê kè jī-tsa̍p si-khel, tsa-bó͘ lâng kó͘ tsa̍p si-khel.
English: If the person is from five years old even to twenty years old, then your valuation shall be for a male twenty shekels, and for a female ten shekels.

Tailo: Tshit gue̍h tshe-it, lín tio̍h ū sìng-huē, lóng m̄-thang tsò lô-tōng ê kang; tse sī lín pûn sàu-kak ê ji̍t.
English: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing of trumpets to you.

Tailo: I mā bô pàng-sak i tī Ai-gi̍p si̍p-kuàn kiânn ê îm-luān, in-uī i iáu siàu-liân ê sî, tsiū ū lâng kah i tsò-hué khùn, lia̍p i tsāi-sik-lí ê ling, koh lâu tshut i îm-luān ê tāi-tsì tī hia.
English: Neither has she left her prostitution since the days of Egypt; for in her youth they lay with her, and they handled the bosom of her virginity; and they poured out their prostitution on her.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Io-ap án-ne tsò, sī beh hō͘ tsit-ê tāi-tsì se̍h tńg uan; guá ê tsú ū tì-huī, tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tsú sù-tsiá ê tì-huī, ē bîng-tshat sè-tsiūⁿ it-tshè ê tāi-tsì.
English: to change the face of the matter has your servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are in the earth.

Tailo: I só͘ huān it-tshè ê tsuē-kò bô koh kā i ē kì-tit, tī i só͘ kiâⁿ ê gī, i ē ua̍h lo̍h-.khì.
English: None of his transgressions that he has committed shall be remembered against him: in his righteousness that he has done he shall live.

Tailo: Hit só͘-tsāi ê thâu-lâng Hi-bī lâng Ha-mool ê kiáⁿ Sī-khiàm khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, tsiū kā i khiú-lâi tsò-hué khùn, kā i lîng-jio̍k.
English: Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her. He took her, lay with her, and humbled her.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, jîn-bîn tuì Ha-tse-lot tshut-huat, tī Pa-lân ê khòng-iá tsat iâⁿ.
English: Afterward the people traveled from Hazeroth, and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.

Tailo: In-uī Só͘-lô-móng kiû tse, Tsú huann-hí i ê uē.
English: The speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.

Tailo: Lí ji̍p-.lāi ē siū tsiù-tsó͘, tshut-.khì mā ē siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed shall you be when you come in, and cursed shall you be when you go out.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kah guá kiat-liân, guá mā kah lín kiat-liân. Tú tshin-tshiūnn ki bô liân tī phû-tô tshiū, ka-kī bē kiat kué-tsí, lín nā bô kah guá kiat-liân, mā sī ē án-ne.
English: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can't bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tuì gû-kûn á-.sī iûⁿ-kûn tiong, kā siā-un-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, uī-tio̍h beh siā ti̍k-pia̍t hē ê guān, á-.sī tsò kam-sim hiàn ê, só͘ hiàn ê tio̍h sûn-tsuân, bô khuat-tiám, tsiah ē tit-tio̍h tsiap-la̍p.
English: Whoever offers a sacrifice of peace offerings to Yahweh to accomplish a vow, or for a freewill offering, of the herd or of the flock, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.

Tailo: Guá tuì ông kóng, Ông nā huann-hí, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tī lí ê bīn-tsîng nā tit-tio̍h un-tián, tsiū kiû lí tshe guá khì Iô-tah, kàu guá ê tsó͘-sian hûn-bōng hit-ê siâⁿ, guá thang koh khí hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: I said to the king, If it please the king, and if your servant have found favor in your sight, that you would send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers' tombs, that I may build it.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, uī-tio̍h mài hō͘ tsit-ê tāi-tsì tī bîn-kan ná thuân ná khuah, lán tio̍h kā in kíng-kò, it-tīng m̄-thang koh hōng I-é-su ê miâ lâi thuân-káng tō-lí.
English: But so that this spreads no further among the people, let's threaten them, that from now on they don't speak to anyone in this name.

Tailo: Iô-tah koh tsing-ho̍k Ga-jah kah i ê kíng-kài, A-si̍t-kî-lûn kah i ê kíng-kài, Ik-lóng kah i ê kíng-kài.
English: Also Judah took Gaza with the border of it, and Ashkelon with the border of it, and Ekron with the border of it.

Tailo: Sī in-uī Tse-ti-kiah ông kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsìng lâng li̍p-iok, kā in suan-pò͘ tháu-pàng ê siau-sit, to̍h-sī ta̍k lâng tio̍h tháu-pàng i ê lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī, só͘-ū Hi-bú-lâi ê lâm-lí, hō͘ in tsū-iû, bô lâng thang koh īng i ê hiann-tī — Iô-tah lâng tsò lô͘-po̍k.
English: that every man should let his male servant, and every man his female servant, who is a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, go free; that none should make bondservants of them, to wit, of a Jew his brother.

Tailo: A-la̍h-bí-li̍k, A-bua̍t, BÍ-sa-li̍k, ǹg sai pîng kàu Kal-mel, koh kàu Hi-hat-li̍p-la̍p,
English: and Allammelech, and Amad, and Mishal; and it reached to Carmel westward, and to Shihorlibnath;

Tailo: Ba-al ê kiáⁿ Be-lah, tsit-ê Be-lah tsò Lū-biān tsi-tso̍k ê siú-líng, hō͘ A-siul ông Thi-gú-la̍t-pi-lé-sel lia̍h-.khì.
English: Beerah his son, whom Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.

Tailo: Ông kah tuè i ê lâng lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm beh kong-kik tuà tī hit só͘-tsāi ê I-é-bú-suh lâng. In tuì Ta-bi̍t kóng, Lí nā bô tû tsiah-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kah pái-kha-.ê, tsiū bē-tàng ji̍p-lâi tsit só͘-tsāi. In siūⁿ kóng Ta-bi̍t tsua̍t-tuì bē ji̍p-lâi tsia.
English: The king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, who spoke to David, saying, Except you take away the blind and the lame, you shall not come in here; thinking, David can't come in here.

Tailo: Mn̂g-kháu khuah tsa̍p tiú. Mn̂g ê siang pîng piⁿ, tsit pîng gō͘ tiú, hit pîng gō͘ tiú. I niû i ê tn̂g sì-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The breadth of the entrance was ten cubits; and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length of it, forty cubits, and the breadth, twenty cubits.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsia̍h bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ tshit ji̍t, kàu tē-tshit ji̍t to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú ê tseh.
English: Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guān Lí ê miâ íng-uán kian-kò͘, siū tsun tsò tuā, kóng, ' Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú sī I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, sī tsò I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè. ' Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê ke ē tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng kian-kò͘.
English: Let your name be established and magnified forever, saying, Yahweh of Armies is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and the house of David your servant is established before you.

Tailo: Tsa-kha-lī-a khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, hui-siông put-an.
English: Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī lín tsū-huē ê sî, guá ê sim-sîn kah lín tsò-hué, khò lán ê Tsú I-é-su ê kuân-lîng,
English: In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, you being gathered together, and my spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,

Tailo: Siàu-liân lâng kng tsio̍h-bō, gín-á taⁿ tshâ, tì-sú pua̍h-tó.
English: The young men bare the mill; The children stumbled under the wood.

Tailo: Tī pîng-guân ū E-si-ta-ol, Tso-lah, A-si̍t-ná,
English: In the lowland, Eshtaol, and Zorah, and Ashnah,

Tailo: In-uī Guá sī tshuā lín tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê Siōng-tsú, beh tsò lín ê Siōng-tè, só͘-í, lín tio̍h sìng-kiat, in-uī Guá sī sìng-kiat ê.
English: For I am Yahweh who brought you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. You shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.

Tailo: Ê-lám tuà tsìⁿ tē, koh ū tsài ping-á ê tshia kah bé-ping. Ki-l mā the̍h-tshut tîn-pâi.
English: Elam carried his quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen; and Kir uncovered the shield.

Tailo: In-uī tsè-si ê tshuì-tûn tio̍h tsûn tì-sik, lâng tio̍h tuì i ê tshuì tshíng-kàu lu̍t-huat, in-uī i sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá.
English: For the priest's lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek the law at his mouth; for he is the messenger of Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Sai-pîng ê kài to̍h-sī tuā hái, tuì lâm pîng ê kíng-kài, it-ti̍t kàu Ha-mat tshut-ji̍p tuì-bīn ê só͘-tsāi. Tse to̍h-sī sai pîng ê kài.
English: The west side shall be the great sea, from the south border as far as over against the entrance of Hamath. This is the west side.

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: in-uī tuì Siōng-tè lâi ê tsai-hō hō͘ guá kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, in-uī I ê ui-giâm, guá tng bē-khí.
English: For calamity from God is a terror to me, By reason of his majesty I can do nothing.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, in tsá-tsá khí-.lâi, tshut-khì The-ko-uah ê khòng-iá. Tshut-khì ê sî, Iô-sa-huat khiā-teh kóng, Iô-tah lâng kah tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h thiaⁿ guá kóng, lín tio̍h sìn Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, tsiū khiā ē tsāi, sìn I ê sian-ti tsiū ē hing-thong.
English: They rose early in the morning, and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear me, Judah, and you inhabitants of Jerusalem: believe in Yahweh your God, so shall you be established; believe his prophets, so shall you prosper.

Tailo: nā guá pò͘-pêⁿ lāi ê lâng bô kóng: Siáⁿ lâng ē tshuē-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê bô tsia̍h Siōng-tè ê hó mi̍h kàu pá ê?
English: If the men of my tent have not said, Who can find one who has not been filled with his meat?'

Tailo: Guá tsiū tuì Ki-tí-bo̍k ê khòng-iá, tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ He-si-bóng ông Si-hông, īng hô-pîng ê uē kóng,
English: I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, kiàn-nā khiân-sîng ê lâng, tī thang tshuē-tio̍h Lí ê sî, tio̍h tuì Lí kî-tó. Tuā tsuí huàn-lām ê sî, it-tīng bē kàu i hia.
English: For this, let everyone who is godly pray to you in a time when you may be found. Surely when the great waters overflow, they shall not reach to him.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: In-uī mê-ji̍t Lí ê tshiú tāng-tāng tshi̍h guá; guá ê tsing-tsuí piàn kah tshin-tshiūnn jua̍h-thinn ê ta-sò. [Sè-la̍h]
English: For day and night your hand was heavy on me. My strength was sapped in the heat of summer. Selah.

Tailo: Páu-lô uī ka-kī piān-hō͘ kóng, Guá tuì Iô-tá-iah lâng ê lu̍t-huat kah sìng-tiān, á-.sī tuì Lô-má hông-tè, lóng m̄-bat huān-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h tsuē.
English: while he said in his defense, Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tshuā i ê lāu-pē Iâ-kop ji̍p-khì khiā tī Huâ-láu ê bīn-tsîng, Iâ-kop tsiū kā Huâ-láu tsiok-hok.
English: Joseph brought in Jacob, his father, and set him before Pharaoh, and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ti̍t-ti̍t khah kiông-tuā khí-.lâi, in-uī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kah i tông-tsāi.
English: David grew greater and greater; for Yahweh of Armies was with him.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h guán, Siōng-tsú sī guán ê Siōng-tè, guán bô khì-sak I. Guán ū tsè-si ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun, koh ū Lē-bī lâng ta̍k-ê teh tsīn i ê tsit-hūn.
English: But as for us, Yahweh is our God, and we have not forsaken him; and we have priests ministering to Yahweh, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites in their work:

Tailo: Guá sī tsin ê phû-tô tshiū, guá ê Thiⁿ-pē sī tsai phû-tô ê lâng.
English: I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.

Tailo: Lâng tàng-sng koh siūⁿ beh huat huâiⁿ-tsâi, siūnn bē kàu sàn-tshiah ē lîm-kàu i.
English: A stingy man hurries after riches, And doesn't know that poverty waits for him.

Tailo: thiⁿ tshâ hō͘ hué tsin iām, kā bah kûn nuā, kā thng ngâu khó, hō͘ kut-hu hu-.khì;
English: Heap on the wood, make the fire hot, boil well the flesh, and make thick the broth, and let the bones be burned.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá kóng, ' Lí lâu tsin tsē lâng ê hueh, tuā-tuā kau-tsiàn, lí bē-tàng uī Guá ê miâ khí tiān, in-uī lí tī Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng hō͘ tsin tsē lâng ê hueh lâu tī tē-.ni̍h.
English: But the word of Yahweh came to me, saying, You have shed blood abundantly, and have made great wars: you shall not build a house to my name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.

Tailo: Tē-sann tiâu miâ kiò-tsò Ti-gu-lí-su, to̍h-sī lâu tī A-siul ê tang pîng ê. Tē-sì tiâu to̍h-sī Iu-hu-la-té.
English: The name of the third river is Hiddekel: this is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

Tailo: Tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p lín tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k ê tiúⁿ-ló kah kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ lóng lâi, guá beh kóng tsiah-ê uē hō͘ in thiaⁿ, mā beh kiò thiⁿ kiò tē hō͘ in tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to witness against them.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tsò sìng-só͘ ê kang tsiah-ê ū tì-huī ê lâng, lóng tsiām-thîng in só͘ tsò ê kang,
English: All the wise men, who performed all the work of the sanctuary, each came from his work which they did.

Tailo: Kā îng-kng hō͘ gû-gōng ê lâng, tú tshin-tshiūnn kā tsi̍t pò͘-tē ê pó-tsio̍h khǹg tī tsio̍h-tui lāi-bīn.
English: As one who binds a stone in a sling, So is he who gives honor to a fool.

Tailo: E-sáu thiaⁿ-tio̍h lāu-pē ê uē, khui-siaⁿ kiò-khó͘ tuā khàu, tuì i ê lāu-pē kóng, Guá ê a-pa, guá, lí mā tio̍h kā guá tsiok-hok.
English: When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said to his father, Bless me, even me also, my father.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h phah-bia̍t lí ê tsú-lâng A-hap ê ke, hō͘ Guá thang pò-ìng Guá ê lô͘-po̍k tsiah-ê sian-ti ê hueh, í-ki̍p Siōng-tsú tsìng lô͘-po̍k ê hueh, to̍h-sī tī I-é-tse-bel ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê.
English: You shall strike the house of Ahab your master, that I may avenge the blood of my servants the prophets, and the blood of all the servants of Yahweh, at the hand of Jezebel.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá kóng, Siōng-tè ah, Lí khuànn, guá lâi sī beh tsiàu Lí ê tsí-ì lâi si̍t-hiān. Kuan-hē guá ê tāi-tsì ū kì-tsài tī tsheh-.ni̍h. (tsù, SPh 40:6-8)
English: Then I said, Behold, I have come (In the scroll of the book it is written of me) To do your will, God.'

Tailo: Tsing-seⁿ nā tuì kò͘-siú ê lâng hia hō͘ lâng thau lia̍h-.khì, i tsiū tio̍h puê guân tsú-lâng.
English: But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner of it.

Tailo: Phû-tô-tshiū ìn kóng, ' Guá kám thang pàng-sak guá ê sin tsiú, to̍h-sī hō͘ Siōng-tsú kah lâng huann-hí ê, khì tī tsìng tshiū ê tíng-bīn iô? '
English: The vine said to them, Should I leave my new wine, which cheers God and man, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?

Tailo: Lín só͘ thang tsia̍h ê tsing-seⁿ, i nā ka-kī sí-.khì, ū lâng bong-tio̍h i ê si-thé, i it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng sî.
English: If any animal, of which you may eat, dies; he who touches its carcass shall be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tī I-su-la-el tsi-tso̍k tiong tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tio̍h tsò i ê lāu-pē tâng-tsong tsi-tso̍k ê lâng ê bó͘, thang hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng ê tsi-tso̍k ta̍k-ê tsip-siú in ê tsó͘-sian ê sán-gia̍p.
English: Every daughter, who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel, shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may possess every man the inheritance of his fathers.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h kā in kóng, ' Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Guá beh hō͘ tsit-ê sio̍k-gí suah-.khì. I-su-la-el tiong bô koh īng tsit-ê tsò sio̍k-gí. ' Tsóng-.sī, lí tio̍h kā in kóng, ' Sî-ji̍t kīn à, ta̍k-ê ī-siōng ê ìng-giām mā sī án-ne. '
English: Tell them therefore, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: I will make this proverb to cease, and they shall no more use it as a proverb in Israel; but tell them, The days are at hand, and the fulfillment of every vision.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guān lín tiong-kan ū lâng ē khì kuainn tiān mn̂g, bián-tit lín pe̍h-pe̍h tī Guá ê tuâⁿ khí hué. Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá bô huann-hí lín, mā bô beh tuì lín ê tshiú tsiap-la̍p lé-mi̍h.
English: Oh that there were one among you who would shut the doors, that you might not kindle fire on my altar in vain! I have no pleasure in you, says Yahweh of Armies, neither will I accept an offering at your hand.

Tailo: koh tī Iô-tah ta̍k-ê siâⁿ tû-khì hiah-ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ kah ji̍t-thâu siōng, kok tī i ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h thài-pîng.
English: Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the sun images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.

Tailo: Guá ê ke tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng m̄-sī án-ne; iáu-koh I ū kah guá li̍p íng-uán ê iok. Bô m̄-sī tsiàu tshù-sū pâi-lia̍t koh kian-kò͘, suî-jiân I bô hō͘ i sing-tióng, tse to̍h-sī guá it-tshè ê tsín-kiù, it-tshè ê ì-guān.
English: Most assuredly my house is not so with God; Yet he has made with me an everlasting covenant, Ordered in all things, and sure: For it is all my salvation, and all my desire, Although he doesn't make it grow.

Tailo: Tshiánn thè guá kā tī Tsú lāi guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê Am-phu-li-à-toh tshíng-an.
English: Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

Tailo: Kel-sióng ê kiáⁿ Lip-nî, Lip-nî ê kiáⁿ Ia-hat, Ia-hat ê kiáⁿ Tsim-mah;
English: Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

Tailo: E-hú pān A-hap ke ê tsuē ê sî, tú-tio̍h Iô-tah hiah-ê siú-líng kah A-ha-tsiah hiann-tī ê kiáⁿ teh ho̍k-sāi A-ha-tsiah ê, i tsiū kā in thâi-sí.
English: It happened, when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, that he found the princes of Judah, and the sons of the brothers of Ahaziah, ministering to Ahaziah, and killed them.

Tailo: Iok-kuī an-siat liáu-āu, Ta-bi̍t só͘ phài ê lâng tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān lāi kuán-lí tshiùⁿ kua ê tāi-tsì to̍h-sī tsiah-ê.
English: These are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of Yahweh, after that the ark had rest.

Tailo: Lí ná ē tsáu tang tsáu sai, siūⁿ beh kái-uāⁿ lí ê lō͘? Lí ē in-uī Ai-gi̍p lâi kiàn-siàu, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng in-uī A-siul lâi kiàn-siàu án-ne.
English: Why go you about so much to change your way? you shall be ashamed of Egypt also, as you were ashamed of Assyria.

Tailo: Lí thiaⁿ! Ū tsin tsē jîn-bîn ê siann, in huā-huā háu, tshin-tshiūnn hái-íng teh huā-huā háu. Ū lia̍t kok ê sù-tsiá, in tsáu-tsông tshin-tshiūnn tuā-tsuí teh tsáu-tsông.
English: Ah, the uproar of many peoples, who roar like the roaring of the seas; and the rushing of nations, that rush like the rushing of mighty waters!

Tailo: A-sah ê kiáⁿ Iô-sa-huat suà-tsiap i tsò ông, ka-kī kiông-sīng, tí-ti̍k I-su-la-el.
English: Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and strengthened himself against Israel.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn phah-la̍h ê teh jiok guán ê kha-pō͘, tì-sú guán m̄-káⁿ kiânn tī guán ê ke-lō͘. Guán ê tsiong-kio̍k teh beh kàu, guán ê ji̍t-tsí í-king muá à; in-uī guán ê tsiong-kio̍k kàu à.
English: They hunt our steps, so that we can't go in our streets: Our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.

Tailo: Lâng ê hûn tsiūⁿ-khì tíng-bīn, siù ê hûn tuī-lo̍h tē, siáⁿ lâng tsai sī án-ne, á m̄-sī?
English: Who knows the spirit of man, whether it goes upward, and the spirit of the animal, whether it goes downward to the earth?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh kóng, Lí koh kā tshiú hē tī lí ê hing tsîng. Mô͘-se kā i ê tshiú hē tī hing tsîng, thiu tshut-.lâi ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, í-king ho̍k-guân kah tsuân sing-khu ê bah bô koh-iūⁿ.
English: He said, Put your hand inside your cloak again. He put his hand inside his cloak again, and when he took it out of his cloak, behold, it had turned again as his other flesh.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ siūⁿ-tio̍h, tsiū kā I-é-su kóng, Lāu-su, Lí khuànn, Lí só͘ tsiù-tsó͘ ê hit-tsâng bû-hua-kó tshiū í-king 枯 ta-.khì à.
English: Peter, remembering, said to him, Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.

Tailo: Lóng sī kāng-khuán, só͘-í, guá kóng, uân-siān ê kah kiâⁿ pháiⁿ ê, I lóng ē tsâu-bia̍t.
English: It is all the same. Therefore I say, He destroys the blameless and the wicked.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê tshuì lóng ē suan-pò͘ sîng-jīn I-é-su Ki-tok sī Tsú , lâi kui îng-kng hō͘ Thiⁿ-pē Siōng-tè.
English: and that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

Tailo: Guá kà E-hu-laim o̍h kiâⁿ lō͘, khan i ê tshiú, tsóng-.sī, in m̄-tsai Guá kā in i hó.
English: Yet I taught Ephraim to walk. I took them by his arms; But they didn't know that I healed them.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, m̄-thang kah in tâng kiâⁿ, tio̍h iok-sok lí ê kha, m̄-thang ta̍h ji̍p-khì in ê lō͘.
English: My son, don't walk in the way with them. Keep your foot from their path,

Tailo: I ê siū-khì tsin ki̍k-lia̍t, kā I-su-la-el ê kak tsuân-pō͘ tsám-tn̄g, tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng kiu I ê tsiàⁿ tshiú. I tshin-tshiūnn sì-kho͘-uî thun-bia̍t ê hué-iām, kā Iâ-kop sio-sio-.khì.
English: He has cut off in fierce anger all the horn of Israel; He has drawn back his right hand from before the enemy: He has burned up Jacob like a flaming fire, which devours round about.

Tailo: kiû Lí tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h suê-thiaⁿ lâi kā i pān-lí; sím-phuàⁿ Lí tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k, tīng pháiⁿ lâng ê tsuē, tsiàu i só͘ kiâⁿ ê pò-ìng tī i ê thâu-khak; tīng gī lâng tsò gī, tsiàu i ê gī lâi hō͘ i.
English: then hear you in heaven, and do, and judge your servants, condemning the wicked, to bring his way on his own head, and justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.

Tailo: Tshit gue̍h tsa̍p-tshit, tsûn khuà tī A-la̍h-la̍t ê suaⁿ.
English: The ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat's mountains.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuà Iô-sé-huh ê kut-thâu kah i khì, in-uī Iô-sé-huh bat pik-tshiat kah I-su-la-el lâng tsiù-tsuā, tuì in kóng, Siōng-tè it-tīng ē tsiàu-kò͘ lín, lín tio̍h tuà guá ê kut-thâu tuì tsia tsò-hué khì.
English: Moses took the bones of Joseph with him, for he had made the children of Israel swear, saying, God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones away from here with you.

Tailo: Lín kám m̄-tsai lín ê sing-khu to̍h-sī Sìng Sîn ê tiān? Sìng Sîn tiàm tī lín lāi-bīn, to̍h-sī lín tuì Siōng-tè só͘ niá-siū ê. Koh-tsài kóng, lín m̄-sī sio̍k ka-kī, sī sio̍k Siōng-tè;
English: Or don't you know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit which is in you, which you have from God? You are not your own,

Tailo: Hit sî, koh ū tsi̍t tsiah tshiah-sik ê bé tshut-.lâi, khiâ bé ê lâng ū niá-siū kuân-pìng, thang tuì tē-tsiūⁿ tshiúⁿ-tua̍t hô-pîng, hō͘ jîn-luī hō͘-siong sat-hāi; i koh ū niá-siū tsi̍t ki tuā ki kiàm.
English: Another came forth, a red horse. To him who sat on it was given power to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another. There was given to him a great sword.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Iô-tah ông-kiong só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ē hō͘ lâng tshuā-khì-kàu Ba-bú-lông ông ê kuì-tso̍k hia, tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ē kóng: Lí ti-kí ê pîng-iú sái-lōng lí, khah iâⁿ lí; lí ê kha lok lo̍h-khì thô͘-muê, in tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin thè-.khì.
English: behold, all the women who are left in the king of Judah's house shall be brought forth to the king of Babylon's princes, and those women shall say, Your familiar friends have set you on, and have prevailed over you: now that your feet are sunk in the mire, they are turned away back.

Tailo: Hiah-ê pò hit só͘-tsāi pháiⁿ siau-sit ê lâng, lóng tú-tio̍h un-i̍k, sí tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: even those men who did bring up an evil report of the land, died by the plague before Yahweh.

Tailo: In ê kuáⁿ-hū ke-thinn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, pí hái sua khah tsē; Guá hō͘ tsân-sat ê tiong-tàu lâi, kong-kik siàu-liân lâng ê lāu-bú, hō͘ thòng-khó͘, kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ hut-jiân lîm-kàu tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas; I have brought on them against the mother of the young men a destroyer at noonday: I have caused anguish and terrors to fall on her suddenly.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê pē ê lō͘ kah i ê lāu-bú ê lō͘, í-ki̍p hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē ê Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê lō͘.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and walked in the way of his father, and in the way of his mother, and in the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, in which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Lí kám m̄-sī kā guá piàⁿ-tshut tshin-tshiūnn ling, hō͘ guá kiat kui thuân tshin-tshiūnn ling-piáⁿ?
English: Haven't you poured me out like milk, And curdled me like cheese?

Tailo: I bat ha̍k-si̍p Tsú ê lō͘, koh jia̍t-sim kā I-é-su ê tāi-tsì siông-sè kóng-lâi kà-sī lâng; suî-jiân i kan-taⁿ tsai Iô-há-neh ê sé-lé niā-niā.
English: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.

Tailo: Hit sî, A-khà-tsuh ông tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ A-siul hiah-ê ông, kiû in pang-tsān;
English: At that time did king Ahaz send to the kings of Assyria to help him.

Tailo: Sio̍k A-sah ê kiáⁿ ū Tsa̍k-khul, Iô-sé-huh, Ne-thá-niah, A-sa-le-lah, tsiah-ê lóng sī A-sah ê kiáⁿ, kui A-sah tsí-hui, tsun-thàn ông ê bīng-līng lâi tshiùⁿ kua.
English: of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asharelah, the sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, who prophesied after the order of the king.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng teh thìng-hāu Lí, thang tsiàu-sî hō͘ in tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: These all wait for you, That you may give them their food in due season.

Tailo: Koh ū tso̍k-tiúⁿ hiàn ji̍p kang-tîng ê khò͘-pâng, kim nn̄g-bān ta-lik, gîn nn̄g-tshing nn̄g-pah mi-nah.
English: Some of the heads of fathers' houses gave into the treasury of the work twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand two hundred minas of silver.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-phú-kng, I-é-su khiā tī huāⁿ-tíng, m̄-koh, bûn-tô͘ jīn bē-tshut I sī I-é-su.
English: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn't know that it was Jesus.

Tailo: In tuâⁿ khîm, tuâⁿ sik, pûn kó͘-tshue, tńg-lâi Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lâi-kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: They came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets to the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsìng kun-tiúⁿ, Ka-le-ah ê kiáⁿ Io-ha-nân, Ho-sia-iah ê kiáⁿ Ia-tsa-ni-iah, í-ki̍p tsìng lâng, tuì sè kàu tuā lóng tsìn-tsîng lâi,
English: Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even to the greatest, came near,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Siōng-tsú tsiū kàng un-i̍k tī I-su-la-el, I-su-la-el lâng sí ê ū tshit bān.
English: So Yahweh sent a pestilence on Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.

Tailo: hō͘ lí tsìn-ji̍p tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê iok, mā tsìn-ji̍p tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè kin-á-ji̍t kah lí só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê.
English: that you may enter into the covenant of Yahweh your God, and into his oath, which Yahweh your God makes with you this day;

Tailo: Beh tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘, thì i tsuân-pō͘ ê mn̂g, īng tsuí sé sing-khu tsiū tshing-khì; jiân-āu thang ji̍p-khì iâⁿ lāi, tsóng-.sī, tio̍h tī ka-kī ê pò͘-pênn guā tuà tshit ji̍t.
English: He who is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and bathe himself in water; and he shall be clean. After that he shall come into the camp, but shall dwell outside his tent seven days.

Tailo: Ha-to-lám, U-tsal, Tik-la̍h,
English: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

Tailo: Án-ne, in suî-jiân í-king tī Mô͘-kuí-ê tsiáng tiong, mā ē hō͘ Tsú ê lô͘-po̍k bán-huê, lâi uân-sîng Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì.
English: and they may recover themselves out of the devil's snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā i kóng, ' Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí kám ū thâi-sí-lâng koh tsiáng-kuán i ê sán-gia̍p? ' Koh tio̍h kā i kóng, ' Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng： Káu tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi tsīⁿ Na-bot ê hueh, káu mā ē tī hia tsīⁿ lí ê hueh, to̍h-sī lí pún-sin ê hueh. '
English: You shall speak to him, saying, Thus says Yahweh, Have you killed and also taken possession? You shall speak to him, saying, Thus says Yahweh, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick your blood, even yours.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tshuā tsi̍t-ê gín-á lâi hō͘ i khiā tī in tiong-kan, koh kā i phō khí-.lâi, tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng,
English: He took a little child, and set him in the midst of them. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,

Tailo: Siōng-tè sī tuì lán kiânn ta̍k tsióng tsín-kiù ê Siōng-tsú; tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kiù lán thuat-lī sí-bông.
English: God is to us a God of deliverance. To Yahweh, the Lord, belongs escape from death.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng kah Iô-tah lâng siū lia̍h khì Ba-bú-lông, kî-tiong I-é-lí-miah mā hō͘ sī-uē-tiúⁿ lia̍h-.khì, īng thih-liān kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, āu-lâi tuì La̍h-má pàng i khì, jiân-āu Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah, who were carried away captive to Babylon.

Tailo: Αp-sa-lôm tsáu kàu Ge-siul ông A-mi-hut ê kiáⁿ Ta̍t-mái hia. Ta-bi̍t ji̍t-ji̍t uī-tio̍h i ê kiáⁿ pi-ai.
English: But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai the son of Ammihur, king of Geshur. David mourned for his son every day.

Tailo: In-uī i ê lāu-pē Hi-tse-kia só͘ huí ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, i koh kā i khí khí-.lâi, koh uī Ba-al khí tuâⁿ, tsò A-si-lah, tsiàu I-su-la-el ông A-hap ê só͘ tsò, koh kìng-pài thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng lâi kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he reared up altars for Baal, and made an Asherah, as did Ahab king of Israel, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served them.

Tailo: Àm-sî, Siōng-tsú tshut-hiān tī Só͘-lô-móng ê bāng tiong, kā i kóng, Guá í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê kî-tó, mā kíng tsit só͘-tsāi tsò kā Guá hiàn tsè ê tiān.
