English: Yahweh appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him, I have heard your prayer, and have chosen this place to myself for a house of sacrifice.

Tailo: Lín ta̍k tsi-tso̍k tio̍h kíng saⁿ-ê lâng, guá beh tshe in khì, in tsiū tshut-huat piàn kiâⁿ hit-ê tē, tsiàu in ê hūn-gia̍h uē-tô͘, tsiū tńg-lâi guá tsia.
English: Appoint for you three men of each tribe: and I will send them, and they shall arise, and walk through the land, and describe it according to their inheritance; and they shall come to me.

Tailo: Thâu-tsîng ê lông tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú kah tiān ê khuah pêⁿ-pêⁿ, kuân tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p tiú, lāi-bīn an-tsng sûn-kim.
English: The porch that was before the house, the length of it, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits, and the height one hundred twenty; and he overlaid it within with pure gold.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiūⁿ suaⁿ, tiàu-tsi̍p I só͘ kah-ì ê lâng. In tsiū lâi-kàu I hia.
English: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.

Tailo: Kám m̄-sī huān-lān lîm-kàu put-gī ê lâng, tsai-hāi lîm-kàu tsok-gia̍t ê lâng?
English: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, And disaster to the workers of iniquity?

Tailo: In thâi-sí tô-tsáu tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê A-má-li̍k lâng, tsiū tuà tī hia kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: They struck the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and have lived there to this day.

Tailo: Tse sī ē hō͘ Siōng-tsú huann-hí, iâⁿ-kuè hiàn gû, á-.sī hiàn ū kak ū tê ê gû-káng.
English: It will please Yahweh better than an ox, Or a bull that has horns and hoofs.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsit-ê tāi-tsì Iô-ná tsin bô huann-hí, tuā-tuā siū-khì,
English: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was angry.

Tailo: Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun kah Lū-biān ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiū lâi kìnn Mô͘-se kah tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal, í-ki̍p huē-tsiòng ê siú-líng, kā in kóng,
English: the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the princes of the congregation, saying,

Tailo: I tsiàu in lāu-pē só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè ho̍k-sāi Ba-al lâi kā i kìng-pài, kik-khí Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el Siōng-tè ê siū-khì.
English: He served Baal, and worshiped him, and provoked to anger Yahweh, the God of Israel, according to all that his father had done.

Tailo: [siàu-lí] Guá ê lông-kun sio̍k guá, guá mā sio̍k i, i tī pik-ha̍p hue tiong teh tshī i ê iûⁿ-kûn.
English: My beloved is mine, and I am his. He browses among the lilies.

Tailo: Tio̍h lah, guá mā ū kā Su-tê-hua-nah tsi̍t ke lâng sé-lé, kî-tha ū kā pa̍t lâng sé-lé á-bô, guá khiok bē kì-tit à.
English: (I also baptized the household of Stephanas; besides them, I don't know whether I baptized any other.)

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng pang-tsān Ta-bi̍t kong-kik thó͘-huí, in lóng sī tuā khuì-la̍t ê ióng-sū, koh tsò kun-tiúⁿ.
English: They helped David against the band of rovers: for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the army.

Tailo: saⁿ-hūn tsi-it tio̍h tī Tsu-ul ê mn̂g, saⁿ-hūn tsi-it tio̍h tī hō͘-uē-ping āu-bīn ê mn̂g. Án-ne kò͘-siú ông-kiong, tsó͘-tsí lâng tshut-ji̍p.
English: A third part shall be at the gate Sur; and a third part at the gate behind the guard: so shall you keep the watch of the house, and be a barrier.

Tailo: Tī An-ti-o-khè ê kàu-huē ū kuí-nā-ê sian-ti kah kàu-su, to̍h-sī Ba-ná-ba kah kiò-tsò Nî-gel ê Si-miān, Ku-lé-nái lâng Lō͘-kioh kah hun-hong ê kun-ông He-lo̍t tsò-hué tuā-hàn ê Má-nî-án, í-ki̍p Sàu-lô.
English: Now in the assembly that was at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kín-sīn! Guá í-king sū-sian lóng kā lín kóng à.
English: But you watch. Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.

Tailo: Lín kì-jiân sī Siōng-tè ê tsú-bîn, kan-îm kah it-tshè ê ù-uè á-.sī tham-sim, tī lín tiong-kan liân kóng-khí to m̄-thang.
English: But sexual immorality, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be mentioned among you, as becomes saints;

Tailo: Ē-tàng suî-ì pa̍k i ê jîn-sîn, īng tì-huī kà-sī i ê tiúⁿ-ló.
English: To discipline his princes at his pleasure, And to teach his elders wisdom.

Tailo: Liân sìng-tiān i to beh kā i ù-uè, guán tsiū kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi, siūⁿ beh tsiàu guán ka-kī ê lu̍t-huat kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

Tailo: Io-ap kah tuè i ê kun-tuī kàu-uī liáu-āu, ū lâng thong-ti Io-ap kóng, Ne-l ê kiáⁿ Ap-nel lâi kìnn ông, ông sàng i khì, i mā pîng-an lī-khui.
English: When Joab and all the army who was with him had come, they told Joab, saying, Abner the son of Ner came to the king, and he has sent him away, and he is gone in peace.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Iô-sé-huh tsiū kóng: guān i ê tē tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú sù-hok, tit-tio̍h thinn-tíng ê pó-bu̍t kah lō͘-tsuí, í-ki̍p tē-hā só͘ khǹg ê tsuí-guân;
English: Of Joseph he said, Blessed of Yahweh be his land, For the precious things of the heavens, for the dew, For the deep that couches beneath,

Tailo: Guá koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h Tsú ê siann kóng, Guá thang tshe siáⁿ lâng? Siáⁿ lâng beh uī guán khì? Guá tsiū kóng, Guá tī tsia, thang tshe guá!
English: I heard the Lord's voice, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then I said, Here I am. Send me!

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì A-lông kóng, Tse sī Siōng-tsú só͘ kóng ê, I kóng: Guá ē tī tshin-kīn Guá ê lâng hián-bîng tsò sìng, tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng, Guá ē tit-tio̍h îng-kng. A-lông mā tiām-tiām bô tshut siaⁿ.
English: Then Moses said to Aaron, This is what Yahweh spoke of, saying, I will show myself holy to those who come near me, And before all the people I will be glorified.' Aaron held his peace.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū tsiah-ê it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, i kan-tsà ê sió-muē Iô-tah iû-guân bô tsuan-sim kui-ǹg Guá, tsí-put-kò sī ké-ì niā-niā. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah has not returned to me with her whole heart, but only in pretense, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Bô-lūn sī piáⁿ, á-.sī puē ê ngó͘-kok, á-.sī sin ê suī, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, kàu lín tuà lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ lín ê Siōng-tè hit ji̍t tsiah thang tsia̍h. Tse tī lín it-tshè tuà ê só͘-tsāi, tsò lín tāi-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: You shall eat neither bread, nor roasted grain, nor fresh grain, until this same day, until you have brought the offering of your God. This is a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Tailo: In ē thâi-su pua̍h-tó; guán ē khí-lâi khiā tsāi-tsāi.
English: They are bowed down and fallen, But we rise up, and stand upright.

Tailo: Lí ê kài-bīng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guá tông-tsāi, hō͘ guá pí guá ê tuì-ti̍k khah ū tì-huī.
English: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, For your commandments are always with me.

Tailo: In-uī ông ê tsûn-tsiah kah Hi-lâm ê lô͘-po̍k tsò-hué khì Tal-si-sih, tsiah-ê Tal-si-sih ê tsûn tsài kim, gîn, tshiūⁿ-gê, kâu kah khóng-tshiok, sann nî tńg-lâi tsi̍t pái.
English: For the king had ships that went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram; once every three years came the ships of Tarshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h kā tsiáu-á ê kui kah mn̂g tû-.khì, hiat tī tuâⁿ piⁿ ê tang pîng ū hué-hu ê só͘-tsāi.
English: and he shall take away its crop with its filth, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, in the place of the ashes.

Tailo: Hit sî, Se-bah kah Tsal-mú-nah, í-ki̍p kin-tuè i ê kun-tuī, lóng tī Ka-kok, tsha-put-to ū tsi̍t-bān gō͘-tshing lâng, to̍h-sī tang-hong kun-tuī só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, in-uī í-king sí tsa̍p-jī bān lâng, lóng sī gia̍h to ê.
English: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their armies with them, about fifteen thousand men, all who were left of all the army of the children of the east; for there fell one hundred twenty thousand men who drew sword.

Tailo: Guá kiaⁿ lí, in-uī lí sī khik-po̍k ê lâng, bô kià mā beh niá, bô iā tsíng mā beh siu-kuah. '
English: for I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn't lay down, and reap that which you didn't sow.'

Tailo: Lí tio̍h gia̍h thâu khuànn thiⁿ, khuànn hit-ê kiong-tshong sī pí lí khah kuân.
English: Look to the heavens, and see. See the skies, which are higher than you.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h kā hiah-ê lâng, to̍h-sī Gi-be-at ê huí-luī kau tshut-.lâi, guán thang hō͘ in sí, tuì I-su-la-el tiong tû-khì hit-ê pháiⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, Biān-iá-mín lâng m̄-khíng thiaⁿ in hiann-tī I-su-la-el lâng ê uē.
English: Now therefore deliver up the men, the base fellows, who are in Gibeah, that we may put them to death, and put away evil from Israel. But Benjamin would not listen to the voice of their brothers the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lín īng tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tsing-seⁿ hiàn tsò tsè-mi̍h, tse kám m̄-sī pháiⁿ? Īng pái-kha á-.sī ū pēⁿ ê tsing-seⁿ lâi hiàn, tse kám m̄-sī pháiⁿ? Lín tshì hiàn hō͘ lín ê tsóng-tok, i kám ē huaⁿ-hí lâi tsiap-la̍p lín? Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: When you offer the blind for sacrifice, isn't that evil? And when you offer the lame and sick, isn't that evil? Present it now to your governor! Will he be pleased with you? Or will he accept your person? says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: In kóng, Guán bē-tàng. Tio̍h thìng-hāu tsin tsē tīn lóng tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi, lâng kā tsio̍h suá lī-khui tséⁿ-tshuì, tsiah thang hō͘ iûⁿ lim tsuí.
English: They said, We can't, until all the flocks are gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well's mouth. Then we water the sheep.

Tailo: M̄-thiaⁿ kíng-kài ê lâng to̍h-sī khuànn-khin ka-kī; tsóng-.sī, tsun-thàn tsik-pī ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h kiàn-sik.
English: He who refuses correction despises his own soul, But he who listens to reproof gets understanding.

Tailo: Kiû Lí khuànn guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ hîng-uî á-bô, kiû Lí tshuā guá kiânn íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê lō͘.
English: See if there is any wicked way in me, And lead me in the everlasting way.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, guán tī Lí ê tiān lāi, siàu-liām Lí ê tsû-ài.
English: We have thought about your loving kindness, God, In the midst of your temple.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tī kàu-huē tiong, guá lîng-khó kóng gō͘ kù hō͘ lâng thiaⁿ ū koh thang kà-sī lâng ê uē, mā bô ài kóng tsi̍t bān kù ê kńg-tsi̍h-uē.
English: However in the assembly I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that I might instruct others also, than ten thousand words in another language.

Tailo: Guá kah lí tuà tsit jī-tsa̍p nî, lí ê mî-iûⁿ-bó kah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-bó m̄-bat ū làu-the, lí iûⁿ-kûn tiong ê iûⁿ-káng, guá m̄-bat tsia̍h.
English: These twenty years I have been with you. Your ewes and your female goats have not cast their young, and I haven't eaten the rams of your flocks.

Tailo: Īng bûn-jī khik tī tsio̍h-pán ê lu̍t-huat pan-pò͘ ê sî, Siōng-tè ê îng-kng ū hián-hiān. Tuì Mô͘-se ê bīn huán tsiò tshut-.lâi ê kng suî-jiân tsiām-tsiām siau-sit, in-uī hit-ê kng hui-siông kiông, tì-sú I-su-la-el lâng bē-tàng tsù-ba̍k khuànn Mô͘-se ê bīn; liân-tài hō͘ lâng sí-bông ê lu̍t-huat to ū tsit khuán ê îng-kng,
English: But if the service of death, written engraved on stones, came with glory, so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly on the face of Moses for the glory of his face; which was passing away:

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín ē hông kiò-tsò Siōng-tsú ê tsè-si; lâng beh tshing lín tsò lán ê Siōng-tsú ê tshe-īng. Lín ē tsia̍h-īng lia̍t kok ê tsâi-bu̍t, tit-tio̍h in ê îng-kng lâi khua-kháu.
English: But you shall be named the priests of Yahweh; men shall call you the ministers of our God: you shall eat the wealth of the nations, and in their glory shall you boast yourselves.

Tailo: hīⁿ-khuân, tshiú-khuân, tà bīn ê phè,
English: the earrings, the bracelets, the veils,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú kian-kò͘ i ê kok-uī, Iô-tah kûn-tsiòng hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ Iô-sa-huat, i tsiū ū tsin tsē tsâi-bu̍t kah îng-kng.
English: Therefore Yahweh established the kingdom in his hand; and all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat tribute; and he had riches and honor in abundance.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hiàn phang-phang ê sio-tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī gû-káng-á tsi̍t tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng tsi̍t tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á tshit tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: but you shall offer a burnt offering to Yahweh for a sweet savor: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old; they shall be to you without blemish;

Tailo: Lán-si ê lâng khùn tāng-bîn, pîn-tuāⁿ ê lâng ē tú-tio̍h iau-gō.
English: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.

Tailo: In ē hō͘ to-kiàm thâi-sí, mā ē hō͘ lâng lia̍h-khì sè-kài kok kok. Ê-lú-sa-lèm ē hō͘ lia̍t pang lâng thún-ta̍h, it-ti̍t kàu lia̍t pang tsiàm-niá ê kî-hān muá.
English: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

Tailo: Guá ū iu-būn, guān guá ē tit-tio̍h an-uì; guá ê sim teh beh hūn-.khì.
English: Oh that I could comfort myself against sorrow! My heart is faint within me.

Tailo: Guá — Ta-ni-el, guá ê sim-sîn tī guá ê lāi-bīn teh iu-būn, sim-lāi ê ī-siōng hō͘ guá put-an.
English: As for me, Daniel, my spirit was grieved in the midst of my body, and the visions of my head troubled me.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ tio̍h tsò-hué siú tsè-si ê tsit, liāu-lí tuâⁿ kah tiùⁿ-lî lāi só͘-ū ê kang. Lín tio̍h án-ne ho̍k-bū, Guá í-king tshin-tshiūnn sàng mi̍h-kiāⁿ hō͘ lín lâi siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsè-si tsit-tsik ê kang. Kiàn-nā guā-bīn lâng kīn-uá ê, it-tīng hō͘ i sí.
English: You and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood for everything of the altar, and for that within the veil; and you shall serve: I give you the priesthood as a service of gift: and the stranger who comes near shall be put to death.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ tshù-piⁿ, to̍h-sī hāi-tio̍h guá hō͘ guá ê I-su-la-el jîn-bîn sîng-tsiap ê sán-gia̍p ê. Siōng-tsú ū án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā in kuáⁿ-tshut in ê tē, koh beh kā Iô-tah ke tuì in tiong-kan kuáⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Thus says Yahweh against all my evil neighbors, who touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.

Tailo: Lín in-uī tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì nā iáu-koh m̄ tsun-thàn Guá, mā tsò tāi-tsì huán-tuì Guá,
English: If you in spite of this won't listen to me, but walk contrary to me;

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p-saⁿ ê sī Hup-pah, tē-tsa̍p-sì ê sī Ia-si-ba-ap,
English: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, ū tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì tshiánn lín m̄-thang bē kì-.tit, to̍h-sī tī Tsú ê gán-tiong, tsi̍t ji̍t kah-ná tsi̍t tshing nî , tsi̍t tshing nî kah-ná tsi̍t ji̍t.
English: But don't forget this one thing, beloved, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.

Tailo: Lí la̍k ji̍t tio̍h tsò-kang, tē-tshit ji̍t tio̍h an-hioh, tī tsai-tsìng siu-kuah ê sî mā tio̍h an-hioh.
English: Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest: in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h liân-bín hiah-ê ū giâu-gî-sim ê lâng.
English: On some have compassion, making a distinction,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí hō͘ guá tsai guá pún-sin ê kiat-kio̍k! Guá nî-huè ū guā tsē? Hō͘ guá tsai guá ê luán-jio̍k kàu siáⁿ-mi̍h thîng-tō͘!
English: Yahweh, show me my end, What is the measure of my days. Let me know how frail I am.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā in kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, m̄-sī Mô͘-se īng tuì thiⁿ lâi ê piáⁿ hō͘ lín tsia̍h, sī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē īng tuì thiⁿ lâi ê tsin ê piáⁿ hō͘ lín.
English: Jesus therefore said to them, Most assuredly, I tell you, it wasn't Moses who gave you the bread out of heaven, but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven.

Tailo: Saⁿ pái hō͘ Lô-má lâng īng kuái-á phah, tsi̍t pái hō͘ lâng īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm, saⁿ pái tú-tio̍h tsûn-phuà, tsi̍t pái tī hái-.ni̍h phiau-liû tsi̍t ji̍t tsi̍t mê.
English: Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. Three times I suffered shipwreck. I have been a night and a day in the deep.

Tailo: Koh ū lâng beh tshì-thàm I-é-su, iau-kiû I kiânn tuì thiⁿ lâi ê sîn-jiah.
English: Others, testing him, sought from him a sign from heaven.

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p tē-tshit nî hó-nî-tang tsi̍t ē kiat-sok,
English: The seven years of plenty, that were in the land of Egypt, came to an end.

Tailo: Guān só͘-ū tsáu-tshuē Lí ê lâng in-uī Lí lâi huann-hí khuài-lo̍k! Guān him-bō͘ Lí kiù-un ê lâng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kóng, Tio̍h tsun Siōng-tsú tsò tuā!
English: Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you. Let such as love your salvation say continually, Let Yahweh be exalted!

Tailo: Guá bô kī-tsua̍t Siōng-tè ê un-tián, in-uī tuì lu̍t-huat nā ē-tàng kah Siōng-tè ū hô-hó ê kuan-hē, án-ne, Ki-tok kám m̄-sī pe̍h-pe̍h thè lán sí?
English: I don't make void the grace of God. For if righteousness is through the law, then Christ died for nothing!

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng kóng, ' Guá ê tsó͘-sian sī tsi̍t-ê teh beh sí ê A-lâm lâng, lo̍h-khì Ai-gi̍p tī hia kià-kha. Lâng-gia̍h tsió-tsió tī hia tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t-ê tuā koh kiông ê kok, lâng-gia̍h koh tsē.
English: You shall answer and say before Yahweh your God, A Syrian ready to perish was my father; and he went down into Egypt, and sojourned there, few in number; and he became there a nation, great, mighty, and populous.

Tailo: Tsit pái lín m̄-bián kau-tsiàn, Iô-tah kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lín tio̍h pâi tīn khiā-.leh, khuànn Siōng-tsú lâi tsín-kiù lín. M̄-bián kiaⁿ, m̄-bián lún, bîn-á-tsài tio̍h tshut-khì in hia, in-uī Siōng-tsú kah lín tông-tsāi. '
English: You shall not need to fight in this battle: set yourselves, stand you still, and see the salvation of Yahweh with you, O Judah and Jerusalem; don't be afraid, nor be dismayed: tomorrow go out against them: for Yahweh is with you.

Tailo: In tâng tso̍k ê hiann-tī, Ko-hat ê kiáⁿ, ū ê kuán-lí pâi-lia̍t ê piáⁿ, ta̍k-ê An-hioh-ji̍t lóng tio̍h tsún-pī.
English: Some of their brothers, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the show bread, to prepare it every Sabbath.

Tailo: Guān hit-ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tsú só͘ tshia-tó ê hiah-ê siâⁿ, mā bô hō͘-hué ê; guān i tsá-khí sî thiaⁿ-tio̍h ai-tshám ê siann, ji̍t-tiong-tàu thiaⁿ-tio̍h huah-hiàm ê siann.
English: Let that man be as the cities which Yahweh overthrew, and didn't repent: and let him hear a cry in the morning, and shouting at noontime;

Tailo: Tshong-bîng ê ìn kóng, ' Guán kiaⁿ iû bô kàu pun lín īng. Siōng hó lín ka-kī kho khì bé. '
English: But the wise answered, saying, What if there isn't enough for us and you? You go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.'

Tailo: Tng hit nî, Iô-tah ông Tse-ti-kiah khí-thâu tsē-uī ê tē-sì nî gō͘ gue̍h, Gi-bóng lâng A-tsù-l ê kiáⁿ Ha-na-niah sian-ti tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān, tng tsiah-ê tsè-si kah tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng, tuì guá kóng,
English: It happened the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was of Gibeon, spoke to me in the house of Yahweh, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,

Tailo: Pak-hong ê ông tò tńg-.lâi, beh koh pâi-lia̍t tuā kun-tuī, pí í-tsîng ê koh khah tsē. Kuè kuí-nā nî āu, i ē tuà tuā kun-tuī kah tsin tsē kun-sū tsong-pī lâi.
English: The king of the north shall return, and shall set forth a multitude greater than the former; and he shall come on at the end of the times, even of years, with a great army and with much substance.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng bô thiàⁿ Tsú, tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘. Tsú ah, kiû Lí kàng-lîm!
English: If any man doesn't love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed . Come, Lord!

Tailo: Ê-bel seⁿ Hua-li̍k liáu-āu, iáu ua̍h sì-pah saⁿ tsa̍p nî, koh ū seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: Eber lived four hundred thirty years after he became the father of Peleg, and became the father of sons and daughters.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsìng jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī E-hu-laim kah tuà tī Sa-má-lī-a ê lâng lóng ē tsai. In tsiàu in kiau-ngō͘ tsū-tuā ê sim kóng,
English: All the people will know, Including Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria, who say in pride and in arrogance of heart,

Tailo: Tshing guá tsò gī ê kīn lah; siáⁿ lâng kah guá sio-tseⁿ, i thang kah guá tsò-hué tuà; siáⁿ lâng tsò guá ê tuì-ti̍k, i thang lâi kìnn guá.
English: He is near who justifies me; who will bring charges against me? Let us stand up together: who is my adversary? Let him come near to me.

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê ài guá tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê lâng lóng kiàn-siàu làu-khuì! Guān hiah-ê tuì guá kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng sit-bōng lâi kiàn-siàu!
English: Let them be disappointed and confounded together who rejoice at my calamity. Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves against me.

Tailo: In-uī A-bu-la-hàm teh kî-thāi Siōng-tè só͘ siat 計 khí-tsō hit-ê ū tē-ki ê siâⁿ.
English: For he looked for the city which has the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī puē-gi̍k ê ke, kám m̄-bat mn̄g lí kóng, ' Lí teh tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? '
English: Son of man, has not the house of Israel, the rebellious house, said to you, What do you?

Tailo: Sia-lúm seⁿ Hil-kí-iah, Hil-kí-iah seⁿ A-tsa-lí-ah;
English: and Shallum became the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah became the father of Azariah,

Tailo: I só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng ē tú-tio̍h un-i̍k lâi bâi-tsòng, liân i ê kuáⁿ-hū mā bô uī-tio̍h in lâi thî-khàu.
English: Those who remain of him shall be buried in death. His widows shall make no lamentation.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kám ū phian-su lâi sím-phuàⁿ? Tsuân-lîng-.ê kám ē phian-su, bô kong-gī?
English: Does God pervert justice? Or does the Almighty pervert righteousness?

Tailo: Lín kuè Iol-tàn hô, lâi-kàu I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ; I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ lâng, A-mô͘-lī lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, Ka-nân lâng, Hiat lâng, Gi-ga-sih lâng, Hi-bī lâng, I-é-bú-suh lâng, lóng kah lín kau-tsiàn; Guá kā in kau tī lín ê tshiú tiong.
English: You went over the Jordan, and came to Jericho: and the men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Girgashite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I delivered them into your hand.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng teh thiaⁿ ê sî, I-é-su kā bûn-tô͘ kóng,
English: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

Tailo: Āu-lâi, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h koh tshut tshit suī, phàⁿ-phàⁿ koh hō͘ tang-hong sàu pháiⁿ.
English: Behold, seven heads of grain, thin and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them.

Tailo: Tsú ah, kiàn-siàu kui tī guán, kui tī guán ê kun-ông, kuì-tso̍k kah tsó͘-sian, in-uī guán tik-tsuē Lí.
English: Lord, to us belongs confusion of face, to our kings, to our princes, and to our fathers, because we have sinned against you.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ài beh hō͘ in tsai, uī-tio̍h guā-pang lâng tsún-pī ê tsit-ê ò-pì, ū guā-ni̍h hong-sīng koh îng-iāu. Tsit-ê ò-pì to̍h-sī, Ki-tok tiàm tī lín lāi-bīn, tsiâⁿ-tsò lín hióng-siū Siōng-tè îng-iāu ê ǹg-bāng.
English: to whom God was pleased to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory;

Tailo: Hit-ê ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng, ba̍k-tsiu bô koh ba̍k-hîn; ē thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng, hīⁿ-khang ē àⁿ teh thiaⁿ.
English: The eyes of those who see will not be dim, And the ears of those who hear will listen.

Tailo: Se-bah kah Tsal-mú-nah tô-tsáu, Gî-tióng kā in jiok, lia̍h-tio̍h Mí-tiân nn̄g-ê ông Se-bah kah Tsal-mú-nah, hō͘ in kun-tuī tio̍h-kiaⁿ tô-tsáu.
English: Zebah and Zalmunna fled; and he pursued after them; and he took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and confused all the army.

Tailo: Ê-no͘k la̍k-tsa̍p-gō͘ huè, seⁿ Me-thu-se-la̍h.
English: Enoch lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Methuselah.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Guá ê tsú ná ē beh jiok lô͘-po̍k? Guá kám ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h m̄-tio̍h? Guá ê tshiú ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ?
English: He said, Why does my lord pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in my hand?

Tailo: E-hú ji̍p-.khì, mā tsia̍h mā lim, kóng, Lín khì khuànn hit-ê siū tsiù-tsó͘ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, sūn-suà kā i bâi-tsòng, in-uī i sī ông ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: When he was come in, he ate and drink; and he said, See now to this cursed woman, and bury her; for she is a king's daughter.

Tailo: Tsìng siú-líng, ióng-sū kah Ta-bi̍t ông ê tsìng kiáⁿ, lóng sūn-ho̍k Só͘-lô-móng ông.
English: All the princes, the mighty men, and also all of the sons of king David submitted themselves to Solomon the king.

Tailo: kî-tiong king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu kah tsong-tso̍k, tsóng-kiōng ū nn̄g-tshing la̍k-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p miâ.
English: even those who were numbered of them, by their families, by their fathers' houses, were two thousand six hundred thirty.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to kā in kóng, Lín ka-kī tshuā I khì, tsiàu lín ê lu̍t-huat khì kā I sím-phuàⁿ. Iô-tá-iah lâng kā i kóng, Guán bô kuân thang kā lâng phuàⁿ sí-hîng.
English: Pilate therefore said to them, Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law. Therefore the Jews said to him, It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,

Tailo: Thiaⁿ guá tsiah-ê uē bô khì si̍t-hiān ê lâng, ná tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t-ê gōng lâng kā tshù khí tuà sua á tíng;
English: Everyone who hears these words of mine, and doesn't do them will be like a foolish man, who built his house on the sand.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit ki kak kah sìng ê tsú-bîn kau-tsiàn, lâi thâi-iâⁿ in.
English: I saw, and the same horn made war with the saints, and prevailed against them;

Tailo: Í-tsîng Ê-lú-sa-lèm li̍k-lâi ū tuā kun-ông thóng-hat hô guā tsuân tē, tsìn-kòng, kuan-suè, tsîⁿ-niû lóng la̍p hō͘ in.
English: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all the country beyond the River; and tribute, custom, and toll, was paid to them.

Tailo: Ha̍k-si̍p tō-lí ê lâng, tio̍h kā ta̍k hāng hó mi̍h kah kà-sī i ê lâng tsò-hué hun-hióng.
English: But let him who is taught in the word share all good things with him who teaches.

Tailo: Lín lóng tsin tshing-tshó tsiah tio̍h; tshù ê tsú-lâng nā tsai tsha̍t-á tang-sî-tsūn ē kàu, it-tīng ē kíng-síng, bē hō͘ tsha̍t-á ó͘ piah-khang ji̍p-lâi tshù lāi.
English: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá kā lí khik tī Guá ê tshiú-tsiúⁿ, lí ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng.
English: Behold, I have engraved you on the palms of my hands; your walls are continually before me.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm siū kat-lé ê sî, káu-tsa̍p-káu huè.
English: Abraham was ninety-nine years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h uī ka-kī kíng hit-ê ha̍p-gî ê, mā tio̍h tsò-hué tsai siáⁿ-mi̍h sī hó.
English: Let us choose for us that which is right. Let us know among ourselves what is good.

Tailo: Lín in-uī Siōng-tsú ê uē lâi phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah ê lâng, tio̍h thiaⁿ I ê uē: Lín ê hiann-tī uàn-hūn lín, koh in-uī Guá ê miâ lâi kā lín kuáⁿ-tshut ê, bat kóng: Guān Siōng-tsú tit-tio̍h îng-kng, hō͘ guán ē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín ê huann-hí. Tsóng-.sī, in ē tú-tio̍h kiàn-siàu.
English: Hear the word of Yahweh, you who tremble at his word: Your brothers who hate you, who cast you out for my name's sake, have said, Let Yahweh be glorified, that we may see your joy; but it is those who shall be disappointed.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Páu-lô kah guán khì hóng-būn Iâ-kop, tsìng tiúⁿ-ló mā lóng tsò-hué tī hia.
English: The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present.

Tailo: In tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsiah-ê teh kóng uē ê lâng kám m̄-sī lóng sī Ga-lí-la-iah lâng?
English: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, Behold, aren't all these who speak Galileans?

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Sàu-lô kā jîn-bîn hun-tsò saⁿ tuī, tī gō͘-keⁿ-tsá ê sî, ji̍p-khì Am-móng lâng ê kun-iâⁿ, kā in phah-sí kàu ji̍t beh tàu, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lóng tsáu sì-suàⁿ, bô nn̄g-ê lâng tsò-hué tuà tsi̍t uī.
English: It was so on the next day, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the camp in the morning watch, and struck the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it happened, that those who remained were scattered, so that no two of them were left together.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì lia̍t pang lâi, thiaⁿ Só͘-lô-móng tì-huī ê uē; thian-hā lia̍t ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h Só͘-lô-móng ê tì-huī, mā ū tshe lâng lâi.
English: There came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.

Tailo: I phuà-pēⁿ sí-.khì, lâng sé i ê sin-si, kā i hē tī lâu-tíng ê pâng-king.
English: It happened in those days that she fell sick, and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper chamber.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu ê sim uá-khò i, lóng bô khiàm-khueh siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: The heart of her husband trusts in her. He shall have no lack of gain.

Tailo: Sàu-lô phah A-má-li̍k lâng, tui Ha-bí-la̍h kàu Ai-gi̍p thâu-tsîng ê Siu-i.
English: Saul struck the Amalekites, from Havilah as you go to Shur, that is before Egypt.

Tailo: Iô-tah ê sim-pū Tha-mal kā i seⁿ Hua-lè-suh kah Tsa-la̍h. Iô-tah kiōng gō͘-ê kiáⁿ.
English: Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū gō͘-ê gōng ê, gō͘-ê tshong-bîng ê.
English: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè in-uī lín ê iân-kò͘, tuì hiah-ê kok só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, lín ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, in-uī thè lín kau-tsiàn ê sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: and you have seen all that Yahweh your God has done to all these nations because of you; for Yahweh your God, he it is that has fought for you.

Tailo: I-su-la-el kā i kóng, Lí khì khuànn lín a-hiaⁿ ū pîng-ána bô, iûⁿ-kûn ū pîng-ána bô, jiân-āu tńg-lâi kā guá kóng. I-su-la-el tsiū tshe i tshut He-bú-lông ê suaⁿ-kok. Iô-sé-huh tsiū khì-kàu Sī-khiàm,
English: He said to him, Go now, see whether it is well with your brothers, and well with the flock; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì guá án-ne kóng, Lí khì khiā tī tsìng lâng ê mn̂g, to̍h-sī Iô-tah lia̍t ông tuì hia ji̍p, tuì hia tshut ê, koh khiā tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsiah-ê mn̂g,
English: Thus said Yahweh to me: Go, and stand in the gate of the children of the people, through which the kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;

Tailo: Gí-tiāⁿ pháiⁿ lâng tsò gī, á-.sī tīng gī lâng tsò ū tsuē ê, tsit nn̄g hāng lóng sī Siōng-tsú só͘ thó-ià.
English: He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the righteous, Both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kè-sio̍k kóng, Lín koh thiaⁿ tsi̍t-ê phì-jū, ū tsi̍t-ê hn̂g-tsú khai-khún tsi̍t tè phû-tô hn̂g, īng lî-pa uî khí-.lâi, lāi-bīn ó͘ tsi̍t-ê tsiú-khut, khí tsi̍t-ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu. I kā tsit tè hn̂g tso͘ hō͘ tshân-tiān, tsiū tshut-khì lí-hîng.
English: Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.

Tailo: Ē-sin lâu-lâng ê lâng só͘ khiâ ê bé-uaⁿ mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Whatever saddle he who has the discharge rides on shall be unclean.

Tailo: A-to-ni-kam ê kiáⁿ-sun, la̍k-pah la̍k-tsa̍p la̍k lâng.
English: The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty-six.

Tailo: Sai ê hia̍t kah sè tsiah sai, tsia̍h-mi̍h ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī kang ê sai, bó ê sai kah sè tsiah sai sì-kè kiânn, bô tio̍h-kiaⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, taⁿ tī tó-uī?
English: Where is the den of the lions, and the feeding place of the young lions, where the lion and the lioness walked, the lion's cubs, and no one made them afraid?

Tailo: Ông ê jîn-sîn mā lâi kā lán ê tsú — Ta-bi̍t ông tsiok-hok, kóng, ' Guān lí ê Siōng-tè hō͘ Só͘-lô-móng ê miâ pí lí ê miâ khah iâⁿ, hō͘ i ê kok-uī pí lí ê kok-uī khah tuā. ' Ông tsiū tī tshn̂g-.ni̍h àⁿ lo̍h-khì pài.
English: Moreover the king's servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, Your God make the name of Solomon better than your name, and make his throne greater than your throne: and the king bowed himself on the bed.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá kiàn-gī, tio̍h hō͘ I-su-la-el jîn-bîn, tuì Tàn kàu Bel-sí-bah, tsū-tsi̍p lâi lí tsia, tshin-tshiūnn hái piⁿ ê sua hiah tsē, lí mā tshin-sin tok-tīn.
English: But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together to you, from Dan even to Beersheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that you go to battle in your own person.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Siat-sú in bô beh sìn lí, mā bô beh sìn thâu tsi̍t-ê sîn-jiah, tsiū ē sìn tē-jī-ê sîn-jiah.
English: It will happen, if they will neither believe you nor listen to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, The̍h gín-á ê tsia̍h-mi̍h hiat hō͘ káu á tsia̍h sī bô ing-kai ê.
English: But he answered, It is not appropriate to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.

Tailo: Hit-ê put-huat ê lâng lîm-kàu ê sî, uá-khò Sa-tán ta̍k tsióng ê kuân-sè, lâi kiâⁿ ké sîn-jiah kah kî-sū.
English: even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,

Tailo: Hit sî, ū Bu-tsih lâng, sio̍k tī Lâm ê tso̍k, Ba-la-khiah ê kiáⁿ E-li-hu, tsin siū-khì; i siū-khì Io-buh, in-uī i lia̍h ka-kī pí Siōng-tè khah ū gī.
English: Then the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel, the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was kindled against Job. His wrath was kindled because he justified himself rather than God.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, lán ê tsó͘-sian kì-jiân sîng-tsiap tsit-ê huē-bō͘, Siōng-tè tsiū tuì in ê bīn-tsîng kā guā-tso̍k kuáⁿ-tsáu. In tsiàm-niá hit-ê thó͘-tē liáu-āu, tsiū kah Io-siú-ah kā huē-bō͘ suá khì hia, it-ti̍t kàu Ta-bi̍t ê sî-tāi.
English: which also our fathers, in their turn, brought in with Joshua when they entered into the possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, to the days of David,

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ tuì ông kóng ê, bîn-á-tsài tsha-put-to kàu tsit sî, tī Sa-má-lī-a ê siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, nn̄g sè-a tuā-be̍h ta̍t gîn tsi̍t si-khel, tsi̍t sè-a ê iù mī-hún ta̍t gîn tsi̍t si-khel.
English: It happened, as the man of God had spoken to the king, saying, Two measures of barley for a shekel, and a measure of fine flour for a shekel, shall be tomorrow about this time in the gate of Samaria;

Tailo: ē tshiong ji̍p-khì Iô-tah, tiòng muá sì-kè im-tsuí, kuân kàu ām-kún. Em-má-nu-el, i ê si̍t thí-khui, phiàn-muá lí ê tē.
English: It will sweep onward into Judah. It will overflow and pass through; it will reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of its wings will fill the breadth of your land, Immanuel.

Tailo: Tsuân Io̍p-pe ê lâng lóng tsai tsit-hāng tāi-tsì, tsiū ū tsin tsē lâng sìn Tsú.
English: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Ha-gal kā A-bú-lâm seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ; A-bú-lâm kā i ê kiáⁿ hō-miâ kiò-tsò I-si-ma-el, to̍h-sī Ha-gal só͘ seⁿ ê.
English: Hagar bore a son for Abram. Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael.

Tailo: A-hap thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, tsiū thiah-li̍h saⁿ, sing-khu tshīng tsho͘ muâ-pò͘, kìm-tsia̍h, khùn mā tó tī tsho͘ muâ-pò͘, koh ûn-ûn-á kiânn.
English: It happened, when Ahab heard those words, that he tore his clothes, and put sackcloth on his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē siúⁿ-sù hó mi̍h; lán ê thó͘-tē ē tshut i ê lông-sán-bu̍t.
English: Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good. Our land will yield its increase.

Tailo: tsiū kā Sàu-lô kah i ê kiáⁿ Io-ná-than ê kut bâi-tsòng tī Biān-iá-mín tē ê Tsé-la̍h, tī Sàu-lô ê pē Ki-si ê bōng; tsiàu ông it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng ê khì kiâⁿ. Tsit sî liáu-āu, Siōng-tsú uī-tio̍h hit-ê só͘-tsāi thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó.
English: They buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the tomb of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. After that God was entreated for the land.

Tailo: A-lông beh ji̍p sìng-só͘ tio̍h án-ne, tio̍h tuà tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á-kiáⁿ tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio-tsè.
English: Herewith shall Aaron come into the sanctuary: with a young bull for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang kā lâng kóng; to̍k-to̍k lí tio̍h khì hō͘ tsè-si giām, mā tio̍h hiàn Mô͘-se só͘ kui-tīng ê tsè-mi̍h, thang lâi tuì tsìng lâng tsìng-bîng.
English: Jesus said to him, See that you tell nobody, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.

Tailo: I lo̍h-khì kah tsa-bó͘ gín-á kóng-uē, i sī Sâm-sóng só͘ kah-ì ê.
English: He went down, and talked with the woman, and she pleased Samson well.

Tailo: I-é-su thîng lo̍h-.lâi, kóng, Kiò i lâi. In tsiū kiò tsheⁿ-mê-.ê lâi, kā i kóng, Hòng-sim, khí-.lâi, I teh kiò lí.
English: Jesus stood still, and said, Call him. They called the blind man, saying to him, Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!

Tailo: I-su-la-el kā Iô-sé-huh kóng, Guá kìⁿ-tio̍h lí ê bīn, tsai lí iáu ua̍h-.leh, guá taⁿ sí mā kam-guān.
English: Israel said to Joseph, Now let me die, since I have seen your face, that you are still alive.

Tailo: Tio̍h thìng-hāu Siōng-tsú! Tio̍h ióng-tsòng, lí ê sim tio̍h kian-kò͘! Khak-si̍t tio̍h sìn-khò Siōng-tsú!
English: Wait for Yahweh. Be strong, and let your heart take courage. Yes, wait for Yahweh.

Tailo: I ē īng hō͘ bān-mi̍h khut-ho̍k ê kuân-lîng lâi kái-piàn lán pi-tsiān ê jio̍k-thé, hō͘ lán tsiâⁿ-tsò kah I kāng-khuán îng-iāu.
English: who will change the body of our humiliation to be conformed to the body of his glory, according to the working by which he is able even to subject all things to himself.

Tailo: tâng-hái tsi̍t-ê kah tâng-hái ē-bīn ê tsa̍p-jī tsiah gû;
English: and the one sea, and the twelve oxen under the sea;

Tailo: I bīng-līng o͘-àm, tē tsiū ū o͘-àm; lóng bô uî-puē I ê uē.
English: He sent darkness, and made it dark. They didn't rebel against his words.

Tailo: Lia̍h hiah-ê ông tshut-lâi-kàu Io-siú-ah hia ê sî, Io-siú-ah tsiū kiò I-su-la-el jîn-bîn lâi, tuì hiah-ê kah i tsò-hué khì ê kun-tiúⁿ kóng, Lín kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, īng kha ta̍h tī tsiah-ê ông ê ām-kún. In tsiū kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, īng kha ta̍h tī in ê ām-kún.
English: It happened, when they brought forth those kings to Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said to the chiefs of the men of war who went with him, Come near, put your feet on the necks of these kings. They came near, and put their feet on the necks of them.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá koh-ua̍h liáu-āu, ē pí lín tāi-sing khì-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

Tailo: Guá kiò tshin-ài ê lâng, tsóng-.sī, in khi-phiàn guá. Guá ê tsè-si, guá ê tiúⁿ-ló teh tshuē kiù miā ê bí-niûⁿ, hit sî in tsiū tī siâⁿ lāi tn̄g-khuì.
English: I called for my lovers, but they deceived me: My priests and my elders gave up the spirit in the city, While they sought them food to refresh their souls.

Tailo: Tī hit gue̍h ê tshe gō͘, to̍h-sī E-hō͘-iá-kin ông siū lia̍h ê tē-gō͘ nî,
English: In the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of king Jehoiachin's captivity,

Tailo: Sio̍k-gí kóng, Tām-po̍h-á ê kàⁿ ē hō͘ kui-sn̂g huat khí-.lâi.
English: A little yeast grows through the whole lump.

Tailo: I tī ta̍k-ê huē-tn̂g kà-sī lâng, siū kûn-tsiòng ê o-ló.
English: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù ê sī án-ne, Lín tio̍h tsiàu ta̍k lâng só͘ tsia̍h ê liōng lâi khioh, ta̍k lâng uī i pò͘-pêⁿ lāi ê lâng, tsiàu i ê lâng-gia̍h lâi khioh, tsi̍t-ê lâng tsi̍t o͘-mel.
English: This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded: Gather of it everyone according to his eating; an omer a head, according to the number of your persons, shall you take it, every man for those who are in his tent.

Tailo: Ló-toh tiàm tī Tso-al ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, tsiū kah i nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tuì Tso-al tsiūⁿ-khì tiàm tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h; i kah nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tiàm tī tsi̍t-ê tōng lāi.
English: Lot went up out of Zoar, and lived in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he was afraid to live in Zoar. He lived in a cave with his two daughters.

Tailo: Ông kah Ha-mán lâi hù ông-hō͘ Ê-su-tel ê iàn-si̍k.
English: So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.

Tailo: Nó͘-ah seⁿ saⁿ-ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī Sé-mh, Hâm, Iá-hia̍t.
English: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Tailo: Tē ah, m̄-thang jia-khàm guá ê hueh; guān guá ê tuā-siaⁿ huah bô thîng-hioh ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Earth, don't cover my blood, Let my cry have no place to rest.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ông tsiū ji̍p-.khì, tsē tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kóng, Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè ah, guá sī siáⁿ lâng, guá sī siáⁿ-mi̍h hō ê ke, Lí tsiah tshuā guá kàu tsit-ê tē-pō͘?
English: Then David the king went in, and sat before Yahweh; and he said, Who am I, Yahweh God, and what is my house, that you have brought me thus far?

Tailo: I kiù-sio̍k lí ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī sí-bông, īng thiàⁿ-sim kah tsû-pi tsò lí ê bián-liû.
English: Who redeems your life from destruction; Who crowns you with loving kindness and tender mercies;

Tailo: Siat-sú lí ê sim phian-siâ m̄ tsun-thàn, koh siū iú-hi̍k khì kìng-pài pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, kā i ho̍k-sāi,
English: But if your heart turn away, and you will not hear, but shall be drawn away, and worship other gods, and serve them;

Tailo: The-ko-uah ê lāu-pē A-siul ū nn̄g-ê bó͘, miâ kiò-tsò Hi-la̍h, ná-la̍h.
English: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

Tailo: Só͘-ū tsò hó sū ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h îng-kng, tsun-kuì kah pîng-an, Iô-tá-iah lâng ē sing tit-tio̍h, āu-lâi tsiah suà-kàu Hi-la̍h lâng.
English: But glory and honor and peace to every man who works good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí ê bīn tio̍h ǹg Si-tòng lâi tuì i suan-pò͘, kóng,
English: Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against it,

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, Lí sī guá ê Siōng-tè, guá ê ông; lâng í-king khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí teh kiâⁿ, kiâⁿ-ji̍p-khì sìng ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They have seen your processions, God, Even the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.

Tailo: I sing khì tshuē i ê a-hiaⁿ Sí-mòng, kā i kóng, Guán í-king tú-tio̍h Ki-tok.
English: He first found his own brother, Simon, and said to him, We have found the Messiah! (which is, being interpreted, Christ ).

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kóng, Tshut-tsāi tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng khì tsò! Hō͘ i kā tsiah-ê phang-iû lâu kàu guá bâi-tsòng ê ji̍t thang īng.
English: But Jesus said, Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of my burial.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Iâ-kop kóng, Lí tio̍h tńg-khì lí ê tsó͘-sian ê tē, kàu lí ê tshin-tso̍k hia, Guá ē kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: Yahweh said to Jacob, Return to the land of your fathers, and to your relatives, and I will be with you.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t him-siān kóng, Siáⁿ lâng ē kā Bia̍t-lé-hèm siâⁿ-mn̂g piⁿ ê tséⁿ-tsuí hō͘ guá lim?
English: David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!

Tailo: I koh kóng, Îng-kng lī-khui I-su-la-el, in-uī Siōng-tsú ê kuī hông tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: She said, The glory is departed from Israel; for the ark of God is taken.

Tailo: Khó͘-bē-thang lí tsò guá ê hiann-tī, sī bat suh guá lāu-bú ê ling ê; án-ne, guá nā tī guā-bīn tú-tio̍h lí, to̍h-sī kah lí tsim-tshuì, mā bô lâng ē khuànn-khin guá.
English: Oh that you were like my brother, Who sucked the breasts of my mother! If I found you outside, I would kiss you; Yes, and no one would despise me.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú ê ba̍k-tsiu tī tsuân tē khuàⁿ-lâi khuàⁿ-khì, kiàn-nā tsuan-sim ǹg I ê, I tsiū ē hián-bîng I ê tuā khuì-la̍t kā i pang-tsān. Tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì, lí só͘ kiâⁿ sī gû-gōng; in-uī án-ne, í-āu lí ē ū kau-tsiàn ê tāi-tsì.
English: For the eyes of Yahweh run back and forth throughout the whole earth, to show himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein you have done foolishly; for from henceforth you shall have wars.

Tailo: Guá beh tshun Guá ê tshiú, kong-kik Iô-tah kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn, mā beh tuì tsit-ê só͘-tsāi tsián-tû Ba-al só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, í-ki̍p Ka-mal（ Tsù, Pài ngó͘-siōng ê tsè-si ）ê miâ kah tsè-si.
English: I will stretch out my hand against Judah, and against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem. I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place: the name of the idolatrous and pagan priests,

Tailo: Si-hua-ti-ah ê kiáⁿ-sun, Hat-thil ê kiáⁿ-sun, Po-ke-liat-hat-tse-baim ê kiáⁿ-sun, A-mí ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: the children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth Hazzebaim, the children of Ami.

Tailo: Guá tuì Lí kiû-kiò, kiû Lí kiù guá! Guá beh tsun-siú Lí ê kà-sī.
English: I have called to you. Save me! I will obey your statutes.

Tailo: Tī hia ū tsi̍t-ê phuà-pēⁿ saⁿ-tsa̍p peh nî ê lâng.
English: A certain man was there, who had been sick for thirty-eight years.

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan ū lâng phuà-pēⁿ bô? Nā ū, i tio̍h tshiánn kàu-huē ê tiúⁿ-ló lâi thè i kî-tó, hōng Tsú ê miâ kā i buah iû.
English: Is any among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord,

Tailo: In-uī Lí ê tsû-ài tuā kàu tú thiⁿ; Lí ê sìn-si̍t thàu kàu kiong-tshong.
English: For your great loving kindness reaches to the heavens, And your truth to the skies.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ê ping kah Io-ap tshut-kun tò tńg-.lâi, tuà tsin tsē tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h lâi. Hit sî, Ap-nel bô tī He-bú-lông Ta-bi̍t hia, in-uī Ta-bi̍t í-king sàng i tshut-.khì, i mā pîng-an lī-khui.
English: Behold, the servants of David and Joab came from a foray, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.

Tailo: Guá koh siông-sè khuànn, ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h tshing-tshing bān-bān thiⁿ-sài ê siann, in lóng uî tī pó-tsō kah ua̍h-mi̍h í-ki̍p tiúⁿ-ló ê sì-kho͘-uî,
English: I saw, and I heard something like a voice of many angels around the throne, the living creatures, and the elders; and the number of them was ten thousands of ten thousands, and thousands of thousands;

Tailo: In ē hō͘ to-kiàm thâi-sí, in ē hō͘ iá-káu thun-tsia̍h.
English: They shall be given over to the power of the sword. They shall be jackal food.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I-é-su ìn kóng, Thiaⁿ Siōng-tè ê tō-lí lâi tsun-siú ê lâng koh khah ū hok-khì!
English: But he said, On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tuì sìn I ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng, Lín nā tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsun-siú guá ê tō-lí, tsiū tsin-tsiàⁿ sī guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him, If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples.

Tailo: Ba-al tsiū tsiàu Pa-lân ê uē khì kiâⁿ, tī ta̍k tsō tuâⁿ hiàn tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-káng.
English: Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.

Tailo: In tī Pik-gē káng tō-lí liáu-āu, tsiū lo̍h-khì A-ta-liah.
English: When they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

Tailo: Guá siong-sìn lín tsai guán ū thong-kuè khó-giām.
English: But I hope that you will know that we aren't disqualified.

Tailo: Tuì Mô͘-se-lio̍k tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Bi-ne-ah-kan.
English: They traveled from Moseroth, and encamped in Bene Jaakan.

Tailo: Hiah-ê ua̍h-mi̍h tsáu-lâi tsáu-khì, tshin-tshiūnn sih-nà teh sih.
English: The living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.

Tailo: Iô-tah lâng tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, Iô-tah lâng tuā-siaⁿ huah ê sî, Siōng-tè tsiū tī A-bi-iah kah Iô-tah lâng ê bīn-tsîng, phah-iâⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn.
English: Then the men of Judah gave a shout: and as the men of Judah shouted, it happened, that God struck Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.

Tailo: Sai ê háu kah bíng sai ê siann lóng suah; sai-á-thûn ê tshuì-khí lóng phah-tn̄g.
English: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, The teeth of the young lions, are broken.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá beh tshe-phài sian-ti, tì-huī ê lâng kah king-ha̍k kàu-su khì lín hia. Ū ê ē hō͘ lín sat-hāi á-.sī tìng si̍p-jī-kè; ū ê mā ē hō͘ lín tī huē-tn̂g īng piⁿ phah, tuì tsit-ê siâⁿ kuáⁿ-tio̍k kàu hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: Therefore, behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city;

Tailo: Iâ-kop kóng, Lí kin-á-ji̍t tio̍h kā tuā-kiáⁿ ê miâ-hūn bē hō͘ guá.
English: Jacob said, First, sell me your birthright.

Tailo: Lí ê kun-tuī tshut-khì kong-kik lí ê tuì-ti̍k, tī iâⁿ-pâng tio̍h ka-kī kìm-kài it-tshè ê pháiⁿ tāi.
English: When you go forth in camp against your enemies, then you shall keep you from every evil thing.

Tailo: Gî-tióng khì tsún-pī tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, īng tsi̍t e-huat ê mī-hún tsò bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, bah hē tī khing-.ni̍h, thng té tī ô͘-.ni̍h, tuà kàu siōng tshiū kha, hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: Gideon went in, and made ready a kid, and unleavened cakes of an ephah of meal: the flesh he put in a basket, and he put the broth in a pot, and brought it out to him under the oak, and presented it.

Tailo: Ông tuì i kóng, Guá tio̍h kuí pái kah lí tsiù-tsuā? Lí thok Siōng-tsú ê miâ, tsí ū tio̍h īng tsin-si̍t kā guá kóng!
English: The king said to him, How many times shall I adjure you that you speak to me nothing but the truth in the name of Yahweh?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè hō͘ lín ke-thinn tsin tsē, lí khuàⁿ, lín kin-á-ji̍t tshin-tshiūnn thinn-tíng ê tsheⁿ hiah tsē.
English: Yahweh your God has multiplied you, and behold, you are this day as the stars of the sky for multitude.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kám-siā Siōng-tsú, kiû-kiò I ê miâ, tī bān-bîn ê tiong-kan suan-iông I ê só͘ tsò.
English: Oh give thanks to Yahweh, call on his name; Make known his doings among the peoples.

Tailo: Hui-lī-sū lâng hîng hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè ê kim-uân, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h A-si-to͘t, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Ga-jah, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h A-si-ke-lông, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Gat, tsi̍t lia̍p uī-tio̍h Ik-lóng.
English: These are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned for a trespass offering to Yahweh: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h in ê bīn ê hîng-siōng, in ū lâng ê bīn, in sì-ê tī tsiànn pîng ū sai ê bīn, in sì-ê tī tò pîng ū gû ê bīn, in sì-ê mā ū ing-tsiáu ê bīn.
English: As for the likeness of their faces, they had the face of a man; and they four had the face of a lion on the right side; and they four had the face of an ox on the left side; they four had also the face of an eagle.

Tailo: Hong īng i ê si̍t kā i kńg khí-.lâi; in ē uī-tio̍h in ê tsè-sū tì-sú kiàn-siàu.
English: The wind has wrapped her up in its wings; And they shall be disappointed because of their sacrifices.

Tailo: I tuà jîn-bîn ê lé-mi̍h, thâi hit tsiah tsò jîn-bîn sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, uī-tio̍h tsuē lâi hiàn, kah khí-thâu ê sio-siâng.
English: He presented the people's offering, and took the goat of the sin offering which was for the people, and killed it, and offered it for sin, like the first.

Tailo: Hua-lè-suh ê kiáⁿ, He-tsú-lóng, Ha-mul2.
English: The sons of Perez: Hezron, and Hamul.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng khiā-teh kî-tó kóng, ' Siōng-tè ah, guá kám-siā Lí, in-uī guá bô tshin-tshiūnn kî-tha ê lâng tham-tsâi, put-gī, kan-îm, mā bô tshin-tshiūnn tsit-ê thiu-suè ê lâng.
English: The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortioners, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

Tailo: tsiū tshe lâng khì The-ko-uah, tuì hia kiò tsi̍t-ê tshong-bîng ê tsa-bó͘ lâng lâi, kā i kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí ké-tsò tuà hà ê, tshīng hàu saⁿ, m̄-thang īng iû buah sing-khu, tio̍h tsng tsò uī-tio̍h sí-lâng tsin kú pi-ai ê tsa-bó͘ lâng,
English: Joab sent to Tekoa, and fetched there a wise woman, and said to her, please act like a mourner, and put on mourning clothing, Please, and don't anoint yourself with oil, but be as a woman who has a long time mourned for the dead:

Tailo: Kóng, Kok-uī, guá khuànn tsit pái kiâⁿ-tsûn, m̄-nā huè-bu̍t kah tsûn, liân lán ê sèⁿ-miā to ē tú-tio̍h guî-hiám kah tuā sún-sit.
English: and said to them, Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.

Tailo: Beh kàu hia̍t piⁿ ê sî, ông tshut ai-siong ê siann kiò Ta-ni-el, tuì i kóng, Íng-ua̍h Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-ni-el, lí ê Siōng-tè, lí só͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh ho̍k-sāi ê, kám ē kiù lí thuat-lī hiah-ê sai?
English: When he came near to the den to Daniel, he cried with a lamentable voice; the king spoke and said to Daniel, Daniel, servant of the living God, is your God, whom you serve continually, able to deliver you from the lions?

Tailo: Tse sī beh ìng-giām in ê lu̍t-huat só͘ kì-tsài ê uē, In bô-iân bô-kò͘ uàn-hūn guá. (tsù, SPh 35:19; 69:4)
English: But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, They hated me without a cause.'

Tailo: Guān I îng-kng ê miâ íng-uán siū o-ló. Guān I ê îng-kng tshiong-muá tsuân tē! A-men! Koh A-men!
English: Blessed be his glorious name forever! Let the whole earth be filled with his glory! Amen and amen.

Tailo: Tse sī uī-tio̍h ta̍k tsióng thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu kah tshng,
English: This is the law for any plague of leprosy, and for an itch,

Tailo: Siōng-tè tiān lāi kim-gîn ê khì-kū, to̍h-sī Nep-kat-ne-tsal tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tiān lāi the̍h tshut-.lâi, tuà-khì hē tī Ba-bú-lông ê biō ê, Ko-le-si ông tuì Ba-bú-lông ê biō lāi the̍h tshut-.lâi, kau hō͘ i só͘ siat-li̍p ê tsóng-tok, miâ kiò-tsò Se-si-ba-tsal,
English: The gold and silver vessels also of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè bô tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì tsò bē-kàu.
English: For everything spoken by God is possible.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h koh tuì I-su-la-el lâng kóng: Kiàn-nā I-su-la-el lâng á-.sī tī I-su-la-el tiong kià-kha ê tshut-guā lâng, īng ka-kī ê kiáⁿ-jî hiàn hō͘ Mô͘-lo̍k ê, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí, hit tē-hng ê lâng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí.
English: Moreover, you shall tell the children of Israel, Anyone of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners in Israel, who gives any of his seed to Molech; he shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ka-kī tsún-pī, tsiàu lín ê tsong-tso̍k, lín ê pan-lia̍t lâi tsun-thàn I-su-la-el ông Ta-bi̍t só͘ kì ê kah i ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng só͘ kì ê.
English: Prepare yourselves after your fathers' houses by your divisions, according to the writing of David king of Israel, and according to the writing of Solomon his son.

Tailo: Lí beh tsia̍h, tsóng-.sī, tsia̍h bē pá; lí ê khang-hi ē tī lí lāi-bīn. Lí ē puaⁿ-suá, tsóng-.sī, an-jiân tuà mi̍h-kiāⁿ khì; lí só͘ tuà-.khì ê, Guá lóng beh kau hō͘ to-kiàm.
English: You shall eat, but not be satisfied. Your humiliation will be in your midst. You will store up, but not save; And that which you save I will give up to the sword.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hiah-ê ū bîng-bōng ê lâng, bô-lūn in ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tē-uī, tuì guá lóng bô khah-tsua̍h, in-uī Siōng-tè bô īng guā-māu-lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn lâng; hiah-ê ū bîng-bōng ê lâng, tuì guá pīng bô ke-thinn siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: But from those who were reputed to be important (whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God doesn't show partiality to man)they, I say, who were respected imparted nothing to me,

Tailo: Guá beh tuān-tsua̍t lín só͘ uá-khò ê bí-niûⁿ, hit sî beh ū tsa̍p-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tī tsi̍t-ê lô͘ kā lín piak piáⁿ, tshìn lín ê gia̍h ê tsia̍h-mi̍h hō͘ lín, lín siūⁿ beh tsia̍h mā tsia̍h bē pá.
English: When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver your bread again by weight: and you shall eat, and not be satisfied.

Tailo: Si-phian Tē-it Kuàn(1~41 phiⁿ） Bô kiâⁿ pháiⁿ lâng ê kè-bô͘, bô khiā tsuē-jîn ê lō͘, bô kah bú-bān ê lâng tsē tsò-hué, tsit khuán lâng ū hok-khì.
English: Blessed is the man who doesn't walk in the counsel of the wicked, Nor stand in the way of sinners, Nor sit in the seat of scoffers;

Tailo: La̍h-ban ìn Iâ-kop kóng, Tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ sī guá ê, tsiah-ê gín-á-.sī guá ê; tsiah-ê iûⁿ-kûn mā sī guá ê, só͘-ū lí só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lóng sī guá ê. Guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kah in só͘ seⁿ ê gín-á, kin-á-ji̍t guá kám ē tuì in tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Laban answered Jacob, The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, the flocks are my flocks, and all that you see is mine: and what can I do this day to these my daughters, or to their children whom they have borne?

Tailo: Lâng puaⁿ tsio̍h-thâu lâi hē tī hia̍t kháu, ông īng ka-kī ê ìn kah tāi-sîn ê ìn kā i hong ba̍t, hō͘ Ta-ni-el ê tāi-tsì lóng bē kái-uāⁿ-.tit.
English: A stone was brought, and laid on the mouth of the den; and the king sealed it with his own signet, and with the signet of his lords; that nothing might be changed concerning Daniel.

Tailo: Án-ne, Nim-sī ê sun, Iô-sa-huat ê kiáⁿ E-hú puē-puān Io-lâm. Io-lâm kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn bat pé-siú Gi-lia̍t ê La̍h-mot, in-uī A-lâm ông Ha-tsa-el ê iân-kò͘;
English: So Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi conspired against Joram. (Now Joram was keeping Ramoth Gilead, he and all Israel, because of Hazael king of Syria;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tuì Siōng-tsú só͘ siū ê hūn-gia̍h, kiông-pō ê lâng tuì Tsuân-lîng-.ê só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p to̍h-sī tsit-ê.
English: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, The heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Tng hit ji̍t, Guá beh kā I-su-la-el tē, hái ê tang pîng, lâng só͘ king-kuè ê suaⁿ-kok, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ Go͘-k tsò bōng-tē lâi tsó͘-tòng king-kuè ê lâng ê lō͘. Tī hia, lâng ē bâi-tsòng Go͘-k kah i ê tsìng lâng; ē kā hit só͘-tsāi tshing-tsò ' Ha-mong-go͘k（ Tsù, Hi-bú-lâi bûn ê im-tha̍k, ì-sù sī Khǹg Go͘-k kun si-thé ）ê suaⁿ-kok'.
English: It shall happen in that day, that I will give to Gog a place for burial in Israel, the valley of those who pass through on the east of the sea; and it shall stop those who pass through: and there shall they bury Gog and all his multitude; and they shall call it The valley of Hamon Gog.

Tailo: Guān Lí kā Lí ê siū-khì piàⁿ-lo̍h-khì hiah-ê m̄-bat Lí ê guā-pang, í-ki̍p hiah-ê bô kiû-kiò Lí ê miâ ê lia̍t kok.
English: Pour out your wrath on the nations that don't know you; On the kingdoms that don't call on your name;

Tailo: In hn̄g-hn̄g gia̍h thâu khuànn, bē jīn-tit i, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu; ta̍k lâng thiah-li̍h guā-saⁿ, ǹg thiⁿ tī ka-kī ê thâu-khak iā thô͘-sua hún.
English: When they lifted up their eyes from a distance, and didn't recognize him, they raised their voices, and wept; and they each tore his robe, and sprinkled dust on their heads toward the sky.

Tailo: Koh kā in só͘-ū ê huè-bu̍t kah tsîⁿ-tsâi, it-tshè ê gín-á kah tsa-bó͘ lâng, í-ki̍p ta̍k tè tshù só͘-ū ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: and all their wealth. They took captive all their little ones and their wives, and took as plunder everything that was in the house.

Tailo: Ial-mut, A-tu-lâm, So͘-koh, A-tse-kah,
English: Jarmuth, and Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah,

Tailo: Tú-hó ū nn̄g-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tsē tī lō͘ piⁿ, thiaⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su tuì hia king-kuè, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tsú, Ta-bi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun ah, liân-bín guán!
English: Behold, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out, Lord, have mercy on us, you son of David!

Tailo: M̄-kam īng tshê-á kuán-kà kiáⁿ-jî ê lâng si̍t-tsāi bô teh thiàⁿ kiáⁿ; nā-sī thiàⁿ kiánn, tsiū ē tsiàu-sî tsik-tok.
English: One who spares the rod hates his son, But one who loves him is careful to discipline him.

Tailo: Τio̍h khì kìⁿ tong-sî tsò tsè-si ê, kā i kóng, ' Guá kin-á-ji̍t tuì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè kóng bîng, guá í-king lâi-kàu Siōng-tsú tuì lán ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán ê tē. '
English: You shall come to the priest who shall be in those days, and tell him, I profess this day to Yahweh your God, that I am come to the land which Yahweh swore to our fathers to give us.

Tailo: In-uī Jîn-tsú sī An-hioh-ji̍t ê Tsú.
English: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.

Tailo: King-tián ū kì-tsài, Beh khua-kháu ê lâng, tio̍h īng Tsú ê tsok-uî lâi khua-kháu. (tsù, ILM 9:24)
English: But he who boasts, let him boast in the Lord.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sioh Lí ê lu̍t-huat ê lâng ū tuā pîng-an, bô tsi̍t hāng ē tîⁿ-puàⁿ in ê kha.
English: Those who love your law have great peace. Nothing causes them to stumble.

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū ê sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, ū ê sī kái-tsong ji̍p Iô-tá-iah-kàu ê lâng, mā ū Ku-lé-té lâng, A-la-puh lâng. Lán lóng thiaⁿ-tio̍h in īng lán ê gí-giân teh kóng Siōng-tè só͘ tsò uí-tāi ê tāi-tsì.
English: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè koh tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guá it-tīng tuā-tuā ke-thinn lí huâi-īn ê kan-khó͘, lí ē kan-khó͘ seⁿ kiáⁿ. Lí ē luân-bō͘ lí ê tiōng-hu, i ē kā lí kuán-hat.
English: To the woman he said, I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bring forth children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.

Tailo: Siōng-tè hō͘ lín kah Ki-tok I-é-su kiat-liân, hō͘ Ki-tok tsiâⁿ-tsò lán tuì Siōng-tè lâi ê tì-huī, koh hō͘ lán kah Siōng-tè hô-hó, tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōng-tè sìng-kiat ê tsú-bîn, iū-koh hō͘ lán tit-tio̍h kiù-sio̍k.
English: But of him, you are in Christ Jesus, who was made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification, and redemption:

Tailo: Lí tiāⁿ-tio̍h kài-hān hō͘ tsuí bē-tàng puâⁿ-kuè, bô koh tò tńg-lâi jia-khàm tē bīn.
English: You have set a boundary that they may not pass over; That they don't turn again to cover the earth.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia tsiū ìn kóng, Lín í-king ka-kī hun-pia̍t kui hō͘ Siōng-tsú, tio̍h kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tuà tsè-mi̍h kah siā-un-tsè kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān. Huē-tsiòng tsiū tuà tsè-mi̍h kah siā-un-tsè lâi, kiàn-nā kam-sim lo̍k-ì ê mā lóng tuà sio-tsè lâi.
English: Then Hezekiah answered, Now you have consecrated yourselves to Yahweh; come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of Yahweh. The assembly brought in sacrifices and thank offerings; and as many as were of a willing heart brought burnt offerings.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Tsú kah guá tông-tsāi, hō͘ guá ū khuì-la̍t thang tshiong-hun suan-iông sìn-sit, hō͘ só͘-ū ê guā-pang lâng lóng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h. Tsuè-āu guá mā tuì sai ê tshuì hō͘ lâng kiù tshut-.lâi.
English: But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

Tailo: It-sa-kal ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k; sio̍k To͘-la̍h ê, ū To͘-la̍h tso̍k; sio̍k Phu-uah ê, ū Phu-uah tso̍k;
English: The sons of Issachar after their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the family of the Punites;

Tailo: Tng tseh-kî ê tshit ji̍t tiong, i tio̍h tsún-pī sio-tsè lâi hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, liân-liân tshit kang, ta̍k kang tio̍h īng tshit tsiah gû-káng kah tshit tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, lóng bô khuat-tiám ê. Ta̍k kang mā tio̍h tsún-pī tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, lâi tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: The seven days of the feast he shall prepare a burnt offering to Yahweh, seven bulls and seven rams without blemish daily the seven days; and a male goat daily for a sin offering.

Tailo: In bē kì-tit I ê kuân-lîng, mā bē kì-.tit kiù-sio̍k in thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k ê ji̍t.
English: They didn't remember his hand, Nor the day when he redeemed them from the adversary;

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá — bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tuì lín pìⁿ bīn, kàng tsai-hō tì-sú tsâu-bia̍t Iô-tah ê kûn-tsiòng.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, even to cut off all Judah.

Tailo: Guān sù pîng-an ê Siōng-tè, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ta̍k hāng hó tāi-tsì, lâi tsun-tsiàu I ê tsí-ì; guān I thong-kuè I-é-su Ki-tok, tī lán ê sim-lāi tsò tāi-tsì, lâi hō͘ I huann-hí; guān îng-kng kui tī Ki-tok, kàu tāi-tāi bô suah. A-men!
English: make you complete in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is well pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-liáu tsiū tshim-ji̍p su-khó, guá khuàⁿ-liáu tsiū tit-tio̍h kà-sī.
English: Then I saw, and considered well. I saw, and received instruction:

Tailo: Tuì Iâ-kop só͘ seⁿ ê, tsóng-kiōng ū tshit-tsa̍p lâng. Iô-sé-huh í-king tī Ai-gi̍p.
English: All the souls who came out of Jacob's body were seventy souls, and Joseph was in Egypt already.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn lâi-kàu Be-thel, tī hia tsē tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng kàu ê-hng, tshut siaⁿ tuā thî-khàu, kóng,
English: The people came to Bethel, and sat there until evening before God, and lifted up their voices, and wept sore.

Tailo: Suî-jiân bû-hua-kó tshiū bô huat m̂, phû-tô tshiū bô kiat kué-tsí, kaⁿ-ná tshiū mā bô siu-sîng, tshân-hn̂g bô tshut ngó͘-kok, tiâu lāi bô puàⁿ tsiah iûⁿ, gû-tiâu mā bô gû;
English: For though the fig tree doesn't flourish, Nor fruit be in the vines; The labor of the olive fails, The fields yield no food; The flocks are cut off from the fold, And there is no herd in the stalls:

Tailo: Kì-jiân tuì só͘-ū ê ua̍h-mi̍h ê ba̍k-tsiu ún-ba̍t; tuì khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu am-khàm.
English: Seeing it is hidden from the eyes of all living, And kept close from the birds of the sky.

Tailo: Lín hō͘ guá ê sim iu-khó͘, īng uē siong-hāi guá tio̍h kàu tang-sî?
English: How long will you torment me, And crush me with words?

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tsiū tshut siaⁿ tuā khàu, Ai-gi̍p lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, Huâ-láu ê ke mā ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: He wept aloud. The Egyptians heard, and the house of Pharaoh heard.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông A-sah saⁿ-tsa̍p it nî, Om-lī tsē-uī tsò I-su-la-el ông, kiōng tsa̍p-jī nî; tī Til-tsah tsò ông la̍k nî.
English: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah began Omri to reign over Israel, and reigned twelve years: six years reigned he in Tirzah.

Tailo: Thih-khì í-king tūn, nā bô buâ lāi i ê tshuì, tsiū tio̍h ke tshut tsin tsē la̍t; to̍k-to̍k tit-tio̍h tì-huī ê kà-sī tsiū ū lī-ik.
English: If the axe is blunt, and one doesn't sharpen the edge, then he must use more strength; but skill brings success.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el kóng, Siōng-tsú huann-hí sio-tsè ê tsè-sū, kám tshin-tshiūnn huann-hí lâng tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê uē? Lí khuàⁿ, tsun-thàn iâⁿ-kuè hiàn tsè, tsun-thàn sī iâⁿ-kuè iûⁿ-káng ê iû.
English: Samuel said, Has Yahweh as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of Yahweh? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to listen than the fat of rams.

Tailo: In tuì Ai-gi̍p bé-.lâi ê tshia, muí tâi kè-ta̍t gîn la̍k pah si-khel, bé muí tsi̍t tsiah kè-ta̍t tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p si-khel. Hiat lâng tsiah-ê ông kah A-lâm tsiah-ê ông, lóng tuì in king-tshiú tsiàu án-ne tuà tshut-.lâi.
English: They brought up and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred pieces of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.

Tailo: I-tsu-hal ê kiáⁿ, tuā ê sī Si-ló-mi̍t.
English: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.

Tailo: In-uī Lí tsò tuā, koh kiânn kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì; tsí ū Lí sī Siōng-tè.
English: For you are great, and do wondrous things. You are God alone.

Tailo: M̄-thang î-suá tsá-tsîng só͘ li̍p ê tē-kài, mā m̄-thang tshim-tsiàm ko͘-jî ê tshân-tē.
English: Don't move the ancient boundary stone. Don't encroach on the fields of the fatherless:

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī Lí ê huat sìng-tē tuā siū-khì; in-uī Lí kā guá kí-khí, koh kā guá hiat lo̍h-.khì.
English: Because of your indignation and your wrath, For you have taken me up, and thrown me away.

Tailo: Sī-sè sī-tuā lóng tī hia; lô͘-po̍k thuat-lī i ê tsú-lâng.
English: The small and the great are there. The servant is free from his master.

Tailo: Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-gō͘ ji̍t.
English: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.

Tailo: E-lí-siah mn̄g i kóng, Guá ē-tàng kā lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí kā guá kóng; lí tshù lāi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h? kuáⁿ-hū kóng, Lí ê lú-pī tshù lāi tshun tsi̍t pân iû, í-guā lóng bô puàⁿ-hāng.
English: Elisha said to her, What shall I do for you? tell me; what have you in the house? She said, Your handmaid has nothing in the house, except a pot of oil.

Tailo: Si-mí ū tsa̍p la̍k-ê kiáⁿ kah la̍k-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, i ê hiann-tī ê kiáⁿ-jî bô guā tsē, in tāi-ke bô tshin-tshiūnn Iô-tah tso̍k ê jîn-ting hiah tsē.
English: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers didn't have many children, neither did all their family multiply like the children of Judah.

Tailo: Guá bat tshuā lí tshut Ai-gi̍p tē, kiù-sio̍k lí thuat-lī tsò lô͘-lē ê tshù; tshe Mô͘-se kah A-lông, kah Mi-lí-ám tī lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: For I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, And redeemed you out of the house of bondage. I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, tī Iô-tah tē, lâng it-tīng tshiùnn tsit-ê kua, kóng: Guán ū kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ. I ē īng kiù-un li̍p-tsò siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, tsò guā-tîng siâⁿ.
English: In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city. God appoints salvation for walls and bulwarks.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lí tsò I-su-la-el ê kàu-su, liân tse to m̄-tsai, sī-.bô?
English: Jesus answered him, Are you the teacher of Israel, and don't understand these things?

Tailo: Án-ne, in tsiū īng soh-á kā I-é-lí-miah khiú tshut kó͘-tséⁿ. I-é-lí-miah iû-guân tuà tī khu-liû-só͘ ê īⁿ lāi.
English: So they drew up Jeremiah with the cords, and took him up out of the dungeon: and Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.

Tailo: I ē tsioh lí, lí mā bô thang tsioh i; i ē tsò thâu, lí ē tsò bué.
English: He shall lend to you, and you shall not lend to him: he shall be the head, and you shall be the tail.

Tailo: E-hua-há-tsuh khún-kiû Siōng-tsú, Siōng-tsú thiaⁿ i, in-uī I khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-su-la-el lâng siū tsè-ap, to̍h-sī A-lâm ông kā in tsè-ap.
English: Jehoahaz begged Yahweh, and Yahweh listened to him; for he saw the oppression of Israel, how that the king of Syria oppressed them.

Tailo: Αp-sa-lôm kā A-hi-to-huel kóng, Lín tio̍h kè-uē, khuànn lán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kiânn?
English: Then said Absalom to Ahithophel, Give your counsel what we shall do.

Tailo: Bān-bîn lóng ē gióng-bōng I ê miâ.
English: In his name, the nations will hope.

Tailo: Io-lâm ông tńg-khì E-tsu-le-el, beh i-tī i ê siong, to̍h-sī i tī La̍h-mot kah A-lâm ông Ha-tsa-el kau-tsiàn ê sî, A-lâm lâng kā i phah-tio̍h ê. Iô-tah ông Io-lâm ê kiáⁿ A-ha-tsiah lo̍h-khì E-tsu-le-el, beh thàm-hóng A-hap ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm, in-uī i ū phuà-pēⁿ.
English: King Joram returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Joram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá ê tông-pau ai-siong ê siann tuì hn̄g-hn̄g ê só͘-tsāi lâi, kóng, Siōng-tsú kám bô tī Si-óng? Si-óng ê ông kám bô tī hit lāi-bīn? Siōng-tsú kóng, In ná ē īng tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng kah guā-pang hi-ké ê sîn-bîng lâi kik Guá ê siū-khì?
English: Behold, the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people from a land that is very far off: isn't Yahweh in Zion? Isn't her King in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their engraved images, and with foreign vanities?

Tailo: Jîn-bîn kóng, Siu-sîng ê sî í-king kuè-.khì, jua̍h-thinn ê ji̍t í-king tsīn, guán iáu bô tit-tio̍h kiù!
English: The harvest is past, the summer is ended, and we are not saved.

Tailo: I hō͘ guá ê bah kah phuê ta-ta-.khì; I at-tn̄g guá ê kut-thâu.
English: My flesh and my skin has he made old; he has broken my bones.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá tsai lâng ê lō͘, m̄-sī tuì ka-kī, kiâⁿ lō͘ ê lâng mā bē-tàng tsú-ì ka-kī ê kha-pō͘.
English: Yahweh, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man who walks to direct his steps.

Tailo: Sìng Sîn kā guá kóng, tio̍h kah in khì, tuì lâng m̄-thang ū tsha-pia̍t khuàⁿ-thāi. Koh ū la̍k-ê sìn-tô͘ kah guá-.khì, guán lóng ji̍p-khì Kol-né-lioh ê tshù.
English: The Spirit told me to go with them, without discriminating. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el kā Sàu-lô kóng, Lí ná ē kā guá kiáu-jiáu, khan guá khí-.lâi? Sàu-lô kóng, Guá khùn-khó͘ kàu-ki̍k; in-uī Hui-lī-sū lâng kah guá kau-tsiàn, Siōng-tè mā lī-khui guá, bô koh īng sian-ti á-.sī bîn-bāng lâi ìn-tap guá, só͘-í, guá tshiáⁿ lí lâi, thang tsí-sī guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kiânn.
English: Samuel said to Saul, Why have you disquieted me, to bring me up? Saul answered, I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God is departed from me, and answers me no more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefore I have called you, that you may make known to me what I shall do.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Siōng-tsú ê tshiú kám sī té? Taⁿ lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê uē ū tuì lí ìng-giām á-bô.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Has Yahweh's hand grown short? now shall you see whether my word shall happen to you or not.

Tailo: Tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, tuì íng-uán kàu íng-uán. A-men! Koh A-men!
English: Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, From everlasting and to everlasting! Amen and amen. BOOK II

Tailo: I tsi̍t-ē tn̄g-khuì tsiū kui thó͘; i ê kè-uē tī hit ji̍t tsiū piàn khang-khang.
English: His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth. In that very day, his thoughts perish.

Tailo: Tī siâⁿ mn̂g hia ū sì-ê thái-ko ê, in tsò-hué kóng, Lán ná ē tsē tī tsia teh thìng-hāu sí?
English: Now there were four leprous men at the entrance of the gate: and they said one to another, Why sit we here until we die?

Tailo: In ê sán-gia̍p ê tē-kài sī Tso-lah, E-si-ta-ol, I-jíⁿ-sī-bi̍k,
English: The border of their inheritance was Zorah, and Eshtaol, and Irshemesh,

Tailo: Lín iàu-kín ê sī tio̍h ū nāi-sim, tsiah ē-tàng si̍t-hiān Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì, thang niá-siū I só͘ ìng-ín ê hok-khì.
English: For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.

Tailo: In tsiū sái-lōng lâng tshut-lâi kóng, Guán bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h i kóng huí-pòng Mô͘-se kah siat-to̍k Siōng-tè ê uē.
English: Then they secretly induced men to say, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, hit ji̍t teh beh kàu, tshin-tshiūnn hué-lô͘ teh to̍h, kiàn-nā kiau-ngō͘ ê kah kiâⁿ pháiⁿ ê ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tsháu-iù, tī hit-ê beh lâi ê ji̍t ē tsuân-pō͘ kā i sio-tiāu, kin kah ki lóng bô lâu-.leh.
English: For, behold, the day comes, it burns as a furnace; and all the proud, and all who work wickedness, will be stubble; and the day that comes will burn them up, says Yahweh of Armies, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p ē pha-hng, E-tóm ē piàn-tsò pha-hng ê khòng-iá, in-uī in pō-gio̍k Iô-tah lâng, koh tī in ê tē lâu bô tsuē ê lâng ê hueh.
English: Egypt will be a desolation, And Edom will be a desolate wilderness, For the violence done to the children of Judah, Because they have shed innocent blood in their land.

Tailo: I tio̍h tshut-lâi-kàu Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng ê tuâⁿ hia, kiat-tsīng tsè-tuâⁿ, mā tio̍h the̍h tām-po̍h gû-káng-á ê hueh kah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng ê hueh, buah tī tuâⁿ tíng hiah-ê kak ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He shall go out to the altar that is before Yahweh and make atonement for it, and shall take some of the bull's blood, and some of the goat's blood, and put it on the horns of the altar round about.

Tailo: Tsit sî liáu-āu, Má-ná-se tī Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ guā khí tshiûⁿ, tī Gi-hóng ê sai pîng, tī suaⁿ-kok lāi, kàu hî-mn̂g ê mn̂g-kháu, uî-se̍h O͘-phue-l, tshiûⁿ khí tsin kuân, koh siat-li̍p kun-tiúⁿ tī Iô-tah hiah-ê kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ lāi.
English: Now after this he built an outer wall to the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance at the fish gate; and he compassed Ophel about with it, and raised it up to a very great height: and he put valiant captains in all the fortified cities of Judah.

Tailo: Mā in-uī lí ê pē ê Siōng-tè, I ē pang-tsān lí; koh in-uī hit-ê Tsuân-lîng-.ê, I ē kā lí sù-hok; I ē kā thinn-tíng kàng-lo̍h ê hok-khì, tshim-ian só͘ khǹg ê hok-khì, í-ki̍p tsia̍h ling sing-sán ê hok-khì, lóng hō͘ lí.
English: Even by the God of your father, who will help you, By the Almighty, who will bless you, With blessings of heaven above, Blessings of the deep that lies below, Blessings of the breasts, and of the womb.

Tailo: Lí uī ka-kī só͘ tsō ê sîn-bîng tī tó-uī? I nā ē kiù lí, tī lí tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê sî, tsiū tio̍h khí-lâi kiù lí. Iô-tah, lí ê sîn-bîng ê sò͘-gia̍h kah lí ê siâⁿ ê sò͘-gia̍h pêⁿ-pêⁿ hiah tsē.
English: But where are your gods that you have made you? let them arise, if they can save you in the time of your trouble: for according to the number of your cities are your gods, Judah.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I-é-su tuì in kóng, Sī guá là, m̄-bián kiaⁿ!
English: But he said to them, I AM. Don't be afraid.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí kā Lí ê tō-lō͘ tsí-sī guá; guá beh tsiàu Lí ê tsin-lí lâi kiâⁿ; hō͘ guá īng tsuan-it ê sim kìng-uì Lí ê miâ.
English: Teach me your way, Yahweh. I will walk in your truth. Make my heart undivided to fear your name.

Tailo: Ap-nel koh kā A-sa-hel kóng, Lí ua̍t tńg-.khì, mài koh jiok guá! Guá ná tio̍h kā lí phah tó tē? Nā án-ne, guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h bīn-tsú thang khì kìⁿ lí ê a-hiaⁿ Io-ap?
English: Abner said again to Asahel, Turn you aside from following me: why should I strike you to the ground? how then should I hold up my face to Joab your brother?

Tailo: Lí tī tsit só͘-tsāi m̄-thang tshuā bó͘, seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: You shall not take a wife, neither shall you have sons or daughters, in this place.

Tailo: Ū suan-hua ê siann tuì siâⁿ lāi huat-tshut! Ū hiáng-siaⁿ tuì tiān lāi huat-tshut! Tsiū-sī Siōng-tsú pò-ìng I ê tuì-ti̍k ê siann.
English: A voice of tumult from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of Yahweh that renders recompense to his enemies.

Tailo: Guán bô tshin-tshiūnn Mô͘-se tio̍h īng phè tà ka-kī ê bīn, hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng bē tit thang tsù-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h i bīn ê îng-kng tsiām-tsiām siau-sit.
English: and not as Moses, who put a veil on his face, that the children of Israel wouldn't look steadfastly on the end of that which was passing away.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Tsú tsài-lîm ê ji̍t ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tsha̍t-á hut-jiân lîm-kàu. Tī hit ji̍t, hiah-ê thiⁿ ē tī tuā ê hiáng-siaⁿ tiong siau-bia̍t, hiah-ê thian-thé ē hō͘ hué sio iûⁿ-khì, tē kah kî-tiong ê bān-mi̍h mā lóng huí-bia̍t khì.
English: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in which the heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will be dissolved with fervent heat, and the earth and the works that are in it will be burned up.

Tailo: Khì pān song-sū ê ke pí khì iàn-lo̍k ê ke khah hó; in-uī tse sī tsìng lâng ê kiat-kio̍k, ua̍h ê lâng mā ē kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì hē tī sim-.ni̍h.
English: It is better to go to the house of mourning than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men, and the living should take this to heart.

Tailo: Thinn tíng ê tsheⁿ tuī-lo̍h tē, tshin-tshiūnn bû-hua-kó tshiū hō͘ tuā hong sàu-kuè, iáu-buē si̍k ê kué-tsí lak liáu-liáu.
English: The stars of the sky fell to the earth, like a fig tree dropping its unripe figs when it is shaken by a great wind.

Tailo: In-uī guá kui ji̍t tú-tio̍h tsai-hō; ta̍k tsá-khí siū tsik-pī.
English: For all day long have I been plagued, And punished every morning.
