Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì i kóng, Lí tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng só͘ kî-tó kah khún-kiû ê, Guá lóng ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h. Guá í-king kā lí só͘ khí tsit king tiān hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, hō͘ Guá ê miâ íng-uán tī hia; Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu, Guá ê sim mā ē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī hia.
English: Yahweh said to him, I have heard your prayer and your supplication, that you have made before me: I have made this house holy, which you have built, to put my name there forever; and my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.

Tailo: Lí ê hiann-tī nā lī-khui lí hn̄g, á-.sī lí m̄-bat i, tsiū tio̍h khan kàu lí ê tshù, lâu tī lí hia, thìng-hāu lí ê hiann-tī lâi tshuē, lí tsiah hîng i.
English: If your brother isn't near to you, or if you don't know him, then you shall bring it home to your house, and it shall be with you until your brother seek after it, and you shall restore it to him.

Tailo: Kā hiah-ê siâⁿ kah tsuân pîng-guân, í-ki̍p siâⁿ lāi só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn, liân tē-bīn tsiūⁿ sing-tióng ê lóng huí-huāi.
English: He overthrew those cities, all the plain, all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew on the ground.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí lâi tsiap-la̍p tsit uī Tsú lāi ê hiann-tī, mā tio̍h tsun-tiōng tsit khuán ê lâng.
English: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all joy, and hold such in honor,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, m̄-thang pàng-sak guá! Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, m̄-thang lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g!
English: Don't forsake me, Yahweh. My God, don't be far from me.

Tailo: Ông tē-tshit nî gō͘-.gue̍h, E-tsu-la̍h lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: He came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Guá beh uī-tio̍h in kah tshân-iá ê tsáu-siù, kah khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu, í-ki̍p tē-tsiūⁿ ê thâng-thuā li̍p-iok; Guá mā beh tuì tsit-ê só͘-tsāi at-tn̄g kiong, to kah kau-tsiàn, hō͘ in ē-tàng an-jiân tó-teh khùn.
English: In that day I will make a covenant for them with the animals of the field, And with the birds of the sky, And with the creeping things of the ground. I will break the bow, the sword, and the battle out of the land, And will make them lie down safely.

Tailo: O-ba-tiah tī lō͘-.ni̍h, E-li-iah tú-tio̍h i, O-ba-tiah jīn-tit i, tsiū phak lo̍h-.khì, kóng, Lí kám sī guá ê tsú E-li-iah?
English: As Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Is it you, my lord Elijah?

Tailo: Tsit nn̄g hāng lîm-kàu lí, siáⁿ lâng ē thè lí ai-siong? Tsiū-sī ū sue-pāi kah bia̍t-bông, ki-hng kah to-kiàm; Guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ an-uì lí?
English: These two things have happened to you. Who will bemoan you? Desolation and destruction, and the famine and the sword; how shall I comfort you?

Tailo: In-uī lín ka-kī tsai, Tsú tsài-lîm ê ji̍t ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tsha̍t-á, tī àm-sî bô-ì-tiong lâi-kàu.
English: For you yourselves know well that the day of the Lord comes like a thief in the night.

Tailo: In-uī I kì-liām I sîn-sìng ê ìng-ín, mā kì-liām I ê lô͘-po̍k — A-bu-la-hàm.
English: For he remembered his holy word, And Abraham, his servant.

Tailo: Muí pak tiùⁿ tio̍h tn̂g jī-tsa̍p peh tiú, khuah sì tiú, tiùⁿ lóng tio̍h sio-siâng ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains shall have one measure.

Tailo: I tio̍h tshuā tsāi-sik-lí tsò bó͘.
English: He shall take a wife in her virginity.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán ê un-tián koh khah tuā, in-uī king-tián ū kì-tsài, Siōng-tè kah kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng tuì-ti̍k, siúⁿ-sù un-tián hō͘ khiam-pi ê lâng. (tsù, TsG 3:34)
English: But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.

Tailo: Tuā tsuí huàn-lām ê sî, Siōng-tsú tsē-uī tsò ông; Siōng-tsú tsē-uī tsò ông, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh sat enthroned at the Flood. Yes, Yahweh sits as King forever.

Tailo: Koh khióng-kiaⁿ lí gia̍h thâu ǹg thiⁿ khuànn Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ hun-phài hō͘ thiⁿ-ē bān-kok ê ji̍t, gue̍h, tsheⁿ, to̍h-sī thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng, lí tsiū siū ín-iú, khì kìng-pài ho̍k-sāi in.
English: and lest you lift up your eyes to the sky, and when you see the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the army of the sky, you are drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which Yahweh your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole sky.

Tailo: In king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tuì muá-gue̍h í-siōng, tsiàu in hiah-ê tsa-po͘ gín-á ê sò͘-gia̍h, in só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê jîn-sò͘, tsóng-kiōng ū tshit-tshing gō͘-pah miâ.
English: Those who were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, even those who were numbered of them were seven thousand five hundred.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng ho̍k-sāi lí, lia̍t kok kuī-pài lí, lí tsò lí hiann-tī ê tsú, lí ê lāu-bú ê kiáⁿ kā lí kuī-pài; tsiù-tsó͘ lí ê siū tsiù-tsó͘, tsiok-hok lí ê tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Let peoples serve you, And nations bow down to you. Be lord over your brothers; Let your mother's sons bow down to you. Cursed be everyone who curses you; Blessed be everyone who blesses you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá Mí-tiân ê sing-lí lâng tuì hia kuè, i ê a-hiaⁿ tsiū kā Iô-sé-huh tuì tséⁿ lāi giú khí-.lâi, kā i bē hō͘ I-si-ma-el lâng, tit-tio̍h jī-tsa̍p-ê gîn-á. Hiah-ê lâng tsiū tuà Iô-sé-huh khì Ai-gi̍p.
English: Midianites who were merchants passed by, and they drew and lifted up Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver. They brought Joseph into Egypt.

Tailo: Ge-tá-lia̍h tuì in kah sio̍k in ê lâng tsiù-tsuā kóng, Lín m̄-bián kiaⁿ Kal-tí-ah ê jîn-sîn, tsò lín tuà tsit só͘-tsāi, ho̍k-sāi Ba-bú-lông ông, tsiū thang tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Gedaliah swore to them and to their men, and said to them, Don't be afraid because of the servants of the Chaldeans: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.

Tailo: Tsiú-kuáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng á-.sī siū lī ê tsa-bó͘ lâng só͘ hē ê guān, kah i ka-kī iok-sok ê uē, lóng ē tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ sîng-li̍p.
English: But the vow of a widow, or of her who is divorced, even everything with which she has bound her soul, shall stand against her.

Tailo: Lín tsai guán tuì-thāi lín ta̍k lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lāu-pē teh tuì-thāi ka-kī ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: As you know how we exhorted, comforted, and implored every one of you, as a father does his own children,

Tailo: I sī Hua-lè-suh ê kiáⁿ-sun, kuán-hat tsiaⁿ-.gue̍h ti̍t-pan só͘-ū ê kun-tiúⁿ.
English: He was of the children of Perez, the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I-é-su tuì in tiong-kan kiâⁿ kuè-.khì, tsò I khì.
English: But he, passing through the midst of them, went his way.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm thiaⁿ-tio̍h i ê ti̍t-á hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì, tsiū tshuā seⁿ-thuàⁿ tī i ê ke-.ni̍h tsing-liān ê tsòng-ting saⁿ-pah tsa̍p-peh lâng, jiok kàu Tàn.
English: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led forth his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.

Tailo: I kā só͘-ū ê tsînn khai liáu-liáu ê sî, hit só͘-tsāi tú-tio̍h tuā ki-hng, i tsiah kak-ngō͘ khiàm-khueh ê kan-khó͘.
English: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Thang siu-sîng ê tsin tsē, tsò-kang ê lâng tsin tsió, só͘-í, lín tio̍h khì kiû hn̂g-tsú phài khah tsē kang-lâng khì siu-sîng.
English: Then he said to them, The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-sài kā i kóng, Mâ-lí-ah ah, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, in-uī lí tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê un-tián.
English: The angel said to her, Don't be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.

Tailo: tshiú-kang iù ê saⁿ-khò͘, tī sìng-só͘ tshīng lâi ho̍k-sāi ê, to̍h-sī tsè-si A-lông ê sìng-saⁿ kah i ê kiáⁿ ê saⁿ, tshīng lâi tam-tng tsè-si ê tsit.
English: the finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.'

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, tsiah-ê kuì-tso̍k tsiū tshe Ku-si ê kan-á-sun, Si-le-mi-ah ê sun, Ne-thá-niah ê kiáⁿ E-ho-tih kàu Pa-lo-sih hia, tuì i kóng, Lí kā só͘ tha̍k hō͘ jîn-bîn thiaⁿ ê tsheh, tshin-tshiú the̍h-lâi hō͘ guá. Nê-lé-iù ê kiáⁿ — Pa-lo-sih tsiū tshin-tshiú the̍h hit pún tsheh lâi i hia.
English: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, Take in your hand the scroll in which you have read in the ears of the people, and come. So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand, and came to them.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Tsú ìn kóng, Ké hó ê lâng, tī An-hioh-ji̍t, lín kám bô ta̍k lâng tuì gû-tiâu tháu i ê gû á-.sī lî-á, khan-khì tsia̍h tsuí?
English: Therefore the Lord answered him, You hypocrites! Doesn't each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?

Tailo: Lí ná ē hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsuē-ok? Hîng-gi̍k ê tāi-tsì, Lí ná ē tiām-tiām teh khuàⁿ? Huí-bia̍t kah kiông-pō tī guá bīn-tsîng, sio-tseⁿ, sio-phah lóng teh huat-sing.
English: Why do you show me iniquity, and look at perversity? For destruction and violence are before me. There is strife, and contention rises up.

Tailo: koh īng Guá tsiah-ê An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng. Tsiah-ê ji̍t tī Guá kah lín ê tiong-kan tsò tsìng-kì, hō͘ lín tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: and make my Sabbaths holy; and they shall be a sign between me and you, that you may know that I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Án-ne, Sàu-lô kah i saⁿ-ê kiáⁿ lóng sí, tsuân ke tsò tsi̍t-ē sí-.khì.
English: So Saul died, and his three sons; and all his house died together.

Tailo: Kuan-hē tuì lu̍t-huat tit-tio̍h ê gī, Mô͘-se ū án-ne siá kóng, Tsun-siú lu̍t-huat ê lâng khò lu̍t-huat lâi ua̍h. (tsù, LBK 18:5)
English: For Moses writes about the righteousness of the law, The one who does them will live by them.

Tailo: Pe-la-tiah, Ha-nan, A-ná-iah,
English: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,

Tailo: Siōng-Tsú kóng, Guá beh kik-tōng Ma-tái lâng lâi kā in kong-kik, in bô koh khuàⁿ-tiōng gîn, mā bô ài ti̍h kim.
English: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not value silver, and as for gold, they will not delight in it.

Tailo: Ū to-kiàm ē lîm-kàu khua-kháu ê lâng, in tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò gōng lâng; ū to-kiàm lîm-kàu i ê ióng-sū, in tsiū khí kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: A sword is on the boasters, and they shall become fools; a sword is on her mighty men, and they shall be dismayed.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Tsú nā ín-tsún, guá liâm-piⁿ to̍h ē khì lín hia. Hit sî, guá to̍h ē tsai hiah-ê kiau-ngō͘ tsū-tuā ê lâng teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē, mā ē tsai in ē-tàng tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord is willing. And I will know, not the word of those who are puffed up, but the power.

Tailo: Bô sio̍k i ê ē tuà tī i ê pò͘-pênn; ē ū liû-hông iā tī i só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his. Sulfur shall be scattered on his habitation.

Tailo: Guá teh kóng teh kî-tó ê sî, jīn guá ê tsuē kah guá ê jîn-bîn — I-su-la-el ê tsuē, uī-tio̍h guá ê Siōng-tè ê sìng-suaⁿ, tī guá ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng hiàn guá ê khún-kiû.
English: While I was speaking, and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my supplication before Yahweh my God for the holy mountain of my God;

Tailo: Hit sî, lín ē kóng, ' Guán bat kah Lí tsò-hué lim-tsia̍h, Lí mā bat tī guán ê ke-lō͘ kà-sī guán. '
English: Then you will begin to say, We ate and drink in your presence, and you taught in our streets.'

Tailo: Tē m̄-thang íng-uán bē-tn̄g, in-uī tē sī Guá ê; lín tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng sī tshut-guā lâng, sī kià-kha ê.
English: The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is mine; for you are strangers and live as foreigners with me.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā só͘-ū ngó͘-tsōng ê iû, kuaⁿ tíng-bīn ê bāng-se kah nn̄g lia̍p io-tsí, í-ki̍p io-tsí ê iû lóng sio tī tuâⁿ tíng.
English: You shall take all the fat that covers the innards, the cover of the liver, the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.

Tailo: A-má-tsiah kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kám bô lóng kì tī Iô-tah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k? Tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ū lâng kiat-tóng beh hāi A-má-tsiah.
English: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kah A-bi-sai thàu-mê lâi-kàu jîn-bîn hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Sàu-lô tó tī pâi-lia̍t tshia ê lāi-bīn teh khùn; i ê tshiuⁿ tī thâu-khak piⁿ, tshah tī tē-.ni̍h. Ap-nel kah jîn-bîn khùn tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: So David and Abishai came to the people by night: and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the place of the wagons, with his spear stuck in the ground at his head; and Abner and the people lay round about him.

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshe lâng khì tiàu A-hi-top ê kiáⁿ, tsè-si A-hi-mé-li̍k kah i lāu-pē tsuân ke, to̍h-sī tuà tī Νo͘p hiah-ê tsè-si, in tsiū lóng lâi ông hia.
English: Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father's house, the priests who were in Nob: and they came all of them to the king.

Tailo: In-uī im-kan bē-tàng kám-siā Lí, sí-bông bē-tàng o-ló Lí; lo̍h hûn-bōng ê lâng bē-tàng ǹg-bāng Lí ê sîng-si̍t.
English: For Sheol can't praise you. Death can't celebrate you. Those who go down into the pit can't hope for your truth.

Tailo: Tì-huī lâng ê sim kà-sī i ê tshuì, koh kā i ê tshuì-tûn ke-thinn ha̍k-būn.
English: The heart of the wise instructs his mouth, And adds learning to his lips.

Tailo: Án-ne, Só͘-lô-móng ông tsò uân Siōng-tsú ê tiān it-tshè ê kang. Só͘-lô-móng kā i ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t só͘ hiàn ê mi̍h tuà ji̍p-.khì, kā gîn, kim kah khì-kū, hē tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān ê khò͘-pâng.
English: Thus all the work that king Solomon worked in the house of Yahweh was finished. Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated, even the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, and put them in the treasuries of the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí kā lia̍t pang kah hiah-ê jîn-bîn hō͘ in, hun-phài in tī ta̍k kak-thâu, in tsiū tit-tio̍h Si-hông ê tē, He-si-bóng ông ê tē kah Ba-siáng ông O͘-k ê tē.
English: Moreover you gave them kingdoms and peoples, which you did allot after their portions: so they possessed the land of Sihon, even the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang tsá-khí, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: In the morning came the word of Yahweh to me, saying,

Tailo: Lí nā lâi-kàu Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tē, lí m̄-thang o̍h hiah-ê kok khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì lâi kiâⁿ.
English: When you are come into the land which Yahweh your God gives you, you shall not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, tāi-tsì tú-tú tsiàu i só͘ kā guán kái-bāng ê lâi si̍t-hiān, lí hō͘ guá ho̍k-tsit, hit-ê lâng siū tiàu lâi sí.
English: It happened, as he interpreted to us, so it was: he restored me to my office, and he hanged him.

Tailo: Koh hō͘ i kah Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k, A-hi-sat-buat ê kiáⁿ A-ho-li-ia̍p, sim ū lîng-khiàu, ē kà-sī lâng.
English: He has put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

Tailo: Bô tsuan-it tsè-sū Siōng-tsú khì tsè-sū pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng ê, tio̍h kā i bia̍t-tiāu.
English: He who sacrifices to any god, except to Yahweh only, shall be utterly destroyed.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā I tī tāi-huē ê ji̍t, tī suaⁿ tíng tuì hué tiong kā lí kóng ê tsa̍p-kài, tsiàu í-tsîng só͘ siá ê khuán-sit, siá tī hiah-ê pi-.ni̍h, Siōng-tsú tsiū kā hiah-ê kau-tài guá.
English: He wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which Yahweh spoke to you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and Yahweh gave them to me.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng hīⁿ-khang am-teh, tuā-siaⁿ huah, tsò tsi̍t-ê tshi̍h uá-.khì,
English: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed at him with one accord.

Tailo: Lín í-king lóng ū tuì Ki-tok niá-siū Sìng Sîn, só͘-í, lín lóng bat tsin-lí.
English: You have an anointing from the Holy One, and you know the truth.

Tailo: Guán ua̍h tī sè-kan, uī-tio̍h I-é-su tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tú-tio̍h sí ê guî-hiám, thang hō͘ I-é-su ê ua̍h-miā tī guán ē sí ê sing-khu hián-bîng tshut-.lâi.
English: For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus may be revealed in our mortal flesh.

Tailo: lín ē tsia̍h kàu tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t muá, kàu bah tuì lín ê phīⁿ-khang tshut-.lâi, hō͘ lín thó-ià, in-uī lín khì-sak tiàm tī lín tiong-kan ê Siōng-tsú, tī I ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu kóng, guán ná ē tshut Ai-gi̍p? '
English: but a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome to you; because that you have rejected Yahweh who is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt?

Tailo: I īng lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Mô͘-ap ông E-gú-lóng, E-gú-lóng sī tsi̍t-ê tsin puî ê lâng.
English: He offered the tribute to Eglon king of Moab: now Eglon was a very fat man.

Tailo: Lín nā kan-taⁿ tsù-ì hit-ê tshīng suí saⁿ ê lâng, tuì i kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí lâi tsē tuā-uī. khiok tuì hit-ê sàn-tshiah lâng kóng, Lí khiā tiàm hia. Á-sī kóng, Tsē guá ê kha-ta̍h piⁿ-á.
English: and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, Sit here in a good place; and you tell the poor man, Stand there, or Sit by my footstool;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lín khì Be-thel huān tsuē, kàu Gil-gal ke-thinn lín ê tsuē; ta̍k tsá-khí hiàn lín ê tsè-mi̍h, muí saⁿ ji̍t hiàn lín ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it.
English: Go to Bethel, and sin; To Gilgal, and sin more. Bring your sacrifices every morning, Your tithes every three days,

Tailo: Tse sī Kel-sióng kiáⁿ-sun tsiah-ê ke, tī huē-bō͘ lāi só͘ tsò ê kang, in só͘ kò͘-siú ê, tio̍h tī tsè-si A-lông ê kiáⁿ I-tha-mal ê tshiú-hā.
English: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting: and their charge shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — guá ê Siōng-tè ah, guān Lí ànn-lo̍h siàu-liām Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó kah khún-kiû, lâi thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kin-á-ji̍t tī Lí bīn-tsîng só͘ kî-tó ê kiû-kiò.
English: Yet have respect for the prayer of your servant, and for his supplication, Yahweh my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which your servant prays before you this day;

Tailo: Tsit-ê Hi-tse-kia kám m̄-sī huì-tû Siōng-tsú ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ kah I hiah-ê tuâⁿ, bīng-līng Iô-tah kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê lâng kóng, ' Lín tio̍h tī tsit-ê tuâⁿ tsîng kìng-pài, sio hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn. '?
English: Has not the same Hezekiah taken away his high places and his altars, and commanded Judah and Jerusalem, saying, You shall worship before one altar, and on it shall you burn incense?

Tailo: Lín só͘ hō͘ Lē-bī lâng hiah-ê siâⁿ, kî-tiong tio̍h ū la̍k-ê tô-siám ê siâⁿ; lín tio̍h án-ne siat-li̍p, hō͘ thâi-sí-lâng ê thang tô-tsáu khì hia; tsiah-ê í-guā, tio̍h koh hō͘ in sì-tsa̍p-jī-ê siâⁿ.
English: The cities which you shall give to the Levites, they shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the manslayer to flee to: and besides them you shall give forty-two cities.

Tailo: In-uī Tsú bat án-ne bīng-līng guán, kóng, guá í-king siat-li̍p lí tsò guā-pang ê kng, hō͘ lí kā guá ê tsín-kiù tuà khì-kàu thiⁿ-piⁿ hái-kak. (tsù, ISI 49:6)
English: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, That you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.'

Tailo: A-láu-nah teh khuàⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h ông kah i ê jîn-sîn tuì tuì-bīn lâi, A-láu-nah tsiū tshut-.khì, phak tī thô͘-kha kā ông pài.
English: Araunah looked forth, and saw the king and his servants coming on toward him: and Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah kā tsìng lâng kóng, Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Tsāi-tsá lín ê tsó͘-sian, to̍h-sī A-bu-la-hàm ê lāu-pē, na-khool ê lāu-pē Tha-la̍h, tuà tī tuā hô hit pîng, ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng.
English: Joshua said to all the people, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Your fathers lived of old time beyond the River, even Terah, the father of Abraham, and the father of Nahor: and they served other gods.

Tailo: In-uī sio̍k-gí kóng, ' Tsi̍t-ê iā tsíng, līng-guā tsi̍t-ê siu-sîng', si̍t-tsāi kóng liáu tsin tio̍h.
English: For in this the saying is true, One sows, and another reaps.'

Tailo: Iô-tah ê kuì-tso̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, tsiū tuì ông-kiong tsiūⁿ-kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān, tsē tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān sin mn̂g ê mn̂g-kháu.
English: When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king's house to the house of Yahweh; and they sat in the entry of the new gate of Yahweh's house.

Tailo: Guān hái kah kî-tiong só͘ tshiong-muá ê lóng tshut tuā-siaⁿ; guān tshân-hn̂g kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê lóng khuài-lo̍k.
English: Let the sea roar, and the fullness of it; Let the field exult, and all that is therein;

Tailo: i ê tiōng-hu seⁿ-khí giâu-gî ê sim, giâu-gî i ê bó͘, i ê bó͘ sī hông uè lah-sap; á-.sī i ê tiōng-hu seⁿ-khí giâu-gî ê sim, giâu-gî i ê bó͘, i ê bó͘ pīng bô hông uè lah-sap,
English: and the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife, and she is defiled: or if the spirit of jealousy comes on him, and he is jealous of his wife, and she isn't defiled:

Tailo: Tit-tio̍h tì-huī kah tshong-bîng ê lâng, tsit khuán lâng tsin ū hok-khì.
English: Happy is the man who finds wisdom, The man who gets understanding.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lí kóng, lí siàu-liân ê sî ka-kī pa̍k khò͘-tuà, suî-piān khì lí ài khì ê só͘-tsāi; to̍k-to̍k kàu nî lāu ê sî, lí tio̍h tshun tshiú hō͘ lâng kā lí pa̍k, kā lí thua kàu lí bô ài khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don't want to go.

Tailo: Tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng sī A-bu-la-hàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, hō͘ Sa-tán sok-pa̍k í-king tsa̍p-peh nî, kám bô ing-kai tī an-hioh ê ji̍t kā i tháu-pàng?
English: Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?

Tailo: Guá suî-jiân tsò gī, guá ka-kī ê tshuì ē tīng guá ê tsuē; guá suî-jiân uân-siān, i ē hián-bîng guá ê hîng-gi̍k.
English: Though I am righteous, my own mouth shall condemn me. Though I am blameless, it shall prove me perverse.

Tailo: Mâ-lé-lel la̍k-tsa̍p-gō͘ huè ê sî, seⁿ Iá-lia̍t.
English: Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, and became the father of Jared.

Tailo: hō͘ guán tshin-tshiūnn lia̍t kok án-ne, guán ê ông phuàⁿ-tuàn guán tiong-kan ê būn-tê, tsò thâu tshuā guán, thè guán kau-tsiàn.
English: that we also may be like all the nations, and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, Páu-lô lóng tī huē-tn̂g kah lâng piān-lūn, khó͘-khǹg Iô-tá-iah lâng kah Hi-la̍h lâng lâi sìn Tsú.
English: He reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded Jews and Greeks.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê tshuì puê-ióng tsin tsē lâng; gōng lâng in-uī bû-ti lâi sí.
English: The lips of the righteous feed many, But the foolish die for lack of understanding.

Tailo: Lín hō͘ guá ê mi̍h í-king kàu-gia̍h koh ū tshun. Guá ū tuì Ē-pa-hu-ló-tit siu-tio̍h lín kià-.lâi ê mi̍h, tshin-tshiūnn huat-tshut phang-phang ê bī, tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōng-tè só͘ huann-hí ê tsè-mi̍h.
English: But I have all things, and abound. I am filled, having received from Epaphroditus the things that came from you, a sweet-smelling fragrance, an acceptable and well-pleasing sacrifice to God.

Tailo: Kàu-huē líng-tō-tsiá mā tio̍h tī kàu-huē guā ū hó miâ-siaⁿ, tsiah bián tú-tio̍h lâng ê huí-pòng, suah hām-lo̍h Mô͘-kuí-ê lô-bāng.
English: Moreover he must have good testimony from those who are outside, to avoid falling into reproach and the snare of the devil.

Tailo: Guá nā kā só͘-ū ê tsâi-sán the̍h-lâi tsín-tsè, á-.sī hiàn sing-khu hō͘ hué sio, nā bô thiàⁿ-sim, tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tuì guá tsiū lóng bô lī-ik.
English: If I dole out all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, but don't have love, it profits me nothing.

Tailo: Tsìng tó-sū, tio̍h tī guá ê bīn-tsîng tiām-tiām! Tsìng lâng tio̍h tit-tio̍h sin ê khuì-la̍t! Lín lóng tio̍h kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiah thang lâi kóng-uē; lán thang tāi-ke lâi piān-lūn.
English: Keep silent before me, islands, And let the peoples renew their strength. Let them come near, Then let them speak. Let's meet together for judgment.

Tailo: Io-a-si kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, í-ki̍p i kah Iô-tah ông A-má-tsiah kau-tsiàn ê lîng-li̍k, kám bô lóng kì tī I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his might with which he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: Tse lóng sī E-ti-a-el ê kiáⁿ, tsiàu in lāu-pē ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tsò tuā khuì-la̍t ê ióng-sū; in ê sò͘-gia̍h sī tsi̍t-bān tshit-tshing nn̄g-pah lâng, lóng ē tsiūⁿ-tīn kau-tsiàn ê.
English: All these were sons of Jediael, according to the heads of their fathers' houses, mighty men of valor, seventeen thousand and two hundred, who were able to go forth in the army for war.

Tailo: Tio̍h khì-sak tsho͘-sio̍k ê uē kah bô-iáⁿ bô-tsiah ê thuân-suat. Uī-tio̍h beh ū kìng-khiân ê sing-ua̍h, tio̍h kè-sio̍k tshau-liān ka-kī.
English: But refuse profane and old wives' fables. Exercise yourself toward godliness.

Tailo: In-uī bîn-tso̍k ē khí-lâi kong-kik bîn-tso̍k, kok-ka ē khí-lâi kong-kik kok-ka; tsin tsē só͘-tsāi ē huat-sing ki-hng kah tē-tāng.
English: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there will be famines, plagues, and earthquakes in various places.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū sì-ê lâng kng tsi̍t-ê piàn-suī-.ê lâi I-é-su hia.
English: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.

Tailo: Guá án-tsuáⁿ tī Ai-gi̍p tē ê khòng-iá sím-mn̄g lín ê tsó͘-sian, mā beh án-ne lâi kā lín sím-mn̄g. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Like as I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I enter into judgment with you, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: I ê pē-bú tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì. I-é-su bīng-līng in m̄-thang kā só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì kā lâng kóng.
English: Her parents were amazed, but he charged them to tell no one what had been done.

Tailo: Ông tshe lâng khì kā i tháu-khui, to̍h-sī tī-lí jîn-bîn ê Huâ-láu kā i tháu-pàng.
English: The king sent and freed him; Even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free.

Tailo: Guān Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok ê un-tián kah lín tông-tsāi!
English: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

Tailo: Nó͘-ah gō͘ pah huè ê sî, seⁿ Sé-mh, Hâm, Iá-hia̍t.
English: Noah was five hundred years old, and Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Tailo: Páu-lô koh mn̄g kóng, Án-ne, lín niá-siū siáⁿ-mi̍h khuán ê sé-lé? In tsiū kóng, Iô-há-neh ê sé-lé.
English: He said, Into what then were you baptized? They said, Into John's baptism.

Tailo: Īng tshiuⁿ tsó͘-tòng hiah-ê jiok guá ê lâng; kiû Lí tuì guá ê sîn-hûn kóng, Guá sī kā lí tsín-kiù ê hit uī.
English: Brandish the spear and block those who pursue me. Tell my soul, I am your salvation.

Tailo: Ông tuì i ê jîn-bîn kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsiah-ê jîn-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng pí lán khah tsē koh khah kiông.
English: He said to his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we.

Tailo: KÓng-tio̍h huē-tsiòng, lín kah tuà tī lín tiong-kan ê tshut-guā lâng, lóng kâng sio-siâng ê lē, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē; lín án-ne tsò, tshut-guā lâng mā tio̍h tsiàu án-ne tsò.
English: For the assembly, there shall be one statute for you, and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner with you, a statute forever throughout your generations: as you are, so shall the foreigner be before Yahweh.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, kûn-tsiòng tng teh thàng-thiàⁿ ê sî, Iâ-kop nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī Tí-nah ê a-hiaⁿ Si-miān kah Lē-bī, lóng gia̍h to, thàn lâng bô tiuⁿ-tî ê sî lâi-kàu siâⁿ lāi, thâi-sí só͘-ū ê tsa-po͘ lâng,
English: It happened on the third day, when they were sore, that two of Jacob's sons, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, each took his sword, came upon the unsuspecting city, and killed all the males.

Tailo: Ông kā tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Lí thang tńg-khì lín tau, guá ē uī-tio̍h lí tshut bīng-līng.
English: The king said to the woman, Go to your house, and I will give charge concerning you.

Tailo: Bô-oh-tsuh kóng, Lí tuì Na-o-mih ê tshiú bé hit hūn hn̂g ê ji̍t, mā tio̍h tshuā sí-lâng ê bo͘ — Mô͘-ap ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Lù-thuh, thang lâi kiàn-li̍p sí-lâng ê miâ tī i ê sán-gia̍p.
English: Then said Boaz, What day you buy the field of the hand of Naomi, you must buy it also of Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance.

Tailo: Al-pak-sat seⁿ Se-la̍h liáu-āu, iáu ua̍h sì-pah khòng sann nî, koh ū seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: Arpachshad lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Shelah, and became the father of sons and daughters.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm kah Iô-tah tú-tio̍h tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī in-uī Siōng-tsú huat-tshut siū-khì, beh tuì I ê bīn-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì; hit sî, Tse-ti-kiah puē-puān Ba-bú-lông ông.
English: For through the anger of Yahweh did it happen in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h guá, guá bô kuáⁿ-kín khì-sak bo̍k-tsiá ê tsit, m̄ tuè Lí, tsai-hō kàu ê ji̍t, m̄-sī guá só͘ ài; tse sī Lí só͘ tsai, guá ê tshuì só͘ kóng ê, lóng tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: As for me, I have not hurried from being a shepherd after you; neither have I desired the woeful day; you know: that which came out of my lips was before your face.

Tailo: Tse beh kā in tsò íng-uán ê lē, koh hit-ê kā lâng hiù tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí, hit-ê lâng tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ; kiàn-nā bong hit-ê tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí ê, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: It shall be a perpetual statute to them: and he who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until even.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, A-ha-sui-ló͘ ông kā Iô-tah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k Ha-mán ê ka-sán siúⁿ-sù hō͘ ông-hō͘ Ê-su-tel. Mol-té-kái mā lâi ông ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī Ê-su-tel í-king kā ông kóng, Mol-té-kái sī i ê tshin-lâng.
English: On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews' enemy to Esther the queen. Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he was to her.

Tailo: In tian-tò liáu-kái Tsú ū kau-thok guá khì thuân hok-im hō͘ bô siū kat-lé ê lâng; tú tshin-tshiūnn I kau-thok Piat-tò͘, khì thuân hok-im hō͘ ū siū kat-lé ê lâng.
English: but to the contrary, when they saw that I had been entrusted with the Good News for the uncircumcision, even as Peter with the Good News for the circumcision

Tailo: Guá tuì in ê bīn-tsîng tû-bia̍t A-mô͘-lī lâng, hiah-ê lâng kuân-tuā tshin-tshiūnn pik-hiuⁿ tshiū, ióng-bíng tshin-tshiūnn siōng tshiū. Tsóng-.sī, Guá kā i tíng-bīn ê kué-tsí bia̍t-tiāu, kā ē-bīn ê kin tsua̍t-tn̄g.
English: Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose height was like the height of the cedars, And he was strong as the oaks; Yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.

Tailo: Tāi-ke tsia̍h pá, kā be̍h-á hiat-lo̍h hái, thang hō͘ tsûn khah khin.
English: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

Tailo: Sio̍k Tsa-tok ê ke, tuā-tsè-si A-tsa-lí-ah ìn kóng, Tuì jîn-bîn tuà kiong-kip ê mi̍h kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān í-lâi, guán tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h, koh tshun tsin tsē, in-uī Siōng-tsú sù-hok I ê tsú-bîn, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê kàu hiah tsē.
English: Azariah the chief priest, of the house of Zadok, answered him and said, Since the people began to bring the offerings into the house of Yahweh, we have eaten and had enough, and have left plenty: for Yahweh has blessed his people; and that which is left is this great store.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng seⁿ kiáⁿ ê thàng-thiàⁿ ē kàu tī i; i sī- bô tì-huī ê kiáⁿ, in-uī i ê sî í-king kàu, bô ing-kai iân-tshiân tī tsú-kiong kháu.
English: The sorrows of a travailing woman will come on him. He is an unwise son; For when it is time, he doesn't come to the opening of the womb.

Tailo: ji̍p-khì kìnn ông, tsiàu tsit-ê khuán tuì i án-ne kóng. Io-ap tsiū kā só͘ tio̍h kóng ê uē kà tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng.
English: and go in to the king, and speak on this manner to him. So Joab put the words in her mouth.

Tailo: Guá kóng, Iâ-kop tsiah-ê siú-líng, I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn tsiah-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ! Lín kám m̄ tsai-iáⁿ kong-pêⁿ?
English: I said, Please listen, you heads of Jacob, And rulers of the house of Israel: Isn't it for you to know justice?

Tailo: In-uī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Lín tio̍h tshò tshiū-á, khí thô͘-tui, kong-kik Ê-lú-sa-lèm. Tse sī hit-ê ing-kai siū hîng-hua̍t ê siâⁿ, in tiong-kan tsuân-pō͘ sī pō-gio̍k.
English: For thus has Yahweh of Armies said, Hew you down trees, and cast up a mound against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.

Tailo: Se-gup seⁿ Ia-il, i tī Gi-lia̍t tē ū jī-tsa̍p saⁿ-ê siâⁿ.
English: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú beh hō͘ Ai-gi̍p lâng bat I, tī hit ji̍t, Ai-gi̍p lâng it-tīng ē bat Siōng-tsú, mā ē hiàn tsè-mi̍h kah lé-mi̍h kā I kìng-pài, koh tuì Siōng-tsú hē guān kah siā guān.
English: Yahweh will be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know Yahweh in that day. Yes, they will worship with sacrifice and offering, and will vow a vow to Yahweh, and will perform it.

Tailo: lâng ū tsi̍t-bān la̍k-tshing-ê. )
English: and sixteen thousand persons),

Tailo: I nā bô koh kè sī koh khah ū hok-khì. Tse sī guá ê siūⁿ-huat; tsóng-.sī, guá siūⁿ guá mā ū siū Siōng-tè ê Sìng Sîn khé-sī.
English: But she is happier if she stays as she is, in my judgment, and I think that I also have God's Spirit.

Tailo: Guá teh khuàⁿ ua̍h-mi̍h ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, ū tshia-lián tī tē-tsiūⁿ, tī ua̍h-mi̍h ê piⁿ-á, sì-bīn kok ū tsi̍t-ê.
English: Now as I saw the living creatures, behold, one wheel on the earth beside the living creatures, for each of the four faces of it.

Tailo: Hō͘ lán ē-tàng thuat-lī tsiah-ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú,
English: To grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, should serve him without fear,

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lán kè-sio̍k lâi-khì hù-kīn ê tsng-thâu, hō͘ guá thang tī hia thuân hok-im; in-uī tse sī guá tshut-.lâi ê sù-bīng.
English: He said to them, Let's go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because for this reason I came forth.

Tailo: Guá koh khuànn, lí khuàⁿ, lóng bô lâng; khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu, mā lóng pue tsáu-.khì.
English: I saw, and behold, there was no man, and all the birds of the sky were fled.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h án-ne kiânn, lín tsiah-ê tsè-si kah Lē-bī lâng, saⁿ-hūn tsi-it tī An-hioh-ji̍t ji̍p-.lâi ê, tio̍h tsò kò͘-mn̂g ê,
English: This is the thing that you shall do: a third part of you, who come in on the Sabbath, of the priests and of the Levites, shall be porters of the thresholds;

Tailo: I-é-su kah sù-tô͘ tsò-hué ê sî, kā in huan-hù kóng, M̄-thang lī-khui Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tsiàu guá tsîng kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h thìng-hāu Thiⁿ-pē ê ìng-ín.
English: Being assembled together with them, he charged them, Don't depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsē-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng ê lâng só͘ bat tsē ê mi̍h ê, tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ, ka-kī tī tsuí-.ni̍h sé, bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: He who sits on anything whereon the man who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, guá bat tshuā lí tuì Ai-gi̍p tē tshut-.lâi. Tio̍h tuā khui lí ê tshuì, guá tsiū hō͘ lí pá-tsiok.
English: I am Yahweh, your God, Who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.

Tailo: Guá — Iâ-kop, sī Siōng-tè kah Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok ê lô͘-po̍k, beh kā só͘-ū sì-suàⁿ tī ta̍k só͘-tsāi ê Siōng-tè ê tsú-bîn tshíng-an.
English: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t lí thó-ià kà-sī, kā guá ê uē pàng tī lí ê kha-tsiah-āu.
English: Seeing you hate instruction, And throw my words behind you?

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat kóng, Tī tsia kám bô Siōng-tsú ê sian-ti, lán thang thok i lâi mn̄g Siōng-tsú? I-su-la-el ông tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k ìn kóng, Tsîng piàⁿ tsuí tī E-li-iah ê tshiú ê, Sia-huat ê kiáⁿ E-lí-siah tī tsia.
English: But Jehoshaphat said, Isn't there here a prophet of Yahweh, that we may inquire of Yahweh by him? One of the king of Israel's servants answered, Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.

Tailo: Lí khui-khuah guá ê sim ê sî, guá tsiū ē kiânn Lí kài-bīng ê lō͘.
English: I run in the path of your commandments, For you have set my heart free. HEY

Tailo: Suaⁿ pang tsiū suàⁿ-suàⁿ-.khì, tsio̍h-thâu suá-lī i ê pún uī.
English: But the mountain falling comes to nothing; The rock is removed out of its place;

Tailo: Thong-ta̍t ê lâng ū tì-huī thang bîng-pi̍k i ê lō͘; gōng lâng ê gōng to̍h-sī kuí-tsà.
English: The wisdom of the prudent is to think about his way, But the folly of fools is deceit.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê thiⁿ-sài khiā tī ji̍t-thâu ê tiong-ng, tuì khong-tiong só͘-ū ê pue-tsiáu tuā-siaⁿ huah, Lâi! Tsò-hué lâi tsham-ka Siōng-tè ê tuā iàn-si̍k!
English: I saw an angel standing in the sun. He cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in the sky, Come! Be gathered together to the great supper of God,

Tailo: I kà-sī guá ê tshiú ē kau-tsiàn, tì-kàu guá ê tshiú-kut ē khui tâng-kiong.
English: He teaches my hands to war, So that my arms do bend a bow of brass.

Tailo: I-é-su án-ne kî-tó liáu-āu, tsiū kah bûn-tô͘ tshut-.khì, kuè-khì Kit-lông khe hit pîng. Tī hia ū tsi̍t khu hn̂g, I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ ji̍p-.khì.
English: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered.

Tailo: Guá kiû-kiò Siōng-tè, Lí m̄ ìn guá; guá khiā khí-.lâi, Lí kan-taⁿ teh khuàⁿ.
English: I cry to you, and you do not answer me. I stand up, and you gaze at me.

Tailo: Guán huān tsuē puē-gi̍k, Lí bô sià-bián.
English: We have transgressed and have rebelled; you have not pardoned.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì huē-bō͘ lāi kiò Mô͘-se, kā i kóng,
English: Yahweh called to Moses, and spoke to him out of the Tent of Meeting, saying,

Tailo: I só͘ seⁿ tsiah-ê kiáⁿ ê tiong-kan, bô kah tsi̍t-ê ín-tshuā i; i só͘ iúⁿ-tshī tuā-hàn tsiah-ê kiáⁿ ê tiong-kan, bô kah tsi̍t-ê khan i ê tshiú.
English: There is none to guide her among all the sons whom she has brought forth; neither is there any who takes her by the hand among all the sons who she has brought up.

Tailo: Lán í-king kí Siōng-tsú lâi tsiù-tsuā, bô beh kā tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kè hō͘ in, taⁿ tsiū in só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, lán beh tuì tó-uī hō͘ in ū bó͘?
English: How shall we do for wives for those who remain, seeing we have sworn by Yahweh that we will not give them of our daughters to wives?

Tailo: Guān lí khan guá, guán tsiū tsáu-lâi tuè lí; ông tshuā guá ji̍p-khì i ê pâng lāi; guán beh in-uī lí lâi huann-hí khuài-lo̍k, guán beh o-ló lí ê ài-tsîng iâⁿ-kuè hó tsiú; in ài lí sī ing-kai ê.
English: Take me away with you. Let us hurry. The king has brought me into his chambers. Friends We will be glad and rejoice in you. We will praise your love more than wine! Beloved They are right to love you.

Tailo: Siōng hó ê iû, siōng hó ê tsiú, siōng hó ê ngó͘-kok, to̍h-sī in khí-thâu si̍k hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê, Guá lóng siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí.
English: All the best of the oil, and all the best of the vintage, and of the grain, the first fruits of them which they give to Yahweh, to you have I given them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó, àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê kiû-kiò! Guá lâu ba̍k-sái, kiû Lí m̄-thang bô tshut siaⁿ! Guá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng sī tsi̍t-ê tshut-guā lâng kah guá ê tsó͘-sian kāng-khuán sī kià-kha ê.
English: Hear my prayer, Yahweh, and give ear to my cry. Don't be silent at my tears. For I am a stranger with you, A foreigner, as all my fathers were.

Tailo: Tiâⁿ sì-bīn ê tiùⁿ-uî lóng sī īng kuè-pháng ê iù-tē tsò ê.
English: All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.

Tailo: Tī ông ta̍k síng kî-î ê Iô-tah lâng mā lóng tsū-tsi̍p, khí-lâi pó-hō͘ ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā, thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k, hióng-siū pîng-an, thâi-sí uàn-hūn in ê lâng tshit-bān gō͘-tshing, tsóng-.sī, bô tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: The other Jews who were in the king's provinces gathered themselves together, and stood for their lives, and had rest from their enemies, and killed of those who hated them seventy-five thousand; but they didn't lay their hand on the spoil.

Tailo: Tuì pó-tsō huat-tshut sih-nà kah tân-luî ê siann. Pó-tsō tsîng ū tshit ki ting-hué teh to̍h, to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê tshit-ê lîng.
English: Out of the throne proceed lightnings, sounds, and thunders. There were seven lamps of fire burning before his throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

Tailo: Na-o-mih phō hit-ê gín-á, hē tī i ê hing tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn lāu-bú teh kā i io.
English: Naomi took the child, and laid it in her bosom, and became nurse to it.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng tio̍h síng-tshat ka-kī, tsiah thang tsia̍h tsit-ê piáⁿ, lim tsit-ê pue.
English: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tshú pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê iûⁿ-á kah iû tsi̍t lô-kik, tsè-si tio̍h tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng iô, lâi tsò iô-tsè.
English: The priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí ē siū kàng kē, tuì thô͘-kha kóng-uē; lí kóng-uē ê siann ē sè-sè, tuì tîn-ai tshut-.lâi. Lí ê siann-im tuì tē tshut-.lâi, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hō͘ kuí hū-sin ê siann-im; lí ê giân-gí kiū-kiū háu, tuì tîn-ai tshut-.lâi.
English: You will be brought down, and will speak out of the ground. Your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will be as of one who has a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and your speech will whisper out of the dust.

Tailo: Hō͘ lí tsai tsin-lí ê uē khak-si̍t khó-khò; hō͘ lí thang īng tsin-lí ê uē huê-hok tshe-phài lí ê lâng.
English: To teach you truth, reliable words, To give sound answers to the ones who sent you?

Tailo: In kā tsi̍h kńg uan tshin-tshiūnn kiong lâi kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t. In tī kok lāi ke-thinn sè-li̍k, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h tsin-si̍t, to̍h-sī pháiⁿ liáu koh pháiⁿ ê, in mā m̄-bat Siōng-tè. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: They bend their tongue, as it were their bow, for falsehood; and they are grown strong in the land, but not for truth: for they proceed from evil to evil, and they don't know me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Íng-ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú tsò lí tuà ê só͘-tsāi; íng-uán ê tshiú tī lí ê ē-bīn. I tī lí ê bīn-tsîng kā tuì-ti̍k kuáⁿ-tsáu, Koh kóng, kā i huí bia̍t-tiāu.
English: The eternal God is your dwelling place, Underneath are the everlasting arms. He thrust out the enemy from before you, Said, Destroy.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì A-lông kah i só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê kiáⁿ Ê-lī-a-tsal, I-tha-mal kóng, Lín the̍h Siōng-tsú hué-tsè só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê sò͘-tsè, tio̍h tī tuâⁿ piⁿ tsia̍h, m̄-thang tsham kàⁿ, in-uī tse sī tsì-sìng ê.
English: Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons who were left, Take the meal offering that remains of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire, and eat it without yeast beside the altar; for it is most holy;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tuì lí ê bīn-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-khì liáu-āu, lí sim-lāi m̄-thang siūⁿ kóng, ' Siōng-tsú tshuā guá ji̍p-lâi sîng-tsiap tsit-ê tē, sī in-uī guá ê gī-hîng. ' Kî-si̍t Siōng-tsú sī uī-tio̍h hiah-ê kok ê pháiⁿ, tsiah tuì lí ê bīn-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Don't speak in your heart, after that Yahweh your God has thrust them out from before you, saying, For my righteousness Yahweh has brought me in to possess this land; whereas for the wickedness of these nations Yahweh does drive them out from before you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t, Siōng-tè ê tsìng kiáⁿ lâi, khiā tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, Sa-tán mā lâi tī in tiong-kan.
English: Now it happened on the day when the God's sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan also came among them.

Tailo: Lán tsai lán sī sio̍k Siōng-tè, m̄-koh, tsuân sè-kan lóng siū hit-ê Mô͘-kuí kuán-hat.
English: We know that we are of God, and the whole world lies in the power of the evil one.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì Ai-gi̍p, tuì ta̍k só͘-tsāi, tuà bé lâi hō͘ Só͘-lô-móng.
English: They brought horses for Solomon out of Egypt, and out of all lands.

Tailo: Tē-peh ji̍t lín tio̍h ū giâm-siok-huē, lóng m̄-thang tsò lô-tōng ê kang.
English: On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly: you shall do no servile work;

Tailo: In-uī i ê siong bē i-tit, tsit-ê tāi-tsì í-king kīn Iô-tah ê só͘-tsāi, kàu Guá ê tsú-bîn ê siâⁿ mn̂g, to̍h-sī Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: For her wounds are incurable; For it has come even to Judah. It reaches to the gate of my people, Even to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal tuì kau-tsiàn tńg-.lâi ê kun-tuī kóng, Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘-se lu̍t-huat ê tiâu-lē to̍h-sī án-ne:
English: Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who went to the battle, This is the statute of the law which Yahweh has commanded Moses:

Tailo: Guá tú teh kóng ê sî, Sìng Sîn kàng-lîm tī in, tshin-tshiūnn tong-tsho͘ kàng-lîm tī lán sin tsiūⁿ kāng-khuán.
English: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

Tailo: Thian-hā ê lâng lóng ài lâi kìnn Só͘-lô-móng ê bīn, thiaⁿ i ê tì-huī, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú siúⁿ-sù tī i ê sim ê.
English: All the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.

Tailo: Tuì guá kóng, ' Páu-lô, m̄-bián kiaⁿ! Lí it-tīng tio̍h khì khiā tuà Lô-má hông-tè ê bīn-tsîng. Siōng-tè í-king kā tsûn lāi só͘-ū ê lâng kau-thok lí à. '
English: saying, Don't be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.'

Tailo: A-sah kah I-su-la-el ông Ba-siah it-sing tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kau-tsiàn.
English: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tsiū ē tuì lín ê bīn-tsîng kā tse só͘-ū ê kok kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, lín mā ē tit-tio̍h pí lín bo̍k-tsîng ê khah tuā koh khah kiông ê kok.
English: then will Yahweh drive out all these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourselves.

Tailo: koh ū hîng lâng ê tǹg-thâu kah só͘ tshiúⁿ lâng ê mi̍h, tsun-thàn ua̍h-miā ê lu̍t-lē, bô koh tsò pháiⁿ, i it-tīng ē ua̍h, bē tì-kàu sí.
English: if the wicked restore the pledge, give again that which he had taken by robbery, walk in the statutes of life, committing no iniquity; he shall surely live, he shall not die.

Tailo: Mā bô hó khuán-thāi Ia-lu-ba-al, to̍h-sī Gî-tióng ê ke, tsiàu i só͘ kiâⁿ tī I-su-la-el ê un-huī.
English: neither shown they kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had shown to Israel.

Tailo: I-su-la-el an-jiân tuà, Iâ-kop ê kiáⁿ-sun ka-kī tuà tī ngó͘-kok kah tsiú ê tē. I ê thiⁿ mā tih-lo̍h lō͘-tsuí.
English: Israel dwells in safety, The fountain of Jacob alone, In a land of grain and new wine; Yes, his heavens drop down dew.

Tailo: I ê kin khînn tī tsio̍h-tui, thàu kàu tsio̍h-thâu ê só͘-tsāi.
English: His roots are wrapped around the rock pile, He sees the place of stones.

Tailo: E-lí-siah kiò Ge-ha-tsih kóng, Khì kiò hit-ê Siu-ném ê tsa-bó͘ lâng lâi. I tsiū khì kiò i, i ji̍p-lâi i hia. E-lí-siah kóng, Phō lí ê gín-á khí-.lâi.
English: He called Gehazi, and said, Call this Shunammite. So he called her. When she was come in to him, he said, Take up your son.

Tailo: I koh īng kim an hiah-ê ki-lō͘-ping.
English: He overlaid the cherubim with gold.

Tailo: I tio̍h kā i ê lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám bī-muá-nî ê mî-iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám bī-muá-nî ê mî-iûⁿ-bó á, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, koh īng tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám ê mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsò siā-un ê tsè;
English: and he shall offer his offering to Yahweh, one male lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb a year old without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for peace offerings,

Tailo: I-é-su mn̄g kóng, Taⁿ lín ū sìn bô?
English: Jesus answered them, Do you now believe?

Tailo: Lín mā m̄-thang hō͘ lâng kiò-tsò Lāu-su , in-uī lín ê lāu-su tsí ū tsi̍t uī, to̍h-sī Ki-tok.
English: Neither be called masters, for one is your master, the Christ.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah koh huan-hù tsè-si kóng, Lín kng iok-kuī khí-.lâi, kiânn tī jîn-bîn ê thâu-tsîng. In tsiū kā iok-kuī kng khí-.lâi, kiânn tī jîn-bîn ê thâu-tsîng.
English: Joshua spoke to the priests, saying, Take up the ark of the covenant, and pass over before the people. They took up the ark of the covenant, and went before the people.

Tailo: Tshiùⁿ kua ê lâng tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm sì-kho͘-uî ê pîng-guân kah tuì Ne-to-huat ê tsng-thâu lâi tsū-tsi̍p,
English: The sons of the singers gathered themselves together, both out of the plain round about Jerusalem, and from the villages of the Netophathites;

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tshiúⁿ in ê ông só͘ tì kim ê bián-liû, tshìn i ê kim tāng tsi̍t tha-lan-t, koh ū siuⁿ pó-tsio̍h; lâng kā tsit-ê bián-liû tì tī Ta-bi̍t ê thâu-khak. Ta-bi̍t tuì siâⁿ lāi tshiúⁿ i ê tsâi-bu̍t tsin tsē.
English: David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set on David's head: and he brought forth the spoil of the city, exceeding much.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsòng tī Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Ná-má, sī Am-móng lâng. Lô-bo-àm ê kiáⁿ A-mí-iam suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and his mother's name was Naamah the Ammonitess. Abijam his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ū kuí tsiah tsûn-á tuì Tî-bé-lī-a lâi, kàu uá-kīn tsîng Tsú tsiok-siā liáu-āu pun piáⁿ hō͘ kûn-tsiòng tsia̍h ê só͘-tsāi.
English: However boats from Tiberias came near to the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks.

Tailo: Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, I-su-la-el jîn-bîn ê ba̍k-tsiu lóng teh khuàⁿ lí, thìng-hāu lí kā in kóng, siáⁿ lâng ē suà-tsiap guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, lâi tsē i ê uī.
English: You, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, that you should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.

Tailo: Tsuí-siú tsin kiaⁿ, ta̍k lâng ai-kiû i ka-kī ê sîn-bîng. In kā tsûn lāi ê huè-bu̍t hiat-lo̍h hái, in-uī beh hō͘ tsûn khah khin. To̍k-to̍k Iô-ná í-king lo̍h-khì kàu tsûn-té, tī hia tó-.leh hó khùn.
English: Then the mariners were afraid, and cried every man to his god. They threw the cargo that was in the ship into the sea, to lighten it. But Jonah had gone down into the innermost parts of the ship, and he was laying down, and was fast asleep.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí só͘ kàu-tok koh īng Lí ê lu̍t-huat só͘ kà-sī ê hiah-ê lâng tsin ū hok-khì.
English: Blessed is the man whom you discipline, Yah, And teach out of your law;

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī A-mí-siá-tái ê kiáⁿ A-hí-e-tsel ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, I tshin-tshiūnn teh tshuā iûⁿ kā ka-kī ê tsú-bîn tshuā tshut-.lâi, tī khòng-iá tshuā in tshin-tshiūnn teh tshuā iûⁿ-kûn.
English: But he led forth his own people like sheep, And guided them in the wilderness like a flock.

Tailo: Tsuân-lîng-.ê tsiū ē tsò lí ê pó-puè, tsò lí ê bûn-gîn.
English: The Almighty will be your treasure, Precious silver to you.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pò͘ khí-lâi tsiū tshut-huat. Tī lō͘ tiong, i tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê Ai-si-o-pí-a ê thài-kàm, to̍h-sī Ai-si-o-pí-a lú-ông Kan-ta-ke ê tsâi-bū tāi-sîn.
English: He arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.

Tailo: In ū kui-ǹg, tsóng-.sī, m̄-sī kui-ǹg Tsì-kuân-.ê; in tshin-tshiūnn píng liàn-tńg ê kiong. In ê siú-líng in-uī tsi̍h ê hòng-tshiòng, ē tó tī to hā; tsit-ê ē tī Ai-gi̍p tē tsiâⁿ-tsò tshiò-pèⁿ.
English: They return, but not to the Most High. They are like a faulty bow. Their princes will fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue. This will be their derision in the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Mô͘-se tuì jîn-bîn kóng, Lín ū huān tāng tsuē, guá taⁿ beh tsiūⁿ-khì Siōng-tsú hia, kiám-tshái ē-tàng kā lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: It happened on the next day, that Moses said to the people, You have sinned a great sin. Now I will go up to Yahweh. Perhaps I shall make atonement for your sin.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông Hi-tse-kia kah tsìng Iô-tah lâng, kám ū hō͘ i sí? Hi-tse-kia kám m̄-sī kìng-uì Siōng-tsú, khún-kiû Siōng-tsú ê un? Siōng-tsú kám tsiū hō͘-hué I só͘ kóng beh kàng hō͘ in ê tsai-hō? Taⁿ nā hāi-sí tsit-ê lâng, lán to̍h-sī tsò tuā pháiⁿ, ē hāi-tio̍h ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Didn't he fear Yahweh, and entreat the favor of Yahweh, and Yahweh repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus should we commit great evil against our own souls.

Tailo: Guá kám bat kóng, tshiánn lín hō͘ guá? Á-sī kiò lín tuì lín ê tsâi-sán the̍h-lâi sàng guá mi̍h-kiāⁿ?
English: Did I say, Give to me?' Or, Offer a present for me from your substance?'

Tailo: á-.sī bong-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h bô tshing-khì ē pê ê mi̍h, á-.sī bong-tio̍h hiah-ê hō͘ i bô tshing-khì ê lâng, put-kuán hit-ê lâng ū siáⁿ-mi̍h bô tshing-khì,
English: or whoever touches any creeping thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatever uncleanness he has;

Tailo: (Peh kiā-á ê si, Ta-bi̍t tsò ê. ）Lâng tuì guá kóng, lán lâi-khì Siōng-tsú ê tiān, guá tsiū huann-hí.
English: I was glad when they said to me, Let's go to Yahweh's house!

Tailo: Lí tó-.leh, it-tīng bē kiaⁿ; lí tó lo̍h-khì bîn-tshn̂g, ē tsin hó khùn.
English: When you lie down, you will not be afraid. Yes, you will lie down, and your sleep will be sweet.

Tailo: Koh bô guā kú, sè-kan bē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, to̍k-to̍k lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, in-uī guá ua̍h-.leh, lín mā ē ua̍h-.leh.
English: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng, Tsuí tio̍h sing-thuàⁿ tsin tsē ū ua̍h-miā ê tōng-bu̍t, tsiáu pue tī tē ê tíng-bīn kah thinn-tíng ê kiong-tshong.
English: God said, Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of sky.

Tailo: Koh beh kì-liām lâi siú hiah-ê ji̍t, tī ta̍k tāi, ta̍k ke, ta̍k síng, ta̍k siâⁿ, hō͘ Phul ê ji̍t tī Iô-tah lâng ê tiong-kan bô huì-tû, tī in ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong-kan kì-liām bô suah.
English: and that these days should be remembered and kept throughout every generation, every family, every province, and every city; and that these days of Purim should not fail from among the Jews, nor the memory of them perish from their seed.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng: Tng hit ji̍t, tìng tī kian-kò͘ ê só͘-tsāi ê ting-á ē suê lo̍h-.khì, ē siū tshò-tn̄g ka-la̍uh lo̍h-.khì, tiàu tī i ê tíng-bīn ê mi̍h ē sí-.khì. In-uī tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: In that day, says Yahweh of Armies, the nail that was fastened in a sure place will give way. It will be cut down, and fall. The burden that was on it will be cut off, for Yahweh has spoken it.

Tailo: Hit gō͘-ê ông tô-tsáu, bih tī Ma̍k-ke-tah ê tōng lāi.
English: These five kings fled, and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.

Tailo: I mā tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān hiah-ê mn̂g siat kò͘-mn̂g ê, bô-lūn án-tsuáⁿ, bô tshing-khì ê lóng bē tit ji̍p-.khì.
English: He set the porters at the gates of the house of Yahweh, that no one who was unclean in anything should enter in.

Tailo: Tsit-má Sìn ê sî-tāi í-king lâi-lîm, lu̍t-huat to̍h bô koh tsò lán ê kàm-hō͘-jîn.
English: But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā hiah-ê kuái-á hē tī huē-bō͘ lāi huat-kuī ê thâu-tsîng, to̍h-sī Guá kah lín siong-huē ê só͘-tsāi.
English: You shall lay them up in the tent of meeting before the testimony, where I meet with you.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí ê kà-sī tio̍h hû-ha̍p kiān-tsuân ê kàu-gī.
English: But say the things which fit sound doctrine,

Tailo: Só͘-í, kok-uī hiann-tī tsí-muē, án-ne lín ing-kai tsai, sià tsuē ê tō-lí sī tuì tsit uī I-é-su thuân hō͘ lín.
English: Be it known to you therefore, brothers , that through this man is proclaimed to you remission of sins,

Tailo: I kā Mô͘-se kóng, Guá sī lí ê tiūⁿ-lâng E-thu-ló, tshuā lí ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kah i ê nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, lâi lí tsia.
English: He said to Moses, I, your father-in-law Jethro, have come to you with your wife, and her two sons with her.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Ai-gi̍p lô-khó͘ tit-tio̍h ê, Kú-si̍t ê tsâi-lī kah Se-bah ê tuā-hàn lâng, lóng ē kui lí, sio̍k lí, koh tuè lí. In ē kuà thih-liān lâi kui lí, phak-pài tī lí ê bīn-tsîng kiû lí, kóng: Siōng-tsú tsin-tsiàⁿ tī lín tiong-kan; tsit-ê í-guā bô pa̍t-ê, jî-tshiánn bô pa̍t-ê tsin-sîn.
English: Thus says Yahweh: The labor of Egypt, and the merchandise of Ethiopia, and the Sabeans, men of stature, shall come over to you, and they shall be yours. They shall go after you. In chains they shall come over; and they shall fall down to you. They shall make supplication to you: Surely God is in you; and there is none else, there is no other god.

Tailo: I it-tīng bô koh tò tńg-lâi tsia, to̍h-sī ē sí tī hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì ê só͘-tsāi, bô koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: But in the place where they have led him captive, there shall he die, and he shall see this land no more.

Tailo: Kiû Lí huat-tshut Lí ê kng kah tsin-si̍t lâi ín-tshuā guá, tshuā guá kàu Lí ê sìng-suaⁿ, kàu Lí ê huē-bō͘.
English: Oh, send out your light and your truth. Let them lead me. Let them bring me to your holy hill, To your tents.

Tailo: Hó kuè-ji̍t ê lâng sim-lāi khuànn-khin huān-lān, tse huān-lān suî-sî teh thìng-hāu kha that-tio̍h ê lâng.
English: In the thought of him who is at ease there is contempt for misfortune, It is ready for them whose foot slips.

Tailo: Hit sî, Ta-bi̍t tī suaⁿ-tsē, Hui-lī-sū lâng hông-siú ê ping tī Bia̍t-lé-hèm.
English: David was then in the stronghold; and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.

Tailo: Mol-té-kái tsiap-la̍p tsò i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê Ê-su-tel, to̍h-sī i ê a-tsik A-mí-hail ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tsiàu tshù-sū tio̍h ji̍p-khì kìnn ông ê sî, tû-khì ông ê thài-kàm tsiáng-kuán lú-tsú ê He-gái só͘ hun-phuè hō͘ i ê, līng-guā bô thó pa̍t mi̍h. Kiàn-nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ê-su-tel ê lâng lóng kah-ì i.
English: Now when the turn of Esther, the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her for his daughter, came to go in to the king, she required nothing but what Hegai the king's chamberlain, the keeper of the women, appointed. Esther obtained favor in the sight of all those who looked at her.

Tailo: E-hú tshut-.khì, lâi-kàu i ê tsú-lâng ê lô͘-po̍k hia, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng mn̄g i kóng, Lóng pîng-an bô? Tsit-ê siáu ê lâi tshuē lí sī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì? E-hú kā in kóng, Lín bat hit-ê lâng, mā tsai i só͘ kóng ê.
English: Then Jehu came forth to the servants of his lord: and one said to him, Is all well? why came this mad fellow to you? He said to them, You know the man and what his talk was.

Tailo: Tio̍h thàn Siōng-tsú thang tshuē-tio̍h ê sî lâi tshuē I, tī I sio uá-kīn ê sî kiû-kiò I.
English: Seek you Yahweh while he may be found; call you on him while he is near:

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì I-é-su kóng, Iô-há-neh ê bûn-tô͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, Hua-lí-sái phài ê bûn-tô͘ mā sī án-ne, m̄-koh, Lí ê bûn-tô͘ mā lim mā tsia̍h.
English: They said to him, Why do John's disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?

Tailo: Taⁿ kong-gī ê kuan-bián í-king kā guá tsún-pī hó-sè, to̍h-sī Tsú tsò kong-gī ê sím-phuàⁿ tsiá, tī hit ji̍t beh hō͘ guá. M̄-nā hō͘ guá ê, mā beh hō͘ só͘-ū him-bō͘ Ki-tok tsài-lîm hián-hiān ê lâng.
English: From now on, there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day; and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing.

Tailo: In-uī Lí ū kiù guá ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī sí-bông, Lí kám m̄-sī pó-hō͘ guá ê kha bô pua̍h-tó, hō͘ guá tī Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng, kiânn tī ua̍h-miā ê kng tiong?
English: For you have delivered my soul from death, And prevented my feet from falling, That I may walk before God in the light of the living.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kám tsin-tsiàⁿ ē kah sè-kan lâng tuà tī tē-tsiūⁿ? Lí khuàⁿ, thiⁿ kah tsiah-ê thiⁿ ê thiⁿ, siōng-tshiáⁿ bô kàu-gia̍h hō͘ Lí tuà, hô-hòng guá só͘ khí tsit king tiān?
English: But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens can't contain you; how much less this house which I have built!

Tailo: Tú tshin-tshiūnn tshik-tsiáu-á pue khí pue lo̍h, ìⁿ-á pue-lâi pue khì, bô-iân bô-kò͘ ê tsiù-tsó͘ mā bē ìng-giām.
English: Like a fluttering sparrow, Like a darting swallow, So the undeserved curse doesn't come to rest.

Tailo: Tse-bul tuì i kóng, Lí bat kóng, A-mí-me-li̍k sī siáⁿ lâng, hō͘ lán kā i ho̍k-sāi, lí kóng tsiah-ê uē ê tshuì tī tó-uī? Tse kám m̄-sī lí só͘ biáu-sī ê jîn-bîn? Lí taⁿ tio̍h tshut-khì kah in kau-tsiàn.
English: Then said Zebul to him, Where is now your mouth, that you said, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? is not this the people that you have despised? go out now, I pray, and fight with them.

Tailo: In m̄-thang tshuā ki-lí tsò bó͘ á-.sī hông uè lah-sap ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò bó͘, mā m̄-thang tshuā hō͘ tiōng-hu lî-tshut ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò bó͘, in-uī in sī kui in ê Siōng-tè tsò sìng.
English: They shall not marry a woman who is a prostitute, or profane; neither shall they marry a woman divorced from her husband: for he is holy to his God.

Tailo: hit-ê kah i su-thong ê lâng, tio̍h the̍h gō͘-tsa̍p-ê gîn hō͘ tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê lāu-pē, in-uī i í-king kā i lîng-jio̍k, tsiū tio̍h tshuā i tsò bó͘, tsi̍t-sì-lâng m̄-thang kā i lî tiāu.
English: then the man who lay with her shall give to the lady's father fifty shekels of silver, and she shall be his wife, because he has humbled her; he may not put her away all his days.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsiàu ta̍k tsi-tso̍k lâi kíng-suán ū tì-huī, ū kiàn-sik koh ū bîng-bōng ê lâng, thang hō͘ guá lâi kā in siat-li̍p tsò lín ê siú-líng. '
English: Take wise men of understanding and well known according to your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.

Tailo: Tī tsik-hua̍t ê ji̍t, E-hu-laim ē pha-hng; guá tī I-su-la-el tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k tiong, hō͘ in tsai tsiong-lâi it-tīng ē huat-sing ê tāi-tsì.
English: Ephraim will become a desolation in the day of rebuke. Among the tribes of Israel, I have made known that which will surely be.

Tailo: Mā m̄-sī tī hái-guā, tì-sú lí kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng uī guán kuè hái tuà-lâi guán tsia, hō͘ guán thiaⁿ lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ? '
English: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsing-seⁿ ê tiong-kan thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, bô-lūn sī gû sī iûⁿ, nā í-king kui Siōng-tsú tsò thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, lâng m̄-thang koh kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, in-uī tse pún-lâi to̍h sī Siōng-tsú ê.
English: Only the firstborn among animals, which is made a firstborn to Yahweh, no man may dedicate it; whether an ox or sheep, it is Yahweh's.

Tailo: Puē-gi̍k kah huān tsuē ê lâng ē tsò tsi̍t-ē pāi-huāi; pàng-sak Siōng-tsú ê lâng it-tīng siū siau-bia̍t.
English: But the destruction of transgressors and sinners shall be together, And those who forsake Yahweh shall be consumed.

Tailo: In-uī in tuì I bô tiong-si̍t, bô tsīn-tiong siú I ê iok.
English: For their heart was not right with him, Neither were they faithful in his covenant.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t ki tshiú bong guá, hō͘ guá ê kha-thâu-u kah tshiú-tsiúⁿ tah tī tē-.ni̍h teh tshuah.
English: Behold, a hand touched me, which set me on my knees and on the palms of my hands.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hiān-kim pí guá khah siàu-liân ê lâng kā guá thí-tshiò, hit khuán lâng ê lāu-pē, guá pún-lâi khuànn in bē khah su guá iûⁿ-kûn ê káu.
English: But now those who are younger than I, have me in derision, Whose fathers I would have disdained to put with my sheep dogs.

Tailo: Bô siū kat-lé ê tsa-po͘ ê, i sing-khu kì-jiân bô siū kat-lé, sī uî-puē guá ê iok, it-tīng tio̍h tuì jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan tû-.khì.
English: The uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off from his people. He has broken my covenant.

Tailo: Jiân-āu Siōng-tè kah i li̍p-iok, īng kat-lé tsò kì-hō. In-uī án-ne, i seⁿ Í-sak liáu-āu tē-peh ji̍t, tsiū kā i kiânn kat-lé. Āu-lâi, Í-sak seⁿ Iâ-kop, Iâ-kop seⁿ lán tsa̍p-jī-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ.
English: He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.

Tailo: Tshuā in tshut-khì liáu-āu, kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê sù-tsiá kóng, Lí tio̍h tô-miā, m̄-thang ua̍t thâu khuànn, mā m̄-thang tuà tī pîng-guân, tio̍h tsáu-khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h. Nā bô, khióng-kiaⁿ lín ē siū bia̍t-bông.
English: It came to pass, when they had taken them out, that he said, Escape for your life! Don't look behind you, and don't stay anywhere in the plain. Escape to the mountains, lest you be consumed!

Tailo: Siōng-tè tī lán pi-bî ê sî siàu-liām lán, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Who remembered us in our low estate; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng gia̍h thâu khuànn, kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng, khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tshin-tshiūnn tshiū-á teh kiâⁿ.
English: He looked up, and said, I see men; for I see them like trees walking.

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Lí īng siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-jiah lâi tsìng-bîng Lí ū kuân tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì?
English: The Jews therefore answered him, What sign do you show us, seeing that you do these things?

Tailo: Tsè-si Tsa-tok kah Ná-than sian-ti, tī Gi-hóng í-king kā i buah iû tsò ông; in lóng tuì hia khí-.lâi, tsin huann-hí, tì-sú siâⁿ ìn-siaⁿ, tse to̍h-sī lín só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê siann;
English: and Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon; and they are come up from there rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that you have heard.

Tailo: Lí bô tuà lí ê iûⁿ tsò sio-tsè lâi hō͘ Guá, mā bô īng tsè-mi̍h tsun-kìng Guá. Guá bô in-uī só͘ hiàn ê mi̍h hō͘ lí lô-khó͘, mā bô in-uī jú-hiuⁿ hō͘ lí ià-siān.
English: You have not brought me of your sheep for burnt offerings; neither have you honored me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with offerings, nor wearied you with frankincense.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su í-king hō͘ Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng bô uē thang ìn, tsiū tsū-tsi̍p tsò-hué.
English: But the Pharisees, when they heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, gathered themselves together.

Tailo: E-gú-lóng tsū-tsi̍p Am-móng lâng kah A-má-li̍k lâng lâi uá i, khì phah I-su-la-el lâng, tsiàm tsó tshiū ê siâⁿ.
English: He gathered to him the children of Ammon and Amalek; and he went and struck Israel, and they possessed the city of palm trees.

Tailo: Nā phah-lak i ê lô͘-po̍k á-.sī lú-pī tsi̍t ki tshuì-khí, tsiū tio̍h in-uī in ê tshuì-khí pàng in khì tsū-iû.
English: If he strikes out his male servant's tooth, or his female servant's tooth, he shall let him go free for his tooth's sake.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h sàu-kak, ta̍t-á, pî-pê, khîm, sik, sing kah ta̍k tsióng ga̍k-khì ê siann, nā phak lo̍h-khì kìng-pài guá só͘ tsō ê siōng tsiū hó; tsóng-.sī, lín nā m̄ kìng-pài, tsiū ē suî-sî siū hiat lo̍h-khì iām-jua̍h ê hué-lô͘, kám ū siáⁿ-mi̍h sîn-bîng ē kiù lín thuat-lī guá ê tshiú?
English: Now if you are ready whenever you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipe, and all kinds of music to fall down and worship the image which I have made, well: but if you don't worship, you shall be cast the same hour into the midst of a burning fiery furnace; and who is that god that shall deliver you out of my hands?

Tailo: ū la̍k-bān nn̄g-tshing tshit-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Dan, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kóng, Guá beh si un hō͘ Na-ha-si ê kiáⁿ Ha-nun, tú tshin-tshiūnn i ê lāu-pē si un hō͘ guá. Ta-bi̍t tsiū tshe jîn-sîn, kau-thok in uī-tio̍h sí lāu-pē kā i an-uì. Ta-bi̍t ê jîn-sîn lâi-kàu Am-móng lâng ê kíng lāi.
English: David said, I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father shown kindness to me. So David sent by his servants to comfort him concerning his father. David's servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí kah tsa-bó͘ lâng kiat uan-siû, lí ê kiáⁿ-sun kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun mā kiat uan-siû, i ē siong lí ê thâu-khak, lí beh siong i ê kha-āu-teⁿ.
English: I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel.

Tailo: In kóng, Guán bat i. Koh tuì in kóng, I kám pîng-an? Ìn kóng, Pîng-an. Lí khuàⁿ, i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ La̍h-khel tshuā iûⁿ-kûn teh lâi.
English: He said to them, Is it well with him? They said, It is well. See, Rachel, his daughter, is coming with the sheep.

Tailo: Guá tsò gín-á ê sî, kóng-uē tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, sìng-tsîng tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, ì-kiàn tshin-tshiūnn gín-á. Taⁿ guá í-king tuā-lâng ā, tsiū kā gín-á ê tāi-tsì lóng pàng-sak.
English: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things.

Tailo: Lí kám ū huat-tō͘ hō͘ tsa̍p-jī kiong tsiàu i ê sî-hāu tshut-.lâi? Koh ín-tshuā Pak-táu-tsheⁿ kah i só͘ sio̍k ê tsheⁿ?
English: Can you lead forth the constellations in their season? Or can you guide the Bear with her cubs?

Tailo: Tsiok-hok lí ê, Guá ē sù-hok hō͘ in; tsiù-tsó͘ lí ê, Guá ē kā i tsik-hua̍t. Tē tsiūⁿ bān-tso̍k ē in-uī lí lâi tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who curses you. In you will all of the families of the earth be blessed.

Tailo: Hit sî, Tsa-kha-lī-a suî-sî khui tshuì kóng-uē, o-ló Siōng-tè.
English: His mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue freed, and he spoke, blessing God.

Tailo: Tha-mal kā i kóng, M̄-thang án-ne, lí kuáⁿ guá tshut-khì ē hāi-tio̍h guá, pí lí tsîng khuán-thāi guá ê khah thiám! Tsóng-.sī, Am-non m̄-khíng thiaⁿ i.
English: She said to him, Not so, because this great wrong in putting me forth is worse than the other that you did to me. But he would not listen to her.

Tailo: Tng Io-si-iah ông tsē-uī ê sî, Siōng-tsú koh tuì guá kóng, Puē-gi̍k ê I-su-la-el só͘ tsò ê, lí ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h bô? I tsiūⁿ tsiah-ê kuân suaⁿ, tī só͘-ū tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshiū kha kiânn kan-îm.
English: Moreover Yahweh said to me in the days of Josiah the king, Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? she is gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and there has played the prostitute.

Tailo: Koh kā Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī, í-ki̍p khǹg kim niáu-tshí kah liàp-á siōng ê siuⁿ, lóng hē tī tshia-.ni̍h.
English: and they put the ark of Yahweh on the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the images of their tumors.

Tailo: Guá tshuā i khì tshuē Lí ê bûn-tô͘, in bô huat-tō͘ kā i i hó.
English: So I brought him to your disciples, and they could not cure him.

Tailo: Tsit-ê lâng khì kìⁿ Pí-la̍h-to, tshíng-kiû siu-bâi I-é-su ê sin-si.
English: this man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus' body.

Tailo: Guá beh kàng hué tī Ha-tsa-el ê ke, sio-bia̍t Bian-ha-tat ê kiong-tiān.
English: But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, And it will devour the palaces of Ben Hadad.

Tailo: I bâi-ho̍k tī ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi, tshin-tshiūnn sai bih tī i ê hia̍t; i bâi-ho̍k beh lia̍h sàn-tshiah lâng; īng bāng kā sàn-tshiah lâng bāng-.leh lia̍h-.khì.
English: He lurks in secret as a lion in his ambush. He lies in wait to catch the helpless. He catches the helpless, when he draws him in his net.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: In lia̍h mê tsò ji̍t, kóng, kng teh tsiap-kīn o͘-àm.
English: They change the night into day, Saying The light is near' in the presence of darkness.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú kah guán tông-tsāi, tsò guán ê thâu, I ê tsè-si mā kah guán tī-.leh, the̍h hiáng-liāng ê kó͘-tshue tuā-siaⁿ pûn lâi kā lín kong-kik. I-su-la-el lâng, m̄-thang kah Siōng-tsú — lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè kau-tsiàn, in-uī lín bē-tàng hing-thong.
English: Behold, God is with us at our head, and his priests with the trumpets of alarm to sound an alarm against you. Children of Israel, don't you fight against Yahweh, the God of your fathers; for you shall not prosper.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g! Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kuáⁿ-kín lâi pang-tsān guá!
English: God, don't be far from me. My God, hurry to help me.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng nā m̄ guān-ì tshuā i ê hiaⁿ-só, i ê hiaⁿ-só tsiū tio̍h kàu siâⁿ mn̂g ê tiúⁿ-ló hia, kóng, ' Guá ê tiōng-hu ê sió-tī m̄-khíng tī I-su-la-el tiong kā i ê a-hiaⁿ thuân tsi̍t-ê miâ-jī, bô beh tuì guá tsīn sió-tsik ê pún-hūn. '
English: If the man doesn't want to take his brother's wife, then his brother's wife shall go up to the gate to the elders, and say, My husband's brother refuses to raise up to his brother a name in Israel; he will not perform the duty of a husband's brother to me.

Tailo: Lâng tsi̍t ē tsai só͘ huān ê tsuē, huē-tsiòng tsiū tio̍h hiàn tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á-kiáⁿ tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, khan lâi-kàu huē-bō͘ tsîng.
English: when the sin in which they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông kóng, Tio̍h tshuā Mi-ka-iah-khì kau hō͘ siâⁿ-siú Am-móng kah ông ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si, kóng,
English: The king of Israel said, Take Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king's son;

Tailo: M̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn m̄-bat Siōng-tè ê guā-pang lâng teh hòng-tshiòng su-io̍k.
English: not in the passion of lust, even as the Gentiles who don't know God;

Tailo: Si̍t-hîng guá Thiⁿ-pē ê tsí-ì ê lâng, to̍h-sī guá ê hiann-tī, tsí-muē kah lāu-bú.
English: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.

Tailo: Guá beh kā ún-tsông ê pó-bu̍t kah ún-ba̍t ê tsâi-pó siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí, hō͘ lí tsai kiò lí ê miâ tiàu lí ê to̍h-sī Guá — Siōng-tsú, I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè.
English: and I will give you the treasures of darkness, and hidden riches of secret places, that you may know that it is I, Yahweh, who call you by your name, even the God of Israel.

Tailo: Suî-jiân A-bu-la-hàm m̄-bat guán, I-su-la-el m̄-jīn guán, tsóng-.sī, Lí sī guán ê pē. Siōng-tsú ah, Lí sī guán ê pē, tuì bān-kó͘ í-lâi, Lí ê miâ kiò-tsò Kiù-sio̍k guán ê Tsú .
English: For you are our Father, though Abraham doesn't know us, and Israel does not acknowledge us: you, Yahweh, are our Father; our Redeemer from everlasting is your name.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê to̍h-sī tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal kah Nùn ê kiáⁿ Io-siú-ah, í-ki̍p I-su-la-el lâng tsi-tso̍k tiong ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tī Sī-lô, tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, liam-khau só͘ pun ê sán-gia̍p, án-ne in pun uân hit-ê tē.
English: These are the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance by lot in Shiloh before Yahweh, at the door of the tent of meeting. So they made an end of dividing the land.

Tailo: Tē-gō͘ ji̍t sī Si-miān kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, Tsu-lí-sià-tāi ê kiáⁿ Si-lu-mi-el.
English: On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, prince of the children of Simeon

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tsiàu án-ne kiânn, hō͘ in tshut-khì iâⁿ guā. Siōng-tsú án-ne huan-hù Mô͘-se, I-su-la-el lâng tsiū án-ne khì kiâⁿ.
English: The children of Israel did so, and put them out outside of the camp; as Yahweh spoke to Moses, so did the children of Israel.

Tailo: Ná ē ū lāu-bú ê kha-thâu-u tsiap-la̍p guá? Án-tsuáⁿ ū ling hō͘ guá suh?
English: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should suck?

Tailo: Lí ná ē tshin-tshiūnn tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì ê lâng, ná ē tshin-tshiūnn bē-tàng kiù lâng ê ióng-sū? Siōng-tsú ah, Lí iû-guân tī guán tiong-kan; guán mā kiò-tsò sio̍k Lí ê miâ ê lâng, kiû Lí m̄-thang pàng-sak guán.
English: Why should you be like a scared man, as a mighty man who can't save? yet you, Yahweh, are in the midst of us, and we are called by your name; don't leave us.

Tailo: Kiû Lí tshun tshiú lâi i-pēⁿ, koh thong-kuè Lí sîn-sìng ê lô͘-po̍k I-é-su ê miâ lâi kiâⁿ sîn-jiah kî-sū.
English: while you stretch out your hand to heal; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of your holy Servant Jesus.

Tailo: In kóng, Guán kam-guān hō͘ lí. Tsiū tshu tsi̍t-niá guā-saⁿ, ta̍k lâng kā só͘ tshiúⁿ ê hīⁿ-khuân hiat tī hit tíng-bīn.
English: They answered, We will willingly give them. They spread a garment, and did cast therein every man the earrings of his spoil.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ nî, Iô-tah ông Iô-sa-huat lo̍h-khì I-su-la-el ông hia.
English: It happened in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the king of Judah came down to the king of Israel.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Taⁿ tsit-ê sī guá kut lāi ê kut, bah lāi ê bah; guá beh kā i kiò-tsò tsa-bó͘ lâng, in-uī i sī tuì tsa-po͘ lâng the̍h tshut-.lâi ê.
English: The man said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

Tailo: In tio̍h tī jī-gue̍h tsa̍p-sì hông-hun ê sî lâi siú, tsham bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ kah khó͘-tshài lâi tsia̍h.
English: In the second month, on the fourteenth day at evening they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

Tailo: Tī An-hioh-ji̍t, guán tshut siâⁿ mn̂g guā lâi-kàu hô piⁿ, siūⁿ kóng tī hia ū kî-tó ê só͘-tsāi. Guán tsiū tsē lo̍h-.lâi kah tsū-tsi̍p tī hia ê hū-jîn-lâng tâm-lūn tō-lí.
English: On the Sabbath day we went forth outside of the city by a riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer, and we sat down, and spoke to the women who had come together.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-sài kám m̄-sī lóng teh tsò Siōng-tè tshe-īng-ê Sìng Sîn, siū tshe-phài lâi ho̍k-sāi teh beh niá-siū tsín-kiù ê lâng?
English: Aren't they all ministering spirits, sent out to do service for the sake of those who will inherit salvation?

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi ê tshù kah Iô-tah ông ê tshù, to̍h-sī thiah-huí lâi tí-tòng tuì-ti̍k ê thô͘-tui kah tí-tòng to-kiàm ê,
English: For thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city, and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are broken down to make a defense against the mounds and against the sword;

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang khuànn-khin bî-sè tiong-kan ê tsi̍t-ê, in-uī guá kā lín kóng, in ê thiⁿ-sài tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē bīn-tsîng teh khiā.
English: See that you don't despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven.
