Tailo: I-é-su thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsiū kā i kóng, Lí iáu khiàm tsi̍t hāng; tio̍h khì bē lí só͘-ū ê tsâi-sán lâi pun hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng, án-ne, lí tsiū ū tsik-tsū tsâi-pó tī thinn-tíng, jiân-āu tsiah lâi tuè guá.
English: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him, You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú hō͘ A-siul ông ê kun-tiúⁿ lâi kā in kong-kik, īng kau-á kau tio̍h Má-ná-se, īng tâng-liān kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, ah kàu Ba-bú-lông.
English: Therefore Yahweh brought on them the captains of the army of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh in chains, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā in kóng, Lín ná ē teh put-an, sim-lāi teh khí giâu-gî?
English: He said to them, Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?

Tailo: í-ki̍p Iol-tàn hô guā, tang pîng A-la̍h-bah ê tsuân tē, it-ti̍t kàu A-la̍h-bah ê hái, uá-kīn Pi-su-gah ê suaⁿ-kha.
English: and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.

Tailo: Lâng huat-tsâi, ka-tîng ke-thinn îng-kng, lí m̄-bián in-uī án-ne lâi tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: Don't be afraid when a man is made rich, When the glory of his house is increased.

Tailo: Guá ê sim ì-hiòng I-su-la-el hiah-ê siat-li̍p lu̍t-huat ê, jîn-bîn tiong kam-guān hi-sing ê, lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú.
English: My heart is toward the governors of Israel, Who offered themselves willingly among the people: Bless you Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí ná ē kan-tāⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h hiann-tī ba̍k-tsiu lāi ê tsháu-á-iù, ā bô tsù-ì-tio̍h lí ka-kī ba̍k-tsiu lāi ê tshâ-kho͘?
English: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye, but don't consider the beam that is in your own eye?

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá siàu-liân lâng lâi kā i ê sin-si pau khí-.lâi, kng tshut-khì bâi-tsòng.
English: The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hun-pia̍t siān-ok ê tshiū, i ê kué-tsí m̄-thang tsia̍h, in-uī tsia̍h ê ji̍t, lí it-tīng ē sí.
English: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, you shall not eat of it; for in the day that you eat of it you will surely die.

Tailo: Kā iûⁿ tshiat tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè, Mô͘-se kā thâu kah bah-tè, í-ki̍p iû lóng sio.
English: He cut the ram into its pieces; and Moses burned the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

Tailo: Suà lo̍h-.lâi, I-su-la-el lâng án-ne kî-tó, Siōng-tsú ah, to̍k-to̍k Lí sī Siōng-tsú! Lí tshòng-tsō thiⁿ kah tsiah-ê thiⁿ ê thiⁿ kah thinn-tíng ê bān-kun, tē kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê bān-mi̍h, hái kah hái tiong ê bān-mi̍h, tse it-tshè lóng sī Lí só͘ pó-tsûn ê. Thian-kun mā kìng-pài Lí.
English: You are Yahweh, even you alone; you have made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their army, the earth and all things that are thereon, the seas and all that is in them, and you preserve them all; and the army of heaven worships you.

Tailo: Tsiàu lán ê Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok kā guá tsí-sī ê, guá ka-kī tsai guá lī-khui sè-kan ê ji̍t-tsí í-king teh beh kàu.
English: knowing that the putting off of my tent comes swiftly, even as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Lí lo̍h-khì kìm-kài jîn-bîn, khióng-kiaⁿ in tsông kuè-kài, kàu Siōng-tsú tsia lâi khuànn, tì-sú in tsin tsē lâng ē sí;
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through to Yahweh to gaze, and many of them perish.

Tailo: Guá kah lín li̍p Guá ê iok, kiàn-nā ū jio̍k-thé ê, bē koh hō͘ tuā-tsuí bia̍t-bông, mā bô koh ū tuā-tsuí huí-huāi thó͘-tē.
English: I will establish my covenant with you: all flesh will not be cut off any more by the waters of the flood, neither will there ever again be a flood to destroy the earth.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm ê lô͘-po̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h in tsiah-ê uē, tsiū ǹg Siōng-tsú phak tī tē-.ni̍h.
English: It happened that when Abraham's servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tuà tī Tsì-kuân-.ê ê ún-ba̍t só͘-tsāi ê lâng, Hit-ê lâng ē tuà tī tsuân-lîng Siōng-tè ê ìm-ńg ē.
English: He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High Will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

Tailo: Lâng ê sim kè-uē i ê lō͘, to̍k-to̍k sī Siōng-tsú teh tiāⁿ-tio̍h i ê kha-pō͘.
English: A man's heart plans his course, But Yahweh directs his steps.

Tailo: I-é-su tī Bē-tha-niah, khì thái-ko pēnn-lâng Sí-mòng ê tshù teh tsē-toh tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî, ū tsi̍t-ê hū-jîn-lâng tuà tsi̍t-kuàn gi̍k-pân ji̍p-.lâi, lāi-bīn té tsin sûn koh kuì ê Ná-ta̍t phang-iû. I kòng-phuà gi̍k-pân, kā phang-iû piàⁿ tī I-é-su ê thâu-khak tíng.
English: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nardvery costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Khó-la̍h tsiah-ê kiáⁿ bô sí.
English: Notwithstanding, the sons of Korah didn't die.

Tailo: Ông ê jîn-sîn kā i kóng, Ha-mán khiā tī īⁿ lāi. Ông kóng, Kiò i ji̍p-.lâi.
English: The king's servants said to him, Behold, Haman stands in the court. The king said, Let him come in.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì guá kóng, Suî-jiân ū Mô͘-se kah Sa-mu-el khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, thè in kiû, Guá ê sim mā bô tsiàu-kò͘ tsiah-ê jîn-bîn. Tio̍h kā in kuáⁿ lī-khui Guá ê bīn-tsîng, hō͘ in tshut-.khì.
English: Then said Yahweh to me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind would not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.

Tailo: in-uī la̍k ji̍t lāi, Siōng-tsú tshòng-tsō thiⁿ, tē, hái kah hit tiong-kan ê bān-mi̍h, tē-tshit ji̍t tsiū hioh-khùn, só͘-í Siōng-tsú sù-hok tī An-hioh-ji̍t, siat-li̍p i tsò sìng.
English: for in six days Yahweh made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore Yahweh blessed the Sabbath day, and made it holy.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h thò bé-tshia, khiâ bé! Tì thâu-khue khiā khí-.lâi, buâ tshiuⁿ, tshīng tsiàn-kah!
English: Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kā tshiú gia̍h khí-.lâi, īng kuái-á phah tsio̍h-puâⁿ nn̄g ē, tsiū ū tsin tsē tsuí lâu tshut-.lâi, huē-tsiòng kah in ê tsing-seⁿ lóng lim tsuí.
English: Moses lifted up his hand, and struck the rock with his rod twice: and water came forth abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their livestock.

Tailo: Lín nā ua̍t-tńg- âi khì-sak Guá ê lu̍t-lē kah Guá ê kài-bīng, to̍h-sī Guá hē tī lín ê bīn-tsîng ê, khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng lâi kā i kìng-pài,
English: But if you turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;

Tailo: Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, tshuā lín tshut Ai-gi̍p tē, beh tsò lín ê Siōng-tè. Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Iô-tah sī sè-tsiah sai; guá ê kiáⁿ, lí lia̍h-tio̍h la̍h-bu̍t tsiū tńg-.khì; i khut-lo̍h, i thèⁿ-kha, tshin-tshiūnn sai, tshin-tshiūnn bó ê sai, siáⁿ lâng káⁿ jiá i?
English: Judah is a lion's cub. From the prey, my son, you have gone up. He stooped down, he crouched as a lion, As a lioness. Who will rouse him up?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ū ua̍h-miā ê bah, to̍h-sī ū kâⁿ hueh ê, lín m̄-thang tsia̍h.
English: But flesh with the life of it, the blood of it, you shall not eat.

Tailo: Tú hit sî, huat-sing tuā tē-tāng, hit tsō siâⁿ tò tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it; in-uī tē-tāng sí-.khì ê ū tshit-tshing lâng; kî-tha ê lâng tuā tio̍h-kiaⁿ, kui îng-kng hō͘ thinn-tíng ê Siōng-tè.
English: In that day there was a great earthquake, and a tenth of the city fell. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, and the rest were terrified, and gave glory to the God of heaven.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tha̍k hit-tiuⁿ phue liáu-āu, siū-tio̍h kó͘-lē, tsiū tuā huann-hí.
English: When they had read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement.

Tailo: Taⁿ bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Lín ná ē kiânn tsit-ê tuā pháiⁿ, hāi lín ka-kī, hō͘ lín ê tsa-po͘ lâng, tsa-bó͘ lâng, gín-á kah tsia̍h ling ê enn-á, lóng tuì Iô-tah tiong kā lín tû-.khì, bô lâu kah puàⁿ-ê?
English: Therefore now thus says Yahweh, the God of Armies, the God of Israel: Why commit you this great evil against your own souls, to cut off from you man and woman, infant and suckling, out of the midst of Judah, to leave you none remaining;

Tailo: Lâm-pak sī Lí só͘ tshòng-tsō; Tha-bool suaⁿ kah Hel-móng suaⁿ lóng in-uī Lí ê miâ lâi huann-hí.
English: The north and the south, you have created them. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lâng nā uī-tio̍h Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ lâi pàng-sak tshù-the̍h, bó͘, hiann-tī, pē-bú á-.sī kiáⁿ-jî,
English: He said to them, Most assuredly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for the Kingdom of God's sake,

Tailo: I-é-su tńg-.lâi ê sî, tsìng lâng lóng kā I gîng-tsiap, in-uī tāi-ke lóng teh thìng-hāu I.
English: It happened, when Jesus returned, that the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.

Tailo: in tuà tī bōng lāi, hioh tī ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi; in tsia̍h ti-bah, in ê khì-kū lāi ū khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h tsò ê thng;
English: who sit among the graves, and lodge in the secret places; who eat pig's flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;

Tailo: In-uī in khuànn thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí tsò sí-ìm, in-uī in tī sí-ìm tsin kuàn-sì.
English: For the morning is to all of them like thick darkness, For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.

Tailo: Hì-lāng liáu-āu, tsiū kā hit niá tn̂g-phàu thǹg khí-.lâi, koh kā I ka-kī ê saⁿ-tshīng tò tńg-.khì, jiân-āu ah I tshut-khì tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off of him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kah Iô-há-neh kā in huāⁿ-tshiú, in tsiū tit-tio̍h Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá.
English: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Nî-lī-ngá ê kiáⁿ: E-lio-e-nái, Hi-tse-kia, A-tsu-li-kam, kiōng saⁿ-ê.
English: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, and Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.

Tailo: In ê thiàⁿ, in ê uàn-hūn kah in ê tsi̍t-tò͘, lóng í-king siau-bia̍t. Tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè tāi-tsì, íng-uán bô in ê hūn.
English: Also their love, their hatred, and their envy has perished long ago; neither have they any more a portion forever in anything that is done under the sun.

Tailo: I ē kā lô-bāng pha tī pháiⁿ lâng ê sin tsiūⁿ; ū hué-iām, liû-hông kah iām-jua̍h ê hong tsò in ing-kai siū ê pò-ìng.
English: On the wicked he will rain blazing coals; Fire, sulfur, and scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.

Tailo: M̄-koh, in-uī guá bô tú-tio̍h guá ê hiann-tī Tî-to, só͘-í, guá ê sim-sîn bô pîng-an, tsiū kah in sio-sî, khì Ma-ke-tó-niah.
English: I had no relief for my spirit, because I didn't find Titus, my brother, but taking my leave of them, I went out into Macedonia.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Iô-sé-huh tshiú tiong ê tāi-tsì, kuán-kaⁿ ê it-khài bô tshap, in-uī Siōng-tsú kah Iô-sé-huh tông-tsāi, jî-tshiánn i só͘ tsò ê, Siōng-tsú lóng hō͘ i hing-thong.
English: The keeper of the prison didn't look after anything that was under his hand, because Yahweh was with him; and that which he did, Yahweh made it prosper.

Tailo: Guá thiàⁿ lín, tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tè thiàⁿ lín thiàⁿ kah ē khí tsi̍t-tò͘, in-uī lín tshin-tshiūnn sûn-kiat ê tsāi-sik-lí, guá kā lín phit-phuè hō͘ tsi̍t-ê tiōng-hu, to̍h-sī Ki-tok.
English: For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy. For I married you to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ.

Tailo: In tio̍h kah lí liân-ha̍p, mā tio̍h tsò huē-bō͘ ê tshe-īng, liāu-lí pò͘-pênn só͘-ū ê kang; tsóng-.sī, guā-bīn lâng m̄-thang uá-kīn lín.
English: They shall be joined to you, and keep the charge of the tent of meeting, for all the service of the Tent: and a stranger shall not come near to you.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Liân lín to bē bîng-pi̍k, sī-.bô? Lín kám m̄-tsai tuì guā-bīn ji̍p-khì lâng ê sing-khu ê, bē hō͘ lâng bô tshing-khì?
English: He said to them, Are you thus without understanding also? Don't you perceive that whatever goes into the man from outside can't defile him,

Tailo: Tio̍h siàu-liām í-tsîng ín-tshuā lín, thuân Siōng-tè ê hok-im hō͘ lín ê lâng. Tio̍h tsim-tsiok khuànn in hîng-uî ê kiat-kio̍k, lâi ha̍k-si̍p in ê sìn-gióng.
English: Remember your leaders, men who spoke to you the word of God, and considering the results of their conduct, imitate their faith.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-la̍t pó-siú lí ê sim, in-uī sim sī ua̍h-miā ê kin-guân.
English: Keep your heart with all diligence, For out of it is the wellspring of life.

Tailo: Huē-tn̂g lāi ū tsi̍t-ê hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin ê lâng, tuā-siaⁿ huah,
English: In the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,

Tailo: Kú-si̍t ê n̂g-gi̍k kah i bē pí-tit; tsiok-siâⁿ ê kim mā put-jû i.
English: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, Neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

Tailo: Guá taⁿ nā tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, kiû Lí kā Lí ê lō͘ tsí-sī guá, hō͘ guá bat Lí, thang tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián. Lí tio̍h siàu-liām tsit tso̍k sī Lí ê tsú-bîn.
English: Now therefore, if I have found favor in your sight, please show me now your ways, that I may know you, so that I may find favor in your sight: and consider that this nation is your people.

Tailo: Tē-sì-ê thiⁿ-sài tsi̍t ē pûn, ji̍t ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it, gue̍h ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it, tsheⁿ ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it lóng siū-tio̍h kong-kik, tì-sú ji̍t, gue̍h, tsheⁿ ê saⁿ-hūn tsi-it piàn-tsò àm. Ji̍t-sî saⁿ-hūn tsi-it bô kng, àm-sî mā saⁿ-hūn tsi-it bô kng.
English: The fourth angel sounded, and one third of the sun was struck, and one third of the moon, and one third of the stars; so that one third of them would be darkened, and the day wouldn't shine for one third of it, and the night in the same way.

Tailo: Mā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tse sī tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè kah i ê kuàn-tiān í-guā.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, and their drink offerings.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tio̍h tī tuì-thâu kàu-bué lóng kah lán tsò-hué ê lâng tiong-kan, suán tsi̍t-ê lâi kah guán tàu-tīn tsò I-é-su koh-ua̍h ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn.
English: Of the men therefore who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,

Tailo: Haiⁿh, Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng I-é-su, Lí hô-pit lâi kan-sia̍p guán? Lí beh lâi huí-bia̍t guán, sī-.bô? Guá tsai Lí sī siáⁿ-mi̍h khuán lâng, Lí sī Siōng-tè ê sìng Kiáⁿ.
English: saying, Ah! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí beh koh bih guā kú? Kám ē kàu íng-uán? Lí ê siū-khì tshin-tshiūnn hué teh to̍h ē guā kú?
English: How long, Yahweh? Will you hide yourself forever? Will your wrath burn like fire?

Tailo: Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-saⁿ ji̍t.
English: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.

Tailo: Ông kā Tsi-bah kóng, Me-hui-bo-siat só͘-ū ê lóng kui hō͘ lí. Tsi-bah kóng, Guá kuī-pài, guān tī guá ê tsú — guá ê ông ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián.
English: Then said the king to Ziba, Behold, all that pertains to Mephibosheth is yours. Ziba said, I do obeisance; let me find favor in your sight, my lord, O king.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tuì kûn-tsiòng kóng, Tio̍h kín-sīn, tio̍h iok-sok ka-kī, tio̍h thê-hông kok tsióng ê tham-sim, in-uī lâng ê ua̍h-miā kè-ta̍t m̄-sī tsāi tī i só͘ tsik-tsū ê tsâi-sán.
English: He said to them, Beware! Keep yourselves from covetousness, for a man's life doesn't consist of the abundance of the things which he possesses.

Tailo: Ke-ná-nah ê kiáⁿ Tse-ti-kiah tsò thih ê kak, kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí ē īng tsiah-ê kak tak A-lâm lâng, ti̍t-kàu in bia̍t-bông. '
English: Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron, and said, Thus says Yahweh, With these shall you push the Syrians, until they be consumed.

Tailo: tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê,
English: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old, everyone who entered into the service, for work in the Tent of Meeting,

Tailo: In kí Siōng-tsú ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, sī beh kóng I tshuā I-su-la-el ê kiáⁿ-sun tuì pak-hong ê tē lâi, mā tuì kiàn-nā Guá só͘ kuáⁿ in kàu ê tē lâi. In ē tuà tī pún só͘-tsāi.
English: but, As Yahweh lives, who brought up and who led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had driven them. They shall dwell in their own land.

Tailo: Siōng-tè thong-kuè tō lâi tshòng-tsō bān-mi̍h, it-tshè siū tshòng-tsō ê lóng sī thong-kuè tō lâi tshòng-tsō.
English: All things were made through him. Without him was not anything made that has been made.

Tailo: Io-lah ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsi̍t-pah tsa̍p-jī lâng.
English: The children of Jorah, one hundred twelve.

Tailo: Bô beh hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tshut lí teh kìm-tsia̍h, kan-taⁿ hō͘ Thiⁿ-pē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h; án-ne tiām-tiām-á teh kuan-tshat ê Thiⁿ-pē tsiū ē kā lí pò-siúⁿ.
English: so that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

Tailo: Sian-ti I-é-lí-miah tsiū kā tsit-ê uē tuì Iô-tah tsìng lâng kah só͘-ū tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê lâng kóng,
English: which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying:

Tailo: In-uī lán nā kah Ki-tok I-é-su kiat-liân, ū siū kat-lé á-.sī bô siū kat-lé lóng bô iàu-kín, iàu-kín ê sī tuì thiàⁿ-sim piáu-hiān tshut-.lâi ê sìn-sim.
English: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision amounts to anything, nor uncircumcision, but faith working through love.

Tailo: Guá kóng-khí guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘, Lí ū ìn-tap guá; kiû Lí kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē kà-sī guá!
English: I declared my ways, and you answered me. Teach me your statutes.

Tailo: I beh tī tsin tsē kok ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan kiânn sím-phuàⁿ, uī-tio̍h tsin tsē hn̄g-hn̄g kiông-bíng ê kok lâi kái-kuat. In ē kā in ê to phah-tsò lê-thâu, kā in ê tshiuⁿ phah-tsò liâm-á. Tsit kok bô gia̍h to kong-kik hit kok, in mā bô koh ha̍k-si̍p kau-tsiàn.
English: And he will judge between many peoples, And will decide concerning strong nations afar off. They will beat their swords into plowshares, And their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not lift up sword against nation, Neither will they learn war any more.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tè tshuā jîn-bîn uan tuì Âng-hái khòng-iá hit tiâu lō͘ khì. I-su-la-el lâng lóng pâi tuī-ngó͘, tuì Ai-gi̍p tē tshut-.khì.
English: but God led the people around by the way of the wilderness by the Red Sea; and the children of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm, Í-sak, Iâ-kop ê Siōng-tè, to̍h-sī lán tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè, í-king hō͘ I ê lô͘-po̍k I-é-su tit-tio̍h îng-iāu. Lín kā tsit-ê I-é-su kau hō͘ kuaⁿ-hú, suî-jiân Pí-la̍h-to kuat-tīng beh pàng I, lín koh tong-tiûⁿ kī-tsua̍t.
English: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.

Tailo: Iâ-kop ê Siōng-tè bô tshin-tshiūnn tsiah-ê, in-uī I sī tshòng-tsō bān-mi̍h ê Tsú. I-su-la-el mā sī I sán-gia̍p ê tsi-tso̍k, bān-kun ê I-é-ho-bah sī I ê miâ.
English: The portion of Jacob is not like these; for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance: Yahweh of Armies is his name.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tsuân huē-tsiòng lóng tio̍h siú tsit-ê tseh.
English: All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.

Tailo: Iô-tah lâng lâi-kàu, tī hia īng iû buah Ta-bi̍t, hō͘ i tsò Iô-tah ke ê ông. Ū lâng kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, Bâi-tsòng Sàu-lô ê sī Gi-lia̍t-ia-be-si ê lâng.
English: The men of Judah came, and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. They told David, saying, The men of Jabesh Gilead were those who buried Saul.

Tailo: In-uī lán ka-kī í-tsîng mā sī bû-ti, puē-gi̍k, siū bê-hi̍k, tsò kok tsióng su-io̍k kah hióng-lo̍k ê lô͘-lē, tī ok-to̍k kah uàn-tò͘ ê tiong-kan teh sing-ua̍h, hō͘-siong uàn-hūn, pí-tshú thó-ià.
English: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kah Iô-há-neh tuì kûn-tsiòng teh kóng uē ê sî, tsiah-ê tsè-si kah sìng-tiān ê siú-uē-tiúⁿ, í-ki̍p Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng hut-jiân lâi-kàu-uī.
English: As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them,

Tailo: Siōng-tè kā i thok-bāng, kóng, Guá pún tsai lí tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì sī sim tiong tuan-tsiàⁿ; Guá tsiah tsó͘-tòng lí, bián-tit lí tik-tsuē Guá, só͘-í, Guá bô iông-ín lí bong-tio̍h i.
English: God said to him in the dream, Yes, I know that in the integrity of your heart you have done this, and I also withheld you from sinning against me. Therefore I didn't allow you to touch her.

Tailo: Tse sī guá — Nep-kat-ne-tsal ông só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê bāng. Bel-ti-sia-tsal, lí tio̍h kā guá kái-bîng tsit-ê bāng, in-uī guá kok lāi it-tshè tì-huī ê lâng lóng bē-tàng kái-bîng hō͘ guá tsai, tsí ū lí ē, in-uī lín sim-lāi ū hiah-ê sìng ê Siōng-tè ê sîn-lîng.
English: This dream I, king Nebuchadnezzar, have seen; and you, Belteshazzar, declare the interpretation, because all the wise men of my kingdom are not able to make known to me the interpretation; but you are able; for the spirit of the holy gods is in you.

Tailo: Tsûn teh kiâⁿ ê sî, I-é-su khùn-.khì. Hut-jiân tsi̍t tsūn kiông-hong sàu lo̍h-lâi ô͘-.ni̍h, tsûn lāi ji̍p tsuí kiōng-beh tīⁿ khí-.lâi, hui-siông guî-hiám.
English: But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.

Tailo: I-é-su khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tó tī hia, tsai-iáⁿ i í-king phuà-pēⁿ tsin kú, tsiū uá-khì kā i kóng, Lí ū ài lí ê pēⁿ hó khí-lâi bô?
English: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been sick for a long time, he asked him, Do you want to be made well?

Tailo: Siōng-tè kám kan-taⁿ sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê Siōng-tè? I mā sī guā-pang lâng ê Siōng-tè, kám m̄-sī? Tong-jiân sī, I mā sī guā-pang lâng ê Siōng-tè.
English: Or is God the God of Jews only? Isn't he the God of Gentiles also? Yes, of Gentiles also,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Sì-kho͘-uî pîng-sî khuànn-khin I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn ê lâng, í-āu bô koh ǹg in tsò tsha̍k lâng ê tshì, hō͘ lâng kan-khó͘ ê tsháu-tshì, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú.
English: There shall be no more a pricking brier to the house of Israel, nor a hurting thorn of any that are round about them, that did despite to them; and they shall know that I am the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Hi-lâm tsè-tsō nn̄g ki tâng-thiāu, muí ki kuân tsa̍p-peh tiú, thiāu ê sì-kho͘-uî tsa̍p-jī tiú.
English: For he fashioned the two pillars of brass, eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits compassed either of them about.

Tailo: Tsiàu guá só͘ kah-ì ê, tsú hō͘ i ū hó tsu-bī, phâng lâi hō͘ guá tsia̍h, hō͘ guá tī buē sí tsìn-tsîng, kā lí tsiok-hok.
English: Make me savory food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat, and that my soul may bless you before I die.

Tailo: Jī-.gue̍h ê pan-tiúⁿ sī A-huah lâng Tó-tāi, koh ū Mik-lo-t mā sī hit-pan ê thâu-lâng, i ê pan lāi ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: Over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite, and his division; and Mikloth the ruler: and in his division were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: Ū la̍k-tsa̍p-ê ông-hō͘, peh-tsa̍p-ê pîn-hui, mā ū sǹg bē-liáu ê kiong-lí.
English: There are sixty queens, eighty concubines, And virgins without number.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá tshe-phài Tî-mó͘-theh khì lín hia. Tī Tsú ê lāi-bīn, i sī guá só͘ thiàⁿ koh tsīn-tiong ê kiáⁿ, i ē kā guá kah Ki-tok kiat-liân ê sing-ua̍h hong-sik, to̍h-sī guá tī ta̍k só͘-tsāi, tī ta̍k kàu-huē só͘ kà-sī ê tāi-tsì, kóng hō͘ lín tsai.
English: Because of this I have sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord, who will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, even as I teach everywhere in every assembly.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè ah, kin-á-ji̍t, tī I-su-la-el tiong kiám tsi̍t tsi-tso̍k, I-su-la-el tiong ná ē ū tsit khuán tāi-tsì?
English: They said, Yahweh, the God of Israel, why has this happened in Israel, that there should be today one tribe lacking in Israel?

Tailo: Io-lâm tsiū tshuā i hiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ kah só͘-ū ê tsiàn-tshia kuè-.khì, thàu-mê khí-.lâi, phah hiah-ê kā i uî-khùn ê E-tóm lâng kah hiah-ê tshia-tiúⁿ.
English: Then Jehoram passed over with his captains, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and struck the Edomites who surrounded him, along with the captains of the chariots.

Tailo: Guān o͘-àm kah sí-ìm tshim-ji̍p kā i tsing-ho̍k; guān ba̍t hûn thîng tī i ê tíng-bīn, guān hō͘ ji̍t piàn o͘-àm ê kā i phah-kiaⁿ.
English: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own. Let a cloud dwell on it. Let all that makes black the day terrify it.

Tailo: I koh uè lah-sap tī Biān-hin-nóm （ Tsù, guân pán-pún sī im-i̍k, ū ê pán-pún ì-i̍k tsò Hin-nóm-kiáⁿ= Hin-nóm ê kiánn）ê Tô-huí-ti̍k, bián-tit lâng tī hia hō͘ in ê kiáⁿ-jî king-kuè hué, lâi hiàn hō͘ Mô͘-lo̍k.
English: He defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t hit sî, Guá beh tshâ I-su-la-el ê tsuē-kò, mā lóng tshâ bô; Guá beh tshuē Iô-tah ê tsuē-ok, mā lóng tshuē bô; in-uī Guá só͘ lâu lo̍h-.lâi ê tsú-bîn Guá ē kā in sià-bián.
English: In those days, and in that time, says Yahweh, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.

Tailo: Lí ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el ê kûn-tsiòng, bô-lūn sī kò-jîn, á-.sī kûn-tsiòng, nā ta̍k-ê tsai ka-kī sim-lāi ê tsai-hō, ǹg tsit king tiān gia̍h-khí tshiú, bô-lūn án-tsuáⁿ khún-kiû, án-tsuáⁿ kî-tó,
English: whatever prayer and supplication be made by any man, or by all your people Israel, who shall know every man the plague of his own heart, and spread forth his hands toward this house:

Tailo: I ē tshing-ho͘ Guá kóng: Lí sī guá ê pē, sī guá ê Siōng-tè, sī kiù guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: He will call to me, You are my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation!'

Tailo: In sī Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se kah I-su-la-el lâng só͘ phah-pāi ê; Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se kā in ê tē hō͘ Lū-biān lâng, Ga̍t lâng kah Má-ná-se puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ê lâng tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: Moses the servant of Yahweh and the children of Israel struck them: and Moses the servant of Yahweh gave it for a possession to the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá khún-kiû Siōng-tsú kóng:
English: I begged Yahweh at that time, saying,

Tailo: sio̍k Iô-tah ê, ū A-mí-ná-tap ê kiáⁿ Ná-sòng;
English: Of Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

Tailo: Hit-ê tshù-tsú tshut-lâi in hia, kā in kóng, Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī, tshian-bān m̄-thang tsò tsit-ê pháiⁿ tāi-tsì. Tsit-ê lâng kì-jiân ji̍p-lâi guá ê tshù, lín tsiū m̄-thang tsò tsit-ê kiàn-siàu ê tāi-tsì.
English: The man, the master of the house, went out to them, and said to them, No, my brothers, please don't act so wickedly; seeing that this man is come into my house, don't do this folly.

Tailo: I koh īng kok tsióng put-gī ê kuí-kè, lâi khi-phiàn hiah-ê teh beh bia̍t-bông ê lâng, in-uī in bô tsiap-la̍p ē-tàng hō͘ in tit-kiù ê tsin-lí.
English: and with all deception of wickedness for those who are being lost, because they didn't receive the love of the truth, that they might be saved.

Tailo: Saⁿ tiám ê sî, I-é-su tuā-siaⁿ huah, Í-lô-i, Í-lô-i, la̍h-má sat-pak-tāi-nî? Tsit-kù A-lâm uē ê ì-sù sī, Guá ê Siōng-tè, guá ê Siōng-tè, Lí ná ē pàng-sak guá?
English: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?

Tailo: Tsûn tio̍h tsò thang-á, kuân tsi̍t tiú; mn̂g tio̍h hē tī tsûn-piⁿ, tsûn tio̍h tsò saⁿ tsàn, hun siōng, tiong, hā.
English: You shall make a roof in the ark, and to a cubit shall you finish it upward. You shall set the door of the ark in the side of it. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g-ê sian-ti tsiū thiaⁿ-tio̍h tuì thiⁿ lâi ū tuā-siaⁿ tuì in kóng, Khí-lâi tsia! In tsiū tī tuì-ti̍k ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, tsē hûn tsiūⁿ thiⁿ.
English: I heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, Come up here! They went up into heaven in the cloud, and their enemies saw them.

Tailo: In-uī nā kā saⁿ-tshīng lo̍h-.khì, lán tsiū bē thǹg-pak-theh.
English: if so be that being clothed we will not be found naked.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tuì lí ê tsìng tsi-tso̍k kíng-suán i, hō͘ i kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun, hōng Siōng-tsú ê miâ khiā-.leh, ho̍k-sāi I kàu íng-uán.
English: For Yahweh your God has chosen him out of all your tribes, to stand to minister in the name of Yahweh, him and his sons for ever.

Tailo: Lín bat kóng, ' Ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tè sī bô lō͘-īng, guán tsun-siú I ê bīng-līng, tī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng khik-khó͘ lâi kiâⁿ, kám ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik?
English: You have said, It is vain to serve God;' and What profit is it that we have kept his charge, and that we have walked mournfully before Yahweh of Armies?

Tailo: tsiàu Mô͘-se só͘ bīng-līng ê, tī An-hioh-ji̍t, gue̍h ê tshe-it kah tsi̍t nî saⁿ pái só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tseh, to̍h-sī Tû-kàⁿ-tseh, Tshit-tshit-tseh, Tuà-pêⁿ-tseh, tsiàu ta̍k ji̍t só͘ ing-kai hiàn ê lâi hiàn.
English: even as the duty of every day required, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the Sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the set feasts, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tents.

Tailo: Tio̍h tuâⁿ khîm tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Siōng-tsú; tio̍h tuâⁿ khîm hô si-kua ê siann lâi o-ló I!
English: Sing praises to Yahweh with the harp, With the harp and the voice of melody.

Tailo: Tuà tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi ê ē tuì to-kiàm, tuì ki-hng, tuì un-i̍k lâi sí; to̍k-to̍k tshut-khì tâu-hâng uî-khùn lín ê Kal-tí-ah lâng ê ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h, lâi khioh-tio̍h i ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: He who remains in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence; but he who goes out, and passes over to the Chaldeans who besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be to him for a prey.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tsit-būn I-é-su ê bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lín lāu-su ná ē kah thiu-suè ê í-ki̍p tsuē-jîn tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g?
English: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?

Tailo: Mā m̄-thang thiaⁿ hiah-ê bô-iáⁿ bô-tsiah ê thuân-suat kah lò-lò-tn̂g ê tso̍k-phó͘. In-uī tsiah-ê ē ín-khí tsing-lūn, tuì īng sìn-sim lâi liáu-kái Siōng-tè ê kè-uē ê lâng bô lī-ik.
English: neither to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies, which cause disputes, rather than God's stewardship, which is in faith

Tailo: Sìng Sîn tshin-tsū kiàn-tsìng tsit-ê sū-si̍t, in-uī Sìng Sîn to̍h-sī tsin-lí.
English: For there are three who testify :

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to tsiū mn̄g I kóng, Án-ne, Lí sī ông, sī-.bô? I-é-su ìn kóng, Lí kóng guá sī ông. Guá beh uī tsin-lí tsò kiàn-tsìng, guá uī-tio̍h án-ne lâi tshut-sì, uī-tio̍h án-ne lîm-kàu sè-kan. Sio̍k tsin-lí ê lâng lóng ē thiaⁿ guá ê siann.
English: Pilate therefore said to him, Are you a king then? Jesus answered, You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.

Tailo: Ông kā Tsa-tok kóng, Lí kng Siōng-tsú ê kuī tńg-khì siâⁿ lāi, guá nā tī Siōng-tsú ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, I ē hō͘ guá tńg-.lâi, hō͘ guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h I kah I tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: The king said to Zadok, Carry back the ark of God into the city: if I shall find favor in the eyes of Yahweh, he will bring me again, and show me both it, and his habitation:

Tailo: Kuah-be̍h ê sî, Lū-biān khì tshân-.ni̍h, tit-tio̍h tshui-tsîng-kó, the̍h-lâi hō͘ i ê lāu-bú Le-ah. La̍h-khel tuì Le-ah kóng, Tshiánn kā lí ê kiáⁿ ê tshui-tsîng-kó hō͘ guá.
English: Reuben went in the days of wheat harvest, and found mandrakes in the field, and brought them to his mother, Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, Please give me some of your son's mandrakes.

Tailo: An-hioh-ji̍t kuè :liáu-āu, tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t thiⁿ-phú-kng ê sî, Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâ-lí-ah kah pa̍t-ê Mâ-lí-ah lâi thàm-bōng.
English: Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.

Tailo: I lâi thiaⁿ Páu-lô káng tō-lí, Páu-lô lia̍h i kim-kim khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ū sìn-sim thang tit-tio̍h hó,
English: He was listening to Paul speaking, who, fastening eyes on him, and seeing that he had faith to be made whole,

Tailo: Ta-má-su-ko ê hô, A-má-nah kah Phal-phal, kám bô pí I-su-la-el só͘-ū ê tsuí khah hó? Guá kám bē-tàng tī hia sé sing-khu lâi tshing-khì? Tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin siū-khì, tsò i khì.
English: Aren't Abanah and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean? So he turned and went away in a rage.

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h tuì hiah-ê puē-gi̍k ê I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn kóng, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, lín kiânn it-tshè khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h lia̍h-tsò í-king kàu-gia̍h!
English: You shall tell the rebellious, even to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: you house of Israel, let it suffice you of all your abominations,

Tailo: Tú tshin-tshiūnn sio̍k-gí só͘ kóng, Bîn-tshn̂g té, hō͘ lâng tshun bē ti̍t; mî-phuē e̍h, hō͘ lâng kah bē ba̍t .
English: For the bed is to short to stretch out on, and the blanket is too narrow to wrap oneself in.

Tailo: só͘-í, bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Le-kap ê kiáⁿ Io-Ná-tap it-tīng íng-uán ū lâng khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: therefore thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not want a man to stand before me forever.

Tailo: In-uī Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, lín tio̍h ka-kī kiat-tsīng lâi tsiâⁿ-sìng, in-uī Guá sī sìng. Lín mā m̄-thang īng tī tē-tsiūⁿ teh puê ê mi̍h lâi uè lah-sap ka-kī.
English: For I am Yahweh your God. Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be holy; for I am holy: neither shall you defile yourselves with any kind of creeping thing that moves on the earth.

Tailo: In tshuē bô I-é-su ê sin-si, tsiū tńg-lâi kóng in ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h thiⁿ-sài tshut-hiān kā in kóng, I-é-su í-king koh-ua̍h à.
English: and when they didn't find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.

Tailo: It-sa-kal sī ióng ê lî-á, tó tī iûⁿ-tiâu ê tiong-kan;
English: Issachar is a strong donkey, Lying down between the saddlebags.

Tailo: Guá nā hō͘ in iau-iau tńg-khì in tshù, in tī lō͘ tiong ē hūn tò-khì, in-uī in tiong-kan ū ê tuì tsin hn̄g ê só͘-tsāi lâi.
English: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way.

Tailo: Guān siàu-siūⁿ beh hāi guá sèⁿ-miā ê lâng lóng làu-khuì kiàn-siàu! Guān ài guá siū hām-hāi ê lâng tian-tò siū lîng-jio̍k!
English: Let them be disappointed and confounded together who seek after my soul to destroy it. Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor who delight in my hurt.

Tailo: Iâⁿ-tiúⁿ suî-sî tshuā ping kah kun-kuaⁿ lâi-kàu bîn-tsiòng hia. In khuàⁿ-tio̍h kun-kuaⁿ kah ping tsiū thîng tshiú, bô koh phah Páu-lô.
English: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. They, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, stopped beating Paul.

Tailo: In lóng ē uan-ke, pē kah kiáⁿ, kiáⁿ kah pē, lāu-bú kah tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kah lāu-bú, ta-ke kah sim-pū, sim-pū kah ta-ke.
English: They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

Tailo: Taⁿ tī lí tsit-ê tó-huāi ê ji̍t, tsìng tó-sū ē phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah; hái tiong tsiah-ê tó-sū khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí sí-.khì, tsiū lóng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Now shall the islands tremble in the day of your fall; yes, the islands that are in the sea shall be dismayed at your departure.

Tailo: I koh tī tiān ê āu-bīn, īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ pán tuì thô͘-kha kàu êⁿ-á khí keh tsi̍t king tshim jī-tsa̍p tiú ê tiān, tuì thô͘-kha kàu êⁿ-á, kā i tsò tī lāi-bīn, tsiâⁿ-tsò āu-tiān, to̍h-sī tsì-sìng-só͘.
English: He built twenty cubits on the hinder part of the house with boards of cedar from the floor to the walls of the ceiling: he built them for it within, for an oracle, even for the most holy place.

Tailo: Lām-sám tsò-tsìng ê lâng ē bia̍t-bông; to̍k-to̍k tshin-hīⁿ thiaⁿ-tio̍h lâi kiàn-tsìng ê lâng, bô lâng ē-tàng kā i piān-tó.
English: A false witness will perish, And a man who listens speaks to eternity.

Tailo: to̍h-sī thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá kong-kik tsit só͘-tsāi kah tuà tī tsia ê jîn-bîn, só͘ kóng ē hō͘ i pha-hng koh siū tsiù-tsó͘, lí ê sim tsiū nńg, lí ka-kī tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi, koh thiah-li̍h lí ê saⁿ, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu, Guá mā ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: because your heart was tender, and you did humble yourself before Yahweh, when you heard what I spoke against this place, and against the inhabitants of it, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard you, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit sî, Nep-kat-ne-tsal ông tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, kuáⁿ-kín khí-.lâi, tuì i ê bô͘-sū kóng, Lán kám m̄-sī pa̍k saⁿ lâng, hiat tī hué-.ni̍h? In ìn ông kóng, Ông, sī à!
English: Then Nebuchadnezzar the king was astonished, and rose up in haste: he spoke and said to his counselors, Didn't we cast three men bound into the midst of the fire? They answered the king, True, O king.

Tailo: Thàu-tsá-khí-.lâi, tāi-ke hō͘-siong tsiù-tsuā. Í-sak sàng in tshut-huat, in tsiū an-jiân lī-khui i khì.
English: They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, iáu ū tsi̍t tsân uē, lí tio̍h siū khuàn-kái; tù tsheh tsē, bû kiông-tsīn; tha̍k tsheh tsē, sing-khu ē ià-siān.
English: Furthermore, my son, be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.

Tailo: in-uī tuì Guá tshuā I-su-la-el khí-.lâi ê ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, Guá m̄-bat tuà tī tshù lāi, sī tuì tsit-ê pò͘-pênn kàu hit-ê pò͘-pênn, tuì tsit-ê tiùⁿ-pâng kàu hit-ê tiùⁿ-pâng.
English: for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tent to another.

Tailo: I tsò I-su-la-el ông, king-kuè sì-tsa̍p nî, to̍h-sī tī He-bú-lông tsò ông tshit nî, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ông saⁿ-tsa̍p saⁿ nî.
English: The time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; he reigned seven years in Hebron, and thirty-three years reigned he in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lí mā bat kóng, ' Guá it-tīng ē hó khuán-thāi lí, hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tshin-tshiūnn hái piⁿ ê sua, tsē kàu sǹg bē-liáu. '
English: You said, I will surely do you good, and make your seed as the sand of the sea, which can't be numbered because there are so many.'

Tailo: Guān Siōng-tè hō͘ Iá-hia̍t huat-tián, hō͘ i tuà tī Sé-mh ê pò͘-pênn, Ka-nân mā tsò i ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: God enlarge Japheth, Let him dwell in the tents of Shem; Let Canaan be his servant.

Tailo: I tī in ê thâu-tsîng tshe tsi̍t-ê lâng sing khì, to̍h-sī Iô-sé-huh siū bē khì tsò lô͘-lē.
English: He sent a man before them. Joseph was sold for a slave.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè ū hō͘ I-é-su koh-ua̍h, tsit-ê ìng-ín í-king ū tuì lán tsiah-ê tsò kiáⁿ-sun ê ìng-giām, tú tshin-tshiūnn Si-phian tē-jī phiⁿ só͘ kì-tsài, Lí to̍h-sī guá ê Kiáⁿ, guá kin-á-ji̍t seⁿ Lí. (tsù, SPh 2:7)
English: that God has fulfilled the same to us, their children, in that he raised up Jesus. As it is also written in the second psalm, You are my Son. Today I have become your father.'

Tailo: Ke-ná-nah ê kiáⁿ Tse-ti-kiah tsìn-tsîng lâi, siàn Mi-ka-iah ê tshuì-phué, kóng, Siōng-tsú ê lîng tuì tó tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ lī-khui guá lâi kah lí kóng?
English: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of Yahweh from me to speak to you?

Tailo: Iàn-si̍k muá tshù mā ū sio-tseⁿ, put-jû tsi̍t tè-á piáⁿ koh ū hô-bo̍k.
English: Better is a dry morsel with quietness, Than a house full of feasting with strife.

Tailo: Tuì taⁿ í-āu, I-su-la-el lâng m̄-thang uá-kīn huē-bō͘, bián-tit in tam-tng tsuē lâi sí.
English: Henceforth the children of Israel shall not come near the tent of meeting, lest they bear sin, and die.

Tailo: Pho-la-thah, A-ta-liah, A-li-ta-tha,
English: and Poratha, and Adalia, and Aridatha,

Tailo: Tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t lāi, guá tû-khì saⁿ-ê bo̍k-tsiá, in-uī guá ê sim thó-ià in, in ê sim mā khì-hiâm guá.
English: I cut off the three shepherds in one month; for my soul was weary of them, and their soul also loathed me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: In tsiàu I-é-su só͘ huan-hù ê kā in kóng, hiah-ê lâng tsiū pàng hō͘ in khì khan.
English: They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go.

Tailo: Guá tshe-phài kàu lín tiong-kan ê tuā kun-tuī, to̍h-sī tē-it tsióng, tē-jī tsióng, tē-saⁿ tsióng kah tē-sì tsióng ê tsháu-me̍h, só͘ tsia̍h hiah-ê nî-tang, Guá lóng beh hîng lín.
English: I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The great locust, the grasshopper, and the caterpillar, My great army, which I sent among you.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì in kóng tsiah-ê uē ê sî, tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê huē-tn̂g ê tsú-kuán lâi phak tī I ê bīn-tsîng, kóng, Guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tú-á sí-.khì, tshiánn Lí lâi-khì kā i huāⁿ-tshiú, i tsiū ē ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying, My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.

Tailo: Só͘-í, sî-ki iáu-buē kàu, lín m̄-thang phue-phîng lâng. Tán kàu Tsú tsài-lîm ê sî, I ē īng kng tsiò o͘-àm ún-ba̍t ê pì-bi̍t, kā ún-tsông tī sim-lāi ê kè-bô͘ hián-lō͘ tshut-.lâi. Hit sî, ta̍k lâng ē tuì Siōng-tè tit-tio̍h I ê o-ló.
English: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord comes, who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and reveal the counsels of the hearts. Then each man will get his praise from God.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá ài lín ē kì-tit lán ê tsó͘-sian lóng kin-tuè Mô͘-se, tī hûn ê pó-hō͘ tsi-hā kuè Âng-hái.
English: Now I would not have you ignorant, brothers, that our fathers were all under the cloud, and all passed through the sea;

Tailo: kiû Lí tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó, sià-bián Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kah Lí ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el ê tsuē; tī Lí kà-sī in só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê hó lō͘ ê sî, koh lo̍h hō͘ tī Lí ê tē, to̍h-sī Lí siúⁿ-sù Lí ê tsú-bîn tsò sán-gia̍p ê.
English: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of your servants, and of your people Israel, when you teach them the good way in which they should walk; and send rain on your land, which you have given to your people for an inheritance.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Biān-iá-mín lâng sí-.khì ê kiōng nn̄g-bān gō͘-tshing lâng, hiah-ê lóng sī gia̍h to ê ióng-sū.
English: So that all who fell that day of Benjamin were twenty-five thousand men who drew the sword; all these were men of valor.

Tailo: Bô-kè-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kah siàu-lí kuan-sim Tsú ê tāi-tsì, sī beh hō͘ i ê sing-khu kah sim-sîn lóng sìng-kiat. M̄-koh, kè-ang ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tshau-huân sè-kan ê tāi-tsì, bo̍k-tik sī beh hō͘ in ang huann-hí.
English: There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares about the things of the worldhow she may please her husband.

Tailo: E-thu-ló in-uī Siōng-tsú khuán-thāi I-su-la-el lâng it-tshè ê hó sū, kiù in thuat-lī Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tshiú, tsiū tsin huann-hí.
English: Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which Yahweh had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.

Tailo: In-uī kiàn-nā siú Guá tsiah-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, kíng Guá só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì, koh tshî-siú Guá ê iok ê thài-kàm, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng:
English: For thus says Yahweh of the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, and choose the things that please me, and hold fast my covenant:

Tailo: Guán thè lín kî-tó ê sî, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kám-siā Siōng-tè, to̍h-sī lán ê Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok ê Thiⁿ-pē,
English: We give thanks to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

Tailo: Uá-kīn Tse-bú-lông ê tē-kài, tuì tang kàu sai, Ga̍t tsi̍t hūn.
English: By the border of Zebulun, from the east side to the west side, Gad, one portion.

Tailo: Tsí-sī lí tì-huī ê ò-pì, tse tì-huī ū ta̍k tsióng ê kong-hāu; lí tio̍h tsai Siōng-tè bô lóng ē kì-tit lí ê tsuē-kò.
English: That he would show you the secrets of wisdom! For true wisdom has two sides. Know therefore that God exacts of you less than your iniquity deserves.

Tailo: Tsú ah, lâng tit-tio̍h ua̍h sī tsāi tī Lí, guá ê sim-sîn ua̍h-.leh, mā lóng sī án-ne; só͘-í, kiû Lí hō͘ guá koh hó khí-.lâi, iû-guân ua̍h-.leh!
English: Lord, men live by these things; And my spirit finds life in all of them: You restore me, and cause me to live.

Tailo: Lí ê sim-lāi bat kóng, guá beh tsiūⁿ kàu thinn-tíng, guá beh tī Siōng-tsú tsìng tsheⁿ ê tíng-bīn kí-khí guá ê tsō-uī; guá beh tsē tī tsū-huē ê suaⁿ, tī pak-hong ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: You said in your heart, I will ascend into heaven! I will exalt my throne above the stars of God! I will sit on the mountain of assembly, in the far north!

Tailo: Tī kuí-nā ji̍t tiong-kan, koh-ua̍h ê I-é-su hián-hiān hō͘ hiah-ê bat tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng kah I tsò-hué tsiūⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê lâng khuànn-kìnn. Taⁿ tsiah-ê lâng ū tuì bîn-tsiòng tsò I-é-su ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn.
English: and he was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses to the people.

Tailo: Guá tī huān-lān tiong kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú, guá kiû-kiò guá ê Siōng-tsú. I tuì sìng-tiān thiaⁿ guá ê siann, guá ê kiû-kiò ji̍p-khì I ê hīⁿ-khang.
English: In my distress I called on Yahweh; Yes, I called to my God: He heard my voice out of his temple, My cry came into his ears.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá í-tsîng khì lín hia, pīng bô īng suí ê giân-sû á-.sī tì-huī lâi tuì lín thuân Siōng-tè ê ò-pì.
English: When I came to you, brothers, I didn't come with excellence of speech or of wisdom, proclaiming to you the testimony of God.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí ua̍t tńg-.lâi, īng kau kau lí ê gê-tsô, kā lí kah lí ê kun-ping, bé-phit, bé-ping tshuā tshut-.lâi, lóng tshīng tsin suí ê tsiàn-kah, tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā ê kun-tuī, giâ tuā-sió ê tîn-pâi, ta̍k-ê gia̍h to-kiàm.
English: and I will turn you about, and put hooks into your jaws, and I will bring you forth, and all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them clothed in full armor, a great company with buckler and shield, all of them handling swords;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tio̍h koh khah kian-siú só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê sìn-sit, tsiah bián-tit phian-lī tsin-tō.
English: Therefore we ought to pay greater attention to the things that were heard, lest perhaps we drift away.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiūⁿ tsûn. Bûn-tô͘ lóng tuè I khì.
English: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.

Tailo: E-lí-siah kā i ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lí thang kā i kóng, lí khuàⁿ, lí uī guán huì tsin tsē sim-su, taⁿ tio̍h kā lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí ài guá thè lí kā ông á-.sī kun-tiúⁿ kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsa-bó͘ lâng ìn kóng, Guá tuà tī guá ê jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan.
English: He said to him, Say now to her, Behold, you have been careful for us with all this care; what is to be done for you? would you be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the army? She answered, I dwell among my own people.

Tailo: Īng pó-tsio̍h siuⁿ hit king tiān, hō͘ i tsin suí, só͘ īng ê kim lóng sī Pal-ba-im ê kim.
English: He garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold was gold of Parvaim.

Tailo: I ē tī siàu-liân ê sî sí-.khì, in ê sèⁿ-miā sòng-sit ná tshin-tshiūnn gín-á piàn pháiⁿ-.khì.
English: They die in youth. Their life perishes among the unclean.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng ìn kóng, Tse to̍h tsin kî-kuài à, I i hó guá ê ba̍k-tsiu, lín iáu-koh m̄-tsai I tuì tó-uī lâi.
English: The man answered them, How amazing! You don't know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.

Tailo: Khó-la̍h tso̍k-tiúⁿ, Ga-tàm tso̍k-tiúⁿ, A-má-li̍k tso̍k-tiúⁿ. Tsiah-ê sī tī E-tóm tē, E-lī-huat só͘ seⁿ ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, sī A-tah ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: chief Korah, chief Gatam, chief Amalek: these are the chiefs who came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom; these are the sons of Adah.

Tailo: só͘ huān ê tsuē kàu i ka-kī tsai-iáⁿ ê sî, i in-uī só͘ huān ê tsuē, tsiū tio̍h khan tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ bó, tsò i ê lé-mi̍h.
English: if his sin, which he has sinned, is made known to him, then he shall bring for his offering a goat, a female without blemish, for his sin which he has sinned.

Tailo: Sàu-lô kā Sa-mu-el kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi ū tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng, kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ tshe guá kiânn ê lō͘, lia̍h A-má-li̍k ông A-gak lâi, tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t A-má-li̍k lâng.
English: Saul said to Samuel, Yes, I have obeyed the voice of Yahweh, and have gone the way which Yahweh sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.

Tailo: Lí khì kā in kóng: Lín tsò lín tńg-khì lín ê pò͘-pênn!
English: Go tell them, Return you to your tents.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kah A-lông kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Tailo: Kóng tsiah-ê uē ê sî, ū hûn kā in tah-.leh, in hō͘ hûn pau-uî-.leh tsiū khí kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ! Lín ê tshù it-tīng ē pha-hng bô lâng tuà.
English: Behold, your house is left to you desolate.

Tailo: I ê tshe-īng kóng, Tsáinn-iūnn, guá kám thang kā tsiah-ê pâi tī tsi̍t pah lâng ê bīn-tsîng? E-lí-siah ìn kóng, Tsò lí hō͘ jîn-bîn tsia̍h, in-uī Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: In ē tsia̍h, tsia̍h-liáu iáu ū tshun.
English: His servant said, What, should I set this before a hundred men? But he said, Give the people, that they may eat; for thus says Yahweh, They shall eat, and shall leave of it.

Tailo: Tē-.ni̍h siōng khí-thâu si̍k ê mi̍h, tio̍h sàng kàu Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê tshù. Tsú suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á m̄-thang īng i ê bó ê ling.
English: The first of the first fruits of your ground you shall bring into the house of Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tsiū tuì huē-tn̂g tshut-.khì, suî-sî kah He-lo̍t tóng ê lâng tsò-hué kè-bô͘, khuànn thang án-tsuáⁿ lâi hāi-sí I-é-su.
English: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

Tailo: Jiân-āu Hue-lik-su bīng-līng liân-tiúⁿ kò͘-siú Páu-lô, mā hō͘ i tām-po̍h-á hîng-tōng ê tsū-iû, mā tsún i ê pîng-iú sàng i su-iàu ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lâi hō͘ i.
English: He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iô-tah tsiah-ê siâⁿ ê lâng kah tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn, beh khì ai-kiû in sio hiuⁿ lâi ho̍k-sāi hiah-ê sîn-bîng. Tsóng-.sī, tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê sî, tsiah-ê sîn-bîng lóng bē-tàng kā in tsín-kiù.
English: Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem go and cry to the gods to which they offer incense: but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.

Tailo: tī Si-óng pi-ai ê lâng, ē īng hue-bō siúⁿ-sù I lâi tāi-thè hué-hu, huann-hí ê iû lâi tāi-thè pi-ai, o-ló ê saⁿ lâi tāi-thè iu-tshiû ê sim; hō͘ in kiò-tsò kong-gī ê tshiū, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú só͘ tsai ê, lâi hián-bîng ka-kī ê îng-kng.
English: to appoint to those who mourn in Zion, to give to them a garland for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they may be called trees of righteousness, the planting of Yahweh, that he may be glorified.

Tailo: í-ki̍p I ê sîn-jiah, I ê só͘ tsò, kiàn-nā tī Ai-gi̍p tiong tuì Ai-gi̍p ông Huâ-láu kah i ê tsuân tē só͘ kiâⁿ ê;
English: and his signs, and his works, which he did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and to all his land;

Tailo: I tio̍h kā tsiah-ê tuà kàu tsè-si hia, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tāi-sing hiàn hit tsiah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê; tuì ām-kún tsūn i ê thâu, tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang kā i phuà-khui.
English: He shall bring them to the priest, who shall first offer the one which is for the sin offering, and wring off its head from its neck, but shall not sever it completely.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iô-tah kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm só͘ hiàn ê lé-mi̍h, sī beh tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú huann-hí, tshin-tshiūnn kū sî ê ji̍t, kó͘-tsá ê nî.
English: Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasant to Yahweh, as in the days of old, and as in ancient years.

Tailo: Lâng put-jû lâi tsia̍h lâi lim, koh hō͘ sim hióng-siū i só͘ lô-khó͘ ê sîng-kó. Guá khuànn, tsit-ê mā sī tshut tī Siōng-tè ê tshiú.
English: There is nothing better for a man than that he should eat and drink, and make his soul enjoy good in his labor. This also I saw, that it is from the hand of God.

Tailo: Kā Ia-lô-ba-am kóng, Lí thang the̍h tsa̍p tè, in-uī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tuì Só͘-lô-móng ê tshiú thiah-li̍h i ê kok, kā tsa̍p tsi-tso̍k hō͘ lí. '
English: He said to Jeroboam, Take ten pieces; for thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to you

Tailo: Í-tsîng uá Hui-lī-sū lâng ê Hi-bú-lâi lâng, tuì sì-hng tuè kàu i ê iâⁿ ê, taⁿ mā tian-tò tńg-lâi pang-tsān tuè Sàu-lô kah Io-ná-than ê I-su-la-el lâng.
English: Now the Hebrews who were with the Philistines as before, and who went up with them into the camp, from the country round about, even they also turned to be with the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.

Tailo: La̍h-khel kóng, Guá kah guá ê tuā-tsé kik-lia̍t sio-tseⁿ, í-king tit-tio̍h khah iâⁿ. Tsiū kā i ê miâ kiò-tsò Ná-hu-tha-lím.
English: Rachel said, With mighty wrestlings have I wrestled with my sister, and have prevailed. She named him Naphtali.

Tailo: Guá ê tshuì-tsi̍h beh suan-iông Lí ê gī, kui ji̍t lóng beh o-ló Lí.
English: My tongue shall talk about your righteousness and about your praise all day long.

Tailo: In-uī lí huâi-īn beh seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, thì thâu-mn̂g ê to m̄-thang kàu tī i ê thâu-khak, in-uī tsit-ê gín-á tuì thai-.ni̍h tsiū kui Siōng-tsú tsò hiàn-sin-tsiá （ Tsù, Guân i̍k-pún im-i̍k tsò Na-tsil / Ná-sè-jíⁿ lâng. ）, i beh tsò kiù I-su-la-el ê thâu tsi̍t-tsām, thuat-lī Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tshiú.
English: for, behold, you shall conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on his head; for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb: and he shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, I ē īng huàn-lām ê tuā-tsuí kā i ê tē im bia̍t-tiāu, kuáⁿ tuì-ti̍k ji̍p-khì o͘-àm.
English: But with an overflowing flood, he will make a full end of her place, and will pursue his enemies into darkness.

Tailo: Guá khuànn guá ê tshiú só͘ tsò it-tshè ê kang, í-ki̍p guá só͘ king-li̍k ê lô-khó͘; lí khuàⁿ, tse lóng sī khang-hi, lóng sī teh lia̍h-hong, tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn lóng bô lī-ik.
English: Then I looked at all the works that my hands had worked, and at the labor that I had labored to do; and behold, all was vanity and a chasing after wind, and there was no profit under the sun.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā in kóng, Lín ná ē hiah kiaⁿ? Lín iáu bô sìn sim, sī-.bô?
English: He said to them, Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?

Tailo: Kàu tē-peh ji̍t, Mô͘-se tiàu A-lông kah i ê kiáⁿ, í-ki̍p I-su-la-el hiah-ê tiúⁿ-ló lâi.
English: It happened on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;

Tailo: Am-móng, Ba-la̍h, O͘-hu-lah,
English: and Avvim, and Parah, and Ophrah,

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê sìn-tô͘ lóng beh kā lín tshíng-an.
English: All the saints greet you.

Tailo: Ha-gal sī tsí A-la-puh ê Si-nái suaⁿ, mā sī teh tsí hiān-kim ê Ê-lú-sa-lèm siâⁿ, in-uī i kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun lóng tsò lô͘-lē.
English: For this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and answers to the Jerusalem that exists now, for she is in bondage with her children.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu bô beh pó-sioh lí, Guá mā bô beh khó-liân lí, beh tsiàu lí ê só͘ kiâⁿ kā lí pò-ìng, lí khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì ē kui tī lí ê tiong-kan. Lín to̍h ē tsai kā lín phah ê sī Guá — Siōng-tsú.
English: My eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will bring on you according to your ways; and your abominations shall be in the midst of you; and you shall know that I, Yahweh, do strike.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh kā in kóng, Guá tú-á kóng lín sī tsing-thàm, tsit-ê uē si̍t-tsāi bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: Joseph said to them, It is like I told you, saying, You are spies.'

Tailo: Siūⁿ beh pó-tsuân ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā, só͘-ū sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē pó-tsuân i ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

Tailo: I-é-su bô-kuán in só͘ kóng ê uē, kā huē-tn̂g ê tsú-kuán kóng, M̄-bián kiaⁿ, tsí ū tio̍h sìn.
English: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, Don't be afraid, only believe.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang uī ka-kī tsù-tsō tsiah-ê sîn-bîng.
English: You shall make no cast idols for yourselves.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Io-siú-ah kā in tsiok-hok, tshe in khì, in tsiū tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn.
English: So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away; and they went to their tents.

Tailo: I ê thâu-khak tsîng ê thâu-mn̂g nā lut, i sī liù-hia̍h ê; iáu-koh sī tshing-khì ê.
English: If his hair has fallen off from the front part of his head, he is forehead bald. He is clean.

Tailo: A-tsu-ma-bet lâng, sì-tsa̍p jī-ê.
English: The children of Azmaveth, forty-two.

Tailo: kā in kóng, Lín m̄-thang ah só͘ lia̍h ê lâng ji̍p-lâi tsia, in-uī lín só͘ siūⁿ beh tsò ê sī ē hō͘ guán tik-tsuē Siōng-tsú, ke-thinn guán ê tsuē-kò kah guán ê kuè-sit, in-uī guán ê kuè-sit tsin tuā, í-king ū Siōng-tè ê tuā siū-khì lîm-kàu I-su-la-el à.
English: and said to them, You shall not bring in the captives here: for you purpose that which will bring on us a trespass against Yahweh, to add to our sins and to our trespass; for our trespass is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel.

Tailo: Guá nā siūⁿ-khí lán lī-pia̍t ê sî lí teh lâu ba̍k-sái, guá tsiū tsin ài koh kah lí kìⁿ-bīn, thang hō͘ guá muá-sim huann-hí.
English: longing to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy;

Tailo: Tē-sì pái liam-khau sī uī-tio̍h It-sa-kal, to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h It-sa-kal lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: The fourth lot came out for Issachar, even for the children of Issachar according to their families.

Tailo: Tuā hái tshiong tshut, tshin-tshiūnn tuì thai-.ni̍h tshut-.lâi, hit sî, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng īng mn̂g kā i kuainn khí-.lâi?
English: Or who shut up the sea with doors, When it broke forth from the womb,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tse to̍h-sī i ê lō͘ ê khuài-lo̍k, í-āu ē ū pa̍t-ê tuì tē-.ni̍h seⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Behold, this is the joy of his way: Out of the earth shall others spring.

Tailo: Lí í-king thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, taⁿ koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h lóng-tsóng; lín kám bô beh suan-iông? Tuì taⁿ í-āu, Guá beh kā sin ê tāi-tsì, to̍h-sī lí só͘ iáu m̄-tsai ê ún-ba̍t ê tāi-tsì, kā lí tsí-sī.
English: You have heard it; see all this; and you, will you not declare it? I have shown you new things from this time, even hidden things, which you have not known.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng tsiū tsò-hué kóng, Tsit-ê Ta-ni-el, tû-khì i ê Siōng-tè ê lu̍t-huat í-guā, lán bô thang tshuē-tio̍h i ê khang-phāng lâi kò i.
English: Then said these men, We shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him concerning the law of his God.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Só͘-í, tsing-thong thian-kok tō-lí ê king-ha̍k kàu-su, tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t ke ê tsú-lâng tuì i ê tshng-khò͘ kā sin ê kah kū ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng puaⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: He said to them, Therefore, every scribe who has been made a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a householder, who brings out of his treasure new and old things.

Tailo: Kàu thiⁿ-kng, Huâ-láu sim bô pîng-an, tsiū tshe lâng tiàu Ai-gi̍p só͘-ū ê su̍t-sū kah tsheⁿ-siōng-ka lâi; Huâ-láu tsiū kā i só͘ bāng-kìnn ê kā in kóng, in bô lâng ē-hiáu kā Huâ-láu kái-bāng.
English: It happened in the morning that his spirit was troubled, and he sent and called for all of Egypt's magicians and wise men. Pharaoh told them his dreams, but there was no one who could interpret them to Pharaoh.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit tsiah liam-khau kui A-tsa-tsel ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ, tio̍h ua̍h-ua̍h an-tì tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, thè i sio̍k-tsuē, pàng i khì khòng-iá, kui tī A-tsa-tsel.
English: But the goat, on which the lot fell for the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before Yahweh, to make atonement for him, to send him away for the scapegoat into the wilderness.

Tailo: Ki-tok uī-tio̍h lán ê tsuē, mā uī-tio̍h tsuân sè-kài ê lâng ê tsuē, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: And he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for the whole world.

Tailo: A-má-tsiah mn̄g Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Guá í-king īng gîn tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t hō͘ I-su-la-el ê kun-tuī, hiah-ê beh án-tsuáⁿ lè? Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k ìn kóng, Siōng-tsú ē kā pí tsiah-ê khah tsē hō͘ lí.
English: Amaziah said to the man of God, But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the army of Israel? The man of God answered, Yahweh is able to give you much more than this.

Tailo: Guá bat tuì Siōng-tsú kóng: Lí sī guá ê Siōng-tè. Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá khún-kiû ê siann!
English: I said to Yahweh, You are my God. Listen to the cry of my petitions, Yahweh.

Tailo: Tī I ê tsè-si tiong ū Mô͘-se kah A-lông; tī kiû-kiò I ê miâ ê lâng ê tiong-kan ū Sa-mu-el. In kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú, I tsiū thiaⁿ in ê kî-kiû.
English: Moses and Aaron were among his priests, Samuel among those who call on his name; They called on Yahweh, and he answered them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá kiû-kiò Lí, in-uī hué kā khòng-iá ê tsháu-tiûⁿ sio-bia̍t, hué-iām sio-tsīn tshân-iá ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: Yahweh, I cry to you, For the fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness, And the flame has burned all the trees of the field.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê ang-î ê kiáⁿ, kan-hu kah ki-lí ê tsíng-luī, lóng tio̍h tsìn-tsîng lâi.
English: But draw near here, you sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the prostitute.

Tailo: Guá ta̍k ji̍t kah lín tī sìng-tiān, lín bô hē tshiú kā guá lia̍h; m̄-koh, tsit-má sī lín tng âng-ê sî, mā sī o͘-àm teh tsiáng-kuân ê sî.
English: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn't stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.

Tailo: Kì-jiân sè-kan lâng bē-tàng īng in ê tì-huī lâi jīn-bat Siōng-tè, Siōng-tè tsiū īng I ka-kī ê tì-huī, huann-hí īng guán só͘ thuân ê gû-gōng ê sìn-sit, lâi tsín-kiù hiah-ê sìn ê lâng.
English: For seeing that in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom didn't know God, it was God's good pleasure through the foolishness of the preaching to save those who believe.

Tailo: Tuì Sa-mu-el í-āu, só͘-ū thuân-káng sìn-sit ê sian-ti lóng ū kóng-khí tsiah-ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tio̍h ē kì-tit Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, in-uī lí tit-tio̍h tuā ki-gia̍p ê khuì-la̍t sī I hō͘ lí ê, sī beh lâi uân-sîng I só͘ tuì lí ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā ê iok, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t ê khuán-sit.
English: But you shall remember Yahweh your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth; that he may establish his covenant which he swore to your fathers, as at this day.

Tailo: thang hō͘ lín suh i ê an-uì ê ling-thâu lâi tit-tio̍h pá, hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h i hong-sīng ê îng-kng, lâi muá-sim huann-hí.
English: that you may suck and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that you may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tī kng liu-liu ê suaⁿ khiā tuā kî, tuì in tshut siaⁿ ia̍t tshiú, hō͘ in ji̍p-khì kuì-tso̍k ê mn̂g.
English: Set up a banner on the bare mountain! Lift up your voice to them! Wave your hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g lâng hut-jiân tuā-siaⁿ huah, Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ ah, guán kah Lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tī-tāi? Sî to iáu-buē kàu, Lí lâi tsia sī beh kā guán tsik-hua̍t, sī-.bô?
English: Behold, they cried out, saying, What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?

Tailo: Siam-mái ê kiáⁿ Ma-óng, Ma-óng sī Biat-tsul ê lāu-pē.
English: The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.

Tailo: Tsú ah, liân-bín guá ê kiáⁿ, in-uī i tài-tio̍h iûⁿ-hîn tsin kan-khó͘, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ pua̍h-lo̍h hué, mā tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ pua̍h-lo̍h tsuí.
English: Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is epileptic, and suffers grievously; for he often falls into the fire, and often into the water.

Tailo: O͘-hui, Ha-bí-la̍h, Io-bap, tsiah-ê lóng sī Iok-tan ê kiáⁿ.
English: and Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

Tailo: Tio̍h khiā khí-.lâi! Īng lí ê siâ-su̍t kah lí tsin tsē ê hû-tsiù, to̍h-sī tuì lí siàu-liân só͘ lô-khó͘ ha̍k-si̍p ê, kiám-tshái ē tit-tio̍h lī-ik, á-.sī tit-tio̍h khah iâⁿ.
English: Stand now with your enchantments, and with the multitude of your sorceries, in which you have labored from your youth; if so be you shall be able to profit, if so be you may prevail.

Tailo: Koh kóng, A-lâm lâng nā pí guá khah kiông, lí tio̍h lâi pang-tsān guá; Am-móng lâng nā pí lí khah kiông, guá tsiū khì pang-tsān lí.
English: He said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for you, then I will help you.

Tailo: Jiân-āu guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài khiā tī Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng, in ū niá-siū tshit ki kó͘-tshue.
English: I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.

Tailo: Bik-bai ê kiáⁿ-sun nn̄g-tshing khòng la̍k-tsa̍p tshit lâng.
English: The children of Bigvai, two thousand sixty-seven.

Tailo: Tong-sî, lín ê jîn-ting iú-hān, sò͘-gia̍h tsió-tsió, koh tī hia tsò tshut-guā lâng;
English: When you were but a few men in number, Yes, very few, and foreigners in it;

Tailo: Iá-uán ê kiáⁿ, E-lí-siah, Tal-si-sih, Kit-thê lâng, To-than lâng.
English: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lín tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng kā lín bê-hi̍k.
English: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, Be careful that no one leads you astray.

Tailo: In-uī tsit-ê Ta-ni-el ū hó sìng-tsîng, só͘-í iâⁿ-kuè kî-tha ê tsóng-tiúⁿ kah tsóng-tok, ông tsiū siūⁿ beh siat-li̍p i lâi tī-lí tsuân kok.
English: Then this Daniel was distinguished above the presidents and the satraps, because an excellent spirit was in him; and the king thought to set him over the whole realm.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá tshin-tshiūnn tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tshin-tshiūnn é-káu bô khui tshuì kóng-uē.
English: But I, as a deaf man, don't hear. I am as a mute man who doesn't open his mouth.

Tailo: Guān in ê lō͘ àm koh ku̍t, ū Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá teh jiok in.
English: Let their way be dark and slippery, Yahweh's angel pursuing them.

Tailo: In-uī tiōng-hu sī hū-jîn-lâng ê thâu, tshin-tshiūnn Ki-tok tsò kàu-huē ê thâu. Ki-tok pún-sin mā sī kàu-huē ê Kiù-tsú, kàu-huē to̍h-sī I ê thé.
English: For the husband is the head of the wife, and Christ also is the head of the assembly, being himself the savior of the body.

Tailo: A-tám ê sè-hē kì tī ē-té: Tng Siōng-tè tshòng-tsō lâng ê ji̍t, sī tsiàu Siōng-tè ê khuán-sit lâi tsō lâng.
English: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God's likeness.

Tailo: Kā lín ê lāu-pē kah lín ê ka-kuàn lóng puaⁿ-lâi guá tsia, guá beh kā Ai-gi̍p tē ê hó mi̍h hō͘ lín, lín mā thang tsia̍h tsit só͘-tsāi ê san-tin hái-bī.
English: Take your father and your households, and come to me, and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.'

Tailo: In-uī guá ê to tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h í-king lim kàu-gia̍h; lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê to ē khì-kàu E-tóm, í-ki̍p guá só͘ gí-tiāⁿ beh bia̍t-bông ê jîn-bîn sin tsiūⁿ, lâi kā in sím-phuàⁿ.
English: For my sword has drunk its fill in the sky. Behold, it will come down on Edom, And on the people of my curse, for judgment.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí khí-lâi uī ka-kī piān-kái! Tio̍h ē kì-tit gōng lâng kui ji̍t án-tsuáⁿ teh kā Lí huí-pòng.
English: Arise, God! Plead your own cause. Remember how the foolish man mocks you all day.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē thiah-huí kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng ê tshù, ē pó-hō͘ kuáⁿ-hū ê tē-kài.
English: Yahweh will uproot the house of the proud, But he will keep the widow's borders intact.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kā guá tshòng-tsō tshing-khì ê sim, hō͘ guá ê lāi-bīn ū uāⁿ sin tsìng-ti̍t ê sim-sîn.
English: Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lí tio̍h sé-tshing lí ê sim, tû-khì pháiⁿ, hō͘ lí thang tit-tio̍h kiù. Pháiⁿ liām-thâu tsûn tī lí ê sim-lāi, beh kàu tang-sî?
English: Jerusalem, wash your heart from wickedness, that you may be saved. How long shall your evil thoughts lodge within you?

Tailo: E-hut liáu-āu, ū A-nah ê kiáⁿ Siam-gal, i īng kuáⁿ gû ê thih-tshì phah-sí la̍k-pah-ê Hui-lī-sū lâng. I mā kiù I-su-la-el lâng.
English: After him was Shamgar the son of Anath, who struck of the Philistines six hundred men with an oxgoad: and he also saved Israel.

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p lâng pháiⁿ khuán-thāi guán, kā guán khó͘-to̍k, kiò guán tsò khó͘-kang.
English: The Egyptians dealt ill with us, and afflicted us, and laid on us hard bondage:

Tailo: Ū siū kat-lé kah bô siū kat-lé lóng bô iàu-kín, iàu-kín ê sī lán tio̍h tsiâⁿ-tsò sin tshòng-tsō ê lâng.
English: For in Christ Jesus neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Mô͘-ap ê bi̍k-sī. Tī tsi̍t mê ê tiong-kan, Mô͘-ap ê Al piàn-tsò hong-huì siau-bia̍t-.khì; tsi̍t mê ê tiong-kan Mô͘-ap ê Ki-l piàn-tsò hong-huì siau-bia̍t-.khì.
English: The burden of Moab: for in a night, Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing; for in a night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing.

Tailo: Sù-tsiá kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, Tuì-ti̍k pí guán khah kiông, tshut-lâi kau-iá kong-kik guán, guán kā i phah kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu.
English: The messenger said to David, The men prevailed against us, and came out to us into the field, and we were on them even to the entrance of the gate.

Tailo: Iô-thàm khí Siōng-tsú tiān ê tíng mn̂g, koh tī O͘-phue-l ê siâⁿ tíng khí tsin tsē tíng mn̂g,
English: He built the upper gate of the house of Yahweh, and on the wall of Ophel he built much.

Tailo: Hit sî, lín koh ē liáu-kái hó lâng kah pháiⁿ lâng ê hun-pia̍t, ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú ê lâng kah bô ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú ê lâng ê hun-pia̍t.
English: Then you shall return and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him who serves God and him who doesn't serve him.

Tailo: Lí īng phuê kah bah hō͘ guá tshīng, koh īng kut kah kin hō͘ guá liân-kiat.
English: You have clothed me with skin and flesh, And knit me together with bones and sinews.

Tailo: Nā bô, bān-it ū Ma-ke-tó-niah lâng kah guá tsò-hué khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín bô tsún-pī piān, guán ē in-uī siuⁿ-kuè siong-sìn, lín suah tsin làu-khuì. Lín kám bē kám-kak koh khah làu-khuì?
English: so that I won't by any means, if there come with me any of Macedonia and find you unprepared, we (to say nothing of you) should be disappointed in this confident boasting.

Tailo: Mn̂g-khing in-uī tshiùⁿ hô ê siann lâi tín-tāng; tiān tsiū ū ian-bū muá-muá.
English: The foundations of the thresholds shook at the voice of him who called, and the house was filled with smoke.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ;
English: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.

Tailo: M̄-thang kiâⁿ gī siuⁿ tsē, m̄-thang tì-huī kuè-thâu; lâng ná ē pāi-huāi ka-kī?
English: Don't be overly righteous, neither make yourself overly wise. Why should you destroy yourself?

Tailo: Huâ-láu kā Iô-sé-huh kóng, Guá bāng-kìnn guá khiā tī hô piⁿ,
English: Pharaoh spoke to Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood on the brink of the river:

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, to̍h-sī tú-tio̍h hô tsuí huàn-lām, i mā bô kiann; Iol-tàn hô tiòng kàu i ê tshuì, i mā an-jiân.
English: Behold, if a river overflows, he doesn't tremble. He is confident, though the Jordan swells even to his mouth.

Tailo: Sàu-lô kā Siōng-tsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, tse sī i thâu tsi̍t pái kā Siōng-tsú khí ê tuâⁿ.
English: Saul built an altar to Yahweh: the same was the first altar that he built to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsuân-lîng Siōng-tè tī hit lāi-bīn kuáⁿ-suàⁿ lia̍t ông ê sî, sè-bīn tshin-tshiūnn Sal-mòng suaⁿ teh lo̍h seh.
English: When the Almighty scattered kings in her, It snowed on Zalmon.

Tailo: Lín tī pún-tē kah khi-ap lín ê tuì-ti̍k kau-tsiàn, tsiū tio̍h īng kó͘-tshue pûn tuā-siaⁿ, tsiū tī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h kì-liām, mā beh tit-tio̍h kiù lâi thuat-lī lín ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: When you go to war in your land against the adversary who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets; and you shall be remembered before Yahweh your God, and you shall be saved from your enemies.

Tailo: Tsiàu lu̍t-huat ê tsè-si só͘ tsò ê ho̍k-sāi, tsí-put-kò sī hóng-tsō thinn-tíng ê huē-bō͘ kah iáⁿ-siōng. Tú tshin-tshiūnn Mô͘-se beh tsō huē-bō͘ ê sî, Siōng-tè ū kā i tsí-sī, kóng, Lí tio̍h kín-sīn, it-tshè tio̍h tsiò tī suaⁿ tíng guá kā lí tsí-sī ê khuán-sit lâi tsō. (tsù, CAG 25: 40)
English: who serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to make the tabernacle, for he said, See, you shall make everything according to the pattern that was shown to you on the mountain.

Tailo: Sio̍k A-sel ê, ē tshut-kun pâi-tīn ê, ū sì bān lâng.
English: Of Asher, such as were able to go out in the army, who could set the battle in array, forty thousand.

Tailo: I thǹg-khì kaⁿ lāi só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, tsi̍t-sì-lâng kah Ba-bú-lông ông tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life:

Tailo: Hit sî, tī Iô-tá-iah síng ê lâng tio̍h tô-tsáu khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tī siâⁿ lāi ê lâng tio̍h tshut-.lâi, tī tsng-kha ê lâng m̄-thang ji̍p-khì tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi.
English: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the midst of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.

Tailo: Guán tsin ài khì lín hia. Guá Páu-lô tsi̍t pái koh tsi̍t pái siūⁿ beh khì, m̄-koh, Sa-tán kā guán tsó͘-tòng.
English: because we wanted to come to youindeed, I, Paul, once and againbut Satan hindered us.

Tailo: I ê kuân-pìng tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā, tsóng-.sī, m̄-sī tuì ka-kī ê kuân-pìng; i ē kiânn hui-siông ê huí-bia̍t, mā ē hing-thong, koh tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kiâⁿ, koh ē huí-bia̍t ū kuân-li̍k ê kah sìng ê tsú-bîn.
English: His power shall be mighty, but not by his own power; and he shall destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper and do his pleasure; and he shall destroy the mighty ones and the holy people.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn phang kā guá pau-uî, tshin-tshiūnn sio tshì-phè ê hué siū phah-hua; guá uá-khò Siōng-tsú ê miâ lâi kā in tsâu-bia̍t.
English: They surrounded me like bees. They are quenched like the burning thorns. In the name of Yahweh I cut them off.

Tailo: Guá ē hun-pia̍t guá ê jîn-bîn kah lí ê jîn-bîn, bîn-á-tsài ē ū tsit-ê sîn-jiah. '
English: I will put a division between my people and your people: by tomorrow shall this sign be.'

Tailo: Án-ne, tī tuā-bo̍k-tsiá hián-hiān ê sî, lín tsiah ē tit-tio̍h bē sit-khì kong-tshái ê îng-kuan.
English: When the chief Shepherd is revealed, you will receive the crown of glory that doesn't fade away.

Tailo: Guá khún-kiû Siōng-tè khui lín ê sim-sîn, hō͘ lín thang tsai I suán-tiàu lín lâi tit-tio̍h ê ǹg-bāng sī siáⁿ-mi̍h; I tuì sìn-tô͘ só͘ ìng-ín ê tsiok-hok sī guā-ni̍h-á hong-hù,
English: having the eyes of your hearts enlightened, that you may know what is the hope of his calling, and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Ta-lió-suh ông tshiam-jī tī hit-ê tsiàu-līng kah kìm-līng.
English: Therefore king Darius signed the writing and the interdict.

Tailo: In-uī kûn-tsiòng tsha-put-to ū gō͘-tshing lâng. I-é-su tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Kiò kûn-tsiòng hun-tso͘ tsē lo̍h-.khì, muí tso͘ tsha-put-to gō͘-tsa̍p lâng.
English: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples, Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.

Tailo: E-li-iah kóng, Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī guá khiā tī I ê bīn-tsîng ê, kóng, kin-á-ji̍t guá it-tīng ē hō͘ A-hap khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá.
English: Elijah said, As Yahweh of Armies lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today.

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; īng pûn ê ga̍k-khì ) Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê uē, kàm-tshat guá ê sim-su.
English: Give ear to my words, Yahweh. Consider my meditation.

Tailo: Tī hia pháiⁿ lâng bô koh-tsài kiáu-jiáu; tī hia ià-siān ê tit-tio̍h an-hioh.
English: There the wicked cease from troubling; There the weary are at rest.

Tailo: A-hap kā Iô-sa-huat kóng, Lí kám beh kah guá khì Gi-lia̍t ê La̍h-mot kau-tsiàn? Iô-sa-huat kā I-su-la-el ông kóng, Guá tshin-tshiūnn lí ê, guá ê jîn-bîn tshin-tshiūnn lí ê jîn-bîn, guá ê bé tshin-tshiūnn lí ê bé.
English: He said to Jehoshaphat, Will you go with me to battle to Ramoth Gilead? Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, I am as you are, my people as your people, my horses as your horses.

Tailo: Lí tī kuân-kuân ê suaⁿ tíng an-tì bîn-tshn̂g, mā tńg-khì hiàn tsè.
English: On a high and lofty mountain have you set your bed; there also you went up to offer sacrifice.

Tailo: In-uī hit khuán gī lâng, Guá bô beh hō͘ i siong-sim, lín īng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē hō͘ i siong-sim, jî-tshiánn lín kian-kò͘ pháiⁿ lâng ê tshiú, hō͘ i bô ua̍t thâu lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ lō͘, lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h.
English: Because with lies you have grieved the heart of the righteous, whom I have not made sad; and strengthened the hands of the wicked, that he should not return from his wicked way, and be saved alive:

Tailo: Tse sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè só͘ bīng-līng lâi kà-sī lín ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, huat-tō͘, hō͘ lín tī lín só͘ beh kuè-khì tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē thang tsiàu án-ne kiânn,
English: Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it;

Tailo: M̄-koh, Guá beh īng kńg-lê-á hong kā in tshue suàⁿ khì-kàu in só͘ m̄-bat ê lia̍t kok. Án-ne, tsit-ê tē tī in khì liáu-āu to̍h piàn-tsò pha-hng, tì-sú bô lâng tshut-ji̍p king-kuè, in-uī in hō͘ thang huann-hí ê tē pha-hng à.
English: but I will scatter them with a whirlwind among all the nations which they have not known. Thus the land was desolate after them, so that no man passed through nor returned: for they made the pleasant land desolate.
