Tailo: Siat-sú in m̄ tuà kun-khì kah lín kuè-.khì, in tsiū tī Ka-nân tē tuì lín tiong-kan tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p.
English: but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê lāu-pē Ki-si phah-m̄-kiàn kuí-nā tsiah lô͘-bú, Ki-si kā i ê kiáⁿ Sàu-lô kóng, Lí tshuā tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k tshut-huat khì tshuē lî-bó.
English: The donkeys of Kish, Saul's father, were lost. Kish said to Saul his son, Take now one of the servants with you, and arise, go seek the donkeys.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, jîn-bîn tsin tsē, koh tú-tio̍h tuā hō͘, guán bē-tàng khiā tī guā-bīn, tse mā m̄-sī tsi̍t ji̍t, nn̄g ji̍t ê tāi-tsì, in-uī guán tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì tíng-bīn ū tuā-tuā huān tsuē;
English: But the people are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we are not able to stand outside: neither is this a work of one day or two; for we have greatly transgressed in this matter.

Tailo: Koh lín mā ē uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘, hō͘ lâng thua-khì tsóng-tok kah kun-ông ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tuì in kah guā-pang lâng tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.

Tailo: In-uī in lóng ài hō͘ guán kiaⁿ, ì-sù sī beh hō͘ guán ê tshiú ē sng-nńg, tì-sú kang-sū tsò bē tsiânn. Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kian-kò͘ guá ê tshiú!
English: For they all would have made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it not be done. But now, God, strengthen you my hands.

Tailo: Guá siūⁿ kóng: Guá siū kuáⁿ-tio̍k, lī-khui Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, tsóng-.sī, guá iáu teh ǹg Lí ê sìng-tiān.
English: I said, I have been banished from your sight; Yet I will look again toward your holy temple.'

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tī Ba-la̍h ê bīn-tsîng, īng to phah-luān Si-se-la̍h kah i só͘-ū ê tshia, i ê kun-tuī, Si-se-la̍h lo̍h-tshia kiâⁿ lō͘ tô-tsáu.
English: Yahweh confused Sisera, and all his chariots, and all his army, with the edge of the sword before Barak; and Sisera alighted from his chariot, and fled away on his feet.

Tailo: A-nah ê kiáⁿ, Ti-sióng. Ti-sióng ê kiáⁿ, Ham-lân, E-si-ban, It-lân, Ki-lân.
English: The sons of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

Tailo: Bô uī guá ê lâng to̍h-sī kah guá tuì-ti̍k. Bô hia̍p-tsō͘ guá ê lâng to̍h-sī teh kā guá phò-huāi.
English: He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn't gather with me scatters.

Tailo: Guá beh tī Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el tiong hián-tshut Guá ê sìng-miâ, mā bô iông-ín Guá ê sìng-miâ koh siū siat-to̍k; lia̍t kok lâng tsiū ē tsai Guá to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el tiong ê sìng ê.
English: My holy name will I make known in the midst of my people Israel; neither will I allow my holy name to be profaned any more: and the nations shall know that I am Yahweh, the Holy One in Israel.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kah Lē-bī ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, hun-phài in tshiùⁿ kua ê hiann-tī tsàu ga̍k, īng sik kah khîm, kah nâ-pua̍h, huann-hí tshut siaⁿ lâi tshiùnn.
English: David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brothers the singers, with instruments of music, psalteries and harps and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up the voice with joy.

Tailo: Hit-ê ki-lō͘-ping mā sī tsa̍p tiú, nn̄g-ê ki-lō͘-ping ê tshùn-tshioh kah khuán-sit lóng sio-kāng.
English: The other cherub was ten cubits: both the cherubim were of one measure and one form.

Tailo: m̄-koh, i tsuè-āu mā tio̍h khì kìⁿ in tsó͘-kong, íng-uán bô koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h kng.
English: He shall go to the generation of his fathers. They shall never see the light.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí ke-thinn jîn-bîn, hō͘ kok-ka hing-ōng; Lí tit-tio̍h îng-kng, koh khui-khuah tsit-ê tē sì-bīn ê tē-kài.
English: You have increased the nation, O Yahweh. You have increased the nation! You are glorified! You have enlarged all the borders of the land.

Tailo: I īng I ê tì-sik hō͘ tshim-ian li̍h-.khui, hō͘ kiong-tshong tih lō͘-tsuí.
English: By his knowledge, the depths were broken up, And the skies drop down the dew.

Tailo: Ha-gái tsiū ìn kóng, Siōng-tsú kóng, ' Tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, tsiah-ê jîn-bîn sī tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, tsit-ê kok mā sī án-ne; in ê tshiú só͘ tsò ta̍k tsióng ê kang mā lóng sī án-ne; in tī tsia só͘ hiàn ê bô tshing-khì. '
English: Then Haggai answered, So is this people, and so is this nation before me,' says Yahweh; and so is every work of their hands. That which they offer there is unclean.

Tailo: Lí mā ē tsai lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tsin tsē, lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tshin-tshiūnn tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsheⁿ-tsháu.
English: You shall know also that your seed shall be great, Your offspring as the grass of the earth.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ná ē bô tsip-siú kí Siōng-tsú só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê kah guá só͘ kíng-kài lí ê bīng-līng?
English: Why then have you not kept the oath of Yahweh, and the commandment that I have charged you with?

Tailo: Guān Lí tshun tshiú pang-tsān guá, in-uī guá ū suán-ti̍k Lí ê kà-sī.
English: Let your hand be ready to help me, For I have chosen your precepts.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê tē tio̍h liam-khau lâi pun, ta̍k lâng tsiàu i tsó͘-tsong tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k ê miâ, lâi sîng-tsiap tsiah-ê sán-gia̍p.
English: Notwithstanding, the land shall be divided by lot: according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.

Tailo: Lín tī tshì-thàm tiong tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guá tsò-hué.
English: But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tī khòng-iá thiaⁿ-tio̍h Na-bal teh tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g,
English: David heard in the wilderness that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

Tailo: O͘-huil, Ha-bí-la̍h, Io-bap; tsiah-ê lóng sī Iok-tan ê kiáⁿ.
English: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, lí ê sió-muē So͘-tóm kah i tsìng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, bô kiâⁿ lí kah lí tsìng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, Sodom your sister has not done, she nor her daughters, as you have done, you and your daughters.

Tailo: M̄-thang lām-sám tshing Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê miâ, in-uī lām-sám tshing I ê miâ ê lâng, Siōng-tsú it-tīng ē lia̍h i tsò ū tsuē.
English: You shall not take the name of Yahweh your God in vain, for Yahweh will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông tsiū tiàu tsi̍t-ê kuaⁿ-uân lâi, kóng, Lí khì kiò Im-lah ê kiáⁿ Mi-ka-iah kuáⁿ-kín lâi.
English: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, Get quickly Micaiah the son of Imlah.

Tailo: Án-ne, sī siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t? It-tīng sī hiah-ê kī-tsua̍t I-é-su tsò Ki-tok ê lâng. Kī-tsua̍t Thiⁿ-pē kah Kiáⁿ ê to̍h-sī Ki-tok ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: Who is the liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This is the Antichrist, he who denies the Father and the Son.

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè bīng-līng lí kiânn tsiah-ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsīn-sim tsīn-sìng tsip-siú, lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: This day Yahweh your God commands you to do these statutes and ordinances: you shall therefore keep and do them with all your heart, and with all your soul.

Tailo: In kàu Pa-lân hia, tuì i kóng, Tsip-pol ê kiáⁿ Ba-al án-ne kóng, ' Kiû lí m̄-thang hō͘ siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì tsó͘-tòng lí bô lâi guá tsia.
English: They came to Balaam, and said to him, Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me:

Tailo: Lí khí-.lâi, khì Pa-tàn-a-lâm, kàu lí ê guā-kong Be-thu-el ê ke, tī lí ê bó-kū La̍h-ban ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tiong-kan, tshuā tsi̍t-ê lâi tsò bó͘.
English: Arise, go to Paddan Aram, to the house of Bethuel your mother's father. Take a wife from there from the daughters of Laban, your mother's brother.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Ka-le-ah ê kiáⁿ Io-ha-nân kah tuè i ê tsìng kun-tiúⁿ, kā só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī Ne-thá-niah ê kiáⁿ I-si-ma-el phah-sí A-hi-kam ê kiáⁿ Ge-tá-lia̍h í-āu, tuì Mi-su-peh só͘ tshuā-khì ê tsa-po͘ lâng, ióng-sū, tsa-bó͘ lâng, gín-á kah thài-kàm, koh sī i tuì Gi-bóng tshuā-lâi ê.
English: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, to wit, the men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon:

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Guá mā beh mn̄g lín tsi̍t kù uē, lín tio̍h kā guá ìn-tap.
English: He answered them, I also will ask you one question. Tell me:

Tailo: In-uī tsit-ê tuā ê la̍t, guá ê saⁿ-khò͘ piàn kah m̄-tsiâⁿ-iūⁿ; tshin-tshiūnn saⁿ ê ām-niá kā guá sok ân-ân.
English: By great force is my garment disfigured. It binds me about as the collar of my coat.

Tailo: In tshing-khì ê ji̍t-kî tsi̍t ē muá, Iô-sé-huh kah Mâ-lí-ah tsiū tsiàu Mô͘-se ê lu̍t-huat, phō enn-á khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm, beh kā I hiàn hō͘ Tsú.
English: When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord

Tailo: M̄-thang lîng-jio̍k lí ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ hō͘ i khì tsò tshiong-ki, khióng-kiaⁿ tē-tsiūⁿ lóng kui ǹg îm-luān, tē-tsiūⁿ muá-muá tuā pháiⁿ.
English: Don't profane your daughter, to make her a prostitute; lest the land fall to prostitution, and the land become full of wickedness.

Tailo: Mô͘-ap ông khuàⁿ-tio̍h kau-tsiàn ê sè-bīn tí-ti̍k bē tiâu, tsiū tuà gia̍h to ê tshit-pah lâng, beh tshiong-kuè tīn khì-kàu E-tóm ông hia, tsóng-.sī, bē-tàng tshiong kuè-.khì.
English: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too severe for him, he took with him seven hundred men who drew sword, to break through to the king of Edom; but they could not.

Tailo: Lán tsit uī tuā-tsè-si, m̄-sī bē thé-thiap lán ê luán-jio̍k; I tī ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì lóng kah lán kāng-khuán ū siū tshì-thàm, m̄-koh, I bô huān tsuē.
English: For we don't have a high priest who can't be touched with the feeling of our infirmities, but one who has been in all points tempted like we are, yet without sin.

Tailo: Guá sī mn̂g, tuì guá tsit-ê mn̂g ji̍p-.lâi ê ē tit-tio̍h kiù, ē-tàng tshut-tshut ji̍p-ji̍p, mā ē tshuē-tio̍h bo̍k-tsháu.
English: I am the door. If anyone enters in by me, he will be saved, and will go in and go out, and will find pasture.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Ài-ah, m̄-sìn koh puē-gi̍k ê sè-tāi! Guá tio̍h koh kah lín tuà guā kú? Tio̍h koh jím-nāi lín guā kú? Kā lí ê hāu-seⁿ tshuā-lâi tsia!
English: Jesus answered, Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.

Tailo: Hit sî, lín bô kah Ki-tok kiat-liân, bô sio̍k Siōng-tè ê suán-bîn, tī Siōng-tè ìng-ín ê iok bô hūn, tī tsit sè-kan bô ǹg-bāng, mā m̄-bat Siōng-tè.
English: that you were at that time separate from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of the promise, having no hope and without God in the world.

Tailo: tuì Khó-la̍h kah i ê tsuân-tóng ê lâng kóng, Kàu bîn-á tsá-khí, Siōng-tsú ē tsí-sī siáⁿ lâng sī sio̍k I ê, siáⁿ lâng sī sìng, tsiū ē hō͘ hit-ê lâng tshin-kīn I; I só͘ kíng-suán ê lâng beh hō͘ in tshin-kīn I.
English: and he spoke to Korah and to all his company, saying, In the morning Yahweh will show who are his, and who is holy, and will cause him to come near to him: even him whom he shall choose he will cause to come near to him.

Tailo: Í-sak kā i ê lāu-pē A-bu-la-hàm kóng, Pē ah. A-bu-la-hàm ìn kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ, guá tī tsia. Í-sak kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, hué kah tshâ lóng ū, tsóng-.sī, sio-tsè ê iûⁿ-á tī tó-uī?
English: Isaac spoke to Abraham his father, and said, My father? He said, Here I am, my son. He said, Here is the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?

Tailo: Hui-lī-sū lâng koh-tsài lâi, pò͘-tì tī Le-hua-im ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: The Philistines came up yet again, and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kî-si̍t ū tì-huī, I ē kàng tsai-hō, bô siu tò-tńg I ê uē; I ē khí-lâi kong-kik hiah-ê pháiⁿ lâng ê ke, koh kong-kik hiah-ê pang-tsān lâng tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng.
English: Yet he also is wise, and will bring disaster, And will not call back his words, but will arise against the house of the evil-doers, And against the help of those who work iniquity.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Tsú ah, Lí tiām-tiām teh khuàⁿ beh kàu guā kú? Kiû Lí kiù guá ê sîn-hûn thuat-lī in ê tsân-hāi! Kiù guá ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī hiong-bíng ê sai-á-thûn!
English: Lord, how long will you look on? Rescue my soul from their destruction, My precious life from the lions.

Tailo: I ê tsia̍h-mi̍h kàu tī i ê tn̂g-á tsiū piàn, piàn-sîng to̍k-tsuâ ê táⁿ tī i ê lāi-bīn.
English: Yet his food in his bowels is turned. It is cobra venom within him.

Tailo: Tsú ah, guá ê lô͘-po̍k piàn-suī, tó tī tshù lāi, hui-siông kan-khó͘.
English: and saying, Lord, my servant lies in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented.

Tailo: Lí nā kiâⁿ hó, kám bē tit-tio̍h kàm-la̍p? Nā bô kiâⁿ hó, tsuē-gia̍t ē bâi-ho̍k tī mn̂g-kháu, i ē luân-bō͘ lí, lí ē hō͘ i kuán-hat.
English: If you do well, will it not be lifted up? If you don't do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it.

Tailo: Hit-ê kiânn siat-li̍p ê lé-gî só͘ hiàn ê bah á-.sī piáⁿ, nā ū lâu kàu keh kang tsá-khí ê, lí tio̍h kā só͘ lâu ê īng hué sio, m̄-thang tsia̍h, in-uī sī sìng ê mi̍h.
English: If anything of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread, remains to the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.

Tailo: Lí īng i ka-kī ê tshiuⁿ tsha̍k-thàu i tsiàn-sū ê thâu; in lâi tshin-tshiūnn kńg-lê-á hong, beh kā guá kuáⁿ-suàⁿ. In só͘ huann-hí ê sī thau-thau-á thun-tsia̍h sàn-tshiah lâng.
English: You pierced the heads of his warriors with their own spears. They came as a whirlwind to scatter me, Gloating as if to devour the wretched in secret.

Tailo: I-é-su iû-guân bô ìn kah puàⁿ-kù uē, tsóng-tok suah kám-kak hui-siông kî-kuài.
English: He gave him no answer, not even one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.

Tailo: Le-mi̍k tshuā nn̄g-ê bó͘, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò A-tah, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Tsé-la̍h.
English: Lamech took two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, tsiū tiām lo̍h-.khì, kui îng-kng hō͘ Siōng-tè, kóng, Án-ne kóng-khí-.lâi, Siōng-tè mā ū hō͘ guā-pang lâng hué-kái, lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā.
English: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life!

Tailo: Guá beh kám-siā Lí, in-uī Lí í-king ìn-tap guá, koh í-king tsiâⁿ-tsò guá ê tsín-kiù!
English: I will give thanks to you, for you have answered me, And have become my salvation.

Tailo: Kiám-tshái tsú-lâng ē tī puàⁿ-mê á-.sī thiⁿ-phú-kng ê sî tńg-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tshéⁿ-tshéⁿ, hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k tsin ū hok-khì.
English: They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch, and finds them so.

Tailo: Hiān-kim lí ê ông tī tó-uī, hō͘ i tī lí tsiah-ê siâⁿ kā lí tsín-kiù? Lí ê sū-su to̍h-sī lí só͘ bat kóng: Kā guán siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê ông kah siú-líng ê, taⁿ in tī tó-uī?
English: Where is your king now, that he may save you in all your cities? And your judges, of whom you said, Give me a king and princes?'

Tailo: Sī īng Ki-tok ê pó-hueh, tshin-tshiūnn bô khuat-tiám koh bô ù-tiám ê iûⁿ-ko ê hueh.
English: but with precious blood, as of a faultless and pure lamb, the blood of Christ;

Tailo: Ti-sióng ê kiáⁿ sī Hem-tàn, E-si-ban, It-lân, Ke-lân.
English: These are the children of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.

Tailo: Lán nā kóng, ji̍p-khì siâⁿ lāi, siâⁿ lāi ū ki-hng, lán ē sí tī hia; nā tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsē tī tsia, mā sī tio̍h sí. Lâi à, lán lâi-khì tâu-hâng A-lâm ê kun-tuī, in nā lâu lán ê ua̍h-miā, lán tsiū ē ua̍h; nā kā lán thâi-sí, huâiⁿ-ti̍t mā sī sí!
English: If we say, We will enter into the city, then the famine is in the city, and we shall die there; and if we sit still here, we die also. Now therefore come, and let us fall to the army of the Syrians: if they save us alive, we shall live; and if they kill us, we shall but die.

Tailo: Lán ǹg-bāng pîng-an, mā bô tit-tio̍h hó-tshù; ǹg-bāng ū i hó ê sî-kî, tian-tò ū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín sī teh liap-tsō pe̍h-tsha̍t uē, lóng sī bô lō͘-īng ê i-sing.
English: But you are forgers of lies. You are all physicians of no value.

Tailo: Tī tē-tsiūⁿ mā m̄-thang tshing lâng tsò Pē , in-uī lín ê Thiⁿ-pē tsí ū tsi̍t uī, to̍h-sī tī thinn-tíng hit-uī.
English: Call no man on the earth your father, for one is your Father, he who is in heaven.

Tailo: In m̄-thang koh hiàn tsè tī in kiânn siâ-îm só͘ tsun-thàn ê kuí-kuài; tse beh tsò in ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: They shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat idols, after which they play the prostitute. This shall be a statute forever to them throughout their generations.'

Tailo: Eh, kiàn-nā lín tshuì-ta ê, tio̍h lâi tsiū-kīn tsuí; bô tsînn ê, lín mā tio̍h lâi, lâi bé lâi tsia̍h; lâi, m̄-bián gîn, m̄-bián kè-tsîⁿ, lâi bé tsiú kah ling.
English: Ho, everyone who thirsts, come you to the waters, and he who has no money; come you, buy, and eat; yes, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.

Tailo: Tsiú lóng lim-liáu ê sî, I-é-su ê lāu-bú tsiū tuì I kóng, In bô tsiú à.
English: When the wine ran out, Jesus' mother said to him, They have no wine.

Tailo: Koh īng gîn tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t, tuì I-su-la-el tsio-bō͘ tuā lîng-li̍k ê ióng-sū, tsa̍p bān lâng.
English: He hired also one hundred thousand mighty men of valor out of Israel for one hundred talents of silver.

Tailo: In tsiū kā Ê-su-tel ê uē tuì Mol-té-kái kóng.
English: They told to Mordecai Esther's words.

Tailo: Tio̍h ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tī tsè-si ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, sio bó ê gû-á, to̍h-sī sio i ê phuê, i ê bah, i ê hueh, i ê sái.
English: One shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn:

Tailo: Hit sî, Ha-ta̍t iáu-sī sè-hàn ê gín-á. Ha-ta̍t kah i ê lāu-pē ê jîn-sîn tiong kuí-nā-ê E-tóm lâng tsáu-khì Ai-gi̍p.
English: that Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father's servants with him, to go into Egypt, Hadad being yet a little child.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi í-king pha-hng, siâⁿ mn̂g lóng huí-huāi.
English: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.

Tailo: Hiah-ê ki-lō͘-ping ê si̍t, kiōng tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, tsit-ê ki-lō͘-ping tsi̍t ki si̍t tn̂g gō͘ tiú, tshun-kàu tiān tsit pîng ê piah, hit ki si̍t mā sī gō͘ tiú, tshun-kàu hit-ê ki-lō͘-ping ê si̍t.
English: The wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits long: the wing of the one cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.

Tailo: Kò i kóng, Tsit-ê lâng siàn-tōng lâng, īng uî-puē lu̍t-huat ê hong-sik lâi kìng-pài Siōng-tè!
English: saying, This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.

Tailo: Má-lia̍p, Pik-a-lo̍k, Í-li̍k-thê-kun, kiōng la̍k-ê siâⁿ kah i ê tsng-thâu.
English: and Maarath, and Beth Anoth, and Eltekon; six cities with their villages.

Tailo: Guá ū tshiánn Lí ê bûn-tô͘ kuáⁿ siâ-sîn, in mā lóng bô i huat.
English: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn't.

Tailo: （ Ta-bi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu īng lâm ko-im hi̍k ké-siaⁿ ）Guá beh tsuân-sim kám-siā Siōng-tsú; guá beh suan-iông Lí it-tshè kî-biāu ê só͘ tsò.
English: I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart. I will tell of all your marvelous works.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí m̄-thang sǹg i bô tsuē, in-uī lí sī tshong-bîng ê lâng, mā ē tsai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā i khuán-thāi, tio̍h hō͘ i pe̍h thâu-mn̂g lâu hueh lo̍h im-kan.
English: Now therefore don't hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man; and you will know what you ought to do to him, and you shall bring his gray head down to Sheol with blood.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lín īng ngē ê uē kik Guá, lín iáu-koh kóng, ' Guán īng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē lâi kik Lí? '
English: Your words have been stout against me, says Yahweh. Yet you say, What have we spoken against you?'

Tailo: Tio̍h tshīng liâng-ê, mā m̄-thang ke tuà lāi-saⁿ.
English: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsiah-ê jîn-bîn lóng ha̍p-it, giân-gí mā sio-siâng, hiān-kim í-king khai-sí tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì, í-āu in só͘ beh tsò ê, bô tsi̍t hāng ē-tàng kìm-tsí.
English: Yahweh said, Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language, and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do.

Tailo: In-uī Iô-há-neh lâi kà-sī lín tio̍h kiânn Siōng-tè ê lō͘, lín bô sìn i; thiu-suè ê kah tshiong-ki ū sìn; á lín khuàⁿ-liáu mā bô hué-kái lâi sìn i.
English: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn't believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn't even repent afterward, that you might believe him.

Tailo: In-uī I-su-la-el lâng kah Lē-bī lâng tio̍h kā in hiàn tsè ê ngó͘-kok, sin tsiú kah iû, tuà kàu siu-tsông sìng-só͘ ê khì-kū ê pâng-king, to̍h-sī tam-tng tsit ê tsè-si, kò͘-mn̂g ê kah tshiùⁿ kua ê teh tuà ê pâng-king. Án-ne, guán tsiū bô beh pàng-sak guán Siōng-tè ê tiān.
English: For the children of Israel and the children of Levi shall bring the wave offering of the grain, of the new wine, and of the oil, to the chambers, where are the vessels of the sanctuary, and the priests who minister, and the porters, and the singers: and we will not forsake the house of our God.

Tailo: Iá-hu-liat ê kiáⁿ sī Pa-sat, Pin-hap, A-si-bat. Tsiah-ê lóng sī Iá-hu-liat ê kiáⁿ.
English: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tuì hiah-ê tshíng hue-tsuí ê lâng kóng, ' Tshiûⁿ ē tó-huāi, ē ū tiòng-tsuí ê tuā hō͘. Ē lo̍h tuā-pha̍uh, koh ē ū tuā hong kā i tshue li̍h-.khì. '
English: tell those who daub it with whitewash, that it shall fall: there shall be an overflowing shower; and you, great hailstones, shall fall; and a stormy wind shall tear it.

Tailo: Koh ū lâng hō͘ lâng īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm, īng kì-á kì, īng to thâi-sí. Mā ū lâng tshīng mî-iûⁿ-á-.sī suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê phuê, sì-kè phun-pho, jím-siū sàn-tshiah, huān-lān kah gi̍k-thāi;
English: They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, ill-treated

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kìm-tsí lí ê kha, bián-tit bô ê, kìm-tsí lí ê nâ-âu, bián-tit tshuì-ta. M̄-koh, lí kóng: Tse sī bô tshái-kang, m̄ lah. Guá í-king luân-bō͘ pa̍t-ê, guá beh tuè in.
English: Withhold your foot from being unshod, and your throat from thirst: but you said, It is in vain; no, for I have loved strangers, and after them will I go.

Tailo: Suî-jiân án-ne, Iô-tá-iah lâng ê thâu-lâng ū tsin tsē sìn I-é-su, in kiaⁿ Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, tsiah bô kong-khai sîng-jīn I, bián-tit hông kuáⁿ-tshut huē-tn̂g.
English: Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they didn't confess it, so that they wouldn't be put out of the synagogue,

Tailo: Guá kui sing-khu lóng sī thâng kah kui tè ê thô͘; guá phuê-hu ê liàp-á siu tshuì tsiū koh tshut-lâng.
English: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust. My skin closes up, and breaks out afresh.

Tailo: Gín-á hō͘ lâng tshuā-.lâi ê sî, siâ-sîn kā i siak-tó, hō͘ i tuā thiu-tshuah. I-é-su tsiū tsik-pī siâ-sîn, i hó hit-ê gín-á, kau hō͘ i ê lāu-pē.
English: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.

Tailo: La̍h-ban koh tuì Iâ-kop kóng, Lí khuàⁿ tsit tui tsio̍h, lí khuàⁿ tsit ki thiāu, to̍h-sī guá só͘ hē tī lí guá ê tiong-kan ê.
English: Laban said to Jacob, See this heap, and see the pillar, which I have set between me and you.

Tailo: Tsai-hāi kah ki-hng, lí ē kā i tshiò; tē-tsiūⁿ ê iá-siù, lí mā bián-kiaⁿ.
English: At destruction and famine you shall laugh, Neither shall you be afraid of the animals of the earth.

Tailo: Iâ-kop ê kiáⁿ Iô-tah kah tshut-bē I-é-su ê Ka-lio̍k lâng Iô-tah.
English: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.

Tailo: Án-ne, Sàu-lô sí-bông, in-uī i tī Siōng-tsú huān tsuē, uī-tio̍h i bô siú Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng, koh in-uī i khì tshuē kuí hū-sin ê tsa-bó͘ lâng lâi mn̄g i,
English: So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against Yahweh, because of the word of Yahweh, which he didn't keep; and also because he asked counsel of one who had a familiar spirit, to inquire thereby,

Tailo: E-li-iah ìn in kóng, Guá nā-sī Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k, guān hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, sio lí kah lí hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng! Tsiū ū Siōng-tsú ê hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, sio i kah i hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng.
English: Elijah answered them, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from the sky, and consume you and your fifty. The fire of God came down from the sky, and consumed him and his fifty.

Tailo: Tsi-tso̍k ê miâ tsiàu ē-té só͘ kì ê, tuì ki̍k-pak ê kài, tuì Hiat-lông ê lō͘, kàu Ha-mat tshut-ji̍p ê só͘-tsāi, tī Ta-má-su-ko kíng-kài Ha-tsal-e-nán ǹg pak kīn-uá Ha-mat ê tē, tuì tang kàu sai, Tàn tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t hūn.
English: Now these are the names of the tribes: From the north end, beside the way of Hethlon to the entrance of Hamath, Hazar Enan at the border of Damascus, northward beside Hamath, (and they shall have their sides east and west), Dan, one portion.

Tailo: Koh tuì i kuân ê ki-ue ū hué huat-tshut, sio i ê kué-tsí, tì-sú i bô giám-ngē ê ki-ue thang tsò tsiáng-kuân-tsiá ê kuái. Tse sī thang ai-siong ê, thang tsò ai-ko.
English: Fire is gone out of the rods of its branches, it has devoured its fruit, so that there is in it no strong rod to be a scepter to rule. This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.

Tailo: In lâi-kàu E-si-kol ê suaⁿ-kok, tuì hia tshò phû-tô tshiū tsi̍t ki, tíng-bīn ū tsi̍t pha phû-tô, nn̄g lâng īng kǹg-á lâi kng, koh tuà kuá-á sia̍h-liû kah bû-hua-kó lâi.
English: They came to the valley of Eshcol, and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bore it on a staff between two; they brought also of the pomegranates, and of the figs.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn kui tīn ê tsha̍t bâi-ho̍k teh tng-tán lâng; tsè-si kiat-tóng, mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne tī Sī-khiàm ê lō͘ thâi lâng, jî-tshiánn si̍t-tsāi teh kiâⁿ siâ-îm.
English: As gangs of robbers wait to ambush a man, So the company of priests murder in the way toward Shechem, Committing shameful crimes.

Tailo: Mô͘-se ǹg thiⁿ tshun-tshut i ê kuái-á, Siōng-tsú tsiū khí luî lo̍h pha̍uh, ū hué kiânn tī tē-bīn tsiūⁿ; Siōng-tsú lo̍h pha̍uh tī Ai-gi̍p tē.
English: Moses stretched forth his rod toward the heavens, and Yahweh sent thunder, hail, and lightning flashed down to the earth. Yahweh rained hail on the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, sian-ti ngē-ngē beh thok Guá ê miâ, kóng Guá só͘ bô bīng-līng i kóng ê uē, á-.sī hōng pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng ê miâ lâi kóng, hit-ê sian-ti tio̍h sí. '
English: But the prophet, who shall speak a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who shall speak in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ka-kī kín-sīn, khióng-kiaⁿ lín bē kì-tit Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè kah lín só͘ li̍p ê iok, uī ka-kī hóng-tsō siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h lâi tiau-khik ngó͘-siōng, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ kìm-tsí ê.
English: Take heed to yourselves, lest you forget the covenant of Yahweh your God, which he made with you, and make you an engraved image in the form of anything which Yahweh your God has forbidden you.

Tailo: In iû-guân tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tik-tsuē I, tī ta-sò ê tē puē-gi̍k Tsì-kuân-.ê.
English: Yet they still went on to sin against him, To rebel against the Most High in the desert.

Tailo: Tsit gue̍h tsa̍p-gō͘ sī Siōng-tsú ê Tû-kàⁿ-tseh, lín tio̍h tsia̍h bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ tshit ji̍t.
English: On the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread to Yahweh. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò sī tsìng-ti̍t, kàu bué ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sí-bông ê lō͘.
English: There is a way which seems right to a man, But in the end it leads to death.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h ta̍k sî kíng-síng kî-tó, kî-kiû Siōng-tè hō͘ lín ū khuì-la̍t siám-phiah it-tshè teh beh huat-sing ê tāi-tsì, ē-tàng tī Jîn-tsú ê bīn-tsîng khiā tsāi-tsāi.
English: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ê tiúⁿ-ló lóng tsū-tsi̍p, lâi-kàu La̍h-má kìnn Sa-mu-el,
English: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel to Ramah;

Tailo: I uá-khò Siōng-tè, Siōng-tè nā beh kiù I, tsit-má tio̍h kā I kiù, in-uī I kóng, ' Guá sī Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ. '
English: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, I am the Son of God.'

Tailo: ( Tsóng-.sī, bô lâng tshin-tshiūnn A-hap, in-uī i tshut-bē ka-kī, kiânn Siōng-tsú khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, sī tuì i ê ông-hō͘ I-é-tse-bel kā i sái-lōng ê.
English: (But there was none like Ahab, who did sell himself to do that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, whom Jezebel his wife stirred up.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì kāng tsi̍t-ê Sìng Sîn tit-tio̍h sìn-sim, ū lâng tuì kāng tsi̍t-ê Sìng Sîn tit-tio̍h i-pēⁿ ê un-sù.
English: to another faith, by the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healings, by the same Spirit;

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lâi tsia̍h tsá-tǹg. bûn-tô͘ bô lâng káⁿ kā I mn̄g, Lí sī siáⁿ lâng? In-uī in tsai I sī Tsú.
English: Jesus said to them, Come and eat breakfast. None of the disciples dared inquire of him, Who are you? knowing that it was the Lord.

Tailo: Huān-nā ē tshuán-khuì ê, lóng tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú! Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú!
English: Let everything that has breath praise Yah! Praise Yah!

Tailo: Guá ê iûⁿ sì-kè kiânn tī tsiah-ê suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tī ta̍k-ê kuân ê suaⁿ tíng, sì-suàⁿ tī tsuân tē, bô lâng khì jiok, bô lâng khì tshuē.
English: My sheep wandered through all the mountains, and on every high hill: yes, my sheep were scattered on all the surface of the earth; and there was none who searched or sought.

Tailo: Tī hia bô koh ū àm-sî, mā bô su-iàu ting ê kng kah ji̍t-thâu ê kng, in-uī Tsú — Siōng-tè ē kā in tsiò-kng, in ē íng-uán tsiáng-kuân tsò ông.
English: There will be no night, and they need no lamp light; for the Lord God will illuminate them. They will reign forever and ever.

Tailo: In-uī Jîn-tsú sī beh lâi tshuē sit-bê ê lâng, lâi kā i kiù.
English: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.

Tailo: In-uī kin-á-ji̍t i lo̍h-.khì, thâi tsin tsē gû kah puî ê tsing-seⁿ, í-ki̍p iûⁿ, tshiánn ông ê tsìng kiáⁿ kah tsiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ, í-ki̍p tsè-si A-bi-a-thal; lí khuàⁿ, in tī i ê bīn-tsîng lim-tsia̍h, tsiū kóng, ' Guān A-to-nî-iah ông bān-suè! '
English: For he is gone down this day, and has slain oxen and fatlings and sheep in abundance, and has called all the king's sons, and the captains of the army, and Abiathar the priest; and behold, they are eating and drinking before him, and say, Long live king Adonijah.

Tailo: Guán tshin-tshiūnn tuì kó͘-tsá m̄-bat hō͘ Lí tī-lí ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn m̄-bat īng Lí ê miâ lâi tshing-ho͘ ê.
English: We are become as they over whom you never bear rule, as those who were not called by your name.

Tailo: Tng Guá ê îng-kng king-kuè lí ê sî, Guá beh kā lí hē tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ phāng lāi, īng Guá ê tshiú kā lí tsa̍h teh, thìng-hāu Guá kuè-.khì.
English: It will happen, while my glory passes by, that I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and will cover you with my hand until I have passed by;

Tailo: Tsú I-é-su ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōng-tè, to̍h-sī hit uī íng-uán thang o-ló ê, I tsai guá bô kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ, he who is blessed forevermore, knows that I don't lie.

Tailo: Guán nā tú-tio̍h huān-lān, sī beh hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h an-uì kah tsín-kiù; guán nā tit-tio̍h an-uì, mā sī beh hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h an-uì, thang ū khuì-la̍t lâi jím-siū kah guán kāng-khuán ê khó͘-lān.
English: But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.

Tailo: I tsiū kā guá kóng, Tse sī tsè-si tsú pó͘ kuè-si̍t tsè kah sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, í-ki̍p piak sò͘-tsè ê só͘-tsāi; bián-tit tuà kàu guā-īⁿ, án-ne lâi hō͘ jîn-bîn tsiânn-tsò sìng.
English: He said to me, This is the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offering and the sin offering, and where they shall bake the meal offering; that they not bring them forth into the outer court, to sanctify the people.

Tailo: Guán ê Siōng-tè ah, Lí kám bô beh kā in tsik-hua̍t? In-uī guán bô la̍t thang tí-tòng tsit-ê lâi kong-kik guán ê tuā kun-tuī, guán mā m̄-tsai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kiânn, guán ê ba̍k-tsiu ngē-ngē beh ǹg Lí.
English: Our God, will you not judge them? for we have no might against this great company that comes against us; neither know we what to do: but out eyes are on you.

Tailo: Taⁿ Siōng-tè thong-kuè I ê Kiáⁿ jio̍k-thé ê sí, í-king hō͘ lín koh-tsài kah I hô-hó, tsiânn tsò sìng-kiat, bô khuat-tiám koh bô thang hiâm ê tsè-mi̍h, hiàn tī I ê bīn-tsîng.
English: yet now he has reconciled in the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and without blemish and blameless before him,

Tailo: Nā kuè tsi̍t-nn̄g ji̍t tsiah sí, tsiū thang bián siū hîng-hua̍t, in-uī sī īng i ê tsînn bé ê.
English: Notwithstanding, if he gets up after a day or two, he shall not be punished, for he is his property.

Tailo: Tú hit sî, i mā kiânn tsìn-tsîng lâi kám-siā Siōng-tè, tuì só͘-ū kî-thāi Siōng-tè kiù-sio̍k Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê lâng, kóng-khí tsit-ê enn-á ê tāi-tsì.
English: Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lín tsū-huē ê sî, pīng m̄-sī teh tsia̍h Tsú ê buán-tshan.
English: When therefore you assemble yourselves together, it is not the Lord's supper that you eat.

Tailo: Kàu tē-gō͘ ji̍t, i thàu-tsá khí-lâi beh tshut-huat, tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê lāu-pē kā i kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí koh tsia̍h kuá tiám-sim, thìng-hāu kàu ji̍t lo̍h sai suaⁿ tsiah tshut-huat. In nn̄g lâng tsiū koh tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: He arose early in the morning on the fifth day to depart; and the young lady's father said, Please strengthen your heart and stay until the day declines; and they ate, both of them.

Tailo: Tī hia ū kā in kuán-hat ê sió Biān-iá-mín, ū Iô-tah ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ kah in kui tīn ê kûn-tsiòng; ū Tse-bú-lông ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, ū Ná-hu-tha-lím ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ.
English: There is little Benjamin, their ruler, The princes of Judah, their council, The princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

Tailo: Tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī ê tsí-ì to̍h-sī, I só͘ kau-tài guá ê lâng, tsi̍t-ê to bē īng-tit sit-lo̍h. Tī bua̍t-ji̍t guá ē hō͘ i koh-ua̍h.
English: This is the will of my Father who sent me, that of all he has given to me I should lose nothing, but should raise him up at the last day.

Tailo: Hit sî, lâng tsiàu-siông teh lim-tsia̍h, teh kè-tshuā. Kàu Nó͘-ah ji̍p-khì tuā tsûn ê ji̍t, tuā-tsuí tsi̍t-ē kàu, tsìng lâng lóng im-sí liáu-liáu.
English: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

Tailo: Siōng-tè beh tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê hîng-uî kā in pò-ìng. (tsù, SPh 66:12; TsG 24:12)
English: who will pay back to everyone according to their works:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí khí-.lâi, Lí kah Lí ū khuì-la̍t ê iok-kuī tsò-hué ji̍p-khì Lí hioh-khùn ê só͘-tsāi!
English: Arise, Yahweh, into your resting place; You, and the ark of your strength.

Tailo: tī jī-gue̍h tshe-it tiàu-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng. In tsiū tsiàu in ê jîn-ting, tuì jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng, tsiàu in ê miâ-gia̍h, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu tsong-tso̍k, pâi-lia̍t in ê sè-hē.
English: They assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month; and they declared their ancestry by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, one by one.

Tailo: Io-ap tsiū kā só͘ sǹg jîn-bîn ê tsóng-gia̍h pò-kò Ta-bi̍t, I-su-la-el lâng ē gia̍h to ê ū tsi̍t-pah tsa̍p-bān, Iô-tah lâng ē gia̍h to ê sì-tsa̍p tshit bān.
English: Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people to David. All those of Israel were one million one hundred thousand men who drew sword: and in Judah were four hundred seventy thousand men who drew sword.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì in kóng, Lâng ná ē kóng Ki-tok sī Ta-bi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun?
English: He said to them, Why do they say that the Christ is David's son?

Tailo: Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun tī Lū-biān ê tuì-bīn, tuà tī Ba-siáng ê tē kàu tī Sal-kah.
English: The sons of Gad lived over against them, in the land of Bashan to Salecah:

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Mô͘-se huan-hù I-su-la-el lâng siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: Moses spoke to the children of Israel, that they should keep the Passover.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán tuì sio̍k-lîng ê lâng kái-sueh sio̍k-lîng ê tāi-tsì, m̄-sī īng lâng só͘ kà ê tì-huī ê uē, sī īng Sìng Sîn só͘ kà-sī ê uē.
English: Which things also we speak, not in words which man's wisdom teaches, but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual things.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, Io-siú-ah tsiàu Mô͘-se só͘ kā i kóng ê khì tsò, kah A-má-li̍k lâng kau-tsiàn. Mô͘-se, A-lông kah Hu-ul lóng tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tíng.
English: So Joshua did as Moses had told him, and fought with Amalek; and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

Tailo: Tú tshin-tshiūnn lán kah Ki-tok tsò-hué siū tsióng-tsióng ê khó͘-lān, lán mā thong-kuè Ki-tok siū-tio̍h hiah-ni̍h tsē ê an-uì.
English: For as the sufferings of Christ abound to us, even so our comfort also abounds through Christ.

Tailo: Hûn siau-suàⁿ tsiū kuè-.khì, lâng lo̍h im-kan mā bē koh khí-.lâi.
English: As the cloud is consumed and vanishes away, So he who goes down to Sheol shall come up no more.

Tailo: Hiah-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng, I kóng, ' Guá beh khì ê só͘-tsāi, lín bē-tàng khì. ', kám kóng I beh khì tsū-sat?
English: The Jews therefore said, Will he kill himself, that he says, Where I am going, you can't come?'

Tailo: I-é-su gia̍h thâu khuàⁿ-tio̍h hó-gia̍h lâng kā in ê hiàn-kim hiat lo̍h-khì hōng-hiàn-siuⁿ.
English: He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.

Tailo: Kā I ê miâ só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê îng-kng kui hō͘ Siōng-tsú, tuà lé-mi̍h lâi-kàu I ê bīn-tsîng; tio̍h īng sìng-kiat ê táⁿ-pān kìng-pài Siōng-tsú.
English: Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name: Bring an offering, and come before him: Worship Yahweh in holy array.

Tailo: Si-óng iáu-buē tú-tio̍h seⁿ kiáⁿ ê kan-khó͘ tsiū sing-sán, iáu-buē tsai thàng-thiàⁿ tsiū seⁿ tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she was delivered of a boy.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ tsit-ê tē piàn hi-bî, hō͘ lâng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì; i in-uī sè-li̍k ê kiau-ngō͘ mā ē suah-.khì. I-su-la-el tsiah-ê suaⁿ lóng ē piàn hi-bî, bô lâng king-kuè.
English: I will make the land a desolation and an astonishment; and the pride of her power shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, so that none shall pass through.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē hō͘ Ai-gi̍p ê hái káng ta-.khì; īng tuā hong tī tuā hô ê tíng-bīn ia̍t I ê tshiú, hō͘ hô hun-tsò tshit tiâu, lâng tshīng ê ē tit kuè-.khì.
English: Yahweh will utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his scorching wind he will wave his hand over the River, and will split it into seven streams, and cause men to march over in sandals.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, sim-lāi tsin kan-khó͘, tsiū bîng-kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng ē tshut-bē guá.
English: When Jesus had said this, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, Most assuredly I tell you that one of you will betray me.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī Tàn ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k; sio̍k Su-hâm ê, ū Su-hâm tso̍k. Tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, tsiah-ê sī Tàn ê ta̍k tso̍k.
English: These are the sons of Dan after their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan after their families.

Tailo: Lán lâi kā i bē hō͘ I-si-ma-el lâng, m̄-thang hē tshiú kā i hāi-sí, in-uī i sī lán ê sió-tī, lán ê kut-jio̍k. Hiann-tī thiaⁿ Iô-tah ê uē.
English: Come, and let's sell him to the Ishmaelites, and not let our hand be on him; for he is our brother, our flesh. His brothers listened to him.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tuì Nó͘-ah kóng,
English: God spoke to Noah, saying,

Tailo: I-é-su tuì i kóng, Tshiú-huānn gû-lê iáu-koh it-ti̍t teh ua̍t thâu khuànn āu-bīn ê lâng, bē kham-tit tsò Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ ê tsú-bîn.
English: But Jesus said to him, No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng tsin siū-khì, hō͘-siong gī-lūn kóng, Ná tio̍h án-ne lâi lōng-huì phang-iû?
English: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, Why has this ointment been wasted?

Tailo: Ba-al thiaⁿ-tio̍h Pa-lân lâi, tsiū khì Mô͘-ap siâⁿ kā i gîng-tsiap; tsit-ê siâⁿ sī tī pian-kài ê ki̍k-thâu, tī Al-nông ê piⁿ-á.
English: When Balak heard that Balaam was come, he went out to meet him to the City of Moab, which is on the border of the Arnon, which is in the utmost part of the border.

Tailo: Guá hō͘ i ū ki-huē thang hué-kái, m̄-koh, i bô beh hué-kái, koh kè-sio̍k i ê îm-luān.
English: I gave her time to repent, but she refuses to repent of her sexual immorality.

Tailo: Tû-liáu guá bô mâ-huân lín pang-tsān guá í-guā, guá tuì-thāi lín ū tó tsi̍t hāng pí kî-tha ê kàu-huē khah bô kàu-gia̍h? Tshiánn lín guân-liōng guá Bô kong-tō ê só͘-tsāi.
English: For what is there in which you were made inferior to the rest of the assemblies, unless it is that I myself was not a burden to you? Forgive me this wrong.

Tailo: Koh tī huē-tn̂g lāi ài tsē kuân uī, tī iàn-si̍k tsē tuā-uī.
English: and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts:

Tailo: Kuè sann nî, Si-mí ê nn̄g-ê lô͘-po̍k tsáu kàu Gat ông Má-kah ê kiáⁿ A-ki-si hia. Ū lâng kā Si-mí kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tī Gat.
English: It happened at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. They told Shimei, saying, Behold, your servants are in Gath.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín tio̍h tshî-siú lín só͘-ū ê, it-ti̍t kàu guá tsài-lîm.
English: Nevertheless, hold firmly that which you have, until I come.

Tailo: Lí tsìng-tsoh, tē bô beh tshut lông-sán-bu̍t hō͘ lí, lí tio̍h sì-kè tsáu, phiau-liû tē-tsiūⁿ.
English: From now on, when you till the ground, it won't yield its strength to you. You shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth.

Tailo: Tio̍h kuan-huâi hiah-ê siū kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn kah in tông kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ. Tio̍h kuan-huâi hiah-ê siū gi̍k-thāi ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lín mā teh siū gi̍k-thāi.
English: Remember those who are in bonds, as bound with them; and those who are ill-treated, since you are also in the body.

Tailo: Gî-tióng koh tuì Siōng-tsú kóng, Kiû Lí m̄-thang tuì guá siū-khì, guá koh kóng tsi̍t pái niā-niā, kiû Lí tsún guá koh tsi̍t pái īng iûⁿ-mn̂g tshì-khuàⁿ māi, taⁿ to̍k-to̍k hō͘ iûⁿ-mn̂g ta-ta, thô͘-kha lóng ū lō͘-tsuí.
English: Gideon said to God, Don't let your anger be kindled against me, and I will speak but this once: Please let me make a trial just this once with the fleece; let it now be dry only on the fleece, and on all the ground let there be dew.

Tailo: In-uī lí tshiúⁿ-kiap tsin tsē kok, lia̍t kok tiong só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng mā ē kā lí tshiúⁿ-kiap; sī in-uī lí thâi lâng lâu hueh, tuì kíng lāi kah siâⁿ-tshī í-ki̍p tuà tī kî-tiong ê lâng só͘ kiâⁿ kiông-pō ê iân-kò͘.
English: Because you have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples will plunder you, because of men's blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell in it.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōng-tè tuì tuā hong ê tiong-kan ìn Io-buh kóng:
English: Then Yahweh answered Job out of the whirlwind,

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, tuì lia̍t kok bān-tso̍k tiong ē ū tsa̍p lâng khînn tsi̍t-ê Iô-tah lâng ê saⁿ-á-ki, khînn i, kóng, ' Guán beh kah lín tsò-hué khì, in-uī guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū Siōng-tsú kah lín tông-tsāi. '
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: In those days, ten men will take hold, out of all the languages of the nations, they will take hold of the skirt of him who is a Jew, saying, We will go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.'

Tailo: A-lâm ông kong-kik kàu i hia, E-lí-siah kî-tó kóng, Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí phah tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ in tsheⁿ-mê. I tsiū phah hō͘ in tsheⁿ-mê, tsiàu E-lí-siah ê uē.
English: When they came down to him, Elisha prayed to Yahweh, and said, Please smite this people with blindness. He struck them with blindness according to the word of Elisha.

Tailo: Bîn-á-tsài tsit sî, Guá ē tshe tsi̍t-ê lâng tuì Biān-iá-mín tē lâi-kàu lí tsia, lí tio̍h kā i buah iû tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê thâu. I ē kiù Guá ê tsú-bîn thuat-lī Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tshiú; in-uī Guá ê tsú-bîn ai-kiû ê siann ū thàu kàu Guá tsia, Guá beh khuàⁿ-kò͘ in.
English: Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man out of the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him to be prince over my people Israel; and he shall save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked on my people, because their cry is come to me.

Tailo: Guá í-king tuì tîn-ai ê tiong-kan kā lí kí-khí, siat-li̍p lí tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê kun-ông, lí kìng-jiân kiânn Ia-lô-ba-am ê lō͘, hō͘ Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng huān tsuē, tuì in ê tsuē lâi kik Guá siū-khì.
English: Because I exalted you out of the dust, and made you prince over my people Israel, and you have walked in the way of Jeroboam, and have made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, kàu Guá kah lí kóng-uē ê sî, Guá ē khui lí ê tshuì, lí tsiū tuì in kóng, ' Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng.' Ài thiaⁿ ê lâi thiaⁿ, m̄-thiaⁿ ê kì-tsāi i mài thiaⁿ; in-uī in sī puē-gi̍k ê ke. '
English: But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall tell them, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: He who hears, let him hear; and he who forbears, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious house.

Tailo: Ké hó ê lâng, sing kā lí ka-kī ba̍k-tsiu lāi ê tshâ-kho͘ the̍h tshut-.lâi, tsiah ē-tàng khuànn tshing-tshó, thang kā lí hiann-tī ba̍k-tsiu lāi ê tsháu-á-iù the̍h tshut-.lâi.
English: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother's eye.

Tailo: E-hu-laim tsi-tso̍k ê tuā ióng-sū tī pún tso̍k tshut-miâ ê, ū nn̄g-bān khòng peh-pah lâng.
English: Of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers' houses.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú phah thong guá ê hīⁿ-khang; guá bô uî-puē, mā bô thè-āu.
English: The Lord Yahweh has opened my ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away backward.

Tailo: Guá tsiâⁿ-tsò guá ê jîn-bîn ê tshiò-pièⁿ; in kui ji̍t īng guá tsò kua-khik.
English: I am become a derision to all my people, and their song all the day.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h i thî-khàu ê ji̍t kuè liáu-āu, Iô-sé-huh tuì Huâ-láu tshù lāi ê lâng kóng, Guá nā tī lín ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, tshiánn lín thong-ti Huâ-láu, kā i kóng,
English: When the days of weeping for him were past, Joseph spoke to the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found favor in your eyes, please speak in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,

Tailo: Sio̍k Bik-bai ê kiáⁿ-sun, ū U-thài kah Tsap-put kah in tsò-hué lâi ê, ū tsa-po͘ ting tshit-tsa̍p lâng.
English: Of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud; and with them seventy males.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì hit tiong-kan tshuā lín tshut-.khì, kau tī guā-pang lâng ê tshiú, koh beh tī lín tiong-kan kiânn sím-phuàⁿ.
English: I will bring you forth out of the midst of it, and deliver you into the hands of strangers, and will execute judgments among you.

Tailo: Guān guá ê hong-hiòng tiāⁿ-tio̍h, lâi tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-lē.
English: Oh that my ways were steadfast To obey your statutes!

Tailo: Siōng-tè thâi in ê sî, in tsiah lâi kiû I; in ua̍t tò-tńg pik-tshiat kiû Siōng-tè.
English: When he killed them, then they inquired after him. They returned and sought God earnestly.

Tailo: I puàⁿ-mê khí-.lâi, thàn lí ê lú-pī teh khùn, tuì guá ê sin piⁿ kā guá ê gín-á phō-.khì, hē tī i ê hing tsîng, kā i ê sí gín-á hē tī guá ê hing tsîng.
English: She arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while your handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.

Tailo: Ná-la̍h kā i seⁿ A-hu-tsa̍t, He-huel, The-me-nî, Ha-ha-si-tha-lī. Tsiah-ê lóng sī Ná-la̍h ê kiáⁿ.
English: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò nn̄g ki kǹg, īng kim pau khí-.lâi.
English: You shall make poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.

Tailo: Só͘-í, i ing-kai uī-tio̍h pún-sin, tshin-tshiūnn i uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn ê tsuē lâi hiàn tsè.
English: Because of this, he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people, as well as for himself.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Kiàn-nā Guá só͘ bat kā lí kóng ê uē, lóng tio̍h siá tī tsheh-.ni̍h.
English: Thus speaks Yahweh, the God of Israel, saying, Write you all the words that I have spoken to you in a book.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū kui tuā-tīn ê ti tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h teh thó-tsia̍h. Siâ-sîn kiû I-é-su tsún in ji̍p-khì hiah-ê ti ê lāi-bīn. I-é-su ū tsiàu in só͘ kiû ê ín-tsún in.
English: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them to enter into those. He allowed them.

Tailo: I īng sih-nà jia tshiú, bīng-līng i phah-tio̍h tuì-ti̍k.
English: He covers his hands with the lightning, And commands it to strike the mark.

Tailo: Guá in-uī gióng-bōng Lí ê uē tì-kàu ba̍k-tsiu hue, guá kóng, Lí tang-sî beh an-uì guá?
English: My eyes fail for your word. I say, When will you comfort me?

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng sī He-mán ê kiáⁿ, He-mán tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê bi̍k-sī, tī ông ê bīn-tsîng tsò sian-kiàn. Siōng-tsú hing-khí i ê kak, hō͘ He-mán seⁿ tsa̍p-sì ê kiáⁿ, saⁿ-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: All these were the sons of Heman the king's seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

Tailo: Bán phû-tô ê nā kàu lí hia bán, kám bô iáu lâu kuí-lia̍p-á? Tsha̍t-á nā àm-sî lâi, kám m̄-sī sún-huāi kàu buán-ì niā-niā?
English: If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, wouldn't they destroy until they had enough?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Nó͘-ah kóng, Lí kah lí tsuân ke lóng tio̍h ji̍p tuā tsûn, in-uī tī tsit sè-tāi ê tiong-kan, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng sī gī lâng.
English: Yahweh said to Noah, Come with all of your household into the ark, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Siàu-liân lâng Αp-sa-lôm pîng-ána bô? A-hi-mâ-tsu ìn kóng, Io-ap tshe ông ê lô͘-po̍k kah lí ê lô͘-po̍k, hit sî guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h tuā hán-huah, m̄-tsai sī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì.
English: The king said, Is it well with the young man Absalom? Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king's servant, even me your servant, I saw a great tumult, but I don't know what it was.

Tailo: Āu-lâi-kàu hioh mê ê só͘-tsāi, khui guán ê pò͘-tē, siūnn bē kàu guán ta̍k lâng ê gîn tsiok-sò͘ iû-guân tī ta̍k lâng ê pò͘-tē kháu, taⁿ guán ū koh tuà-.lâi.
English: When we came to the lodging place, we opened our sacks, and behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight. We have brought it back in our hand.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, hō͘ Siōng-tè sià tsuē tńg-khì tshù-.ni̍h ê, sī tsit-ê thiu-suè ê lâng, m̄-sī hit-ê Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, in-uī kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng it-tīng ē siū kàng kē; khiam-pi ê lâng ē siū thê-ko.
English: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí tuì Se-il tshut, tuì E-tóm tē kiâⁿ lâi. Hit sî, tē tín-tāng, thiⁿ teh tih, hûn mā tih tsuí.
English: Yahweh, when you went forth out of Seir, When you marched out of the field of Edom, The earth trembled, the sky also dropped, Yes, the clouds dropped water.

Tailo: Siat-sú Lí ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng, in-uī tik-tsuē Lí tsiah thâi-su tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng, in nā kui-ǹg Lí, jīn Lí ê miâ, koh tī tsit king tiān kî-tó ǹg Lí khún-kiû,
English: If your people Israel be struck down before the enemy, because they have sinned against you, and shall turn again and confess your name, and pray and make supplication before you in this house;

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì tsuâ kóng, Hn̂g lāi tshiū-.ni̍h ê kué-tsí guán thang tsia̍h,
English: The woman said to the serpent, Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat,

Tailo: Lín Tio̍h tshe lín tiong-kan tsi̍t-ê lâng khì tshuā lín ê sió-tī lâi. Lín tsiah-ê lóng tio̍h kuainn tī tsia, thang tsìng-bîng lín ê uē, khuànn lín ū sîng-si̍t á-bô; nā bô, guá kí Huâ-láu ê sèⁿ-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, lín it-tīng sī tsing-thàm.
English: Send one of you, and let him get your brother, and you shall be bound, that your words may be tested, whether there is truth in you, or else by the life of Pharaoh surely you are spies.

Tailo: In-uī i ài-hō͘ lán Iô-tá-iah lâng, koh pún-sin uī lán khí huē-tn̂g.
English: for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tsiū tshe tsi̍t-ê sù-tsiá ji̍p-khì A-siul ông ê iâⁿ tiong, kā hiah-ê tuā lîng-li̍k ê ióng-sū, í-ki̍p hiah-ê siú-líng kun-tiúⁿ tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-tiāu. A-siul ông muá-bīn kiàn-siàu tńg-khì pún-kok, ji̍p-khì i ê sîn-bîng ê biō lāi, ū i tshin-seⁿ ê kiáⁿ tī hia īng to kā i thâi-sí.
English: Yahweh sent an angel, who cut off all the mighty men of valor, and the leaders and captains, in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned with shame of face to his own land. When he was come into the house of his god, those who came forth from his own bowels killed him there with the sword.

Tailo: Tī tuâⁿ tíng ê hué tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ to̍h, m̄-thang hua.
English: Fire shall be kept burning on the altar continually; it shall not go out.

Tailo: tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú tī I-su-la-el ê thâu-tsîng só͘ kuáⁿ-tshut ê guā-pang lâng kah I-su-la-el lia̍t ông só͘ siat ê kui-lē.
English: and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Yahweh cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they made.

Tailo: In-uī in tuì siōng sè kàu siōng tuā ê lóng it-bī tham-sim, tuì sian-ti kàu tsè-si lóng kiânn kan-tsà.
English: For from the least of them even to the greatest of them everyone is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even to the priest everyone deals falsely.

Tailo: koh kong-kik Tal-si-sih só͘-ū ê tsûn-tsiah kah só͘-ū thang ì-ài ê suí mi̍h.
English: For all the ships of Tarshish, And for all pleasant imagery.

Tailo: Hiah-ê hū-jîn-lâng lī-khui bōng tsiū ti̍t-ti̍t tsáu, in-uī in kiaⁿ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah suah gāng-.khì. In mā bô kā lâng kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, in-uī in tsin kiaⁿ.
English: They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú in-uī I ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê iân-kò͘, m̄-kam bia̍t Iô-tah, tsiàu I só͘ ìng-ín Ta-bi̍t ê uē, íng-uán siúⁿ-sù tsi̍t pha ting hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: However Yahweh would not destroy Judah, for David his servant's sake, as he promised him to give to him a lamp for his children always.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, bô lī-khui Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê tsuē, to̍h-sī hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē ê.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn't depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: E-lí-siah kóng, Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī guá khiā tī I ê bīn-tsîng ê, lâi tsiù-tsuā, guá it-tīng m̄ siu. Ná-mān kiông-pik i siu, m̄-koh i tsua̍t-tuì m̄ siu.
English: But he said, As Yahweh lives, before whom I stand, I will receive none. He urged him to take it; but he refused.

Tailo: Phah tâng sai-hū A-li̍k-san-toh kā guá hāi kah tsin tshám, Tsú ē tsiàu i ê só͘ tsò lâi kā i pò-ìng.
English: Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his works,

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Iô-tá-iah lâng siàn-tōng kìng-khiân tsun-kuì ê hū-jîn-lâng kah siâⁿ lāi ê thâu-lâng lâi pik-hāi Páu-lô kah Ba-ná-ba, kā in kuáⁿ-tshut hit só͘-tsāi.
English: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders.

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong-kan ū Sa-lū, Sa-lū sī Me-siu-lám ê kiáⁿ, Me-siu-lám sī Ho͘-ta-iah ê kiáⁿ, Ho͘-ta-iah sī Ha-se-nu-ah ê kiáⁿ.
English: Of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, M̄-koh, taⁿ ū tsîⁿ-tē ê tio̍h tuà-.khì, ū hîng-lí tē ê mā tio̍h tuà-.khì; bô to ê lâng, tio̍h bē i ê guā-saⁿ, khì bé to lâi tuà-.khì.
English: Then he said to them, But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.

Tailo: Tuì Lí tit-tio̍h khuì-la̍t ê lâng tsin ū hok-khì! In tsûn-sim ì-hiòng Si-óng ê tuā lō͘.
English: Blessed are those whose strength is in you; Who have set their hearts on a pilgrimage.

Tailo: Kè-sio̍k ta̍k ji̍t tī sìng-tiān lāi o-ló Siōng-tè.
English: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

Tailo: Tī Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng, tsē tī in tsō-uī ê jī-tsa̍p sì ê tiúⁿ-ló, bīn phak lo̍h-khì kìng-pài Siōng-tè,
English: The twenty-four elders, who sit on their thrones before God's throne, fell on their faces and worshiped God,

Tailo: Lâng nā kā lî, á-.sī gû, á-.sī iûⁿ, á-.sī pa̍t tsióng tsing-seⁿ, kau-tài tshù-piⁿ kò͘-siú, tsing-seⁿ kiám-tshái sí, á-.sī siū-siong, á-.sī hō͘ lâng thau khan-.khì, bô lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h,
English: If a man delivers to his neighbor a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any animal to keep, and it dies or is injured, or driven away, no man seeing it;

Tailo: Só͘-í, m̄-thang uī-tio̍h bîn-á-tsài lâi tshau-huân. Bîn-á-tsài ê tāi-tsì bîn-á-tsài tsiah lâi tshau-huân; tsi̍t ji̍t ê kan-khó͘ tsi̍t ji̍t tng.
English: Therefore don't be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day's own evil is sufficient.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Tî-mó͘-theh ê tsò lâng lín lóng tsai, i tshin-tshiūnn kiáⁿ tuì lāu-pē kah guá tsò-hué lô-khó͘ lâi hing-khí hok-im.
English: But you know the proof of him, that, as a child serves a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the Good News.

Tailo: Hu-sia lâi-kàu Αp-sa-lôm hia, Αp-sa-lôm kā i kóng, A-hi-to-huel kóng án-ne, lán kám tio̍h tsiàu i ê uē kiânn? Nā bô, lí tsiū tio̍h kóng!
English: When Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spoke to him, saying, Ahithophel has spoken after this manner: shall we do after his saying? if not, speak up.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú tsiàu I só͘ kóng ê, hō͘ guá ua̍h-.leh í-king sì-tsa̍p-gō͘ nî, to̍h-sī tuì I-su-la-el lâng kiânn tī khòng-iá, Siōng-tsú kā Mô͘-se kóng tsiah-ê uē ê sî. Lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ guá peh tsa̍p-gō͘ huè à,
English: Now, behold, Yahweh has kept me alive, as he spoke, these forty-five years, from the time that Yahweh spoke this word to Moses, while Israel walked in the wilderness: and now, behold, I am this day eighty-five years old.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú in-uī A-bú-lâm ê bó͘ Sa-lái ê iân-kò͘, kàng tuā tsai-hō tī Huâ-láu kah i tsuân ke.
English: Yahweh plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram's wife.

Tailo: Lín mā tio̍h thè guán kî-tó lâi pang-tsān guán. Án-ne, ū tsin tsē lâng uī guán kî-tó hō͘ guán bông-un, mā ū tsin tsē lâng uī-tio̍h guán tit-tio̍h tsiok-hok lâi kám-siā Siōng-tè.
English: you also helping together on our behalf by your supplication; that, for the gift bestowed on us by means of many, thanks may be given by many persons on your behalf.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lâi kong-kik i ê ē tshut-tsāi ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kiâⁿ, bô lâng tī i ê bīn-tsîng khiā ē tiâu. I ē khiā tī îng-iāu ê tē, i ê tshiú kiânn tsâu-bia̍t.
English: But he who comes against him shall do according to his own will, and none shall stand before him; and he shall stand in the glorious land, and in his hand shall be destruction.

Tailo: Lín ná ē kóng, guán sī tì-huī ê lâng, Siōng-tsú ê lu̍t-huat kám ū tī guán tiong-kan? Lí khuàⁿ, king-ha̍k kàu-su bú-lāng pit-ba̍k, hō͘ i piàn-tsò ké ê.
English: How do you say, We are wise, and the law of Yahweh is with us? But, behold, the false pen of the scribes has worked falsely.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tsiūⁿ-kàu Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng ê tâng-tuâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī huē-bō͘ hia, hiàn tsi̍t tshing tsiah ê tsing-seⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn tsò sio-tsè.
English: Solomon went up there to the brazen altar before Yahweh, which was at the tent of meeting, and offered one thousand burnt offerings on it.

Tailo: Kò͘-mn̂g ê sī Sia-lúm, Ak-kup, Tal-móng, A-hi-mān kah in ê hiann-tī, Sia-lúm tsò in ê thâu.
English: The porters: Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brothers (Shallum was the chief),

Tailo: Lín nā kan-taⁿ īng sim-sîn kám-siā, hiah-ê huē-tsiòng m̄-tsai lí teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, i ná ē tuì lí ê kám-siā tâng-sim lâi kóng, A-men ?
English: Otherwise if you bless with the spirit, how will he who fills the place of the unlearned say the Amen at your giving of thanks, seeing he doesn't know what you say?

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng ê sim ē tsai ka-kī ê kan-khó͘; i ê huann-hí, guā-lâng mā bô hūn.
English: The heart knows its own bitterness and joy; He will not share these with a stranger.

Tailo: In-uī hit sî tshut-ji̍p ê lâng tsin tsē, liân tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî-kan to bô. I-é-su kā in kóng, Án-ne, lín mā tio̍h kah guá lâi-khì phian-phiah khah bô lâng ê só͘-tsāi sió hioh-khùn tsi̍t ē.
English: He said to them, You come apart into a deserted place, and rest awhile. For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

Tailo: I kóng, Tsú ah, in thâi-sí Lí ê sian-ti, thiah-huí Lí ê tsè-tuâⁿ, tsí ū tshun guá tī-.leh, in mā teh siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā. （ Tsù, LOS 19:10, 14)
English: Lord, they have killed your prophets, they have broken down your altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

Tailo: In-uī ài beh kiù ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā; uī-tio̍h guá kah hok-im lâi sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē kiù-tio̍h sìng-miā.
English: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê pē-bú tio̍h the̍h tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsāi-sik-lí ê pîn-kì tshut-.lâi, tuà kàu i pún siâⁿ mn̂g ê tiúⁿ-ló hia.
English: then shall the father of the young lady, and her mother, take and bring forth the tokens of the young lady's virginity to the elders of the city in the gate;

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, guá — Ta-ni-el hun-bê, phuà-pēⁿ kuí-nā ji̍t, jiân-āu khí-lâi pān-lí ông ê sū-bū. Guá in-uī tsit-ê ī-siōng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, bô lâng ē liáu-kái kî-tiong ê ì-sù.
English: I, Daniel, fainted, and was sick certain days; then I rose up, and did the king's business: and I wondered at the vision, but none understood it.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-sái tshin-tshiūnn khe tsuí teh lâu, in-uī lâng bô tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: Streams of tears run down my eyes, Because they don't observe your law. TZADI

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì guá kóng, Lí tio̍h koh khì thiàⁿ hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, i sī îm-hū, mā sī i siong-hó ê lâng só͘ thiàⁿ ê, tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tsú thiàⁿ I-su-la-el lâng, tsóng-.sī, in phian-ǹg pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, ì-ài phû-tô-kuaⁿ piáⁿ.
English: Yahweh said to me, Go again, love a woman loved by another, and an adulteress, even as Yahweh loves the children of Israel, though they turn to other gods, and love cakes of raisins.

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, guá tī Iô-tah khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng tī An-hioh-ji̍t ta̍h tsiú-khut, puaⁿ tiū-khún, koh hō͘ lî-á tsài, koh īng tsiú, phû-tô, bû-hua-kó kah ta̍k tsióng ê ka-tann, tī An-hioh-ji̍t taⁿ ji̍p-khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm; guá tsiū tī in bē tsia̍h-mi̍h hit ji̍t, kā in tsik-pī.
English: In those days saw I in Judah some men treading winepresses on the Sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and lading donkeys therewith; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all manner of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day in which they sold food.

Tailo: Guān îng-kng kui hō͘ Siōng-tè, it-ti̍t kàu íng-íng uán-uán. A-men!
English: to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.

Tailo: Ta-lió-suh ông jī nî káu-gue̍h jī-tsa̍p sì, Siōng-tsú ê uē thok sian-ti Ha-gái kóng:
English: In the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the Word of Yahweh came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

Tailo: Guá tsua̍t-tuì bô tshing lín tsò gī, guá kàu sí mā m̄-sǹg guá tsò bô uân-tsuân.
English: Far be it from me that I should justify you. Until I die I will not put away my integrity from me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú phīⁿ-tio̍h sio-tsè ê phang-bī, sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Guá bô beh koh in-uī lâng ê iân-kò͘ tsiù-tsó͘ tē, in-uī lâng tuì sè-hàn ê sî, sim só͘ siūⁿ ê to̍h-sī pháiⁿ; Guá bô beh koh tsiàu Guá tsit-má só͘ tsò ê, koh-tsài huí-bia̍t kok tsióng ê ua̍h-mi̍h.
English: Yahweh smelled the sweet savor. Yahweh said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake, because the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I ever again strike everything living, as I have done.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, lê-tshân ê ē jiok-tio̍h siu-kuah ê, ta̍h phû-tô ê ē jiok-tio̍h iā tsíng ê. Tuā suaⁿ ē tih tiⁿ-tsiú, sió suaⁿ ē lâu ling.
English: Behold, the days come, says Yahweh, That the plowman shall overtake the reaper, And the one treading grapes him who sows seed; And sweet wine will drip from the mountains, And flow from the hills.

Tailo: Nā ū hó-gia̍h lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ū khiàm-khueh, m̄-koh, bô tông-tsîng liân-bín ê sim, ná ē-tàng kóng i thiàⁿ Siōng-tè?
English: But whoever has the world's goods, and sees his brother in need, and closes his heart of compassion against him, how does the love of God remain in him?

Tailo: Guān tsō in kah uá-khò in ê lâng, lóng ē kah in kāng-khuán.
English: Those who make them will be like them; Yes, everyone who trusts in them.

Tailo: Siâ-sîn lī-khui hū-sin ê lâng, tsiū tī bô tsuí ê tē-khu beh tshuē tsi̍t-ê hioh-khùn ê só͘-tsāi, m̄-koh, lóng tshuē bô.
English: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn't find it.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê lâng suî-jiân pháiⁿ, iáu-koh ē-hiáu īng hó mi̍h hō͘ lín ê kiáⁿ-jî, hô-hòng lín tī thinn-tíng ê Thiⁿ-pē, I kám bē īng Sìng Sîn lâi hō͘ tuì I khún-kiû ê lâng?
English: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?

Tailo: Āu-lâi, kah i tsò-hué khǹg tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān king-kuè la̍k nî; A-tha-lí-iah kuán-lí hit-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: He was with her hid in the house of Yahweh six years. Athaliah reigned over the land.

Tailo: He-lo̍t tsiū kong-khai tsiù-tsuā, tap-ìng hit-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á bô-lūn kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h lóng beh hō͘ i.
English: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatever she should ask.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, I it-tīng sù-hok tī lí ê bí-niûⁿ kah lí ê tsuí, Guá koh ē tû-khì lín tiong-kan ê phuà-pēⁿ.
English: You shall serve Yahweh your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take sickness away from your midst.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, jîn-bîn tsiū tī tē-tshit ji̍t an-hioh.
English: So the people rested on the seventh day.

Tailo: Nā hué-pan tī i ê phuê-hu sī pe̍h ê, khuán-sit bô tshim-ji̍p tī phuê-hu lāi, i ê mn̂g mā bô piàn-pe̍h, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h kā ū tsìng-thâu ê lâng kuaiⁿ-kìm tshit ji̍t.
English: If the bright spot is white in the skin of his body, and the appearance of it isn't deeper than the skin, and the hair of it hasn't turned white, then the priest shall isolate the infected person for seven days.

Tailo: M̄-thang lō͘-hiān lí ê lāu-bú ê ē-sin, lâi lîng-jio̍k lí ê lāu-pē. I sī lí ê lāu-bú, m̄-thang lō͘-hiān i ê ē-sin.
English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father, nor the nakedness of your mother: she is your mother. You shall not uncover her nakedness.

Tailo: Guá ê sèⁿ-miā tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tú-tio̍h guî-hiám, guá iáu-koh bô bē kì-tit Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: My soul is continually in my hand, Yet I won't forget your law.

Tailo: sio̍k Tse-bú-lông ê, ū Tse-lông ê kiáⁿ E-lí-ap;
English: Of Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Lí sī siáⁿ lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ? Tshiánn kā guá kóng, lín lāu-pē ê ke ū só͘-tsāi thang hō͘ guán hioh á-bô?
English: and said, Whose daughter are you? Please tell me. Is there room in your father's house for us to lodge in?

Tailo: Lán kám thang kóng, ' Tuì lâng '? (In iū koh kiaⁿ kûn-tsiòng, in-uī tsìng lâng lóng lia̍h Iô-há-neh tsò sian-ti. )
English: If we should say, From men'they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet.

Tailo: Io-ná-than tsiū kah Ta-bi̍t ê ke kiat iok, kóng, Guān Siōng-tsú tuì Ta-bi̍t tsiah-ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú lâi thó i.
English: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, Yahweh will require it at the hand of David's enemies.

Tailo: I-sá-iah án-ne kóng sī in-uī i ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su ê îng-kng, tsiah kóng kuan-hē I ê tāi-tsì.
English: Isaiah said these things when he saw his glory, and spoke of him.

Tailo: Tsháu-me̍h tsia̍h-uân hit-ê kíng lāi tsheⁿ-tshuì ê mi̍h, guá tsiū kóng, Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí sià-bián Lí ê tsú-bîn! Iâ-kop ná khiā ē tiâu? In-uī i sī bî-sè.
English: It happened that, when they made an end of eating the grass of the land, then I said, Lord Yahweh, forgive, I beg you! How could Jacob stand? For he is small.

Tailo: Tuì Tel-me-lah, Tel-hal-sah, Ke-lup, A-tóng, Im-mel khí-.lâi ê, bē-tàng tsìng-bîng in ê tsong-tso̍k sè-hē, tsin-tsiàⁿ sī I-su-la-el lâng á m̄-sī.
English: These were those who went up from Tel Melah, Tel Harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer; but they could not show their fathers' houses, nor their seed, whether they were of Israel:

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-kóng lí ê sim-lāi ū hit-ê Siōng-tè ê sîn-lîng, jî-tshiánn lí ū kng-bîng, tshong-bîng kah hó ê tì-huī.
English: I have heard of you, that the spirit of the gods is in you, and that light and understanding and excellent wisdom are found in you.

Tailo: hit-ê tē-kài koh thàng-kàu Ik-lóng piⁿ-á ê pak pîng, hit-ê tē-kài suà-kàu Si-kí-lûn, king-kuè kàu Ba-la̍h suaⁿ, koh thàng-kàu Ngá-pí-liap, tsit-ê tē-kài kàu hái uî-tsí.
English: and the border went out to the side of Ekron northward; and the border extended to Shikkeron, and passed along to Mount Baalah, and went out at Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.

Tailo: Lí nā thiaⁿ Guá it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, kiânn Guá ê tō-lō͘, tsò Guá khuàⁿ-tsò tsìng-ti̍t ê tāi-tsì, siú Guá ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, tshin-tshiūnn Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê só͘ tsò, Guá tsiū kah lí tông-tsāi, kā lí kiàn-li̍p kian-kò͘ ê ke, tshin-tshiūnn Guá kā Ta-bi̍t kiàn-li̍p ê, koh beh kā I-su-la-el kau hō͘ lí.
English: It shall be, if you will listen to all that I command you, and will walk in my ways, and do that which is right in my eyes, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with you, and will build you a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel to you.

Tailo: King-kuè hiah-ê sî, lâng lâi-kàu ngó͘-kok tui, siūⁿ beh tit-tio̍h jī-tsa̍p táu, tsí ū tsa̍p táu. Ū lâng lâi-kàu tsiú-khut, siūⁿ beh tit-tio̍h gō͘-tsa̍p àng, tsí ū tit-tio̍h jī-tsa̍p àng.
English: Through all that time, when one came to a heap of twenty measures, there were only ten. When one came to the wine vat to draw out fifty, there were only twenty.

Tailo: Ū lîng-li̍k ê lâng tit-tio̍h thó͘-tē; thé-biān ê lâng tiàm tī hit tiong-kan.
English: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth. The honorable man, he lived in it.

Tailo: Lí nā tī lō͘-.ni̍h tú-tio̍h tsiáu-siū, á-.sī tī tshiū-.ni̍h, á-.sī tī tē-.ni̍h, lāi-bīn ū tsiáu-á-kiáⁿ á-.sī tsiáu-nn̄g, tsiáu-bó àⁿ tsiáu-kiáⁿ á-.sī pū nn̄g, lí m̄-thang lia̍h tsiáu-kiáⁿ suà lia̍h tsiáu-bó.
English: If a bird's nest chance to be before you in the way, in any tree or on the ground, with young ones or eggs, and the hen sitting on the young, or on the eggs, you shall not take the hen with the young:

Tailo: Lí kám m̄-tsai? Lí kám bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h? Íng-uán tsûn-tsāi ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú, tshòng-tsō tē-ki̍k ê, I bô ià, mā bô siān; I ê tì-huī bô thang tshik-to̍k.
English: Haven't you known? Haven't you heard? The everlasting God, Yahweh, The Creator of the ends of the earth, doesn't faint. He isn't weary. His understanding is unsearchable.

Tailo: Kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng tsō-tsok sǹg bē-liáu ê pe̍h-tsha̍t uē lâi kong-kik guá, tsóng-.sī, guá beh tsuan-sim tsun-siú Lí ê kà-sī.
English: The proud have smeared a lie upon me. With my whole heart, I will keep your precepts.

Tailo: Ū tsai-hō à, hiah-ê siat-li̍p put-gī ê lu̍t-lē, kì-tsài kan-tsà ê phuàⁿ-sû ê lâng.
English: Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers who write oppressive decrees;

Tailo: Pa-lân tsiū thê-khí i ê kua, kóng: Ba-al, khí-lâi thiaⁿ; Tsip-pol ê kiáⁿ, lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ guá.
English: He took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; Listen to me, you son of Zippor:

Tailo: Huâ-láu ê kun-ping í-king tuì Ai-gi̍p tshut-.lâi, hiah-ê uî-khùn Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê Kal-tí-ah lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h in ê hong-siaⁿ, tsiū thiat iâⁿ lī-khui Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: Pharaoh's army was come forth out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they broke up from Jerusalem.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kóng, A-ná-ni-a, lí án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ Sa-tán tshiong-muá lí ê sim lâi khi-phiàn Sìng Sîn, kā bē hn̂g ê tsînn thau-thau-á lâu tsi̍t-pō͘-hūn khí-.lâi?
English: But Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lín kìm-tsia̍h sī beh sio-tseⁿ, sio uan-ke, īng hiong-ok ê kûn-thâu-bú phah lâng. Lín kin-á-ji̍t kìm-tsia̍h, bē-tàng hō͘ lín ê siann thuân kàu tíng-bīn.
English: Behold, you fast for strife and contention, and to strike with the fist of wickedness: you don't fast this day so as to make your voice to be heard on high.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng án-ne sī teh tshì-thàm Hui-li̍p-pò͘, in-uī I-é-su ka-kī tsai teh beh tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: This he said to test him, for he himself knew what he would do.

Tailo: M̄-thang tī Gat pò lâng tsai, lóng m̄-thang thî-khàu; guá tī Bia̍t-liah-hu-lah kō tī tîn-ai ê tiong-kan.
English: Don't tell it in Gath, Don't weep at all. At Beth Ophrah I have rolled myself in the dust.

Tailo: Tsuân huē-tsiòng gī-lūn beh koh siú tseh tshit kang. Tsiū án-ne, huann-hí koh siú tseh tshit kang.
English: The whole assembly took counsel to keep other seven days; and they kept other seven days with gladness.

Tailo: Kim-sè ê bua̍t-ji̍t mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne; thiⁿ-sài beh tshut-.lâi, tuì gī lâng ê tiong-kan kā tsuē-jîn hun-pia̍t tshut-.lâi,
English: So will it be in the end of the world. The angels will come forth, and separate the wicked from among the righteous,

Tailo: M̄-koh, uàn-hūn hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ê lâng, sī ua̍h tī o͘-àm tiong; i tī o͘-àm tiong teh sing-ua̍h, m̄-tsai ka-kī ê hong-hiòng, in-uī tsit-ê o͘-àm hō͘ i ê ba̍k-tsiu tsheⁿ-mê.
English: But he who hates his brother is in the darkness, and walks in the darkness, and doesn't know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.

Tailo: in-uī Siōng-tsú ê uē án-ne kā guá kóng, ' Lí tī hia m̄-thang tsia̍h piáⁿ, m̄-thang lim tsuí, mā m̄-thang tuì lí khì ê lō͘ tńg-.lâi. '
English: for it was said to me by the word of Yahweh, You shall eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that you came.

Tailo: Me-la-lih ê kiáⁿ, tsiàu in ê ke sī Mak-lī, Mu-sih. Tsiah-ê tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k sī Lē-bī lâng ê ke-kháu.
English: The sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers' houses.

Tailo: Ai siânn kah Be-thel siâⁿ, só͘-ū ê lâng lóng tshut-khì jiok I-su-la-el lâng; siâⁿ mn̂g pàng khui-khui, khì jiok I-su-la-el lâng.
English: There was not a man left in Ai or Beth El, who didn't go out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued after Israel.

Tailo: Pak-bīn mā tio̍h ū uî, tn̂g tsi̍t pah tiú, i ê thiāu ū jī-tsa̍p ki, tâng-khū jī-tsa̍p-ê. Thiāu ê kau kah huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ lóng tio̍h īng gîn tsò.
English: Likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, and the pillars of it twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k lín tio̍h kìng-uì Siōng-tsú, sîng-sim si̍t-ì ho̍k-sāi I, in-uī lín tio̍h ē kì-tit I uī lín só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì ū guā tuā.
English: Only fear Yahweh, and serve him in truth with all your heart; for consider how great things he has done for you.

Tailo: In-uī tse sī guá ê hueh, sī li̍p-iok ê hueh, uī-tio̍h tsin tsē lâng lâi lâu tshut ê, beh hō͘ in ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián.
English: for this is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many for the remission of sins.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kā tsiah-ê uē tuì I-su-la-el ê kûn-tsiòng kóng, jîn-bîn tsiū tsin iu-būn.
English: Moses told these words to all the children of Israel: and the people mourned greatly.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsiù-tsó͘ ē lîm-kàu tī lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiâⁿ-tsò sîn-jiah kî-sū, ti̍t-kàu íng-uán.
English: and they shall be on you for a sign and for a wonder, and on your seed forever.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ iáu teh siūⁿ tsit-ê ī-siōng ê sî, Sìng Sîn kā i kóng, Ū saⁿ-ê lâng lâi beh tshuē lí.
English: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, Behold, three men seek you.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, kā I kau hō͘ guā-pang lâng, koh kā I hì-lāng, piⁿ-phah, tìng si̍p-jī-kè, tē-saⁿ ji̍t Siōng-tè ē hō͘ I koh-ua̍h.
English: and will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, to scourge, and to crucify; and the third day he will be raised up.

Tailo: Guá beh pàng hué tī Ai-gi̍p, Sìn ē tú-tio̍h tuā thòng-khó͘; Nô͘ ē tú-tio̍h kong-phuà, Nó͘-hu ē tng-thâu pe̍h-ji̍t tú-tio̍h tuì-ti̍k.
English: I will set a fire in Egypt: Sin shall be in great anguish, and No shall be broken up; and Memphis shall have adversaries in the daytime.

Tailo: I ê lāu-bú ìn kóng, M̄-thang án-ne, tio̍h kā i hō-tsò Iô-há-neh.
English: His mother answered, Not so; but he will be called John.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī ua̍h-tsuí tíng, huî-khì ê lāi-bīn thâi hit nn̄g tsiah tsiáu ê tsi̍t tsiah.
English: He shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.

Tailo: In tsiū tshuā i lâi I-é-su hia. Hit-ê kuí tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su, tsiū suî-sî hō͘ hit-ê gín-á tuā thiu-tshuah, kā i siak lo̍h-khì thô͘-kha, hō͘ i liàn-lâi liàn-khì koh lâu-nuā.
English: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

Tailo: I ē uī Guá ê miâ khí tiān, Guá ē kian-kò͘ i ê kok-uī, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: He shall build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.

Tailo: Hué tī in ê thâu-tsîng teh to̍h, hué-iām tī in ê āu-bīn teh sio. In buē kàu ê tē tshin-tshiūnn E-tiân hn̂g; in kuè-liáu ê tē, tsiâⁿ-tsò pha-hng ê khòng-iá; bô tsi̍t hāng siám-phiah ē lī.
