English: A fire devours before them, And behind them, a flame burns. The land is as the garden of Eden before them, And behind them, a desolate wilderness. Yes, and no one has escaped them.

Tailo: Hiah-ê gia̍h kiong-tsìnn ê Ke-tal ióng-sū só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê gia̍h-sò͘ tsió-tsió. In-uī tse sī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè kóng ê.
English: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, will be few; for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken it.

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ ê kun-ông kah tuà tī sè-kan ê jîn-bîn, lóng m̄-sìn tuì-ti̍k kah siû-ti̍k ē tshim-ji̍p Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê siâⁿ mn̂g.
English: The kings of the earth didn't believe, neither all the inhabitants of the world, That the adversary and the enemy would enter into the gates of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Mô͘-se tsē-.leh sím-phuàⁿ jîn-bîn; jîn-bîn tuì tsá-khí kàu ê-hng, lóng khiā uá-lâi Mô͘-se ê sin piⁿ.
English: It happened on the next day, that Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from the morning to the evening.

Tailo: Sè-î kiânn kan-îm lâi puē-puān i ê tiōng-hu, lī-khui i tò tńg-khì Iô-tah Bia̍t-lé-hèm, kàu lāu-pē ê ke, tuà hia sì gue̍h-ji̍t.
English: His concubine played the prostitute against him, and went away from him to her father's house to Bethlehem Judah, and was there the space of four months.

Tailo: In īng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē tāi-thè Siōng-tè ê tsin-lí, in ho̍k-sāi siū-tsō-bu̍t, bô kìng-pài hit uī tsō mi̍h ê Tsú, I tsiah sī ing-kai íng-uán siū o-ló ê. A-men!
English: who exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

Tailo: Lí nā tshing-khì tsìng-ti̍t, I ē uī-tio̍h lí tshénn khí-.lâi, koh hō͘ lí kong-gī ê tshù hing-thong.
English: If you were pure and upright, Surely now he would awaken for you, And make the habitation of your righteousness prosperous.

Tailo: Huān-nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí ê lâng lóng ē tsù-ba̍k khuànn lí, tsù-ì siūⁿ lí, kóng,
English: Those who see you will stare at you. They will ponder you, saying, Is this the man who made the earth to tremble, who shook kingdoms;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Sa-tán kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, i tī lí ê tshiú-thâu, tsóng-.sī, lí tio̍h lâu i ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Yahweh said to Satan, Behold, he is in your hand. Only spare his life.

Tailo: In tsē-toh teh tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî, I-é-su kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, Lín tsiah-ê kah guá tsò-hué tsia̍h ê lâng tiong-kan, ū tsi̍t-ê ē tshut-bē guá.
English: As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, Most assuredly I tell you, one of you will betray mehe who eats with me.

Tailo: Ông-tshin kah kuì-tso̍k, í-ki̍p sè-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ, lóng sī tuì guá lâi tsiáng-kuân.
English: By me princes rule; Nobles, and all the righteous rulers of the earth.

Tailo: Un-hô ê ìn-tap ē hō͘ siū-khì suah; kóng-uē huâiⁿ-pà ē kik-khí siū-khì.
English: A gentle answer turns away wrath, But a harsh word stirs up anger.

Tailo: Guá tsiū beh hō͘ tsit king tshù tshin-tshiūnn Sī-lô, hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò tē-tsiūⁿ bān-kok tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē-pèⁿ. '
English: then will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h iok-kuī tī E-hu-la̍t, guán tī tshiū-nâ ê tshân tshuē-.tio̍h.
English: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah. We found it in the field of Jaar:

Tailo: Guá sí ê sî, lí tio̍h kā guá tuà-tshut Ai-gi̍p, bâi-tsòng tī guá ê lāu-pē kah a-kong bâi-tsòng ê só͘-tsāi. Iô-sé-huh kóng, Guá ē tsiàu lí ê uē khì tsò.
English: but when I sleep with my fathers, you shall carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their burying place. He said, I will do as you have said.

Tailo: I iáu teh kóng ê sî, koh ū tsi̍t-ê lâi, kóng, Siōng-tè ê hué tuì thiⁿ kàng lo̍h-.lâi, sio iûⁿ-kûn kah hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k, lâi kā in siau-bia̍t; tsí ū guá tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu-lī, lâi kā lí pò-kò.
English: While he was still speaking, there also came another, and said, The fire of God has fallen from the sky, and has burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them, and I alone have escaped to tell you.

Tailo: Ha-ta̍t tī Ai-gi̍p thiaⁿ-tio̍h Ta-bi̍t kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn, kun-tiúⁿ Io-ap mā í-king sí. Ha-ta̍t tsiū tuì Huâ-láu kóng, Tshiánn iông-ín guá-.khì, hō͘ guá tńg-khì guá ê pún-kok.
English: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the army was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to my own country.

Tailo: Lí kah lí hiah-ê kiáⁿ, lí hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k, tio̍h kā i tsìng-tsoh tshân-hn̂g, tuà só͘ tshut-sán ê hō͘ lí ê tsú ê kiáⁿ ū mi̍h thang tsia̍h; tsóng-.sī, lí ê tsú-lâng ê kiáⁿ Me-hui-bo-siat ē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī guá ê toh tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: You shall till the land for him, you, and your sons, and your servants; and you shall bring in the fruits, that your master's son may have bread to eat: but Mephibosheth your master's son shall eat bread always at my table. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.

Tailo: In-uī Kit-thê ê tsûn ē lâi kong-kik i, tì-sú i sim iu-būn, tsiū tò tńg-.khì. I koh thòng-hūn sìng iok, tsiàu i ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kiâⁿ; i ē tò tńg-lâi kah khì-sak sìng iok ê lâng tsò-hué kè-bô͘.
English: For ships of Kittim shall come against him; therefore he shall be grieved, and shall return, and have indignation against the holy covenant, and shall do his pleasure: he shall even return, and have regard to those who forsake the holy covenant.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng, Suá-khui hit tè tsio̍h-thâu. Sí-lâng ê á-tsé Mal-tha kā I kóng, Tsú ah, i í-king sí sì ji̍t à, taⁿ it-tīng tsin tshàu.
English: Jesus said, Take away the stone. Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to him, Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā tsiah-ê pue-puâⁿ lāi-bīn ê mi̍h the̍h-lâi tsín-tsè lâng, án-ne, lín ta̍k hāng mi̍h tsiū lóng tshing-khì.
English: But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.

Tailo: In king-kuè ê lō͘ ū huí-bia̍t kah pi-tshám.
English: Destruction and misery are in their ways.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá beh kā tsit-ê siâⁿ só͘-ū ê tsâi-bu̍t kah lô-khó͘ só͘ tit-tio̍h ê kah it-tshè ê pó-puè, í-ki̍p Iô-tah hiah-ê ông ê pó-bu̍t, lóng kau tī in ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú; tuì-ti̍k ē kā in tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, ē kā in lia̍h khí-.lâi, ah in khì-kàu Ba-bú-lông.
English: Moreover I will give all the riches of this city, and all the gains of it, and all the precious things of it, yes, all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies; and they shall make them a prey, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.

Tailo: kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín tio̍h bâi-ho̍k ping lâi kong siâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī siâⁿ āu, m̄-thang lī-khui siâⁿ siuⁿ hn̄g, lóng tio̍h tsún-pī hó-sè.
English: He commanded them, saying, Behold, you shall lie in ambush against the city, behind the city; don't go very far from the city, but be all ready:

Tailo: Guá Páu-lô tshin-tshiú siá tī tsia, guá ē hū-tsik hîng; nā-sī kuan-hē guá kiù lí ê lîng-hûn, guá bô pit-iàu kā lí kóng-khí lí só͘-khiàm guá ê tsè.
English: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self besides).

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Só͘-lô-móng tsē tī Siōng-tsú só͘ siúⁿ-sù ê uī, suà-tsiap i ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t tsò ông, ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì lóng hing-thong, I-su-la-el jîn-bîn mā lóng tsun-thàn i.
English: Then Solomon sat on the throne of Yahweh as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.

Tailo: Í-sak tsiū khì tuà tī Ge-lal.
English: Isaac lived in Gerar.

Tailo: Ê-lám ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsi̍t-tshing nn̄g-pah gō͘-tsa̍p sì lâng.
English: The children of Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k tshut-khì lō͘-.ni̍h, kā só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê bô-lūn hó-pháiⁿ lóng tshiánn lâi. Hun-iàn ê tuā thiaⁿ lâng-kheh tsē kah muá-muá.
English: Those servants went out into the highways, and gathered together as many as they found, both bad and good. The wedding was filled with guests.

Tailo: I mā tio̍h kā hit tsiah iûⁿ-káng kah hit khing bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò siā-un ê tsè, tsè-si mā tio̍h suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè kah kuàn-tiān.
English: He shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to Yahweh, with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest shall offer also its meal offering, and its drink offering.

Tailo: Lí tshe lí ê lô͘-po̍k lâi bú-bān Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá tuà tsin tsē tsiàn-tshia tsiūⁿ-kàu suaⁿ kuân ê só͘-tsāi, kàu Le-ba-nòng ki̍k tshim ê só͘-tsāi; guá beh tshò hit-tsâng kuân-tuā ê pik-hiuⁿ tshâ kah siōng hó ê siông tshiū. Guá beh tsiūⁿ-kàu ki̍k kuân ê só͘-tsāi kah hiah-ê puî tē ê tshiū-nâ.
English: By your servants, have you defied the Lord, and have said, With the multitude of my chariots I have come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon. I will cut down its tall cedars and its choice fir trees. I will enter into its farthest height, the forest of its fruitful field.

Tailo: I-é-su siū hāi liáu-āu, ū īng tsin tsē tsìng-kì hián-bîng I iáu ua̍h-.leh. Tī sì-tsa̍p kang ê tiong-kan, I hián-hiān hō͘ sù-tô͘ khuànn, tuì in kóng-khí Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ ê tāi-tsì.
English: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God's Kingdom.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng sîn-sìng ê lé-gî, lâi kā só͘-ū ê hiann-tī tsí-mē tshíng-an.
English: Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h hit tshit tsiah iûⁿ-á, ta̍k tsiah tio̍h hiàn tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat.
English: and one tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs;

Tailo: A-hi-mo͘t ê kiáⁿ El-ká-nah, El-ká-nah ê kiáⁿ Só-hui, Só-hui ê kiáⁿ Ná-hat;
English: As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ta̍k nî só͘ tit-tio̍h ê kim, kiōng la̍k-pah la̍k-tsa̍p-la̍k tha-lan-t.
English: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred sixty-six talents of gold,

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tī Ka-nân tē só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal kah Nùn ê kiáⁿ Io-siú-ah kah I-su-la-el ta̍k tsi-tso̍k ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, só͘ pun hō͘ in ê, lóng kì tī ē-té:
English: These are the inheritances which the children of Israel took in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed to them,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, nā-sī guá, guá ê kha hiám-hiám-á ta̍h-thu̍t khì, guá ê kha hiám-hiám-á tshū lo̍h-.khì.
English: But as for me, my feet were almost gone. My steps had nearly slipped.

Tailo: Kong-gī ē tsò i ê io-tuà, sìn-si̍t ē tsò i ê sing-khu ê tuà.
English: Righteousness will be the belt of his waist, And faithfulness the belt of his waist.

Tailo: I-sá-iah tshut-.khì, iáu-buē kàu tiong-īⁿ, Siōng-tsú ê uē tsiū lîm-kàu i kóng,
English: It happened, before Isaiah was gone out into the middle part of the city, that the word of Yahweh came to him, saying,

Tailo: Tsiàu tsit-ê tsún-tsik lâi sing-ua̍h ê lâng to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê tsú-bîn, guān pîng-an í-ki̍p liân-bín kah lín tông-tsāi!
English: As many as walk by this rule, peace and mercy be on them, and on God's Israel.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ kah tuà tī Iô-tá-iah ê sìn-tô͘ lóng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h guā-pang lâng mā tsiap-siū Siōng-tè ê tō-lí.
English: Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

Tailo: Guá bô tsē tī iàn-lo̍k ê lâng ê huē tiong lâi khuài-lo̍k; guá in-uī Lí ê kám-tōng, ka-kī tiām-tiām tsē, in-uī Lí hō͘ siū-khì tshiong-muá guá.
English: I didn't sit in the assembly of those who make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of your hand; for you have filled me with indignation.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí tio̍h koh tuì in kóng tsit-ê uē, ' I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Ta̍k-ê àng beh té tsiú muá-muá. ' In ē tuì lí kóng, ' Guán kám m̄-tsai ta̍k-ê àng ē té tsiú muá-muá? '
English: Therefore you shall speak to them this word: Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall tell you, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ kiânn beh kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lâi-kàu Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ hù-kīn ê Pik-huat kî. I-é-su tshe nn̄g-ê bûn-tô͘,
English: When they drew near to Jerusalem, and came to Bethsphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,

Tailo: Tio̍h kā tsiah-ê mi̍h tsò sò͘-tsè, tuà kàu Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kau-tài tsè-si, hō͘ i tuà kàu tuâⁿ tsîng.
English: You shall bring the meal offering that is made of these things to Yahweh: and it shall be presented to the priest, and he shall bring it to the altar.

Tailo: Tuì ē-bīn tsiah-ê lóng ē hō͘ lín bô tshing-khì, kiàn-nā bong-tio̍h hit-ê sí ê, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng sî.
English: By these you will become unclean: whoever touches the carcass of them shall be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: O͘-biat seⁿ I-é-sái, I-é-sái seⁿ Ta-bi̍t.
English: and Obed became the father of Jesse, and Jesse became the father of David.

Tailo: I-é-su khiâ lî-á hiòng tsîng kiânn ê sî, tsìng lâng kā ka-kī ê guā-saⁿ pho͘ tī lō͘-.ni̍h.
English: As he went, they spread their cloaks in the way.

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū kì-tsài kóng, Lâng nā ài beh pó-sioh ua̍h-miā, koh ài beh kuè hīng-hok ê ji̍t-tsí, tio̍h kìm-tsí tshuì-tsi̍h kóng pháiⁿ uē, koh m̄-thang kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: For, He who would love life, And see good days, Let him keep his tongue from evil, And his lips from speaking deceit.

Tailo: I ê sian-ti sī phû-phiò, kuí-tsà ê lâng; i ê tsè-si sī siat-to̍k sìng-só͘, koh uai-khiok lu̍t-huat.
English: Her prophets are arrogant and treacherous people. Her priests have profaned the sanctuary. They have done violence to the law.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsing-seⁿ kah só͘ tshiúⁿ-lâi ta̍k-ê siâⁿ ê tsiàn-lī-phín, lóng tshú-lâi tsò ka-kī ê lō͘-īng.
English: only the livestock we took for a prey to ourselves, with the spoil of the cities which we had taken.

Tailo: Lí nā m̄-tsún Guá ê jîn-bîn khì, Guá beh tshe kui tīn ê hô͘-sîn kàu lí kah lí ê jîn-sîn hia, í-ki̍p lí ê jîn-bîn, mā ē ji̍p-khì lí hiah-ê tshù, koh ū Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tshù kah in só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi, lóng ē ū kui tīn ê hô͘-sîn muá-muá.
English: Else, if you will not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies on you, and on your servants, and on your people, and into your houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.

Tailo: koh hō͘ Ko-hat ê kiáⁿ-sun kî-tha ê tso̍k, tī Má-ná-se puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ê tē, ū A-nel kah i ê kau-iá, Pí-liân kah i ê kau-iá.
English: and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Aner with its suburbs, and Bileam with its suburbs, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.

Tailo: Ji̍t-lo̍h ê sî, Io-siú-ah tshut līng, tsiū tuì tshiū tíng siu sin-si lo̍h-.lâi, hiat tī in só͘ bih ê tōng lāi, īng kuí-nā tè tuā tsio̍h hē tī tōng kháu, kàu taⁿ iáu tī-.leh.
English: It happened at the time of the going down of the sun, that Joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and cast them into the cave in which they had hidden themselves, and laid great stones on the mouth of the cave, to this very day.

Tailo: In tsáu tsin kín, kip-beh thâi lâng;
English: Their feet are swift to shed blood.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tsiū án-ne kā tshia kah gû siu khí-.lâi, kau hō͘ Lē-bī lâng.
English: Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and gave them to the Levites.

Tailo: Án-ne, I-su-la-el lâng ê sán-gia̍p tsiū bô tuì tsit tsi-tso̍k kui kàu hit tsi-tso̍k, in-uī I-su-la-el lâng tio̍h ta̍k-ê tsip-siú in tsó͘-sian tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p.
English: So shall no inheritance of the children of Israel remove from tribe to tribe; for the children of Israel shall cleave everyone to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

Tailo: In-uī guá bat kiò lín, lín m̄-thiaⁿ; guá bat tshun tshiú kā lín tsio-ho͘, lín bô lâng tì-ì;
English: Because I have called, and you have refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one has paid attention;

Tailo: Ū kì-tsài kóng, nā-sī gī lâng bô iông-ī tit-kiù, án-ne bô kìng-khiân ê lâng kah tsuē-jîn ē án-tsuáⁿ? （ Tsù:TsG 11:31）
English: If it is hard for the righteous to be saved, what will happen to the ungodly and the sinner?

Tailo: Nā ū lâng kā lín kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, lín tio̍h kóng, ' Tsú beh sú-iōng i. ' Hit-ê lâng suî-sî ē hō͘ lín khan-.lâi.
English: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, The Lord needs them,' and immediately he will send them.

Tailo: I tio̍h huāⁿ-tshiú tī sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ ê thâu-khak tíng, tsiū uī-tio̍h i siū tsiap-la̍p, thè i ka-kī sio̍k-tsuē.
English: He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

Tailo: Sí-mòng Piat-tò͘ tsiū peh khí-lih tsûn tíng, kā bāng thua tsiūⁿ-huāⁿ, kui-bāng tuā-bué hî muá-muá, tsóng-kiōng tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p-saⁿ bué; hî suî-jiân hiah tsē, bāng mā bô phuà-li̍h.
English: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn't torn.

Tailo: Thang pò-ìng guā-pang, hîng-hua̍t lia̍t kok.
English: To execute vengeance on the nations, And punishments on the peoples;

Tailo: I ê mn̂g tîm lo̍h tē, Tsú huí-huāi at-tn̄g i ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ. I ê kun-ông kah kuì-tso̍k tuà tī bô lu̍t-huat ê lia̍t kok tiong; i ê sian-ti bô tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê khé-sī.
English: Her gates are sunk into the ground; he has destroyed and broken her bars: Her king and her princes are among the nations where the law is not; Yes, her prophets find no vision from Yahweh.

Tailo: só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí bô beh koh thun-tsia̍h lâng, mā bô beh koh hō͘ lí ê jîn-bîn tsua̍t-sû.
English: therefore you shall devour men no more, neither bereave your nation any more, says the Lord Yahweh;

Tailo: Tse it-tshè kám m̄-sī guá tshin-tshiú tshòng-tsō ê? (tsù, ISI 66:1-2)
English: Didn't my hand make all these things?'

Tailo: Pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì sio̍k tī Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè ê, hián-bîng ê tāi-tsì sī íng-uán sio̍k tī lán kah lán ê kiáⁿ-sun, beh hō͘ lán kiânn tsit-ê lu̍t-huat it-tshè ê uē.
English: The secret things belong to Yahweh our God; but the things that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.

Tailo: Gōng-ti̍t ê lâng bô tsi̍t kù uē m̄-sìn; thong-ta̍t ê lâng ta̍k-pō͘ kín-sīn.
English: A simple man believes everything, But the prudent man carefully considers his ways.

Tailo: I àm-sî khì khùn, ji̍t-sî khí-.lâi, hit-ê tsíng-tsí huat-gê koh tsiām-tsiām tuā tsâng, i m̄-tsai án-tsuáⁿ ē án-ne.
English: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he doesn't know how.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá taⁿ sī tuì lín bat lu̍t-huat ê lâng teh kóng uē. Lín kám m̄-tsai, lâng ua̍h-.leh tsiah siū lu̍t-huat kuán-hat?
English: Or don't you know, brothers (for I speak to men who know the law), that the law has dominion over a man for as long as he lives?

Tailo: E-hut lâi kìnn i, ông ka-kī tsi̍t-ê tsē tī liâng-líng ê lâu-tíng, E-hut kóng, Guá hōng Siōng-tsú ê kài-bīng ū tāi-tsì lâi pò lí tsai. Ông tsiū tuì tsō-uī khiā khí-.lâi.
English: Ehud came to him; and he was sitting by himself alone in the cool upper room. Ehud said, I have a message from God to you. He arose out of his seat.

Tailo: Guān Siōng-tsú ke-thinn lín ê jîn-sò͘, ke-thinn lín kah lín ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: May Yahweh increase you more and more, You and your children.

Tailo: Tiám ting ê iû, thang tsò buah iû ê kah hiuⁿ ê phang-liāu,
English: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,

Tailo: M̄-thang kah in tsing-tsiàn, in ê tē guá liân tsi̍t kha-jiah ê uī to bô beh hō͘ lín, in-uī guá í-king kā Se-il suaⁿ hō͘ E-sáu tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: don't contend with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as for the sole of the foot to tread on; because I have given Mount Seir to Esau for a possession.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng in-uī Mí-tiân lâng ê iân-kò͘, khùn-khó͘ kàu-ki̍k, I-su-la-el lâng tsiū kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú.
English: Israel was brought very low because of Midian; and the children of Israel cried to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, sìn ê lâng ū íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: Most assuredly, I tell you, he who believes in me has eternal life.

Tailo: Guá í-king kā lín kóng tsin tsē pái, taⁿ guá koh lâu ba̍k-sái kā lín khó͘-khǹg, ū tsin tsē lâng ê hîng-uî hō͘ in tsiâⁿ-tsò Ki-tok si̍p-jī-kè ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: For many walk, of whom I told you often, and now tell you even weeping, as the enemies of the cross of Christ,

Tailo: Bîn-tsiòng kah tē-hng-kuaⁿ thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, tsiū tio̍h-kip put-an.
English: The multitude and the rulers of the city were troubled when they heard these things.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh kā lín khuán-thāi só͘ uá-khò tsit king īng Guá ê miâ tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, í-ki̍p Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kah lín ê tsó͘-sian ê tē, tshin-tshiūnn Guá tsá-tsîng khuán-thāi Sī-lô án-ne.
English: therefore will I do to the house which is called by my name, in which you trust, and to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.

Tailo: Tshuē-tio̍h liáu-āu tsiū kā I kóng, Tsìng lâng lóng teh tshuē Lí.
English: and they found him, and told him, Everyone is looking for you.

Tailo: In-uī Sìng Sîn tsó͘-tsí in tī A-si-a síng thuân tō-lí, in tsiū tuì Hu-lú-gia̍h kah Ga-la̍h-tia ê só͘-tsāi king-kuè.
English: When they had gone through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

Tailo: Lâng ē kā lia̍t kok ê îng-kng kah tsun-kuì tuà-lâi hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ.
English: and they shall bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it so that they may enter.

Tailo: guān ū tsi̍t-ê teh thiaⁿ guá! Lí khuàⁿ, ū guá só͘ uē ê kì-hō, guān Tsuân-lîng-.ê ìn guá! Guān guá ē tit-tio̍h guá ê tuì-ti̍k só͘ siá ê kò-tsn̄g!
English: Oh that I had one to hear me! (Behold, here is my signature, let the Almighty answer me); Let the accuser write my indictment!

Tailo: Lâng só͘ khí-tsō ê kang-tîng, nā bô hō͘ hué sio-.khì, tsiū ē tit-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ.
English: If any man's work remains which he built on it, he will receive a reward.

Tailo: Nā bô sí-lâng koh-ua̍h, án-ne, Ki-tok tsiū bô koh-ua̍h.
English: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither has Christ been raised.

Tailo: Suà-tsiap i ê sī Hat-ko-tsuh ê sun, U-lī-a ê kiáⁿ Me-le-mo͘t siu-lí. Suà-tsiap i ê sī Bí-sī-sat-pia̍t ê sun, Be-lé-kiah ê kiáⁿ Me-siu-lám siu-lí. Suà-tsiap i ê sī Ba-nah ê kiáⁿ Tsa-tok siu-lí.
English: Next to them repaired Meremoth the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz. Next to them repaired Meshullam the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel. Next to them repaired Zadok the son of Baana.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng, Tsiah-ê tsuí ê tiong-kan tio̍h ū kiong-tshong kā tsuí kah tsuí hun-khui.
English: God said, Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.

Tailo: Koh tuì hit-ê bûn-tô͘ kóng, Khuànn, lí ê lāu-bú! Tuì hit sî khí, hit-ê bûn-tô͘ tsiū kā I-é-su ê lāu-bú tsiap tńg-khì in tau.
English: Then he said to the disciple, Behold, your mother! From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

Tailo: Kàu siu-sîng ê kî, hn̂g-tsú tshe tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k khì tshuē tshân-tiān, beh tuì in siu hn̂g-tso͘ ê kué-tsí; tsóng-.sī, tshân-tiān phah hit-ê lô͘-po̍k, hō͘ i khang-tshiú tńg-.khì.
English: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.

Tailo: Kiû Lí ē kì-tit Lí só͘ bīng-līng Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se ê uē, kóng, ' Lín nā huān tsuē, Guá tsiū beh kā lín sì-suàⁿ khì lia̍t kok;
English: Remember, I beg you, the word that you commanded your servant Moses, saying, If you trespass, I will scatter you abroad among the peoples:

Tailo: Pa-lân tuì Ba-al kóng, Lí tī tsia kā guá khí tshit tsō tuâⁿ, kā guá tsún-pī tshit tsiah gû-káng, tshit tsiah iûⁿ-káng.
English: Balaam said to Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bulls and seven rams.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā it-tshè ê tshau-huân kau-thok hō͘ Siōng-tè, in-uī I kuan-sim lín.
English: casting all your worries on him, because he cares for you.

Tailo: Iô-tah kóng, Guán tuì guá ê Tsú beh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guán iáu ū siáⁿ thang kóng? Guán ná ū huat-tō͘ thang uī ka-kī piān-kái? Siōng-tè í-king tshâ-tshut lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê tsuē-kò, guán kah hit-ê tī i ê tshiú tshiau-tio̍h pue ê, lóng sī guá ê tsú ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Judah said, What will we tell my lord? What will we speak? Or how will we clear ourselves? God has found out the iniquity of your servants. Behold, we are my lord's bondservants, both we, and he also in whose hand the cup is found.

Tailo: Tsit-ê jîn-bîn só͘ kóng ê tông-bô͘, lín m̄-thang kóng; in só͘ kiaⁿ ê, lín m̄-bián kiaⁿ, mā m̄-thang lún.
English: Don't say, A conspiracy!' concerning all about which this people say, A conspiracy!' neither fear their threats, nor be terrorized.

Tailo: jiân-āu tuì I-su-la-el lâng kóng, Ji̍t-āu lín ê kiáⁿ-sun nā mn̄g in ê lāu-pē kóng,
English: He spoke to the children of Israel, saying, When your children shall ask their fathers in time to come, saying, What mean these stones?

Tailo: In lóng tsuan-sim thiaⁿ i, in-uī i kàu taⁿ tsin kú īng siâ-su̍t hō͘ in tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì.
English: They listened to him, because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.

Tailo: I tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê uē, kong-kik hit-ê tuâⁿ, tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tuâⁿ, tuâⁿ, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, ē ū tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ tshut-sì tī Ta-bi̍t ê ke, miâ kiò-tsò Io-si-iah, i beh kā suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ ê tsè-si, to̍h-sī tī lí ê tíng-bīn sio hiuⁿ ê, hiàn tī lí ê tíng-bīn, mā ē kā lâng ê kut-thâu sio tī lí ê tíng-bīn. '
English: He cried against the altar by the word of Yahweh, and said, altar, altar, thus says Yahweh: Behold, a son shall be born to the house of David, Josiah by name; and on you shall he sacrifice the priests of the high places who burn incense on you, and men's bones shall they burn on you.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē tuì Si-óng kā lí sù-hok! Lí it-sing ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê hok-khì!
English: May Yahweh bless you out of Zion, And may you see the good of Jerusalem all the days of your life.

Tailo: Sàu-lô kóng, In tuì A-má-li̍k lâng hia tuà-.lâi ê, in-uī jîn-bîn pó-sioh siōng hó ê iûⁿ kah gû, beh hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, kî-tha ê guán lóng tsâu-bia̍t.
English: Saul said, They have brought them from the Amalekites: for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice to Yahweh your God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.

Tailo: Tsè-si Tsa-tok tsiū tuì pò͘-pêⁿ lāi the̍h té iû ê kak, īng iû buah Só͘-lô-móng. Lâng tsiū pûn sàu-kak, tsìng lâng lóng kóng, Guān Só͘-lô-móng ông bān-suè!
English: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil out of the Tent, and anointed Solomon. They blew the trumpet; and all the people said, Long live king Solomon.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín ê siau-sit liáu-āu, tsiū kè-sio̍k uī lín kî-tó, put-sî khún-kiû Siōng-tè hō͘ lín ē-tàng tuì Sìng Sîn tit-tio̍h ta̍k tsióng ê tì-huī kah lí-kái, ē-tàng tshiong-hun bîng-pi̍k I ê tsí-ì,
English: For this cause, we also, since the day we heard this, don't cease praying and making requests for you, that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,

Tailo: Bān mi̍h kì-jiân ē án-ne siau-bia̍t, lín tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò lâng? Lín ê sing-ua̍h tio̍h sìng-kiat koh kìng-khiân,
English: Therefore since all these things are thus to be destroyed, what manner of persons ought you to be in holy living and godliness,

Tailo: I ê siâⁿ mn̂g ē pi-siong ai-kiò; i ē líng-tsīng tsē tī thô͘-kha.
English: Her gates shall lament and mourn; And she shall be desolate and sit on the ground.

Tailo: In-uī him-bō͘ tseh-kî lâi iu-būn ê, Guá beh kā in tsū-tsi̍p, in sī sio̍k lí ê, in tam-tng lîng-jio̍k tshin-tshiūnn taⁿ tāng-tàⁿ.
English: Those who are sad for the appointed feasts, I will remove from you. They are a burden and a reproach to you.

Tailo: Tsiū m̄-thang ngē lín ê sim, tshin-tshiūnn lín ê tsó͘-sian puē-gi̍k ê sî, tī khòng-iá teh tshì-thàm Siōng-tè.
English: Don't harden your hearts, as in the provocation, Like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tuà tī Iô-tah tsiah-ê siâⁿ ê I-su-la-el lâng, Lô-bo-àm iû-guân tsò in ê ông.
English: But as for the children of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá ū thiàⁿ lín. M̄-koh, lín kóng, Lí tī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì thiàⁿ guán? Siōng-tsú kóng, E-sáu kám m̄-sī Iâ-kop ê a-hiaⁿ? Tsóng-.sī, Guá thiàⁿ Iâ-kop,
English: I have loved you, says Yahweh. Yet you say, How have you loved us? Wasn't Esau Jacob's brother? says Yahweh, Yet I loved Jacob;

Tailo: In kóng, I kám thang khuán-thāi guán sió-muē tshin-tshiūnn tshiong-ki?
English: They said, Should he deal with our sister as with a prostitute?

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ tsiū lo̍h-khì kìnn hiah-ê lâng, kóng, Guá to̍h-sī lín teh tshuē ê lâng, lín lâi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuì-sū?
English: Peter went down to the men, and said, Behold, I am he whom you seek. Why have you come?

Tailo: Tshit ji̍t tio̍h hiàn hué-tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú, tē-tshit ji̍t sī sìng-huē, lóng m̄-thang tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h khó͘-kang.
English: But you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh seven days. In the seventh day is a holy convocation: you shall do no regular work.'

Tailo: I kah i kóng-uē ê sî, ông kā i kóng, Guán kám sī siat-li̍p lí tsò ông ê bô͘-sū? Lí tiām-tiām, beh thó phah, sī-.bô? Sian-ti tsiū tiām-tiām, koh kóng, Guá tsai Siōng-tè tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh bia̍t lí, in-uī lí tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì, m̄-thiaⁿ guá ê khuàn-kái.
English: It happened, as he talked with him, that the king said to him, Have we made you of the king's counsel? Stop! Why should you be struck down? Then the prophet stopped, and said, I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this, and have not listened to my counsel.

Tailo: Tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hiah-ê siâⁿ mn̂g lāi, lí m̄-thang hiàn Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê tsè.
English: You may not sacrifice the Passover within any of your gates, which Yahweh your God gives you;

Tailo: Huē-tn̂g ê tsú-kuán in-uī I-é-su tī An-hioh-ji̍t kā lâng i-pēⁿ tsiū siū-khì, tuì kûn-tsiòng kóng, Ū la̍k ji̍t thang tsò-kang, hit la̍k-ji̍t kan thang lâi i-pēⁿ, An-hioh-ji̍t m̄-thang án-ne tsò.
English: The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude, There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá tsá to̍h it-ti̍t siūⁿ beh siá phue hō͘ lín, lâi tâm-lūn lán lóng ū-hūn ê tsín-kiù. Taⁿ guá kám-kak tsin su-iàu siá phue lâi kā lín kó͘-lē, lín tio̍h uī Siōng-tè tsi̍t pái to̍h uân-tsíng thuân hō͘ sìn-tô͘ ê sìn-gióng-lâi hùn-tàu.
English: Beloved, while I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation, I was constrained to write to you exhorting you to contend earnestly for the faith which was once for all delivered to the saints.

Tailo: Guán ê tiúⁿ-ló kah tuà tī guán hia ê jîn-bîn tsiū kā guán kóng, ' Lín tshiú tio̍h tuà lō͘-.ni̍h īng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h khì kā in gîng-tsiap, tuì in kóng, guán sī lí ê lô͘-po̍k, taⁿ kiû lí kah guán li̍p-iok. '
English: Our elders and all the inhabitants of our country spoke to us, saying, Take provision in your hand for the journey, and go to meet them, and tell them, We are your servants: and now make you a covenant with us.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Ta-bi̍t uī-tio̍h hit tè tē tshìn la̍k pah si-khel ê kim hō͘ Ol-nân.
English: So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.

Tailo: Lâng nā huí-huāi Siōng-tè ê tiān, Siōng-tè ē kā i huí-bia̍t; in-uī Siōng-tè ê tiān sī sîn-sìng, lín to̍h-sī hit-ê tiān.
English: If anyone destroys the temple of God, God will destroy him; for God's temple is holy, which you are.

Tailo: tsiū hiàn tsè hō͘ i ê bāng-á, sio hiuⁿ hō͘ i ê tuā bāng, in-uī in tuì tsiah-ê tit-tio̍h puî koh suí ê hūn-gia̍h kah tshiong-tsiok ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Therefore he sacrifices to his net, and burns incense to his dragnet, because by them his life is luxurious, and his food is good.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g-ê bûn-tô͘ teh kóng tsiah-ê uē ê sî, I-é-su tshin-sin khiā tī in tiong-kan, kā in kóng, Guān lín pîng-an!
English: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them, Peace be to you.

Tailo: Koh tshú hit só͘-tsāi ê tsíng, tsai tī puî tē, tshah tī tsin tsē tsuí ê piⁿ-á, tshin-tshiūnn tsai liú-tshiū,
English: He took also of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fruitful soil; he placed it beside many waters; he set it as a willow tree.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah A-lông tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì tsò, Siōng-tsú án-tsuáⁿ kā in huan-hù, in tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: Moses and Aaron did so. As Yahweh commanded them, so they did.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín kim-mê koh hioh tsia, thìng-hāu guá khuànn Siōng-tsú ē koh kā guá kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: Now therefore, please wait also here this night, that I may know what Yahweh will speak to me more.

Tailo: só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Guá kí-khí Guá ê tshiú, kóng: Tī lín sì-kho͘-uî ê ī-pang lâng si̍t-tsāi ē siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: I have sworn, saying, Surely the nations that are round about you, they shall bear their shame.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì i kóng, Tshòng-tsō lâng ê tshuì ê sī siáⁿ lâng? Hō͘ lâng é-káu, tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng, ba̍k-tsiu kim, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê, sī siáⁿ lâng? Kám m̄-sī Guá — Siōng-tsú?
English: Yahweh said to him, Who made man's mouth? Or who makes one mute, or deaf, or seeing, or blind? Isn't it I, Yahweh?

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kám-siā Siōng-tsú, kiû-kiò I ê miâ, tī bān-bîn tiong-kan suan-iông I ê tsok-uî!
English: Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name! Make his doings known among the peoples.

Tailo: In-uī lâng tsin tsē, bē-tàng kng uá-khì I-é-su ê sin piⁿ, in tsiū tī I-é-su tíng-bīn ê tshù tíng thiah tsi̍t khang, thang kā piàn-suī-.ê teh tó ê pho͘-á luī lo̍h-.khì.
English: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

Tailo: Toh-tíng tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hē pâi-lia̍t ê piáⁿ tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: You shall set bread of the presence on the table before me always.

Tailo: Lí sī guá ê Siōng-tè, guá beh kám-siā Lí! Lí sī guá ê Siōng-tsú, guá beh tsun Lí tsò kuân!
English: You are my God, and I will give thanks to you. You are my God, I will exalt you.

Tailo: Tī kiong-tshong ê ē-bīn, in ê si̍t thí ti̍t-ti̍t, tāi-ke sio-tuì, koh ū nn̄g ki si̍t khàm i ê sing-khu tsit pîng, mā koh ū nn̄g ki si̍t khàm i ê sing-khu hit pîng.
English: Under the expanse were their wings straight, the one toward the other: each one had two which covered on this side, and every one had two which covered on that side, their bodies.

Tailo: Lí ná ē thau-thau-á tsáu? Lí thau-tsáu mā bô kā guá kóng; hō͘ guá bē-tàng īng huann-hí, tshiùⁿ kua, phah kó͘, tuâⁿ khîm, lâi sàng lí tńg-.khì, kám m̄-sī?
English: Why did you flee secretly, and deceive me, and didn't tell me, that I might have sent you away with mirth and with songs, with tambourine and with harp;

Tailo: I kóng, Iô-tah kûn-tsiòng, tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn kah Iô-sa-huat ông — lí, lóng tio̍h thiaⁿ, Siōng-tsú tuì lín án-ne kóng, ' M̄-thang in-uī tsit-ê tuā kun-tuī lâi kiaⁿ, lâi lún, in-uī tsit-ê kau-tsiàn m̄-sī tsāi tī lín, to̍h-sī tsāi tī Siōng-tè.
English: and he said, Listen you, all Judah, and you inhabitants of Jerusalem, and you king Jehoshaphat: Thus says Yahweh to you, Don't be afraid you, neither be dismayed by reason of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God's.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá ê sim beh kah Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè li̍p-iok, hō͘ I ê tuā siū-khì ua̍t-tńg lī-khui lán.
English: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with Yahweh, the God of Israel, that his fierce anger may turn away from us.

Tailo: Biáu-sī tshù-piⁿ ê lâng sī bû-ti; tsóng-.sī, bîng-lí ê lâng tiām-tiām bô tshut siaⁿ.
English: One who despises his neighbor is void of wisdom, But a man of understanding holds his peace.

Tailo: Kiû Lí kà-sī guán, án-tsuáⁿ lâi sǹg ka-kī ê ji̍t-tsí, thang hō͘ guán ê sim tit-tio̍h tì-huī.
English: So teach us to number our days, That we may gain a heart of wisdom.

Tailo: Lín kin-á-ji̍t nā tsiàu sîng-si̍t kong-gī khuán-thāi Ia-lu-ba-al kah i ê ke, lín tsiū thang tuì A-mí-me-li̍k lâi huann-hí, i mā thang tuì lín lâi huann-hí;
English: if you then have dealt truly and righteously with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice you in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you:

Tailo: Guá tī Io̍p-pe siâⁿ kî-tó kah sit-sîn ê sî, ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng. Ū tsi̍t-ê tshin-tshiūnn sì-kak-thâu pa̍k-.leh ê tuā-pak pò͘ tuī lo̍h-.lâi, lak tī guá ê kha tsîng.
English: I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision: a certain container descending, like it was a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners. It came as far as me.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí tńg-.khì, lí ê kiáⁿ bē sí. Hit-ê lâng siong-sìn I-é-su kā i kóng ê uē, tsiū tńg-.khì.
English: Jesus said to him, Go your way. Your son lives. The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.

Tailo: mā hō͘ in tsò kng-thé tī thiⁿ ê kiong-tshong, tsiò-kng tī tē-tsiūⁿ. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: and let them be for lights in the expanse of sky to give light on the earth, and it was so.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì A-lông kóng, The̍h hit-ê hiuⁿ-lô͘, īng tuâⁿ tíng ê hué té tī hit tiong-kan, hē hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn, kuáⁿ-kín tuà kàu huē-tsiòng hia, kā in sio̍k-tsuē; in-uī ū tuā siū-khì tuì Siōng-tsú huat-tshut, un-i̍k í-king teh huat-tsok.
English: Moses said to Aaron, Take your censer, and put fire therein from off the altar, and lay incense thereon, and carry it quickly to the congregation, and make atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out from Yahweh; the plague is begun.

Tailo: A-sel lâng kah tuà hit só͘-tsāi Ka-nân lâng ê tiong-kan tsò-hué tuà, in-uī bô kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: but the Asherites lived among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land; for they did not drive them out.

Tailo: Bô-oh-tsuh huan-hù siàu-liân lâng kóng, I nā tī kui khún ê tiong-kan khioh be̍h-sap, mā tio̍h iông-ín i, m̄-thang hō͘ i kiàn-siàu;
English: When she was risen up to glean, Boaz commanded his young men, saying, Let her glean even among the sheaves, and don't reproach her.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tuì Siōng-tè ê un-tián, guá iáu-buē tshut-sì I to̍h kíng-suán guá,
English: But when it was the good pleasure of God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me through his grace,

Tailo: Hiann-tī, lí ê thiàⁿ-sim hō͘ guá ū tsin tuā ê huann-hí kah kó͘-lē, só͘-ū ê sìn-tô͘ mā tuì lí tit-tio̍h kik-lē.
English: For we have much joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.

Tailo: Siōng-tè pàng só͘-ū ê lâng lóng tī bô sūn-ho̍k ê tsōng-thāi, sī uī-tio̍h beh liân-bín só͘-ū ê lâng.
English: For God has shut up all to disobedience, that he might have mercy on all.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tsiū kā A-mô͘-lī ông Si-hông ê kok kah Ba-siáng ông O͘-k ê kok, hit-ê tē kah i kíng lāi tsiah-ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī sì-kho͘-uî tsiah-ê siâⁿ, lóng hō͘ Ga̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun kah Lū-biān ê kiáⁿ-sun, í-ki̍p Iô-sé-huh ê kiáⁿ Má-ná-se ê puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k.
English: Moses gave to them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land, according to the cities of it with their borders, even the cities of the land round about.

Tailo: In-uī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú it-tīng pang-tsān guá, só͘-í, guá bô kiàn-siàu; uī-tio̍h án-ne, guá hō͘ guá ê bīn ngē kah tshin-tshiūnn tīng tsio̍h; guá mā tsai guá it-tīng bô tì-sú làu-khuì.
English: For the Lord Yahweh will help me; therefore I have not been confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be disappointed.

Tailo: Tī hia ū tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò A-ná-ni-a ê lâng, sī tsi̍t-ê tsun-siú Mô͘-se lu̍t-huat koh kìng-khiân ê lâng, tsin siū tuà tī hia ê Iô-tá-iah lâng tsun-kìng.
English: One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus,

Tailo: Hiah-ê ping-á mā kā I hì-lāng, kiâⁿ uá khì phâng sng-tshò͘ hō͘ I,
English: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,

Tailo: Hit-ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū kuī lo̍h-lâi kiû kóng, ' Tsú ah, tshiánn hō͘ guá ān tsi̍t ē, guá ē hîng lí só͘-ū. '
English: The servant therefore fell down and kneeled before him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will repay you all!'

Tailo: Tī īⁿ ê sì-kak-thâu ū īⁿ, sì-bīn ū tshiûⁿ uî-.leh; ta̍k-ê īⁿ, tn̂g sì-tsa̍p tiú, khuah saⁿ-tsa̍p; sì-ê kak-thâu ê īⁿ, in ê tshùn-tshioh lóng kāng-khuán.
English: In the four corners of the court there were courts enclosed, forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four in the corners were of one measure.

Tailo: In-uī thian-kok ná tshin-tshiūnn kun-ông beh kah i ê lô͘-po̍k kiat-siàu.
English: Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê lâng í-king kah lán sio-siâng, ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t siān-ok, taⁿ khióng-kiaⁿ i koh tshun tshiú tuì ua̍h-miā-tshiū bán kué-tsí lâi tsia̍h, tsiū ē ua̍h kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh God said, Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he put forth his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever...

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh án-ne kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tuì lí ê ke hing-khí tsai-hō kong-kik lí, Guá beh tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, kā lí hiah-ê bó͘ hō͘ lí ê tshù-piⁿ, i ē tī tshing-thian pi̍k-ji̍t kah lí hiah-ê bó͘ tâng-pâng.
English: This is what Yahweh says: Behold, I will raise up evil against you out of your own house; and I will take your wives before your eyes, and give them to your neighbor, and he will lie with your wives in the sight of this sun.

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ tsē tsûn kuè-khì Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘ ê tuì-bīn huāⁿ, lâi-kàu Gê-la̍h-sam lâng ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Lí ū tuì Lí siū buah-iû ê siū-khì, kā i ià-siān, kā i khì-sak.
English: But you have rejected and spurned. You have been angry with your anointed.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê jîn-sîn kóng, Guá ê tsú, guá ê ông, m̄-sī án-ne lah, sī I-su-la-el tiong ê sian-ti E-lí-siah kā lí tī khùn-pâng só͘ kóng ê uē, lóng kā I-su-la-el ông kóng.
English: One of his servants said, No, my lord, O king; but Elisha, the prophet who is in Israel, tells the king of Israel the words that you speak in your bedchamber.

Tailo: Guān Io-buh siū tshì-giām kàu thiat-té, in-uī i ê ìn-tap tshin-tshiūnn pháiⁿ lâng.
English: I wish that Job were tried to the end, Because of his answering like wicked men.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsit-ê kiáⁿ sí-khì ū koh-ua̍h, phah-m̄-kiàn ū koh tshuē-.tio̍h. 'In tsiū tsò-hué huann-hí khìng-tsiok.
English: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.' They began to celebrate.

Tailo: Guá beh ìn lí, mā beh ìn uá-khò lí ê tâng-phuāⁿ.
English: I will answer you, And your companions with you.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h lim-tsia̍h á-.sī hióng-hok, siáⁿ lâng ē iâⁿ-kuè guá?
English: For who can eat, or who can have enjoyment, more than I?

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsò I-su-la-el tsuân kok ê ông, koh tī tsìng lâng ê tiong-kan píng-kong kiâⁿ-gī.
English: David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness to all his people.

Tailo: In tsiū m̄-káⁿ koh mn̄g I-é-su siáⁿ-mi̍h būn-tê.
English: They didn't dare to ask him any more questions.

Tailo: tsiū tio̍h tuì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tē, kā só͘ siu-sîng ta̍k hāng khí-thâu si̍k ê lông-sán-bu̍t, the̍h tām-po̍h, hē tī khing-.ni̍h, khì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ beh kíng-suán an-tì I ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi.
English: that you shall take of the first of all the fruit of the ground, which you shall bring in from your land that Yahweh your God gives you; and you shall put it in a basket, and shall go to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there.

Tailo: Iá-lî ū tsháu, kám ē tshut siaⁿ? Gû ū tsháu-liāu, kám ē háu?
English: Does the wild donkey bray when he has grass? Or does the ox low over his fodder?

Tailo: M̄-thang īng khiā-thui tsiūⁿ Guá ê tuâⁿ, bián-tit lō͘-hiān lí ê ē-sin. '
English: Neither shall you go up by steps to my altar, that your nakedness may not be exposed to it.'

Tailo: Li̍p-iok liáu-āu, i ē kiânn kuí-tsà, īng tsió-tsió ê jîn-bîn tsiâⁿ-tsò kiông-bíng.
English: After the league made with him he shall work deceitfully; for he shall come up, and shall become strong, with a small people.

Tailo: Lāi-guā īng sûn-kim pau khí-.lâi, sì-kho͘-uî tsò kim suàⁿ-khí,
English: He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold for it round about.

Tailo: Tsháu-me̍h tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, tē-jī tsióng ê tsháu-me̍h ē lâi tsia̍h; tē-jī tsióng tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, tē-saⁿ tsióng ê tsháu-me̍h ē lâi tsia̍h; tē-saⁿ tsióng tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, tē-sì tsióng ê tsháu-me̍h ē lâi tsia̍h.
English: What the swarming locust has left, the great locust has eaten. What the great locust has left, the grasshopper has eaten. What the grasshopper has left, the caterpillar has eaten.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū khui tshuì tuì in kóng, Tsit-tuāⁿ king-tián, kin-á-ji̍t lín thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê sî í-king si̍t-hiān ā.
English: He began to tell them, Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.

Tailo: In kô-kô tîⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tshì-phè, tshin-tshiūnn lim tsiú lim kah tsuì-tsuì, in iáu-koh ē sio-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn ta-ta ê tsháu.
English: For entangled like thorns, and drunken as with their drink, they are consumed utterly like dry stubble.

Tailo: I hō͘ bē senn kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng liāu-lí ka-tîng, tsò tsin tsē kiáⁿ ê lāu-bú lâi huann-hí. Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú!
English: He settles the barren woman in her home, As a joyful mother of children. Praise Yah!

Tailo: Uàn-hūn Siōng-tsú ê lâng ē lâi tâu-hâng I, tsóng-.sī, in ē kú-tn̂g siū hîng-hua̍t.
English: The haters of Yahweh would cringe before him, And their punishment would last forever.

Tailo: In tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin tsiūⁿ suaⁿ-tē khì, lâi-kàu E-si-kol ê suaⁿ-kok, thàm-khuàⁿ hit só͘-tsāi.
English: and they turned and went up into the hill country, and came to the valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.

Tailo: Tē-jī-ê, tē-saⁿ-ê mā lóng tshuā hit-ê hiaⁿ-só.
English: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

Tailo: In tī hia ê sî, Mâ-lí-ah sing-sán ê kî kàu.
English: It happened, while they were there, that the day had come that she should give birth.

Tailo: Lín lâi, tsia̍h guá ê piáⁿ, lim guá tiâu-hô ê tsiú.
English: Come, eat some of my bread, Drink some of the wine which I have mixed!

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tsò gī lâng sio̍k-huê ê kè-tsînn; kan-tsà ê lâng tsò tsìng-ti̍t lâng ê thè-sin.
English: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; The treacherous for the upright.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Lāu-su ah, tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tang-sî ē huat-sing? Koh tsiah-ê tāi-tsì beh huat-sing tsìn-tsîng, ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tiāu-thâu?
English: They asked him, Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?

Tailo: Uī ka-kī ê ke tsik-tsū put-gī ê tsînn, beh tsò siū tī kuân ê só͘-tsāi, ǹg-bāng thuat-lī hiong-ok ê sè-li̍k, hit khuán lâng ū tsai-hō ah!
English: Woe to him who gets an evil gain for his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the hand of evil!

Tailo: Lâng nā huān-tio̍h ing-kai sí ê tsuē, siū pān tsuē sí, lí nā kā i tiàu tī tshâ-.ni̍h,
English: If a man have committed a sin worthy of death, and he be put to death, and you hang him on a tree;

Tailo: I kā i ê lāu-pē só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, í-ki̍p i pún-sin só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê kim, gîn kah khì-kū, lóng tuà lâi-kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: He brought into the house of Yahweh the things that his father had dedicated, and the things that himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.

Tailo: I ê jîn-sîn khí-lâi puē-puān, tī lo̍h-khì Sik-la̍h ê Mi-lō͘ kiong thâi-sí Io-a-si.
English: His servants arose, and made a conspiracy, and struck Joash at the house of Millo, on the way that goes down to Silla.

Tailo: In ná kiâⁿ khuì-la̍t ná ke-thinn, ta̍k lâng lâi-kàu Si-óng tiâu-kìnn Siōng-tè.
English: They go from strength to strength. Everyone of them appears before God in Zion.

Tailo: M̄-thang khi-phiàn ka-kī, Siōng-tè sī bē-tàng bú-jio̍k ê. Lâng ē tsiàu i só͘ iā ê tsíng lâi siu-sîng.
English: Don't be deceived. God is not mocked, for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.

Tailo: In-uī Thiⁿ-pē thiàⁿ Kiáⁿ, só͘-í, kā ka-kī só͘ tsò ê lóng kā Kiáⁿ tsí-sī, mā ē kā pí tsiah-ê koh khah tuā ê tāi-tsì tsí-sī Kiáⁿ, beh hō͘ lín kám-kak kî-kuài.
English: For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel.

Tailo: Koh kì-tsài tī tso̍k-phó͘ tiong ê, in ê sè-hàn ê, in ê bó͘, in ê kiáⁿ, in ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tī tsuân huē-tsiòng tiong ê, in-uī in tsīn tsit-hūn ka-kī tshing-khì tsiâⁿ-sìng.
English: and those who were reckoned by genealogy of all their little ones, their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, through all the congregation: for in their office of trust they sanctified themselves in holiness.

Tailo: In-uī I-é-su ū bīng-līng siâ-sîn tuì hit-ê lâng tshut-.lâi. Í-tsîng siâ-sîn tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kā i lia̍h tiâu-tiâu, lâng īng thih-liān-á kā i liān-.leh, īng kha-liâu tshiú-khàu kā i khàu-.leh, koh kā i kuainn khí-.lâi; m̄-koh, i kā pa̍k i ê khì-kū tshuah-tn̄g, siâ-sîn koh hō͘ i tsông tshut-khì khòng-iá.
English: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bands apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.

Tailo: Koh īng to phah tsè-si ê siâⁿ — Νo͘p kî-tiong ê lâm-lí, gín-á, tsia̍h ling ê enn-á kah gû, lî, iûⁿ, lóng īng to thâi-sí.
English: Nob, the city of the priests, struck he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and nursing babies, and oxen and donkeys and sheep, with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: In tsiū kā Páu-lô thua kàu A-lí-o suaⁿ ê huat-īⁿ, kā i kóng, Lí teh kóng lūn ê sin ha̍k-suat kám ē-tàng pò guán tsai?
English: They took hold of him, and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by you?

Tailo: Tng tsit-ê ē hiú-nuā ê piàn-tsò bē hiú-nuā-ê, ē sí ê piàn-tsò bē sí ê sî, king-tián só͘ kì-tsài ê Sí-bông ē hō͘ tik-sìng thun-tsia̍h lo̍h-khì (tsù, ISI 25:8) tsit kù tsiū ē ìng-giām.
English: But when this corruptible will have put on incorruption, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then what is written will happen: Death is swallowed up in victory.

Tailo: Kìng-uì Siōng-tsú tsiū ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā; i ē an-ki pá-tsiok bē tú-tio̍h tsai-hō.
English: The fear of Yahweh leads to life, then contentment; He rests and will not be touched by trouble.

Tailo: In ê si-thé āu-lâi ūn tńg-lâi Sī-khiàm, bâi-tsòng tī A-bu-la-hàm īng tsînn tuì Ha-mool ê kiáⁿ-sun bé-.lâi ê hit tè bōng-tē.
English: and they were brought back to Shechem, and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.

Tailo: Tsò put-gī ê lâng ē siū put-gī ê pò-ìng, in-uī Siōng-tè īng kāng tsi̍t-ê phiau-tsún tuì-thāi muí tsi̍t-ê lâng.
English: But he who does wrong will receive again for the wrong that he has done, and there is no partiality.

Tailo: Tī sí-bông ê tiong-kan, bô lâng kì-liām Lí; tī im-hú ê tiong-kan, siáⁿ lâng kám-siā Lí?
English: For in death there is no memory of you. In Sheol, who shall give you thanks?

Tailo: Jiân-āu guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h hō͘ sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h kah hiah-ê tiúⁿ-ló uî teh ê pó-tsō tsîng, ū tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-ko khiā-.leh, iûⁿ-ko ná tshin-tshiūnn bat siū sat-hāi. Iûⁿ-ko ū tshit ki kak, tshit luí ba̍k-tsiu, to̍h-sī siū Siōng-tè tshe-phài khì tsuân sè-kài hit tshit-ê lîng.
English: I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a Lamb standing, as though it had been slain, having seven horns, and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God, sent out into all the earth.

Tailo: Si-phian Tē-sì Kuàn(90~106 phiⁿ)（ Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k — Mô͘-se ê kî-tó. ） Tsú ah, Lí ta̍k sè-tāi tsò guán tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.

Tailo: In só͘ tam-tng ê tsik-jīm, tsiàu huē-bō͘ tsiah-ê kang-tîng, to̍h-sī huē-bō͘ ê pán kah i ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ, i ê thiāu, i ê tsō,
English: This is the charge of their burden, according to all their service in the Tent of Meeting: the tabernacle's boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, m̄-sī. Lín nā bô hué-kái, lóng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne bia̍t-bông.
English: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Iá-hia̍t ê kiáⁿ, Go-mel, Má-gok, Ma-tái, Iá-uán, Thô͘-bal, Me-sik, Thi-la̍k.
English: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

Tailo: Ióng-sū sí kah án-ne, tsiàn-khì huí-bia̍t kah án-ne!
English: How are the mighty fallen, The weapons of war perished!

Tailo: Guán lāu-pē sí tī khòng-iá, i m̄-sī tī Khó-la̍h ê tóng lāi, bô kah in kâng tóng tsò-hué kong-kik Siōng-tsú; sī tī ka-kī ê tsuē tiong sí; i mā bô kiáⁿ.
English: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against Yahweh in the company of Korah: but he died in his own sin; and he had no sons.

Tailo: Gi-be-at lâng khí-lâi kong-kik guá, àm-sî pau-uî guá hioh ê tshù, siūⁿ beh hāi-sí guá, koh kiông-kan guá ê sè-î tì-kàu sí.
English: The men of Gibeah rose against me, and beset the house round about me by night; me they thought to have slain, and my concubine they forced, and she is dead.

Tailo: In nn̄g lâng kā I-é-su ê sin-si siu lo̍h-.lâi, tsiàu Iô-tá-iah lâng bâi-tsòng ê kuàn-lē kā sin-si buah phang-liāu koh īng iù-tē pò͘ pau khí-.lâi.
English: So they took Jesus' body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

Tailo: I lo̍h pha̍uh hō͘ in tsò hō͘; tī in ê thó͘-tē kàng-lo̍h iām-hué.
English: He gave them hail for rain, With lightning in their land.

Tailo: Sîn-lîng tsiū ji̍p-lâi guá ê lāi-bīn, hō͘ guá khiā khí-.lâi. I kah guá kóng-uē, tuì guá kóng, Lí khì, lí tio̍h ka-kī kuainn tī tshù lāi.
English: Then the Spirit entered into me, and set me on my feet; and he spoke with me, and said to me, Go, shut yourself within your house.

Tailo: Khí-tsho͘ hok-im tsin-tō thuân hō͘ lín ê sî, lín thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê hok-im, ū tuà-lâi khǹg tī thinn-tíng ê ǹg-bāng.
English: because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the Good News,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú siū-khì I-su-la-el lâng, kā in bē hō͘ Mê-só͘-po-ta-miah ông Kó͘-san-lī-sat-tiân. Tsiū án-ne, I-su-la-el lâng ho̍k-sāi Kó͘-san-lī-sat-tiân peh nî.
English: Therefore the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Cushan Rishathaim king of Mesopotamia: and the children of Israel served Cushan Rishathaim eight years.

Tailo: Taⁿ, sè-kiáⁿ, lín tio̍h kah Ki-tok kiat-liân lâi sing-ua̍h, án-ne, tī Ki-tok tsài-lîm ê sî ē-tàng hó-tánn, bē in-uī I ê tsài-lîm, kám-kak kiàn-siàu tsáu-khì bih.
English: Now, little children, remain in him, that when he appears, we may have boldness, and not be ashamed before him at his coming.

Tailo: Siâⁿ tio̍h ū kau-iá, ǹg pak nn̄g-pah gō͘-tsa̍p, ǹg lâm nn̄g-pah gō͘-tsa̍p, ǹg tang nn̄g-pah gō͘-tsa̍p, ǹg sai nn̄g-pah gō͘-tsa̍p.
English: The city shall have suburbs: toward the north two hundred fifty, and toward the south two hundred fifty, and toward the east two hundred fifty, and toward the west two hundred fifty.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā A-khip-pò͘ kóng, Tio̍h kín-sīn lâi tsīn lí tuì Tsú só͘ niá-siū ê tsit-hūn.
English: Tell Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord, that you fulfill it.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Uī-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h îng-kng kah tsun-kuì siúⁿ-sù hō͘ Mol-té-kái? Sū-hāu ông ê jîn-sîn ìn kóng, Bián siúⁿ-sù i siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: The king said, What honor and dignity has been bestowed on Mordecai for this? Then the king's servants who ministered to him said, Nothing has been done for him.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Guá só͘ huan-hù lí ê, lí lóng tio̍h kóng. Lí ê a-hiaⁿ A-lông tio̍h tuì Huâ-láu kóng, hō͘ i tsún I-su-la-el lâng lī-khui i ê tē.
English: You shall speak all that I command you; and Aaron your brother shall speak to Pharaoh, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.

Tailo: Uá-kīn Má-ná-se ê tē-kài, tuì tang kàu sai, E-hu-laim tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t hūn.
English: By the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west side, Ephraim, one portion.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú só͘ buah iû ê, thang pí-phīng guán phīⁿ-khang lāi ê khuì, tī in ê hām-kheⁿ lāi hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.tio̍h; kóng-tio̍h i, guán bat kóng: Guán beh tī i ê tì-ìm ē, ua̍h tī lia̍t kok tiong.
English: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of Yahweh, was taken in their pits; Of whom we said, Under his shadow we shall live among the nations.

Tailo: Páu-lô tī Ko-lîn-to koh kah huē-iú tuà kuí-nā ji̍t liáu-āu, in tsiū lī-khui hia kah Pu-lí-su-ki-lah hām A-ku-lah tsò-hué tsē tsûn khì Su-lī-a. Páu-lô ū hē guān, tsiū tī Kian-khu-lia̍h tsián thâu-mn̂g.
English: Paul, having stayed after this many more days, took his leave of the brothers, and sailed from there for Syria, together with Priscilla and Aquila. He shaved his head in Cenchreae, for he had a vow.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê bē kì-tit Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k, tio̍h siūⁿ tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tsiah bián tì-kàu guá kā lín thiah-tshuì, bô lâng thang kā lín tsín-kiù.
English: Now consider this, you who forget God, Lest I tear you into pieces, and there be none to deliver.

Tailo: I siūⁿ-lâi siūⁿ-khì, kóng, ' Guá bô kàu só͘-tsāi thang tún guá ê ngó͘-kok, taⁿ beh án-tsuáⁿ? '
English: He reasoned within himself, saying, What will I do, because I don't have room to store my crops?'

Tailo: Mi-ka-iah kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí ji̍p-khì bih tī ka-kī ê lāi-pâng, hit ji̍t lí tsiū ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Micaiah said, Behold, you shall see on that day, when you shall go into an inner chamber to hide yourself.

Tailo: In tiong-kan tsi̍t-ê kóng, Sî-kan kàu, guá it-tīng ē koh lâi lí tsia; lí ê bó͘ Sa-la̍h ē seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ. Sa-la̍h tī āu-bīn pò͘-pênn mn̂g-kháu ê só͘-tsāi teh thiaⁿ.
English: He said, I will certainly return to you when the season comes round. Behold, Sarah your wife will have a son. Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him.

Tailo: Guá nā-tsún ū thuân hok-im ê un-sù, iū-koh liáu-kái só͘-ū ê ò-pì kah tì-sik, sīm-tsì ū kian-kiông ê sìn-sim thang î-san tó-hái, nā bô thiàⁿ-sim, guá tsiū lóng bô lō͘-īng.
English: If I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge; and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but don't have love, I am nothing.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê tsû-ài kah I tuì sè-kan lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê kî-sū, guān lâng-lâng lóng o-ló I.
English: Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness, For his wonderful works to the children of men!

Tailo: Ha-nun tsiū kā Ta-bi̍t ê jîn-sîn ê tshuì-tshiu thì tsi̍t-puàⁿ, koh tuì-tiong kuah-tn̄g i ê saⁿ kàu tuā-thuí tíng, tsiū tshe in tò tńg-.khì.
English: So Hanun took David's servants, and shaved off the one half of their beards, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.

Tailo: Phài Tse-ka-lí-ah, Ia-ji-el, Se-mi-la-mo͘t , Ia-tsi-el, Un-nî, E-lí-ap, Ma-a-se-iah kah Be-ná-iah tuâⁿ sik, i ê siann-im tshing-liāng.
English: and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries set to Alamoth;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê sim ài lâng tsò pháiⁿ, i ê ba̍k-tsiu pīng bô khó-liân i ê tshù-piⁿ.
English: The soul of the wicked desires evil; His neighbor finds no mercy in his eyes.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ka-kī sí-.khì ê mi̍h, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, thang hō͘ lín mn̂g lāi kià-kha ê lâng tsia̍h á-.sī bē hō͘ guā-kok lâng tsia̍h, in-uī lí sī sìng ê jîn-bîn, sio̍k tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè. Tsú suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, m̄-thang īng i ê bú ê ling.
English: You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself: you may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner: for you are a holy people to Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.

Tailo: Tuì A-bûn-te-pí-la̍h-thài-im tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Ne-bó tuì-bīn ê A-bá-lîm suaⁿ.
English: They traveled from Almon Diblathaim, and encamped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.

Tailo: Tsē tī ki-lō͘-ping ê tiong-kan, bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè ah, to̍k-to̍k Lí tsò thian-hā bān-kok ê Siōng-tsú, Lí bat tshòng-tsō thiⁿ-tē.
English: Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, who is enthroned among the cherubim, you are the God, even you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.

Tailo: In-uī in tuà tsing-seⁿ kah pò͘-pênn khí-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn tsháu-me̍h hiah tsē lâi, lâng kah lo̍k-tô sǹg bē-liáu, in ji̍p-lâi tsit-ê só͘-tsāi beh kā i phah-pháiⁿ.
English: For they came up with their livestock and their tents; they came in as locusts for multitude; both they and their camels were without number: and they came into the land to destroy it.

Tailo: Khí-.lâi! Lán tio̍h thàu-mê tsiūⁿ-.khì, huí-huāi i ê kiong-tiān.
English: Arise, and let us go up by night, and let us destroy her palaces.

Tailo: Lín sǹg Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tshù-the̍h, kā tshù thiah-huí lâi siu-pó͘ siâⁿ tshiûⁿ.
English: You numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.

Tailo: Lán tsai lán í-king tshut-sí ji̍p-ua̍h, in-uī lán ū thiàⁿ hiann-tī tsí-muē; bô thiàⁿ-sim ê lâng, iáu siū sí-bông ê kuán-hat.
English: We know that we have passed out of death into life, because we love the brothers. He who doesn't love his brother remains in death.

Tailo: Ak-sil ū la̍k-ê kiáⁿ, in ê miâ sī A-tsu-li-kam, Bo-ke-lu, I-si-ma-el, Sia-li-ah, O-ba-ti-iah, Ha-nan. Tse lóng sī Ak-sil ê kiáⁿ.
English: Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.

Tailo: Koh ū siaⁿ tuì thinn-tíng kóng, Tsit-ê sī guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê Kiáⁿ, I sī guá tsin-tsiàⁿ kah-ì ê.
English: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said, This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.

Tailo: In thiaⁿ He-lo̍t ê uē tsiū tshut-huat. In tī tang-hong khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê hit lia̍p tsheⁿ, hut-jiân tuà thâu-tsîng teh kā in tshuā-lō͘, lâi-kàu hit-ê enn-á ê só͘-tsāi, tsiū thîng tuà hit tíng-bīn.
English: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h liáu-āu, tshut-hiān hō͘ I ê bûn-tô͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tse sī tē-saⁿ pái.
English: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

Tailo: Guá tsai Guá tuì lín só͘ tsûn ê ì-sù, sī siúⁿ-sù pîng-an ê ì-sù, m̄-sī kàng tsai-hō, beh hō͘ lín ê bué-kíng ū ǹg-bāng.
English: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, says Yahweh, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you hope in your latter end.

Tailo: Guá sī tsuân-lîng Siōng-tè, tshut-hiān tī A-bu-la-hàm, Í-sak, Iâ-kop; tsóng-.sī, Guá ê miâ kiò-tsò I-é-ho-bah, Guá m̄-bat hō͘ in bat Guá.
English: and I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty; but by my name Yahweh I was not known to them.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tsia̍h pá liáu-āu, I-é-su kā bûn-tô͘ kóng, Kā tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê sut-á khioh khí-.lâi, m̄-thang phah-sńg.
English: When they were filled, he said to his disciples, Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.

Tailo: Tsìng-ti̍t ê sàn-tshiah lâng, iâⁿ-kuè o͘-pe̍h-kóng koh gû-gōng ê lâng.
English: Better is the poor who walks in his integrity Than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá tshun-tshut tshiú-.ni̍h só͘ gia̍h ê kuái-á bué, lâi tuh-tio̍h bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, tsiū ū hué tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tsuân-pō͘ ê bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ sio khí-.lâi. Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá tsiū lī-khui khì, bô koh-tsài khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Then the angel of Yahweh put forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and there went up fire out of the rock, and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and the angel of Yahweh departed out of his sight.

Tailo: Tsi-bah tuì ông kóng, Io-ná-than iáu ū tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, sī pái-kha-.ê. Ông kā i kóng, I tī tó-uī? Tsi-bah ìn ông kóng, I tī Lô-tí-pa lâng Am-mí-el ê kiáⁿ Ma-kil ê ke.
English: The king said to him, Where is he? Ziba said to the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir the son of Ammiel, in Lo Debar.

Tailo: In-uī Ta-bi̍t tī Si-phian ka-kī kóng, ' Tsú kā guá ê Tsú kóng, tsē guá ê tsiànn pîng,
English: David himself says in the book of Psalms, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,

Tailo: A-bú-lâm ê bó͘ Sa-lái bô kā i seⁿ kiáⁿ. Sa-lái ū tsi̍t-ê lú-pī, miâ kiò-tsò Ha-gal, sī Ai-gi̍p lâng.
English: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, bore him no children. She had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.

Tailo: Tsa̍p-it nî saⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: It happened in the eleventh year, in the third month, in the first day of the month, that the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bô phak lo̍h-khì kìng-pài ê ē siū hiat lo̍h-khì tī iām-jua̍h ê hué-lô͘.
English: and whoever doesn't fall down and worship shall be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.

Tailo: Pó-tsō tsîng ū tshin-tshiūnn tsuí-tsinn hiah tshing ê po-lê-hái. Pó-tsō ê sì-kho͘-uî ū sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h, tsîng-āu lóng ū ba̍k-tsiu.
English: Before the throne was something like a sea of glass, similar to crystal. In the midst of the throne, and around the throne were four living creatures full of eyes before and behind.

Tailo: Tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, tsiah-ê sī Ná-hu-tha-lím ê ta̍k tso̍k; in king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsóng-kiōng sì-bān gō͘-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families; and those who were numbered of them were forty-five thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Suà-tsiap A-hi-to-huel ê, ū Be-ná-iah ê kiáⁿ Io-ho-iá-tah kah A-bi-a-thal. Io-ap tsò ông ê lio̍k-kun tsóng-tiúⁿ.
English: and after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the captain of the king's army was Joab.

Tailo: Guá beh jiok guá ê tuì-ti̍k, mā ē jiok-tio̍h in; in iáu-buē bia̍t-bông tsìn-tsîng, guá bô beh tò tńg-.khì.
English: I will pursue my enemies, and overtake them. Neither will I turn again until they are consumed.

Tailo: Tsiàu I tī kó͘-tsá thong-kuè sîn-sìng ê sian-ti ê tshuì ìng-ín kóng,
English: (As he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets who have been from of old),

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín m̄-tsai ka-kī teh kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h. Guá só͘ lim ê pue, lín kám ē-tàng lim? Guá siū ê sé-lé, lín kám ē-tàng siū?
English: But Jesus said to them, You don't know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá ē īng tshuì hō͘ lín kian-kò͘; īng tshuì-tûn ê an-uì hō͘ lín kiám khin thòng-khó͘.
English: But I would strengthen you with my mouth. The solace of my lips would relieve you.

Tailo: Kuán-lí Mi-su-peh tē ê Kol-ho-tseh ê kiáⁿ Sia-lông siu-lí tsuí-tsuâⁿ ê mn̂g; kā i khí-tsō, kā i khàm, an i ê mn̂g-sìⁿ kah i ê só, i ê kông, í-ki̍p uá-kīn ông ê hn̂g ê Si-ló-ám tî ê tshiûⁿ, ti̍t-kàu hit-ê tuì Ta-bi̍t siâⁿ lo̍h-.lâi ê kiā-á.
English: The spring gate repaired Shallun the son of Colhozeh, the ruler of the district of Mizpah; he built it, and covered it, and set up the doors of it, the bolts of it, and the bars of it, and the wall of the pool of Shelah by the king's garden, even to the stairs that go down from the city of David.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh īng soh-á hē tī lí ê sin tsiūⁿ, tì-sú lí bē-tàng huan kuè-pîng, kàu lí uî-khùn siâⁿ ê ji̍t muá uî-tsí.
English: Behold, I lay bands on you, and you shall not turn you from one side to the other, until you have accomplished the days of your siege.
